name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: The worst chinese food I have ever had. I ordered for delivery. I ordered 4 dishes most of which had green or white onions in huge chunks that were barely even cooked. The green onions were literally cut into 3" chunks. They were very nearly raw. The broccoli beef had chinese broccoli not regular broccoli which I had never seen for that dish, and the menu didn't state that it was made with chinese broccoli. The bok choy with garlic sauce had plenty of bok choy....but mostly the white bitter part and very few greens. The beef was tough and chewy not tender like it should be and flavorless. The mongolian beef was sweet which it isnt supposed to be and minty which is just weird. The fried rice was mushy. Seriously just crap food. I didnt even finish it. Just tossed the rest. It seems that the in house eating is great according to the reviews so I'm really puzzled why delivery was so bad. But for some reason, delivery food quality in this case was ridiculously bad. Who ever made this wasn't even pretending to know how to use a wok. I ordered this through amazon restaurants. I'll be contacting them about a refund. Yeah, it was THAT bad.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Had my order delivered through Amazon Prime Now, used their $10 off first time order coupon code. Delivery time was 39 minutes, which was awesome.  The Shrimp and Vegetable Egg Rolls were awesome, packed full of tender shrimp. The Potstickers were large, and the filling, though unidentifiable, tasted pretty good. The Almond Fried Chicken was overcooked, chewy, and tough. The sauce was not a normal thick sauce for Almond Fried Chicken... not sure what it was. But the chicken tasted OLD, and was inedible. I won't even take it home to try to feed it to my cats, it's THAT bad. Since Almond Fried Chicken is the ONLY main dish I ever order from a Chinese/Cantonese restaurant, I will most likely never order from Harbor City Restaurant again... there was really no excuse for sending out such bad chicken to a delivery customer. Ten bucks down the drain on that one!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Honestly you guys should be ashamed of yourself. You guys are selling something that is illegal. Selling shark fin soup is illegal and harsh. OVER 26 million sharks are killed each year just for this disgusting soup. GET RID OF IT!!!!

I found a piece of hair on my shrimp ball and my wonton noodle soup was Luke warm and slimy. The service was pleasant although the place was dirty. Won't come here ever again...

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Well, I'm a big fan of dim sum and this is the only dim sum place I've been to in the Seattle area. I was not impressed by any of the dishes and a couple(that I normally love) kind of grossed me out. We got the normal things we get shrimp crystal dumplings (har gow) (both the normal dumpling and the flatter ones covered in sauce), pork dumplings (shumai), pork buns, Chinese broccoli, and a couple other things. The pork buns were the worst I've ever had and the har gow (normally my gf's favorite) was her least favorite thing we ordered. I give it props for having the ladies walking around with the carts which I always appreciate and the prices were right. Wouldn't come back though.

name: Harbor City Restaurant

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Always a nice surprise to find places like this in Chinatown. Most are touristy and food subpar. I didn't realize how long HCR has been around until we came in and read it on their menu. Definitely an institution after 100 years!  Everything we ordered was good. Not too greasy and salty. My ultimate favorite is the raw fish salad. So much happening in my mouth with so many flavors coming out. Packed full of flavor and textures. For an Irish guy Im happy.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: The food is possibly 4 stars. Service is 2 stars. Slowness is 5 stars. And I'm a super star.

name: Harbor City Restaurant

Interior is a dive, but the food is decent. Generous portions. Taste is authentic. Good variety on menu. I would go back if I had a craving for Chinese.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: large tasty portions of freshly steamed dim sum. Harbor City go rid of the steamcards. You order from your table with an app and they bring the food to you as soon as it's cooked. Prices are reasonable and service is good.Good food, good servie, good prices, pleasant interior. What more could you want.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: We had a great meal! The food was amazing, and the place is very nice and authentic, if you are looking for a restaurant to try Chinese food, I highly recommend it!Also, the service was super nice, recommended us typical dishes, and was very friendly during the whole time, as well as the rest of the team!Thank you all, we will be back!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: excellent dimsum in the heart of Chinatown ID. While Jade Garden is a consistent favorite, this little younger sister across the street has become a crowd pleaser in recent years. Long wait on weekend so walk around after you put your name in and you should be set in 25-30 minutes.We'll come back!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: The food here is amazing have been here a few times and had such a great time. This last time I went I got bad service and had to ask the waitress for my food after waiting for over 20 Mins witch is not normally the case the service in the past has been good so I hope I just caught the waitress on a bad day. But the foods so good I'll be back.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: The food was pretty good here once you finally get done ordering. It was a busy day after we sat down but as soon as the first order came the food started rolling thru. Will definitely come back

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Got some take out from here for dimsum. Not bad. The price per dish was around $5-6.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Still great dim sum even having to order differently. Pretty quick service will come again and again

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Good dim sum but the place can be filthy specially the carpet.If your ata small table by yourself they will seat another person at your table without asking you which is rude.Chinese behavior issue.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Harbor City is a staple in Seattle's Chinatown. It opens early and stays open late. I decided to review Harbor City because early mornings in Seattle's Chinatown can be difficult to find good Chinese food. Harbor City offers Dim Sum each day so one can always go here. But the good thing about Harbor City is you can order off the menu as well as select Dim Sum from the carts. I like to order one or two vegetables from the menu to complement the Dim Sum. The two I like to order are Chinese Broccoli and Bok Choy. Of course this is a lot of food so going as a group of four or more is best.I had 4 friends from Spokane, WA in town and took them to Harbor City. Not having good quality Chinese in Spokane, they really had a good time. I got funny looks when order vegetables, but in no time both dishes were gone. Between the Dim Sum and Vegetables, everyone had a good experience. The food as usual is always good.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: We were on vacation with my family and definitely hungry looking for a great place to indulge. This certainly hit the spot. Delicious dimsum choices, menus made to order esp the peking pork chop. A must try.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: I love trying out new restaurants, and it was a fun place for my friends and I to go. We enjoyed the food very much. I loved the combination of traditional Korean flavors with a modern twist - unique!It was sort of 'Korean tapas', but it was a bit expensive for the amount of food you get. So tasty though! The service was good and everyone was friendly, so no complaints there.I know they're new, but I do wish they had a happy hour. I work downtown, and would love to come by more frequently, but unless a happy hour appears, this place will be for special evenings.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Very good. Waitress misunderstood and place the wrong order for me.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: I had a brunch here on Saturday with my friends. My friends were telling me before that this was the best place to have Dim Sum in town, and my expectation was set very high. When we got there around 11:30, it was already fully packed. "shumai" was really good, and also I liked stir fried Chinese broccoli. To be frank, food itself is maybe 3.5 stars but including serving speed and "price", I would say 4 stars. To me, it is nonsense to expect "great five star" service from $ or $$ restaurants. If someone wants to get Five-star service, they should go "high price" restaurants. From their price, I think 4 - 4.5 starts should be reasonable with me. Again, it is a great place to enjoy dim sum and also "China town"! You must expect long wait if you go for brunch.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Yummy. It's the real deal

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: The kung pao chicken was very good, not too spicy or salty. The onion ginger chicken was also very tasty. Chicken very tender and good portions. Chinese broccoli was very good as was the soft tofu and mushroom and the charsiu bbq honey chicken was good. The only thing that lacked was the taro beef dim sum. Not much flavor or taro color! Service is as expected for only one guy serving the whole restaurant, but our food was delivered quickly. I would order their normal food but stay away from the dim sum.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Classic Chinatown restaurant, specializing in roasted meats. Barbecue pork never fails, though you can definitely find better Chinese food in Bellevue

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Lots of food for the price. It was hard to finish all of it, I think I had over half of it left over for the next day.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Dim Sum = Yum! Pleanty of variety to be had. Carts & Trays of wonderful dumplings come around quite often. Don't forget to order the crispy green beans with garlic chips as they are a special item and don't come around regularly like the dumplings do. They serve dim sum anytime but when it's not busy you have to order from the dim sum menu.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: dimsum in here very good and until to night. most of restaurant just have dimsum in the morning, only this restaurant has at night

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: So good! This is one of my favorite dim sums in the ID.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Long waits on Saturday morning!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Good service and food. We were satisfied.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Dim sums are tasty, went under the recommendation of my cousin. Can't go wrong.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Best Dim Sum I've had so far.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Great authentic Chinese food for dinner. Never disappointed with ample servings and cooked to perfection. Have had a variety of dishes. The salted fish/chicken fried rice is great and so is their fried whole fish.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Good dim sum at great prices, fast and friendly service every time.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Nothing exceptional. Pretty cheap and legit.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Awesome dim sum

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Dim sum is very very good!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Hard pressed to find a 5-star dim sum restaurant in the Seattle area, but this is one of many that comes the closest. Of note, don't expect a whole lot on ambience.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: The dim sum itself here is alright. Not great, but not terrible. The trick though, is learning some of the secret dishes this place has to offer: Try ordering a "century egg steamed fish rice-noodle roll" (or "pay dan yu pien cheung fun" in Cantonese), or a "spareribs and chicken feet steamed rice-noodle roll" ("pai gwut fong jow cheung fun"). I promise these will blow you away. One of the best kept secrets in Chinatown.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Harbor City Restaurant in Chinatown is a must-visit spot for authentic Cantonese dim sum. It's bustling with energy, offering a lively atmosphere that truly adds to the experience. From fast service to delicious food, this place hits all the marks for a great dim sum outing.Ambiance: 5/5The restaurant has a vibrant and authentic feel, exactly what you'd expect from a busy dim sum spot. It was crowded, but that only added to the charm and authenticity of the experience.Authenticity: 5/5Harbor City delivers an authentic dim sum experience with traditional dishes that remind me of the heart of Cantonese cuisine. It's as close as you can get to dining in Hong Kong without leaving the U.S.Flavor: 5/5The dim sum dishes were fresh, flavorful, and hit all the right notes. From the delicate shrimp dumplings to the perfectly cooked pork buns, every bite was a delight. The food came out quickly, ensuring everything was piping hot and ready to enjoy.Cost: 5/5For the quality and authenticity, the prices are very reasonable. The portions are generous, making it an excellent value for the experience you're getting.Service: 5/5Even with the crowd, the service was exceptional. The staff were attentive and efficient, keeping up with the fast pace and ensuring our table had everything we needed.Final Thoughts:Harbor City Restaurant is a gem for anyone looking to enjoy authentic Cantonese dim sum in a lively and vibrant setting. Whether you're a dim sum enthusiast or trying it for the first time, this place will not disappoint. I'll definitely be back to explore more of their menu!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: One of the best dim sum restaurants in Seattle, this place truly stands out. Each dish is prepared with fresh ingredients, bursting with flavor and authenticity. The variety on the menu is impressive, offering everything from delicate dumplings to savory buns. I've never left disappointed, as the portions are generous and fully satisfying. Every dish is cooked to perfection, showcasing the chef's skill and attention to detail. Whether you're a dim sum enthusiast or trying it for the first time, this spot is sure to impress.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: What. A. Vibe! This fabulous place in the middle of Chinatown is an absolute must. You have to order via QR code because, hey, it's Seattle... But the soup dumplings alone are worth it. I loved that sesame cake, too!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Great menu! Everything is here. Smells great, taste great, and fair prices. Menu on the phone. Enjoy your food!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Honeycourt was my go-to for about a decade, but the last several times have been disappointing. Everything we ordered at Harbor City was delicious! And you can order through your phone. Prices were reasonable too. Our server was also very nice and helpful. We'll be back!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: It was early morning when I entered the restaurant. I was waited to be seated, but there were other customers at their table told me to come in and sit down. Then someone will brings a menu and a pot of hot tea to the table. They usually served Jasmine and oolong tea, no chrysanthemum tea.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Very good experience. I am glad I can give you five stars. Because the service of their staff was very good.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: This is my go-to dim sum place in Seattle! There's a lot of food choices on the menu and it is reasonably priced. Food arrives quickly and the portions and the noodle dishes especially are pretty large. The food here's really good and authentic 10/10 would recommend!!!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Great food and service for the price. Everything came out hot and was delicious. Will definitely be returning.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Authentic Asian cuisine and were delighted to find this place! Staff was clearly being very careful about safety, but friendly and welcoming, too. We loaded up on Dim Sum, especially enjoyed shrimp dumplings, sweet & sour prawns, egg rolls, and even had Peking duck. Food was all well prepared served steaming, and we brought home leftovers!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: I'm a huge fan of the oysters at Harbor City Restaurant!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: food was amazing. there was a wait, but it was well worth it!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Best dim sum restaurants in Chinatown ,Great food at a reasonable price. I absolutely loved the food , hope their system gets better!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Friendly staff, good food, I had a great time!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Food is amazing!!! I honestly cannot remember what I ordered because it was so good!!! I know this doesn't help anyone but food is good.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Although some glitches happen from time to time, this company has proven that they really care about their customers and always find a way to keep you happy... all that on top of truly fresh and delicious food. Yummy! Highly recommended.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Uno de mis lugares que siempre visito en lugares como nueva york o Chicago es el barrio chino y en Seattle tambi�n tienen su propio barrio chino y tiene muchos restaurantes deliciosos

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Went here after reading Yelp reviews. It was great. A bit of a wait due to size of restaurant but it was a great recommendation.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: We had a very nice Dim Sum lunch here, everything was amazing!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Food was authentic and delicious... wish I could have ordered one of everything. Definitely will be coming back!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: This place was amazing. The food was all around really good the food presentation is outstanding. If you decide to come to this place, ask for the menu because there, they hold the good food. I asked for fried chicken wings and it was amazing. I highly recommend this place

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: There is a wait but the food is worth it. Best dim sum in Chinatown. Customer service is great. Once you are seated it is quick to get your selection of dim sum. I often go with my family and friends. I definitely recommend this dim sum restaurant.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: I love this place. I think their food is better than Jade Garden. I love their tripes, har how wife chives, just everything. I am full and have left overs and still the bill is about 20 percent cheaper than Bellevue.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Everything was fresh and tasty. Highly recommended!!!Definitely I will be back when I am in Seattle.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: I guess I will come again. Nice place and tasty food)

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Delicious alternative to Jade garden.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Best shu mai in the history of the world. Period.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Love to come here for dim sum. Honestly, half the time I don't know what I'm ordering, just kind of pick & hope for the best. It's 99% amazing and 1% scary. Would definitely recommend for the adventurous diner.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Cheap and delicious!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Not a fancy place, but the price is sooooooo good!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Really enjoyed our dinner here. Came in around 6:30. Service was pretty quick. Waitress was nice. We really indulged, with a little of everything and some dessert, too. Only $11/person before tip. Good deal.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Loved it! The dumplings are amazing! The portions are pretty big so make sure you don't order too many dishes. The prices are very reasonable and the place is very stylish

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Amazing Dim-sum and at a great price! I will be back often!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Dim Sum- AMAZING. Worth the wait. I've never been during any other time but the dim sum is really great. Best I've had in seattle. Gotta go if you haven't been.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: For dim sum, I've tried Jade Garden, House of Hong, and a few others in addition to Harbor City. I see the same dishes at most places, but there are certainly differences in preparation, quality and freshness. Harbor City is the best. Their shrimp cakes in particular are excellent. Many dishes, like the pork bun, seem to have a glaze of honey or syrup on them and are sweeter than at most places. The staff are good about filling water glasses and are very willing to make things upon request (my daughter loves pork pot stickers, which aren't usually on the carts). The restaurant is small and gets crowded on Sunday mornings.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Fresh food even I was there at mid-night. And the service is pretty good as well.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Fantastic dim sum! Had to wait 50 minutes but it was worth it!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: great cheap dim sum!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Food was fantastic and the servers were super nice too!

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: I agree with Jackie - best dim sum in Seattle.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: This is my favorite Dim Sum joint in Seattle, after several positive experiences during the last few months I'll be making this my "go-to" Dim Sum Restaurant. Their portions are ample, the variety and preparation of the items excellent, the staff attentive. The prices are also very reasonable, you'll be pleasently surprised when you receive the bill.A Wide selections of teas are available to those who ask. My favorite item is the Lo Mai Gai, but the Taro nest is better than I've had at other local Dim Sum restaurants.

name: Harbor City Restaurant
text_review: Very good, with less of a wait than Jade Garden.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Small place in Pike Place Mkt. Quite cozy but, a fun atmosphere and a bit loud. Quite a few small twists on BBQ dishes without going too far out of the box. The cornbread in particular was outrageously good! The cocktails were creative and excellent? They were a great selection and text... even for a power drinker. The service was great and suited our tempo. We'll be back.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The whiskeys were unbelievable. The atmosphere was very nice. I am knocking one point off because one of my drinks was served in a cracked snifter glass. It was a very visible. Prices are very reasonable.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Good food love the way they serve the food. server have good patient to listen to the guest

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: A gem located in the Pikes Place Market!Great ambiance and a large selection of whiskey. The service was incredible too!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Radiator Whiskey, located on the 2nd floor above Pike Place Market and accessed through an elevator, offers a hearty dining experience that earns it a solid 4/5 rating. Despite the crowded seating and full bar area, the ambiance is lively, bordering on loud, making it a bit challenging to hold a conversation. The portions here are generous, catering to those with hearty appetites or groups looking to share.The loaded tater tots is a great, easily shareable appetizer for 3-4 people. The toppings were generous especially the pulled pork. The smoked then fried chicken dish, accompanied by a substantial serving of Mac n cheese, and cornbread, comes with two sizable pieces of chicken and is perfect for those with larger appetites or can be shared by two, especially if paired with an appetizer or side dish.The fried pork shank, while tender, lacked balance. The collared greens were overly salty, highlighting the need for some form of carbs, like bread or potatoes, to counterbalance the dish's fattiness and saltiness. I see in the pictures that this was served with some form of pasta in the past, not sure what changed. We didn't try a drink here but will plan on doing so next time. Solid option for dining near downtown if you account for the noise level and lack of space.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Good food and good drinks. Highly recommended.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: I hadn't been here in a while, but wanted to start an anniversary celebration with a couple of great drinks with a whiskey lover. They have an expanded menu of great dinners and appetizers, and we ended up staying and eating too. This place rules. Great selection, aged cocktails and good food? Awesome

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Its a nice small place. However it doesn't have many veg options. So if you are one, no point in going. I ordered grilled goat cheese sandwich and soup. It's really good. Their butterscotch custard was yummy. Another thing I really enjoyed was their mint lemonade.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Its a nice small place. However it doesn't have many veg options. So if you are one, no point in going. I ordered grilled goat cheese sandwich and soup. It's really good. Their butterscotch custard was yummy. Another thing I really enjoyed was their mint lemonade.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Its a nice small place. However it doesn't have many veg options. So if you are one, no point in going. I ordered grilled goat cheese sandwich and soup. It's really good. Their butterscotch custard was yummy. Another thing I really enjoyed was their mint lemonade.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Came in for breakfast and was not frustrated. The food they serve is loaded with heavenly flavors and their refreshment was great. Can't fault the waiters as the spot was very occupied yet they gave a valiant effort to serve me quick as I was set out toward a gathering. A debt of gratitude is in order for your administration.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Very nice atmosphere, food is always amazing. A little pricey but you get what you pay for. The servers and Bar make this place worth going for. Great beer selection and a non-pretentious cocktail list. I had a great eating and drinking experience.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: This place is straight out of the Hobbit haha. I love the food, love the drinks, love the atmosphere. Kind of hard to find to be honest, but the beef brisket I had made it worth it. We used Instapark around the corner, and it worked great!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Such a gem of a place. Great popcorn while you wait and such a unique menu. Great spot in the market. Would go back and bring friends visiting Seattle!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The music does not go well with the decors. The cocktails were fine but not so much to choose from.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Radiator Whiskey is gut!!! that have amazing pork and good options for big groups. Some of the bigger portions need to be pre-ordered and reservation is recommended. They also have good whiskey flights and a verity of local whiskeys. Great place for a date.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great selection of bourbon and scotch. Pretty cozy and difficult to get a seat during peak times. But the bartenders are very friendly and very knowledgeable. A great place if you would like to learn about bourbon and scotch.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The staff was friendly and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the excellent cocktails. Though expensive, but worth it.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: First time here, excellent food and drinks also the tots are great!! This is a very cozy place with excellent service and a great selection.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Like everyone says....Go for the tots! The beef brisket is to die for. I do love this place & the food, but it can be a bit loud.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The staff were friendly and the food was amazing. I highly recommend the excellent cocktails. Though expensive.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The drinks were amazing, go for happy hour and have their apple-infused mule, it's delicious. I just had appetizers but the food was pretty good as well, tater tots with an egg on top is surprisingly amazing. Not sure about the actual meals but I bet they're delicious as well.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Delicious food and drinks. A little hard to find though, but their website has decent directions.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: I love this place. The view out the window looking at 1st Ave is super fun, and the cocktails and bourbon selection are fabulous. It can get really busy at times, but it's still worth visiting even when it is.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The drinks were amazing, go for happy hour and have their apple-infused mule, it's delicious. I just had appetizers but the food was pretty good as well, tater tots with an egg on top is surprisingly amazing. Not sure about the actual meals but I bet they're delicious as well.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The drinks were amazing, go for happy hour and have their apple-infused mule, it's delicious. I just had appetizers but the food was pretty good as well, tater tots with an egg on top is surprisingly amazing. Not sure about the actual meals but I bet they're delicious as well. Very limited seating.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great food and wonderful staff. Will come againBrenda M

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Excellent spots with excellent customer service! Related and inmate setting. A out of the ordinary dining experience but a memory maker meal for sure!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Love this place! :) bacon biscuit was delicious

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The food at Radiator Whiskey is amazing! The menu items are original and unlike anything I've seen elsewhere, but everything was super yummy and reminded me a little strange comfort food. I'd never purchase chicken livers, but the fried chicken livers with franks hot sauce were astounding. As was the tater tots with gravy and fried egg, as well as the pork cheek stew with Fritos. (The Fritos actually make the dish). Next time, I'm purchasing the pig face, not only because it seemed tasty, but the left overs came wrapped in a foil swan. Not only is the food great, the staff were wonderful as well as the atmosphere is cosy and laid back.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Amazing new place that just opened right through the hallway from Matt's in the Industry. Adored the barrel aged manhattan and pork cheek stew! Service was prompt and friendly. The chalkboard food menu had many delicious seeming choices that I'll undoubtedly need to attempt later on!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Love the ambience of this place. The food is good-- the drinks are amazing. The only thing that was kind of weird is that we had to stand at a stand up table and eat our lunch. Wasn't a huge fan of that. They should reconfigure their seating somehow.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: My boyfriend and I came here for NYE dinner. We called earlier in the day and they told us that reservations were full and we could dine here if we walk in and wait. We really wanted to try this place out since my boyfriend loves whiskey and the food here looks yummy. Upon arrival, we were surprised that the restaurant was only 3/4 full and was seated promptly. It made me wonder how many customers they turned down on the phone if they told everyone who called that day that reservations were full. It was a difficult for us to find this place but it is located between the Pike Place sign and the Starbucks across the street. You take the elevator up a few floors and walk down hallway to get here. It felt like walking in an office building which I never experienced or imagined a bar to be at.Service: We were seated promptly at a table that fits 4. After another party of two left, the waitress asked if we would like to move to the other table for two next to the window with a view. I thought this was nice of them and the view outside our window was the busy 1st Ave and of course, the strip club across the street. Food: I ordered a Turkey Drum Confit and my boyfriend ordered Fried pork shank. The Turkey Drum confit was big and cooked very well and was not dry at all! The sauce that was served with it was super delicious as well as the potatoes it came with. It was the perfect portion. The fried pork shank was juicy and meaty. Ambiance: I liked the tiny barrels around the restaurant. With the dim lighting and individual candle lighted up on each table, it gives a very classy feel.Overall, I would definitely come back. The food, drinks, and service is outstanding.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: I really, really like this place. Perfect flavor combos, fantastic ambiance and doesn't break the bank. After several visits, I've tried out a pretty good portion of their meat-centric menu and everything so far has had very solid flavor. Will be back!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: nice place to hangout with friends and have dinner. good foods and drinks. staff is very nice. They had good selection of whiskey.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Love the happy hour here. You can get a tall boy of rainier and a shot of whiskey for $5 - gets the job done. They give you popcorn to snack on, too. They also, expectedly, have a great list of whiskey and cocktails too. I have only seen other eat the food and it looks delicious. The downside is the size - pretty small so its often a tight squeeze for a drink after work.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Be sure to make a reservation. Great place.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The food is really good. Great service as well..

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: They have fresh and tasty food at good prices.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Shouldn't have to wait forever to eat. So annoying. Bar drinks are way overpriced and under served. Bad enough for the wait. Drinks were small and way too expensive Won't be back. Crazy. Waiting 1 hour 15 mind for our table.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Pretty amazing food, and the bartenderes are great.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Hidden gem.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Awesome meal, even better whiskey

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Couple days ago wanted to relax and have some shots. I met my expectations by visiting the Radiator Whiskey. Cool cocktails and really good whiskey. The environment is really friendly and warm so you can relax easily. I would advice to visit this place for everybody.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Good atmosphere and even better drinks.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: I recently visited this bar and I must say, it was a great experience. The atmosphere was lively and welcoming.Good selection of drinks. The food menu was also impressiveOverall, I had a fantastic time at this bar and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and relaxed place to hang out. I will definitely be returning in the future.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: As a BBQ connoisseur, I have to say this place was actually pretty decent. The food was good, the service was great, and the drinks? Excellent! You have to like beer, bourbon, or whiskey--they really know how to pour here. You have to appreciate real rock music. The music selection was spot-on and added to the laid-back vibe. Lastly, you have to be real. If you're expecting some high-end, pretentious dining experience, this isn't the place for you.If you're looking for a casual spot with good BBQ, great drinks, and an awesome playlist, this place is worth checking out.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: That place was great. We didn't eat, just had some whiskey and a glass of reisling. The service was awesome - super friendly and attentive. I'd totally recommend it for drinks. We didn't try the food since we already ate, but I heard it's good too. Not sure about parking, we walked from pier 55, took us about 10 mins. Oh, and don't miss it - the bar is upstairs and the sign isn't very obvious. But seriously, the service is top-notch! The vibe was really chill on a Wednesday night. If you're into whiskey, you should definitely check this place out.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Nice place with good ambience there was super nice food. I love the place very beautiful under decoration is nice.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: is it good place for dating? um planning to go there, as i read all review it seems good

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: It's a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing wines, food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Everything was good. We will be returning customers for sure. Me & the husband both loved this place.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Had the Mac n Cheese and a Scotch! out of this world! what a combo! I'm going to come back to try more items on the menu!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Food was amazing, service was great. They really hold themself to a high standard. It felt like I was in someones dinning room and that really added to the ambiance. Got a great table by the window with a great view of the market.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Love the bar. The atmosphere and the service was top tier!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: It might seem unusual to find BBQ in the northwest, yet I relish in discovering unique regional takes regardless of the city. On my visit, I opted for the smoked and fried chicken, complemented by mac and cheese. The experience was truly delightful. Although chicken isn't usually my go-to choice, this particular dish proved to be an excellent decision! We were served by Amanda, who was not only personable but also quite well-versed in her field.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: It was absolutely great, unusual for a pike place restaurant which usually cater to tourists. Do not skip the pork belly appetizer or the cornbread! I had the brisket and it was lick the plate delicious.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Radiator Whiskey, with its relaxed but classy environment, provides something for everyone and is just what downtown Seattle has been missing! I had the corn chowder and apple salad, both of which were delicious! Everyone in our group chose something different but were equally thrilled with the chicken liver starter!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Always a great evening here, good drink selection and they have almost anything you could imagine (or they'll recommend something if you want). Never too overpacked but usually a pretty energetic and lively crowd. A good after-spot once you hit up Matt's in the Market too.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Friendly staff who actually knew about the bourbon they were selling. If you like whiskey,their chicken is out of this world, and it's the first place I've heard of getting deep fried beef lips... I know it sounds weird, but they were delicious! I really love this place and it's my go to celebration establishment.I would definitely recommend!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Super relaxed and chill atmosphere. I am totally in love with the pulled pork. This is a great place to get together for dinner and drinks with a group of people. I will defiantly be back, lol its almost like a staple to my diet already.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Our experience was good, and the highlight of the meal is the Braised brisket and Fried pork shank. Every dish has been the right portion, so we leave not feeling stuffed. The wait staff is great and always super hospitable.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: My friend and I came here last night and we had a great time. The staff was so friendly and drinks were on point! I highly recommended this place!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Ordered Fried pork shank and it was a fantastic dish. In all fairness, their menu has a promising look. I think if we didn't order an appetizer, but I can come back for that. Service was fabulous! I'll probably try to go on a happy hour for more discounts.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Crowded bar setting with chic gourmet eats.The place was a little difficult to find, but well worth the search. We started with the watermelon tomato salad. This fresh and tasty dish was not a dish I was expecting to find this kind of bar scene, but it got me excited for the rest of the meal. For mains, I ordered the fried pork shank. I consider most things that are fried to be good, but this was excellent. The layers of texture below the crispy fried crust to the tender meat made this dish a delicious adventure to eat. Great place to wind down after tiring yourself out from site-seeing around Pike/Pine!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great location to start off . It has a great happy hour . Would recommend this place to people visiting the area

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Tried new scotch/single malt highlands' whiskey (Highland park and dalmore) and they weren't a disappointment!!! Perfect ambient and nice view from the corner edge bar seatings (by the entrance)!!! Perfect for a quick bite and snacks before the concert at showbox! Must try small plates! we ordered the tater tots w/ fried egg and gravy, and the burrata cheese!!!!!! They were BOMB!!! I dig this place!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: SMOKED HALF PIG HEAD - Do it!!! We did and ended up sharing with folks from tables near us. It was amazing to see, even better to taste but the best part was how much fun it was sharing.The mushrooms....The old fashioned.....The service......It was just a wonderful experience all the way around!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great spot. Atmosphere was fun and the place has a lot of interesting things to look at. This place feels like the ultimate man cave. Everything is rugged from the menu to the drinks to the decor. Its technically a bar with very limited food options.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The food and the atmosphere was great. I made reservations for a party of 4 two hours before opening and they were able to fit us in! The roasted half chicken was so delicious - it had a nice smoky flavor with a sweet glaze. The potato salad along with the shaved salad consisting of zucchini, yellow squash, and celery paired really nicely with the chicken. The picture doesn't do the dish justice - it was a generous portion but I managed to finish it all!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The drinks were amazing, bartenders super chill and friendly, my favorite part was the classic hip-hop playlist bumping the whole night.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Went here for the Beast Feast. It's was amazing!!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Best dinner spot in Seattle. They have amazing food, people are nice and everything is organized perfectly well. I would recommend this place if you're a foodie and you don't afraid of late dinners.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: This place isn't very big but it is AMAZINGLY good. Located upstairs on the 3rd floor it felt pretty hot & stuffy but we quickly got over that with some YUMMY drinks. Staff was extremely friendly and the open kitchen allowed us to watch the chef work his magic! Before you order take a look at their specials. We had the Debris Sandwich and the fried pork shank. Then topped it all off with the pecan pie with rum ice cream. We left stuffed!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Pikes place is a wonderful place. I was told upon moving here it's a galore of interesting stuff. And it is! I stumbled upon this restaurant and was very pleased with it. Nice food, nice service.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The food was excellent, the drinks were delicious and the wait staff was outstanding. I will definitely be coming back the next time I have a craving for good whiskey drinks.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: OMG! This place is awesome! The turkey leg is the bets I've ever had! Fast service.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: As you'd expect with the name, this place has a fantastic selection of whiskeys and scotches from all over the world. Their food is on point as well. The space is a little small, so prepare for that, otherwise you're in for a real treat!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: great food and drink. highly recommended .

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Whiskey Pete would be proud!! This place does cocktails the right way. Happy hour was a blast, even though I was solo. I ordered the Skinny Girl Cocktail and a piper Sammie. Good stuff for sure.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Came here around 8 o'clock with a few buddies to grab a few drinks. We were looking for a laid back, chill environment and radiator whiskey is just the place. It was a bit crowded on a Friday night. Took us about half an hour to get a spot. My friends and I just wanted to chill and talk about life so we ordered a bunch of cocktails and drank it. Wasn't sure what it was but I believe it was probably tequila or vodka.After being there for a bit over an hour, we got hungry and ordered tater tots. It definitely hit the spot. It came wit a fried egg on the top and wow what a finishing touch.If you want to go here to drink, snack and eat light or full food. This is the perfect place with the perfect ambience. Could get extremely busy though.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great food! Great service! Look out for the pig

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: The food here is awesome. We ordered the pig head (I know, sounds gross), but was pretty great. It was prepared perfectly and the sauces were good as well. The other dishes were great as well. I definitely recommend coming here early since we didn't have a reservation and had to wait. Will be coming back for more.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: GREAT whiskey selection, food was awesome, atmosphere was super and I will be back!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great place with nice cocktails. I will be back to this place for sure. Very nice atmosphere and professional service

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Deliciousness galore! Brisket is so good! Even the gf likes it and she's super picky about her meat.Make sure to make reservations or you might have watch others enjoy their meals

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: I visited Radiator on my last trip to Seattle really enjoyed the Whiskey tasting and meat plate. Fantastic. Great waitstaff who clearly love what they do.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: HOLY SMOKES THIS IS GREAT ! This is a tiny little spot that has some great whiskey. They offer free popcorn and kithcen closes at 11:30pm ENJOY !

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great service, food and strong drinks.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: love this place, me and the wife come here at least once a month

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Love, love, loved it here! The food, the ambiance and the service were top notch !am going to state the obvious and say that this place has a fine selection of whiskeys. We chose to taste one of their flights.It gives you a nice variety from smooth to smokey to dry, etc. We had a couple cocktails as well which were all really good. All the food and drinks were on point. This place is amazing.Great atmosphere. Not too loud. Great drink selections. Highly recommended this place !!!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Wow - this place is delicious. Service was really good and the food was out of this world. I'll be coming back for sure.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: This place has unique spunky food items (Pig's Head!?) and offers a lot more cocktails than you would expect from a whiskey bar. Lots of creative interior, keeping with the Pike's Place vibe. Our table ordered a few different flights, all constructed tastefully, and we were pleased with the recommended fried eggs and tots. Our server, Rachel, was one of the best servers I've ever had and was happy to answer all of our questions. This spot is a gem, and I am planning on coming back soon to try their cocktails!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great cocktails and very helpful service!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Micheladas here are bomb! And the prices here are great. Bartenders are very generous and always checking up on you unlike other bars out here. Can't wait to come back!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great spot to go to for cocktails with friends. Very crowded and not a lot of space so get there early if you want a spot.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Excellent customer service.The food was absolutely amazing! It was busy on June 17th evening, but the cooks and servers managed the crowd well.The bartenders are really helpful with their drink selection.Thanks guys,I'll definitely come here again!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: i freaking love whiskey! not much more american than that! other than using caplocks to show how much you love something! murrica!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: I am a huge BBQ snob and had found nothing that compared to what is produced out of my backyard until I went to Radiator Whiskey. The Porchetta was magical. It was smokey and porky and fatty and everything you want out of porchetta. Their fried chicken livers are amazing too. I don't know anything about whiskey but the Bourbon Margarita was very good. I have had friends who do like whiskey swoon at their selection. Find out about the Beast Feast. For a group of people you get a whole pig for $300. I'm looking forward to my gang going in a few weeks!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: This place is incredible! There were four of us and each of us ordered something different. Everything we ordered was delicious. Recommendation: order the pork meal.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Fantastic meal! Get the tots :)

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: What a great place. We came by it by chance while walking around looking for a place for dinner. Atmosphere was great, food was incredible and the selection of liquor is unbelievable. A+ place. Try the tots, turkey drum, and pecan pie!!!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: I could write a long winded review, describing in detail every last thing that makes Radiator Whiskey so unbelievably epic. I'm not gonna do that though. All you need to know is that I can die happy now! Don't think. just do it!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: you have to try the barrel aged cocktails. pretty amazing.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Amazing food and ambiance. Had a blast and will be back.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Delicious. Great atmosphere.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Great restaurant and great food, if you in the mood for an amazing place this is where you want to be. It is nice a quaint and the food is just perfect. The customer service is awesome and I will be going back as often as we can. Thank you again and see you soon.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Delicious food and wonderful service. This place is a great find for someone visiting downtown.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: 2nd floor

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Such a fun atmosphere! And it smelled like BACON!

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: Oh yeah!  Awesome actually whiskey and beef tongue. Definitely an original.

name: Radiator Whiskey
text_review: OMG so great!

name: Altura
text_review: This dining experience for their tasting menu was a terrible disappointment. I can't exaggerate enough how unsatisfying and way too salty the dishes were. And the desserts were soaked in alcohol, like why? The owner and chefs there really need to taste the dishes they are serving. How can you serve something almost inedible and charge $700+ for two people. We have been to other tasting menus in Seattle and this is somewhere you should stay away. I would say the night went bad once we noticed it took 20+ minutes in between dishes. I've never experienced a tasting menu that took 3+ hours to finish. There was a foie gras pasta dish that should not be served to anyone for any reason.. it was really hard to chew and swallow. Mostly the dishes tasted like salt, sugar, and alcohol... This restaurant is inconsistent with their dishes: 1. We were celebrating a birthday and two others around us were also celebrating. Our birthday dish was the only one without a candle... odd. 2. My partner and I both did the non-alcoholic drink pairing and for some reason our drinks were not served the same level of liquid and ice.. a little weirdOverall I'm glad we got to experience this place and won't be recommending this place to anyone.

name: Altura
text_review: Overpriced and under delivered. $600 for 2 and the experience was a joke. What a mistake.

name: Altura
text_review: Food and wine was meh . Way over priced for what it is. Was not impressed with any of the dishes

name: Altura
text_review: Expect to pay 300 plus dollars to be held hostage for 3 hours before the tasting menu is complete, only to end the night with an upset stomach and violent diarrhea.

name: Altura
text_review: For$300 per person, I would have expected more. Nothing about the decor, ambiance or staff attire screamed fine dining.The food wasn't anything to be wowed about.

name: Altura
text_review: It was a good meal but overpriced. With food, tip, wine, e.t.c, you're spending more here than you would at Canlis or the Herbfarm, and the experience is not better or vastly different. A decent experience, definitely not to be repeated.

name: Altura
text_review: Thought this place was fairly good and worth a try, just a little over priced.

name: Altura
text_review: Me and my friends actually went to this place just to have drinks but then we realized that we should have some of their interesting pastas. We ordered their Papparedelle and it was pretty tasty and delightful. The spicy ragu was extremely mouthwatering and delightful and we definitely enjoyed it. I just hope that they could upgrade some of their drinks to make it more tasty and interesting.

name: Altura
text_review: Been hearing about this place for a long time and finally was able to try it. Very cozy atmosphere, pretty cute decorations and great service.Although I heard about this place so many times before, I still don't know what I was walking into, and I have no idea about the food they serve.But since I love food I was willing to try, and I was excited. The course meal started with oysters and caviar, followed by sliced beef tounge, and then the noodle pasta with anchovy flakes, with sorbet as intermission. At this point I'm already a bit full, but the pork and wagyu beef makes it difficult to stop.Everything was very tasty and delicious. This is a pricey restaurant, but we definitely get our money's worth.

name: Altura
text_review: Amazing meal! Was very impressed with the wine list and the sommelier's knowledge on wines. Food was prepare superbly, but the price tag... Oh boy, the price tag! Never have I been to a restaurant for dinner for 2, and the receipt shows over $600 ($500 + tips)  Of course, half of that went to the wine bottle but still...

name: Altura
text_review: I went when I had dietary restrictions due to allergy, and they prepared perfectly, delectable dishes that didn't skip a beat despite my multiple regulations. A perfect combination of satisfying flavors presented in a new light to delight all your senses. I will be back.

name: Altura
text_review: Took a friend here for a birthday dinner and we did the 8:30pm time slot. The food was pretty good, the ambiance and atmosphere is very chic and very much similar to other fine dinning establishments. The food was pretty different. I still don't know how I feel about pigeons for main protein course. I was hoping for something more for the price. And the additional truffle shavings on the pasta was pretty lack luster. My only complaint is that the service is very slow. By the end we ran out of the restaurant because we were there till 11:55pm. I get that they wanted to serve everyone at the same time with all our courses simultaneously but some people are very slow and we had to wait for them. I was just exhausted by the end. Food was 8.5/10 service was about 6/10 over all I'll say everything was about 7.5/10.

name: Altura
text_review: I don't attend fancy dinners, but decided to splurge once with another couple. Simply amazing! The food had layers of flavor that literally became the topic of conversation until the next dish. Drinks were endless and the atmosphere melted away as the focus was on food and company. Definitely considering making progressive dinners like this a regular thing.

name: Altura
text_review: Highly recommend this place! Food is delicious. It is modernized Italian food with a twist. What I love about the food is that the flavors are all very subtle yet they have a small kick of a unique ingredient. So if your not a fan of food with very strong flavors, or a not yet used to having powerful ingredients, this is a great place to start introducing your pallette to new and unique flavors(high end cuisine). Best part about the restaurant in my opinion is the open concept and how you can see how the chefs are preparing your food. It is very interesting and amusing to see how these types of meals are being prepared from start to finish. And how everyone in the kitchen seems to be creative with what they prepare. Overall had a great experience!

name: Altura
text_review: Calm, collected, high quality modern cuisine dining. It's Italian inspired. Definitely a special occasion place and call ahead and let them know about dietary restrictions. I enjoyed the experience quite a bit.

name: Altura
text_review: Altura is my new favorite restaurant. My husband and I came here for our 5th anniversary and cannot wait to come back again. Yes, it's pricey, but worth every penny. Not to compare apples and oranges but I used to think I couldn't find any restaurant that would beat Ruth Chris as far as quality and flavors goes but Altura blew them outta the water.

name: Altura
text_review: Terrific and delightful. Thank you!

name: Altura
text_review: I went here few weeks ago... Honestly I was really happy! Since Panevino closed a tear ago, I had no Italian restaurant satisfying me around here. I used to live in Rome for 8 years, and now so mad at myself that didn't check your restaurant for years. Thank you so much for making this area better to live!!!!

name: Altura
text_review: really good meal

name: Altura
text_review: Everything was solid, albeit sloooow.Food: Flavors we radical, Pasta courses were ridiculously small.Service: super friendly, pretty knowledgeableOverall: Gives Spinasse a run for it's money (just need to bolster the pasta portion). We were very impressed, should be 5 stars, but slow and pasta size.

name: Altura
text_review: I generally only want to give 5 star reviews (meaning I just don't review places I think suck)- but I thought the food here was FABULOUS. A new coworker brought me here last week. I didn't realize it had just opened, and I don't normally go to restaurants until they've been open for a month or two. I just like to let them iron out the kinks.Anyway, the food was too good to not mention. The rib-eye was cooked to perfection. The chicken was moist and tender-and was served with roasted grapes! Even the bread was divine.There is just ONE thing keeping me from giving Altura 5 stars-the room. It's just a bit "clunky" for lack of a better word. Our table was hard to get in and out of, and my elbow would hit the wall when cutting my food. I mentioned it to them, and they seemed appreciative. The service was also excellent!

name: Altura
text_review: First time back after four years of drought and it's just as fantastic as always. Love the new single seating format and the food is off the hook.

name: Altura
text_review: This represents the pinnacle of dining experiences I've had in Seattle. The ambiance of the restaurant is a blend of energetic and tranquil. I had previewed the sample menu prior to my visit, yet each dish still left me in awe. The meticulous attention to detail was simply remarkable. Opting for counter seating provided us with an exclusive view of the chefs crafting each inventive, refined, and delightful dish. I couldn't have enjoyed it more!

name: Altura
text_review: I had an incredible dining experience at this restaurant! The produce was incredibly fresh and prepared immediately upon ordering, which really made a difference in the taste and quality of the dishes. The highlight of the meal for me was the red sponge cake - it was absolutely amazing and I couldn't stop raving about it to my friends afterwards. The restaurant also impressed me with its creative use of ingredients, such as the wagyu fat candles, which added an interesting and unique flavor to the dishes.In addition to the delicious food, the cooks were extremely friendly and made the dining experience even more enjoyable. I also highly recommend sitting at the kitchen counter, as you get to watch the chefs in action and even receive free samples of dishes. Overall, I want to thank the team at this restaurant for a truly great experience and can't wait to come back and try more of their delicious creations.

name: Altura
text_review: Truly incredible... highly recommend!

name: Altura
text_review: Wonderful dining experience! We did the drinks pairing as well. I really liked that it was a mix of cocktails/wine and mocktails. Every course was well thought of. Altura is certainly on the expensive side but certainly worth a visit!

name: Altura
text_review: Very good restaurant with impeccable reception. The staff are very pleasant and very kind. We appreciated the time taken by the waiter to explain the dishes we did not know.

name: Altura
text_review: Altura is a gem. Incredible attention to detail from start to finish. Bites are meticulously plated and seasoned perfectly with the addition of heat in appropriate proportions. In terms of service, Chef prepares everything as you roll in. I was fortunate enough to sit in front of chef's counter, where we watched everything prepared as we sat down. Meaning, the second I walked in, our dishes six courses down were being freshly assembled. Canapés breaming with color and visually appealing juxtaposition, all adorn in front seat with beautiful fresh greens like red vein sorrel. The dishes rolled out seamlessly as service flowed with the kitchen. Everyone around us felt at home as the food continued to pour in. From the first few bites we got to witness one said plate our food for the next course, while the other side prepared our dishes for the following. Almost in unspoken synchronicity everything streamed onto our view. My friend, who had never witnessed pasta being freshly prepared, stared in awe as Chef rolled fresh raviolo without hesitation. As the drinks poured, and the dishes were consumed, we ended the night with a phenomenal series of dessert bites with minor table side service to finish. To sum everything altogether, I must say, this restaurant exceeded my expectations of what Seattle's fine dining scene had to offer. I'm thrilled to see this restaurant standing still after the coils of pandemic had ruined our restaurant industries left and right. If anything, last night stood as a testament and will to the determination this team has to delivering what really good food is to our beautiful Emerald City.

name: Altura
text_review: The food was really delicious. The staff are very attentive, even we don'tknow the rest of the dishes, they give us some advice, good customer service. Recommended!

name: Altura
text_review: Amazing meal as usual. Excellent service. Walked in shortly after opening and were seated without fuss or hesitation. Every bite created thoughtfully. Got the wagyu and didn't regret it. Appreciate the take home menu and truffles.

name: Altura
text_review: This restaurant isn't eligible for a Michelin star (or 3) as it's in the wrong city for that. But Altura is most certainly a contender for it when and if Michelin comes to Seattle. We sat at the counter tonight and had such an incredible experience! We sat by Bridget, who was working the sauté station. Also nearby was the head chef, Nathan Lockwood. So. Delicious. So unpretentious. Such depth to the flavors and such unusual combinations. Super fresh and seasonal ingredients, which were honored by their treatments. The crew works in an open kitchen with a calm and precision. It isn't stuffy, it isn't rigid but it is polished and clean. We're from chicago. We know good food. This isn't as fancy shmancy as Alinea, but it is just as delicious and honestly one of the best meals I've had. Thank you Altura!

name: Altura
text_review: If there was a piece of heaven on earth then part of it would definitely reside here - yes the food, service, ambiance, and overall experience was that good. My husband and I came in late December to celebrate our birthdays. Word to the wise show up hangry (hungry to the point that you are angry about it)- we made the mistake of only being hungry and towards the end became too full to finish the desserts. As others have mentioned the menu is predetermined so all you have to do is sit back and enjoy the experience. This place deserves some kind of michelin star - Bravo!

name: Altura
text_review: This one of the best tasting menu restaurants I've ever eaten at anywhere. The wine pairing really add to the experience and the small seating capacity lends to an intimate dining experience. A pricey dinner but par excellence and well worth the cost!!

name: Altura
text_review: This place is divine. I highly recommend sitting at the bar so you can catch all the action from the chef that runs an amazing tight ship. Sitting at the bar also allows you to ask the chef/sous chefs about the food, the ingredients and gives you that perk that they make you something special specifically for you. I went when I was having dietary restrictions due to allergy and they prepared amazing, delectable dishes that didn't skip a beat despite my multiple restrictions. If you are looking for special, romantic, small, quaint place with orgasmic food, this is the place. If you want to impress a foodie, take him/her there.

name: Altura
text_review: This is the BEST restaurant I have ever been to! Every dish is amazing and tasty~ love this restaurant

name: Altura
text_review: Fantastic service, extremely creative execution. Every time we come, even on the spur of a moment, we are welcomed and leave feeling that we just had the most amazing experience. A wonderful combination of having deeply familiar and satisfying flavors presented in a new light to delight all your senses. By far the best place to go for foodies.

name: Altura
text_review: A decent restaurant for fine dining. I came here with a dear friend. I just loved the food here. Its was very mild and tasty. Customer service is excellent. Will visit this place again.

name: Altura
text_review: The service was attentive and pleasant, the food was creative, light, and delicious, and the price was very reasonable. I'd definitely recommend it. Looking forward to many more meals here in the future. I took one star off for the atmosphere, feels like they're still settling in their ambiance

name: Altura
text_review: The chef has never disappointed me once. The price is on the high end but well deserved. The flavor is generally well balanced. Ingredients used are fresh and top notched. Top choice for special occasion.

name: Altura
text_review: I was lucky enough to eat at the counter at Altura while on business in Seattle my last night. This place was recommended to me by a friend back in NYC and I am glad I checked it out!Although I was still jet lagged and quite a bit tipsy I had an excellent meal. The chefs tasting menu is an excellent value and holds up to any michelin star equivalent in other cities I have been too. It was nice to just chill out and watch the chefs behind the counter prepare all the different courses with such precision. Also the wine pairing was great with the sommelier tailoring it to my preference of no white wine. There were some unusual wines and it was a nice experience to enjoy so many in one night. I rarely yelp but had to about this place!

name: Altura
text_review: We ate at Altura last weekend and the food, service and atmosphere were all wonderful! There are lots of inventive choices for each course and lots of options for tasting menus with and without wines. We sat at the "chef's table" overlooking the kitchen area and it was fascinating. Even if you think you know how a restaurant kitchen might run, you can learn something here!Thanks, Nathan, for a fabulous meal start to finish!

name: Altura
text_review: A beautifully repurposed space; attention to every detail, and gorgeous park views through the stunning windows -- elegant would be my word of choice if I had to describe this restaurant in a single word. Exquisite, knowledgeable yet friendly service by superb staff, from the cheerful receptionist to the engaging.

name: Altura
text_review: best dinner I've had in a long time in seattle.

name: Altura
text_review: My boyfriend and I went together with a couple of friends and we had a blast. The food was wonderful.

name: Altura
text_review: Exceptional food. We had the three course meal, and very much enjoyed it. Everything was delicious, full of flavor. The atmosphere feels cozy, while upscale at the same time.

name: Altura
text_review: Excellent! Elegant!

name: Altura
text_review: very good food. pricey but worth the money.

name: Altura
text_review: Fantastic service and food. Gnocchi was killer!

name: Altura
text_review: Simply AMAZING!!! Both atmosphere and food-

name: Altura
text_review: wonderful place, great food. great service and they are really italians:thank you altura! bravi! it is really small so make sure you have reservations otherwise...........there is always to wait!

name: Altura
text_review: The best Italian food in Seattle! We got the five course dinner, and it was excellent. The homemade pasta was just great. The courses were small, so you try lots of different stuff. Be sure and get bread when you arrive, the dipping sauce is amazing. The only complaint: hard to get in, it's so busy! I guess that happens when your good is so good....

name: Altura
text_review: I love you, Altura!

name: Altura
text_review: A little crowded, but I still give it five stars. The food was excellent, and the service even better.

name: Altura
text_review: Simply ... perfectly ... one of the finest restaurants I've ever experienced.

name: Altura
text_review: One of the best and most enjoyable dinners I've had in Seattle

name: Altura
text_review: Exceptional dinner. Fabulous service. Delicious food. Imaginative (venison ravioli with chocoate infused sauce!) and extremely well balanced taste and texture in every dish. Kudos to the chef. It was my husbands birthday, and it was most excellent. Especially loved the razor clams with semolina crust. Just outstanding. Tough to get a reservation, but worth doing so well in advance to have a special meal at this top notch seattle restaurant. Pricing was fair--$49 for three courses of your choice!Yummy.

name: Altura
text_review: A+ EXCEPTIONAL DINING EXPERIENCE!!Each time I go it gets better and it is hard to improve on fabulous.Altura equals brilliant state of the art cuisine sourced with the finest ingredients, coupled with gracious warm service and a delightful wine selection. This young chef, Nathan Lockwood, is a master and Seattle is very fortunate to have acquired this gem of fine and fun dining!Thank you Altura for another delightful evening!

name: Altura
text_review: Everything is amazing - must go

name: Altura
text_review: Our dinner was AMAZING. The homemade gnocchi just melted in my mouth. It reminded me of what my Italian grandmother used to make. My other favorite was the warm apple crostata. Everything was delicate and beautifully presented. Next time, I want to sit at the bar so I can watch the food being prepared. Two thumbs up!

name: Di Fiora
text_review: This is review comes after numerous visits to this place that has lead me to update my previous review. Let's be clear that the food and cocktails here are great, the flavors and plating of various dishes are amazing. But I've seen the progression of decline in service that has lead to horrendous customer service. I don't think I've ever had a waiter tell me, "it's been 10mins and you haven't order anything, and we over booked reservations tonight and need the table in 30mins"I am very disappointed in any establishment that will approve of anyone with such unprofessionalism and disrespectful attitude towards patrons. We had just sat down and the menu wasn't pulling up on our phones. I also don't find it pleasing to hear restaurants are over booking reservations and rushing people to eat. That's so unpleasant to hear from a restaurant that I've dinned at many times before. After this experience I think I'm going to stay away from here for a while or just get Togo, becuase dealing with their rude staff and workers has made this place very irritating to dine at.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: We loved the environment but the food was nothing special.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Mediocre food, music didnt match ambience

name: Di Fiora
text_review: The atmosphere and service was great but my friends and I ended up with food poisoning the next day:( three of us ordered the chicken and it was delicious, but we all got super sick the next day (our friends who didn't order chicken were fine). Disappointed we spent so much just to be sick:(

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Overpriced and overrated.We spent a Sunday in Seattle, and found ourselves later in the evening (is 9-10pm considered late now even in downtown Seattle?), and this place was still open (last call, must pick a dish in the next 5 10 minutes!).Smaller serving sizes and a taste that did not inspire. Surrounding tables with larger groups of friends were having fun with some cool looking cocktails, which may be a good enough reason to come here.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: I was waiting to try their drinks but I didn't get it again.As for the food, they are very good about it. Mains fine and fine.Crab Friend's rice was also done and he expected more than $25 in demand from less crab. The fried egg is also good as is the presentation.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: It took at least 45 mins even though we had a reservation here. Though the ambience is pretty nice here, reservations should be handled properly

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Wonderful place, saw it a few times on Tiktok and finally got to check out. The prices of the entries were surprisingly cheaper than what I expected. Really enjoyed the crispy chicken and the curry. Crab fried rice is also really good. Must check out place in Seattle.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: So, I finally hit up Di Fiona in Seattle, and let me just say, it's like stepping into a Pinterest board curated by a wine-drunk interior designer with taste. The vibe? Equal parts "your rich friend's remodel" and "Instagrammer's paradise." The food? Actually, shockingly good. The kind of Italian that makes you pause mid-bite to question every sad spaghetti night you've ever had.The staff? Friendly, but with that "cooler-than-you" Seattle edge--like, yeah, they know you're impressed, and they're totally fine with it. Prices? Let's just say your wallet might need a hug after, but honestly, worth it.In short: Di Fiona is annoyingly perfect, like Seattle itself. Pretentious, beautiful, and somehow irresistible. Damn it, I'll be back.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Went here while on vacation with family. The decorations on the interior were stunning! Made the atmosphere really cozy. The food was amazing. Most of us ordered steak, including myself, and it was cooked perfectly. Drinks were good as well. The staff was super attentive and friendly. Will definitely be back!

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Di Fiora consistently knocks it out of the park with every visit! First and foremost, the atmosphere is simply stunning. They refresh the décor with the seasons, ensuring it's always a feast for the eyes--truly an Instagram-worthy haven.Our culinary adventure included dishes like Kow Soi, crab fried rice, steak, garlic pork over rice, crispy garlic chicken, duck avocado curry, seafood tom yum soup, and Vietnamese crunchy rolls, all beautifully plated. While everything we tried was delicious, the standout stars were undoubtedly the duck avocado curry and the crispy garlic chicken. The curry was, without a doubt, the finest I've encountered in any Thai restaurant--rivaling even some of the best Peking duck I've tasted! Though no one asked about my preferred spice level, the flavor and heat were perfectly balanced, leading me to dip nearly everything in that luscious avocado curry.The crispy garlic chicken is always cooked to perfection, with a garlic dressing that's downright addictive. I find myself craving this spot at least once a month, and we'll continue to return for a consistently enjoyable meal that never disappoints. Di Fiora truly knows how to curry favor with its patrons!

name: Di Fiora
text_review: The best neighborhood Asian Fusion restaurant. Must try the calamari and the Malaysian Coconut soup- with shrimp- to die for.Actually- everything is good here!

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Warm, welcoming attentive staff. Excellent customer service. Beautifully decorated cafe. Delicious food and cocktails.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: First off, Gui was incredibly friendly, attentive, and helpful. He not only seated us but also served as our server throughout the meal. While everyone who assisted us was very kind, our primary interaction was with him, and he truly excelled in his role.As for the food, I'm perplexed by any previous reviews describing it as "bland." Unless they mean it's not as intensely spicy as vindaloo curry or ghost pepper level, I'm not sure where that criticism is coming from. Speaking as someone who has an extensive spice cabinet and is often critical of under-seasoned dishes, I can confidently say this place was outstanding. My partner and I dined here last night, and we were both thoroughly impressed. We ordered the crispy duck with green curry, the house carbonara, the ahi appetizer, the coconut soup, coconut crepe cake, and a total of three cocktails. Every dish was excellent; we were particularly enamored with the coconut soup, which we wished we could buy by the gallon. The duck and carbonara were also exceptional, bursting with full flavor, and impeccably prepared. While the ahi appetizer wasn't quite on the same level as the rest of the meal, it was still quite good--my partner especially enjoyed it.
