Overall, the dining experience was stellar, and we're already planning our next visit before we have to leave town. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town!

name: Di Fiora
text_review: amazing food, people gave my family a nice service. drinks are good too, prices are ok, could be better to the given quality

name: Di Fiora
text_review: The best food i have eaten in a while!! I'm very pleased. We ordered the steak and crab fried rice, which both turned out to be very delicious. The steak had unique Asian spices that blend very well together with the meat and salad on the side. The fried rice was soft and tasty and I kept wanting more. We will definitely come back to try other dishes :)Note: they have a reservation system and are usually fully booked. We didn't make a reservation beforehand but managed to get in after waiting for half an hour. So make your reservation.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Delicious food, stunning aesthetic, good service, pretty drinks, not too expensive. Highly recommend. We loved the flavor of all the dishes. Super flavorful Asian fusion dishes - especially that coconut soup. I'd order all of these again and come back to try the rest of the menu. Thank you!

name: Di Fiora
text_review: TRY THE WINGS OMG TRY THE WINGS!!! I love their wings because when you eat them with the sauce, it taste amazing, and when you eat them without the sauce they taste EVEN BETTER. Its almost like magic. I swear I am not even lying because without the sauce it taste so refreshing, and their is a hint of a lemon lime taste at the end. Its amazing. I love this place so much. My cousins and I went for the first time for a galantines event we were doing and we all were mind blown. Its cozy, cute, comfy, yummy, and the service and drinks were bomb as well. Five stars all the way, they never let down.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: I like it. Suggestions and Recommendations: The restaurant staff offered suggestions and recommendations based on their expertise and knowledge of the menu. Their insights helped me discover new and delicious dishes that I might not have tried otherwise.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: I love there location I'm in love with there food I've eat there 4 times already And I would definitely recommend

name: Di Fiora
text_review: On my second visit, I am delighted to confirm that Di Fiora is just as excellent as it was the first time. The fried calamari and crab fried rice were especially enjoyable. We also tried the Malaysian Coconut Soup with seafood and the rainbow salad. Although I typically consume white woodear mushrooms in sweet soups, I appreciated the texture of the mushrooms in the soup here. Additionally, the rainbow salad would be visually appealing on Instagram. This restaurant is an ideal location for a romantic date or a night out with friends.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Beautiful venue, consistently good food. I just love this place every time I came here. Highly recommend the roasted duck and the crab fried rice! Must order items every time. Also really love the scallops in sauce, and drinks were also creative and reasonable. My girlfriend adored the decoration here!

name: Di Fiora
text_review: This might be my new favorite restaurant. Unique flavors, super high quality, and amazing decor. I never realized I liked caviar until I checked the menu after and realized they sprinkled some on all of our dishes.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Beautiful food and beautiful decor. I thought they put a lot of thought into everything. Highly recommended.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: LOVE LOVE LOVE! From the food to the drinks, everything is amazingly presented.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Great service and delicious food. My daughter wanted to try this place and it was great.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Great Food and Great Service. Highly recommended for reservations during dinner time. I have been waited at other restaurants that has no reservations for over an hour so having the online reservation system is convenient. Best dishes I recommended are Crab Fried Rice, Curry and Chicken Wings. Kids love it so much.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: I visited this restaurant again on Sunday but the line omg!! Crazy busy so I decided to come back again this Monday brunch ( with reservation) all the dishes that I ordered still delicious as before. Especially the crab fired rice which is my fav one. I love the Monday vibe with full house customer but not too crowded. The playlist was very interesting as well. Never disappointed every time I came here. Definitely and definitely recommend this Asian fusion restaurant.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: I had a very good experience at this restaurant. The food was awesome. The decorations are very classy.

name: Di Fiora
text_review: Great meal, service, and atmosphere! I will absolutely be coming here again. Such a good find!!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: GROSSSEverything about this place was gross. I would never come back people where disrespectful

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: after you eat they let you keep the bones to build a cage

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Why are they doing Togo orders with no mask and no gloves? Food is not worth my health. I will not be ordering from fogon anymore while in quarantine. Everyone should stay away from this place for safety. The gentleman working the front desk was really rude to me as well. My husband wanted to get down and confront him but we drove off. YOU NEED GLOVES AND MASK!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This place is a hot mess. There is absolutely no system in place for the Togo orders. They are definitely unable to keep up with the demand of business. There is no social distancing happening when you pick up your order! None of the employees are wearing mask. This place is a covid trap waiting to happen. Do not order food here as they are not prepared for the demand or have a safe system In place. On top of that, the guy GARY who works the front table is not friendly at all and completely stressed and unprofessional. He is RUDE AF! Sorry fogon, officially going down the street for safe Mexican food! Absolutely no excuse for the horrible customer service from GARY. I would like an explanation from the owners as why they are putting customers at risk but not following CDC guidelines to wear a mask. It went to affect April 3rd! Also, during a pandemic when people should be really be nice to each other you have the worst person GARY at the front helping customers who has the worst attitude ever. I am coming out of my house to support you as a restaurant and I'm treated like that is completely unprofessional. It says a lot about a restaurant when you see all the reviews and there is absolutely no response from the owners. Good or bad.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This place is really rude. Never coming here. Do not recommend this place. Paid for our food and drinks and made us wait outside.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: BE AWARE!!!!! First time in Seattle. We stopped in for a bite and a drink and both drinks had glass in the drinks!!! One drink was a chard the size of an ice cube and the other one had tiny pieces at the bottom of the other glass. This absolutely unacceptable!!! The manager didn't bother to come to the table with an apology for the mishap. The waiter said simply said, "the manager is not going to charge you for your glass filled drinks." NO APOLOGY IF ACKNOWLEDGEMENT!!!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Not kid friendly. Ended up leaving right after arriving. Parking is horrible. We were looked down on because o brought my 7 and 2 year old. Food may be good but not good enough.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Only good thing is they have black beans ... they charge for chips and salsa and it's not even good ... I could go on but need I?

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Keep moving....I definitely would suggest skipping the cocktail list. For example, "fresh lime juice" = margarita mix from Safeway. The service feels inexperienced and rather discombobulated. Maybe it was just an off night?

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Food was good . Staff were dicks, I walked in with my mask on and sat down and took it off. When going to the bathroom I forgot to put it on, then a staff member yelled for me to put it on - way over the top. Trying to find the BR another staff member said in a condescending tone, "it's over there with the biggest door". Maybe I was disoriented with another douche staff member yelling at me, either way, the staff were dicks who acted with a rod up their ass

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Workers seat their friends before customers that were there first. Cool vibe but friends should WAIT.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: 2nd time here. We loved the food and service the 1st time. This time service was horrible. The food was still good. What made me question if I want to return again was the service but the icing on the cake was we paid w 100 cash when we got our change it was 13 I was like excuse me I have the manager 100 and he said let me check and went in the back.  I saw the manager so I showed him what I was given and he followed the guy to the back and they both returned this time with the 20 I was shorted.  Not sure his name but he is tall, skinny Latino. Beware!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This is not Mexican food. This is a Honduran abomination. (Catrachos! Los olí a entrar no más. Mages! Dejen de inventar!) 4 stars on Yelp for this mediocrity says everything about Seattle's grasp of Mexican cuisine: hopelessly out of touch.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Price is great but the quality of the food is average at best. This place tends to get very crowded and sometimes the lines get long. They do have a lot of seating so it turn around pretty quick. Most of the staff members are friendly but you can tell that it does get a little overcrowded at times and things get missed. It's a good place to go if you are getting ready to go out and get hammered or are coming back from getting hammered. I just wouldn't think of going here for regular dinner or a date. There are just too many options to eat in Seattle for better quality (except you will pay more).

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Really great lunch spot. I also hear their HH is great.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Delicious Mexican food. The Ultimate Margarita was great as well!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The serving sizes are huge! All of us were surprised how cheap it was for a big plate of food. The place has a good vibe and serves great Mexican dishes. I had a Chicken Fajita Burrito (pictured) and a Torta. Wasn't the best Mexican food I've had, but good enough.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Extremely good Mexican food, unbelievably delicious. Everything on their menu is top-notch, although the shrimp cocktail is served hot? It's usually a cold dish, but whatever, this restaurant deserves the spotlight. If anything, it's surprising it doesn't have an award by now. Stop by and have a fiesta full of fun and a margarita to complement, why not.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This place is great! Atmosphere is chill and cool but the staff is also really friendly. They know what they're doing and what they're talking about, and you can tell making the customers happy is their main priority. Food is pretty good, some Mexican classics and some twists, and for their prices it's 100% worth it.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Easily some of the best mexican food Iv'e ever had, love their mole!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: So much deliciousness! We are here at least once a week, I swear. They've got their take-out situation DOWN! Awesome margaritas to-go even! Check out their menu on-line, ring them up, and swing on by in 15-20. The pick-up station is right as you get in the door and you can see thru the glass door if you need to wait until someone else finished getting their goodies. Support this lovely, family-owned, local business in these nutty times, y'all!!!!!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I loved that they have happy hour and they are the best mexican resto in town!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Service could have been better but the food was really good! I had the ceviche and corona, super good!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Big portions, and really good! You don't get skimped, and the atmosphere is great!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: They start you off with a delicious dish called tostada. We ordered tortilla soup and tacos. The tacos were so spicy we sent them back for another dish. Our waitress was wonderful. I would eat here again.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great happy hour, pretty good food. I grew up close to the border and have pretty high standards for Mexican food and this place definitely satisfied. Drinks were delicious and reasonably priced (the sangria was good and strong too) the fresh tortillas reminded me of home and were very very good. When it isn't happy hour it's a little pricey but still worth it. It was very busy and loud which I don't mind but if it bothers you, go during an off time.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Best Mexican food I've ever had! I'm going to crave this place. Awesome ambience, excellent service!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: One of the best places to get mexican food in town. Their tortillas are just amazing!!!I'm giving it a 4 instead of 5 only because their veg options are not great. My faves here - Guac and chips, margaritas, Polla a la Crema!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The complimentary appetizer tostada is worthy of ordering on its own! Delicious food, and a lot of great options that you don't always find at other Mexican restaurants. Definitely would recommend.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: It's large and loud but good service and good authentic Mexican food. I'll be back!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This is the first real Mexican I have had in Seattle. Definitely worth a try!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: good authentic mexican

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Ceviche was great! High quality, not high prices.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Like it!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Opened today. Lively remake of the space and a delicious array of offerings on menu.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This was quite a nice surprise during our recent visit to Seattle. The service and atmosphere is great, but the food truly stole the show! This was one of the best meals and overall experiences I've had in a long time. I highly recommend!!!!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Best tortillas in town! Try their street tacos for sure. Their chicken fajitas is different from what you would usually find elsewhere. The chicken comes soaked a light tangy sauce. The Veggie tamales was surprisingly good.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great food and great service! Parking was easy to find. I will definitely be back. The servings were plenty!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I recently visited fogón with my girlfriend, and we had an amazing time. The drinks were perfect, especially on a hot day, and the environment was inviting with great music playing in the background. We were particularly impressed by our server, Erick. He was exceptionally nice, helped us choose some fantastic drinks, and made sure our ice water was always refilled. Despite being busy, he managed everything efficiently and made our experience memorable. We'll definitely be coming back!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The service was fast. The servers answered my questions with courtesy. The chicken enchilada was so good I will be back and thank you.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Very very good food! Tostada was complimentary and it was delicious! Might go back for breakfast

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Amazing food! So surprising. Very cool atmosphere, too. The complimentary appetizer is to die for. Had the enchilada & the street tacos. Definitely recommend the spiked horchata!!!!!!!! Also got lunch and brunch! So delicious for every meal

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: It's one of my favorite places to go to for Mexican food.Highly recommend the quesadilla as well as the fish tacos! The portions are pretty good for the price, and the flavors are on point. The fatty meat in the quesadilla is perfectly paired with fresh salsa and cheese. The fish taco was delicious as well. Crispy and light fish in a soft-shelled taco is so worth it. Another go-to is the burrito! Highly recommended if you want something more filling, as it has veggies and beans inside. There are also several sauces available that go well with your choice of food!Service was great as well, the order was served quickly too.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Visited on Halloween evening. The food was decent Mexican food. Ambiance was nice. Good options for happy hour. It took us 40 minutes to get the table. Highly recommend to book table before arriving. The restaurant has accessible entrance located in street level. Parking could be challenging since the location is in busy Capitol Hill area.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: For as long as I've been here, this spot has stayed on the corner of Pine/Belmont the longest. If you can get in for their Happy Hour, it is worth the wait. Good food and good luck.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great service!!! Went on a weeknight and we got to sit down quickly and the service was very fast too!Drinks are always FRESH! And the price is right for using fresh ingredients! (None of that sweet and sour mixer crap!)

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great Mexican place in seattle! From what I understand there aren't a lot but this one was amazing! I had the Arroz con Pollo which was delicious and everyone else loved their food as well. Service was super fast even though it was a Friday night and they were busy. I'd love to come back here.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Wanna share business reviews, service complaints and remain anonymous. Send us your videos at honestconsumereviewer@gm…

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great food and good service and pleasant atmosphere. Have been a few times and it hasn't disappointed yet.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Really enjoyed dining at Fogon. The mojito was fresh with the right amount of liquor, the Queso Fundido had a good amount of spicy chorizo and was truly really cheesy, and I'm glad I had enough room to have some of the flans. If you're looking for a lovely Mexican restaurant, check them out.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Amazing! Food and service were great. We had the Seafood enchilada and the fish tacos.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Delicious lunch options for a great price! Service is always so-so but not a big deal to me

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great service, food, and value! We popped by for an early dinner this weekend and the place was absolutely packed, but we were seated and served super quickly!The place was a bit hot even with the fans running, but not a big deal. They have happy hour everyday so it was great to try out some of the items. I got carne aside tacos subbed with flour tortillas and it was delicious!This place is probably one of the best Mexican restaurants I've had in Seattle. 5/5 would definitely recommend!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Awesome tacos and great atmosphere, can't wait to bring my wife to try some drinks and other food!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The burritos are great. The cream chicken is great too.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Tacos are amazing. 1/2 off Tequila on Taco Tuesday can't beat itStreet Tacos , margaritas

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I go there for the crab enchiladas. That's the only thing I get. It hits the spot every time.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Excellent authentic Mexican food. The selection of mole sauces are outstanding. Menu choices are excellent. Our servers were lovely, attentive, and patiently answered all our questions whilst giving us great recommendations. The most creative and possibly authentic Mexican menu. Recipe, taste, presentation, and absolutely fabulous! We had Carne Asada Burrito and Tortilla Soup has an amazing presentation and looks so appetizing. The food is delicious and well seasoned. The timing was excellent and the service was second to none. If not enough the ambiance allows for a relaxed meal and great conversation.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great service - fun and exciting atmosphere- food quality is great for the price - a great go to place

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Yes! All thumbs up! Awesome burritos as you can see.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Food and drinks were really good! The staff are really friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I come here to get my favorite carne asada burrito!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I would highly recommend trying the mole here, it's delicious!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I absolutely love the burritos here. Great price and delicious food!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: It's one of my favorite places. Been here quite a few times. The vibe is always fab and the staff is generally very friendly, only this time one of the staff on the floor (Mexican descent) seemed so happy, and love the sharing smile. Lovely comeback!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great spot with some good vibes. Great friendly service all the way around. Food tastes awesome, with some twists to dishes pre-Covid. I really enjoy the booth streets with the windows popped open. They added a great spot outdoors due to Covid. I've been coming here since they've opened. The drinks are so yummy and offer scratch in house drinks.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: One of those hole-in-the-wall places you always hear about with fantastic food. Went there for lunch not expecting much but found the owners working the grill and extremely friendly and helpful. The food was great and prepared quickly. Overall, very good.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: My favorite place for Mexican food. Everything I have tried was super delicious. Thank you for being often during this hard time. Me and my friends always order pick-up whenever we gather up together and they like it as well.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: My favorite favorite place to eat! The ceviche and tacos are to die for, place is always packed and great vibe and atmosphere!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I'm glad that I'm writing this review. Location was absolutely beautiful and phenomenal customer service. I had truly a wonderful time here. Attentive staff, delicious food and friendly environment. For me, this place is on my top list. Preferably recommended!!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The food was literally a mouth-watering! I dined here recently and it was nice to experience to taste such delicious authentic Mexican food. The tacos dorados and carne asada were definitely the best for me. It was really fresh and taste so delicious. Excellent authentic food. The staff was nice. They have a great location. Service was a bit slow just because it is packed though.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Loved the place, you won't go wrong with their Mexican dishes, you'll surely get what you paid for and get filled with satisfaction. Portions were on point, it's a bit hard for me to finish a whole plate of carne asada burrito. It was so good, the meat and the sauce certainly gives this omph! in every bite.Service is also top notch, I had a great experience and the staff that took care of us was very friendly and welcoming. Gave us our orders quickly and we are very happy with it.We'll come back and highly recommend this place to others.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Very good Mexican food. Very good menu.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Ultimate margarita is everything.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Amazing food it was delicious..I also really enjoyed atmosphere.They also have a good choices for vegetarians

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This is a place I regularly come to.They are very generous with their portions, food comes out quickly, and the service is great. ii loved it.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I went up to Seattle to visit a friend and this was my first meal there. I was happily satisfied! Despite the hour and a half wait (when we were told 45m-1h) and loud ambience, the chips, salsa, guac, and food were delicious.Everyone in the group got the entree with meat, rice, and beans so we got to try different dishes. I had the pollo asado and was surprised to see a large slab of chicken on my plate. But I didn't even need a knife it was that tender. And don't even get me started on the handmade corn tortillas! Best ever.At the end of the meal I was full but not feeling weighed down. 10/10 would return; maybe for happy hour next time!!!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Had dinner with a friend, we had a good time and great Mexican food.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Fire! Everything on their menu is a most have. This is one of the places that you have to visit several times in order to enjoy the full menu. Their guac is incredibly on point. I could kiss their cooks!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Delicious drinks! Delicious food! GREAT service! Oh, and they have an amazing HH menu! We need a Fogón in Los Angeles.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I went to Fogon Cocina a few weeks ago, and the food and drinks were both good. Nice atmosphere and nice interior. I will definitely go back again. One of the best restaurants in town, and I hardly recommended it. Everything in the menu is delicious and has great flavor. Nice ambience, polite waitress and nice music inside.Hubby and my favorite date night spot! We change up our order with each visit, and it is always AMAZING!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: My favorite restaurant in Seattle. A must try! The food is great and all of the staff members are friendly. Anytime anyone comes to visit I tell them to go here.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Best Mexican Food spot in Seattle!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Love the little app they give you before you order. Best salsa verde as well. Service is good, a little slow but doesn't bother me. Great place to watch games too.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I love this place. What a great find. I am in love with the complimentary tostadas to start off the meal. Yum. The guacamole is delicious and the carne asada cooked perfectly. on my next cheat day, Im heading back there for that queso with chorizo. It looked incredible.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Awesome happy hour!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: My family loves this place! The second you sit down, and sometimes before, your drink order is asked and hot chips and perfect salsa are at your table. The prices are right and the food is delicious. We especially enjoy their bean and cheese burritos. Our toddler loves their rice and chips and salsa.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This area is very good. Everything is newly made- chips, salsa, tortillas, salsa, guacamole, ceviche, etc... You name it. Food is tasty and genuine- not your typical texmex that's common around here. The staff is extremely friendly and keen to please. At first the cocktails look pricy but they're DELICIOUS and made with top quality tequilas. And they've wonderful happy hour specials!! No gripes here!!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This is my go to. Recommend it to someone daily. Was very upset it took me this long to find out about this place. Closets I have had to authentic Mexican food in Seattle. Torta and a beer and you'll be happy. See you tonight!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Very good food. I would highly recommend this place to anyone! Although my stop was quick, I really enjoyed the service, environment, and food.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Soooooooooo good they seriously have the best chicken tortilla soup! There happy hour is the best! And the free tostada!! Heck yes! You won't be disappointed!! Love the vibe in there

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Delicious! Great service, great food, and a great happy hour!! Definitely going back!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Fogon is my favorite right in my neighborhood the best noon day margarita you will ever have! They will serve you fast and you can enjoy a cheap happy hour after three i tried it after seeing some other yelp reviews and now I can't stop going there!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The best happy hour place ever! I live couple feet away and the place is always crowded- in a good way. Owners are super nice and the food is delicious. Their tortilla soup is SO good, especially on a rainy day. Regular menu is reasonably priced and happy hour menu is hard to beat!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This place is amazing.  I will never go to Seattle and not visit it again.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Delicious. Well priced. Great service.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Great food and friendly service. Will definitely come back!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Food is mediocre. But the happy hour bar is awesome! U have to get the $8 Margaritas, they give u entire flask, it's 5 drinks! Bucket of beer is good too. Free chips and salsa. Chips r fresh, a little thick for my liking but some love.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Delicious authentic Mexican food! Definitely recommend!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: This restaurant is excellent on all levels. I have made reservations for the last five years here and it is consistantly the best experience each time.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Fogon has great food, super friendly staff and a comfortable atmosphere! Love the drinks, the fresh-hand made tortillas and their authentic Mexican dishes!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Good food. Great happy hour!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The girl who works there is so sweet, that is why I go not for the food!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: I love this place! amazing food and very reasonably priced. the staff always make me feel special.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: They have Happy Hour 9pm to close. Great for late night munchies.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Highly recommend!

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: The food is fantastic. Lots of options. Amazing horchata!Love them.

name: Fogon Cocina Mexicana
text_review: Really great space, and the food looked as great as it tasted. Friendly staff!

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: the most racist place I have ever been to!!! the bartender with long braids and ugly green nails can't stand to see a black man with a white female/ wife that he's been with for 22 years! thus bartender is a bitch!! food was amazing you staff is horrible!!!!!!!!! never will be back! and this posted all over YouTube! we are big YouTube influencer and came to your establishment because if other YouTubets! this place is racist!!!! get new bartenders!!!

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: My recent dining experience at Communion in Seattle was nothing short of disappointing. From lackluster dishes to poor service, it fell far below expectations.Firstly, the gumbo was bland, lacking in flavor, and the seafood was overcooked, resulting in a less-than-pleasant texture. The Mac and cheese, while a classic favorite, was ruined by an excessive amount of smoky flavor. Even the cosmopolitan tasted more like watered-down Kool-Aid than a crafted beverage.To add to the disappointment, the service was subpar. Our waitress seemed disinterested and unfriendly, displaying an attitude that made us feel as though we should be grateful just to be dining there. Her lack of helpfulness only exacerbated our already tarnished experience.Overall, Communion failed to deliver on both the culinary and service fronts. For those seeking a memorable dining experience in Seattle, I would advise looking elsewhere.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: I am definitely not at home here. Twice the hostess turned me away claiming the empty seats were for reservations only. I never expected such snobby behavior from a soul food joint. Evidently gentrification turned these Black folks bougy to where they turn away customers who aren't white hipsters living in the area. A decade ago East Union was a crime infested area with struggling Black owned businesses begging for customers. What a difference a decade makes. So I took my money to another business with much better customer service does not care about the social caste of the customer.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: I wanted to like this place, I really did. However, the food was average, service was fine, and branding/marketing is corny (e.g., calling their sushi Hood Sushi - why?!) Based on their social media pictures, I thought I was going to take one bite of a dish, slam my hand down utensil tightly gripped and let out an expletive in joy. But, no, I took one bite of the hood sushi and could not discern the flavors of the catfish or other ingredients. I primarily tasted seaweed and rice and the watermelon sauce just added salt (a lot of it) to the mix. Overall, the food didn't live up to the hype. Though, I may give the food one more chance because the catfish and grits LOOKED amazing (all their food looks delicious on Instagram and in-person). All the food I ate was just okay. First, I tried the sushi which didn't offer the fusion flavor the chef intended. The shrimp toast would have been great if it wasn't over toasted. Also, the greens were too oily for me.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: Overhyped restaurant. Food is mediocre at best. Totally not worth the wait. Won't dine here again.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: My recent visit to Communion left me with mixed feelings. While there were some highlights, there were also areas that could use improvement.Food Quality: Everything we ate seemed overcooked and dry. It seemed as if it was reheated too many times, idk but it wasn't what I was hoping for cause almost every review I saw made it seem like it was gonna be some of the best food in the PNW. The drinks were good though. The best part of the meal was the watermelon salad. The flavored hot sauce just tasted like regular hot sauce to me so that was kinda disappointing. I saw some Nigerian and Carribean-inspired items, so I tried the akara; they were a miss for me personally. Service: The service was friendly and attentive. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and offered suggestions. However, there was a bit of a delay in getting our food, which was a downside, especially when you're hungry. (But the delay in food wasn't an issue in totality because it was busy so that's expected)Ambiance: It has a laid-back and casual atmosphere, which fits the cuisine. The décor and music were enjoyable. It was kinda weird that they picked and chose who to enforce their dress code with and not. Portion Size: The portion sizes were quite generous it was enough for two of us and more. Drinks: The drinks were really good and fit the theme. The names were unique and some were already premade so all you had to do was pour and enjoy.Overall Experience: While my visit had its share of ups and downs, there were some notable aspects. The flavors and ambiance created a pleasant atmosphere, but the food quality was inconsistent, and the wait times were slightly longer than expected. I would recommend giving this restaurant a try, but I hope they focus on improving the consistency of their dishes to make it a more reliable dining option. It's a three-star experience for now, but with some tweaks, it could certainly reach higher heights.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: I came here for drinks with colleagues when staying at the hotel above. We stopped in to use some drink coupons. What a fun theme and great drinks at reasonable prices. We were the only guests and received excellent service in a unique, beautiful setting. It is a must-see! The design of the bar is stunning. The beautiful backlit stained glass murals throughout make for a relaxing environment. We will return!

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: They have really good soup and sandwich combinations here.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: Excellent service. The ambiance of everyone sitting close to each other was a great idea. Everyone there was nice, friendly, & seem to enjoy the food. The customers were very diverse although restaurant is black owned. I enjoyed the creative menu. Hood Sushi is delicious. The dumplings hit the spot as well and tasted like a cabbage. I wish I had a dozen Hoe cakes. Fried okra without the slime left me in awe. The deviled eggs were so good.I'm definitely going back when I'm in Seattle again

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: Best experience ever! The service was spot on. Food was absolutely delicious and we can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu! What a wonderful local business, a must try!!

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: Very nice restaurant, with excellent food .Make sure you have reservations.Parking is not plentiful around this restaurant.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: The food, service, and music was great. The owner was nice and welcoming. He made sure we had a great experience.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: One of the best meals I've had in a very long time. Great service and even better food. If you get a chance to eat here you have to take it.

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: amazing food and amazing ppl!!!!!

name: COMMUNION Restaurant and Bar
text_review: This place is gold. Sat outside in comfort with heaters and started with our server's suggestion of the salmon corn chowder, rich and smooth. And don't come here without trying the okra, crisp and just the lightest seasoning. For the entrees, the berbere smoked chicken was cut and presented to perfection. And the shrimp and grits are just another reason we'll come back. Service was impeccable.

name: Le Coin
text_review: The place smells AWFUL.Seriously, its super stinky and smells like someone farted in a bag and left it for 5 years to marinate. Put some incense in there y'all. Besides that, the waiter dropped my food and i had to wait like 2 hours for my food. Food was decent though, overpriced still for its mediocrity

name: Le Coin
text_review: We went back to Le Coin, this time I got the chicken sandwich. I have to admit I'm a Le Coin Burger fan, but my husband loved the chicken sandwich equally and so we switched. Jordan was super friendly and our waitress was so kind. Definitely recommend this place. Our guests also loved the apple fritters.

name: Le Coin
text_review: I was honestly a bit disappointed in the menu. The dishes were good but not really what I was hoping for.

name: Le Coin
text_review: Get the octopus and wagyu, it's super delicious!

name: Le Coin
text_review: Excellent selection of NW French fusion dishes. Gotta go back to try more of there sumptuous fare... Great wine selection and local brews. Katie was superb as our server & the entire staff are so helpful and friendly! Hip, fun & cozy, yet not pretentious. Highly recommend.

name: Le Coin
text_review: Absolutely my favorite location!Le Coin has a great vibe overall, and the food is excellent.Starting your meal with oysters and champagne mignonette is a terrific idea. Although there is always something new and fascinating to try on the seasonal menu, my all-time favorite dish is the steak frites. The dessert selection never lets you down, and the cocktails are creative and intriguing. Service were so fast.

name: Le Coin
text_review: fantastic food , drinks, serviceeverytime!

name: Le Coin
text_review: The staff were engaging, relaxed, and were genuinely happy to have us. We opted for the Chef's counter tasting menu and felt quite satiated by the fourth course. Not only were the staff engaging but the chefs and line cooks were equally interested in how we were doing, what dish stood out, etc. Not to mention the free beignets from Andrew, who was happy to share his newly mastered technique with us. The food was incredibly layered with wonderful ingredient selection, preparation and execution. The oysters with bacon were some of the best cooked oysters I ever had and don't sleep on the greens as presentation, they paired so well with sauce too. Highly recommend a visit if you like a dining experience to be engaging and each dish to be well designed and paired exquisitely with all ingredients. Next time, I'm opting for the wine pairing.

name: Le Coin
text_review: We had a great time. This is a local gem. The service and food could not have been any better.

name: Le Coin
text_review: We had a really pleasant experience here, there seafood is delcious!

name: Le Coin
text_review: The take out food still taste great and the best is it still have great presentation inside the to-go box. :)

name: Le Coin
text_review: Everything was great! Warm outdoor seating, awesome service and food!We will be back.

name: Le Coin
text_review: Great place for take out. They bring it right to your car. Loved the pandemic margarita.

name: Le Coin
text_review: We order here our take out dinner during this lockdown...The entire staff engaged with us, friendly, and so sweet while waiting to our orders. I ordered this sablefish. It was a powerhouse of flavor, it was incredibly tasty. Looking forward to returning.

name: Le Coin
text_review: Food was fantastic. Service was spot on. Great location. All in all it was a fun dinner with wonderful food.

name: Le Coin
text_review: I can't speak highly enough of the food and service we received on our visit to Le Coin. What brought me to the restaurant was the cool drink menu which was inspired by one of my favorite shows-The Wire. We were able to reserve a seat at the chefs counter and it was worth it. The chef and other kitchen staff were amazing. The interacted with us, answered with questions etc. The octopus is absolutely phenomenal and so was the pork chop and sablefish dish. We saw a lot of the burger coming out the kitchen so that's next on my list. This place is a must go and we will be returning soon

name: Le Coin
text_review: Excellent food! Good quality and diverse offerings. Best to go during HH to try a better variety. The location and interior were really nice too. Wonderful service from Leslie and Ray! We will certainly be back again!

name: re:public
text_review: Just had a fantastic time with friends at this pub! The food was absolutely delicious, especially the Steak Bites, Fries, and Crispy Brussels Sprouts. The menu offered a variety of options, and everything we tried was top-notch. The pub itself has a great atmosphere, with solid vibes that make it a nice spot to hang out.One of the highlights was the extensive drink options available. They had a wide selection of drinks to choose from, catering to various preferences. The service was quick and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, making sure we had everything we needed.The prices were fair for the quality and quantity of food and drinks provided. It's always a relief when you get good value for your money. All in all, it was a great experience - good food, good drinks, good service, and good vibes. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you're in the mood for a enjoyable and satisfying pub experience.

name: re:public
text_review: Good food. Good service. Portions are big. So order mindfully. Was there for dinner a few weeks back.

name: re:public
text_review: Had a big team dinner there and they were able to accommodate us and had great food and drinks.

name: re:public
text_review: This is one of the best first date locations in all of South Lake Union in my opinion. Great ambiance and excellent food.

name: re:public
text_review: Great location and tasty cocktails and happy hour bites. They have a very nice outdoor patio that has a really nice vibe. The old fashioned was reasonably priced and tasted great. I liked their whiskey selection that I saw posted above the bar.

name: re:public
text_review: Was not sure what to expect, but it was very good. Thank you for the good food and the great service!

name: re:public
text_review: Perhaps the best carne asada fries I have had in a very long time!

name: re:public
text_review: It was a nice place and the restaurant has a great interior setting. The menu was incredible and has lots of good options. Everything was fresh, well-seasoned, and worth the wait. The restaurant has a great ambiance was pleasantly great. Very cozy to dine in and the food was well-presented. I got to taste the challah french toast and wild boar bolognese. Very wonderful taste, so delicious. The portion was a good and very reasonable price.

name: re:public
text_review: Good lunch spot. Sandwiches are great value and they have great cocktails too- doesn't disappoint but doesn't wow you either

name: re:public
text_review: Very cool Whiskey/Bourbon/scotch bar and restaurant. Only had the late night menu but food was delicious but portions are small. Beet salad and steak bites were delicious.

name: re:public
text_review: Cool little spot with pretty good food. I felt it was a little over priced, but for the ambiance we made it work.

name: re:public
text_review: This place was cool. It had a good happy hour, good food, and good service. I'd recommend if you are in the area.

name: re:public
text_review: I love this place. Such a cool vibe. The staff is friendly, the service is great, and the drinks are tasty. The olive appetizer is fantastic, as are the fries with the aioli sampler.

name: re:public
text_review: Strolled in for brunch midday on a Saturday, not really knowing what to expect. I had previewed a brunch menu online that looked like it was on point, but I was really sold by the fact that they take online reservations for brunch - unheard of in Seattle - and all I really wanted was some good food in a decent atmosphere without the hours long wait that generally trademark brunch in this city.While this is certainly one of the many dinner/bar locations that brunch offerings are clearly their second line of business, with "brunch" written on a chalkboard for diners to take notice while they are in for a drink on a Friday night, I was pleasantly surprised at the airiness of the place with the roll-up opened on a nice summer day.Service was great - timely, thoughtful, and kind. Mimosas were generous in the champagne department and were mixed with fresh oj. And the food - THE FOOD! I ordered the beef short rib chilaquiles and the hubs ordered the fried chicken/waffle. The chilaquiles were delicious! Topped with radish and cilantro, a side of black brand with cotija cheese, and served with crème fraîche, a lime wedge, and green "diablo salsa" - just the right amount of heat. The fried chicken and waffle were also amazing - the chicken was juicy on the inside and had perfectly crispy skin, and the waffle was sprinkled with pecans and bacon and topped with a cardamon butter that was to die for! The perfect sweet/savory brunch item.If you're looking for a fabulous brunch without the wait, re:public is now definitely on the top of my list.

name: re:public
text_review: Only been here from lunch and drinks.  Not bad, but not great.

name: re:public
text_review: i like this place a lot. a couple of weeks ago i wound up here twice in one week. i really like the bread and butter dish. i recommend asking for extra salt to bring the butter up to that special zing level. i think it's either $2 or $3.i met up with a friend to give him some water bottles for his future STP ride. they are massively late. parking is a hassle around there. i found a couple of douchey guys sitting in their douchey cars, talking on their douchey cell phones, taking up valuable free street parking spots. hope that doesn't turn into a hot new trend. i would go back again for the good beers and i'd try the food too.

name: re:public
text_review: Great decor. Great wine selection. Great food, except for the egg on the asparagus plate. My friend and I enjoyed being by the garage door. I'm a foodie, she's not. Good time had by both. Would come again.

name: re:public
text_review: SNARF!Re:Public is a new cute little cubby looking joint straight ILLIN' in the midst of SLU. The red letters on the sign make it that much more magical. Anywho, we had a private company event here and I definitely indulged. The ambiance was very romantic so I could definitely see myself cruising here for a nice glass of vino on a weekend or weekday with a sweet lil' thang.I had the crab puffs as an appetizer and they were quite scrumptious, some amazing lasagna and pasta for my entree. After I was almost all the way full I tried their rib eye and was immediately blown away. This place wasn't too pricey so definitely worth your time if you're in the area.Bonus info: This is about 1 notch up from Joey's in SLU. It's more expensive so I would recommend Joey's if you're just having drinks and/or a light appetizer and Re:Public if you want a higher class menu and ambiance.

name: re:public
text_review: I was happy to try this place. Great food. Everyone I was with enjoyed it.

name: re:public
text_review: Great happy hour menu for food and drinks. The service was fast and friendly. Lunch and dinner menu are great too.

name: re:public
text_review: Absolutely delicious and service was impeccable. Would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

name: re:public
text_review: Was in Seattle for 36 hours and wound up here twice. Delicious foods, one of the best Old fashioneds I've ever had, and AMAZING service from the bar staff.

name: re:public
text_review: The menu is excellently great and good quality meals. Great spot for dinner. We occasionally dined here and so far the food never disappoint us. The kurobuta Pork Chop and Risotto were on-point, well-cooked, and taste really delicious. The drinks selection made our night perfectly great, Cocktails are fantastic. The price is reasonable.

name: re:public
text_review: The carne asada fries here are to die for!

name: re:public
text_review: This is the best place to get some carne asada fries in my opinion!

name: re:public
text_review: The steak fries are absolutely phenomenal here!

name: re:public
text_review: Amazing service and delicious food selection, you can't go wrong with anything here! Food to service is spot on :)

name: re:public
text_review: Four words. Happy hour lamb burger. Do it.

name: re:public
text_review: i love food and staff here.for the great food and wonderful experience, i would give them 10 stars :)

name: re:public
text_review: Fantastic staff, great space and location in South Lake Union. I LOVE the bartender Rory. (Had been in the week before and really liked it so brought my team in for drinks after work, Rory remembered what I had the last time I was in and was a dream!) Everyone made us feel very welcome and will definitely be back. Seems like a lot of regulars with the staff greeting many by name.A really wonderful place and worth a visit if you're working near Amazon campus.

name: re:public
text_review: One of the best bars and restaurants in Seattle.

name: re:public
text_review: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! This has become a monthly treat for me and a couple co-workers. Fantastic wine list, amazing food, small portions but worth every penny. You just have to get a little wine-drunk first and savor each bite. I wish I had done a review when this was still on the menu, but I am going to mention it anyway...foie gras creme brulee. Yep, most amazing thing I have ever had in my entire life. I couldn't tell if I was eating a meal or a dessert, omg, if you guys are reading this please, please bring it back! I have only sat at the bar, but service is always attentive even when its busy. Until last week I was only in on weekday nights, but I stopped by for a martini by myself on a friday and it was packed! Definitely a fun scene on the weekends if you are looking to meet people or come in with a group, probably not as good for a date seeing as it was super loud, but good for them for being busy. A+

name: re:public
text_review: Great food. Really cool ambiance. Love this place.

name: re:public
text_review: Went in on a friends recommendation last night. The place has a bigger city feel and a great whiskey selection. Started at the bar with manila clams and the pork belly...wow. Moved to a table after that and split some pastas and steak. Great food across the board. Solid ambiance and knowledgeable staff...I will head back soon

name: re:public
text_review: Went Back for drinks and those crab Agnolotti, EXCELLENT!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Performative staff, the quintessential passive-aggressive cool kids manager, speaks to Latino employees like they're dumb and have no senses. Yay, how liberal!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I go to this place often to grab some oysters. Usually have a great experience. Whoever was the hostess tonight made me never want to return. I walk in at 10:25 to be seated and am told their kitchen closes at 10:30. Which is odd cause I've never been told this especially cause I only order oysters and a few drink around this time and day. Needless to say I won't be back.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I am still reeling from shock of how horribly myself and my family were treated. I, visibly pregnant, was seated at a table with a bench on one side and 2 chairs on the other. My 2yo and 5yo were both sitting with me on the bench side waiting for my husband to arrive. There were 3 other similar tables next to us, all still unseated. The hostess kindly brought us crayons for my children to color on the paper laid across the table. My daughter was coloring, never straying once from our table. My son was guardian of the crayons. On three occasions, my *near 2yo* screamed loudly "MINE!" when my daughter went for a crayon. I am well aware this is less than ideal. It is a phase he is in, screeching any time he is excited or mad or expressing emotions. Before and after each of those moments, he was calm and happy and just fine. Each time he did it, I did my best to get him to stop immediately. We had been there all but 10 minutes. The manager, Christopher Fischbach, approached me and said "You are going to have to reign this in." I asked "excuse me?" And he said "you are going to have to reign this in. We can't have your children running around and the screaming will have to stop." I replied that my daughter hadn't left the table once and then asked how he suggest I stop my not yet 2yo son from screaming?" He said he didn't know. I asked "and what if I can't? Will we be escorted out?" And he said "if it is excessive, maybe so. We have to seat these other tables."At this point I was so incredulous, I could not believe this was being said to a paying customer, let alone the fact that a child was being targeted. I asked if this was routine for them, he did not reply and he walked away. I still cannot believe this happened. I am appalled. I am ashamed to say that we stayed, but I refuse to be bullied. Yeah, they got my money, but I have my dignity. And I hope Christopher (who, no, does not have children of his own) treats families trying their absolute best with the respect they deserve moving forward. He was a pretty massive disappointment to humanity tonight.Do yourself a favor and don't waste your money here. The food was not remotely worth what they lack entirely in service.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Transphobic environment. As you've probably gathered, my partner is a transgender woman and I fully support/love her, we were eating at the Old Spaghetti Factory in Southcenter when my partner said she felt someone staring at her, I was going to assure her that kno one was staring, however, I was appalled to see this kid working there standing in the kitchen entrance pointing at her, I stared the kid down until he walked away. I immediately asked for the manager, the manager who came over to help us was completely drunk, he asked us if we were sure he was pointing at us, and he offered to pay for our food. This place is a whole bundle of bad memories for us now. Time to go to Cheesecake Factory instead.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: No sign out front. Just a door painted pink. When we finally found it, it wasn't open yet but someone came to the door and said that if we wanted to wait until they opened in 20 minutes we probably couldn't get seated right away because we didn't have reservations. Kind of a snotty attitude as well. So we just walked away.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The food and service doesn't matter for this review. Our waitress wore a t-shirt that said "My Body, My Choice, My Abortion". I don't care what your beliefs on this topic are. Any establishment with such little class and decency that would allow an employee to dress like this isn't worthy of visiting. Shameful.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: This is the worst restaurant I have ever been too. I would give them negative stars if I could.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: If I could give thus place zero stars I would. They are racist!!!!DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I went there and I noticed the door. IT WASN'T PINK! Why?! Please paint it pink! Never go here again if they don't paint this door!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The only restaurant I have ever walked out of-TWICE

name: The Pink Door
text_review: This is my favorite restaurant and my family and I have spent a lot of time here. Tonight sept 15th 2018 we called and were told we couldn't make a reservation and to just come in. We arrived at 6:50 and were turned away saying that there is no space for us ( there was plenty of space as we could see) We were told there was a burlesque showing going on later in the evening in the back. The lack of communication makes me never want to come here again.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Arrived to the restaurant with reservations to find the menu so offensive with anti-Trump item names. Way to offend patrons who want to support your restaurant. Your employees are mandated to obey the owners political views - no thanks. Never will we support your business. Service was terrible once we expressed being offended.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: We made reservations through open table and received excellent seating in the dining room. I have been to the pink door for many many years and for many occasions, however on this particular occasion we were celebrating 2 birthdays. We enjoyed a very nice lunch for two, linguine vongole and the squid ink pasta seafood special.The awkward moment arrived when the server brought us an empty plate with two birthday candles absent of anything except the two candles.We felt as though he presented an "empty" birthday wish. I am still dumbfounded by the gesture. Honestly I would have preferred no recognition rather than the empty plate presentation. That was the one star reception we received. My friend had flown in from San Francisco for this luncheon and it was immeasurably disappointing.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Rude Manager! Dont waste your time going there. Manager (blonde woman) was very rude to us.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Posting political views on your menu is completely unacceptable. The first thing I looked at was the drink menu, only to come across a drink called "Dump Trump" I find this offensive and arrogant. I will not be back nor will I recommend The Pink Door to others.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: $20 per person for "Theatre Seating" for their Burlesque show means cramming chairs in around the dining tables. They wouldn't take a reservation for dinner, but made us prepay to sit next to the kitchen for the show. I feel like a pauper in the Kings court.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The place is cute! The trapeeze performer is great. The problem was the cost of the food for the quantity and quality. We really went to see the perfomace thinking it would be a fun way to spend dinner. Well the performace is five minutes at best, every 30-45 minutes so don't go for that. The food was way over priced. I spent $44.00 for a small bowl of (premade) gluten free pasta with a bland cream sauce, a butterscotch pudding (which was pretty good) and a glass of water-yes $44!!! . Since I had to eat GF I didn't get bread unless I wanted to pay $3 more for Udi's bread. There were no dinner salads, veggies, meat for my dish or anything else. I hate the Italian Denny's (Olive Garden) but have to say I have had better meals there and for a better price. Felt a bit duped by the allure of a cool performace which is the only reason I was willing to spend that kind of money on pasta only to find out it the performance wasn't really part of the ambiance. Very disappointing.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: ****worst food poisoning of my life****

name: The Pink Door
text_review: We planned our meal two months in advance, reserved a table, and hoped to top off the last night of our Seattle vacation with an excellent view, meal and drinks.We were seated on the patio, jammed into a corner but jutting out into the walkway, where we were jostled by staff and other diners. We ordered sodas while taking a moment to look at the wine menu, and decided to share an order of the calamari with spinach. This was okay, a bit overcooked and chewy, but we had high hopes for the meal - I ordered linguine with clams, and my husband ordered clams and mussels.I had one bite of my pasta with clams, and couldn't eat anymore. The pasta was overcooked, but all of that was masked by the amount of sodium in the "broth" - you could taste nothing BUT salt, as though a cup of it had been poured into the cooking liquid. The acidity burned my tongue and scoured the inside of my mouth. I couldn't taste or eat properly for two days afterward. My husband's clams and mussels had no seasoning or taste, other than that of steamed and overcooked seafood. No garlic, wine, herbs or anything else. It was as if they'd steamed the shellfish and dumped them in the bowl. Also, no pasta or other sides were served with that dish: $26 or so for a bowl of flavorless steamed mussels and clams. We declined to order something else, and asked for our check. This was the only time in our lives that we've ever walked out of a restaurant. Although the manager comped our soda and calamari, we left a comparable amount on the table for the waitress and staff. We figured they shouldn't be left without the tip they'd have received had the chef and kitchen staff not put out such an embarassing "meal". We spent an hour trying to find another restaurant that was open in the area after 9 PM, which oddly enough is not easy to do, especially as we'd walked from our rental to The Pink Door.As far as ambience and staff: the greeter and our waitress were very nice. The place was okay, but other than some cute decoration and a good band, it wasn't exceptional - certainly not enough to balance out the mediocre starter and inedible meal. I can honestly say I'd not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: the food quality was not special to pay $115 for 2 people. the pasta tasted fresh but the chicken tasted like a box of sand which is very sand, dissappointing in my opinion. the desert wine tasted i literally yacked two. the desert was very decent but again over pricedthe ambiance was really extraordinary i would say that but other than not visiting seattle because of this

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I recently visited Purple Café and Wine Bar in Seattle for the first time, and unfortunately, my experience left much to be desired. While the ambiance and drink selection were noteworthy, my overall impression was tainted by uncomfortable seating, lackluster food, and an unpleasant aftermath.Let's start with the positives. The restaurant's ambiance and wine selection create a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere, making it a suitable spot for drinks and socializing. However, when it comes to the dining experience, there are considerable drawbacks.The seating arrangement was notably uncomfortable, detracting from what could have been an enjoyable evening. The chairs lacked ergonomic design, making it difficult to relax and fully savor the dining experience.Turning to the food, I ordered the chicken, expecting a premium dish given the prices. Regrettably, the reality fell short of expectations. The chicken was disappointingly dry, reminiscent of a budget BBQ chicken one might find at a grocery store. The lack of succulence and flavor left me questioning the value for the cost.Unfortunately, my disappointment did not end with the underwhelming meal. The next day, I experienced persistent gas and an upset stomach. While I'm not quick to attribute these symptoms solely to the restaurant, it does raise concerns about the quality of ingredients or food handling practices.In light of my overall dissatisfaction and the subsequent digestive discomfort, I believe the establishment should consider refunding my purchase. A dining experience should leave patrons satisfied and comfortable, and unfortunately, Purple Café and Wine Bar fell short of these expectations.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We got kicked out for not having our vaccine cards handy deapite having ample seating available outside. ironically we not only had the vaccine but also the booster AND are healthcare workers that take care of about 1,000 patients a day in Texas. So glad to get this amazing service after all we do to fight covid on a daily basis. Great way to treat the healthcare workers By kicking us out to the streets.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I wouldn't even rate this one star, they discriminated against me and my family. I will never return, I have never I my life been treated this way. Unbelievable!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Beautiful chic trendy downtown vibe restaurant, but...so disappointing, bad server she was unprofessional in a rush hurry forgetting things too abrupt @ table, so-so food from the over priced menu considering "What This Place Is"! Ordered 2 Wine Flights @ table server forget one card listing what we were drinking and finally brought the info wine description card half way after drinking the wine. We here just after 4p the place was not that busy! Terrible rock shrimp asparagus pizza dried out tasted like a unsalted cracker. Salads too small for the price and not that appealing looking or tasty!!!!! Parking was great only $5 after 4p underneath in garage.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: One of the worst experiences. Waiter was rude and beligerant, and turned a celebration for our son's camp getaway into a miserable experience. It was so bad we walked out of the restaurant before ordering anything, even though we had no other place to go. Terrible, and sad. Management didn't care, and their fake empathy towards us was even more insulting, even as they realized the ridiculodness of the situation. Too bad, we have been there before and liked it. We will never set foot in that establishment.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I used to love this restaurant for their wonderful service and Sommeliers.  The last two times I have been there in the last two months, the servers just seemed to be checked out and going through the motions. There is no passion in their work, and they are no longer trying to create an ambiance or a dining experience, and when I drop 2-300 for a dinner for 2, I expect more. I went there this evening, and again the waitress comes over with a nice bottle of wine, but where is the sommelier? Have they gotten rid of this program where the Som comes over and decants your wine. I loved talking about wine with the Som, and thought it added a nice touch. Guess Harvest Vine and Luc will now get my business. Goodbye Purple Cafe. My filet mignon was not medium, and even though I told my server, she didn't really seem to care, and I am not one to send food back unless she felt it should return to the kitchen, and she didn't say anything. The filet came by itself, so I found myself hungry afterwards and ordered two cheese tastings which were nice as always. There just isn't anything special about Purple any longer........it's just get the customer in, and get them out...............I can feel a better energy and have a special dining experience elsewhere. Seattle has some great restaurants. Sorry Purple........won't be back. GC

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Horrible place and the worst manager ever.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: If you haven't noticed by now, I'm huge on customer service. This place had some of the rudest, most pretentious @$$holes I have ever met. So we went in late on a Tuesday night after a Mariners game, as my buddies sister and friend were in town from the East Coast. After ordering a shot and a drink, we were content for about 45 minutes. My buddy ordered a drink and about 20 minutes later hadn't received it. When he finally received his drink, I ordered another, and jokingly asked him if I could get it in less than a half hour. Turns out we didn't look like the crowd they prefer, so he decided that my joke meant I was intoxicated and didn't deserve to be served anymore. It was my 2nd drink in an hour, AND we had ordered food. After speaking with a manager, he agreed that I did not look intoxicated, but they don't undermine the "judgement of their staff". Maybe my joke was in poor taste, but I was trying to be lighthearted, not offensive, and if you work in a bar, you should be ready to deal with garbage from rude patrons, and a little banter at the bar shouldn't be handled like that. 0 stars is what they deserve,, and I guarantee I will never return to this place. I will say I was digging the atmosphere of the place before that whole thing happened.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Cafe has been one of my favorites for the past few years and I have celebrated many birthdays and other special occasions there. Last night I came in excited but was very disappointed with the service. After waiting for some time to get our food, my table was finally served except for myself. Unfortunately, many of the pastas cold upon serving. I had ordered the purple chopped salad which was okay once I got it but that wasn't until 20-30 minutes after the rest of the table. By the time I was starting to eat the rest of the table was finished. Not even an acknowledgment from the waiter or an apology was given. I understand mishaps occur but I'd expect some sort of acknowledgment of it by the staff so I was not left waiting.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I thought that the food was pretty average. It was definitely over-priced for the quality of food. It was not bad, but it was not worth the price we paid.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Wines are over priced and list is not well put together.  Food ok but once again you can get better across the street

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food was so-so at best and our waiter had an attitude. Definitely won't go to this place again next time we're in Seattle. Thank God we were with good company!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This restaurant is a real deal! It is the place where you can find the real food at the real price. Worth paying for it trust me! See you soon! Highly recommended!! Prices are fair for most items and the food is delivered to your table in a reasonable time. They have the best service in town.I can't wait to come back here!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: food is great. of course the wine is yummy but it is pretty loud. came in with a group of girls (7) and sat at a table and couldnt hear eachother talk. good for a casual meal but not if you want something more intimate i wouldnt recommend.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Ate here for dinner. Muslced the door open to a nice restaurant inside.The food was great, good selection of wines,had a great red, but don't expect me to remember what it was. Would be a a nicer atmosphere if it weren't so loud. Couldn't carry a conversation. Overall, satisfied.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Foods are ok, not sure this is American or Chinese, but it has many selections.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is a nice place with a really nice atmosphere. If you make sure to order anything in particular, order the lobster mac and cheese. Very nice!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good atmosphere but this place is definitely more style than substance.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place was cool

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The atmosphere was lovely, a GREAT wine list and amazing service. However, the food was a little salty. I will definitely give it another chance. Perfect location for a girls night out!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Outstanding selection of wine and a great atmosphere.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Like a model: gorgeous on the outside, vacuous inside. I adore this convertion of a bank's big windows to a chi-chi wine bar with a spiral wine column in the middle. But was I surrounded by celebs or something? I don't think I had spinach in my teeth!!!!! Pay attention to me, please. Nice full flavored cup of soup. Looks like great wine flight options. PUHLEASE though .... I am not invisible even though I wasn't showing cleavage.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Meh. That pretty much sums it up. The food was meh. The atmosphere was meh. The service was meh. Even some of the wine was meh.We had a few things off the tasting menu and a couple of that evenings specials. It was all so unremarkable that I really don't remember what any of them were.While parts of the interior are cool, it felt like a cafeteria in there (albeit a nice one). It's like they were going for European Courtyard and instead got Food Court At A Reasonably Nice Mall.My wine flight was good (I guess I chose well), but my husband's was not (I guess he didn't).It was a totally passable (if not far too pricey) evening, that I won't be hurrying back to repeat. But if I end up there again somehow? Whatever. I'll eat, I'll drink, I'm sure it will be fine. But..... meh.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Came for a date night, ambiance was among the best. Food was good although I think we got youelr typical dinner burgers & fries. Service was acceptable. Would go again for memorable nights. Pricing was fair.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Everything about this restaurant is very good. It's a large open space with comfortable seating and great service. The food is quite good.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We came here for dinner and made a reservation immediately. It's a huge cool place, and the decor is beautiful, however I think they could happily use more lighting when the sun goes down it feels really dark and difficult. I think they have an intimate feel but it's completely dark.We ordered appetizers, which came out quickly. However, it takes a long time for us to heal ourselves after being cleansed. The food was great; I enjoyed the burrata and calamari appetizer, but found the duck a bit dry.Overall would get it here but again due to cheap service.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love this place! Large selection of wine and exquisite hand-crafted cocktails. Every appetizer we tried was fantastic, but the Gorgonzola dates are by far our favorite!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Food was delicious, service was great. Great date spot. Close walk from the water. Sit at the table or bar and you're in good hands.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food was prepared well and everything was simply in the perfect spot. The lighting is sufficiently dim to set the disposition . My beau cherishes the spot, we come here consistently to have our dinner. The staff is warm, inviting as well and they got you covered for every one of your necessities.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I don't live in the city so when I do get to go to the city I have a list of restaurants I want to visit. This spot being one of them. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience - from the food, to the service to the atmosphere. Come here if you want a great time and great food.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love the downtown Seattle location's atmosphere! The only issue is that it can be a little busy and sometimes the wait is long between check-ins from the server. The food is incredible and, of course, the wine is amazing. Would recommend for a nice date night!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I had lunch with my coworkers there for the first time. The atmosphere was good, really like their wine case. The food was good - I ordered the Spaghetti and meatballs - so so good. The only complaint I have is that the wait time was too long. I was there during the peak lunchtime, so I think this could be acceptable. Also, they have great dessert menu. I had the Creme Brulee. I definitely will be back to try them all haha.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We had a party of 6. Service was prompt and our server was very knowledgeable about menu items.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Pretty good food and a cute place.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing pizza! The wine (of course) is amazing as well. I'll be back again soon.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Could have been a 5 except for the screaming kids. Don't go here for a quiet dining experience.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food, wine, service and atmosphere were great. Had a great girls night out here. Will definitely be going back.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Pleasant place for weekend out! Parking is a little inconvenient though.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love the sandwiches and salads but they are very expensive. Salads will run you close to $15 not including drink or anything else.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: we really enjoyed this place. great food and great ambiance.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Ambiance is lovely. The food here is delicious! I'm a huge fan of the baked brie. Will come back for more!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is always a restaurant that I get excited to go to. It can sometimes get a little loud, but the food always makes up for it!
