I had a special of theirs a while back that was a steak and risotto dish, and I still dream about it! The service is almost always good, and the food is amazing, but I'd highly recommend making a reservation!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is the place to go for great wine sampling. Whether you try a flight or taste by the glass, the selection of wine here is extensive. They have really great small plates and happy hour prices as well.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I just had a 20 person party in one if the back rooms at The Purple and the staff, food and wine were amazing. The pairings were superb. Anna and Tyler did such a great job, I remember Anna from another very positive dining experience there. I so appreciate her style. She was attentive and handled the crowd with such professionalism. I would highly recommend The Purple!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food was incredible, the staff was super sweet and the cocktails were perfect. If only I was wealthy, I'd go all the time..

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Went there for dinner last night before a show. The service was excellent and the food was amazing!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great place to visit.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Really good, nice ambiance.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good food, good service and comfortable seating! Loved the layout and different options for dining and drinking here. Also a bit pricey.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great food but service can be improved!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I always get something from the tasting bar including the wine pairing. I am never disappointed here; try the duck liver pate or the curry lamb empanada. The atmosphere at the purple in downtown is always good and waitresses are super nice. It is noisy, so get ready to have a loud conversation.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great Happy Hour in Kirkland. I like the Beef carpaccio, not for the vegans, but I love it especially when it is washed with some Pinot Noir

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I ordered the pesto pasta...delicious! My favorite dish we tried...goat cheese topped with cranberries appetizer. yes...yum!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Just amazinggg... Great service, nice cocktails..

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I was contacted through Yelp, by the Manager, after I left my previous review. He offered apologies and wanted to try to make things right. His apologies were greatly appreciated. It says a lot. I will be back.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Fun wines and cheeses!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: If you go to Purple, take your time and settle in. Enjoy a flight of wine and cheese pairing or something else before you order. I'm definitely not a wine buff and my wife is no expert, but we enjoy the ability to have a relaxing conversation and enjoy some new wines we normally wouldn't try. The staff is very helpful in recommending combinations and they don't make you feel out of place if you aren't a wine expert. The entrees have all been quite good and very reasonably priced, with the exception of the lobster mac' n cheese (although it is well worth the $27). My only complaint is how cold it sometimes feels. I would love to see a nice fireplace added to warm things up in the winter.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: My favorite lunch spot downtown. One of the best wine lists in Seattle

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Tha experience was amazing as always!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Coolest place ever!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is such a cool place. I just found them for the first time. The decor is amazing and reminds me of something you would see in LA. The food was so good. For the prices they charge I thought they should have given you larger portions. It isn't a place I would go all the time due to the cost but it is really nice for once in a while.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great environment to bring a friend and drink some wine! Don't go there if you want to have an intimate conversation because it's loud. All the hard surfaces make for a loud environment. Loved the food and enjoyed the Rafanelli 06 zin for $75.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple is a wonderful place. We did the cheese and wine pairing and it was delightful. They are only missing 5 stars because my customer service experience from the male bartender was not good. Everyone else was great though. Ill be back for sure.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Just had a group business lunch here and was impressed with the decor and the taste of the food. Service was solid and the wine list was very deep. We ate upstairs in the balcony the space is small but quite enough during the lunch hour to carry on conversations.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love their lamb burger and sea salt caramel desserts. The pork sirloin was so-so. What was that they put over the meat? Caramelized sweet radish? It just doesn't go well with the meat. Service was good and the atmosphere was lively.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great wine selection and a very cool decor. The wine markup isnt so bad, but that should be expected at a wine bar. They have a great wine list and good options for tastings of wine and cheeses by the flight. The bar doesnt know how to make a martini, but once again they are a wine bar. If anything, I would say they should simplify the food menu. I found it to be too many choices, found myself spending too much time reviewing the menu, but I went there for wine and appetizers, not for dinner, so I may be biased.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: DInnerFood was good

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Lobster Mac n' cheese. that's all i got to say.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar is a fantastic spot that deserves five stars. The pasta was absolutely delicious, bursting with flavor and perfectly prepared. The ambiance was lovely, creating an inviting and elegant atmosphere that made the meal even more enjoyable. The service was standard but efficient, allowing the food and setting to shine. Overall, it's a wonderful place for a great dining experience. Highly recommend!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We had a wonderful experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious as was the service. I ordered the grilled lamb chops and my wife had the dungeoness crab pasta. Both were amazing. We also ordered the spicy prawns which had a kick but were so tasty. And finished it off with the vanilla bean creme brulee.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Lovely service - the waitress was kind and accommodated a table of our choice. The place gets loud, so best to take a table or two away from the crowd if you can. Food was great - we had the calamari and pasta and both were great. Cocktails were top notch and no complaints.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Very very good indeed This is the perfect date or group dining spot.Absolutely fantastic little spot in downtown Seattle.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Café and Wine Bar in Seattle truly delivers an exceptional experience. The ambiance instantly captures you, creating a perfect backdrop for the exquisite food. The wine and cocktail selection is top-notch, perfectly complementing the culinary delights. Highly recommended for those seeking an unparalleled dining journey

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Food was great, and surprisingly they weren't busy at all for mothers day when we got there. No complaints except i wish they had checked on us a little more. I had to keep looking for someone when I needed water, or napkins or to order.Kid-friendliness: They do have a kids menu and were great to my kiddo for mothers day

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love it, amazing service, amazing ambiance, foods amazing don't know what else you could ask for.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Purple Cafe and Wine Bar and I have to say, it was an absolutely fantastic experience from start to finish! From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the elegant and inviting atmosphere. The decor is sophisticated and stylish, with plenty of seating options to suit any preference.The menu is full of delicious and creative dishes that are made with high-quality ingredients and cooked to perfection. I especially loved the cheese and charcuterie board, which was beautifully presented and paired perfectly with the wine selection. Speaking of wine, the wine list is extensive and impressive, with a great selection of wines from around the world to choose from.The service was also top-notch, with friendly and knowledgeable staff who were always available to answer questions and make recommendations. The attention to detail was evident in everything from the presentation of the dishes to the quality of the stemware used for the wine.One of the things that really stood out to me was the emphasis on sustainability and locally sourced ingredients. It's clear that the restaurant takes great care in selecting the best possible ingredients, which adds an extra layer of quality to every dish.Overall, I would highly recommend Purple Cafe and Wine Bar to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in an elegant and sophisticated setting. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a great night out, this place is sure to exceed your expectations. I can't wait to come back and try more of their amazing dishes and wines!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good service, good food, highly recommend!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Beautiful atmosphere, delicious wine. Stopped in for a quick drink on our way to a show.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Wow-what a great time we had at Purple.There were 6 of us. We had drinks, apps, entrees and desert. All of the food was exceptional.The service was top notch too. The server was always there.One other positive is the restaurant was not loud and we could actually hear each other from the other side of the table. In some restaurants, its so loud you cant hear the person next to you when they are yelling in your ear. Not here!Highly recommended!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This was a great place. Great wine selection and food.  Service was very nice and informative.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I've been to this place two years ago for my husband's birthday. The interior has a cool vibe and there is an impressive wine display. The staff were friendly. I loved the bone marrow appetizer and the seared scallop main course. This place is on the quieter side for a wine bar. I'd recommend this place.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place is perfect for a lunch date or dinner date. The atmosphere is calm and soothing and let's talk about their meals! They're well done and absolutely delicious! Dessert was a bit dry but I generally loved the whole experience. The décor is poetic from the choice of color and accessories in the establishment. The special service offered for a romantic date is just on another level. I think it would be had for any person to turn down an engagement  or wedding proposal that is made in this establishment. More to the service and the décor, the accommodation facilities befit loyalty. Spending a night at the establishment is an epic experience. I would definitely come back for a second date at this place and recommend it to my friends with a lot of confidence.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: OK, so I am writing this about pre-COVID Purple, in the hopes that soon we will be back to normal post-COVID Purple.It's one of my favorite places for a date night, from the ambiance, to the amazing food, to the fabulous wine pairings.A wine flight at Purple was always a wonderful trip. I am holding the vision of doing more of them sometime soon....viva la Purple!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing restaurant! Great staff and excellent communication

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: nice place, nice people, good prices

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I always enjoy the service and food at Purple. I've been here before multiple times and liked it. The food and wine are always consistent. Our server was fabulous and made the whole dining experience remarkable.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I found this place by chance. I found the food excellent, and the wine list was impressive. We had the cranberry chicken salad and Lobster Mac & cheese. We enjoyed our meal so much.Everyone was incredibly friendly & helpful.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Yum yum yum! This is one of my favorite spots up north and the wine list is amazing! Try the lobster mac and cheese and you won't be disappointed :)

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Delicious food and the wine selection is AWESOME. I don't know if they have it on the menu anymore but awhile back they had a lobster mac and cheese which was FANTASTIC. I hope they bring it back to the menu.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love this place! Been back several times. Everything is great, but especially the cocktails. Delicious.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Located downtown seattle. Great food and ambience.  The service was amazing. Our server was on top of it and extremely helpful. High quality food. The place is beautifully decorated. Highly recommend

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Wow, SUCH friendly service! And the view is great. I have nothing to complain about here at all, I'll be back for sure! I had a great cabernet that I forget the name of, I hope they remember what it is haha.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Fantastic place! Food was incredible coupled with excellent service. Very nice wine selection.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: It was simply amazing. Everything was great. The Brie is amazing and the mushroom soup.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good food and really great staff.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: So good! We came on a Tuesday night around 7pm, and they were already packed! We ended up waiting about 15 minutes for some seats at the bar. The ambiance is great -- dim lighting that worked seamlessly with the high ceilings & impressive floor-to-ceiling wine tower. The wait staff was extremely friendly, and made great food recommendations! We tried:- the Riesling -- sweet and fruity!- baked brie -- no need to elaborate, just get it.- seafood stew -- recommended by our waiter, and it was so good! Will definitely be back if I'm ever in town again, but perhaps with a reservation next time.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I am not usually someone who leaves reviews but i was so impressed with Purple Cafe that I thought I should! The following was excellent 1.)Making a reservation over the phone2.Being welcomed at the door3.)Service 4.) FoodFood was off the charts. I impressed my entire family. Thank you for making a special night perfect!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love, love, love this restaurant! I've never had a bad meal here. Our sommelier last night was so attentive, and helpful. He made our night.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great service. Food is delicious. Very crowded. Make sure to make reservations before going in.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We went here for lunch, everyone at the table ordered a glass of wine and salmon with rice. Great atmosphere, business professional setting. Excellent waiter! I highly recommend this location and we will be back again.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We got a table for four almost immediately. The service was friendly and the staff very attentive. We REALLY Really enjoyed our meal here. Probably one of the best corned beef hash I've had. The corned beef was tender, flavorful; potatoes perfectly fried; delicious rye bread and two fried eggs on top. My friend had the fried egg sandwich (provolone, bacon, egg, greens) which he thought was great. We had a vegan with us as well and the server said the chefs are really good at accommodating food requests. They made the Espanola vegan by replacing the eggs with more veggies and avocados. Everyone was satisfied. Great service as well. Facility was clean including the bathrooms. I can confidently recommend Purple Cafe to others!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place was amazing! The atmosphere was perfect and the food was unbelievable. The staff could not have been nicer!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Cafe was highly recommended, and exceeded my expectations! The decor is elegant and modern with an interesting wine twist. The menu is varied and satisfying. However, the true highlight is the staff... They were warm, charming, and so knowledgeable about their products & features! Janice, the Sommelier is elegant with a fun spirit, and will guide your wine journey like a true professional. This place is legit!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love so many things about this place. Great wine selection and lovely small plates. I also had one of the best soups I've ever had here--it was the soup of day so sadly it isn't there all the time. I've been here several times and it's always good. Even nice if you are flying solo and just want to sit at the bar.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: One of my favorite downtown spots for wine. Vast selection and very good service. I also recommend the lamb sirloin or crab cakes here. They're ******* outrageous.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I work near by and decided to check it out after work. So good!!. Came back two days in a row because i was so in love! Definitely a new after work unwind spot. Love it!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Went to Purple café with my fiancé on our first anniversary and it was perfect date!!It was so beautiful inside(especially the wine tower) and the service was good, food was great.Everything was perfect and even our server gave me a wine for free when I told him that we are here to celebrate the anniversary. I would like to visit again!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Walked in based on yelp review and we're not disappointed. Amazing!! Every dish was a culinary delight.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love love love this place!! Amazing food to die for and an even more wonderful wine list! This is a must go spot for everyone!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great atmosphere/food/wine, easy parking

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We just had tapas and drinks. Everything was very tasty. Decor is modern/eclectic. Service was very good and helpful with suggestions. Oh yeah, desserts were great... try the chocolate caramels with sea salt.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great food, ambiance and service. Worth every penny!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: YUM! The pizza special was soooo good! And, they have great wine too.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is by far my favorite resturant, everything on the menu is absolutely fabulous! Great for happy hour!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great, creative food. Loved the wine flights! Made me want to take a vacation to the vineyards! Waitstaff was very pleasant, patient and helpful. Cool ambiance too.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: LOVE!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Nice atmosphere...service is excellent...if your in downtown Seattle. You should definitely stop by and grab a drink...will not be disappointed..lots of attractive women around...

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Everything was perfect. Food was amazing!!! Service was great. Price was right.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place is SO good, and gets better every time!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love Purple Cafe! Their baked Brie is to die for. And, I am in love with their lobster mac. Did I mention how much I love their baked Brie? Warm right out of the oven, melting all over the plate, fresh cut grapes on top with fresh baked rosemary flat bread. #mmm

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great small plate menu

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing, from start to finish!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I recently had the opportunity to take my girlfriend here for her birthday. I wanted to take her somewhere nice and make it memorable for her. She's a wine and cheese lover so I knew she'd appreciate this place but I also wanted to take her here so she could try something new as she doesn't have a very adventurous palate.First off, the ambiance was nice and romantic. She loved the tower of wine and spiral staircase in the middle of the restaurant. We started off upstairs in the lounge with a drink while we waited for our table and then headed to our table where we chose from the Tasting Bar menu.She was feeling a little adventurous so we had the the Duck Liver Pate and the Ahi Tuna Poke which were both spectacular. For our entrees, the lady chose Duck Confit and I had Filet Mignon. She LOVED the Duck and couldn't stop raving about it.After the numerous bottles of wine and all the delicious food, I'd say we had a pretty sexy evening.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love it. Really nice place. Try their salty caramel chocolates :)

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I went with my boyfriend last night for a "date night" very classy and ultra hip and modern.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Took my girl here for " date night" and they did not disappoint.The atmosphere is perfect for a nice semi classy date. They had great food options beautiful selection of wine choices.Try a few different wine flights, its a better bang for your buck kind of thing.You will not be disappointed. Oh and save room for desert!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great Place great wines!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: SO AMAZING! I had the lobster mac & cheese and it was to die for!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great place for lunch or dinner. Definitely worth a try!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Five of us sat down Saturday for a last minute 10pm reservation and we started by asking the waiter for an exciting, well priced, bottle of Pinot. Naturally, we got the look one gets when asking for exciting pinot and a "Well, pinots are usually more mellow than exciting," yes we said, exciting but mellow will be fine.That interaction managed us the sommelier who came, chatted, and quickly returned with a few fist fulls of bottles and glasses and our dinner for 5 turned into a wine tasting for 5. We all learned something, and chose a bottle, which was great. We dared not ask its cost though we had asked for "value." A few "tasting" rounds of apps, some salads, and some great entrees, I had the pork, done nicely, and the to die for deserts..... we picked up another bottle. The check arrived and our new favorite was only $30, very nice Purple, very nice.But what blows me away about this place is the size of the space. It has got to be one of the biggest, openest venues in seattle with the giant wine rack spiraling up the middle. I think you just feel really good here, you feel out and alive as you look at the downtown buildings though the two story windows. Just go already.....

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Do yourself a favor and get yourself a cheese plate with a wine pairing. DIVINE! Great Atmosphere and great booze. I'll be back

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I'm usually not that big on salads, but theirs are fantastic. The roasted red pepper & goat cheese one is something I have cravings for from time to time, and the apple, walnut & stilton salad is great, too (it comes with a light, sweet, interesting champagne vinaigrette).Mondays are half-price bottle night. Recently, I was here with two friends and we shared a cheese flight to start, then we each had an entree and dessert, plus we shared a great bottle of pinot noir. It worked out to $33 each, including tip. You can't beat that!Their sorbets are always creative, fresh and delicious, and I love their sea salt caramels (you can now get an order of sea salt caramels to go, by the way! They make a great hostess gift).I love the decor here, too. Service is a tad slow, but knowledgable and friendly. When my husband and I went to lunch here as a little celebration on the day we picked up our marriage certificate, they brought us out champagne and sea salt caramels--on the house!We go here five or six times a year, and every single experience has been great!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: If I could, I'd fly to Seattle just to have dinner here. J'tadore, Purple.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: BEST wine bar hands down. Killer Filet Minion!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We were there for our anniversary and we love it! Our first time and certainly won't be our last!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: What can I say. I loooove Purple. The General Manager (Stephanie) is wonderful and always makes sure we are well taken care of. Their spectacular daily Risotto specials rarely fall under 5 stars. And they have a few nice selections of wine..hahaha.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: It is a great place, in my opinion the best overall restaurant in Seattle. The service is excellent, the food is good enough and the setting is just perfect.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Rude , racist waitress, anything I asked him he was saying idk , giving me bs and attitude, he asked my friend for their ID AND SAID THE ONLY ID WE ACCEPT IS FROM US AND CANADA NOTHING FROM EUROPE. Wth is that supposed to mean??? He asked us to leave just like that.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Not.Very good . Small portions .took a long time to get our food . Would not come back . Not good service

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Complete disaster ! How can people be so foolish? $10 for lettuce sandwichNo direction ! Total gimmick

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Damn our decision for choosing Damn the Weather. Terribly Disappointing. Please Note:1. They do not take reservations - 45 minute wait for a party of six. When we were told our table was ready, we were then sat at a 4 top. Yup!2. Food overpriced - $16 for a hamburger slightly larger than a slider. Very salty and undercooked. The side that came with it....pickled onion. 3. Why our two pasta dishes were served in a french onion soup crock.....no idea. Pasta was mushy, over salted and lackluster.4. The smell in the restaurant was very off pudding. I could go on. Save your self the disappointment and go elsewhere.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Usually try I keep reviews to myself in my collections. With the amount of travel I do I just use YELP as a reminder of where I've been and where to go in my quick layovers, but this one I feel I had to

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Too expensive for what it is. $18 burger , $21 for half a dozen oysters

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: The drinks were ok and the bar was nicely decorated. But while sitting at the bar i heard one bartender talking badly about another customer at the end of the bar.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: We went fairly late at night just for a little to eat and some drinks. We liked the atmosphere, but thought the food was only OK. Go for drinks, not food.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Great Burger - Outstanding. Ate here with a group from work. Great place.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Positive: Very attentive service. Space came at a high price. No happy hour. Cocktails were good but very small, same for appetizers. 120 bucks for three cocktails and three appetizers, and not being particularly satisfied with the portions or the flavors I don't want to go back.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: I kept on coming back for the oysters. The freshness, the plating, and the sides are amazing. The food is pulling me to come back. Though the location is a hole in the wall cause if it's the peak hour, you just have to wait for the customers to be done with their meal, yet it is worth the wait I must say. With all that food? Why regret waiting? The bar is gorgeous, I like it very much. The drinks they serve are exceptionally flavorful, you can tell that it is mixed well. The service in addition will make your dining experience genuinely fine. All I can suggest is more spaces for the customers, it would be a step up.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Outstanding food...best salad we've ever had. Belgium Whit was awesome. And our Bartender, Emma was Outstanding! Great Customer service ! Would highly recommend this establishment

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: I kept on coming back for the oysters. The freshness, the plating and the sides are amazing. The food is really pulling me to come back. Though the location is a hole in the wall cause if it's the peak hour, you just have to wait for the costumers to be done with their meal, yet it is worth the wait I must say. With all that food? Why regret on waiting.The bar is gorgeous, I like it very much. The drinks they serve is exceptionally flavorful, you can tell that it is mixed well. The service in addition will make your dining experience genuinely fine.All I can suggest is more spaces for the costumers, it would be a step up.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Great cocktails. Beautiful space. Food was very tasty. Only complaint is price-- too high on the food.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Cozy little cocktail bar. I sat at the bar with my friend. Bartender suggested us a cool place to go. High end drinks. I feel it was over priced but good non the less.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Good food, cool space! Can get a little loud at night time but other than that, a good dinner spot! I wasn't impressed by the wine..

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Love this place! The atmosphere and drinks are spot on.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: This is a great little happy hour spot!

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: I had zucchini noodles and they were really good!

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Make sure to get the fries!

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Haven't been there, but that's 5 Stars for a hella cool name. I'm sure it's also a lovely spot.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: A Cocktail Lover's Paradise: Damn the Weather Sets the Bar High!Damn the Weather is hands down the best cocktail bar in our local area, and it has never failed to impress me with its extraordinary libations and charming ambiance. From the moment you step inside this hidden gem, you know you're in for an exceptional experience.The atmosphere at Damn the Weather is nothing short of inviting, with its cozy and chic interior that strikes the perfect balance between elegance and comfort. The dim lighting sets the mood for an intimate evening, making it an ideal spot for catching up with friends or enjoying a date night.Now, let's get to the heart of the matter - the cocktails! The mixologists at Damn the Weather are true artists, and their creations are nothing short of magical. The cocktail menu is a carefully curated masterpiece, featuring a wide array of unique concoctions and classic favorites, all crafted with precision and creativity.Every cocktail I've tried at Damn the Weather has been a revelation of flavors. Each sip reveals a perfect fusion of ingredients, resulting in a symphony of tastes that dance on your palate. Whether you prefer a refreshing and fruity libation or a bold and spirit-forward cocktail, they have something to cater to every preference.One of my personal favorites is their signature cocktail, "Damn the Weather," which lives up to its name. The combination of spirits, fresh ingredients, and a touch of artisanal flair makes it a must-try for any cocktail enthusiast.The attention to detail in every aspect of Damn the Weather is commendable. The bar staff is not only incredibly knowledgeable about the cocktails they serve, but they are also friendly and attentive, always ensuring a seamless and enjoyable experience for patrons.Furthermore, the bar's commitment to using high-quality, locally-sourced ingredients is evident in the taste and presentation of each cocktail. It's clear that they take pride in their craft, and it shines through in every aspect of their offerings.In conclusion, Damn the Weather is a haven for cocktail lovers, and it's undoubtedly the crown jewel of our local area. If you're looking for an unforgettable evening filled with exceptional libations and impeccable service, this bar should be at the top of your list. I can't recommend Damn the Weather enough, and I'm already eagerly anticipating my next visit to explore more of their delightful cocktail creations. Bravo to the talented team behind this cocktail paradise!

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Love it here. Always have good food. Definitely will be back for atmosphere, food and drinks

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Another place with a fun name in town that I love. It's hugely popular, so be aware that if you don't make reservations you may have to wait for a while. The ambiance of this place is so nice and the food is amazing while the sauce had the perfect balance.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: This place was amazing. The food, atmosphere, and wait staff were all incredible. We had about a half-hour wait before we could be seated, which is to be expected on a Saturday evening. Our waiter was fast, friendly, and very attentive. I had the Cacio e Pepe. It was amazing. I had everyone at the table try it because it was so delicious. I want to go back and eat it every day.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: the food was delicious. Every item we ordered was flavorful and tasty. they made sure everything is in proportion. Enthusiastic service staff. The accompanying services are good. will come back here!!

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Damn this restaurant is sooooo good! Everything was fresh and the wait wasn't too long!

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: the food was absolutely delicious. Every item we ordered was flavorful and tasty. they made sure everything is in proportion. Enthusiastic service staff . The accompanying services are good. will come back here

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Good atmosphere!!!The food is good !!!We enjoy the evening!!!Will come again for sure !!!Will recommend to friends and family !!!

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Wonderful. Wonderful. Wonderful. Environment, service team and just being there. Best that can be. Thanks.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Loved this place. Low key and trendy. Popped in for a dessert. Warm chocolate brownie topped with a peanut butter flavoed ice cream. Delicious! Good service too.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Great for meeting up with old friends over good cocktails. To get a good atmosphere, You will not be disappointed.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: This place was amazing. The food, atmosphere, and wait staff were all incredible. We had about a half hour wait before we could be seated, which is to be expected on a Saturday evening. Our waiter was fast, friendly, and very attentive. I had the Cacio e Pepe. It was amazing. I had everyone at the table try it because it was so delicious. I want to go back and eat it every day. This place rocks.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: I'm a big fan of their Fernet. Also beer.

name: Damn the Weather
text_review: Best drinks in the world. Truly.

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: Unimpressive meal. French toast was cold when served. Only one server for the entire indoor dining area during weekend brunch time. therefore sluggish service.

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: I was really looking forward to celebrating my mother's birthday at Musang, especially after highlighting the occasion on our reservation. Unfortunately, the experience fell short in several ways. Despite our clear instructions, the staff completely overlooked the birthday, even going so far as to bring a dessert for the birthday celebrant at the table next to us. To add to the mix, our leche flan was forgotten for about 15 minutes until we had to remind them.On a positive note, the ambience was quite nice and the setting is definitely inviting. However, the service needs a lot of work if they hope to match the quality of their decor. Overall, a decent spot with plenty of potential, but the service mishaps really detracted from what should have been a special celebration. Three stars.

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: Not open on 8/10. There wasn't a notice or anything on the window :c kinda disappointing

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: I finally snagged reservations for Musang at a decent hour for dining with friends on a weeknight after work (plan ahead folks!). I was super excited to try this "elevated" Filipino food, as my experience of Filipino food has been more limited and more casual. The interior was inviting and warm, design that has been considered but isn't fussy or pretentious. The waitstaff were friendly and informative, able to answer our questions about ingredients and portions to share everything family style. I started with an Ube Lemon Soda. Wow, don't miss this delicate, refreshing vanilla lemon drink! I knew I definitely wanted the lumpiang and pancit, my go-to Filipino choices. My dining companions had little to no exposure to Filipino food and one person doesn't eat anything with seafood, so family style eating limited what i would normally choose just a bit. I am not a huge beef fan, but l love short ribs and the wait person recommended them, so that was our main. We rounded out dinner with a Brussels sprouts dish and garlic rice. Lumpiang and pancit are definitely done deliciously here. We were all scraping the pancit sauce onto our rice (definitely get the garlic rice!). The lumpiang probably has one of the best wrappers I have ever tasted, and the filling was a perfect blend of minced pork and shrimp, with an excellent vinegar based dipping sauce (sawsawan). The major disappointment of the evening was the short rib Kare Kare. Impressively sized and beautifully presented with a pool of peanut sauce and perfectly cooked veg tucked to the side, our meat was tough, chewy and difficult to get off the bone. The sauce/meat combo was flat and one dimensional. I have read other reviews of this dish where the meat was clearly prepared better, and described as "fall off the bone." Sadly we did not get that version of the dish. At $52 this was a dish no one wanted to finish or eat much of. The most delicious sounding dessert on the menu (a spiced apple ice cream dish) was not available, so we tried the corn bibinka. This was like a chewy rice flour cornbread with warm honey butter. Tasty, but not something I would order again, especially for dessert. Every seat was full during our 7PM visit and we were notified ahead of arriving dining time would be limited to 1 hour 45 minutes for a party of 3 due to turnover, as well as 22% service charge (they are very good about letting you know you don't have to add gratuity, but you are prompted when paying to choose a percentage or "no tip". Eater Reader, I can't choose no tip.) I don't have a problem with any of this for an experience, but it's not a structure I am going to generally choose for my average dining out. If someone wanted to go to Musang and invited me, I would definitely say yes, but I don't think it will be on my list of go-to suggestions unless I am looking for a special occasion restaurant in that part of town due to price, turnover pressure (which they aren't overt about), and difficulty in getting a reservation. However, it is definitely worth having the experience, whether you already love Filipino food or need an introduction. P.S. No pics because this was a night for enjoying company with friends who don't photograph their food.

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: I really liked both their spring rolls and their squers

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: OMG the food was every bit as good as I had heard, and somehow even better. We were happy to get an 8:30 reservation and it was a really nice experience from the moment we walked in. The interior is perfectly nice and comfortable, but our server made the whole experience top notch. He recommended his favorite items on the menu and we followed his recommendations. Excellent. Can't wait to come back!

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: My family is addicted to the garlic rice and short rib kare kare. For dessert, the corn bibingka is also a must try!

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: From the moment I took my first bite of the Kare-Kare short ribs, my taste buds were treated to an symphony of flavors that left me in awe.The menu has an impressive array of options, each one crafted with evident care and attention to detail. Every dish was a masterpiece, blending ingredients in ways that showcased the chef's exceptional skill and creativity with Filipino dishes. And let's not forget the dessert the bibingka creation that balanced sweetness, texture, and visual appeal in a harmonious marriage.The service matched the quality of the food, with a staff that was attentive, knowledgeable, and passionate about the culinary offerings. If you're seeking a dining experience that transcends the ordinary and elevates your appreciation for fine cuisine, this is the place to be. Without a doubt, I'll be returning to savor more of their exceptional offerings in the near future.

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: Absolutely amazing experience. Great staff all around! Highly recommend making reservations if you plan on dining in. Wait time about 90 minutes when we came in, but was absolutely worth the wait with their hospitality alone. Food was delicious! The sauce for the lumpia was really good. Sisig and fried chicken was good. The gravy for the chicken was good on the chicken and the rice! For dessert we had the tsokoleyt tibok-tibok, which is like a mousse and was absolutely delicious that we ordered a second one. Very friendly staff and even made our youngest some puréed squash. Thank you for the excellent dining experience!!!

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: The food is really authentic But the location is really the problem Really hard to find parkingReally bad neighborhoodThe store is really nice and organized The food is fantastic Not amazing but pretty goodService is very very good

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: After we were able to get a reservation almost 3 weeks in advance I was very excited to try this Filipino restaurant. I grew up with a lot of Filipino friends, and the food here brought back a lot of memories eating at their house. After dinner we noticed the Ube cheesecake wasn't on the menu. But the waiter was so amazing to get us some, off the secret menu and I was not let down. Go and try this place!

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: I can't say enough about Musang. It was the most incredible meal I've had in a long time. The smoked oysters are unlike anything I've ever had- if you like oysters try this dish! The short rib was so tender it fell off the bone (actually- no knife required), and the garlic rice was amazing.

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: Love the service and the food! Every dish we ordered were delicious. Highly recommend. I'd love to come back soon.

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: We are new CA transplants (please don't hate us) and not particularly familiar with the area. I wanted to take my Filipina wife somewhere special for her birthday. All the positive reviews here are spot on - trust them implicitly.Service. It abounds here. While we had an admittedly long wait because it was Friday night peak dinner hours the hostess was so gracious and polite throughout our time, and was so with all guests coming and going despite the pace; never once did she look flustered or less than cool (even when some expressed frustration when politely explained about the expected wait). She was also spot on with our wait estimate which to me also demonstrated she has her finger on the pulse of the place and knows her craft. This gracious humble knowledge permeated all staff. Our server was awesome, on top of things, aware of the menu and could explain about the dish nuances from a deep awareness that reflected passion not a disinterested standardized script being rattled off to get it over with. Patient and kind. She was also perfectly present - there at just the right moments without hovering. We met the sous chef later and I think she and my wife must have chatted for over a half hour and while much of it was in Tagalog so I only caught bits and pieces or when she intentionally shifted to English because she was intentionally including me - in any case it was warm and vulnerable filled with cheer and the joy present in hearing of my wife's experiences that night were evident (despite her being at the tail end of a 17hr on her feet bustling around day).Wow I can't believe I've written this much and haven't even gotten to the main attraction...THE FOOD!! I don't have the childhood memories to tie everything in emotionally but can say everything was delicious. Some uninformed or close minded purists might decry it's not authentic enough because various ingredients were swapped out. However they could not be more mistaken. Substitutions were the hallmarks of the dishes and epitomized Filipino traditions to use local use fresh and don't waste. Any changes were done with thought and care, creativity and artistry. You might notice a subtle difference but nothing "doesn't belong" and, at risk of heresy, manifest themselves as overall improvements to fix something not quite right in the original. From the very first bite my wife's eyes welled up with tears of joy and remembrance to days of her youth. This flood of thought and recollection permeated the evening as each new dish presented elicited a fresh cascade of memories and tears and left her feeling, really feeling, like her dearly missed and departed Momma had returned for her special birthday to cook her a treat.We look forward to many more evenings and special meals here and eager to see and experience what new seasonal flairs the talented chefs can come up with.Thank you again to all of the staff at Musang, for making a night to remember.(Sorry I didn't get into deep detail, but for reference we had: Lumpiang, Bola Bola, Sinigang, Steamed Rice, Beef Mechado, and then wrapped everything up with Flan Cake and Tibok Tibok -- there's nothing we had that I wouldn't recommend and the only thing that would prevent me from ordering each again would be wanting to try everything else on the menu)

name: Musang Seattle
text_review: This place is hellllaaaa bomb. I am one of the pickiest eaters that you could ever meet and the food here is AMAZING! I seriously ordered every item twice. This place has a warm feeling to it because the whole staff is super generous and nice.I seriously can't wait to go back!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: very bad service and they take a long time to eat food i didn't have time to take my food and i left this store i waited there for 40 minutes

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Closed 2 hours early on Halloween? Um, me definitely thinks not.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Came here for their oysters and geoduck although they were fresh the portions were small on top of that and automatic 19% tip was charged so the value just wasn't there

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: It was ok. Fresh tasty food. But very little amount of food. Still hungry after dinner. Lol.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Excellent seafood and great service. (Gratuity already included when the bill comes.)

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Great oysters! A really cool local spot!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: The oysters were very tasty and the chili mussels top notch. Our service was friendly and attentive. We tried a little of everything and it was all good

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Dawn is a fantastic waitress! Food was good. My girlfriend loves oysters and he said they were the best he has had. It was a great visit.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Guess what I ate here? Guess? Oysters! And they were yummy. Fresh, and beautifully prepared.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: I love this place! The food is fabulous as is the service. We make it a priority to visit whenever we are in town.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: A must try when you find yourself in Seattle, the oysters are incredible and the service was so friendly and welcoming.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Meet some coworkers for a holiday happy hour. It's our go-place after work. The food and service are always on point!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: As ostras sao maravilhosas. minha esposa e eu gostamos demais. Super bom, o lugars lindo pra caramba tmb. Achei o maximo, passamos um jantar muito bom em familia

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: This is my first time eating a fried oyster! And by golly it is scrumptious! I think I will eat fried oysters at every oyster bar from now on! Yum!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: 12/10 would recommend! What a great spot! Staff was friendly, location clean, everything was delicious!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Fabulous fresh seafood served by people who give a care about serving the best. Enjoy!We had dungeness crab, chowder, baked oysters, muscles and the bread. You DO want the bread... To eat the sauce they serve in the crab body!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Exceeded  my expectations, despite the price! Right down to food quality, presentation,  and instructions.   The meal has a lot of dishes to try . lucky for me, it was not as spicy as  I had thought it would be.   Definitely recommend & going to return .

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Dawn was great! Oysters were incredible. Wine was awesome. Great atmosphere. Will be back!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Oysters on ice, steamed clams and mussels, fries with cheese and garlic aioli... this was an unforgettable meal. Shellfish so good I can't wait to go back.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Everything we ordered were fresh and delicious. The drinks were amazing. The staff was helpful in explaining the dishes. Highly recommended!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: It was my first time to have geoduck, and I love the texture. Also I had never compared so many different types of oyster, and didnt even knew there were so many different types. It is great that you can see live oysters so closely.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Great restaurant! The food tasted great and was well prepared. Also received excellent service from the staff. To top it off the prices were great considering the quality of food you get.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Good oysters and good serviceAtmosphere was good too!

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Came again, and we are very happy with the oysters and service.

name: Taylor Shellfish Oyster Bar
text_review: Happy hour!!!

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: The service was ok, not the best. They want you to leave immediately after your dinner. The food was fine, not the best....

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Just ok, definitely not the best sushi in the area, and not the place I would go back to

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Wasn't there????I'm not adding anything to a review when I never went to the restaurant.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Had a bunch of great sushi and got drunk.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: The best Japanese food i've had in a very long time!!!!! The customer service is always great and I always feel very welcomed!

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Probably the best sushi I've had in Seattle.  Unique signature rolls that tasted fresh and the service was above and beyond. Strongly recommend.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Everyone was so friendly and so polite. The food was good and the price was reasonable.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: I recently had an incredible dining experience at Katsu-ya Seattle! The sushi was simply amazing, with the crispy rice tuna roll stealing the show with its fresh, flavorful tuna and delightful crunchy texture. The recommended roll of 12 was also fantastic, featuring delicious tuna and salmon. The service was outstanding; our waiter was friendly and attentive, ensuring a comfortable and enjoyable meal for my party of two. Overall, Katsu-ya Seattle exceeded my expectations with its exceptional sushi and impeccable service--I can't wait to return for more!

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Exquisite Sushi Experience at Katsu-ya Seattle!Katsu-ya Seattle is a true gem for sushi enthusiasts! Sitting at the sushi bar offers a front-row seat to witness the mastery of the head sushi chef. It's a delight to watch as he skillfully crafts each piece of sushi with precision and care. What makes the experience even better is the wonderful conversation you can have with the chef, sharing insights about the ingredients and techniques. It adds a personal touch to the meal that is truly memorable.The marinated tuna at Katsu-ya Seattle is simply unparalleled. The flavors are perfectly balanced, making each bite a revelation. The freshness of the fish is evident in every piece, showcasing their commitment to using top-quality ingredients. Whether it's nigiri, sashimi, or specialty rolls, you can trust that the fish will always be impeccably fresh and delicious.The atmosphere at Katsu-ya Seattle is inviting and comfortable, with plenty of seating options. The team is exceptional, providing attentive and friendly service from the moment you step through the door. You are greeted warmly and made to feel welcome throughout your dining experience. Considering the quality of the food, the value offered is outstanding, especially considering the Seattle area's dining scene.Katsu-ya Seattle is a must-visit for sushi lovers seeking a remarkable dining experience. From the mesmerizing sushi preparation to the incredible flavors, this restaurant delivers on all fronts. With its great atmosphere, friendly team, and remarkable value, it's a place that will keep you coming back for more!

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: I celebrated my anniversary at this restaurant, and it was the perfect choice. The menu was filled with delicious options, and the presentation was beautiful. The staff went out of their way to make the night special, with personalized touches and attentive service. I highly recommend this restaurant for any special occasion or romantic date night.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Awesome spot! Delicious and fun place for a date night.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: I'm a huge fan of the fried-food options they have here.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Delicious food plus good environment. Especially impressed by the warm service; I was thirsty after jogging in the morning. The waitress was very thoughtful and poured tea for me whenever it ran out.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: They have really good fried appetizers here!

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Fresh, delicious, raw fish here. Some places you have to worry about, I was impressed here.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: My husband and I have been hungry for Sushi, however, it is not easy for us as I need to be strictly Gluten Free. We decided to stop by this new location in Seattle South Lake Union and the manager and staff were very accommodating of my needs without any difficulty. Their willingness to work with customers won our business. Of course, we thoroughly enjoy the food! Definitely will go back!!!

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Our hotel, CITIZENM, down the street recommended us this place when I asked for their best sushi restaurant in town. They weren't lying. This is my top 3 favorite sushi spot and it was my first time there! I ordered:Corn TempuraSeared Spicy Albacore w/ Crispy OnionJapanese CevicheSalmon w/ Black CaviarCreamy Popcorn Shrimp TempuraChili Edamame4 1/2 RollEverything was amazing. However, one SMALL complaint, although the flavor of the edamame was yummy, it was on the overcooked side. It felt mushy, I prefer for it to not be that soft. If it's your first visit, just order off their signature dish list. You won't be disappointed.

name: Katsu-ya Seattle
text_review: Got to be in town for the grand opening of the restaurant the food was fantastic given the difficult covid situation the event was small and only 2-4 people at each table. The food was amazing and the displays of sashimi was out of this world (check out the pictures)

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: I was extremely dissatisfied with my dining experience. After reading several reviews I expected more meal options. The food was a bit too salty. The service could have been better.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: This american restaurant that sells premium pretend italian food is a disgrace to the italian culinary culture. This restaurant is an absolute insult to the great Piemonte region of italy.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Ugh ! Sinking like the Titanic and people flock here. What's with the fools on the hill

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: While I heard good reviews on this place, I found it to be mediocre and not very flavorful.very expensive and no value at all..not sure why so many good reviews!!!will not never go back

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Portions too small and too expensive for the size. In Italy they are at least three times the size for less than half the price.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: The space is nice, and the bartender was good. But the food portions were small and expensive, and the deconstructed tiramisu was so ridiculous I can't find words for it.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Great service but wildly overpriced meals. We each had a pasta since we wanted to get some variety. My friend had the "famous" butter and sage, and I had the pork and beef ragu. The food was okay, but to pay $28 for a bowl of pasta is just over the top. Again, service was great, but I just can't recommend anyone pay that much for a bowl of noodles. The waiter recommended we split a pasta because they said the portion was large...which might be true if the noodles were thicker. We both finished ours in under 10 minutes (without rushing!)

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: I had a wonderful meal with a friend here. The food was high quality, and we expected the prices are to be that expensive, knowing the location. The bits are large enough to share, and the roasted meat special was a fantastic choice. You can't go wrong here. We were looking forward to getting back to try more of their dishes.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: not as good as id hoped.. menu was a bit limited.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: the food was pretty good too expensive overcook pasta

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Very delicious food! We ordered one dish from each section of the menu and were pleased with each one. Every single appetizer option is to die for. Unfortunately, the seating is a little awkward not sure why two tables would be placed in the center of the restaurant where servers and other patrons need to be walking by. Be prepared for extremely uncomfortable chairs and slow service. It was a 3 hour dining experience with a lot of wait time between each dish.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Very delicious food! We ordered one dish from each section of the menu and were pleased with each one. Every single appetizer option is to die for. Unfortunately, the seating is a little awkward not sure why two tables would be placed in the center of the restaurant where servers and other patrons need to be walking by. Be prepared for extremely uncomfortable chairs and slow service. It was a 3 hour dining experience with a lot of wait time between each dish.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Went for wine pairings lunch today at this high end Northern Italian restaurant that is well known for its handmade pasta. I always think good wine must be paired with good food which this place deserves. However, I didn't like the food being served in common plate to be shared with 2 other diners. I highlighted this to the waitress but my suggestion was not taken seriously. service

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: On the menu there's an option to order EVERYTHING. That's what we did. It was a great experience by itself. The food are mostly tasty. The fresh pasta taste so good - especially liked the mini ravioli with rabbit. The duck breast and the tuna mayo appetizer also stand out. The service was exceptional as well. Overall it was a great experience

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: We went with a group of 8 and did the family style Degustazione where they literally bring you everything on the menu over multiple courses. And it is not a small amount of food. Our waiter was fabulous and warned us that we should pace ourselves and he was right.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: After being told repeatedly that we needed to try Spinasse we finally did. I would say that it largely lived up to its reputation. The staff were extremely professional but also friendly. The menu had enough variation to make it possible for several different experiences but we made the mistake of ordering a succession of incredibly rich dishes rather than something light and crisp between the rich items. That said, everything was exceptional, if a bit much, but we had a great dinner and would highly recommend Spinasse, not that they need our endorsement.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: I was simply getting exhausted since morning and chosen to move out for lunch. This is probably the best spot I have gone to for lunch. Just improved my evening. On the off chance that you are searching for an incredible early lunch detect this is it. This place has some of the best Italian food, I can count on my hands how many times I've enjoyed a great meal!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Seriously delicious noodles and different/delicious parm cheese.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Incredibly unique food. The portions are fairly sized. I liked getting a bunch of appetizers, it was good to taste a bunch of their different styles.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: The service and the homemade pasta are incredible. Prices are high, but worth the high quality food and atmosphere. Our server was fantastic and did a great job of helping us pick the best food and cocktails.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: The service and the homemade pasta are INCREDIBLE. Prices are high, but worth the high quality food and atmosphere. Our server was fantastic and did a great job of helping us pick the best food and cocktails. Highly recommend the baby artichokes and the sage pasta.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Very nice and cozy room,food as excellent,service very attentive and professional.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Excellent food. Everything that they put in front of us was very tasty. The only negative was that even though we reserved a table a month in advance we were seated by the door. All in all a very good experience though.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Everything was good, but a little too rich for me, especially the fine.pasta in butter and sage which really was like eating pure butter! Appetizer plate is okay as is the pork belly, but the highlight for me was the coconut panna cotta which was very well balanced.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Solid menu of delicious dishes. They have fantastic pasta that is made fresh.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Good very good but not as good as altura. Enough said

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Quite possibly the best medium price dining experience in WA . Quality of food and service is consistently OUTSTANDING....One of the few SoCal dining experiences that feels every bit like lower Manhattan...Pastries worthy of the Champs Lysee...and how cool are those totally clear ice cubes!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Exceptional Food and service

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Loved the food. The gnocchi melted in my mouth.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: The restaurant expanded twice its size!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: I had dinner this evening with my old friends, very delicious food , friendly servers and convenient atmosphere , I feel like eating real Italian food in Italy .

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Went for dinner. The atmosphere and decor is nice enough and gives a good neighborhood italian family spot to eat. Service is friendly, but slow. The value for what you get was off-par. The shrimp were less than fresh, the salad was too trendy to be friendly - I don't know who started this trend, but a half wedge of lettuce that you have to cut up yourself does not make a salad enjoyable, nor contribute to a "neighborhood" vibe. Too high-end of an idea there--which I find really isn't enjoyable at any restaurant. Lunch or bar use might be better time to visit. Would not go back for dinner.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: This is the place to go if you are looking for Authentic Italian Food! Best food, services, atmosphere. The bread is fantastic!! The deserts are great...Everyone and everything is delicious!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Great food and service!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Went to the much hyped Spinasse for dinner last weekend. Overall an ok experience, but don't know if I agree with all the positive press it's getting. Pro's: Very good tasting food, simple and very nice atmosphere/ambience, good wine list and pleasant staff.Con's: Limited menu - especially the much talked about pasta dishes, nice waitress, but slow service,We'll give it another try, but I'm not in a hurry to get back anytime soon.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: good food. a tad pricey. great atmosphere.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Good staff, great pasta- we tried most of the menu between the three of us and everything was good.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Incredible food and service however the place is SO loud.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Best advice: Just order the butter and sage pasta. Holy lord that is the best pasta I've ever and I mean EVER had in this town (the only close rival I can think of is Volterra in Ballard). Pair it with carrots, and you've got one perfect meal. We LOVE this place! Great atmosphere (although avoid sitting at the bar as it does seem to draw some poser-types, and you'll be subjected to their annoying conversations) ... and go early or make reservations as the space is a tad cramped. Service is okay, but you get the sense, sometimes, that they don't really like you and that they have better things to do or that they're more sophisticated than you (which is why I'm giving it 4 rather than 5 stars -- oh, and because it's a bit cramped) ... but the food is truly amazing. Promise.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Love this place, although it is very small and doesn't smell right. Food and Service is superb!! as far as price wise, it is pretty fair. their menu is very unique Italian dish, and it reminds me of me being in ItalyGreat Place!!!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: It is going to be tough to tell y'all everything we ate because we almost had one of everything on the menu. Three letters- WOW! It was hard to get a reservation earlier than 8:30, but it was worth the wait. The staff was great, our waitress was so really knowledgable, helpful and funny. There was only one thing I didn't like, Campari and Soda is not my drink of choice. Now that's out of the way... everything that was delicious... the hand cut egg pasta with butter and sage, so simple... but it was my favorite thing. My favorite entree was the whole rainbow trout. Perfectly cooked. I suggest you let the waiter fillet it for you. And then finish the meal off with a pot of Herkimer coffee. We had friends in from out of town and this is a meal we'll always rememeber.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Great experience. Will be back.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: We loved the food! WONDERFUL! The decore was a little ZzZzZz but it is very homey. The service was great. The shared tables was fun, we loved it. However, they have the most uncomfortable chairs on earth!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Always a delicious place! The butter and sage pasta is iconic and you can't go wrong with it (even if you're a strict carnivore!). Love this place so much! The halibut (pictured) is a star too!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: If you're a pasta fanatic, Spinasse is an absolute must-visit. From the moment you walk in, the ambiance is inviting and it has the most welcoming staff.The star of the show is undeniably the pasta. I promise you which ever kind you order, won't disappoint.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Excellent food & service. Enjoyed the portions. Nice and well done. Nice atmosphere. Large seating available for groups.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Lovely company we had and great food. From the wine to the dessert. Thoroughly enjoyed the food. We had the antipasto, risotto, tajarin, and tiramisu as dessert. It's so tasty and not pretentious like other fancy restaurants.Everything is perfect, the ambiance is intimate but not too formal. Their staff is also super attentive and friendly. We'll be going back soon!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Spinasse has firmly secured its place as our absolute favorite restaurant, and every visit here is nothing short of a gastronomic delight. If there were a way to give this place more than five stars, I would do so without hesitation.Our latest visit to Spinasse was a testament to why we keep returning. We couldn't resist ordering our all-time favorites - the Ragu and Short Rib.The Ragu at Spinasse is, in a word, perfection. It's the kind of dish that makes you wonder if the chefs have secretly discovered a portal to Italy to source their ingredients. Handcrafted with love, the pasta was the ideal canvas for the rich, meaty, and profoundly satisfying ragu sauce. Each bite was a revelation, a harmonious blend of flavors that danced on our taste buds. It's a dish that defines comfort food; every spoonful warms the soul.The Short Rib is a true showstopper. The succulent, tender meat practically melts in your mouth, and the depth of flavors is nothing short of mesmerizing. The presentation is a work of art, but the real masterpiece is the taste. The slightly sweet undertones complement the savory richness of the dish, creating a symphony of flavors that's nothing short of extraordinary.Now, onto the only downside - getting a reservation! It's no secret that Spinasse is a sought-after dining destination, and it's not surprising, given their exceptional experience. The only drawback is that it can be challenging to secure a table, especially for impromptu visits. But I suppose that's a testament to their well-deserved popularity.The ambiance at Spinasse is intimate and inviting, making it perfect for a romantic evening or a special celebration. The staff is knowledgeable and incredibly accommodating, which adds to the overall charm of the place.In conclusion, Spinasse is a culinary treasure in Seattle, and their Ragu and Short Rib dishes are the stuff of dreams. While getting a reservation might require some planning, the experience is more than worth it. If you're a fan of authentic Italian cuisine served with passion and precision, Spinasse is a must-visit. It's our go-to place for creating cherished memories over exceptional food, and we can't wait for our next visit!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Best pasta in Seattle. Love sitting at the counter. Love love love the pasta and the sides

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: What an amazing dinner with my girl. Pasta was so good. Will definitely be back here again.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: The best food EVER! Our favorite spot in seattle. Could not recommend it enough

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: This Italian restaurant is a hidden gem, literally. Overall, great indoor and outdoor experience, pretty chic and romantic. The drinks are pretty good, but a bit strong. They have a wide selection of pizzas, portions of pasta, salads, and other small plates. The margarita pizza is pretty tasty, thin, and doughy. It could have been a bit crispier, but still good. I love how the portions of pasta are homemade. Overall good experience would recommend.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: This place is amazing! Best pasta I've ever had.. I had the butter sage pasta.. highly recommend!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Food was awesome and service was great. The music entertainment was amazing. The piano player and drummer were both awesome. The sound with each song was great and made for a great dining experience. would highly recommend the musicians and the venue.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: good lord, the food is amazing here. i only got to try the rabbit ravioli and butter/sage noodles, and both were spectacular. The service was a little disjointed, and i found the pace to be variable, but overall a great experience. I found the wine to be a bit overpriced, but everything else was on point.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: one of the best meals i've had in a while. thanks for all of your suggestions. try all the pastas!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Very delicious Italian food, check it out!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: The place are clean drinks, food and staff are great, I am pleasant to visit here.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: We ordered from their menu with 10 dishes and they deliver quick this great food. Pasta was amazing with special seasoning and toppings. Plus the service is exemplary! Will recommend this place.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: can't say enough. definitely would eat myself to harm here.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Thank you Sara for an amazing time . And the food was very Good . We will be going back .

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: YUM! Go during the week because the wait can be long

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Incredible fresh pasta. Great service.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Delicious Northern Italian food...............We have eaten at Spinasse in the Capitol Hill neighborhood twice in the last two months and each time was thoroughly enjoyable. To start, we had the Antipasto Misto which was a taste of each of the appetizers. A great way to taste lots of their dishes. All of the pasta is homemade and I think we have tasted each of their pastas over two visits and have loved all of them. The lamb Agnolotti, which is a ravioli type pasta, is particularly good. Nice wine selection too. Highly recommend.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: I think this is the best pasta I have ever eaten - spectacularly good.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Romantic. Come here if you know your food and have good taste. Amazing pasta, amazing wine list. Loved this place. And if you are lucky to get the marble round table in front, you will absolutely feel like are you in the movie, Lady and Tramp, sipping pasta together.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Not only excellent food but excellent customer service, it gets pretty busy, so try to make a reservation and be there on time, great wine selection also.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: WOW! I was a little intimidated initially look at the menu and not knowing many of the words. When I found out what it was I was a little uneasy. My friend had been here before so she ordered everything for us. Despite my preconceived notions, the food was superb! We started with delicious prosciutto followed by the fried squash. The fried squash was very crispy and complimented the warm and dense ricotta cheese inside. Next we ate beef tongue which fell apart in my mouth. It was very delicious. We ordered the butter and sage pasta as well as the beef/pork ragu pasta. The butter and sage pasta just melted in my mouth. I could have eaten to servings of it. The beef ragu was equally delicious and reminded me of a more gourmet version of Skyline Chili. Lastly, we enjoyed the rabbit meatballs. They were well seasoned and tender. I would come back and order everything again!! Everything was very very good. I plan to bring out of towners/family here in the future!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: WOW!!! I was blown away by this place. I was a little concerned when I looked at the menu because I didn't understand half the words and the ones that I did looked a little scary...(ground liver??). I was pleasantly surprised with everything I had. My friend did all the ordering for us and I couldn't say anything bad as each dish was better than the last! The ground liver paste on a cracker was surprisingly delectable. The butter and sage noddles melted in my mouth. Next time I want to try the rabbit meatballs!!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: My favorite restaurant in Seattle! I was given this recommendation by a fellow wine lover and it over delivered. The menu is Piemonte inspired and the wine list is amazing. Loved every dish we ordered and the wine of course!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Great restaurant! It was our first time here. The food was wonderful, as well as the service. We will be back!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Great service, great food and great atmosphere. We moved to Seattle a year ago and while we have found a lot of great restaurants, Cascina Spinasse continues to be a favorite. The service is warm but professional and the setting is great. Regarding the food, just simple, fresh, amazing dishes. The pasta with butter is as great as everyone says but we've loved everything we've tried there. Great neighborhood spot (and we travel from Bellevue to dine there).

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: This was my favorite restaurant we visited while in Seattle! We were late arriving to our reservation due to traffic (like an hour late) and they couldn't have been more gracious and accommodating. We were greeted with an incredible amuse bouche that was out of this world. The restaurant is charming and quaint, the music is perfect, the dining room volume perfect, the lighting perfect, the table spacing perfect. It has an old world Italian cafe meets slightly Seattle industrial feel going on. The restaurant is not pretentious in the least!
