Their open kitchen offers peek a boo views into what looks like a movie set... pasta station with fresh ravioli being made, all with rustic mood lighting instead of sterile and fluorescent bulbs. The service was elegant, restrained, yet casual and personable. Everyone's food was incredible. Several decided it was the best Italian dish they'd ever had. The dessert was unreal.. Get the blackberry chocolate... It will rock your world with utterly perfect simplicity. The bar has 8 or so open seats... when we come back we'll head straight there for drinks and better views of the action. And of course more mind blowing food.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: the food was definitely small portion but it was so worth it

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: egg & sage

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Definitely go for one of the pastas -- the ragu is to die for!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Great food, inviting atmosphere.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Super friendly - a fun dining experience. It's great for both a group of friends or, better yet, a date. Everything is so fresh and well presented. Spinasse also has a great wine selection. Try the veal + pork!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Can't beat the house made pasta, charcuterie, great wine selection, and stellar service. This place is a real treat.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: This restaurant is fantastic.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: I dream of this place.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Seems to simple to be so good....but the sage butter pasta dish is soooo good!!!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: So Good

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Some of the best authentic italian food you can find in Seattle. My boyfriend and I were so pleased to finally find a place that knows how to make pasta! Every bite was delicious and since going the first time we have taken many family and friends. Just wonderful!

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. You just cannot go wrong with their menu. Great service, great drinks and lovely attentive service.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Incredible food, outstanding waitstaff.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: My fav italian joint in town..

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Best appetizer I have ever had (seriously) the rabbit sausage stuffed cipolini onions at Cascina Spinasse. Never had anything like it. I would recommend this place to anyone, it's amazing.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Yum. My go-to place for romantic dinners with my boyfriend or fun good Seattle meals to impress out of town guests. The menu continues to get better and better without losing the sage pasta dish. And the people here are super friendly and nice every single time I go in. NO attitude. Fine dining isn't all about the food, it is about the entire experience. Spinasse has time and time again impressed me and pleased me. I absolutely love it here.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: My favorite Italian restaurant in Seattle beside La Spiga. The pasta is all fresh and made in the house, fun watching making pasta in front of you. Love the Russian Salad . Unfortunately is no longer on the menu:(Always satisfied when leave this restaurant.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: sublime pasta. lardo :)with Cynthia and Louis. 14 yr ms anniversary

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Best Italian in Seattle.Great drinks

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: rabbit meatballs.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: What can you say it is the best. If you have some extra money and want to treat you and the wife out. This is the place. Great food great service. The best wine around.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Lives up to the hype! Love it

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Don't know where to begin. Will be smiling about this meal for days. I have been bending my fiance's ear about this place since October. Finally got here tonight and it exceeded expectations. It's a Sunday and we got an 8:30 reservation- make sure to call ahead or use Open Table! Our waiter (Luis) was attentive and knowledgeable without being pretentious. He recommended a perfect wine to get us started. The anchovy topped buttered crostini set the tone- simple and spectacular! The little corner table by the window was so romantic. We started with a chickpea insalata with marinated rabbit and homemade mayo- amazing. It went perfectly with the wonderful bread. Next we had the famous butter and sage pasta and a new rabbit sausage pasta primi. For secondi we both had the pork shoulder- braised and slow cooked with anchovy and lemon- good God! There just aren't words. Our server got the rabbit sausage recipe from the chef for us (fiancé makes wild game sausage) and brought me an excellent grappa to finish things out. I could die happy!!! Will be back again and again- next time plan to try the extravagant tasting menu. Believe the hype- this place earns it's five stars in every way.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: One of the best Italian experiences in Seattle. Amazing service.

name: Cascina Spinasse
text_review: Really love the food and atmosphere here. These guys are actually Americans which surprised me at first because the entries were unusually special. My expectations were high because of a friend's description. She was here with some friends during a girl night out and recently surprised me with her invitation. My expectations were met.I'm hooked! It's a little pricy but well worth it.

name: Olmstead
text_review: Very happy to see something finally open up in the former Broadway Grille location. Absolutely great location.The good:- Food is decent. Better than a diner, not too pretentious, priced reasonably. - Cocktails are great! Menu is a lot more interesting than I expected. Really diverse selection. - Service was fine - I'm sure they're still just getting sorted out.The not-so-great:- Fries could have been cooked a little longer (a tad soggy)- Hamburger bun was soggy-ish - needed to be pre-toasted- My their-take-on-a-Jungle-Bird-but-with-Calvados was a little too _dry_ for what the drink is, which was surprising (used to seeing tiki-ish drinks come out too sweet; this was actually the opposite.) Campari needs to be tamed; about a half teaspoon of simple syrup may have been in order.Overall, though, I'm optimistic about the food and service and think they'll dial it in. However, The bad:The place was barely remodeled from Broadway Grille days; they put some paint, paneling and wallpaper up and that's about it. So what this means is it is extremely loud in this restaurant. While not as bad as some places (I'm still looking at you, Union) I really hope this changes. It makes for an unpleasant dining experience.There are essentially no soft surfaces or acoustical panels at all in their front dining area which means it's mostly concrete and glass. I'm sure it'll be better in the summer when they can open the garage doors but that's only a few months out of the year.The back larger area by the bar has the advantage of height so it's likely less noisy (we didn't dine back there) but still going to be a problem especially if they plan on using the stage.There's a difference between "festive" noise levels and "I literally cannot hear the person three feet away from me on the other side of the table when he speaks at a normal volume" so I really, really hope you guys get this under control. I shouldn't have to be carrying earplugs with me to a restaurant just to get through my meal without feeling assaulted by the background noise.And yes, this is becoming a cause of mine - this city has a real problem with noise in bars and restaurants but _not everyone_ has the problem to the same degree. Some new restaurants do, in fact, get it right.Overall, though, on the right track and will check it out again in a few months.

name: Olmstead
text_review: Toasts were great. Nice to see a new promising spot in the old Broadway Grill spot.

name: Olmstead
text_review: Great food, great service, great drinks, great brunch, great neighborhood. Would recommend

name: Olmstead
text_review: Great service, awesome owner, and delicious food. The fried chicken sandwich, burger, and really everything else on the menu are great. The drinks are also excellent.

name: Olmstead
text_review: Lots the options and the choices we made. Love this quaint place with friendly service.

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Excellent service and food! It's small so get there early! The decor is interesting and fun.

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Earns my Mexican seal of approval for its authentic Mexican cuisine. Run by a family from Guadalajara, they infuse great care into their dishes. The Carne en su Jugo, Rajitas, and Caramelo are exceptional. They also present a plate of salsas that I truly enjoyed. The overall décor adds to the pleasant dining experience.

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Their drinks are yummy and food is amazing. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu.

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Best food in town and the best service too  Can't wait to go back soon  Nice people who own it too

name: D' La Santa
text_review: What's not to love about this place? Awesome food, drinks, and friendly service. Every month my wife and I go on a date night, and this was my date night pick. So happy we came here because it was amazing!

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Gets my Mexican stamp for authentic Mexican food. It is run by a family from Guadalajara with great care. Carne en su jugo, rajitas and caramelo are great. They bring a plate with salsas which i really enjoyed. The overall décor is nice

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Very great service and food, it was very filling!! For sure a great spot:) the food portions are very big as well good for sharing!

name: D' La Santa
text_review: I ordered takeout at this restaurant. Good service, advice on dishes that suit each customer's needs. The food is carefully packed. The shipping process does not affect the dish. The food was still hot when we received it. I choose Picocitos and Guacamole. the food is very palatable. Good review of the service and quality of the food

name: D' La Santa
text_review: The picture says it all, soo yummy!!!!

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Came here for a Saturday evening date night. Ordered drinks, queso fundido, and the taco arte plate for two. Everything was delicious, and portions were large. The decor and ambiance was lovely, perfect for a nice date night with delicious food. The staff were all very friendly, and service was great. I would definitely recommend this place and will be coming back!

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Coming from SoCal, this was the first restaurant we visited in Seattle and it did not disappoint!!We felt so welcome and had a great conversation with our awesome server Sthephanie - this is a family owned restaurant with top notch unique and beautiful decor! I'll be coming back here the next time I'm in Seattle!

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Esta todo súper rico!!! Me encanto la margarita y la parrillada sin dula la mejor! Y el lugar es hermoso. mi familia y yo nos fuimos felices y esperamos regresar pronto!

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Love, Love, Love!!! Everyone is so nice and the food is even better. Perfect location for date nights !

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Excellent service, spectacular atmosphere and authentic delicious Mexican food. Undoubtedly the best Mexican food restaurant in Seattle.Totally recommended.

name: D' La Santa
text_review: Excellent! The food is fantastic, the decoration is amazing. I will be back for sure.

name: Paju
text_review: Had a mimosa here for $6 (6.50 ish if counting tax). Good place to get your food and sit down for a drink in the middle of cravings. Honestly a little pricey for not a full glass (it was more half or 2/3s) I would've liked but overall it was fine.

name: Paju
text_review: We had reservations for dinner, but had to wait and the smoky smell was pretty overwhelming. The service was slow, and we waited a lot. The Octopus dish was too salty, but the Mushroom was great. The Seafood Jeon was good, and I really liked the Sujebi. The ribeye was okay, but nothing special for the price. Overall, it was a pleasant experience, but maybe a bit overpriced.

name: Paju
text_review: Paju is a high-end Korean fusion restaurant that aims to offer a unique dining experience by combining traditional Korean flavors with modern cooking techniques. While I enjoyed my meal at Paju, I have to say that I wasn't blown away by the flavors.The dishes at Paju are beautifully presented and prepared with care. The staff is knowledgeable and attentive, making sure that every guest feels welcome and taken care of. However, I have to admit that the flavors didn't seem to mesh together perfectly in my experience. For example, the squid ink kimchi fried rice was well-prepared and tasted good, but it didn't have that wow factor that I was hoping for. It essentially tasted like a squid ink pasta but with rice and some kimchi thrown in, which was good but not amazing.That being said, I would still recommend giving Paju another try. The restaurant clearly puts a lot of effort into their dishes, and it's possible that other menu items may be more to your liking. Additionally, the atmosphere of the restaurant is upscale and sophisticated, making it a great choice for a special occasion or a night out.Overall, while my experience at Paju was good, I didn't find the food to be amazing. However, I would be willing to give it another try in the future, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a high-end Korean fusion dining experience.

name: Paju
text_review: As soon as you approach, the inviting scent of a crackling wood-fire grill instantly brings to mind warm, joyful memories of campfire gatherings--a perfect prelude to the meal ahead. The menu showcases an exciting mix of flavors, and I couldn't help but marvel at the grilled branzino, which was cooked to perfection. Even more impressive was the duck, which arrived with beautifully crispy skin and a rich, succulent taste. The banchan, Paju-style, accompanying these grilled dishes were a delightful and refreshing complement, balancing the flavors perfectly.The bar offers some delicious cocktails. I can't wait to return!

name: Paju
text_review: Food was incredible. I enjoyed food I never thought I would! Unique! Service was perfect.

name: Paju
text_review: From the moment you step into Paju, you're embraced by an atmosphere that's both modern and welcoming, blending a touch of elegance with the ultimate comfort. It's the kind of place where you instantly feel at ease, yet excited for the culinary journey ahead.Let's dive into their menu, where each dish is a testament to Paju's commitment to quality and innovation. The hamachi crudo, paired with the tartness of granny Smith apples, is a refreshing start, balancing flavors with finesse. The oxtail tacos are a standout - the use of crispy seaweed shells is ingenious, enclosing tender, flavor-packed meat that's nothing short of a taste sensation. And the octopus? It's a triumph in tenderness, matched with a sauce that elevates it to a whole new level of deliciousness. In fact, every dish we tried was a hit, leaving no room for disappointment.Service at Paju is as impeccable as their food. The staff isn't just friendly; they're genuinely enthusiastic about their offerings, guiding you through each dish with knowledge and charm. It's the kind of service that makes a great meal unforgettable.A pro tip for fellow food enthusiasts: visit Paju with a group. Why? Because you'll want to order everything on the menu, and trust me, it's all worth trying. It's a gastronomic adventure that's best shared.

name: Paju
text_review: l love to eat at paju. it's so unique and savory. My favorite foods in there are yellowtail, bugak and, beef tartare nowadays.  Cozy place and nice service. I will keep going there and try other new dishes.

name: Paju
text_review: Food are absolutely delicious. We tried all the dishes on the menu during our last two visits & like them all.

name: Paju
text_review: Amazing! Was surprised at how great I found all the dishes.

name: Paju
text_review: Amazing food! Great staff! Compliments to the chef! Wonderful experience!

name: Paju
text_review: The food was perfect, thank you. We got fried pork (tang soo), and the chicken wings. Will be back!

name: Paju
text_review: Best meal I have ever had! Modern Korean. Chef relocated from a 2 star Michelin rated restaurant in NYC. Great food and atmosphere. Going to bring some other friends back later this week.3 days later....I have now officially tried everything on the menu and there I promise you every dish is over the top fantastic! Chef Jeong knew I was coming back with a friend for her birthday and he made a special dish and cake for her. My son made me promise to bring home the Truffle Bulgogi and Panna Cotta for him which he loved when he was in with me a few days ago. Chef Jeong even accommodated my daughter who is extremely difficult to please and she wanted seconds. My friends who I dined with tonight agree this is the best food they have ever had. I describe it as a party in my mouth one dish after another.

name: Paju
text_review: Wow, what a great addition to the neighborhood! This was a Korean food experience unlike anything I've ever had.I first took note of this place last week while it was still under construction. They had a sign posted in the window advertising "modern Korean food", and with Korean being one of my favorite cuisines, I was super intrigued and resolved to stop by next time I was visiting SIFF (it's right around the corner from the Uptown.)Last night was that night and seriously, the food here is unreal. There was only one other table of patrons during my visit so the chef (who's also the owner) came out and chatted with us for a while. He's SUPER nice and apparently he was the chef de cuisine for Jungsik (a 2 Michelin Star Korean restaurant in NYC) before moving out here a couple years ago to raise his kids. Color me impressed.Anyway, back to the food. The menu here is pretty small (there were about 8 dishes) so I think I tried about half of its contents.I started with the Sweet and Spicy Wings. Two things I want to emphasize: 1) the wings are very large and meaty (which more than justifies the $13 for 6 pieces price point), and 2) these are literally the best wings I've ever had. Perfectly cooked, impossibly crispy, and so so so flavorful with just the right amount of kick. This was absolutely the star of the show and I can't recommend it enough.Next up was the Endive Salad. I almost skipped this item because the menu literally just says "Endive" as the title of the dish and I didn't realize it was a salad, but the server suggested it and I'm SO glad I tried it. The ingredients were interesting: endive, burrata, sunflower seeds, orange, and a smoked vinaigrette. I've literally never tasted anything like it. It's smoky and citrusy and refreshing all at once. The flavor profile is so complex and I implore any adventurous eaters to give this a try. It's simply wonderful.For the entree, I went with the Truffle Bulgogi. I was hesitant because I think truffle is a little played out as a flavor and usually when a dish incorporates it, it overwhelms the entire dish. I wasn't thrilled about the prospect of having my beef drenched in truffle oil but the server highly recommended it so I figured what the hell? Once again, Paju won me over with this one. The bulgogi is pretty straightforward in terms of what you'd expect flavor-wise but with some nice touches to elevate the dish: rib eye for the beef; crispy quinoa to add a little crunch; beautifully sliced shitake mushrooms on top. It plays really nicely against the truffle, which is much more subtle (thankfully) than I was expecting. The rice was well seasoned (that's not to say it was salty) and much like the salad, all the flavors came together perfectly. My only complaint with this dish is I wanted something to give it a little kick (I like spicy!) I feel like some fresh chilis or spicy kimchi would've sufficed so hopefully they'll find a way to accommodate us fire chasers down the road as they establish themselves.I was stuffed by this point in the meal (which is saying something given my insatiable appetite) and was prepared to call it a night when the kitchen sent out a complimentary Panna Cotta for me to try. Hooooooooly shit it was good! It was served in a cup and topped with a citrusy syrup (grapefruit perhaps?), sliced grapefruit, sweetened granola, and fresh blackberries. You guys. This is the stuff dreams are made of, and I generally don't use hyperbole. It was absolutely unreal.A trip to Paju will cost you a bit more than a standard trip to your neighborhood takeout joint, but they're playing a whole different game over here. It's upscale dining in a casual atmosphere with a hospitable staff and ambitious chef. I've just never had Korean food quite like this. Rachel Yang, you're on notice -- there's a new player in town. If they can hang on long enough to establish themselves, Chef Jeong seems destined to shake the whole game up.

name: Paju
text_review: What a great new gem! Delicious Korean fusion.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Bartenders seemed nice but I wouldn't call this a craft bar. Not recommended, I know the industry is hurting still so maybe they can't find good bartenders right now. Cute place tho.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Absolutely Disgusting!!!I don't know where all these reviews are coming from because our experience Saturday night was beyond horrific!!Place is in a tight spot in Seattle you can walk right past it. Once inside its an amazing looking little space almost like old Seattle vibe. We ordered the chicken burger and it was pink in the middle twice, Fish tasted like old seaweed, not to mention the kitchen staff didn't even have hair nets!! One of em looked like an Irish butler with his 1940s hat, they must have one of those programs where they hire the homeless. drinks came out extremely odd tasting. When we asked the bartender what was some of the alcohols used were she said " idk it's my 1st day". The place doesn't have security so the homeless wonder in aimlessly. Our server told us that a homeless person came in with a Knife last week and cops had to be called while guests restrained him!!! Im not trying to get stabbed while I eat out. It's connected to another bar so the bathroom is shared, homeless people in the bathroom clogging up the toilets and overflowing into the hallway which made the place smell horrible. We asked for a manager but one was not on duty they said. There are better places to eat around town I'd stay far away from this place. -10/10 Dumpster Level

name: Dead Line
text_review: Came back in with the gals to get a few drinks and we were shocked to see that there has been a complete flip of employees. Don't know if ownership changed but it's definitely not tye same. Bartenders were not friendly at all, all our drinks were wrong. Hope this place can pull it together

name: Dead Line
text_review: Place is not what it used to be. Seems like they did a complete staff change. Moral of the staff seems very low, the bartenders seemed like they had no clue what they were doing. Way better places around to get a craft cocktail than this place. Will NOT be coming back

name: Dead Line
text_review: Absolutely disgusting. This place has gone down hill over the past few months. The ladies and I found out a lot about what's been going on from the locals

name: Dead Line
text_review: HORRIBLE AND Terrible place. Staff is extremely unfriendly and discriminative. Save your money and go to a place that has actual heart and soul.

name: Dead Line
text_review: This place, it's a mixed bag of flavors. The oversized empanadas are a force to be reckoned with, packed to the brim with goodness. The Brussels sprouts dish, on the other hand, is a real winner, a taste explosion. Sadly, the wings are forgettable, and the sangria won't make your day. The hot sauce selection sounds intriguing, even though I didn't get to dive into it. As for the black cod dish, it had potential, but it left room for improvement. It's a rollercoaster of tastes, and just when you thought it couldn't get more interesting, a fight breaks out outside - an unexpected twist in this culinary adventure.

name: Dead Line
text_review: The cocktails are smalls and honestly not very good, the ambient is ok.  Many the next time will be good.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Came here for a company event. We rented out the 2nd floor and we had a dedicated server/bartender. The service was great and the venue

name: Dead Line
text_review: Questo ristorante è gestito da professionisti con grande attenzione al cliente. Piatti molto buoni e molto belli, ottimo rapporto qualità e prezzo.

name: Dead Line
text_review: I visited Deadline Bar during happy hour and it was an okay experience. The atmosphere was pretty standard for a bar - dim lighting and loud music. The drinks weren't my favorite or anything. I wasn't a fan to be honest. They just taste like straight up alcohol, no flavor in the cocktails. The prices were a bit high.The food at Deadline Bar was also just okay. I tried the garlic parmesan fries and they were pretty standard - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. They were served with a side of ketchup. Overall, the fries were nothing special.All in all, I would say that Deadline Bar is a decent spot if you're looking for a place to grab a drink with friends and have never been before. Worth a try. Would I go again? No. The atmosphere is pretty standard, the drinks are not the worst and the food is okay. It's not the best bar I've ever been to, but it's not the worst either. A plus is that the bathrooms are very clean.. lol.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Calvin and Martin were absolutely fantastic last night. Great service, great food, great cocktails. I'll be telling all my friends to come here. Id give more stars if I could. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back!

name: Dead Line
text_review: Great food. Great drinks. No disappointments except for the price some of their drinks were a bit higher. Their staff was very friendly and accommodating. Every meal comes fresh and well flavored. I was lucky to be seated right away for a late dinner. All around I had a pleasant meal but I am into their drinks. The sacred spring cocktail was lit! Would I go back? Most definitely.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Great food. Great drinks. No disappointments except for the price some of their drinks were a bit higher. Their staff was very friendly and accommodating. Every meal comes fresh and well flavored. I was lucky to be seated right away for a late dinner. All around I had a pleasant meal but I am into their drinks. The sacred spring cocktail was lit! Would I go back? Most definitely.

name: Dead Line
text_review: The cocktails were amazing and the bartenders were awesome. The food was average and not my favorite part.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Classy and hip spot in Pioneer Square. A perfect place to have dinner or a drink during or after the monthly first Thursday art walk.

name: Dead Line
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Dead Line, and it exceeded all expectations! From the moment we walked in, the service was top-notch--attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.For our meal, I opted for the Carne asada tacos, and they were absolutely delicious. The flavors were vibrant, and each bite was a delight. My wife went for the crispy chicken sandwich, and she couldn't stop raving about how perfectly crispy and flavorful it was.To cap off our meal, we indulged in the habanero caramel cronuts, and wow, what a treat! The combination of sweet and spicy was simply divine, and it's definitely a must-have dessert at Dead Line.Overall, our experience at Dead Line was nothing short of phenomenal. The food was outstanding, the service was impeccable, and the atmosphere was welcoming. I wholeheartedly recommend Dead Line to anyone visiting Seattle--it's a true gem in the culinary scene. We'll definitely be back on our next trip to the city! 10/10, would highly recommend.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Recommended by a local so I gave it a try and I love it. The place gave an ambiance vibe which is matched with Seattle's vibe.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Drinks were ESPECTACULAR!!!! I drunk too much that night, my wife and I loved the place. Como falamos no Brasil, BOM PRA CARAMBA!!!! O servico muito bom, nao e barato mas vale muito a pena.

name: Dead Line
text_review: This is a hidden gem. They were busy but sat us quickly. The ambience is great. Such a fun place for a date night. Food was delicious. Service was great. Can't wait to come back here again.

name: Dead Line
text_review: I recently dined at Dead Line, and let me tell you, it was absolutely fantastic! The food there deserves a solid 5-star rating. The moment I stepped in, the cozy ambiance and friendly staff made me feel right at home. But it was the mouthwatering dishes that truly stole the show.The menu offered a delectable array of options that catered to every taste bud. From savory burgers to crispy fries, each dish was bursting with flavors that were simply irresistible. The burgers were juicy and perfectly cooked, accompanied by a generous portion of golden fries that were seasoned to perfection. The ingredients used were fresh, and the attention to detail in the presentation was commendable.

name: Dead Line
text_review: I was looking for a place with awesome food and an outdoor area to enjoy the nice weather and this was just perfect. I love the name, as I'm always dealing with deadlines, I loved the patio and the food was awesome. Really cool place. Beyond that the atmosphere and service was amazing.

name: Dead Line
text_review: What a great night out!!The drinks were really good w cute names. The food was awesome. So was the service.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Romantic atmosphere and delicious foods!we went there for my birthday. thank you so much!

name: Dead Line
text_review: Oh my god, the Chorizo Tacos and Pork Belli Cauliflower Tacos are to die for! The food is phenomenal. I went there with my husband a couple of weeks ago, and we loved it. Great service, friendly people, amazing location... we will be back for sure!

name: Dead Line
text_review: Great food, great drinks great setting and super friendly staff. Everything was awesome.

name: Dead Line
text_review: The cocktails were interesting and the ambiance was perfect! Excellent crowd and overall had a terrific experience. Would go again.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Cheese fries and chorizo tacos are great and the bar manager Dev is the man!

name: Dead Line
text_review: Drinks were good and and small menu was excellent. Great little find. Service was good to

name: Dead Line
text_review: This is a delightful place to grab a drink!

name: Dead Line
text_review: I found the Dead Line to be a lovely spot to grab a drink.

name: Dead Line
text_review: My favorite place to go to for a nice cocktail!

name: Dead Line
text_review: Where to start... I had popped into this place a few times on my way to a game or when at a show at the Central and service has always been amazing, and now if I'm near Pioneer Square I make a point to stop into this wonderful establishment. My husband and I even ended up doing a small court wedding and having our reception here in one of their private rooms, The Gold Room. Bar service wise; they had a server that seemed to be completely dedicated to our needs and was very timely on making sure everyone was satisfied. The bar staff even came up with custom cocktails for my husband and I that many of our guests fell in love with. Kitchen wise; I was blown way by the cuisine. My husband being from Mexico originally, it was very important to me to be able to have the most authentic South American cuisine I could get (even if it wasn't Mexican specifically). The kitchen staff far exceeded my expectations by not only being amazing chefs in columbian inspired cuisine but, by asking if there was anything in particular that my husband missed from home. To the point where one of them called their mom asking for a family recipe. Needless to say my husband had food that night that he had not had for 3+ years. The staff in both bar and kitchen made the night extremely easy and unforgettable by the service of phenomenal cocktails and food. For the record the staff members that created this amazing experience where Rich (Event Coordinator), Phillipè (Chef), Tanner (Chef), and Jim (Bartender that was handed our event), and Cody (Bartender)

name: Dead Line
text_review: Amazing food. Amazing wine. Good drinks. They have this quaint little back room to host small private parties. A girlfriend threw her birthday dinner party there and the service was just amazing. They made sure our wine glasses were never empty and provided excellent service. I started with the plantain chips. They were really good. Then I ordered the octopus and thought it was delicious, but not amazing. The brisket however was over-the-moon amazing! I highly recommend it! The plates are huge for tapas but small for entrees. I needed 1 a half plates to fill up, and din't feel like I overate at all. So try this place out and be ready to share. I'd go back here for sure!

name: Dead Line
text_review: Amazing food. Amazing wine. Good drinks. They have this quaint little back room to host small private parties. A girlfriend threw her birthday dinner party there and the service was just amazing. They made sure our wine glasses were never empty and provided excellent service. I started with the plantain chips. They were really good. Then I ordered the octopus and thought it was delicious, but not amazing. The brisket however was over-the-moon amazing! I highly recommend it! The plates are huge for tapas but small for entrees. I needed 1 a half plates to fill up, and didn't feel like I overate at all. So try this place out and be ready to share. I'd go back here for sure!

name: Dead Line
text_review: We accidentally ended up here when the bar next door wasn't opening for 15 more min. We tried Deadline's door and although they weren't actually open, the manager (I presume) graciously let us in! We were so happy! We stayed and ordered a few rounds of cocktails and enjoyed their FREE apps during happy hour. These weren't just bagged tortilla chips-they were legit delicious apps. We loved them all and had a blast! I'm pretty sure my drink was the Madame something and it was wonderful! We highly recommend! Excellent customer service, cocktails and appetizers!

name: Dead Line
text_review: Great drinks. Great service. Great decor. Looking forward to coming back for another.

name: Dead Line
text_review: Third day opened and very impressive. The cocktails were delicious, the octopus was delicious, the asparagus and a wonderfully fresh sauce perfect for summer, and the ceviche was good. The host had the chef bring us a sweet tamale for desert that blew my mind. The ambience is fantastic. That back room looks so fun. Can't wait to come back.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Food is good but they are overpriced. They are understaffed. This was our first time here and it wasn't a pleasant experience.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Service is good, but way over priced. No value here. Please read carefully. we ordered the Hot Pot with Chicken. It was $22.00 and we maybe got 7 pieces of chicken. It was mostly rice and and a few vegetables. Such a disappointment. Earlier they day we ate at another restaurant in the area and the bill came to the same. We were so impressed with the meal there. we should have known, seeing all the other restaurants in the area much busier than this one. Spend your money elsewhere.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: I love Korean food but I didn't need the side of racism I experienced

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: We always Uber eats our food but is not like anything special tofu soup is ok and seafood pancake is average kabli beef is to normal Go as a last resort .

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Stone Korean Restaurant is one of my favorite place the chicken is so tasty and delicious!

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Solid Korean food, also love that they're on Uber Eats!

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: We had dinner there Saturday night around 7:30, no reservation and a 5 minute wait for 3 of us. Had bipmbop, fried rice and bulgogi, everything was delicious and fresh tasting. The hot pots were perfect, lots of veggies, meat, rice that got crispy and a raw egg to stir in.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Everything was so flavorful and delicious. Best meal I've had in a long time. Would definitely return if I lived here.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Great Korean Food! A must for good Korean food!

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: I just celebrated my 25th birthday in this Korean restaurant, and I love the food here. My family was enjoying the food, and the place was so great. It feels like we were in Korea. The staves were also approachable and accommodating. I will surely recommend this Korean restaurant to everyone.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Stopped by to get a take order for Korean friend chicken, kalbi rib, seafood pancake, this was my favorite food from this restaurant. Plus all the staff are great. Worth to come back again and again.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Authentic, delicious and great prices for the quality and quantity of their dishes. What's not to love?!

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Everything was delicious. I will definitely return

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: Best korean restaurant in downtown Seattle.

name: Stone Korean Restaurant
text_review: One of the best Korean restaurants in all of seattle. Authentic home style Korean cooking in a modern setting. Make sure to order the fried chicken (preferably with Beer), you won't regret it!

name: Rondo
text_review: I heard amazing things about this restaurant. I read all the stellar reviews of this place written by fellow yelpers. I saw all the pictures. I went with high expectations. Maybe it may have been different had we dined in. Who knows, but what I ordered vs what I paid...something doesn't seem right to me. First, the uni ikura bowl. As you can see, the amount of uni in this bowl is ridiculous. Granted, they said it's not uni season and that uni they have are quite small...ok.... but when you charge me $58 for this bowl, I expect a little better. Let me go back on the price of this item. This donburi is originally $38. That's what's listed on the menu. No where on their website or at the restaurant, does it say price will adjust depending on availability. No where does it say it will adjust as we'll be paying market price, but they said they'll have to charge us $58 because it's not uni season. We paid the price thinking we'd at least get what we paid for. What we got is actually not even worth $38. Sorry. I think you could have done a whole lot better Rondo. If this is all the uni you had, maybe you shouldn't be selling any uni dishes, rather than hiking up the price.  Bara chirashi - this was ok. Not as outrageous as the $58 bowl. Was it worth $22? Unsure. Maybe I would have justified it had it not been for the $58 mess. Don't get me wrong. I'm not ranting because I'm cheap. I'll gladly pay $58 ..80..100 IF my food matches what I pay for. But for an establishment that serves many uni dishes, you should have either 1) not sell any after explaining low stock/low availability/ 2) explain low stock/low availability and charge the normal price 3) OR charge $58 and give that much + add something else to the donburi to justify that price.

name: Rondo
text_review: For lunch, we ate inside the restaurant, but our meal was served in a plastic to-go lunch box.For a lunch costing over $100 for 3, wouldn't it be normal to use proper tableware instead of a plastic to-go lunch box for an in-house meal? It was unpleasant and very disappointing.

name: Rondo
text_review: For the prices, especially during happy hour, I was really expecting more. I was quite disappointed after having read all the yelp and Google reviews. Hopefully, we just ordered the wrong items during happy hour, at least the wait staff seemed helpful. Their daily menu included a blue fin tuna handroll. We opted for the additional uni since it sounded like it was fresh from Santa Monica. We tried some uni from Santa Monica from another Seattle Japanese restaurant, Kamonegi, and it was extremely fresh. Sadly, we were disappointed with the uni from Rondo as it was either not as fresh or was a bad batch since it apparently came from the same source. The bluefin tuna seemed decently fresh and the ikura seemed pretty fresh. The handroll overall was still decent, perhaps 4/5.The Yuzu Ebi Mayo was 5 pieces of shrimp covered in a mayo mixed sauce over some green spring mix (similar mix from grocery stores). Nothing too special about this one, tasted decent, 2/5.Tasty B.B. Noodle - Uni and IkuraThis dish reminded me of a creamy pasta dish with extra parmesan cheese. There was a bit of uni and ikura in the mix as well. The uni was the same Santa Monica uni from earlier and could be fresher, especially for the price. 2/5.Bara-Chirashi DonburiThis was the reason why we tried this place, and unfortunately, we were disappointed. There were two small thin pieces of wagyu in here which is understood since its not cheap, definitely on the well done side. The wagyu was pretty good, but it was drowned out by the over seasoned rice. The rest of the sashimi seemed to be decently fresh, however, the rice was overly seasoned which drowned out the flavor of the sashimi. The donburi was quite small for the price, especially during happy hour. 2/5.Overall, pretty high price tag for happy hour in Seattle. Was hoping to get swept off my feet as far as quality goes but was disappointed. Who knows, maybe I ordered all the wrong dishes which is why this place has glowing reviews. For now, I don't think I'd return as there are many other happy hour spots to try while in Seattle.

name: Rondo
text_review: The all dishes were so tasty. and the ambiance was so good.

name: Rondo
text_review: Rating: 4 out of 5 stars4 out of 5 Rating (maximum points = 5)Value for money: 4Cleanliness: 4Food Quality: 4Customer Service: 5Look and Feel (Ambiance): 5 Thank you, Come Again?: 4Rondo Restaurant in Seattle is a culinary destination that I had the pleasure of visiting recently in my work trip in Seattle. Rainbow Uni Shooter ($9): I loved the combination of uni, ikura, tobiko, quail egg, nori puree, and umami soy on sushi rice. It was like a little meal in a small sake cup. The balance was just right, making it a standout dish.Corn Kara-ge ($7): I'm not entirely sure what is basted in the corn, but it tasted like miso butter to me. It was lightly roasted and had a good savory flavor with the sweet corn kernels. Yum. Uni and Seafood Udon ($24): While a bit on the expensive side, this dish was delicious. My only feedback is that it needed a little more salt and cream sauce, as it was slightly dry.Soft Serve with Miso Caramel ($5): This dessert was delicious! The texture of the ice cream was perfect, and the sweetness level was spot on. My only feedback is that the miso flavor could have been stronger.Overall, I had a great dining experience at Rondo and would definitely return to try their chirashi and bento boxes, which look so tasty!

name: Rondo
text_review: There are not many choices in the menu during lunch hours. The food quality was pretty good, though.

name: Rondo
text_review: We opted for takeout from this restaurant. Our order included the ox tail soup, bluefin handroll, bara chirashi donburi, and uni maze-don. Everything was fresh and delicious. The uni maze-don was my favorite; I adore uni! The ox tail soup was good, although slightly salty on its own.I'd definitely consider visiting in person next time to try their desserts!

name: Rondo
text_review: Pretty decent restaurant. Highly recommend their Bara Chirashi bowl and Tonkatsu, which was super crispy. The Mr. Pork also tasted great but was kind of heavy. Their fried chicken, however, was a little bit disappointing.

name: Rondo
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Rondo, a Japanese restaurant that left me thoroughly impressed. From the moment I laid eyes on the food, I knew it was going to be a delightful experience. And let me tell you, the taste lived up to the visual appeal.The dishes at Rondo were not only beautifully presented but also packed with flavor. Each bite was a testament to the skill and craftsmanship of the chefs. The freshness of the ingredients was evident, and the attention to detail in the preparation truly elevated the dining experience.Beyond the delicious food, the ambience of the restaurant was fantastic. The cozy yet elegant setting provided a welcoming atmosphere, and the attentive staff added to the overall positive experience. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner or a gathering with friends, Rondo offers a perfect environment to enjoy a memorable meal.I was so impressed by my visit to Rondo that I can confidently say I'll be returning the next time I find myself in Seattle. The combination of delectable dishes, inviting ambience, and top-notch service makes Rondo a standout among Japanese restaurants in the area.In conclusion, if you're in search of a Japanese dining experience that not only tantalizes your taste buds but also pleases your eyes, I highly recommend paying a visit to Rondo. The food is as delicious as it looks, the ambience is great, and the overall experience is truly enjoyable.

name: Rondo
text_review: Worth it! Great service and food...the decadent shrimp uni pasta dish was nothing like I've ever had, WOW! Only downside is that it's a bit cramped.

name: Rondo
text_review: Update: I went again with some friends and ordered a Donburi bowl, but found a hair in it... which was a bit unsettling but the food was still good! I was too scared to point out the hair but it did kind of disgust me a bit.

name: Rondo
text_review: If you're looking for a place to try flavourful Japanese food, I think Rondo is the best spot. I ordered a spicy tuna bowl, and I could choose between chicken or ribs. How I was sort of hungry, I asked fried chicken. The food was very well prepared, the size of the portion was quite big, but the star of the dish was the sauce. It tastes like an authentic homemade Japanese sauce, and the fried chicken was crunch and tasty.Also, the waiter was courteous and pleasant with all of us.

name: Rondo
text_review: Highly Recommended! This place serves so many tasty dishes it makes exploring the menu fun. Some standout favorites include Mr. Pork Rib, Chinese-style curry donuts, spicy red ramen (actually, all the ramen!), the curry, and the donburi. Every dish brings the flavor and soul, so satisfying!It's a fantastic spot for couples or larger groups to share and enjoy together. The staff is absolutely amazing--energetic, positive, and genuinely give a damn that you have a great time.The atmosphere is another highlight for me. It's cozy and relaxed, with a lively vibe from a restaurant full of happy folk super satisfied with everything Rondo dishes up. You can't help but feel the good energy here.Yeah I like this place :)

name: Rondo
text_review: Super duper yummy!! I ordered the ribs and they were so tender and juicy! Been here a few times and have enjoyed everything I've gotten so far. Employees are friendly and quick!

name: Rondo
text_review: Rondo is a gem nestled in Cap Hill, offering an izakaya experience very reminiscent of bars I visited in Japan years ago. I love the ambiance and variety of food and drink options... Slightly biased here because I'm a huge fan of their sister restaurant Tamari Bar, which has a very similar atmosphere and menu offerings.The Rainbow Uni Shooters are a must-try burst of umami, creamy butteriness in a single bite. I usually feel indifferent towards the taste of uni, but I would definitely get these shooters again.Also decided to try the Uni Seafood Creamy Udon. It's exactly what it sounds like: a comforting bowl of udon noodles bathed in a creamy white sauce and topped with uni. Adding this to my list of uni dishes I would order again.The Aburi Salmon Battera Sushi was another flavorful bite. The seared salmon melts in your mouth and the smoky flavor compliments well with the rice.For drinks (forgot to take a picture), my friend and I ordered a matcha gin & tonic and a fruity cocktail I'm forgetting the name of. I thought both were pretty good.Overall, solid food and drink flavors and presentation, inviting ambiance, and attentive service!

name: Rondo
text_review: Where do I even start? No matter how many times I go to Rondo, I will never get tired of it. With constant new daily specials, a loaded happy hour menu, and impeccable menu staples, there is always delight to be found. My personal favorites are the spicy tuna donburi, the premium bento box, and the spicy tuna crispy sushi bites from the happy hour menu! The service is always fast and the presentation is superb. It's perfect for special outings and casual ones as well. Ordering from the happy hour menu makes it fairly affordable for the quality, but even apart from that, Rondo is worth it!!

name: Rondo
text_review: Excellent food and service can't wait to come back to try the rest of the menu!

name: Rondo
text_review: We came here looking for a Japanese restaurant and we left happily satisfied. You can not leave without tasting the magnificent flavors of the "Mr. Pork Ribs", I guarantee that you will love them. Everything was tasteful and nicely presented. It is a 10/10!

name: Rondo
text_review: Japanese fusion with special items on the menu that changes weekly. Everything is fresh and delicious! Highly recommend the Mr. Pork Ribs and Creamy Udon (with seafood). Tables are limited as space is not huge; visit during lunch hours to avoid peak hours. Fun fact: this restaurant is one group with Baiten and Tamari Bar.

name: Rondo
text_review: Food especially happy hour options are great! Foods mostly are tasty and reasonable prices (i guess)

name: Rondo
text_review: The food is very delicious, you feel like you're in Japan! All the ingredients were so fresh and it tasted so good. The service was good, they were speaking Japanese throughout to make you feel like you're at a foreign country! The atmosphere of the place is not the quietest but it is somewhat private!

name: Rondo
text_review: My partner and I ate at Rondo last night and had an amazing time. It seem like they have a lot of regulars because they knew each other by name and they sat close to the bar. The service was really great!! The food was some of the best I've had. My partner loves curry so he had it along with an Oxtail Ramen. I had katsudon and Tokyo Shoyu Ramen. In my opinion, the bill was a bit pricey but so worth it. Next time we go we will definitely bring the rest of our family.

name: Rondo
text_review: Came here on a recommendation for having a great Happy Hour 2-530pm. It did not disappoint! They have a $10 special that includes a beer, 5oz Sake and a chef choice appetizer. We also got the spicy tuna crispy sushi bites and the rondo maze-men. Everything was delicious and the staff could not have been nicer!

name: Rondo
text_review: This place has excellent lunch specials and a cool atmosphere. Will definitely be returning.

name: Rondo
text_review: Food always looks as good as it tastes. One of my favorites

name: Rondo
text_review: The food here is amazing, I'll definitley be coming again!

name: Rondo
text_review: Good service! We enjoyed every item we ordered, I especially loved the raindrop cake which I had never seen on a menu or enjoyed before. It was so adorable! Definitely recommend.

name: Rondo
text_review: Never had maze-men before but ordered the Amigo and it was delicious. Had a nice kick. Ocean salad was also generous and fresh. Service was great.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: The food is great, though the eggs are bland. The restaurant can't manage its traffic, best to call ahead

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: It was a Wednesday lunch. Waited 45 mins in the line. Sat at the table for 20 mins before anyone came to take the order.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Food and service was ok. My dish of choice was the negi-goma chashu-men. Almost everything about the dish was good. The only issue I had was that the bowl had what seemed like half a bottle of sesame seeds. I'm familiar that they are a part of the dish but that was a lot!

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: One of the worst ramen shop experiences I've ever had. Service was slow, host rude, portions small, and wait way too long. We waited over two hours after trying to call to reserve beforehand but being told that they "did not do reservations". After arriving, we were told to join the wait list and would have to wait for at least an hour. By the time we sat down to eat our food, nothing but life-changing ramen could have made this experience better. Unfortunately, this was not life changing.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: I heard a lot about this place but I don't get the excitement surrounding this ramen shop. I went here and got the Shio Rekka Ramen and it was very oily and salty. Was missing a lot and was not very impressed with the meal. There are many other ramen places in the area that I think are better and less wait. I don't know if I'll come back a second time.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Regular ramen with reasonable price! Not the best in Seattle and not worth for 1hr drive from north. Kinda salty!

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: I visited Ramen Danbo for lunch and found street parking nearby, which was easy enough to find, though it does cost. The wait outside was a bit long--about 40 minutes--but that's to be expected since the place is pretty popular. While you wait, you pre-order your food on a slip, which streamlines the process once you're seated.Once inside, the food came out surprisingly fast. I ordered the classic ramen with egg and extra chashu, it did not disappoint. The broth was incredibly rich, full of deep, savory flavors, and the noodles were cooked to the perfect texture. The tender, flavorful pork added the perfect touch.Service was excellent--waitstaff were attentive and friendly, making the dining experience enjoyable. The place is on the smaller side, so seating can be a bit tight, but it's definitely worth it for the food. I also noticed they have a stamp reward system, so you can earn free ramen over time, which is a nice bonus.Overall, a really tasty bowl of ramen, and I'd definitely return for another round in the future!

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Expect a line because this place seems to be busy every time I pass by. We waited an hour on a Sunday night. Service was a bit slow but their friendliness makes up for it. The food was flavorful and hearty. Would come again.Curry Ramen + Soft Boiled Egg ($15.45) - This was a seasonal product so I'm glad we got to try it. Very flavorful.Classic Rekka Ramen + Soft Boiled Egg ($14.95) - Can't go wrong with this.Gyoza ($6.75)

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Wonderful ramen! Not a special or interesting environment, but great food for a quick meal.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Authentic but sometimes a bit too crowded.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: There's a reason there's always a line at this place, and I understand why now. I ordered Negi Chashu. The soup was not too salty or greasy. Super creamy and pretty mellow compared to other ramen I've had. Light but packed with lots of flavor. The noodles were soft and delicate and paired well with the broth. The chashu was soft and not too greasy so it tasted great with the spicy chutney. Usually a very balanced bowl of ramen that is almost perfect. It's a matter of preference, but I'm sure something like pickled ume would be a welcome addition to this bowl. If it was just the food, Denbo would be the closest to the 5, but like most popular spots around Seattle, you're usually pushed into a small corner and forgotten about because of the restaurant. . . How crowded it was. You might gasp at your neighbor at how full the tables are at this restaurant. There's really no room to walk, pass, or even get in or out of your seat without imposing. I had to flag down the wait staff for water, my order, and then my check. I would recommend Denbo if you want a solid bowl of ramen, just have time to wait for your table, and just want a loud time to hangout with friends.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: It was good, not the best I've ever had but would definitely come again. No real complaints

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Food is super delicious, especially the curry broth. Our server was the delicious but the host was kind of rude

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: I got the shiro with eggs and mushroom. The broth was light and the noodles were perfect! My boyfriend got the negi-goma and he said it was a bit too sesame for his liking. Also, he added a lot of toppings and the bowl was not big enough to hold the broth to match the toppings. His broth got shallow within a few bite. Compared to his ramen, mine would taste like water. However, since I ate mine instead of switching between ours I thought it was enough flavor. The food came out super fast! Service was great.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: I like the noodles a lot I just feel like sometimes it's seems too salty like salt but I liked it since I can make it creamy

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Very good ramen. Service is a bit slow but otherwise food is great. Bit of a wait though.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: This place is so crazily crowded and wait times are ridiculous for a Sunday night.Ordered -Miso rekka ramen : went with medium spice, standard thin noodles with medium broth. They customize everything on the menu and make it vegan. Served under 10 mins are tasted great. Quantity is great for the price and it's a must try if you are a ramen lover.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: I love all of the Japanese food. The ramen was not bad, enough size but nothing special at all. Same with other ramen house. Hope can get more different flavor.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: solid ramen. get the pork and egg. fresh and inexpensive

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: great ramen, the egg was cooked perfectly and the noodles too

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: I recently visited Ramen DANBO and it was an exceptional dining experience from start to finish! The classic ramen with thick noodles was nothing short of perfection. The broth was rich and flavorful, enveloping the chewy, thick noodles in a warm embrace that felt like a hug for my taste buds.I paired my ramen with a lunch combo that included gyoza and a refreshing ginger ale. The gyoza were perfectly crispy on the outside and filled with juicy, savory goodness. The ginger ale added a nice, tangy touch to round off the meal.Every bite was a delight, and the service was top-notch. If you're looking for a comforting and delicious bowl of ramen, Ramen DANBO is the place to be. Highly recommend!

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: The noodles, the broth! Some of the best ramen!The best part of the place is we can choose the thickness of the broth, spice levels, and additional toppings. Highly recommend this place for everyone. Make sure you are hungry before you visit as the portion size is huge.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: The Best Ramen in Town!! Cheap, Filling and Flavorfulllllllll! The only thing I wish they had on their menu is fried chicken.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Ramen Danbo: Your Personalized Noodle Playground! Calling all ramen enthusiasts and veggie heroes! Ramen Danbo isn't just about delicious, build-your-own bowls (though, oh boy, are they delicious!), it's about creating a ramen experience that sings to your soul.  Imagine: a fragrant, creamy tonkotsu broth or a vibrant miso masterpiece, your canvas. Then, the toppings parade begins! And the best part? You only pay for what tickles your taste buds. No ramen regret here! But guess what? Ramen Danbo doesn't discriminate against herbivores! Their dedicated vegetarian menu is a symphony of flavorful broths, fresh veggies, and crispy tofu that rivals any meat-eater's dream bowl. So gather your crew, vegan or not, and prepare for a slurp-tacular adventure! Here's what keeps us coming back for more:Endless customization: From broths to noodles, toppings to spice levels, it's your ramen, your way.Budget-friendly bliss: Pay only for what you crave, leaving mystery fees and ramen remorse in the dust.Seasonal surprises: New flavor journeys every few months? Yes, please! Vegetarian haven: Veggie friends, rejoice! Your ramen dreams have come true. So next time you're craving a soul-warming (or taste bud-exploding) ramen experience, ditch the boring chains and head to Ramen Danbo.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Ramen lovers, rejoice! let me tell you, this small little gem is an absolute haven for your taste buds. What truly impressed me was the dedication to cater to all types of diners. As a vegetarian, I often struggle to find flavorful options, but Ramen Danbo truly delivered with their veggie ramens. They have a number of veggie offerings.We tried their veggie miso ramen, seasonal tomato ramen and the sesame ramen, and I was blown away by the explosion of flavors in each bowl. you have the option of choosing noodle thickness, richness of broth and a number of other customization. The veggie miso ram had a velvety miso broth. The depth of the flavors was incredible, and the umami notes from the miso took this bowl to a whole new level. The noodles were perfectly cooked, and every bite had perfect texture and flavor. The tomato ramen was an interesting combination but I enjoyed the other two ramens more. It is a seasonal flavor they have. 3.5/5The sesame ramen, oh my goodness, was a revelation. If you like Sesame you will love this broth. The rich nuttiness of the sesame combined with the savory broth was a match made in ramen heaven. my favorite! 5/5Their veggie gyozas are decent too 4/5- had favorful filling and the dough to filling ratio was Pete! The portion sizes were generous. While there was a wait of 60 minutes to get a table, I can wholeheartedly say that the wait was absolutely worth it. However, I must mention that finding parking around the area was a bit challenging. It took some time to locate a suitable spot, but don't let that deter you from the wonderful dining experience that awaits inside.Highly recommend this place for veggie ramen lovers

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Great food. Great service. Lively ambiance. Waited 40 min on a Saturday night at 8:45pm.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: I walkways walk by this place and it's always packed, finally decided to try it and now I can see why it's so busy!!! Loved it

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: The restaurant is fairly large with quite large so it becomes quite hard when trying to pick something. Once we got a table and were seated, we were handed the menus and took a look. Aside from ramen they also have other items like gyoza and side dishes. After ordering it didn't take long to get the food. I tried the Miso Ramen and that was tasty. Delicious broth nice noodles and pork. I enjoyed the food and it was fairly cheap too.

name: Ramen Danbo

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Came here for an early Friday night dinner. We were seated, had our order taken and our food came out all in the span of ~5 minutes. Very fast and efficient service...but they weren't busy at all so we weren't rushed at all.I got the Classic Rekka ramen and my boyfriend got the Classic Chashu-men ramen with extra spice.I love all the options to customize and my thick noodles were cooked perfectly al dente (firm), which I enjoyed. I loved my broth, it was very rich and flavorful. It wasn't that spicy but had a nice flavor. The Chashu ramen broth had a cleaner, sweet flavor. My boyfriend mentioned that although he ordered extra spice his had zero spice, but it wasn't that big of a deal.The bowls/portions were rather small, which they work around by offering extra orders of noodles, but still a good sized meal. (Boiled eggs were also a add on).Overall, would recommend coming here if you want to get a quick tasty meal.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Lines were long most times I have been in but I did not mind the wait. It was and has always been worth it for me and my kid. The ramen is chewy, the broth savory umami, and the gyoza rounds up the meal. Wait service is really prompt and I enjoy sitting by the 'bar' so I can check out the cooks prepare the meal.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Really fast, good food. Love the miso ramen.

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: Probably the best ramen in Capitol Hill! Their broth is very distinct and their pork nearly melts in your mouth. I love the thick noodles in their shiro, particular, personally

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: If you haven't tried this ramen place yet you have to! I ordered the classic Rekka ramen, and the broth is probably the best I've had in Seattle. I really liked how you can customize everything too, like the thickness of noodles, which I ordered more soft. The staff here is also so friendly, multiple people came to check on our table which was really nice. Will definitely be back!

name: Ramen Danbo
text_review: The spicy miso ramen is amazing. The service was excellent and the staff was super friendly. We kept on getting asked if everything was great and as we finished three staff members took our plates. The best ramen and staff in town! Don't forget to try the gyoza and add the pickled veg to your ramen.

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: I used to love this place but now I don't know what is going on with them. I ordered 2 item pork belly and sullung tang ( Uber eat )but I didn't receive sullung tang at all and pork belly was not even warm as well as missing stuff. I tried to call them but I wasn't able to contact them.

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: I live in the Eastlake area and have eaten here at least six times. But no more after this evening. My husband and daughter and I went in and this was our experience.  We tried to order the chicken dish which we had the last time we dined here. We were told that we needed to order two meals and we could not split them. So we ordered of the pancakes. Our daughter wanted the volcano egg. So here's where I'm going to give the math breakdown.The Chicken dish is $ 18.00The Volcano egg is   10.00The Kimichi Pancake 14.00Our server came back to the table and said we couldn't order that way because we had to order two of the 18.00 dinner items .I then asked if we could just do a take out order instead. She returned and said we could but that the Volcano Egg couldn't be a take out item. I then asked if we could just sit there and my daughter eat the egg dish while we waited. Now mind you this was at 4:30 and there was only one other table in use. We were told we couldn't do that. I then said fine were leaving. I then explained to the manager or who ever he was about why we were leaving. He wanted to explain to me that on the menu it says that there has to be two orders of the chicken dish. So here's the math again. Two Chicken dishes for 18.00 =   36.00One Chicken Dish and One Kimich Pancacke   18.00+14.00=32.00So it was worth him not at least trying to have us stay and eat at his restaurant for $4.00. He needs to learn about customer service. Also not to mention that his server who we would have tipped 20% missed out as well as we are local to this neighborhood and have been trying to support our local restaurants  But not to worry we walked down the street to HayMaker had a great dinner during their happy hour. The service was great they went out of there way to make sure we enjoyed our meal. I will not be returning to Son of a Butcher and will not be taking my family who we were going to go and eat this up coming week.

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: Decided to try takeout as I was craving Korean food....not sure if my food had been tampered with, literally looks like togo food someone ate out of. Poor presentation. Their in-dining experience was a lot better. There are better takeout Korean options in Seattle. Overall, I dont recommend.....H Mart food is sadly better quality and for a lesser price. Giving a two star for their effort.

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: If you're in Seattle and craving the best Korean BBQ experience, this place is an absolute must-visit. It's located in quiet neighborhoods in Eastlake like a hidden jewel box.The highlight of the meal is undoubtedly the Korean BBQ, which features some of the highest quality cuts of meat I've ever had. Their SOB cuts were tender and flavorful, while the pork belly was perfectly crispy on the edges and succulent in the middle. ( one of the best pork belly I ever had in Korean BBQ!! ) Each meat was grilled to perfection right at your table, adding to the interactive and fun dining experience. The quality of the meats is exceptional--tender, juicy, and full of authentic flavors.But the greatness doesn't stop at the BBQ. The seafood pancake (haemul pajeon) is hands down the best I've ever tasted ( everyone in my group agreed ). Crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside, with generous chunks of seafood. It's the perfect complement to the grilled meats.The side dishes (banchan) here are next level--each one is fresh, vibrant, and packed with flavor. From the crunchy kimchi to the savory pickled vegetables and silky steamed egg, every bite is a delight. The variety of banchan that comes with the meal elevates the entire experience, offering a great balance to the richness of the BBQ.If you're a fan of Korean cuisine, this place is by far one of the best in the Seattle area. Excellent service, top-notch quality, and an unforgettable meal. Highly recommended!

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: By far one of my favorite KBBQ spots in Seattle! The meat quality is top notch. I love their sauces and side dishes, they complement the meal perfectly. The servers were very friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was lively, making it a great dining experience every time. The price is on the higher side, but it's definitely worth it for the quality. Highly recommend.

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: My favorite place to go - it never disappoints! The food quality is top-notch and the staff, especially the owner, Mr. Park, are so friendly. The only downside is that they open at 5pm. I wish they were open for lunch too. If they were, I'd definitely go there every day!

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: Best Korean in the city. Fun atmosphere. Lots of parking. Great value. Will be going back

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: Tried other Korean bbq in the cities but still the best have ever been to. We ordered brisket and pork belly and the pork belly were excellent that we had to order more. The combo comes with soup, steamed egg and they don't disappoint you.We were smart enough to make a reservation this time to avoid long wait so try to make a reservation. Also, keep in mind that they are short of staff so the service can be a little slow. However, the quality of food and side dishes was still amazing.

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: This is my go to spot for Korean bbq in Seattle. Trust me, I know what I'm talking about (Korean).

Our waiters/waitresses are always so engaging and good at their job and the food is next level. This is a place we tell others about!

name: Son of A Butcher
text_review: Son of a Butcher will now be my Korean BBQ place of choice in Seattle. Came here few times and definitely worth it. It's not AYCE but they serve quality meat so you get what you pay for. Food was amazing, great barchan selections.

The honey adds the perfect touch of sweetness that takes the biscuits to another level.We also tried one of the plates, but I wasn't as big a fan of it. It felt like just regular scrambled eggs with gravy and grits on top, nothing too exciting. Still, the biscuits alone are worth the visit, and I'd definitely recommend stopping by just for those!

text_review: If you're looking for a no-frills, down-to-earth breakfast spot, look no further than this gem. The long line outside was a testament to what was awaiting inside.We tried the hot mess bitch - and oh boy, it did not disappoint. The smothering of gravy was just the way I like it, and the portion size was more than enough for my wife and I to share. We were full before we even finished the whole thing!The staff, while unconventional, were an absolute delight. Expect a good-hearted cuss word or two, adding a unique and fun touch to the morning atmosphere. There's nothing quite like being talked dirty to in the early hours - it certainly set the tone for a fantastic day. We'll definitely be back for more.

name: Biscuit Bitch
text_review: I stumbled upon Biscuit Bitch during a leisurely walk through the streets of Seattle, and what a delightful surprise it was! From the moment I walked up to their storefront, I could feel the inviting and energetic vibes that this place exudes.The staff at Biscuit Bitch were quick to greet me with a smile and express genuine enthusiasm for their food. As a first-time visitor, I appreciated their helpfulness in guiding me through the menu and answering my questions.Now, let's talk about the star of the show - the biscuits. Oh boy, these biscuits are out of this world! They are perfectly flaky and buttery, with just the right amount of crispness on the outside. Whether you prefer a classic egg and bacon combo or a more adventurous option like the Gravy Train with fried chicken, each bite is a taste bud-tingling experience.The quality and freshness of the ingredients are evident in every dish. Biscuit Bitch offers a range of choices, including vegetarian and vegan options, ensuring there's something for everyone. The portion sizes are generous, ensuring you leave feeling satisfied and content.One thing that stood out to me was the vibrant and eclectic atmosphere. From the street art that adorns the walls to the energetic music playing in the background, Biscuit Bitch creates a unique and fun ambiance that enhances the dining experience. It's the perfect spot to grab a delicious meal and soak in the local Seattle vibes.I must also mention the outstanding service. Despite the bustling nature of the place, the staff remained attentive and efficient, ensuring that every customer felt valued and well taken care of.In conclusion, stumbling upon Biscuit Bitch during my walk turned out to be a stroke of luck. The fantastic food, vibrant atmosphere, and exceptional service make this place a must-visit in Seattle. I highly recommend giving it a try - you won't be disappointed. A solid 5-star experience!

name: Biscuit Bitch
text_review: A Seattle staple, this super hyped, but good cafe is definitely a must when you're in town! Of course as soon as they open, there's a line out of the door, but it goes by pretty quick. I love how everything is super "bitchy" themed. This sass filled cafe has a variety of biscuit dish options.We ended up getting a Smokin' Hot Bitch, which is a biscuit and gravysmothered in cheese and topped with a Grilled Louisiana hot link, eggs and jalapenos. Since the plate already seemed heavy enough, I opted for no cheese. Everything was sinfully delicious and the portions were so huge that I just couldn't finish it. Overall, if you live by YOLO and don't mind an early onset of clogged arteries then definitely come to this spot :-D

name: Biscuit Bitch
