text_review: So excited that I finally got to try this restaurant and it definitely lived up to the hype! Hidden in an alley near Pike Market and only identifiable by their signature pink door, this restaurant feels like stepping into an old vaudeville theater. When we went, there was a live band with an amazing vocalist playing blues/Americana music. The pasta was good but the dishes could've used more sauce that was a consensus from all. The prices are affordable that's for sure. We stayed for a few hours, enjoyed the food, atmosphere, jazz band and company. The service could've been quicker but the waitress was extremely nice and knowledgeable. There's no reason why I wouldn't go back.

text_review: We could not have been more delighted with our experience at The Pink Door. We found it by chance and it really does have a nondescript pink door. The food was good but nothing special compared to the hundreds of other Italian places in town. Since it's been over a month ago, I can't even remember what we ordered, which means while it was good it also isn't especially rememberable. Still, you should go check out this historic Seattle restaurant. You won't be disappointed and is you go on a show night all the better.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I went here for Valentines Day. The service was great and the food was delicious!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Its been a while since I've been to the Pink Door. It hasn't changed a bit. I did have a pleasant meal, but the service was the star outstanding staff in every way!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: A great location doesn't hurt this wonderful local business. Recently they relocated their kitchen or rather renovated their kitchen and I think that certainly helps. Friday night spot on fun.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I came here at about almost closing time and still got served. I had one of their vegetarian dishes and it was delicious, I can only imagine how good the ones with meat taste. It wasn't busy at all but then again it was a weeknight. Love the place, the feel and the service with such great food.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: A bit pricey but great atmosphere

name: The Pink Door
text_review: super busy but love the vibe and environment

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Really, go for the tapenade, the lemonade, and the summer deck seating.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Such a Seattle Staple.If you are there for me I am there or you!!Super good food!!!!!!!!!!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: One of most vintage and collectively put together restaurants I have been to in Seattle. The simple but elegant aesthetic adds a nice touch to the vibe and provided my time there with relaxing energy. I indulged in the spaghetti with meatballs and enjoyed the simplicity in the flavors.Everything blended well and gave my palled a sweet but organic dance. The pricing is far and if you have dessert you're only coming out of your pocket about 40$. HIGHLY recommended!!!!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Amazing experience. Delicious food. Great service. Long wait(didn't have a reservation), WORTH THE WAIT.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great overall experience. We started with the cheeseboard and it was the perfect start to the meal. I had the Linguine alle Vongole and the clams were so fresh it was one of the best linguine's I've had. My partner had the Lasagna, which he said was amazing. We were really pleased with this restaurant and definitely plan to come back on our next trip to Seattle.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: If it wasn't for the Seattle traffic it would be 5 stars!!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great atmosphere! Small jazz band trio was play on a Tuesday night. Loved the food and creative drink menu. We went back on another night since we liked this place so much. I also learned that they have acrobats that work the indoor swings on some evenings for added entertainment.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Love this place! Food is awesome and they provide decent service. I have had a few instances where the wait for food was a little long but besides that, I have had no issues. The food seems fresh and tastes delicious

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Best Italian restaurant I have been to in Seattle! I came here and had the grilled Caesar salad and it's hands down the most delicious plate I've ever had. It was so good I couldn't even wait to take a picture. I also ordered the tuna tartare and shared the red sauce pasta! I'm so pleased with the quality of the food here. We also bought a bottle of Sangiovese and it was on point. Classy feel, classy restaurant! Such a great experience!!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Loved the cabaret with dinner, Fantastic, talented woman

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I ordered the cioppino and my god, the broth was delicious. I eagerly asked our waitress for more bread so I can lap it all up. My girlfriend ordered the risotto which was so craftily made and had such exquisite flavor and wasn't overcooked nor undercooked but just right. For dessert we got the apricot and strawberry crumble which was too sweet, but thank god we had some ice cream to tone it down.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Excellent spot for a cocktail and a great atmospheres. Traveled here with some friends and this place was recommended by the hotel concierge and once we got there we knew why. Excellent selection and the bartenders knew what they were doing. They were very knowledgable and didn't have to stick to the menu, they offered to make anything with any individual ingredients that you like. Step right in and enjoy

name: The Pink Door
text_review: great atmosphere, live music & shows some nights. super cool 'speakeasy' vibe though it's just down the alley from Pike Place

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The Pink Door. I 'd been here once before, and had an excellent experience, so I convinced the group to check it out. As before, there was an accordion group, which totally rocked (we lucked out and got a table close to the stage). I went with the chilly dungeness crab dish, and between the four of us, we killed two bottles of wine, and totally enjoyed ourselves. Everyone adored their plates too, and the desserts were divine. Highly recommended.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: so much funmust go at least once :)duhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Good food. GREAT atmosphere. Perfect for a date night.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: One of a kind surroundings, as well as the vegetarian/pescatarian food collection is varied and delightful. Undoubtedly one of these areas which makes you feel as if you have finally found the city and broken out of the tourist routine, regardless of the closeness to Pike's Place I could not decide between 4 and 5 stars, but it gets five to counter all the whinging.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Burlesque, Italian food... what is not to like?!The patio in the back is where all the real action is (weather permitting). Decent views of the water and downtown.They have some vegan options here, which was a nice surprise (I am not Vegas but when going with friends). I am a big fan of the puttanesca.I have only seen the "show" once, and it was entertaining but the real star is the food.Its called the Pink door because, other than the pink door, you wouldn't know how to find the joint.The bar across the alley was a great place to go after to continue the celebrations. I am drawing a blank on the name.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Went there once, the entrance is literally a pink door and sit by the stage. The ambience is very cosy and the host is very friendly. Will come back for sure.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Visit the Pink Door on a warm evening. All these are quite uncommon, but it is definitely worth spending one on the Pink Door's raised veranda. Actually, make an evening of it by putting on that swooshy small clothing you paid too much for and a spritz of expensive cologne. I really like their wild mushroom risotto and they make a bloody great caesar also. Of course you may appreciate a glass of wine or another pretty beverage, as well as your company will see you enchanting.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Coming to this place was an interesting experience with the rustic pink door entrance. Plus knowing it was more of a pub it sort of threw the feel off. All the art on the walls and building was a please surprise and was excited about the whole place.The lasagna was fantastic and given the reviews from everyone else it's no suprise as well. Lasagna with some tabasco sauce makes it even better. Especailly with some heat makes the pallet just open up to bring the favor in that much more.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Really good food, great for a night out, can get pricey but the food is definitely worth it, in the summer you can sit on the balcony which is a huge plus, parking can be hard to find sometimes due to the prime location.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: great food options. go there for happy hour! it is the best. some great shows are placed here too

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Love Pink door. Jude is amazing!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I have lived in the Seattle area for quite some time yet had never been to the Pink Door. It was my birthday and my friends wanted something different than the usual so we tried it. Overall the food was good, all of our different wines were wonderful and we liked the atmosphere. We went on a Saturday evening so were able to watch the trapeze act. I'm told that they have 3 different trapeze acts a night but we only saw the first one. A little disappointing but still a unique experience. On Sundays they have a Vaudeville type of show that we haven't seen and may go back for that sometime. One note to others who have not been....there is no sign to indicate where the restaurant is outside. You enter from Post Alley and you must look for a kinda pink door to enter the Pink Door. Guess we should have read the yelp reviews before going :)

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The veg lasagnas were great and surprising light!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Beautiful decor - my girlfriend and I loved this place. Everything was exceptionally good, from the food to the service. Very happy with my experience here.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: DL: This place has consistently great pasta (not as great as Barolo, but pretty close). The entertainment can be fun. Their appetizers tend to be on the spot. They have nice hours (good for people who work late and whatnot).Pink Door has been a consistently good spot. The particular highlights have been the pasta and the appetizers. Their pappardelle ragu is great! Most often Pink Door has been delivered via Postmates. It's one of the most solid bets for Italian we've found for delivery.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: It's been two months since my friends and I visited The Pink Door and my mouth is still watering whenever I think about how amazing the pesto lasagna was. I never thought a simple looking dish could taste that incredible. It's a must-order. The calamari was excellent as well. We assumed it was the usual deep fried dish but it wasn't. It was a nicely sauteed dish with garlic, tomatoes, spinach and white wine. When you enter through the pink door, you'll be mesmerized by how pretty the place is. It's an ambiance I'd imagine my reception to have if I had a small wedding party. The setting was whimsical, elegant and romantic.The back part of the restaurant has a more laid-back feel and is also where the bar is located! There's also an outdoor seating area - perfect to enjoy a meal with your S/O or friends.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: You Gotta Go Once... this is one of those places that is the complete experience. Right from the start, the whole idea that there is no sign, just a pink door on an alley, gets you in the theme. It's not that hard to find if you pay attention, and look over the wall and see all the people dining on the deck that hangs over the water with an amazing view. Once inside, it's got that old Seattle brothel décor, and if you time it right, a trapeze artist twirling around for her 5 minute performance every 30 minutes. If you book online, it's for seating outside. We were there during a rare heatwave, so outside at night was great. Perfect view of the water, the Great Wheel, and a cool statue on the neighbor's balcony next door.The service was good, friendly, attentive, informative. The food was tasty, but my two teenaged sons reported it was not enough food. They both ordered the Pappardelle, which was only that on a plate. I ordered a really juicy piece of freshly caught king salmon, and my husband ordered cioppino. My plate was the tastiest, simple and fresh. The cioppino was good, but neither a brothy soup or a plated dinner, it was somewhere in between.If you somehow book a table inside, it's more crowded, intimate, and entertaining for sure. On Saturdays they have a cabaret show, which is separate from the meal.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great surprise. Ambiance was awesome glad we got in at the right time. Seafood was great and authentic.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Goto place when I'm in downtown... it never disappoints!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great Italian food with classy ambiance!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Yup! It's good!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Fun, eclectic environment. Quite delicious

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Service great, plenty of choices of wine (Italian and West Coast focused), and the food is always good (Some new items Every time). Their Cesar sounds so simple but its so good either add the shrimp or the crab. We tried the fish of the day and cioppino. Let me just say Seattle gets down with their see food. This place is always busy and they have live music almost everyday of the week. The entrance in an alley way so its fun to find. Close to Pike Market and Downtown. Very Romantic and from now on will make it a point to dine here every time I come to Seattle.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: A must stop for me whenever I am in the area. Don't missed the Trapeze show. Great service, delicious food and an overall fun experience. Recommeneded for dates and birthdays

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Took my wife here for our night out. Had an amazing time. The menu could of have a few more options, however all the food was good quality. I will for sure take my wife back in the summer for the out door seating our waiter mentioned to us. Slightly over priced so it is more of a special occasion restaurant. Parking around there was hard to find but I guess I have to expect that by pike place.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: It was a great little out of the way place for lunch. Food was delicious and the server was very friendly. Will definitely come back.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I don't get this place. I mean the food wasn't bad, but I didn't see anything special. Definitely did enjoy the performance. I would give it a try one more time.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Huge servings and the food was really delicious.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Lobe the Pink Door! Went there for the first time in 5 years last week and it was still fantastic! What a unique and wonderful place to go and drink and eat. One of the very best in Seattle!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Been dining at The Pink Door from the time it opened. Consistently superb food, ambiance and staff. Always perfect for a special evening.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Very nice, cute and romantic... the food is awesome too!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: We came here over the weekend with some out-of-towners, and wanted to give them a great dinner experience. This place delivered. We ended up splitting two appetizers, and I personally ordered the lasagna, and it was great. My wife really enjoyed her linguini and we all had a great time.The meal was a little pricey, but the atmosphere and the staff were wonderful. The performance was very entertaining as well, and it was worth the cost for such a great meal, and such a great time.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The pasta is divine!

text_review: This place has great food and good entertainment. The price was a little high, even with a trapeze artist.

text_review: The short show is not bad. The food is not bad. But the cocktail is diluted.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Love the environment but the food is so so.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I've only been once and already remembered the address! It's just that good.

name: The Pink Door

The waitstaff was attentive, the food was amazing. I highly recommend the pasta with bolognese sauce! YUM! And the trapeze artist....AMAZING!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The clams and mussels are amazing.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I always go back for their prosciutto, the best in town.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The art of burlesque dancing.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The food was very good and the ambiance was great, they had live music playing while I was thereThe service was good and I would go back again.

name: The Pink Door

text_review: Good food, good service, chic and cool atmosphere. I'd totally go back!

text_review: I fell in love the first time I came here for lunch: summer, seated on the deck, Wine, caprese, beautiful view! I always take colleagues from out of town here, make sure you have reservations for a group. Saturday nights are super fun

text_review: Great patio with a great view.

name: The Pink Door

name: The Pink Door
text_review: this place is awesome... i should give them 5 stars for the food and the environment.... but some of the waitresses there are not very polite. i took one star back. yes this is place is a place to eat and hang out if you have a chance to go Seattle...

name: The Pink Door
text_review: This is still one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle with great food and ambiance and their outdoor deck is one of the best places to savor a sunny Seattle day.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: All the great reviews say it well.....great spot with very good food

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Good food, and nice atmosphere - what else could you ask for?

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Really yummy food. Fun show. Great with friends. Just go! :)

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Good stuff. Nice atmosphere.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The Pink Door is just glorious. It is beautiful in the summer and elegant in the winter. The bread is good to start with and their expresso is divine to end with. Try out the Lazagne-it is world famous and rightfully so-perfectly cooked, soft yet firm, creamy yet tangy. They have delicious daily specials and very friendly staff!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Hands down the best lasagna i've ever had in my entire life. I can't wait to come back!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Amazing food and atmosphere. Service was wonderful. First time there will definitely go again

name: The Pink Door
text_review: My family really enjoy the food and the vibe of the restaurant. My dining companion opted for the classic spaghetti carbonara, and it was delightfully creamy and savory, with just the right amount of pancetta. The staff was welcoming, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. Our server provided excellent recommendations and checked in on us regularly without being intrusive. It's evident that they take pride in their food and service.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The Pink Door is an absolute gem in Seattle! From the moment we walked in, we were met with a warm and inviting atmosphere. Every dish was exquisite, made with high-quality ingredients and perfectly balanced flavors. The attention to detail in both the food and service made the experience truly special.To top it all off, the view was breathtaking--overlooking the ocean and the iconic Seattle Ferris wheel, creating the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable meal. If you're looking for exceptional Italian cuisine with a stunning ambiance, The Pink Door is a must!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The food here is nothing short of incredible. My friend ordered the lasagna, and I had to try it. We both agreed that it was, without a doubt, the best lasagna we've ever had--perfectly layered, flavorful, and just the right balance of textures. I ordered the pork chop dinner with cherry sauce, arugula, and potatoes, and I can honestly say it was the best pork chop I've ever had. The meat was perfectly cooked, tender, and juicy, and the cherry sauce was a delightful addition that brought the dish together. Every bite was perfection.The restaurant itself is decorated beautifully--cute and elegant, which just adds to the overall experience. We also found the prices to be quite reasonable, especially considering it's an upscale restaurant. Overall, this was an unforgettable dining experience, and I highly recommend it!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: What a lovely place. Everything from the food, ambience , live music and service was special. I can't wait to come back.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: So cute and great food! I loved the whole experience. I will be going back as soon as i can!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Wonderful meal (pasta!) and great service. We had a great view of the bay down below. It's worth the wait in line.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Haven't been back in years but we just made a reservation. I've been dreaming about their Branzino! Can't wait to get there!!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I love the food, and the place has a very relaxing vibe. It's always one of my top choices when dining with family.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: What a wonderful experience. This place was recommended by several different people and it was definitely a great recommendation. The food was amazing and the service was excellent. The location has a great vibe and beautiful decor. Definitely recommend when visit g the area.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: My garlic bread needs to come grilled for the rest of my life now. Everything was great. But I got the lasagna which was delicious but small and I was still hungry after. The rigatoni with mamas meatballs was delicious but more on the Al dente side than we wanted. The meatball I thought it was just ok. But it's a popular dish. And the rose hips to my lips was really sweet but tasty.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: wow Such a good food. Honestly the best restaurant in Seattle.The yellowtail tuna is my favorite dish over there and then you have the lasagna that you have to try. Highly recommended.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: An excellent location, especially sitting by the windows. More expensive than we were set out to spend. But, the food and the service were excellent.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I was told about Pink Door by several people and decided to give it a try, it did not disappoint. Pink Door impresses with its thoughtfully crafted dishes and inviting atmosphere. The Ahi Tuna Crudo was fresh and bright and was complemented by fried capers and microgreens, creating a balanced plate with delightful textures and flavors. The Lasagna Pink Door, rich with spinach and perfectly melted cheese, exceeded my expectations despite not being a huge lasagna fan. The Lemon Risotto with Prawns had a bright, lemony taste that wasn't overpowering. The creamy risotto was decadent yet light, while the prawns were large, flavorful, and juicy. For dessert, the Tiramisu was creamy with soft, spongey ladyfingers and a pleasant coffee taste. The Espresso Martini, though smooth and potent, left me wishing for a creamier texture, but that's personal preference. Reservations can be hard to come by, but walk-ups are an option if you're willing to wait. The beautifully decorated interior and attentive, friendly service make Pink Door a charming spot worth the effort to visit.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Pink Door in Seattle, and it was an exceptional experience. Our waitress, Krista, did an excellent job recommending meals, appetizers, and drinks. She was attentive, ensuring our waters were always filled, which added to the overall positive experience.The ambiance was wonderfully relaxing, enhanced by a beautiful view of The Sound and West Seattle. The setting alone makes this place worth visiting.Now, onto the food. The lemon risotto is a must-try; it's perfectly balanced and flavorful. The crab and corn salad appetizer is another standout, bringing the freshness of Northwest crab right to your table. However, the oil served with the bread could be improved; it's a bit lacking for dipping six pieces of bread. A little more oil would go a long way.Despite this minor detail, Pink Door is a must-go destination. Just be sure to look for the huge line, as the entrance can be easy to miss.---

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I've never been to Seattle WA or this restaurant 5 stars yippy Kaya yippyly doo I love food

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I was told about this restaurant from a colleague and it was just as good as he said it would be! The atmosphere is fabulous, the food is delicious and fresh and the staff is both knowledgeable and friendly. This is a place to go if you'd like to relax and enjoy a great meal!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great food, great music, great service while the place looked great inside. Loved this place!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: He completes his work very well and I have also got a lot of comfort through him. I really satisfied with the service.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Food:The Pink Door is renowned for its authentic Italian cuisine, featuring a diverse menu that celebrates fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Highlights include handmade pasta dishes like the signature lasagna and fettuccine with wild mushrooms as well as hearty meat and seafood entres. The food is expertly prepared with attention to flavors and presentation, appealing to both traditional Italian cuisine enthusiasts and adventurous foodies alike.Service:The service at The Pink Door is attentive and friendly, reflecting a genuine passion for the hospitality. Staff members are knowledgeable about the menu offerings and are quick to offer recommendations or accommodate special requests. The overall atmosphere is relaxed yet professional, contributing to a pleasant dining experience.Conclusion:For a taste of Italy in heart of Seattle.The Pink Door exceeds expectations with its delightful ambiance and delectable cuisine. Whether you're a local or a visitor, dining at The Pink Door is a culinary experience not to be missed.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The ambience, food, service, everything was amazing!!! My fiancé got the bolognese and it was so flavorful and I got the beef rib which was the best thing I ate in Seattle! I definitely recommend this spot if you visit Seattle because this place alone made the trip worth it!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Customer service was excellent and food was delicious. Little hard to find but overall highly recommend

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Everything about this place was great. Our server was very kind. They did forget the appetizer that we ordered but they apologized after and had it be on the house. The lamb chops were to die for. So good. It is so moist and tender. Their cocktails were balanced and attention to detail was noticed. An Italian soda is also recommended! You will have a pleasant experience dining here!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Thank you Mike. The service was amazing. The price was excellent. Very highly recommend thank you

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Title: A DeliciousNestled in the heart of downtown Seattle, this pasta haven is a true gem for any culinary enthusiast. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere that sets the stage for an unforgettable dining experience.The service here is impeccable, with attentive staff members who go above and beyond to ensure your satisfaction. Whether it's recommending the perfect wine pairing or accommodating dietary restrictions, they handle every request with grace and professionalism.Now, let's talk about the star of the show: the famous Pink Door lasagna. It's not just a dish; it's a masterpiece. Each layer is lovingly crafted with the finest ingredients, creating a symphony of flavors that dance on your palate with every bite. From the rich tomato sauce to the creamy ricotta cheese,spinach in every element is perfectly balanced, leaving you craving more with each forkful.But the excellence doesn't stop there. Every dish on the menu is a testament to the chef's skill and dedication to authentic Italian cuisine. Whether you opt for the classic spaghetti carbonara or indulge in the decadent fettuccine Alfredo, you're guaranteed a culinary journey that will transport you straight to the streets of Italy.In conclusion, if you find yourself craving a taste of Italy in the heart of Seattle, look no further than this pasta paradise. With its welcoming ambiance, top-notch service, and mouthwatering dishes, it's a dining experience that will linger in your memory long after the last bite. Highly recommended for pasta aficionados and foodies alike!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great place! Amazing food. Excellent service. Will be back. Highly recommend if you're on the area.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Never disappoints! I've been here multiple times and the food and service is always on point!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The most amazing food ever! And also the staff is so nice to everyone. I highly recommend buying food from here...

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Love this place Great food always fresh Amazing atmosphere Perfect customer service

name: The Pink Door
text_review: cant find anything negative really to say everything is nice from the food the service and the vibe of the place! prices are reasonable also especially for Seattle. sometimes there is waiting but totally worth it to be honest!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great lemon drop martini and great space after a long day of wine tasting. Did not want any more wine and pasta was perfect - we were here 10 years ago and they have made a bigger space. Less romantic but very fun

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Food was great, the drinks were really good and the service was excellent! Would definitely recommend this place !

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Always great service and food. Need to make rest in advance. Greta date spot. Whole rock fish was amazing.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great food great atmosphere the the pastas are great and the limoncello and the tiramisu is to die for

name: The Pink Door
text_review: This place has the view, the vibe, and the charm. The food is delicious, the ambience is hypnotic. I love this place!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Fun, trendy atmosphere with live shows that vary nightly. The music was unfortunately very loud (bordering on too loud) in the front room and not audible in the back room. The mushroom pasta was a bit too salty for me but I highly recommend the lasagna which was light and airy with a thin layer of tomato sauce on top. The bread pudding and budino were also excellent.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: A little hard to find at first, but the atmosphere is fun and the drinks were amazing! The food was so good too. We sat outside and watched the sunset over the sound. The wait staff was very friendly and the service was fast!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Amaazing food! The whole experience from start to finish is great waitress is always so friendly and kind.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Finding the place is half the fun! The risotto and olives under my fish were exceptional contributions and not an afterthought to the delicious entree. Best dessert I've ever had, get the Butterscotch.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great scenery and environment. We sat outside on the patio. Lasagna is the best I've ever had. Large selection of food items. Great drink menu and desserts. Highly recommend.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: A Culinary Extravaganza at Pink Door: A Gem Near Pike Place MarketRating: Nestled near Pike Place Market in Seattle, the Pink Door restaurant stands as a shining gem in the city's culinary landscape. Boasting delicious Italian fare, impeccable service, and a delightful array of drinks, the Pink Door provides a dining experience that is nothing short of exceptional.The heart of any restaurant is its cuisine, and the Pink Door excels in delivering an Italian culinary experience that is second to none. From the moment you take your first bite, you are transported to the rustic kitchens of Italy, where flavors are bold, ingredients are fresh, and each dish tells a story. The menu showcases a thoughtful selection of traditional Italian favorites, expertly crafted with a modern twist. Whether it's the velvety pasta dishes, flavorful antipasti, or the mouthwatering desserts, every item on the menu is a testament to the culinary artistry of the chefs.Complementing the delectable cuisine is the outstanding service that the Pink Door is renowned for. The staff is not only attentive and professional but also exudes a genuine warmth that adds to the overall charm of the dining experience. From recommendations tailored to your preferences to a seamless flow of service, the team at Pink Door ensures that every guest feels pampered and valued.The libations at Pink Door deserve special mention, as they add an extra layer of sophistication to the dining affair. The drink menu is a carefully curated selection of wines, cocktails, and spirits that perfectly complement the flavors of the cuisine. Whether you're a wine enthusiast or prefer a craft cocktail, the Pink Door has a libation to suit every palate.Beyond the culinary delights, the Pink Door also offers a captivating atmosphere. The restaurant's interior is a blend of classic Italian charm and artistic flair, with live performances ranging from cabaret to trapeze acts adding an extra layer of entertainment. The ambiance is vibrant and inviting, creating an unforgettable dining experience that lingers in your memory.The Pink Door near Pike Place Market in Seattle is more than just a restaurant; it's a culinary gem that sparkles with authenticity, flavor, and warmth. From the mouthwatering Italian dishes to the impeccable service and captivating atmosphere, the Pink Door captures the essence of an extraordinary dining experience. If you're in search of a place where delicious food, great service, and wonderful drinks converge, the Pink Door is a must-visit destination.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The Pink Door: A Seattle GemNestled in the heart of Seattle, The Pink Door is a culinary gem. From the lively cabaret-style atmosphere to the delectable Italian fare, every aspect is a testament to the restaurant's charm. Pasta Perfection: 5/5The handmade pasta stole the show--cooked al dente and adorned with rich, flavorful sauces. The signature lasagna was a highlight, showcasing a perfect blend of textures and tastes. Entertainment Extravaganza: 4.5/5The live cabaret performances added a unique touch, enhancing the overall dining experience. A delightful blend of music, comedy, and skilled acrobatics created an entertaining backdrop. Wine Wonderland: 4/5The extensive wine list complements the Italian menu splendidly. A diverse selection of reds and whites caters to varied preferences, though a few more affordable options would be appreciated. Ambiance and Views: 5/5The enchanting decor, coupled with views of Pike Place Market and Elliott Bay, creates a magical setting. Ideal for both intimate dinners and celebratory gatherings.In a nutshell, The Pink Door offers a quintessential Seattle dining experience--a perfect fusion of exceptional cuisine, vibrant entertainment, and captivating views. A must-visit for those seeking an unforgettable taste of Italy in the heart of the Emerald City.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The ambiance here is the BEST! An old speakeasy (or so the story goes) turned restaurant. It's in an alley and there's no sign, just literally a pink door. You walk in and you're at the top of a staircase overlooking the restaurant. There's often live music and one time I saw an aerial artist performing during our dinner. The food is mostly Italian fare. I usually get a fish dish like Ahi tuna or halibut and a Caesar or kale salad. Having lived in Japan, I'm very picky about my fish, and the fish I've had here has always been fresh. Tables in the back have a great view of the water. On sunny summer days you can eat on the patio. I recommend for a romantic dinner, a business lunch or a gathering of adult friends or family.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: My family and I recently visited The Pink Door and had an incredible dining experience. We ordered two dishes, the Squid Ink Tonnarelli and the Lasagna Pink Door, and both were outstanding. The Squid Ink Tonnarelli was perfectly cooked and had a deliciously unique flavor. The pasta was infused with squid ink, which gave it a slightly briny taste that complemented the breadcrumbs in the dish. The Lasagna Pink Door was equally impressive. It was layered with rich, Bolognese sauce and creamy, making every bite melt in my mouth. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts side dish, which was a standout in its own right. The sprouts were roasted to perfection with a slightly crispy exterior, and the addition of bacon and balsamic vinegar added a wonderful depth of flavor. It was the perfect side dish to accompany our mains. To accompany our meal, we ordered the It Feels Right cocktail and The Pink Door mocktail, both of which were delicious and complemented our dishes perfectly. The It Feels Right cocktail was a refreshing blend of spirits and fruit juices, while The Pink Door mocktail was light and refreshing, making them the perfect complement to our rich and flavorful dishes.The atmosphere of the restaurant was charming and cozy, with the decor adding to the ambiance. Service was impeccable too - our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Overall, I highly recommend The Pink Door for a special dining experience. The food is exceptional, and the atmosphere is perfect for a romantic date or a night out with friends.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: FOOD: really really good! Everything we ordered was spot on. Here's a few we especially loved:1. Pink Door Caesar- this had fresh Dungeness Crab and their dressing was slightly different from the usual which we really loved! 2. Pink Door Lasagna- definitely not your typical lasagna - this one is vegan. The pasta layers are thinner than usual, probably using homemade pasta and we're living for those thin layers!! The flavors on here were also bomb. I just wished the pasta was a bit more al dente or firm but still, really good.3. Ahi Crudo- you really can't go wrong with fresh tuna!! We ended up dipping our bread in the sauce afterwards too cause it was so refreshing. Wish it came in a bigger serving for the price paid, but still good.4. White Chocolate Pound Cake Panini- it looks like a savory dish, but this actually makes use of pound cake as the slices with marshmallow and some crunchy things in between. This was my first time seeing dessert made this way, and I loved it. It was quite sweet though, so get this to share! 5. Squid Ink Tonnarelli- generous serving of pasta and shrimp! The pasta was perfectly al dente and the flavors were spot on.SERVICE: their servers were not very welcoming - they never smiled, never made small talk but they were very much efficient. Our glasses of water were never empty.

text_review: I've come here multiple times and the service is always great, the food is delicious, and the experience is always fun. I love sitting on the patio and just having drinks with friends and enjoying the atmosphere. But you better get a reservation because they fill up quick and walk-ins are not always guaranteed. I definitely want to come back for when there's a show. This place gets a bad rap because it's near the market and could be categorized as a tourist trap, but I've lived here for a while now and always wants to take friends here for dinner or brunch. So I would not hesitate to come back here again and just have a good time.

The ingredients are fresh and tasty  and the flavor profile is excellent.

The decoration is light and  simple, cool , very suitable for those who like simplicity. I will recommend  to my firends and will come here often .

name: The Pink Door

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I've been visiting the Pink Door for a couple of years and I've always had a nice experience. This place has some of the tastiest, most special, most exciting and delicious food I've ever had, and it was just a wonderful experience to end. The workers are nice, the bartenders mix some delicious drinks, and the food is delicious. It's recommended!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Last week's celebration was memorable, thanks to Pink's Door service and food! Awesome! Such an amazing place. Fantastic food. Portions were massive, but of course, we had to get delicious sides. Great vegan and vegetarian options too (which they could add more). The staff was lovely, which I did find rare to find in most restaurants in Seattle. A must go to place!!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Fantastic place, guy. We arrived at the end of July at about 2:00 p.m. during Covid and were able to stroll in without a reservation. That made us so excited about it. If you're looking to enjoy yourself a little bit at the time of COVID, certainly look at this highly recommended spot.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Lovely freshly cooked and prepared, delicious food. I had lentil soup and black pudding salad. Artisan bread with the soup would be better than sliced bread. The egg yolk with the black pudding would be better soft. The staff was attentive and the restaurant is lovely, I'll definitely be back it can be difficult to find good soups and salads, especially at a decent price.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Best Food i have ever tried . We will come back here again soon . The atmosphere was great.Clean place and friendly staff

name: The Pink Door
text_review: One of the best places to eat in the city, I can't praise the food and service here enough. It's the best Italian restaurant I've ever eaten at, I'm glad that they are still open for delivery, though the experience of dining in is so much better - the lighting and décor make the food taste even better.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Their lasagne is my special birthday treat. Great atmosphere. A little cramped but when you are a beloved institution what can you expect.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Can't find a better place with good atmosphere as the pink door! Lots of great memories and great staff!

name: The Pink Door

text_review: I am glad Pink Door finally opened! We had the great experience. The food was superb and our server Jack made our experience so enjoyable. Also the aerialist who entertained us with her beautiful performances throughout our Monday night meal! Iconic Seattle favorite for sure!

text_review: I'm beginning to love this place. The food was delicious and the services were good. I enjoyed my dinner here, I had a great time, although pricey, it is totally worth it.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I love this place! Pastas was delicious. If I'm ever in Seattle again,this place will be a must.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: My friend and I went to the Pink Door for dinner last Friday and the experience was fabulous! The owner of the restaurant, Jackie, was extremely kind and friendly, accommodating us by seating us in their new elegant dining room despite the fact that we were two hours late for our reservation (flight delays on a Friday). The food was absolutely delicious and the service was perfect. I've been going to the Pink Door when I visit Seattle, for the last 15 years. It's a place where you must go and enjoy the ambience as well as the wonderful food. I am so happy that they are still around. Treat yourself!

name: The Pink Door

text_review: I took my God daughter to the Pink Door for her 18th birthday lunch and "tourist in your own city" day at Pike Place Market. I was a little worried because it was so crowded when we walked in, but they were able to seat us almost right away. We both had clam linguine for our meals and it was divine. She was very pleased with the whole experience and has thanked me several times for having taken her to the Pink Door. I have been a regular customer for years, but this experience was especially memorable thanks to the wait staff, and the awesome food. We will both be back soon!

text_review: Booked through Open Table a few weeks before our trip to Seattle and glad we did. The restuarant is located directly across from Wine Bar with a patio down a busy alley with lots of other restaurants. You can't miss it. Seated at a window table overlooking the Public Market and the harbor.Also ordered the Arancini with fontina cheese. Both of these were delicious. Scallops mussels clams and the cioppino- everything was good. My daughter had the spaghetti and meatballs, her favorite meal, and she said the sauce and meatballs were some of the best she has had. Overall, we were very happy with our meal, atmosphere was perfect on a warm summer evening. Even the interior of the restaurant was fun.

text_review: The pink door has excellent Italian food. Or so I hear. I haven't been there yet but I hear a great recommendations. If you're visiting Pike Place market you should definitely check it out. They even have some jazz sometimes. Italian food in Seattle is hard to come by and so this is definitely on my list and I am bookmarking it.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: The Pink Door retained all of its personality and charm while increasing its square footage. It still feels cozy but now with a spectacular view.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: This is by far one of my favorite places for a show and dinner in Seattle. Super hard to find but once you find the literal Pink Door you know you're in the right spot. Perfect pasta meal and service is great. Definitely get there early if you want a good table.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Great food here. The show was not my thing but service and food were fantastic. Great job.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: What better way to spend a snow day than in a nearly deserted Pike Place Market and a fabulous three course lunch at the Pink Door! I walked in at 11:25 (yes, they opened early!) and was seated by the window, at my favorite spot. I started with a glass of the house white, served in a little green bottle and small tumbler. The bread arrived almost immediately, along with a little bottle of olive oil. I ordered the 1/2 antipasto, roasted beet salad and rigatoni with grilled sausage. Now that is some good Italian comfort food, served in the most beautiful setting imaginable. Thanks Pink Door for being my "go to" spot for ANY occasion!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Delicious food and great atmosphere!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I love this place. Great service. The aesthetics more than the food but the food is good too

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Will never forget their lasagna. It was so flavorful. Stellar!I also tried Caesars salad topped with crab and that was good as well. Loved the atmosphere, the interior is pleasing.People are respectful, very good service!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Unique beautiful environment, and nice service. Taste is not perfect but still very nice to have.

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Have always loved the Pink Door. Best lasagne in town. Best atmosphere. Love the fountain mid restaurant.

text_review: Great food and great people, we really enjoyed our dinner. We would recommend to other :)

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Got a reservation on a Thursday evening at 5:45 PM. We were seated immediately in the back room and decided on a bottle of The Dissident from the Mark Ryan Winery (priced at $65). It was delicious and an amazing red blend. Worth it - plus it was date night, so why not! We split the Caesar salad with fennel dusted croutons and it tasted amazing. We also got Mama's Meatballs which were delicious and was accompanied by a super flavorful marinara. For our main courses we both decided on their two specials. The NW Fish of the Day was a pan-seared halibut with black lentils, roasted carrots, and an arugula and shaved fennel salad. \The other special was squid ink pasta cioppino style with a spicy marina. IT WAS FANTASTIC. The noodles tasted fresh and soaked in all of the well-developed spicy sauce and the seafood was cooked perfectly. It was a bit pricey with the bottle of the wine and two appetizers, but it was well worth it and I will definitely be back again. Highly recommend it!

name: The Pink Door
text_review: I just wanted to post about our recent experience at The Pink Door. Its our wedding anniversary. I checked out a bunch of restaurants ahead of time and decided on The Pink Door due to it's combination of romantic decor, reasonable price and great food reviews.I was mildly worried about some of the comments regarding rude servers and such but figured it was still the best bet in town.After a long day running all over the Pike Place market, we arrived for dinner at 6:30. We were promptly seated and for the life of me can't remember our waiters name. He was extremely polite and had the specials down pat. I ended up ordering the spinach lasagna while my husband had the spaghetti and meatballs. Our food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and we began to enjoy our meal.After just a few bites, a busser working near our table dropped a water glass which shattered all over the floor. As far as we could tell, none of it hit us or the table next to us so we continued our meal. Almost immediately another female employee came up and asked us if we were ok and if any glass had gotten in our food. We told her that it didn't but she insisted on having the food remade just in case. We told her we understood and she removed the old food. Our waiter showed up at the same time and was also concerned about our welfare.A short while later our new food arrived and everything was great. When we went to pay, our waiter brought the check and explained that both our entrees were on the house due to the accident. I told him that wasn't necessary but was greatly appreciated.I just wanted to say a special thanks to all the employees who helped us for making a memorable anniversary. We will definitely be back to The Pink Door on our next anniversary...

name: The Pink Door
text_review: Ahhhhhh the Pink Door. How I miss this place. I discovered it four years ago when looking for a good Italian place near work (I was at Macy's at the time) and found this place on yelp. I called ahead and they weren't busy so I thought I would stop by. Boy was I impressed. To this day, not even a home cooked lasagna by mom could satisfy my craving for what they make. Since that day I have taken friends who all have loved the food and service, and have come alone. I find the patio to be a wonderful place to enjoy a nice glass of wine and a good book. I also promised myself that night that someday I would have a boyfriend who would take me there on a date. We've been together for two years now, have a five month old daughter, and are now engaged. And he and I have been there together twice now.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Service was quick and firm, but leave a lot to eat. Dry mix mala noodles come out hot and watery, it's funny to call it "mala". Popcorn Chicken with Honey Mustard... All in all, this was the top seller among the many Biang Biang-style noodle joints across the country.(original)The service was quick and good, but the food left much to be desired. The dry mix mala noodle turns out to be lukewarm water, and it is called "mala" and spoken. The popcorn chicken was served with martyr's heads... Overall, these are the highest-grossing of all Biang-style noodle joints to visit across the country.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Was not impressed with the meal. Ordered it this evening and it just seemed oily more than anything.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: My visit to Biang Biang Noodle left me with mixed feelings. While the wait time after ordering was a bit lengthy, clocking in at 25 minutes for a bowl of noodles, the taste was okay, though not particularly surprising. Unfortunately, the Popcorn Chicken didn't live up to expectations; it's definitely not recommended as it didn't taste like it was supposed to.To add to the disappointments, my Mike tea never arrived, but the server promptly addressed it by removing it from the bill. Getting water refilled proved challenging, possibly due to a busy time and a shortage of servers during the shift. Despite these drawbacks, the server's attentiveness in handling issues and the acceptable noodle taste make me consider giving Biang Biang Noodle another chance, hoping for improvements. Three stars for now.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: High prices, stingy portions, and good food. Parking is a bi+@h, too. Not a winning combo.

name: Biang Biang Noodles

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: The prices for the food are quite reasonable, which is definitely a plus. However, I found that the flavors didn't quite meet my expectations and could use some improvement. Despite this, I appreciate the value offered and plan to come back to give it another chance, hoping for a better experience next time.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Yum!!! Large portions and fast service. Came with friends on a weekday for a late dinner and I got the dry mala- spicy and good!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Food price is reasonable but not the very best taste of food.I will come back and try again if i can give it 5 stars

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Biang Biang gave me a solid noodle experience that was a bit more than the usual fare. The service was impressively fast - my order arrived almost as soon as I sat down, which was great! The pork options, especially in the noodles, were really flavorful and tender, adding a nice savory depth to the dish.The soup, though, could have used a bit more kick. I was hoping for a little more spice to balance the richness of the broth. And while the noodles were delicious and freshly made, the prices felt a bit on the higher side for a casual spot. Still, Biang Biang left me satisfied, and I'd happily return for another round - maybe next time I'll ask for extra spice!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: #### Rewritten Text:The quality of the noodles is exceptional. They are delightfully chewy, clearly hand-pulled, and fresh. The mala flavor is executed perfectly, making these dishes truly outstanding. While I would pass on the dumplings, I personally lean towards the soup dishes over the dry ones, as the latter can sometimes be a bit too dry. Nonetheless, it's quite a challenge to find a noodle place with a better texture than this.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Couldn't be happier with our visit! The noodles were a real highlight - super fresh and the portions were so generous. You could tell they were made right there on the spot. The Pork rib noodles and popcorn chicken were a delightful combo, both solid choices. The food overall was not only delicious but truly authentic, giving a real taste of the cuisine. The atmosphere was unmatched, creating the perfect backdrop for a satisfying meal. Kudos to the attentive waitstaff, their service added that extra touch to our dining experience. No doubt, we're already planning our next visit.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Noodles where fresh, I would give it a try if you never had pulled noodles. Good service .

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Noodles and sauce are bomb!! I was surprised the Spicy Beef Dry Mix wasn't very spicy, but amazing flavor! Pork belly dry mix was delicious as well. Chive & Pork Dumplings also hit the spot. Excited to try their drinks and other items! Service was solid.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: The pork dumplings were good, tasted fresh and handmade.The taste and quality was there, but price to size ratio wasn't what I was expecting it to be. Overall good place to check out at least once.

text_review: Honestly, I came here with my friends as a quick noodle stop (when I mean quick, I mean like 30 mins before closing oops) and so all I ordered was a fried tofu bao, which was actually super good! Honestly the price point wasn't my favorite part of trying this lil bao, but in all honesty, I'd come back to try the noodles rather than the bao. I think it would be more worth it, after seeing my friends eating their noodle dishes while I was eating a bao... Anyways, that's besides the point-- I'd come here for the nice atmosphere and good food, but not really if I was on a budget.

Checking in on an iPad thru Yelp. Gets pretty busy during rush dinner hours, but it moves pretty quickly. Definitely a must try at least once.

There isn't much area to sit I didn't mind at all enjoying my food on one of their outside tables.I've been back a few times already and will be going back again!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: The food here is very delicious, and it has a different feeling. It has been a long time since I last had Chinese food, especially during this time in the United States. I really miss those Chinese dishes.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Biang Biang Noodles: A Must-Try for Noodle LoversBiang Biang Noodles has quickly become my go-to spot for satisfying Chinese cuisine. The noodles are simply incredible - thick, chewy, and full of flavor. The scallion pancakes are another highlight, light and crispy with a subtle savory taste.The service was top-notch, with friendly and attentive staff who made me feel welcome. I highly recommend Biang Biang Noodles to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Chinese meal.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Ordered the Pork Rib Dry Mix and the Mala Spicy Beef Dry Mix. The meat is super tender, the sauce is a flavor bomb, and the noodles have a perfect bouncy and chewy texture. Sichuan Honey Wings are crispy and sweet!Definitely coming back!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Biang Biang Noodles in Seattle is a gem that never disappoints, even after years of visits. The food is consistently incredible--hand-pulled noodles with bold, authentic flavors that transport you straight to Xi'an. The service is always friendly and efficient, adding to the welcoming atmosphere. The ambiance strikes the perfect balance between casual and lively, making it a go-to spot for a satisfying meal every time. Highly recommended!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: I'm really impressed with [Fast Food Restaurant]! The service is quick and efficient, and the food is always fresh and tasty. Great value for the money and consistently satisfying. Definitely a go-to spot for a fast and delicious meal!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: I stopped by for dinner around 8 PM. The place was bustling, with only two servers handling the crowd. I had to wait between 5 to 10 minutes before being seated. Having done my research, I promptly ordered the Mala Spicy Beef Dry Mix, a popular choice among Yelpers. Biang Biang specializes in hand-pulled noodles, known as lamian in Chinese. These noodles are made by repeatedly stretching and folding a piece of soft wheat dough to align the gluten and warm it up. The dough is then rolled out to a workable thickness and cut into portions.The food arrived quickly. Despite being called "dry," the dish wasn't completely dry like Hakka noodles, which is something to keep in mind if you're new to the restaurant. Unlike some Chinese/Vietnamese dishes that might include broth with animal bone marrow or blood, this dry order didn't contain any such elements.The Mala Spicy Beef Dry Mix was delicious and perfectly spiced (I ordered medium spicy). The portion was generous. Despite needing to ask for a fork (I know, sacrilege), I wasted no time digging in.The table service was adequate but not proactive. I had to flag down my server once for the fork and later for a glass of water, both of which were brought promptly.Finding parking in the area can be difficult and expensive. It cost me $6 for an hour of street parking several blocks away from the restaurant.The seating area is not huge, but the tables more closely spaced than in a traditional American restaurant. There appeared to be a flight of stairs leading to an upper level, but I didn't see anyone using it.The prices are competitive, reflecting Seattle's pricey food scene. Overall, I'd not hesitate to return.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: The food here is SO good! I loved the home made noodles and the passion fruit margarita was also very smooth and nice!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: The spicy chicken dry noodles were amazing. Great environment and experience overall. I would drive very far to eat food this good, some of the best noodles I've had in my life.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Food is great. Service is just as good the only thing is it's hard to get a seat during the winter.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: I Ordered a noddle's from "Biang Biang Noodles" for the whole family. The noddles was delicious and my family love it.Delivery was right on time, and everything arrived intact. It made for a stress-free family dinner. Will definitely order again for our next family gathering!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Food and service is too good. The venue was very nice. The staff were friendly, I will go back for sure.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Absolutely stellar experience at Bang Bang Noodles in Seattle during my recent out-of-town visit! From the moment I stepped in, the vibrant atmosphere and the warm welcome made me feel right at home, miles away from it. The noodles are simply out of this world - each bite was a perfect blend of flavors, textures, and the kind of homemade quality you can't find just anywhere.The drink selection was equally impressive. Not only were the drinks pretty, but they were delicious. The service at Bang Bang Noodles is just as remarkable as the food and drinks. The staff were friendly, attentive, and genuinely cared about making our dining experience memorable. Bang Bang Noodles truly stands out not just for its incredible food and drinks, but for the passion and love they pour into every dish and beverage. A must-visit spot in Seattle for any noodle lover or anyone looking to indulge in a culinary adventure. This place made my trip even more special, and I can't wait to return and try everything else on the menu!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Delicious and Authentic Sichuan food! The same taste as you get in Sichuan. First time I went there and it was very good!We recommend this place to have a nice dinner, plates are very abundant and tasty. It's nice to try something different, the waiter was friendly and very respectful.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: I've been going to Biang Biang noodles for years. I was super excited to try their new cocktail bar. The ambiance beautifully captures the Hong Kong aesthetic of the 60s, creating a unique and inviting atmosphere. The price is actually reasonable given the ingredient cost and labor cost now days. The drinks are thoughtful made and tasted complex. I could pick up the nuances of ingredients. Over all I had a good time with my partner.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Hand-Pulled Happiness: A Biang Biang Noodles ReviewSeattle's Capitol Hill boasts a vibrant culinary scene, and Biang Biang Noodles stands out as a must-try for anyone seeking an explosion of flavor and texture. Tucked away on 12th Avenue, this gem offers a unique experience, starting with the mesmerizing spectacle of watching their chefs hand-pull the namesake noodles. These wide, chewy ribbons are the foundation for a symphony of deliciousness.My personal favorite is the Spicy Dry Beef Noodles. The perfectly cooked beef melds with the chili oil-infused sauce, creating a dance of heat and savoriness. Each bite is a revelation, showcasing the skill of the chefs and the quality of the ingredients. The accompanying side dishes, like the refreshing cucumber salad, perfectly balance the richness of the main course. Biang Biang Noodles is more than just a meal; it's an adventure for your taste buds. So, if you're looking for an authentic and exciting culinary journey, head to Capitol Hill and discover the magic of Biang Biang Noodles!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: I had my first experience with hand-pulled noodles here, and I'm delighted with my choice! The noodles had a delightful chewiness, and the sauce harmonized perfectly with them. I was pleased to find numerous vegetarian options on the menu.Despite the initial appearance of smaller portions, the servings are quite generous - be assured, it is very filling.The restaurant is charmingly decorated, and they even have adorable tote bags available for purchase!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: First time tried this place. Food was delicious! Service was great. Will come back next time

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Such a delicious spot in cap hill for hand pulled noodles!! I believe they're known for their dry mix noodles, but my favorite has to be the pork rib soup noodles. The spice level is perfect too, I normally go for medium and it's a great balance. Service is prompt, food comes out super fast. The restaurant is also casual, a perfect spot for a chill dinner. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait during busy times, but the line goes by decently fast. Overall a great spot for a cheap dinner in cap hill!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: I love that the noodles cook up perfectly, the veggies stay crispy, and the sauce is perfect. You can add spices as well. I love cucumber salad and Biang's salad is one of my favorites and no order is complete without it.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Biang Biang is definitely legit - and spicy!I temped the fates by going as spicy as possible - worth it, but definitely felt the heat. Make sure to go for the pork as well!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Biang Biang Noodles is a gem in Seattle! The ambiance is cozy, and the aroma of hand-pulled noodles fills the air. I ordered the signature Biang Biang noodles, and they were a revelation--wide, chewy strands drenched in a savory, perfectly spiced sauce. The menu offers a delightful variety, but these noodles stole the show. The staff was friendly, and the service was prompt. If you're a noodle enthusiast, this spot is a must-visit. I can't wait to return and explore more of their delectable offerings!

text_review: If you have been to China and liked teh food tehre, you'll love the food here. The first meals in a UK Chinese restaurant that took me back in flavour and atmosphere, staff were colol as well. Quick service and realky great flavours.

text_review: First time I went to a Szechuan restaurant and I was not disapointed. Great cuisine, with multiple flavor and very nice presentation. The meal set was pretty cheap for the quantity and quality. The staff were super friendly, the portions were big, and the atmosphere was fantastic. My partner and I left the place full and happy. I will go back to taste more dishes. Can't wait to come back!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: My family and I popped in here on a whim and HOLY COW ! No joke the best place we've eaten at in years. Food was incredible and not over priced - service was fantastic they even boxed our left overs. Not to mention the food was at our table minutes after we ordered, hot n fresh. You must try the the signature six piece wings, popcorn chicken and signature pork noodle soup (sorry I forgot the exact names). My son really liked checking out the fish tank too. If it wasn't 30 mins away from us we would be here once a week no doubt. Thank you!!!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: They have some of the most delicious noodles that I have ever had here!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Tastiest food ever and fresh noodle was delight to eat. Best service. I would love to go again and again. I would definitely recommend to everyone!!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Hands down best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great great flavor and on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: My favorite place for Noodles! Staffs are so nice!And appetizers are good! Love the everything about here!   Good for casual dinners and lunch! I am so happy to have found Biang Biang Noodles. Highly recommended!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Hands down best seaweed salad I have ever had. It's so fresh and just perfect in every way. And honestly every other thing we got was delicious. Noodles, wontons, and the little sandwiches are awesome. Great great flavor and on time. I'd def order from here again. I highly recommend!

name: Biang Biang Noodles
text_review: Was walking around Cap Hill when I came across this place. I wasn't sure what to order and what the different noodle styles meant. The customer service was great as the cashier explained the different option and the style of the restaurant. It looks really nice. I ordered the cumin lamb dry mix and a crispy chicken bao. My order was done in the time frame I had been given, about 15 minutes. I also really liked how there were chairs outside the restaurant for me to sit and wait since not many places have that right now. The lamb lamb was well portioned and was very flavorful. The crispy chicken boa was delicious. I really enjoyed my experience and will be trying something new off their menu next time I'm in Cap Hill.

name: Nue
text_review: Went here for lunch and one of the staff was being rude to my friend. Would never come back again. There are so many ways to deal with customers but that was definitely not the one.

name: Nue
text_review: Worst service ever. This place is good only for their food but not their service. Come here if you want to order to go only.

name: Nue
text_review: We ordered the chicken wings and it was rawwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww­wwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww

name: Nue
text_review: Me and my friends we're very disappointed at their menu because we thought they have a lot of menu that we can choose but they didn't. We expected that they have soup either for lunch.

name: Nue
text_review: We were a party of three including my one year old son, and we were asked to move tables to accommodate a party of 10 during our meal as we were in between eating our food. We had pushed the food out of our sons reach and were probably taking up one extra seating. Plain simple rude to ask a customer to change seats while in the middle of a meal, completely ruined my appetite and my $70 down the drain!! Addressed issue with manager only to be told that a lie, that the party had a reservation. Never going back again!

name: Nue
text_review: The food was tasty, but not worth the high prices. Service was friendly but not very attentive.

name: Nue
text_review: I was really excited to come here after hearing from the a coworker about their food. I came here one night and knew I had to get the spicy jumbo wings, they good, but just drenched in fish sauce and it was just so heavily breaded that it wasn't much meat underneath. Now don't get me wrong, I can handle my fish suave being that I'm Vietnamese, but this was just too much for me. We also got the shrimp paste grilled on lemongrass stalks and that too was just way too over powering and made it almost too bitter to eat. Over all the decorations were fun and interesting to look at. The cocktails were mediocre. And the wait is always so long, there are better Thai restaurants in the area with no wait and food you can actually enjoy.

name: Nue
text_review: Ok the taste was pretty good but the food seemed to be not that fresh. Considering the allure of the restaurant I believe these things matter a lot. The food seems to be a bit uncooked and that made me notice the staleness of the food upon observation. I'll give it a 3/5.

name: Nue
text_review: Okay, don't take this review into account if you not a vegetarian.I really admire the ambience, vibes around this place. Totally loved it.But why 3 starts?Ordered -Cambodian Salor Kari Sap Curry : isn't exciting as it sounds. This is a Thai food. I could get this at a thai place for much cheaper price. Tastes great though.Price on this item was $20. Yes, you get less than half the portion you expect. Totally overpriced. Im still surprised about the ratings they have on yelp.If you still wanna try, go for it.

name: Nue
text_review: Nue offers a delightful dining experience with its creative and diverse menu. The atmosphere is vibrant and welcoming, making it a great spot for both casual meals and special occasions. The dishes are flavorful and well-presented, showcasing a variety of global influences that make each visit unique. Service is generally attentive, though there can be a bit of a wait during busy times. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food you receive. Overall, Nue is a fantastic choice for anyone looking to enjoy a fun and flavorful meal in a lively setting.

name: Nue
text_review: Good drinks, delicious spicy food and all for a good price. Plenty of seating, bring a friend!

name: Nue
text_review: Really great had a bunch of dishes, everyone was fantastic! Peri Peri chicken, the dahl, brussel sprouts were stand out and the World tour of butter plate was fun!

name: Nue
text_review: Nue offers incredibly flavorful food that will leave your taste buds satisfied. However, one major challenge is finding parking in the area. With only parallel parking spots available, and very few at that, it can be a frustrating experience. Another aspect to note is the communal dining setup, where you may find yourself sharing a table with multiple parties, leaving little elbow room. This can make it difficult to fully enjoy the delicious food without being cautious of bumping into other patrons or accidentally knocking something over. That being said, the fried chicken wings are a standout item on the menu, with a delightful fish sauce that adds an extra layer of flavor. On the other hand, the Vietnamese iced coffee may be a bit too sweet for some tastes. While the portions at Nue are satisfying, it's worth mentioning that the menu prices are on the higher side for the area and ambiance. Lastly, the staff's service is decent, but nothing particularly noteworthy.

name: Nue
text_review: Great place! Went back home to visit for thanksgiving this past year, and was so grateful of how convenient it was to make reservations (through Yelp). You absolutely have to have their fried rice. I am Filipino myself, and their fried rice is amazing.

name: Nue
text_review: A eclectic restaurant is a gem in Seattle. They have food from all over the world and even some wacky Thai Water Beetles! Not for me but my friends have them a try and stated they were simply salty. The cocktails weren't that great: the food the strong-suite of this place in my opinion. I couldn't really taste the lime or star anise in my drink, it was just like spiked pineapple juice.

name: Nue
text_review: I love the diversity of foods on the menu. The tosilog and the shakshuka were so good! Your receipt is brought to you in traveling books. Found that cool too. It sucks that they no longer do bottomless brunch. I personally don't like how the OJ is pre-mixed in the champagne. However, the experience was still great.

name: Nue
text_review: It's like a study abroad themed restaurant. I actually wanted to dislike this place but the food is excellent. I always get the Bunny Chow. Its one of my favorite dishes anywhere in Seattle. Good drinks too.

name: Nue
text_review: Lovely atmosphere and a good place in an area full of life. We really appreciated the food. The two starters were fantastic!The goat curry was missing a bit of salt, I think. But it can happen when cooking constantly, and it is subjective taste. Very easy to resolve. Service was quick. Most of the staff was friendly and polite. Very positive experience.

name: Nue
text_review: We came here to celebrate my birthday some month ago and we were not disappointed. Delicious and fresh tapas as it can get. Delicious that is all. It gets busy pretty quickly at dinner time but overall the crowd is well managed for a comfortable seafood fest with your companionsFour stars just because I found it a bit overpriced.

name: Nue
text_review: Very thing taste good. The fry chicken wings is definitely not chengdu but they are good.

name: Nue
text_review: The food here is amazing. I've never been so surprised by each dish being so entirely distinct from each other.

name: Nue
text_review: Always a pleasure dining here. There is always a wait for breakfast and brunch, but well worth it! Friendly service and great prices. A must for us whenever we are in the city. Their Chengdu fried chicken and Jamaican Jerk are out of this-world delicious!

name: Nue
text_review: This place is great to go with a few people as you can share everything and portions are big.It was just two of us and we ordered 3 dishes but there were so many more items on the menu and being served that looked amazing. Highly recommend the chicken wings and South African Bunny Chow!Went back again last week.Tried their ribs which were fantastic along with the usual suspects but finished the meal with their coconut cake which was marvelous. Love this place !

name: Nue
text_review: A beautiful place with elegant decorations!My friend and I came here for dinner. It's our first time here, and we're confused about what to order. There's a lot to choose from on the menu! The area was clean and packed with people around 7 pm, and we waited for a while to be seated.Their menu consists of food from other countries. The ambiance was unique, and the wall decorations were beautiful and trendy! It catches your attention, and they also have good drinks selections!We will be back soon! Thank you!

name: Nue
text_review: Our order arrived 5 minutes before quoted time in less than an hour of order placed. So convenient and will definitely use again. Good job. Will be calling again real soon. However consider creating a website or an app that will make contacting you guys much more convenient as compared to calling in order to place an order. An app will go in getting more customers for the premises since the app will be available on several platforms and hence easy for the people to download it. Similarly a website will help to advertise the business as well as the services that are offered as well as any other information that might be considered relevant to the customer.

name: Nue
text_review: Nice interesting, spicy food. It would be great if the menu changed more often, but most things we've had here have been great.

name: Nue
