text_review: Special air with dishes that go from bands the world over. It's a decent spot to sit outside on a pleasant day or inside on a stormy one, attempting one of the yummy mixed drinks from the menu. The proposal is the Sunny Bunny for early lunch or the Bunny Chow for supper.

name: Nue
text_review: This place was so fetch. Really great spot for getting a quick bite before heading to bars and I'm kicking myself for not having enough time to get a full meal. We got their more tapas style foods and you absolutely have to order the brussel sprouts. They were amazing and fully loaded. Great food

name: Nue
text_review: Many choice of food with great decor Friendly staff and good drink selection. The pric is not expensive.

name: Nue
text_review: Should be 4.5. Great atmosphere, service, and creative food.

name: Nue
text_review: everything was cooked brilliantly.

name: Nue
text_review: The food was excellent and they have lots of options. Excellent place and they have great setting. One of the popular place in the city. Great vibe inside and outside. The staff were very helpful and provided great service. They were attentive to our orders and request.The menu was beyond great.The appetizer was so good and delicious. I like the Balinese Barbecued Spare Ribs, Chengdu wings, and Shaskshuka. It was all well-cooked and decent flavor. The drinks were so good and fresh too. Nice customer service.

name: Nue
text_review: Food is delicious and service is amazing! Love that they keep changing out some items on the menu!

name: Nue
text_review: Our initial experience at NUE was fantastic. The diverse menu offered a culinary journey through various flavors. I couldn't help but smile when I spotted Tocilog on their menu, and naturally, I had to order it.The Filipino Tocilog was accompanied by a delightful dipping sauce. The tocino slices were tender, and the egg was perfectly fried to a crisp. The Israeli Shakshuka was expertly cooked and seasoned. Lastly, the Tower of Chengdu Wings provided a satisfying crunch and a hint of spice. The distinct flavors of fish sauce, lime, and peppercorn were unmistakable. The presentation was impressive. All of this was complemented by a glass of "Less Mosa."The ambiance of the place is cozy and eclectic, and the service was outstanding. Without a doubt, NUE is a restaurant I'd consider for brunch or dinner when in Capitol Hill.

name: Nue
text_review: I was looking for a bite to eat when I landed in Seattle and boy did I find one! Von's 1000 Spirits is an American restaurant with an all scratch kitchen specializing in Seattle Sourdough & the largest collection of fine spirits in the cityWe each ordered a burger and were highly impressed. The bun was soft and fluffy, patties homemade, and reminded me of mom & pop shop burgers I would eat as a kid in Pasadena (Lucky Burgers, anyone?) The waiters were all extremely nice and the place was packed! However the vibe still felt intimate. Here are the two types of sandwiches we orderedDouble Smashed American Burger - two prime beef patties, American cheese, caramelized onions, packed dills, lettuce, and some magical sauce

name: Nue
text_review: The food was great! Service was amazing as well. The ambience is vibey and they give your check to you in a book which I think is a nice touch!

name: Nue
text_review: This is one of my favourite brunch places in Seattle. The food really tasty and innovative. My favourite is their South African Sunny bunny. Do try their tower of wings as well. The staff were really friendly and I highly recommend this place.

name: Nue
text_review: Great flavors and unique dishes! Cannot wait to taste all the robust flavors still to come.

name: Nue
text_review: I've been to this place at least 15 times in the last year and I would eat there every day if I could. It's my go to answer whenever anyone asks me where I want to eat. It's also a great date spot. ;)The flavors here are incredible. I can't get enough of the hummus, kale & carrot salad, fresh potato frites, and roti. I generally don't like brussels sprouts but they're my favorite item on Nue's menu. I usually ask them to bring out the pineapple cornbread near the end since it's best when warm, and all their desserts are delicious too.

name: Nue
text_review: This restaurant lives up to the eclectic vibe. It's unique in every aspect. Their take on fried chicken is like none you've ever had. The barbecue ribs are a must, slow-cooked to perfection. The meat fell off the bone with every bite. All in all, it was a solid experience.

name: Nue
text_review: I tried this restaurant for the first time last night and it was simply amazing! Great food, great service, and a menu full of savory delight. If you like spicy food, Indian food, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mediterranean - this place has a variety of world flavors. Highly recommended!

name: Nue
text_review: Very delicious !! I think I would Definitely recommend this to anyone who is out and about visiting the city.

name: Nue
text_review: I tried this restaurant for the first time last night and it was simply amazing! Great food, great service, and a menu full of savory delight. If you like spicy food, Indian food, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mediterranean - this place has a variety of world flavors. Highly recommended.

name: Nue
text_review: Delicious. The decor is pretty cool and the servers are really friendly. They had a great selection of drinks and we all had an overall good experience!

name: Nue
text_review: I tried this restaurant for the first time last night and it was simply amazing! Great food, great service, and a menu full of savory delight. If you like spicy food, Indian food, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mediterranean - this place has a variety of world flavors. Highly recommended!

name: Nue
text_review: Very yummy fries, I was very impressed!

name: Nue
text_review: Amazing brunch spot!!! Highly recommended!! Perfect blend between authentic and comfort food!!

name: Nue
text_review: This was a new experience for me, and I'm pleased I tried it! a nice serving size with a lot of flavor However, I would definitely have a side of rice with the wings. I'd go back!

name: Nue
text_review: Food was really good! Seating not great but food was worth it.

name: Nue
text_review: The restaurant has the finest cuisine. Beautiful plating and excellent taste are two components for a memorable dish and it delivers both. The service was perfectly synchronized with the staff on point for every little dining detail and the food was impeccable. I highly recommend this place.

name: Nue
text_review: I had a great dinner here, food was excellent, and the service was awesome.

name: Nue
text_review: I 'm going to this place to have the best meal. Yeah, I liked the service. This is really informative and enjoyable. Definitely back. I don't have any complaints. That's pretty cool,

name: Nue
text_review: The decor and the food in this place are to die for!

name: Nue
text_review: Thumbs up to this restaurant!! The place is very relaxing and very instagramable, this is where you can satisfy your cravings because the food here really tastes good, and the crew workers they are really approachable. This restaurant is a fun place when you have a date or a meeting or you can also bring your whole family, you and your love ones may feel the satisfying taste of each meal that this restaurant serves, in this restaurant you may feel like there's no place that could ever satisfy you only this restaurant, try to taste and feel home, better late than never.

name: Nue
text_review: This is a wonderful place full of atmosphere and wonderful food. great place to go with family and friends with lots of different options and easy to share.

name: Nue
text_review: I had a blast at Nue! Their food brought my travel memories back while eating there. A must try place if you are in Seattle.

name: Nue
text_review: Awesome food in an environment that transports you to another continent. Delicious and creative without being weird or over self indulgent.

name: Nue
text_review: Inventive food. Warm, community-creating environment. Honest, work-their-a**es-off owners and staff. One of my favorite Nue memories has been joining their One-World dinner featuring Syria. Not only were we exposed to delicious food (which, of course, we'd never tried before), but we dined with several Syrians, many of whom were recent refugees. It felt more like someone's home than a restaurant. Thanks, Nue, for enabling me to break (damn good) bread with people I never would have otherwise had the chance to meet.

name: Nue
text_review: Nue is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle. It's vibey, and the food is delicious, unique, and colorful. The cocktail menu is fun too. Also, don't forget to try the Thai water beetles!

name: Nue
text_review: I love Nue and I really mean it. The food is amazing and of awesome quality but, most importantly, it's such a cozy place! On the other note, we had a first date with my future husband there so it will always have a special place in my heart

name: Nue
text_review: Nue is a unique restaurant in Seattle, and it's worth a trip to Capitol Hill from the 'burbs if you haven't already tried it. It's a small, locally-owned business and the owners travel the world to find new and delicious international street food dishes for their menu, so there's often something new to discover. I'm not an adventurous eater but my husband is, and there's always something there for both of us.The dining room is an intimate setting with decor sourced from all over. Great date-night place in a classy, relaxed setting with international flair. It's also been fun to see it featured on several food TV shows!

name: Nue
text_review: This place has such a great variety of food from all cultures! I recommend doing family style so that you can try a bunch of different things because everything is delicious! Don't forget to get the tower of wings!!!

name: Nue
text_review: One of the few restaurants where you will not be disappointed when you are adventurous

name: Nue
text_review: Even though one of the things I tasted was a giant bug, this is one of the best places to eat in Seattle! It's like taking a round-the-world tour with someone who's crazy about food. The laphet toke and the Chengdu wings remain favorites of ours. The UN skewers were awesome, especially accompanied by the pineapple cornbread. Their house made ice creams are mind blowing too. The water bugs...well, there was a crazy story that goes along with them, that we were lucky enough to hear firsthand from Chris.

name: Nue
text_review: I've dined now at Nue twice, and was floored by everything I tried. Having been to many of the countries represented on the menu, I was ready to be disappointed but was impressed by the combination of authenticity and creative spin placed on the food. While I agree it helps to be adventurous (part of the fun eating here), the food is surprisingly accessible. Somewhat randomly, I ended up on a rafting trip on a 4 day rafting trip with Chris Cvetkovich, who owns Nue along with his wife Uyen. We somehow conned Chris to cook for us the entire trip - it was incredible to see him come up with exquisite meals riverside, often improvising with random ingredients from various coolers. More impressive was hearing Chris talk passionately about the people, places, and food he has encountered across the world. Inspiring. I'll be heading back to Nue for the food, but will enjoy it in a new light after spending time with Chris

name: Nue
text_review: I don't eat a lot of meat but when I have a fried chicken craving this is the spot for the best wings I have ever had. The presentation on the wings is awe-striking as you are served a massive tower of perfectly golden brown wings. The wings have the perfect amount of flavor and a mouth watering crunch when you bite into them. If you're looking for a lighter accompaniment to your wings, the Brussel sprouts with coconut are delightful. The negative to the restaurant is it is smaller so it can feel cramped. I wish the tables were a little more spread out and there was better sound dampening. That said it's in Seattle, and I'm sure they've done they best they can in order to make a profit. I highly recommend this place as the top spot for wings in the state. Not only that but they also have a really unique menu with other delicious items.

name: Nue
text_review: Went for brunch and was blown away. Was absolutely delicious. Will come back again and again.

name: Nue
text_review: Visiting from the Bay Area, I have to say this was the most tasty meal I've had in a long time. The whole vibe is just incredible. It's community seating and that was very different for us but we enjoyed it so much. Thanks for a bomb meal !

name: Nue
text_review: I was skeptical because I thought the menu looked like a mess. Nothing seemed connected to me, everything felt like it had a million ingredients. But the food was absolutely delicious. We had the mofongo, Brussels sprouts, and the Syrian kale salad, and pineapple cornbread, and all four were phenomenal. The seating is mostly communal and it's tiny and loud so don't expect ambiance. Other than that, it's fab!

name: Nue
text_review: Love this place, go hungry be sure to get the chicken wings!

name: Nue
text_review: Excellent, unique foods. A sampler of the best food around the world. It is highly unlikely that you have eaten anything that is on the menu. Come willing to try new things. We suggest ordering multiple items and sharing them family style.

name: Nue
text_review: My wife and I came to Nue for dinner on Monday night and had our minds blown. The food was so good! We were dying at each bite, gobbling things up, and so happily full afterwards. Our waiter was so attentive and kind! He kept our water refilled, gave excellent suggestions, and had this kind, friendly air that made it seem like he genuinely cared about our experience. It is so hard to find that kind of warmth in restaurants these days and we were super impressed. I cannot wait for the next time I go to Nue, so that I can try their lunch menu.I give Nue 5 stars because everything was great. When you walk in you get that small business family owned feeling and you just know they do their best to give you a great time.

name: Nue
text_review: I was looking for a good breakfast place near my home. Found this on Yelp and it became our official breakfast diner! Went three morning in a row and enjoyed each on of them. The servings are large, the price reasonable and the service efficient. This is not gourmet fare but filling and quick. Line ups each morning but never waited more than 10 minutes. The servers were pleasant and responsive to requests and often constantly moving. Everything we ate was good!

name: Nue
text_review: So good! The goat curry was so good. Must order McNguyen drink so so yummy! Will be back!

name: Nue
text_review: I gave new five stars because their service and their staff were excellent. They are gracious and professional. I have the Cuban sandwich which was outstanding. The Mofongo was underwhelming. The communal dining was unexpected but kitschy. I plan to go back.

name: Nue
text_review: The goat curry is great! The Dutch pancakes are great! So many unique dishes!

name: Nue
text_review: Really like the concept this place has going. Not an extensive menu, but a very diverse one that emulates international street food. I really enjoyed the Bunny Chow and Jamaican Jerk Chicken, along with the pineapple cornbread. Relatively young crowd gives the place a lively vibe that reflects many Capitol Hill restaurants.

name: Nue
text_review: Super super good. The pay for parking is totally worth this small menu. The people are A+ nice and friendly

name: Nue
text_review: The jerk chicken is to die for. We also split the bunny chow and octopus skewers--both were full of flavors. We went on a Tues night and was able to get seated right away.

name: Nue
text_review: Fresh, inventive dishes. The wings are top notch.

name: Nue
text_review: I'm not exactly what you'd call a "Professional Yelper" (this is my first review) but this was seriously the BEST meal I've had in years!I started with the Syrian Kale Salad and Tostilocos. The salad was dressed perfectly and the crunch of the toasted almonds and sweetness of the 'shattered dates' (I still need to figure out how they cut them so damn small) were the perfect textural and flavor counterbalance to the dressing.The Tostilocos were really cool and from what I was told, a pretty common Street Food in Mexico. They consisted of a bag of Mexican, Salsa Verde Tostitos, slit open and stuffed with all kinds of flavors and textures that just worked. Hot sauce, crunchy jicama and cucumber, Tamarind candy, nuts, pickled pork skins, etc. Super fun.I then, based on everyone's suggestions on Yelp, had the goat curry. This dish was over the top, or is it 'off the hook'? I can never keep up with these things. Anyway, super complex dish, just the perfect amount of spicy heat and the sweetness of the coconut cornbread on the side was the bomb (or is it the 'shit'?) I had the McNguyen cocktail which was Vietnamese coffee and Irish Jameson Whiskey shaken over ice. This was one of those drinks that could get a pass just for the clever name but OMG the flavor combo was amazeballs. I'd never tried Vietnamese coffee before, and now need to without whiskey, just to taste the pure flavor of it. After that I need to move back to the one with Jameson though because the combo was fantastic.......and I love whiskeyI was totally full by now but wanted to try their liquid nitrogen ice cream I'd heard about and ordered the French Toast and Bacon Flavor. Without going into too much detail let's just say I'm stopping by after work tomorrow just for another scoop.The service was fantastic and the decor super unique and kitschy but didn't feel contrived. I've been to a lot of bars and restaurants that just hang a couple of taxidermy pieces on the wall wearing hats and call it cool but this place definitely has its own character but still feels real (esp for Capitol Hill)I got a chance to chat a lot with one of the owners (he was my waiter) who mentioned that a lot of stuff on the menu changes all the time. Can't wait to come back and see what's new!!

name: Nue
text_review: The rating says as good as it gets and indeed our dining experience at Nue was just that. There were four of us that shared this wonderful food, starting off with unusual and very refreshing non-alcoholic drinks. Than we got down to the real event - beautiful food tastes from around the worlds starting off with what became one of my favorites, a yellow pea salad (Theng Manga Pattani Sundal) -nutty crunchy yellow peas served on grilled romaine and finished with lemon oil. Yum! We then slowly shared and array of dishes from the Grilled Barbados Pig tails that had crispy skin and tender juicy meat with a yummy dipping sauce, Jamacian Jerk Chicken that was tender, juicy and just exploding with flavor to the very satisfying sandwich-The Maracas Shark and Bake.  We ate slow and enjoyed each bite as it arrived one at a time. Great service and good tastes. that's as good as it gets.

name: Nue
text_review: Service was fantastic, atmosphere was good .Friendly and attentive staff and excellent food selections. It was a little spicy but all the flavors worked well together.I would tell everyone to come eat here. I loved everything about this place. If you're ready for something new come to NUE!!!

name: Nue
text_review: Eclectic and delicious collection of food and drinks.

name: Nue
text_review: Fantastic food and really friendly staff. Heard about this place from a friend so I came here with my colleague during our trip to Seattle. I like the small plates -- gave me a chance to sample many flavors & dishes -- sort of like an international version of tapas! The dirty diplomat cocktail was also really awesome.

name: Nue
text_review: What an amazing and unique menu. Been twice already and working my way through everything on the menu.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Take one look at this places Facebook page and the unhinged owner and it will tell you everything you need to know to go anywhere else.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food is okay, the service fair to good, but the management is racist and unhinged.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Has rats and health code violations. Owner is a narc who incites violence on his Facebook business page.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Worst restaurant experience ever. Owner goes to social media to insult, berate and harass customers. They can't take ANY criticism whatsoever and treats customers and employees like dogshit. Wouldn't eat here if you paid me.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food poisoning. Nuff said

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: My mother (who is an older woman and no longer has a job) ordered a gift card from here for me and my wife's anniversary. I called to ask them to refund it because it was more money than she should be spending.When I spoke with Lauren to have the gift card refunded back to my mother, she seemed more concerned with keeping her money because they refused to refund it.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Upscale restaurant, decent food and prices but like many other restaurants in Seattle the environment is anti Black!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Didn't enjoy the over priced food with a little less than okay hospitality. I wouldn't recommend it around the area there are some cheaper restaurants with much better food and portions.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The service took forever, they forgot items, and it took an hour to get a check

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food was fine, however I refuse to support a business that has an douche as an owner and doesn't take the safety of others seriously.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Used to love the restaurant, now I am fully aware that the guy that owns it is a complete douche. I will NEVER eat at any of his restaurants and neither will my clients or groups I bring to Seattle. He is exactly what this world doesn't need....close the place down...move to another city, you do not belong here!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: No call back , 2 years later. Apparantley, they do not black people,

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: HORRIFIC OWNERSHIP AND STAFF!! Do NOT go here. Just look at their food review outside the door. It's a BIG sad face :( because they have rats and cockroaches. Everyone who's local knows not to ever come here to Pesos next door.. awful places. The staff is what makes it the worst of all. Me and my friends refuse to enter either of these establishments.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Bad service and food. Took us fifteen minutes to get the attention of waiter to get a menu. The food was terrible.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Came here last Monday night (3/5) and definitely got food poisoning from the Pan Seared Petit Half Chicken. Never coming back.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I will never eat here. There are nasty roaches roaming around in the kitchen where they cook and prepare the food. They also allow underage drinking at their lounge. Also, the owner of the restaurant is known to have sex with Seattle strippers on the dining table where customers eat.Bon appetit!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: My family and I used to go there A LOT and we've spend A LOT of money on that place, until we had JENNIFER as a waitress and she was a total BITCH, REALLY RUDE, TALKED the customer back with an attitude and OVER CHARGES for extra drinks that we didn't order, REALLY UNPROFESSIONAL...WORSE COSTUMER SERVICE EVER. I spoke to the manager on duty and he was a completely an asshole. He didn't apologize for the worse customer service or not even offered anything, which I wasn't expecting anything back except their waitresses to be more professional and friendly. But it seems that all the waitresses there have an attitude, well how can they not if it comes from management in that place. I will NEVER go back and I will NOT recommend this place to anyone.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: One of the best ambiances of any restaurant I've ever seen - destroyed by TV programming. Barf!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Came in for the late night happy hour. Sexy atmosphere; candles everywhere. Good looking staff to compliment the interior design, but are they super unprofessional!! They were all ripping shots at the bar, including the manager! My waitress was beyond inebriated and slammed everything down that she gave us. Food was honestly good, except the mussels were past their prime. Crumbled inside of my mouth, so I had to spit it out. I expressed my opinion to the drunken waitress as she responded "eew, gross" and ran away. Manager came over to smooth things over, but he just made excuses instead of apologizing- probably thinking about his next shot choice. To make matters worse the FOH employees:A) all were talking about us- they're drunk so they can't control the volume of their voices, again the manager is ring leader in this conversation- so inappropriate and unprofessional. B) sent us out another mussel dish, but I was scarred from the first one so I turned it away.I guess I insulted the line cook? Table was in prime view of the kitchen so I could see him looking at the plate, running his mouth and then he gives me a nasty look. Word of advice to him: don't serve anything you wouldn't eat yourself and don't be in denial of when you send out shitty plates. Beautiful place, some dishes great and some sub par, but they need to pay attention to their daily operations, look at the management more and get a new service team before this place goes downhill! Sorry, just saying! I manage in casual fine dining and this behavior/treatment towards guests, I simply would not stand for.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Not

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Not even close to French food. Don't even bother with this one.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Didn't like the taste of the items ordered... Will never try this place again

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Waitress was unprofessional. She was eating and drinking on the job. Wtf and where the hella is her boss?? I would of fired her on the spot. What is this place turning into. Trashie is all I can say. Trash!!! Won't come back or recommend. Trash

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Worst restaurant I've ever been to. I normally enjoy myself here a lot, drinking with friends, but the service and food arrival sucks. We all ordered at the exact same time and two of our plates came out first. I didn't want to eat because I felt so awkward. Then the rest of the food came out later after leaving my food in the middle of the table because I felt so awkward. I then asked how long it would take for a bowl of soup to come out so I could eat with them. He said it was only a couple minutes... 20 minutes later I was sitting with no food and the rest of my friends were done eating. I cancelled my soup because if I wanted to eat alone awkwardly I would have done it with the first dish that arrived way too early.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Actually, the response to Jeffrey G's review is enough to cause me to give a place like this wide berth. He drove home Mr. G's point about the pretentiousness and pomposity. I, too, notice everyone is a hipster in black---not my kind of crowd, and I enjoy good food, but ambiance is just as important. This, "I'm from Everett and therefore cannot be pretentious" is as laughable as the fact that he bothered to respond to the review in the first place! I'll save my bucks for a place that doesn't look down on the more colourful among us, thanks.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Eek is right !!! I really can't figure out why this place is so busy or has good reviews. We have been here three times and boy it just does not get any better. The staff seem to be able to drink on the job and our server had way to much , She was wasted. The Food NASTY really why do people like it ?? Are they so wasted or hung over that anything will do ? Come on Queen Anne you deserve way better than this joint. Fried food out of bags ??? This place is just plain old GROSS !!!! You can get way better food at Trader Joe's for less than half of what you spend here, And you don't have to smell the nasty breath of a drunk ass server..

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Not worth it. Poor service.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: It should be better based on the reviews. My experience though is so below average, it cannot be explained.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Very small portions and waitresses are not very attentive.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I miss my hometown Creole. Miss my grandmas creole. What this place tho? This is not creole. What is this fusion stuff? I aint feelin it. There be some mad ladies here on the weekend tho. The music be lowkey poppin too. But I still aint gettin full off the food. Moral of the story. Get your hunger fixed elsewhere. Get your thirst fixed here.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Mediocre food. Wasnt impressed with staff - they seemed to be too busy for me.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: It ain't Toulousaine. May not be French.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This place is dirty and overrated. Why does everyone love this place so much. Pretty disappointing.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: If you're vegetarian (or even pescetarian), there are very few options here.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: We live in the Queen Anne neighborhood, so we keep going back to this place, hoping against hope that it will get better. But is doesn't!Something always goes wrong. Two weeks ago it was a breakfast that came so late that we had to inhale it to get to work on time. And the music was full of tunes that only could be handled with a scotch on the rocks. At 8 in the morning? NOT!Tonight it was two steaks, one so tough that it ruined what was a good flavor. But my wife's medium well steak came with the cow still mooing, and by the time they delivered the overly well done substitute back after we complained, appetite be gone. Evening ruined while she watched the rest of us eat our entries. This place is fine if you're looking for some good looking babes and don't mind the poor service and hit-and-miss food so you can enjoy the eye candy. But the price isn't cheap. So go there for drinks, check out the latest tatoos on the butt of some hard-belly, then get the hell out of there for a burger at Dicks, just a block away. At least you'll get what you expect.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: the grits were not grits!!!! very disappointed! weirdest grits ever!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food is delicious! compliments to the chef. the service however is AWFUL. the servers act like they're doing you a favor when taking your order. A tip is for good service, not it is expected and definitely NOT earned by this team.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great food! ... but the service has really dropped off a cliff. Staff can be rude and dismssive.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Came here with my daughter and she's a very picky eater but there were plenty of choices for the both of us. We got two different dishes and they were both pretty good. Only thing that could've been better was mine was lukewarm instead of hot. She actually ended up eating most of mine. All in all, we had a great experience, looking forward to coming back soon.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: this place is always consistent love the menulove the staffgreat part of town

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Would say that this place was only alright. I came here for brunch and had beignets and eggs benedicts, and have to admit I was expecting more considering how long the wait was and the price. Nothing particularly special, and can't really say I'll be back.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Le petit tolouse. thats all my french allows. but seriously good food here if you havnt checked it out. I would recommend.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: It's a nice cozy place to go. The food quality (had salmon and halibut) and taste does not live up to the other finer points of this establishment. Service was good but felt a little rushed.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: My chicken sandwich the chicken was not marinated at all this place I heard is # 10 in the world or something when I walked by to go have lunch they did not even have a sign with their name on it so I was like walking around for a minute or 2 but I figured it out the number one place in America everyone should know it no sign needed Lol :) .... if I come back to Seattle I will give them another try they might have some other dishes that are good you know what I mean

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great Happy Hour. Slammed at night.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: food was great. the service was fine and the soup was great. Food is a little pricey but the atmostpher was fun. It took a while for us to get our water and our drink wasn't very strong. Their benights were good though. It wasn't like cafe du monde but the chocolate dip was awesome.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food was totally mediocre but the service was amazing!!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: it was really nice atmosphere, but we found somebody's stuff under the table and had a wrong bill twice. the prices are a little bit high

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I like all their foods but the place was too noisy. Can't even hear each other talk in there.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: My boyfriend has wanted to try this place for some time. We went in on a Wednesday after work and.Great food and decor (love the mosaic floor). We were seated and it took a little while for our server to get to us. She seemed a little stressed as she took our drink orders, I tried the Madame Toulouse cocktail (excellent) and Joe had a Guinness. For dinner he ordered the Gulf prawns in red basil and was not disappointed. I had the Dungeness Crab with fried green tomatoes. All in all a very good experience and I will try it again. Our server was not having a good night which, of course, can happen to anyone, but she was slow and forget to ask for our second round of drinks. Also, no smile all night. On another night the food and decor would probably have been enough to rate it a four or five, but service led me to rate it 3 stars.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: the only good thing for me was dessert. lots of people, though

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Came here for a quick drink and an appetizer with a friend. I got a glass of their sangria and it was very solid. Not the best sangria I have ever had, but it was what I was in the mood for. My friend also ordered an appetizer and I had a bite of it. I cannot remember for the life of me what the dish was, but it was fried, a little spicy and again, pretty solid.Definitely wouldn't be a go-to if I lived in Seattle, but it was a fun experience for a late-night adventure.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Didn't have anything against this place, it was good, but I haven't been back, so that says something.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food here is always impressive. The staff can be a bit sub par. Long waits on drinks and if you need something once your food is dropped off it is hard to flag someone down.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Lamb burger is awesome. Lunch hour is very busy, the place is usually fully packed. The drinks are the same as everywhere else in town, not bad. The food and servers are good. Sometimes the wait for your food is slow especially around lunch.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: We came in on a pretty busy day and waited about 20 minutes before being seated. The waiting area is very small and most people (including ourselves) had to stand for the duration of our wait. The restaurant has a New Orleans Mardi Gras decor. We ordered scallops and a shrimp dish. Both were just OK. Our waitress wasn't very attentive, but the atmosphere was fun if you like places that are a bit noisy.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Beignet's and a Creole Bloody Mary for breakfast. Cannot go wrong with anything on their menu. Service is not so good almost all the time. The last time I went with my sister and we sat for 15 minutes before we even got water. It was kind of a bummer. But then the food came and I was reminded why I keep going.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: review is for last call only. not for the food.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The place is alright. It was very hard to find, didn't even have the name on the building, we drove around the block a few times until we saw the address. The waiting area has a horrible setup and if it's busy people will crowd in front of the host booth. I was skipped twice while trying to get a table.The waiters were all very friendly. I went for breakfast on a Sunday and I think the food is over priced and with a small portion size, tastes good though.The inside is pretty tacky. It looks like they have sheets stapled to the ceiling to hide the insulation. The ceiling lights look like they were held up by those plant hooks that screw into the ceiling, then plugged into a regular outlet just exposed on the ceiling.I honestly don't know how this place ended up on the Food Network. I'd rather go to ihop for breakfast

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This restaurant definitely has an enormous menu, so if you are someone who appreciates having many options then this is your place. However, the food isn't really fitting to my palate. Nonetheless, the atmosphere and drinks are great. If you're looking for a good place to start your night Toulouse is a good option

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Overrated and lacks subtlety of flavor, not to mention overpriced.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food is good, a bit high priced but if you eat during happy hour it's a better deal. I discovered a caprese sandwich during happy hour one night and returned specifically for that a month or so later and they refused to serve it since it wasn't happy hour, no matter what the price. That irritated me a bit but I got something else and it was pretty good. (Not as good as the sandwich, but still tasty enough)

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Beautiful place - terrible service - pretty good food - terrible service - awesome drink menu - oh, but terrible service. I say try it out, because the ambiance is amazing, and the food and drinks are pretty good - hopefully you will have better service (and much faster) service than us.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food was excellent, ambiance was simple and beautiful. The service was excellent.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Been several times for dinner. Always a great experience with delicious food and cocktails.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I am not kidding when EVERY single one of the 6 of us agreed that this was the BEST food we have ever had, and would travel to Seattle again just to eat here.Every part of every dish was delicious, the service was wonderful, and atmosphere was great!!We all got something different for lunch and for dessert, and everything was just to die for.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Omg food here is amazing! I tried the gnocchi pasta w/ mushrooms and prosciutto and it was to die for..Beware of a huge menu! The choice is impressive for fish eaters! Very nice, great service.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The Cajun foods are not very good as I thought. But still tasty though. Hahahahahahahah

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Toulouse Petit is a Louisiana restaurant that offers a unique brunch experience with delicious southern flavors incorporated into its food. The food is consistently tasty, and you can tell that a lot of care and attention is put into the preparation of each dish. The menu is varied, and there are plenty of options to choose from, including some creative twists on classic brunch items.However, one downside is that the coffee leaves much to be desired. If you're a coffee lover, you might be disappointed with the quality of the coffee here. Nevertheless, the quality of the food more than makes up for this minor drawback.Overall, if you're looking for a unique brunch experience that incorporates delicious southern flavors, Toulouse Petit is an excellent choice. The only downside is the wait time, but that's just a testament to how popular and beloved this spot is.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This place is recommended if you are going on a date. Most candles I saw at one place were here and that's the unique artifact about this place. The food was great, although they don't serve anything unique on the menu. I just love the decor of this place.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Had a lunch at Toulouse Petit. Food quality and taste was kind a all over the place. The Dungeness crab over fried green tomatoes was very good and I'd highly recommend it. Fried half chicken over gravy was also seasoned well and very tasty. The seafood gumbo tasted a little under seasoned, peppery enough, but lacking something. The kurobota pork/gnocchi was the saltiest food I've ever had at a restaurant. It paired well with the gumbo though. The beignets also may not be what people expect. Ours tasted slightly overcooked on the outside but extremely doughy and pasty on the inside. I've heard that's the New Orleans style though. I'd normally give it a lower rating, but it had a very nice vibe and solid service. Presentation was decent, price wasn't too high, and they seemed to be accommodating of groups without reservations. I'd like to try their brunch next time. Overall, the entire covid situation hasn't been particularly great for any restaurant, so it's good to see them still working.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: First time visiting the place with a group of friends on a Saturday night. The ambiance was great, our server was friendly and wasn't too impressed with the food. Overall, we all had a great experience!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: first off I am two fifths italian so I think I know what I'm talking about when it comes to cajun food. this is basically the uppity city people version of cajun classics. pretty good though delicate and airy sauces and surprising spice level on the andoulie which is there signature dish. Overall good but Caused a bit of a seen. Bastard door boy asked for my vax card so I hollered at him and floored it and bowled through a bunch of tables. Gotta let these vaxMaxxers im not to be messed with.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I've yet to have a bad experience with Toulouse Petit either from dining in or to-go. To drive a specific review though, I took my partner here for birthday brunch. We were told it would be about 45 minutes and it was, in fact, exactly about 45 minutes. The hostess was friendly and set the right expectations, so kudos there. Once seated, our server greeted us and got us on our way. Everything came out quickly and well prepared and was just delicious. Like, seriously good. Everytime. Only negatives are that the parking sucks (that's seattle for you) and that to get to the bathroom, you need to go through the kitchen which honestly weirds me out, but love love love this place.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Kayla was outstanding! First two courses were delicious, dessert was average (wait until you can get to Cafe du Monde for benigets). Meal ended on a low note. LIVING WAGE TAX?!?!?? Really? Why do I have to pay for my meal, a tip, and subsidize the living wage that the owner of this establishment should be paying. Stop trying to drain your customers for every cent they have. They're working off of a living wage also trying to have a nice night out.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: wonderful breakfast here. great ambiance and social distancing. I had two cocktails: the Florentine Brunch Cocktail and the Storm Spritzer and both were fantastic. I also loved the beignets. I had the Toulouse Breakfast Sandwich. The restaurant itself is rather relaxed

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I come here and get something different every time. Sometimes I want to get the same thing but there is just so much to try. Every time I'm surprised at how great the dish was. It has such great depth from the flavors to the ingredients. Each dish is unique in its own way. If you want spontaneity and delicious food, come here!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I really like the pastries here. They have a cute nice sitting area too.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Been coming here for many many years! Birthday events, anniversary dinners, happy hours. The food is still amazing and I love the atmosphere, but the service was a bit lacking today. The sweet beignets are always a good finish to a great dinner!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great if not amazing food. Really enjoyed the selection of choices. Service was decent not my surly then you would expect from Seattle. Overall a great dining experience.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Eating here is always a wonderful experience! Make sure to make reservations as they are always busy.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good food. good staff. Ok menu. Why do i keep going back?

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Toulouse remains to be one of the best places in the city for happy hour food, variety, and price for their small plates!It's noisy and cramped in the bar, but if you sit at a table it's much more intimate and comfortable--in any case, you're here to enjoy the bustle and people-watching of downtown!We love the fried chicken, grits, spicy prawns, lamb sliders, and the breakfast. Everything I've had at Toulouse is excellent.They're a great spot for brunch, lunch, dinner, or late night. The wait time can be long, but this is a good place for locals and visitors both. If you take out of town guests here, they will be impressed!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food was good, lots of variety to choose fromService and staff are prompt and attentivePrice is reasonableI enjoy the atmosphereGreat place for breakfast and brunch

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I don't get around to posting reviews until weeks later or whenever but i knew everyone needed to hear about this place. Or at least people like to know the place. It is one of my fav places.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Love the beignets here, and most of the breakfast food is quite good, but the dinner menu could offer a little more variety. Still a fan!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I've been there to have some dessert. It was so good. Nice server and nice atmosphere.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I ate here last night (finally!) for the first time. It was delicious and the atmosphere with all the candles made for a great date night. we were seated pretty promptly for how busy it was so that made us happy. Definitely recommend!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I love the food here. The flavors are excellent and I have yet to have something I did not really enjoy. The atmosphere is great as well and the whole experience makes me want to come back again and again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Some of the best breakfast and brunch food around, I have been coming here for years and never had a problem.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: An amazingly large menu and we've loved everything we've tried. The bartenders are top-notch as well. I love to go old-school with some spicy Gumbo, but we also recommend the BBQ prawns with creamy grits, and the crawfish beignet.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food was great. The service was great. What really makes the first two exemplary was the general hospitality this Restaurant offers its guests. If you have never been Go. if you have been go again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I give Toulouse 4 stars for an amazing breakfast fare. Their lunch and dinner menus have not been my favorite. Usually the dishes are too salty. They take pride in having the best happy hour menu, but the dishes are tiny and you get what you pay for.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Everything here is top notch.....Brandon is awesome

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Love their food. This location comprises of open seating which means you are not assigned a designated server who seats you at a table. First come first serve where you hover over patrons, wait for them to leave their seats for any reason and take advantage of the opportunity to steal their seats.Service was great and our meal was served to us on time with no delays. Try to come when it's not busy or overcrowded. Towards the end of meal, other patiently waiting patrons are shameless to ask how much longer you're going to take to finish your meal and if they can come grab your tables soon or after?

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good food - good service. A great spot for brunch or dinner.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great food for breakfast on a Sunday, but very busy and somewhat slow service.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Very good, I love happy hour! The prices are very cheap and affordable.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: whether its french toast or cajun food, it is all amazing. Pacific seafood mixed with Louisiana flavors.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Breakfast is phenomenal and the beignets are an absolute must!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The space is lovely, warm & bustling. The menu is huge (a little overwhelming) & diverse.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great breakfast place. Service was fabulous and the food unique and delicious.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I recently went here, but didn't love the food. It was okay, but not great in my opinion. The southern inspired meals aren't really authentic, but the staff are so great and accommodating that as a whole I give the place 4 stars. It's hard to notice from the street, but once inside it's quite nice décor.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Had a nice dinner here a while ago. Can't remember what we ate, but I just remember it was good food and a good experience. The waitress was attentive, and the host accommodated us with last-minute walk-in and no reservation. Only had to wait 10 min or so and it was dinner time on a Sat night with a full restaurant. Much appreciated!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Wonderful food and wonderful service. We had an amazing night!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Wrong check, 2 times. Loudly but nice interior.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: From step one, you will appreciate all the idea that was set into the creation of the eatery. The window panes, feel from the 5,000 pounds of plaster on the wall, mosaic tiles and the blownglass fixtures are amazing. The service was hands down fantastic. Fortunate for me, my buddy who joined me works next door , therefore I sort of felt like portion of an entourage, but regardless the food was yummy, particularly for them only lately opening. I had the halibut, cooked perfectly and my buddy had the pork plate

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Really good happy hour pricing.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Been here for brunch and dinner a few times; extensive brunch and dinner menu. Good food!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Feels like it's been an elegant area destination for years... great attention to detail - mosaic tiles, exquisite blown glass and steel art. And it is comfy, with candles over all of the walls that warm up the space. Excellent food, excellent drinks, extremely fine for a date. And they serve Bakon Vodka! Bartender Jason Crume created a delightful holiday eggnog choice when we were there called the "Bakon flip" - A whole egg, 1.5oz Bakon vodka, 1ounce Irish cream, .5ounce maple syrup. Serve in flip glass (or wine glass), grate Fresh nutmeg on top.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Very interesting creations at this fun, exciting, great-spot-for-a-date-night. Their happy hour is A+ too.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: i came with my wife in this restaurent for diner, i enjoy my night and the food was good but the serveur was agressif

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The toulouse petit is very great Restaurant with strong customer service and outstanding staff. the food was amazing from appetizers to desert. very peaceful atmosphere

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing breakfast happy hour! LOVE this place. Parking can be tricky, though.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Used to be my favorite happy hour, but ever since they raised their prices I have not been able to go as often. Best creole french food in Seattle. Service is okay, LOVE LOVE their breakfast happy hour (crab meat benedict is the best thing). If you get a chance, try the new orleans prawns (dinner version). meaty prawns, creamy butter/cheddar grits, heaven.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great place for brunch!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food is great. Ton of food options. Get in for brunch...

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Two of us were here for a Sunday late morning, no reservations, place was packed with people standing outside. They said a 20-minute wait and got us in even sooner. The food was delicious--beignets were the star of the show. French press coffee was OK. Service was attentive and friendly. Atmosphere is great, gorgeous wood inlay tables, colorful glass tiles, creative lighting, loved it. One star off because it was super noisy--lots of hard surfaces that bounced sound around plus they play music. But we will totally be back again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: It was amazing brunch. I got a good time with my wife

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: A true highlight while visiting Seattle. Quaint with a divine, delectable, delicious cuisine! Much love from Birmingham, Al.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good food; crowded though :(

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing food! Of course I had to get the fried chicken and it was so juicy. The cocktails are on point too. I had a bourbon and honey cocktail which asked the server to keep them coming... Love the low lighting and all the candles. Host was super nice and sat us in a really nice booth for hour date night. Coming back for sure. If you are looking for something away from down town and yummy this is it! A real Seattle experience.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Excellent selection of Cajun cuisine that makes me want to return very soon. The menu offers a great selection of appetizers and main courses --- almost too many. The specialty cocktails are fun and offer great variety. The only downside is the parking which is a problem near Queen Anne. I cannot wait to return so I can sample more of the menu offerings.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This place is on a level with the Carnelian Room in San Francisco with regards to the food. Outstanding. The "Cajun Meatloaf" featured a powerful floral aroma of black pepper without the expected kick in the teeth from overseasoning. The butterscotch and banana pie was to die for, and yet barely sweet enough to qualify as desert. Food is served very late, so if you find yourself hungry in Seattle late at night you would do well to check this spot out.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Recently took my friend for her birthday. I expected excellent...and got it. Service, food, atmosphere. All great. So rare to find cajun anything in Seattle. And, the prices weren't crazy. A little noisy with the bar in the same space but it was a weekend night. I can't fault them for that. Worthwhile visit.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The restaurant is beautiful! The lighting us dim at night, but creates ambiance.The food is the real star here! On our first visit my girlfriends and I were there for happy hour. (word to the wise, their happy hour is insanely busy so get there early) I had the crab ravigote over fried green tomatoes and creole shrimp and both were absolutely amazing.I've come back for dinner several times and never been disappointed. They have a great wine list and a very well stocked bar. I brought my boyfriend here once or twice, he's more a casual beer guy so this place isn't really for him. More for me and my girls!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food was very good. Really enjoyed the jumbalaya. Arugula salad didn't impress. Service was good, a little slow... could've been more attentive. Nice place, but the music was a bit loud.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Perfect place to go with a lot of friends, and just order everything on the appetizer menu and share. great cocktails too.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Went two consecutive nights. 2 people, averaged $75/person with tip. Food was amazing!!!! First night, service was fantastic. 2nd night, we cancelled our last drink order (that was almost 10 minutes old), paid our bill and left. If you go, hope you get the good staff, and definitely start with the 'fried chicken gumbo'!!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: There are a few things that keeps me from giving this 5 stars, but over all I'm a fan and I'll continue to eat here just because there are delicious items on this menu. I love the shrimp and grits combo and the jambalaya is really good. A tad salty....but good. I have been here twice so far, once for my anniversary. I did find that the cocktails I ordered were a little bitter and sometimes lacked sweetness that you expect from a cocktail. But the overall flavor was delicious. Just add a little more sweet and it would be perfect. We ordered the Pastini risotto and the corn and sweet onion Macque Choux which was absolutely delish. I would order those again. They were plentiful in size as well. So my husband and I split those while waiting for our entrees. We also ordered the braised and fried bacon which was delicate and cooked perfectly. I just wished there was more. The entrees are a little on the small side and we ordered a half chicken and a ribeye. I had to send the ribeye back because it was way overcooked. But they brought us a new one and didn't charge us for either. Which was awesome. The ribeye they brought us was laid on top of a delicious mash with a blue cheese on the steak. It was so good. My half chicken was also good, but a little lacking in size. Had I only ate the entrees, I would have been left very hungry. I suggest you get sides to go with your meal. It's a little on the expensive side, but it is good. Of course there are some imperfections that could use a little tweaking but overall, I love this place. At the end of our anniversary dinner, the waitress brought us some free beignets in a chicory sauce. The sauce itself was so good and so were the beignets if you've never had one. Granted I've had better at another establishment, but the thought was really nice. They have a huge wine list as well. The atmosphere is lovely and I think you should at least try it once.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: They have amazing beignets and whatever spices they use on their potatoes is delicious!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good place over all. The table bread was a little dry but over all it's was good. Would go back.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This is a restaurant with great atmosphere and decor. This place is unique with the candles lit on the wall and that itself made it a great experience for me. It's priced well and the food is great (not amazing but eating it in this pretty little place made it ten times better!) From out of town and would definitely go back!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I LOVE the happy hour here! Especially the snails. :)

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: 5 stars for ambiance and food but I hade to take off a stars because We got food poisoning from the gumbo. But I like this place so much we STILL come back. Heck it only happened once and who doesn't need a deep internal cleansing every few years?This has got to be my favorite romantic spot to dine in Seattle. All the candles flickering could make anyone appear more attractive!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Yummmmmmmy food and sweet ambiance!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good food. Spicy and open late. Fun spot

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great breakfast in a beautiful restaurant. Can't miss here.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I prefer going here for breakfast. I tried going here for dinner once and wasn't impressed. Try the beignets...yum!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: beignet! in loving memory of lillian

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Went here recently with some friends and am very pleased. They have a drink called the Honeybadger (and it was amazing). Everyones food was amazing and tasty and the prices were slightly high but well worth it. The red velvet cake nearly started Armageddon at our table (HANDS OFF MAH CAKE!)

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: On caveat, you should know that the place is sort of Louisiana style/Cajun food, not Toulouse as in southern France. The place is known for brunch, which is when I went. The place is busy so you may have to wait. The place is crowded a bit noisy. The service is fairly quick, slow enough to talk but not slow. The food is tasty and hot. The other person that I was with had a crab omelet which actually had chunks of crab, not imitation crab or tiny bits. The portion size is average to slightly large.They have no parking so street parking is what you have to find. On Sundays, it's easy. On other days, if you go for brunch, it's probably ok.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Soooooo good. The coffee is so delicious with the Begnets. The decor and atmosphere is vibrant and fun. Generally I like the breakfast better than the dinner, but that's just my pick

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Oh the wonderful goodness of fluffy and light beignets! Ate here for breakfast on a weekday with a friend, so the wait wan't too long ~5 minLove the drinks too! Had the Katie-mae which has st. germain which I absolutely LOOOVE! The french press coffee which was served so beautifully tasted amazing as well- I like it dark and strong!. We had a pork cheek sandwich and mussels. The mussels were great but the sandwich tasted like a salt lick. Not good. If it weren't for that sandwich I would've given 5 stars. The beignets alone are worth coming here for.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: delicious Foie gras!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good food. Good drinks. Good atmosphere.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Be sure to make reservations ahead of time--even on a Saturday morning, this place is packed! With the reservations we made ahead of time though, it was no problem at all to get a table.$6 Happy Hour BREAKFAST was a unique treat. I had an heirloom tomato scramble with spicy red potatoes and a grapefruit mimosa.French food with a spicy Cajun twist!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Surprised to see negative reviews on this place because my experience was pretty good. A noisy restauarant that is a bit slow with service, I thought my food was better than most busy packed popular places. Appreciated the large menu because there were so many things that looked good, although a lot of it is fried so beware. I like french onion soup and theirs is very good. Seafood is good too--try the oysters.I asked for recommendations the first time I came but there were so many things recommended that I had to come back a few times to taste everything. This is one of my favorite spots due to the Happy Hour menu, too.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Awesome happy hour with great prices.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The decor is a little bit weird during the day but the food is really good!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great happy hour and lots of choices. The food was delicious. Not to mention how great of an atmosphere it is.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Beignets!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Happy hour in the morning? You must try it - the breakfast is awesome.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I've been here for breakfast a few times... Everything I've ordered I loved. One was a chickpea English pea something-a-rather that was absolutely amazing. Bloody Marys are decent and you never have to wait too long for a table. The only thing I don't recommend featured on "the best thing I've ever eaten" show... Pork cheek hash or something. It must have been missing because neither myself or my BF thought it was that good but everything else we've tried there has been amazing... Sometimes the service takes a while but it is a very large restaurant.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Arry pretty much said everything there is to say. it's a VERY nice dining room. my companion had the Duck Confit and i had the easy jambalaya. both dishes were extremely flavorful and delicious. my friend said that the restaurant was mentioned as one of the top 10 restaurants in the nation. i didn't understand how that could be determined, but then on the top of their receipt it states "one of the top 10 resturants in the nation as determined by blah-blah and msn.com" (i can't remember the other source). there you go then! try it out.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Went here for happy hour with friends and had a great time! The manager was extremely helpful and went out of his way to help one of my friends. The food was great, but the drinks were better!Highly recommended!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Happy Hour Portions are delicious and cheap. And Small.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: fun dinner with great food and service...we'll be back!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Just went to this place for the first time the Saturday after xmas. I had a friend in town and I wanted to take him somewhere new. The place was busy but we found a table in the bar area. The beer selection was different, it forced me to try some new beers. We were pretty much just drinking, but did order a half dozen raw oysters in a half shell. Very good. The staff was super friendly. We spent some time at a table and the server was great, and then we moved to the bar and the bartenders took really good care of us. I recommend checking this place out, I want to try more of the menu.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Beautiful.Delicious.Go there.Now.Did I mention delicious?

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great place. Beautiful, well-designed space with an interesting assortment of options...We stumbled onto it after eating some Thai in Queen Anne and wished we had eaten at Toulouse. We finally got there the other night and got to have a great dinner. Both of my companions enjoyed their food (a ton of really amazing meat, fish, poultry options). I, however, got a great salad and some sides--much to the weird grumbling behavior of my waiter who (every time I asked for something) looked at me like I was from Mars. Hello--high end does great wonders for us vegan/veg--esp when our companions order a butt load from your menu!Everything else was grand--from the setting to the beautiful people eating there. Ok, maybe I am wrong...maybe it wasn't that my waiter was less than stellar because I am veg. We have two theories: 1) (my companions' version) you, pierced waiter, had a crush on me and were jealous that i was two hunky guys or 2) (my version) you, pierced waiter, were jealous that I was coming between you and my two sexxxy male companions would have loved to have eaten you for desert.Go there. Eat. Drink. Enjoy. Maybe you will bed him...?

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: As a Seattle foodie with a penchant for bold flavors, I recently had the pleasure of dining at Toulouse Petite, and let me tell you, this place is nothing short of incredible. Serving some of the best Cajun Creole food I've ever had, Toulouse Petite is a true gem.Culinary Highlights:Crab Eggs Benedict: The crab eggs benedict was a revelation. Perfectly poached eggs atop fresh, succulent crab, all smothered in a silky hollandaise sauce. Every bite was a symphony of flavors that transported me straight to New Orleans.Seafood Jambalaya: The seafood jambalaya was spot on. The rice was perfectly cooked, and the medley of seafood--shrimp, crawfish, andouille sausage--was seasoned to perfection. It had just the right amount of spice to leave a lasting impression without overwhelming the palate.The atmosphere at Toulouse Petite is warm and inviting, with a cozy, yet vibrant vibe that makes you feel right at home. The attention to detail in both the decor and the service is impeccable. Whether it's a quick lunch or a leisurely dinner, I always leave feeling well taken care of.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I can't say enough good things about Toulouse Petite and their incredible server, Kathy! I come here often, and every single visit is a delight. The food is always exceptional, but what truly makes this place stand out is the outstanding service. Kathy is amazing--attentive, friendly, and always goes above and beyond to make sure my dining experience is perfect. She really made me feel like a valued guest!The atmosphere at Toulouse Petite is warm and inviting, and the attention to detail is impeccable. Whether it's a quick lunch or a leisurely dinner, I always leave feeling well taken care of. Thank you, Kathy, and the entire team at Toulouse Petite, for consistently making my visits so enjoyable. I'll definitely be back soon! Probably next Sunday

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food was excellent as was the service. Our waiter Chris was exceptional, as was everyone else.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: We love the food and service. Always spotOn , it was our first date and our anniversary = 9 years Thank you

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Embarking on a culinary journey in Seattle, I stumbled upon a charming gem that forever changed my perception of French toast. Nestled in a quaint corner, this establishment not only boasts exquisite antique decor but also exudes a warm, inviting ambiance. The staff, with their impeccable service, further elevated my dining experience.Now, let's talk about the star of the show - the Crème Caramel French Toast. This divine creation, adorned with succulent strawberries and luscious pecan butter, is a symphony of flavors. The marriage of crème and caramel is a delight to the senses, but it's the pecan butter that truly steals the show. Its heavenly blend of sweetness and nuttiness leaves you craving for more.As I relish every bite, I must also commend the perfectly crispy strips of bacon that accompany this masterpiece. Each element on the plate harmonizes beautifully, creating a symphony of flavors that dance on your palate.In conclusion, this enchanting spot has captured not just my taste buds but also my heart. It's a must-visit for anyone looking to embark on a culinary adventure in Seattle.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Toulhouse Petit has been a staple go to for brunch when I am in Uptown (formerly Lower Queen Anne). However, I recently visited for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with the meal. I enjoyed a Cajun Shrimp Po' Boy with a small salad and side of fries. The Po' Boy was delicious and had a generous amount of shrimp. The salad was well dressed, and the fries were nice and crispy. Although I have been several times it never gets old the New Orleans style atmosphere that breaks up the Seattle Contemporary style that most restaurants fall back on for decoration. The staff was polite and quick to respond before I could ask. All in all, Toulouse should be on your list whether a visitor from out of town or a long-time resident. Thank you for the great lunch and will be dining here again soon. P.S. This is one of, if not the, best brunch spots in Seattle if you like Cajun style foods.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I love southern food, and I was blown away by the menu here. There are so many things to choose from it'll take you a good 15 minutes just to read through it at best! I had the mufalletta sandwich and it was unbelievably good. My buddy had a fried shrimp po boy sandwich and he couldn't get enough of it! He also had a bloody Mary which was a little on the small side but still tasted great. The atmosphere is really nice and it's not too loud inside as they have good acoustic fabric on the ceiling so it doesn't echo at all. Very clean bathroom. And plenty of seating in the restaurant. The decor is really cool too with all the candles on the wall, and the building really stands out among all the other buildings on lower Queen Anne. I have to go back here at least another 10 times to try enough stuff on the menu to feel like I've actually done a good job of trying dishes here!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Oh my god. I can't say enough good things. I have been coming here for years. This place never fails to provide an absolutely delicious eye rolling meal. I have trouble deciding what to eat. The brunch is phenomenal. By far the best. The beignets!!! The drinks!!! Not only this, I have received outstanding service. Our food took longer than usual to come out. Manager comped all of our drinks. I was very grateful and didn't mind the wait. They very much care about your experience. We will be back again many times more.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Popped in for lunch before hitting up the tattoo convention. The food was AMAZING! If you've eaten in nolo and liked it you're going to love this place. Pro tip- despite GPS it's a little hard to find since as far as we could find, there's not really much for signs!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I recently had an outstanding dining experience at this French restaurant. The ambiance was inviting, and the standout was Hadley's exceptional service. She expertly guided me through the menu and ensured every aspect of my meal was perfect. The dishes were a delightful fusion of flavors, with the muscles and gumbo being fantastic Hadley's attentiveness and warmth truly elevated the evening. If you're seeking a memorable culinary adventure with exceptional service, this restaurant is a must-visit. :)

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food is fresh, flavorful and tasty Service was Great this rime, last couple of times it took a while for us to get our order in and the food. The Sunday brunch menu has a wide selection and portions are of nice size. In the Seattle area it s a good value.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Everything my friends and I have ordered has been delicious - and everything is off a vast menu.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Ambience, food and service is unlike any other in lower QA. Miss the days Pesos was around but this vibe is v similar.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I had been searching for a place to celebrate a birthday dinner with my family, and this place had come highly recommended by many food blogs, friends, and social media accounts. I was skeptical of the legitimacy of a French-Creole restaurant in Seattle, since we unfortunately don't have many restaurants serving that type of cuisine, but I held out hope that this one would prevail, since I love French-Creole food!I made a reservation for 7:30 on a Sunday night, and upon arrival, we were seated immediately. The restaurant was packed to the brim, and the atmosphere was buzzy, but not overly loud. The dining room itself is dark and dimly lit - a perfect ambience for a romantic date. You can tell the painstaking labor put into creating this restaurant, from the thousands of hand-laid tiles to the hundreds of candles the restaurant's staff lights each night (detailed in the back part of the menu, if you want to know more). Service was friendly and helpful, if a bit slow (though I totally understand, since it was a weekend). After getting seated, our waitress asked us if we wanted bread ($7, comes with butter), and it came out a couple minutes later, piping hot and fresh from the oven. It was a pretty authentic French baguette (coming from someone who has had some of Paris's best), though I will say that it is a bit bland, so eat it with the salted butter! The sommelier came out, and my dad ordered an Alsatian red that he was curious about. The somm seemed extremely knowledgeable and was more than happy to talk about the extensive wine list! The wine itself was very fairly priced with minimal markup for a restaurant, and there's really something for everyone on the 16-page list. We ended up ordering four entrees, which we split among the four of us. My entree, the Grimaud Farms Muscovy Duck Confit over Lentils de Puy with Local Butternut Squash ($34), was delicious - the duck was crispy and flavorful, and the lentils were hearty and well-spiced without being heavy.
