I will say that the portion of my entree was relatively small (the duck leg was small and there wasn't much butternut squash at all), but there was a good amount of lentils. My brother ordered the Big Easy Jambalaya ($33), which comes in a sizzling skillet piled high with prawns, chicken, house-made andouille sausage, and tasso ham. The rice on the bottom was perfectly cooked (not hard, but not mushy at all), and had absorbed the rich, deep Creole flavors of the spice mix and meats on top. It was slightly spicy, but we actually wished it were a little spicier! My mom ordered the Jumbo Wild 'Barbecue Shrimp' New Orleans ($36). The shrimp was well-seasoned, with some sort of Creole seasoning (cayenne pepper and paprika being some standout flavor notes), and they were quite large, as the name suggested. The grits were so rich and creamy (complimented amazingly by the chives/scallions served on top), but we couldn't finish the whole portion for that reason. Finally, my dad ordered the Puget Sound Pacific Mussels with Roasted Shallot-Coriander Paste/Red Basil Nuoc Cham and Pommes Frites and Aioli ($21, $9 extra for frites). This surprised us by being our favorite dish of the night; apart from getting a very generous portion of both mussels and pommes frites, both were perfectly cooked, and we loved the Vietnamese-style sauce that the mussels came in (and we especially loved dipping the baguette in it!). We were so full by the end of the meal that we couldn't even think about getting dessert, but all of the desserts we saw other tables ordering looked amazing, and we would definitely go back to try them another time. Ultimately, I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a romantic date night or a celebratory dinner. No, the prices are by no means cheap, but I think that the portions are fairly generous here, and it's no more expensive than Seattle's other high-end, classy date-night restaurants. The food and ambience couldn't be better, the restaurant itself is beautiful, and the service is great - we'll definitely be going back!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Something special about Toulouse. I ended up googling some stuff myself, just because I rarely eat Creole food. But in the best way, and trying something new. It was cheerful, but cozy, with a velvet banquette of small candles. After ordering custom from the impressive, yet overwhelming, menu, we had prawns, chori and grits.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good experience.I would recommend this to others also...Great service and good food....

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food, drinks, atmosphere, and customer service were all wonderful. Not much more you could ask for!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Wow! Great food and service. The staff was great, and so was the service! Prices for the quality definitely evens out!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing food, love the atmosphere and the food was just delicious! Great service and so many options on the menu!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great happy hour and service! Super cool and cute spot for date or dinner with friends. Happy hour is where it is at! Everything was yummy!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: They have delicious dessert like breakfast!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food was so delicious, it had lots of options.Very well prepared dishes. Staff were very accommodating. Recommended!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This is my favorite restaurant of all time! Never once been disappointed with a meal. I would recommend it time and time again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food is so fabulous. Every time we come, we leave with huge smiles on our faces, full bellies, luxurious ones. I probably have to eat here again. Greatly recommended!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: My wife/fiancée (wedding ceremony delayed due to Covid) went to Toulouse for Halloween, and it was the best restaurant experience we have ever had in Seattle. The restaurant itself was beautiful and atmospheric, and the food was absolutely delicious. They had a wide array of selections for different price ranges, which was appreciated. We had Sea Scallop Coins, the Seafood Gumbo, and an arrangement of 3 of their cheeses. Every dish blew us away, and the service provided by our waiter, Harrison, made this an incredibly memorable experience. He was perceptive, friendly, and good-humored; he even noticed my wife's ring and congratulated us. He even went as far as giving as a plate of beignets as a congratulations--above and beyond service, and I only wish I could have tipped more. After our first night there, we already know we want to come here again as often as we can. I have no complaints about my experience at Toulouse!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Second time here, both time's the food was great along with the service. Short and sweet

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: One of our favorite places in Seattle. They never disappoint!Love the food and ambiance

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Five stars for fantastic food and outstanding, attentive service. It was the first time here, and it met my standards. Good to make the choice! Recommend it for sure! They're open during the Covid 19, and I enjoyed it so much that I had to get it again next week. It's really a lot of fun to try. Friendly, competent employees.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This spot is one of the few great places in Queen Anne for a nice fine dining experience, we ordered chicken gumbo and the house special burger both were delish and the flavors were robust.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I like here.Hard to find parking sometime.The environment is so good.They have happyy hOur small plate as well.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This is really a great place to eat and grab a few drinks. I've spent a lot of my time working in the South and this place brought me right back to that time. It was pretty packed which is always a great sign for a business. The atmosphere was beautiful with candles everywhere. The service was friendly and fast. My duck confit was cooked crispy and moist. Oh, and I can't forget the creme brule because it was cooked to perfection. I'm only in town for the next two days, but I might just have to eat here tomorrow again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: delish. loved itdefinitely coming back

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good food great atmosphere and the drinks were made perfectly. What else can you ask for?

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Fried chicken is awesome! Definitely recommend everyone to try!!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Love it here! Maybe one of my favorite restaurant in the city! I go there every time I stop by Seattle! Great drinks. Amazing shrimp and grits and the bacon! And always good service.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I must admit, I've never been here. However, there is a review here posted within a day by someone posing as me that is absolutely false. My account has been active since 2011, the account below was created yesterday. That account and the person behind that account have been reported. PLEASE SUPPORT NEIGHBORHOOD BARS. Next time I'm in Queen Anne, I'm stopping here. See you soon, Toulouse.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Breakfast is not to be missed! Beignets and chickroot coffee are fantastic. My family ate 3 meals in 3 days here and everyone raved about it. It's a must-visit whenever I'm in town on business. Love the cozy booths and knowledgeable servers.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Fantastic food, good drinks, and the service was good even when they were quite busy. Highly recommended restaurant!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing food - Excellent Service! We did happy hour and dinner.  Will definitely - go back!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: We stumbled across this restaurant while in Seattle to watch the Warriors game at Key Stadium, the final event there. The food was fabulous. Escargot, Cauliflower soup w/crab, Lamb Sliders, Mussels. All delish, the ambulance is great and the staff is the best. A must do :-D

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great salad! And great service. Such fantastic late night menu. Will be coming here again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Staff was very nice and friendly and we even had amazing table service as well ad bar service. They seem like they really care, thanks for the great time! Ill be back most definitely i can tell you that!!haha

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I'm. Or much of a French toast person, but Toulouse has the absolute best French toast I have ever had in all my 44 years! The service was prompt and courteous. The menu is a perfect balance of unique and traditional. And the decor! I couldn't stop staring at their wall treatment. I need to figure out how they did that!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I like coming here because the food is great, and the staff Are super friendly. But the blonde host girl Tea sure is fabulous. She does so much every time I come she's running around helping her co workers out and going above and beyond anything ive ever seen a host do at other restraunts. Plus she's beautiful and always warm and welcoming to everyone that comes in. She's just great. Keep it up Tea!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This is my favorite restaurant in Seattle, hands down. The servers are so friendly, accommodating, and awesomely personable. I ordered ~5 drinks at once and my server totally understood me and my love for beverages (juice, coffee, cocktail, etc.) The menu is very extensive as you will be bound to find a delicious, favorite dish (or 2)!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This place is the absolute bomb! I came here for the summer and this was one of my very favorite local eating spots! The ambience is amazing, but the manager, Rodney and the bartender Stephan deserve the highest accolades. I have been here three times in three weeks and would suggest that everyone go there. I felt wind and dined and like a princess. The bartender went out of his way so much to make me feel special that I actually went home and picked a fight with my husband because I have never had a man wait on me hand and foot the way he did. LOL! When I ran across the street to the store, I came back and found a beautiful glass of wine, dessert, and a complementary to go bag because he wanted me to try a certain dish that I wanted to order but never did. This hospitality went above and beyond any experience I have ever had in a restaurant and it will definitely keep me coming back for more!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great food and atmosphere! Love this place!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great food. Great atmosphere. Would go again~

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Decor - 4 StarsService - 5 StarsVariety - 5 StarsFood Quality (Freshness and Flavor) - 5 StarsPortion sizes - 4 StarsValue - 5 StarsOverall Rating - 4.66

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great food, great drinks, and even better happy hour.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This place is my fave Queen Anne Happy Hour spot. Their happy hour menu is extensive, with the best variety. I always get their cauliflower soup with crab and truffle. If you haven't tried that yet- you are missing out.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Love their happy hour. Good place for some soul food and very unique drinks/menu items that never dissapoint.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I don't even know where to start. The restaurant itself is beautiful, from the space to the music, low lighting and decor to the open lay out. Our server was soft spoken and kind and made several amazing suggestions for their late night menu. Her service was wonderful, timing and her personality were perfect for a great night out. I will definitely be going back. The chorizo mussels and the Serrano margarita were grade A, excellent! Thank you Toulouse Petit!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Service is great. Food is great. Atmosphere is great.I will only go there for brunch though.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Everything lovely and delicious! Close to Seattle Rep. Perfect for before the show!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I highly recommend the cauliflower soup. It's filled with creaminess, truffle aromatics, and lots of chunck crab meat. I crave that soup!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: 4.5 so giving it a 5. Great service, very good food at a good price. Got there 5 minutes before the small dish happy hour ended. Waitress helped us order small dishes right away. Everything she recommended was very good. Would definitely go back again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I'm trying to be objective, but i have nothing but rave reviews for this place. it was gorgeous, for starters. i'm glad we got to dinner early (right after work) it seemed to be filling up fast.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Excellent envrioment and food

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great addition to Seattle. Best happy hours in Seattle. I come here with my friends all the time for happy hours.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I love this place,  My favorite part about Toulouse is they serve breakfast till 3pm. Most people come here because of Food Network. I would recommend the Jambalaya. It's honestly the best thing I've ever eaten. My friends always orders the banana pancake and it's amazing as well. Overall this is a great place to visit.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Our absolute favorite Francais/New Orleans style restaurant in Seattle. If you haven't tried the cauliflower soup-- DO. I dream about it.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: We came here as a family for breakfast and the food was really good. My kids had something to find off the menu and ate the whole thing without complaining. I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict and it was delicious!! The potatoes were flavored perfectly and I ate my whole dish! That was probably one of the best brunch's that I have had in a very long time. I would definitely recommend Toulouse Petit and don't be afraid to take the kids because the menu offers a large variety which is great for all ages.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great food. Good atmosphere and vibe. one of my faves when I go into the city!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Fantastic!!! I only come during breakfast happy hour and have never been unsatisfied.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Don't skip on the brunch.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This restaurant is so good! Had breakfast here and it was fabulous! French press coffee and massive strips of bacon. Definitely recommend this place!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Love meeting here for brunch on the weekends!Good food and friendly service!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Delicious food, went there for lunch today. Had duck terrine, Pork cheeks, Toulouse Beet salad, Talgliatelle w/ mushrooms. Amazing lunch and wonderful service. Coffee from a coffee press, strong and rich. Arnold Palmer w/ just enough lemonade and more tea (not too sweet). Great place, huge awesome menu. Thanks!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The cocktails and happy hour are a must here! It can get pretty rowdy here so I don't recommend it for intimate talks unless you see they're slow.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing. This place is "nicer" than most places I frequent but their happy hours are IMO the best in the city. I have had at least half of the breakfast happy hour menu and would definitely order each thing again. I definitely wish they didn't always try to push me to the bar for breakfast but I will tolerate it for such delicious food.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: My boyfriend recommended me this place and now this is one of my favorite place for breakfast or brunch. I just love to come here and hangout with friends on my lazy weekend times. I have tried almost all the things, and believe me, if you are a food lover, you should defiantly give a try to this place. The staff is also very friendly.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Cute resturaunt. Great place to bring a date. Very good soul food. We need more of these in Seattle.

text_review: This food at this place is just too good.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This is the most fantastic food in Seattle. We loved it so much we went to dinner and then back for lunch. The service was great and the drinks are fun too.

text_review: AAA

text_review: love this place

Always make reservations cause they are super busy! So worth it!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Yum, yum, yum!!! This place is amaze! It has the yummiest food, the ambiance is completely sexy, the service is friendly, all a win! I love to bring dates here because the lighting is dim and the place just has a sexy feel to it. Brunch is cool too. The drinks are pretty good, I usually like it stiffer than they provide but they still get the job done. Parking is a beast however... I say it is worth finding a parking spot even if you have to walk several blocks.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Absolutely love this place !! Everything is yummy & I mean EVERYTHING !! That includes their desserts :)

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: i've had almost everything on their menu and it has always been fantastic! one of my favorite restaurants to go to with my friends or husband.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I greatly enjoy this place. The food is excellent, the service is very friendly & accommodating, and having been here a few times I've yet to have a dish i didn't enjoy. All of the friends I've had dine with me here greatly enjoyed it as well.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Good Staff. Good food. Great brunch. A short wait to get in but well worth it.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Excellent food, have been here couple of times for brunch, great food great ambience

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I've been in here a handful of times, and they had me at shrimp and grits!! Great service and lovely atmosphere!! I highly suggest this place to any foodie or anyone with a taste bud in their mouth!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Thank you for a Great Breakfast and Service. The food was hot and tasty.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Top notch food and drinks. We live in Tacoma and it's definitely worth the drive.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Add confit garlic to anything, or everything!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: My friends and I have been going around town this past summer to different brunch places and this is absolutely our favorite EVER!!!!My roommate and I got there early and where placed on the waiting list while the rest of our group got there. Of course they only seat groups when majority of the group is there so we were bumped a few times which was fine because the hostess was so kind and light hearted about it, making us feel welcomed and not an inconvenience.When we were seated our waitress was very friendly and had very cool, tasteful tattoos that I was very well done; hey weren't tackey. The food came all at once so none of us had to wait for each others orders to arrive which was very impressive seeing that it was very busy and most restaurants will generally serve based on what comes out of the kitchen first. All of it was nice and hot and delicious. I had the Oyster and Bacon Benedict which was perfect. The eggs were poached but still had that delicious running yolk. The oysters where breaded and fried but not cooked all the way through giving it a very ocean-y flavor which I thought added an unique flavor to the entire dish. All the staff was friendly and had a smile on which I know from experience is a very hard thing to do on a Saturday morning during a rush. Definitely coming back here again.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Pork cheek confit, fried chicken po boy, spicy jambalaya- all plates our party LOVED. We went for lunch, right before the rush and the ambiance was great. Service was okay, but I never yearned for a drink so I can't complain. I will definitely be back on our next visit to try new dishes!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: wish it wasnt so busy id eat here every day!!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: You can beat this - out favorite breakfast in Seattle!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This place is a bizarre mixture of bros and tasteful people looking for genuinely good food, all elbowing each other to get on the waiting list first. The food is worth it, if you can handle rubbing elbows with fratboy rejects and their ilk.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: This is one of my go to spots for consistently good food and drinks and service!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

I also love watching sports here as the food is amazing, staff is great and the atmosphere is relaxed with a great vibe.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Awesome, simply awesome.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
