name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Breakfast Happy Hour. Who knew this existed? The Pork Hash is fantastic but the benedict with the veal sauce is pure heaven. French press coffee and Beignets are my favorite Sunday splurge.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I love hot food!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Wonderful food!! It's little bit pricy but worthy.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Food is AMAZING. One of the most diversified and unique menu's. Make a reservation if you plan on going on a weekend dinner otherwise wait isn't too bad. Make room for the beignets and the pressed coffee. Place can be a little dark but the ambiance is nice.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I'm not an expert...but this is the best jumbalaya I've ever had.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing! Wonderful food, delicious food and beautiful atmosphere!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great breakfast!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: We go there at least once a week for great drinks and I pretty much always get the jumbalaya. Spicy and delicious. Once the buzz is on, then we usually head to Pesos to finish it off.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I was at Toulouse about a week ago and I would have to say, hands down the best happy hour in the city. Great food and drinks. Love this place. And the bartender Tyler is fabulous!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I love happy hours as much as Ron Burgundy loves gin and Toulouse Petit has (I don't know if it's self-proclaimed or what) the best happy hour in the nation! I'm inclined to agree. I've been here somewhere between five and ten times for happy hour and we have barely scratched the surface of the happy hour menu! The sides are the best! Everything is less than five bucks! I especially like the corn grits, the haricots verts with bacon (that's green beans) and the Brussels sprouts. We've tried the alligator and found it to be absolutely delicious, and the basics like several varieties of sliders. And let's not forget dessert! White chocolate bread pudding, apple crisp and pear tart. As a fan of biegnets from Cafe du Monde in New Orleans I was afraid to try an obvious impersonator, but Toulouse biegnets are stand-alone outstanding. I love this place!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Beautiful steaks and other items. Great service, and located right around the corner from a great dueling piano bar. These guys know how to do the restaurant business. I think this is one of the greatest restaurants in seattle.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Breakfast happy hour! I could never get bored of the menu. Great staff.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I Love this place! They are nice, and the food is really really good. $7 Happy hour is the best!!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Yum yum yum. Wish it wasn't in Lower Queen Anne because I'd eat here more.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: The food is always good and the manager Joe is so nice. My gf and I went here for dinner and Joe took great care of us getting us into the bar on a busy friday night. Their menu is amazing especially if you like spicy food! Awesome!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Amazing place. Delicious food. Wonderful atmosphere. A must for Seattle.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Awesome! Best brunch in town!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: So Good!!!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I had one of my top meals in Seattle at this place on Friday. We ate on the bar side which serves the full menu. Good wine, pretty good service (the place was packed so I'm too critical) and just really awesome food. My lamb ragu was incredible and there are at least three or four other menu items I will go back and try. Great wine selection too. Definitely check this place out.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Went back again for breakfast happy hour. I fell in love all over agin! $6.00 and delish! Best deal in town. All real, fresh ingredients- very important to me. Pork cheek hash was out of this world, and my dining partner had the biscuit and gravy- were fantastic, a sexed up version of the diner classic. Oh-- and daytime drinking- (we were celebrating!) drinks were on special too- the Breakfast Milk Punch & Katie Mae were a wonderful addition to the best Thursday afternoon in my recent memory.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I have never written a review on Yelp before, but I had such a great time here last night I wanted to share it! This was my first time at Toulouse, a friend had asked me to go with her to an event there. Now I realize they don't normally have live music, but they did last night, and it was GREAT. Even better though was the food. My goodness. The best grits I've had in ten years, BBQ prawns, fried green tomatoes, and an AMAZING halibut dish.   Our service was attentive, fast but not rushed (and thats saying something because this place was packed), and the girl running the front door was right on with her menu suggestions!   I will be going back to Toulouse, and often. If you haven't been, you should go see for yourself.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Great cocktails at brunch and biscuits and gravy were great.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I have been several times now, and each time has been great!! The only con I can come up with is parking on Lower Queen Anne, during late night, or weekend brunch. Love the variety of the late night Happy Hour! There are also drink specials now! Hard to find great happy hour food & drink specials!

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: this place is good.. soo good.. that i have been houding my friends to meet me, just so that we can go here.went 2 weeks back during the happy hour.. was very very very impressed with their happy hour menu.. it was impressive.. large selections of items.. something for everyone.. even my finicky friend.. tried so many dishess.. the small sized is just right for the price $5.. which means you can try out many different dishes if you cant make up your mind which one to eat.. so this is what we hadoysters wrapped on bacon : pretty okCreole Shrimp ( i think) this was terrific... terrific.. this one i am going to have alwayslamb slider : good tooBeef sliders : goodone more shrimp dish.. but all of it was soo good.. even the atmosphere makes for good environment.waiting to go back again :)

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I have had consistently great service and great food at this place. I love going here. Great place to stop being so damn uptight and enjoy it.

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: I tried their breakfast last week , I really like it, the best in queen annThanks

name: Toulouse Petit Kitchen & Lounge
text_review: Attended a pre-opening party so can't comment too much on service or cost. But I did get a chance to sample almost all of the dishes and the short review: AWESOME. But before I dive into the food, I should mention the decor. The decor is amazing. All the tables were handmade and inlaid with intricate designs. Each table took at least 12 man hours to construct. All the metal work (lights, bottom of tables, partitions in the bathrooms, etc.) were all done and custom built on site. The plaster on the walls was made with many, many layers and then chipped away to reveal all the colors. Amazing. The man hours spent on this restaurant must have been insane. Now food. When I go to a restaurant to do a sampling like this, I usually have a few I like, maybe 1 or two that I love, and a few that are just so-so. Just about everything I had that night was amazingly good. I loved almost every single dish I tried. The dishes all have a New Orleans/Creole/Cajun flair. I had so many dishes that it's hard for me to remember all the goodness. Pork cheek: amazingly tender and terrific seasoning. Alligator: tastes like chicken. Really. And it's great with the mashed potatoes. Gumbo: had two servings. There were lots more, but just can't recall them off my head at the moment. What I do remember most fondly was the bananas fosters. That made me want to weep for happiness. It might have been the booze that I was drinking all night, but that and the other desserts were all amazing. I really can't wait to go back and get full size portions of their food.One other thing that needs to be mentioned is the bar. The bar area occupies the significant majority of the floor space. The liquor porn that's up on that wall is amazing. There's something like 40+ different vodkas (flavors and brands). Again, since I was at a tasting event I didn't see a menu. I left it up to bartender Miles Thomas (who also works at Tavern Law -- another one of my favorites) to pour me some libations. My favorite drink of the night had some gin and champagne in it. I didn't get to see everything that he poured, but I could drink that all night long.I can't wait for Toulouse to officially open. I'll be there often.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Disappointed Dining ExperienceI recently visited Tilikum Place Cafe and unfortunately, it was not a pleasant experience. The service was slow, and we had to wait nearly an hour for our food to arrive at the table. The extended wait time significantly impacted our overall enjoyment of the evening. The menu was also very limited however the food did taste really good. I hope the restaurant can improve its efficiency to provide a better dining experience for future patrons.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We got there at 9:25 am. 1/3 of the table was empty but they told us that we had to wait 30-40 min. We left. Very disappointed.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Their "famous" dutch babies are tasteless

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: So many empty tables and we were told it would be a 40 min wait. Ended up taking two hours. There were homeless people everywhere outside made for a very uncomfortable wait. Then the host had the AUDACITY to tell us he only had one table that would be for a reservation later so we would have to eat within an hour after our long wait. Horrible service and overpriced for eggs and toast that are masked by an instagrammable presentation.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Shitty food and shitty service.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Tilikum is an orca whale that was abused at SeaWorld. Why would you name your restaurant off of him? Do you care for innocent creatures? Anyways, tried the food here and hated it. I hated it as much as Tilikum hated his cage.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Sometimes the vibe and attitude of servers is a reflection of the owner. This place is probably the best negative example of this. I feel sorry for the staff.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: For my sunday brunch i tried out this place. I ordered fried egg with toast and french toast. The egg was super oily and over fried and my friend didnt like what he ordered either

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We were sat immediately when we got there and didn't see a waitress to order drinks for 21 mins. After ordered it took 10 mins to get them. We didn't get our appetizers until 50 mins after we sat down. Appetizers were the best dishes in the house though. Burrata and vegetable tart were amazing. Main courses came 45 mins later and were mediocre. The halibut was over cooked and the meatballs were over taken by the tomato sauce. Less sauce would have been better. The waitress was loud and would engage a table from 3 tables away.Then they started setting up(moving chairs, tables, and just being a distraction while we had dessert.)Overall experience was "how is this place booked out so far for decent food and the worst fine dining wait staff"?

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Normally, they tell you that you need to wait a long time for a table but usually it doesn't take long. But after you get seated, service is kind of slow here.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Food was good! Service was great! But I think it was too hyped up.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Perfect way to start a Sunday! Sweet, savory, crispy and fluffy - what more could you ask for?

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I didnt like this place much. I know it sounds weird but this place smells weird and i hate it and food was okay nothing too great

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Mediocre food with mediocre service.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I wish I had better things to say but this place ... A place I was excited to experience was shockingly poor. First was. .. Service. .. Our lack there of. No ice in the water. ..coffee I ordered never showed up. .. Only saw the waiter when he delivered the bill. Second. ..food. bleck. I ordered the cured salmon scramble. Sounded great.. It was about 2 tablespoons of wet sludge.. my friends asked "is this a joke? " when it was put in the tale. ..Old fashioned garnish consisted of poorly sliced cantaloupe complete with rhind on one side. Lucky for me it was floating in the egg/salmon liquid so was inedible. Did i mention the "salad" aka too old bagged spring mix...so old it "made its own vinaigrette" type leaves. I won't be returning. I wish I could get my money back.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: nothing fancy but ok food

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great restaurant to entertain clients. wonderful steaks and some of the best service in town. don't pass up the incredibly delectable lobster bisque. the desserts are as big as the city.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Lovely brunch.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The food here is great. The only problem is that for a place as beautiful as this and for food as good you would expect servers to be more attentive. I've gone here several times and had my water class remain empty or have servers act almost too casual. I like a more casual vibe but I also would like drinks in a timely manner and to take our dessert order, etc.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Tilikum Place Café is an absolute treasure in Seattle, offering a warm and inviting atmosphere paired with exceptional food. Known for its Dutch-inspired menu, this café is a must-visit for brunch enthusiasts or anyone seeking a relaxed yet elevated dining experience.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Always have a least one meal whenever I'm in Seattle. The staff is super friendly and the food is always solid!!!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Amazing German pancake! Only problem was that when we made a reservation, and split the pancake for the two of us. The waitress was obviously upset that we didn't spend alot of money. She repeatedly approached us asking us to order more food. So I reluctantly got a bloody merry. Ruined the whole vibe. But whatever.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Tilikum Place Cafe came highly recommended as a brunch spot during our visit to Seattle, and it certainly lived up to its reputation. Our server was a delight, the interior exuded comfort, and the food was simply scrumptious. The French onion soup was rich in flavor and featured a delightful cheese crust. I decided to try the savory Dutch baby, and it turned out to be an exceptionally delectable choice. I regret not ordering it for myself. The warm mini baguette and the light, delightful profiteroles with vanilla ice cream rounded off the meal perfectly. I'm pleased that we heeded the recommendation and made a reservation at Tilikum Place Cafe.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Amazing food, service, and atmosphere. Was visiting from LA and had no idea what to eat. A friend found this place and we just walked in. Glad we did. We each got something unique and everything was full of flavor. My baked egg was so good I am on a mission to try and find it somewhere in California by me. . . I will make this a stop every time I'm in Seattle.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Astonishing. The food was excellent and baked goods were really good too. The service was exceptional and friendly. I'd likewise urge their java. I can not recall a better cup of just black java(unless of course, you enjoy the typical cup of burnt caffeine you find elsewhere). For those who own a chance stop by, you will not regret it.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Good all around. It took us a little while to get seated, reservations are highly recommended. Once we got seated the service was excellent. The food is really good, I don't consider myself a foodie and the menu was a little more foodie than I would like but there was a special lamb bacon omelet that was tasty.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We came here for a local breakfast while staying nearby. We came both days and loved it! The biscuits and gravy are very southern and were our favorites! Best we've had on the west coast! We Would love to visit again. Our server was friendly and served us both days. Great experience!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I'm very foody. With regards to geek I become a food geek and I in a real sense have recorded every one of the unique places that I visit to have my number one dishes added to the rundown too.Service was incredible as well. Mindful and quick Tilikum is amazing!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We ordered takeout since they were booked. We got the savory Dutch babies and the house quiche. It was my first Dutch babies so I didn't know what to expect. I wish we could've gotten more toppings in it. The house quiche was very good, I liked it a lot more than the Dutch babies because of the crust and it had more flavors. My boyfriend liked the Dutch babies more because it's got a strong egg taste. For me, it was a bit too much flour.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This is my go-to spot on late nights after the kid's games. After their games the kids are hangry and tired. So, the fact that they know my kids and make them feel so welcome is great. The food is consistent and tasty and comes out in a reasonable amount of time. I get my favorite drink and we all have a great time. It's really quite a fun spot.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Stop eating something here for a while and it's truly good that I'm not satisfied with the taste, perhaps I'm looking for the taste I want.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Food was pretty good but the wait to be seated and for the food to be out was pretty long ..

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Need a booking yet we were fortunate to get in because of a scratch-off. The best eggs Benny!! We likewise had the Dutch infant (stuffed flapjack) which was super filling. An incredible spot for Sunday early lunch!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great spot for brunch. You have to try their Dutch Babies which they are known for. It takes about 20 min to make so I would advise you to decide before you get there if you want to order it. Then you can tell the server when they take your drink orders, that way it will come out hopefully closer to the time everyone else gets their food. Pro-tip....We had the sweet & savory Dutch Babies and loved both of them. When i was a kid my dad would make dutch babies for Sunday breakfast, and these were just as good as his. This is the second time I've been here & had good experiences both times. Take your friends fo sho.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Awesome place to have brunch!I love their Dutch Babies! The only minus is that you have to make a reservation in advance. But it is totally worth it!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: You will need a reservation. This was an extraordinary meal, starting with a very helpful and delightful waitress who had worked at this business for over 8 years. She had terrific suggestions and, surprise, highlighted a chicken dish which was the locals' and her favorite. This was wonderful. We enjoyed a most memorable meal, including home made cookies (!). We out of town boys will return on our next trip to Seattle.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: A friend turned me on to this joint, and the pancakes were awesome, this is a neat old-fashioned style, more laid back and relaxing atmosphere, well I'm hooked.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Yummy place for breakfast. Priced right. Service was great. Food was delicious.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I like it but customer service is great

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Good food - but the service is lacking. Very much enjoyed the dishes I had here. Wait staff is very lazy, which takes away from an otherwise excellent dining experience.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This place has an amazing brunch menu at affordable prices. There is a wait depending on what you order but it is definitely worth the wait.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This place is awesome. Only thing you should do is put in a reservation for a table.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Highly Enjoyable. Great ambiance and location.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We had the lemon, blueberry and ricotta dutch baby and the sandwich/soup combo. We took the salmon sandwich and the onion soup. Everything was very delicious!! Still dreaming about that soup, it was the best onion soup I've ever had! And the dutch baby was so well balanced, sweet tangy creamy.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Amazing food, service and atmosphere. Was visiting from LA and had no idea what to eat. A friend found this place and we just walked in. Glad we did. We each got something unique and everything was full of flavor. My baked egg was so good i am on a mission to try and find it somewhere in California by me. . . I will definitely make this a stop every time im in Seattle.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Really good all around. It took us a little while to get seated, reservations are highly recommended. Once we got seated the service was excellent. The food is really good, I don't consider myself a foodie and the menu was a little more foodie than I would like but there was a special of a lamb bacon omlette that was really tasty.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Amazing food, service and atmosphere. Was visiting from LA and had no idea what to eat. A friend found this place and we just walked in. Glad we did. We each got something unique and everything was full of flavor. My baked egg was so good i am on a mission to try and find it somewhere in California by me. . . I will definitely make this a stop every time im in Seattle.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This cozy place brought us amazing experience with food and service. The price is surprisingly cheap for the amount of food we ordered and the great food quality. Will be back!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Not bad place at all I would definitely recommend it if u are looking for unique lunch or dinner

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Breakfast menu was delicious, if your going later in the evening then you can enjoy more from their bar.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great place! Really nice staff, my food was really good. I think the service was really great, my girlfriend was very impressed she told me she was impressed

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This is my favorite brunch place in all of Seattle. The wait staff are friendly and the food is amazing. I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. Definitely make a reservation as it is a small place and is usually busy around normal lunch and dinner hours.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Excellent brunch with changing specials. Wonderful combination of flavors with every dish and a very good attention to detail with plating. Fresh squeezed orange juice and Bloody Mary's using what seemed like fresh tomato juice. French press coffee was good, but poor filters kept allowing grounds through. Would definitely go back.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Eggs Benny is always killer, order the dutch baby right away!(It's amazing, but takes a while to cook)

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Make a reservation, it's worth it!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Besides the unusual location, this place is a fresh favorite. Such great, fresh and unique foods. My halibut special was astounding and the stew was outstanding! Everything we had was nicely prepared, nicely performed at adequate prices. We sat at the pub and our waiter/bar tender was incredibly careful. We intend to go back shortly.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Food was excellent and baked goods were really good too. Service was exceptional and friendly. I'd likewise urge their java. I can not recall a better cup of just black java(unless of course you enjoy the typical cup of burnt caffein you find elsewhere). For those who own a chance stop by, you will not repent it.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Astonishing. Food was excellent and baked goods were really good too. Service was exceptional and friendly. I'd likewise urge their java. I can not recall a better cup of just black java(unless of course you enjoy the typical cup of burnt caffein you find elsewhere). For those who own a chance stop by, you will not repent it.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I've eaten here three times with two of them being really good, the third just ok.  Might've been an off night. I still recommend it to anyone listening. Interesting plates and good service.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: received from owner: "Your 12 ounce glass of fresh squeezed grapefruit juice contained the juice from 5 whole grape fruits."

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We shared the chop salad which was excellent. We each had a Dutch baby -- savory for him and sweet for me. We would have rather each had a salad and split the Dutch baby. They didn't have a ton of flavor.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: What a great experience! Our waiter was a wonderful guy that spent a good five minutes telling us the specials. He was very sweet and earnest, he wanted us to have a good breakfast. The food was delicious. I had the roast turkey sandwich and my friend had the chocolate dutch baby. The only down side was that my sandwich was cold.Great atmosphere would definitely recommend this place!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I love coming to this place ! All their menu are awesome ! I love how I can seat at the bar and look at all the fresh they prepare! Not only their foods are awesome , their drink are good too! If you are looking for a quite place with great food and drink , this is your place ! I would recommend you try everything on the menu !!!!!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: best handmade pasta. not easy to get in for brunch though

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Loved the food! You really can't go wrong here!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Good food, a tad more expensive than $$ but the quality and service was great

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Went for dinner two nights ago. Very good service. Excellent hand-made pasta.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I went here 3 times. The first time I thought it was fantastic. We have the eggs benedict which was one of the best I've ever had. However the second time we went i was a bit disappointed with the time it took for our food to come out but at least the waitress gave us some free treats to hold us over. However the reason for the 4 stars is b/c the last time I ate here I felt like the food was too heavy and I had quite a stomach ache for hours. Maybe the breakfasts are too rich for me but I do love the staff and the ambiance is so nice.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food, nice breakfast as well.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Decent prices and portion sizes. Tasty dinner.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This place was awesome. Good food, cute atmosphere, very friendly waitstaff. Will come again.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Nice food .. need a little bit more quantity.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food, great service. Appetizers are delicious.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I have been wanting to stop and eat here for the longest time and finally had a chance the other night. I thought it was wonderful and the wait staff were helpful, nice and not so in our faces.Drinks : We all had different drinks and they were tasty !Appetizers: We had the pasta which we couldn't get enough of with their crunchy bread and butter. We also had their squash blossom's which were out of this world. Dinner : We each ordered something different and everyone enjoyed their meal which seemed to be cooked perfectly. Cookies and home made ice cream , what else can I say other than the place is cute, clean and they make very tasty meals and drinks. I would suggest that everyone try this little hidden gem.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: If you're lucky enough to snag a reservation at this gem, you're in for an unforgettable experience. This brunch spot, with its breathtaking view of the Space Needle, perfectly combines delicious food, impeccable service, and a stunning atmosphere.The Dutch baby is a standout--fluffy, golden, and served with the perfect balance of sweetness and richness. It's the kind of dish that lingers in your memory long after the last bite. Every plate that came out looked like it was made with care and attention to detail.Despite being booked out months in advance and buzzing with activity, the service here is stellar. The staff is attentive, friendly, and makes you feel welcome, even amidst the hustle.The view of the Space Needle takes the experience to the next level--whether you're sipping coffee or enjoying a full meal, it's hard to beat the ambiance. Definitely worth planning ahead for this one!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Tilikum Place Restaurant : A Hidden Gem Worth GuardingIf I could keep this place a secret, I would--but Tilikum Place Café in Seattle deserves every bit of praise. After dining in over 40 countries, I can confidently say this might be the best restaurant I've ever been to.The food? Beyond Michelin-worthy. Every bite is crafted with passion, precision, and flavor that left me genuinely stunned. Some standout dishes for me were the hand-cut pasta, baked oysters, and the perfectly grilled lamb rack. For brunch, the eggs benedict and quiche were simply unforgettable--comforting classics elevated to a whole new level.The service was just as exceptional. Christie, my server, made phenomenal recommendations that elevated the entire meal. Her warm, attentive energy made me feel right at home. Lotta, the manager, has created an environment that's inviting, cozy, and effortlessly friendly. It's a place where you feel like you know everyone the moment you step in.And then there's Bo, the bartender--a true rockstar whose charisma and spot-on drink pairings added an extra sparkle to the experience. Ba, the owner, runs this café with a style and presence that every restaurant should aspire to emulate.What truly sets Tilikum Place Café apart is its atmosphere. Not only is the staff amazing, but watching the other customers laugh, converse, and enjoy their meals with the same joy I felt is a testament to the magic of this place.Tilikum Place Café & Restaurant is not just a meal; it's an experience. If you're in Seattle, it's a must-visit. You'll find the best of the city (and maybe the world) right here.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The ambiance is soooo beautiful!! Wonderful service and food was delicious! Definitely coming back. The butternut squash kale salad was BOMB!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I cannot express my adoration for this little brunch nook more. The staff is kind and friendly. We feel like family every time we visit, to a degree I can't recommend more. The food is good and the portions are huge and more than enough to share. The baked beans were amazing and savory Dutch is also very unique.Titikum Place Cafe is a must-visit gem! This was a great way to end our space needle sightseeing!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Super good food + great service!! Love the seasonal and variety in the menu, from week to week. Very cute + picturesque with the decor too.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I cannot express my adoration for this little brunch nook more. The staff are our beloved friends. We feel like family every time we visit, to a degree I can't recommend more. I almost always leave teary eyed from just how wonderfully welcoming they are. Every single one of them are amazing.That's just the service. The food? Phenomenal. They have a rotating menu that is always impeccable, always novel, always delicious. The chefs clearly are a well-oiled machine, because food always comes out quickly and perfectly.If you're visiting, you'll want to have a reservation, and for a good reason. The Tilikum Place Cafe is a reason alone to visit Seattle.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Everything was off the hook. Every bite was brilliant. The staff was amazing. I can't wait to go again

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Friendly customer service. Amazing diner that served excellent breakfast meals. The food was cooked perfectly and has amazing food options. I can't tell how excellent the food was and I have lots of favorites food there especially the Baked egg, benedict, and toast. The meals were generous portions for the price and was extremely appetizing. Always enjoyed the food there. Would definitely dine in there again.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I recently tried Tilikum which was recommended to me by a friend and it did not disappoint. Even though I arrived about 10 minutes before my reservation time, I only had to wait for about 5-8 minutes. Looking at the long line of people waiting outside, I was so glad that I made a reservation. The food was incredibly fresh and had some unique and delicious flavor combinations. I also loved the consistently nice decor of the restaurant. The service was fantastic - fast, friendly, and very attentive to my needs. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Excellent gem and great spot for breakfast food. Absolutely amazig service and friendly staff. She was extremely accomodating, friendly, and constantly to make sure our experience was going smoothly. The food was pleasantly good and they have great portions too. Absolutely satisfying. The Dutch Babies and Baked Eggs were my favorite food there. I highly recommend this place.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Went here for lunch and it was fantastic. The coffee really good. I got the warm bread and jam, the baked eggs, and one of the specials (wild rice cakes). Everything was delicious. Highly recommend! Get there early, they fill up quick any day of the week.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Although Tilikum Place Cafe was not originally on our itinerary, its reputation preceded it and we couldn't help but step in as we strolled towards the Space Needle. This turned out to be one of the most rewarding decisions we made that day!If you're planning a visit, take it from us - make a reservation. We were fortunate that a table became available due to a no-show, but it's clear that this place is popular for a reason.The standout item here has to be the Dutch babies. Available in classic, sweet, and savory varieties, these delightful treats are the restaurant's pièce de résistance. Note that they take 25-35 minutes to prepare, but they're worth every delicious moment of anticipation.Our choice was the savory option, an irresistible combination of pancetta, asparagus, spring garlic, and provolone. Served fresh from the oven, it was an indulgent medley of gooey, cheesy goodness enveloped by perfect dough. A hint of hot sauce, thoughtfully brought to our table without prompting, added just the right zing.Complementing our meal was the French onion soup - a sinfully decadent rendition, amplified with crouton, Gruyere, and bacon, and a distinct red wine flavor that made it one of the best I've ever tasted.What sets Tilikum Place Cafe apart, beyond its incredible food, is the ambiance and staff. The entire team is friendly and the space is warm and inviting, creating a comforting environment akin to dining at home with loved ones.Tilikum Place Cafe is more than a meal, it's a memorable dining experience that resonates long after you've savored the last bite. Highly recommend!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great times here. We had such a blast can't wait to be back. One good thing in Seattle !

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The food was absolutely delicious at a great price! We came as soon as they opened so we were easily able to get seats. I recommend having a reservation just in case though as it gets busy quickly. Just a warning, the sweet Dutch baby will stain your mouth and teeth dark purple from the berries! It's worth it though for the taste.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Super friendly staff! And the savory dutch baby was delicious!! This is a popular spot, so you should call a day or two in advance to add your name to the cancellation waiting lists

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The best brunch place ever. Love the food,  Ambiance and the service is the best ever. You have to try the german pancakes!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Adorable location, friendly service and good food and drink. Would definitely return.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food..Great service!!! Make a reservation and do not miss out on a great experience.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Awesome food, super friendly and knowledgeable staff, there was some waiting to get table but rest all went great. I ordered a quiche and blueberry dutch baby pancake. Latte was nice too. Not very spacious but enough for a brunch place in downtown.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We've probably been here five times. We love the food, the wine & the staff. It's a super welcoming place & the food is wonderful. Make sure you make a reservation.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The food was amazing . The service was very good and I received the food very fast .Everything was wonderful! Highly recommend

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I've always had great food and service at Tilikum Place Cafe. The employees, especially the girls who are usually at the cash register, have always been exceptionally friendly and respectful, even when there's a huge rush! Let's remember that working in a busy and popular restaurant is not always easy, and we should keep our advice for people just trying to do their job and serve us food to ourselves.The dishes coming out of that kitchen looked amazing. Our food was great and the service was super good as well. Extensive menu and we already tried some of their food. The Baked eggs, Dutch Babies, Eggs Benedict were so great and really delicious. Can't wait to go back. I highly recommended this place. Must try.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The food was absolutely phenomenal and the service was amazing!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I came here with the family and everything was going great. When the manager came and introduced himself for no particular reason. He asked about our experience and we ended up striking a conversation. He even offered to buy us a desert on the house. I love when this happens because it means that management truly cares. I will be coming here more often.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This place is in walking distance of my place. I come here once a week. The food is always fresh and made to order. I have never not had something that wasn't delicious on the menu. The drinks are strong but delicious. If you want somewhere reliable and consistent, this is the place to be.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: We love the restaurant so we figured we'd give it a shot. This place was a nice surprise when we were walking around downtown Seattle! The food is very good, and the staff is pretty good.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: So far, this is one of the best restaurants I've been to for breakfast. Visited this place recently and it was a great dining experience. The ambiance of the place was really great too. Amazing food and I could still remember the great food I ordered TPC Breakfast Plate was a good meal. It tastes great and very delicious. A good portion at a reasonable price. Great customer service. The staff was so accommodating from the start to the end. I'll be back again for another course of a meal.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I went to Tilikum the other day and was very happy with the experience. It was my first time being in this place and it's my first time having their DUTCH BABIEEEES! It was so good and delicious, I love the savory one and will probably have it again in the near future.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food & great service. Wished I lived here so I could go more often. Make this a part of your trip.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Carbohydrate ParadiseWow.... what a wonderful establishment!I can honestly say that there is nothing I do not love about this restaurant. The service, food, and atmosphere was all grade A. I was just walking by and saw the food from the outside and decided to stop in for some breakfast. From the minute I walked in the door I was greeted by a adorable little lady that gave me the best seat in the house (at the bar next to the kitchen) with no wait time. I order the Dutch Baby Savory with no bacon and the French Press Coffee. The coffee was perfect not to strong not hot. And OMG the Dutch was filled with a perfectly cooked broccoli with creamy cheese and super fluffy bread. If you love carbs and a great cup of coffee you have to check this place out.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: They serve the one and only onion soup I can not only tolerate but enjoy. It is perfect! Also, they have mastered the green salad. It's eye pleasing and delicious.If you really plan on trying this place out, call and reserve your table in advance! It's gets very crowded very soon. The space is nice, light and airy. Calm and relaxing atmosphere. Great experience.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: One of my favorite little spots in Seattle. I love the warm Chicken salad for lunch. Every soup is delicious. Dinner is always perfect, service fantastic and romantic lighting. Convenient place to stop before a show at the key arena, play at the Rep or a PNB performance.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: One of my favorite brunch places when I can get a reservation (which can be pretty tough when you are last minute or even a few days before a needed reservation) but when I can get in it's amazing. Always down for a dutch baby in both the sweet and savory version even though it takes longer to make than other meals but worth it. The ingredients that they use here are always fresh and taste amazing!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Older style service, kind of lax. Don't come here if you're trying to cut carbs haha. Everything is REALLY delicious. REALLLLLLY delicious. I loved the soup of the day (fish stew). Would recommend!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food and friendly staff. All my food was amazing i loves it all so much. My boyfriend got great food too. We were both super happy and will be back. Mmmmh im just thinking of the food now! Yum

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great local place, the broiled oysters are unbelievable.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Dutch babies are delicious. Make a reservation and all is well. Really delicious food and the specials are to die for.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I've been taking out of town guest to this place for for YEARS! Now I'm the "Out of town guest". It's still ALL THAT!,

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Deeeeeelish! There was a wait, but worth it.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Good food. You will come back often.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I got the baked eggs (attempted to ask for just egg whites) but due to recommendation of our server it would be too dry if I did that. The baked eggs were nice n fluffy and it has the meat and veggies right in there. So good! But I have to warn you, the breadcrumbs somehow always kept tickling my throat so be careful and don't breathe it down like I did.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Dutch Baby... Need not say anything else.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great Soy Latte and almond pastry.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Best homemade ketchup ever. Do recommend making a reservation because it's quite packed!!!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This place is awesome. French press coffee made at your table fresh! Had the purée lentil soup so good. Had a sweet Dutch pancake. Wow so good! And so much food. Enough for 2 to share. We also had the lamb and feta cheese Dutch pancake! Small cozy place. Very very busy we had to make reservation the day before and got there early and waited in line outside before it opened too but well worth it

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: A good brunch spot. Been around Seattle for a while so I feel like I am taking part of keeping 90's Seattle alive by eating here. Service is good even when it gets a bit cramped up in there. At times the brunch wait can be up to an hour-- but more power to them. Glad many like to go there and eat. Not there fault they are popular...can only seat so many folks at once. I have been treated like family and have become a regular. I like the fry up and the dutch baby.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The best brunch place in Seattle.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: The staff were so friendly and eager to talk about menu. The space is very open, great spot to grab happy hour and socialize.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Had Sunday breakfast at Tilikum Place Cafe on a recent trip to Seattle. I would suggest making a reservation because it was completely full. The cafe is very cute and quiet with a great view of the Space Needle from my window seat. The Savory Dutch Baby (the Dutch Baby is reason we came!) was fantastic and absolutely worth the trip. We also has a Pork Belly Benedict special and Baked Eggs with French Press coffee - all fantastic! Great food, service, ambiance and no wait with a reservation. You won't be disappointed.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Make a reservation, the place gets packed.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This is one of the best brunch places in Downtown/Belltown/SLU.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Went for a hot drink and they took extra special care of us with a great beverage and very friendly service. Highly recommended, you will not be disappointed!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Love the eggs. They do the spice right

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This place is great. I just moved to Seattle and was checking out new spots this week for lunch. Nice atmosphere. Will be coming back.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Loved the food here so much. Cant wait to go back!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Went there for an anniversary brunch. Amazing food, great Dutch Baby, excellent service. Will definitely return!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Thank you for making my birthday dinner so special. Everything we had was delicious. Thank you :)

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This place always has a great menu and is such a cute little spot to sit and people watch out the window. The staff is always knowledgeable about the menu and where the food comes from, and they have a great drink menu in addition to the bartender always making up something fun & new!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I had the BEST brunch here, although it was a very long wait without a reservation (not actually sure if they even do them). The dutch baby was incredible, but I've never had one before so not sure how it stacks up. I recommend trying it, though!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Good place to enjoy Brunch, Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner, always full, better make reservations, long lines/ waits for a table, good customer service, definitely a good treat

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Loved this place. Located in a cute neighborhood. The place gets busy but the service is good and the wait is worth it. Arrive early bc it gets packed. I had the bacon, cheese, broccoli skillet concoction (forgot the name, oops) and it was something worth the calories and time. All in all, what a cute breakfast cafe should be.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Absolutely delicious! The staff here is the bomb, I will be back so much more often!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Had a great dinner, awesomeJust had to let peopleTo know it's good to eat hereThe whole experience was awesome

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Some of the best food ever, and very pleasant wait staff.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great little place. They do take reservations, but we walked in and were assigned a table for 1 hour. Great breakfast! Fresh squeezed orange juice and homemade sausage and jam.Came back two years later and still AMAZING!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Wow I, a huge fan this place is amazing I will def be back. The staff is awesome and great people. Wow I just can't stop coming back. Yum

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Love this place! The service staff are all lovely people and very efficient. The egg breakfast sandwich was great. The food is not greasy and well served. You can get in and be out within an hour if you are in a rush and the waiters accomodate you and your schedule. Great place.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Excellent food and service, but a little pricey!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Best food in Belltown! Some plates delicate, some plates bold. All are good.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This restaurant deserves your dollar. I've eaten dinner twice, and both meals were excellent. Last night, my wife and I shared both a squash tart and an order of calamari stuffed with chorizo with martinis...then a wonderful bowl of parsnip puree soup. Our main courses were a pork chop and a dish of braised rabbit with spinach and mushroom dumplings...but something went wrong. Somehow, the chef thought we wanted the rabbit loin wrapped with pancetta. When the error was discovered in the kitchen, the dish was sent out gratis, and the correct braised rabblt dish was immediately fired. We enjoyed the rabbit loin... and probably would order it again! A very brief wait provided an interlude, then we enjoyed our (correct) entrees.I tell this story because the test of a restaurant is how it addresses problems, and they did a wonderful job of turning a problem into a delightful experience.The Tilikum Cafe is a wonderful, relaxing bistro, and you ought to try them out!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Dinner service and food is outstanding - everything is made from fresh, seasonal ingredients so items change very so often.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Delicious!! My favorite place to eat when I am in Seattle.: )

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Dropped by for brunch with a couple of friends. I had a chance to try everyones food and share some of mines. We had the eggs benedict, their fry up, quiche and dutch babies. All of the food was great. Make sure you have reservations because it gets pretty busy. Enjoy.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Amazing food. This is one place I want to return to again and again. Excellent food, friendly staff and easy parking.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: This is a 5 star restaurant. The perfect spot and food is incredible. Food, service is amazing!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Used to come here all the time when I could walk. This place is great!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Sitting at the counter on a damp Seattle evening after 8 miles of sightseeing, hubby and I enjoyed a delicious meal in an inviting setting. Watching the chef work his magic was more exciting than some Cirque shows. Hubby had the chicken soup, which had lovely lime undertones. I had the grilled romaine salad with peaches, which was so good, I'm going to try to recreate it at home. Our main courses were the chicken, which understandably is a signature dish. The crusty skin, the herbs/spices, the juiciness of the meat, the mushroom sauce, all worked to create one of the best chicken dishes either of us have ever had. My pasta with hazelnut would have stood out except for how great the chicken was. We shared their signature dessert, profiteroles, served with vanilla ice cream and a caramel sauce flavored with my fav, cardamom. Hubs & I wish a restaurant like this would open in Las Vegas.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Attentive customer service, tasty food and an overall great experience.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: wowowowowowowowowowow this is the best food i have ever had in my life of 27 years i am extremly satisfied and i would like to come back here again and eat all this beautkufl tasty food.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Love this place, the service is as good as the food.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: loved it - loved the coffee, loved my breakfast, I had to wait but it was worth waiting for. Service could have been a little better but they were busy

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: My favorite place for lunch. Chic.Elegant.Timeless.Great food.A truly classic Seattle experience.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Dutch Baby!!! Worth the trip to Seattle.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food, not too loud.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Wonderful food and great service.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: great food and great people

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Had a wonderful steak and the atmosphere was extremely friendly. This is my third visit and will be back.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: AWESOME ...... Loving it. Definitely the place to enjoy relaxingLove the REAL ATTITUDE ... Never change

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food, great staff.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I read all the reviews and decided to give it a try, and my husband and I were not disappointed! We decided to "share" the beet salad, the pasta appetizer, the pork chop and a cheese plate (we selected only one cheese, but it was accompanied by all the amazing fixings.) Wow! The portions were appropriate, but if you're starving, order the pork chop. Every bite was delicious. While we are only visiting for a few days I would definitely return here anytimeA,

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Loved everything we ordered there. The most aromatic quiche I have ever had!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: So good!great service!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Excellent breakfasts, French press coffee and great service. Be sure to make a reservation.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Amazing brunch. Highly recommended.

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: love love love love that place, I love this little neighborhood, quite it , romantic, the food is absolute amazing like no other .

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: Great food and service!

name: Tilikum Place Cafe
text_review: I'm a big chicken when it comes to trying brand-new restaurants. I've got unreasonably high standards, and having been repeatedly disappointed by previous gambles on new places, I now prefer to wait until the reviews come in so I can have at least some assurance that I won't be wasting my money and calories. So my husband really had to twist my arm to get me to go to Tilikum Place Cafe for brunch this morning and, to be honest, the only reason I agreed to go is that I was starving and it's just one block away from our condo. "Be brave!" he said. "Uh-uh." "Cluck cluck cluck!" "Uh-uh." "It's right down the alley, you'll be eating in minutes!" Done!Well chalk one up for hubby. I was encouraged right away when I got what was possibly the best cappuccino of my life, served with a lump of raw sugar and a tiny little shortbread cookie. I felt even more optimistic when we split a tender, house-made orange cream scone. Then I knew everything was going to be okay when we got our main courses. I had a savory Dutch baby with delicata squash and goat cheese, served in the mini-cast iron skillet it was baked in, along with a pitcher of warm maple syrup, and my husband had baked eggs with spinach and bread crumbs. I'm not sure which was better. The eggs were tender and creamy and had those golden crunchy bread crumbs, but the Dutch baby was so light and right on the fence between savory and sweet. We also had a nice little baguette with butter and jam. If you're a quarterback, you're going to want to order more than we did, but for us it was the perfect amount of food, and incredibly our bill (for two people! in Belltown!) came to only $31. Our waitress was charming and attentive, and explained that the owner is also the chef, almost always a good thing in my experience. The food was easily as good as that at, say, Dahlia Lounge or Lola. I can't wait to go back for dinner. I think we're going to wear a groove in the alley between our condo and this place!

name: List
text_review: One of the worst dining non-experiences I've ever had.

name: List
text_review: I can't take food to go? Seriously? A tad arrogant me thinks.

name: List
text_review: Generally great place, delicious food. The waiter was a nice person, however the waitress' behavior was strange. In my opinion, she should not be in a position to support the customer, she shows up in a big place.

name: List
text_review: The portions were very small, too small for Italian food. So small that we had to go to McDonalds after because we were still hungry.

name: List
text_review: The food was good but the service made it not worth the trip. We were told it would be a 25-30 minute wait so we got some coffee and came back 20 minutes later and the host told us they already called our name 5 minutes ago so now we have to go all the way to the bottom of the list. It took us an hour just to get a table.

name: List
text_review: I'm not sure what the hype at List is about. It's crowded 24/7 with types of people who can't hang because they're usually about to head to Amber after getting hammered here.The gnocchi are boring flour balls that gets slathered in 3 sticks of butter with a bit of truffle oil. I wasn't very impressed by them even though everyone waxes poetic. The calamari I had was too chewy and hardly fried that it lacked texture or crisp. With the crowd nonsense, it takes a long time before your food is ready.The only thing they have going on is their HH wine selection.

name: List
text_review: (Google Media) It's a really great environment. Spicy Meatballs are delicious! If your home drinks menu includes one, it's second to none. Water is second to last(originalThe atmosphere of this place is good. Spicy Meatballs Delicious! If your home drinks menu includes one, it's second to none. Water is second to last.

name: List
text_review: Just okay. The truffle gnocchi was delectable and the happy hour specials were pretty impressive--but everything else ranged from 'meh' to 'fine.'

name: List
text_review: Our visit was not successful. I ended up drinking soft foods for over a week due to a broken tooth at this restaurant. The local manager was fine but the senior management had an uncaring attitude could not be flexible to my situation. I found this to be very unfortunate and the worst form of customer relation. My case did not require anything out of ordinary since it only required the chefs to make a customized meal for me. The facts here were that I could either be asked to pay an extra cost or be advised on the other best alternatives. I tried to suggest this to the management and this is where I realized that the middle level management was accommodative of my suggestions, however they could not be able to make a decision without the top management. The unfortunate bit is that the top management felt that since it was a case involving one person it was insignificant. The management should seriously consider better ways of dealing with customers who require special services.

name: List
text_review: This place is certainly a good value because of the half priced happy hour specials, but the food is just OK. The wait is usually long, and the experience is not really worth waiting for. Service is very efficient and sweet, and the dishes are served rapidly to keep the tables turning quickly.

name: List
text_review: The food is good but service not so much. We had to keep flagging down our waiter to get his attention.

name: List
text_review: It's good for happy hour

name: List
text_review: Most of their food is above average. BUT, YOU MUST TRY THEIR DESSERT! That is the only reason that I keep going back.

name: List
text_review: Tight little space but atmosphere was great. Food was delicious. Come early if you want a seat or a table. Expect to wait.

name: List
text_review: This place is a gem! Delicious food, a wonderful atmosphere, and perfect service make it a great spot. The place is nice and clean, enhancing the overall experience.The meal was fantastic, with very good service. The server was attentive and friendly throughout, providing excellent service. The Spicy Meatballs, Grilled Caesar Salad, and Lava Cake were all worth it. A culinary experience that was truly delightful in every way!

name: List
text_review: Came on a Monday for all day happy hour, great way to try the place for the first time since it's half price during happy hour.Good food, good service and I think the price is reasonable for what you are getting. The place is a bit dark though and the bartender is also the waiter.That's why it can be a little slow sometimes. But he is really friendly, efficient and attentive. Food was fantastic especially the truffle gnocchi. We also tried the salmon and meatballs, it was alright.

name: List
text_review: The food at List was definitely the highlight of our experience. The menu had a nice variety of dishes to choose from and everything we ordered was well prepared and delicious. However, the reason we went to List was for happy hour and unfortunately, the ambiance wasn't quite suited for it. The lighting was quite dim and the space felt a bit cramped, especially since we were a large group of 13 people. Not the convivial milieu we were expecting.Despite this, the servers were fantastic and really did their best to make us feel comfortable. They were very accommodating and attentive to our needs, even going so far as to gift us a complimentary bottle of wine. We appreciated their efforts and thought it was a really nice touch.Overall, I would recommend List to anyone who enjoys good food in a cozy atmosphere. However, I would caution against bringing a large group for happy hour as the space might be a bit cramped. That said, I would definitely come back to List if I was in the area, but perhaps with just one or two other people.

name: List
text_review: Upon arriving at "List," I was struck by the intimacy of the establishment, and I must admit that the bar area felt a bit cramped. However, the modern and trendy ambiance more than made up for any minor discomfort. The subdued red lighting created an air of sophistication and elegance, and the overall vibe was one of conviviality and warmth.Once seated, I ordered the rigatoni, which was a heavenly combination of creamy sauce and tantalizing spices. The dish was presented with an artistic flair that belied the skill and creativity of the chef.Next, I decided to sample the bacon-wrapped prawns, which were both intriguing and tasty. The combination of the smoky bacon and the succulent prawns was a flavor explosion in my mouth, and while the bacon may have slightly overpowered the prawns, the dish was nonetheless a unique and enjoyable experience.To accompany my meal, I ordered a red blend wine, which was simple and elegant, with subtle notes of fruit and spice that perfectly complemented the flavors of my entrees.In conclusion, despite the small and slightly crowded nature of the establishment, "List" is a must-visit for any discerning foodie. The modern and trendy ambiance, combined with the exceptional culinary creations and attentive service, makes this a dining experience that is not to be missed.

name: List
text_review: I've always came in here for dinner, but I decided to come in here for lunch one day. Boy was I surprised. The lunch items were surprisingly much different than the dinner selections but there were also a few from the dinner menu. The selection was great in terms of different combinations. The portions were a bit smaller but all in all the food was great.

name: List
text_review: really good food, and the aesthetic inside is phenomenal!

name: List
text_review: My wife loves to dine at List, we've been there several times and have never been disappointed us. The service was great, the food was always good and the inside looks intimate. Must try their Chilean sea bass, it was great, tasted so delicious, my favourite on the menu. My wife enjoyed eating their octopus salad, she loves the flavour. The tables were full packed but it doesn't feel crowded. I like how organized the area was. Overall, we had a great time in this place. Better to check it out.

name: List
text_review: We've been there twice and the food is still on point as well as the drinks. My girlfriend craving for seafood so we ordered bacon wrapped prawns, grilled Chilean and octopus salad with a bottle of wine; it was delicious, we honestly enjoyed it.The place used to be my girlfriends favorite, coz literally, she loves pink and I was black. The good thing is this place matched up. Love the ambiance, the customer kept coming to this place, it became quite popular now.

name: List
text_review: It is a cute little place with it's perks.If you manage to find parking somewhere near, you are having a good day. Because it's so small a place it gets crowded pretty quickly, especially during their happy hours which start from 4:30. Everything on menu is half price, which, I guess, is great. But I personally prefer a dining experience not involving wait and noise.Now, once you're in you will want to start with a cocktail. I really suggest you sticking with cocktails, because I never had a good wine here. It is cheap, but because it's cheap, it's whatever. The cocktails, on the other hand are elaborated and good.Food is very tasty! I honestly suggest you try everything. Don't have favorites, but all is good.

name: List
text_review: Fantastic prawn dishes... Wine for 2 is perfect. Happy Hour as well

name: List
text_review: Cold, but very dark restaurant. It has an eclectic variety of dishes, among which Mediterranean cuisine. Most dishes are done pretty well. There is no reservation, and food comes when it is ready, and not immediately.

name: List
text_review: One of my favorite places for good eats! Seriously, this place doesn't have a bad thing on the menu and I have tried almost everything. The gnocchi in truffle cream is heavenly and one of the many reasons why I come back,along with great cocktails!

name: List
text_review: Food was delicious. Happy Hour specials were great. Staff was extremely friendly. Will definitely go back when I'm in town.

name: List
text_review: It's is a nice spot to have some coffee and relax reading a book. On the other hand the quality of food leaves a bit to be desired. Other cafes in area offer better quality of food.

name: List
text_review: I found that the prices are quite high with any other party, this restaurant can't be cheap. Everything was very tasty.

name: List
text_review: tried this place last night and it was delicious!!! i had their calamari which was on point and also their desserts are pretty good as well. i will be coming back to this place a lot more now that i have discovered it and also good place to take a date.

name: List
text_review: The food was excellent and very well priced. Even without the happy hour deals the dishes range from 8 - 14 dollars; which are fantastic costs for this particular market. I 'd the happy hour wine and loved it very much. Happy hour costs stone! The staff is extremely friendly, particularly the owner Leo. We had an excellent time there, eating yummy food, drinking great wine and chatting up w/other patrons and staff. I 'll definetly go back and highly recommend it.

name: List
text_review: Great food. Great taste! I'm giving it 4 stars bc they are always busy and it can get a bit crowded. And the wait times are a bit long. But just means they must be doing something right.

name: List
text_review: This place has an amazing happy hour. The food is SO good, great service, great atmosphere.I'LL BE BACK.

name: List
text_review: Great prices and friendly wait staff. The food is hit and miss. We ordered calamari, seared tuna, burger, bacon prawns and mussels. The seared tuna had no seasoning on it, not even salt/pepper. Mussels were okay. Bacon prawns sat upon a kale salad that was so spicy I couldn't taste the kale. Calamari was good, nice seasoning and crispy. Burger and fries were your standard fare. We'll be back because the pricing is affordable but we'll see about what we order next time.

name: List
text_review: Sunday was half off day! Tried the gnocchi, mussels in a spicy tomato sauce, sea bass, and bacon wrapped prawns. The mussels were my favorite- so tender and juicy without a speck of sand. The prawns were a little disappointing, kind of overcooked. Service was great and friendly. Wait was around thirty minutes without reservations. Very young and hipster hangout. Bar area looked cool- the table was lit up with red lighting.

name: List
text_review: Great menu and very attentive and knowledgeable staff. I will definitely return here!

name: List

name: List

name: List
text_review: H     H    H    HHHH HHHH  H   HH     H  H H   H   H H   H   H HHHHHH  HHH  HHHH  HHHH    HH    H  H   H  H      H        HH    H H    H H      H        HH     H  HHHH   H   H  HHHH    H     H  H   H  H   H  H   H   HHHHH  H   H  H   H  HHH   H    H  H    H  H   H  H  H       H    H  HHHH   HHHH  H   HEven before you get to Seattle, you'll notice how expensive everything is starting with your search for a hotel. Thankfully List has an amazing Happy Hour with ridiculously cheap prices for exquisite eats...all food is half price!!!3:00-5:00pm AND 9:00-11:00pm, which we attended the later for a late dinner. Night time the interior is modern and chic with a red glow...though a bit too dark for my tastes. Thursday night the friendly staff quickly seated us, but I imagine Friday or Saturday this place will be crowded.$6 Glass of house red wine...can't beat that price!$10 HH Price...Handmade Gnocchi with black truffle cream...yum! $10 HH Price...Local fresh clams, herbed white wine broth...yum!$10 HH Price Columbia River steelhead(salmon), spicy cilantro pesto...yum! And this way better and bigger than the $32 salmon dinner I had a Lola!The food came out quickly which was amazing given the exceptional quality. Service was almost perfect until the very end of our meal. I know there is a labor shortage, so the bartender was helping bus for the one lone waitress. While clearing our table, she accidently splashed a bit of clam broth on my wife...opps! She gave a verbal apology. We didn't press the issue since everything was already so cheap, but it was bummer to end the evening...otherwise this place is great, and the BEST Happy Hour in Seattle!

name: List
text_review: One of the best happy hours in the area! Super fast service & perfect portion sizes to try everything... and yes, we tried one of almost everything!

But the waitress reassured me that there were some great options on the menu and then proceeded to suggest some. The dish I ordered was very tasty the seasoning was great and not too spicy. If you like spicy or don't like spicy, this is a great place.

text_review: We absolutely loved this place. Small, cool atmosphere, and awesome small plates, seems that even the pickiest of eaters can find something here. The octopus salad and chicken with mushrooms were our favorite dishes. The beef tenderloin was awesome too, however it was served as a large piece and I wish it was cut. And the dessert was awesome. The hazelnut ice cream was incredible. Our server was extremely attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. Great food and an even greater value!

name: List
text_review: Wonderful location in Beltown

name: List
text_review: What a wonderful place to end the day. Went here on a Friday night.The food was amazing. The octopus salad was out of this world. I also recommend the amazing gnocchi.Our server was very pleasant, and our glass never got empty.We would eat here again.

name: List
text_review: amazing gnocchi! great atmosphere too.

name: List
text_review: Excellent drinks and food. Staff is super helpful! Will definitely be back again before returning home. Loved the drinks ambiance and decor

name: List
text_review: My gf and I were in Seattle for the first time this week from SoCal, and we stumbled across the place while walking exploring the city. The food was amazing! We went last Sunday night and didn't know that it was happy hour, which was a pleasant bonus. Literally everything we ordered was great, I wish this place was in my neighborhood. The gnocchi, sea bass, and the octopus salad were delicious. Great service,food, and even the bathrooms were dope. If I lived in Seattle, I would go here every week!

name: List
text_review: List is by far one of my favorites in Belltown!

name: List
text_review: This place is PERFECT for happy hour. The ambiance is dark only lit by candles during the night with music playing in the background. Their menu items are half off during happy hour. Trust me you will not be disappointed. We left on a full stomach we could barely finish our food we ordered so much because of the pricing being incredible. We also just wanted to try a little bit of everything. They serve Macrina bread which if you've never tried, is absolutely incredible. The flatbread is a must try. Thick and delicious. The clams are also served with a tasty broth that makes an incredible combination. Their desert cake is a MUST. warning it is very rich. Overall if pick this place again for good happy hour food.

name: List
text_review: This place is PERFECT for happy hour. The ambiance is dark only lit by candles during the night with music playing in the background. Their menu items are half off during happy hour. Trust me you will not be disappointed. We left on a full stomach we could barely finish our food we ordered so much because of the pricing being incredible. We also just wanted to try a little bit of everything. They serve Macrina bread which if you've never tried, is absolutely incredible. The flatbread is a must try. Thick and delicious. The clams are also served with a tasty broth that makes an incredible combination. Their desert cake is a MUST. warning it is very rich. Overall if pick this place again for good happy hour food.

It's a little loud but nothing overwhelming.

text_review: A friend and I tried List for the first time yesterday and were very satisfied with our experience there. The food was fantastic and very well priced. Even without the happy hour deals the dishes range from 8 - 14 dollars; which are great prices for this economy. I had the happy hour wine and enjoyed it very much. Happy hour prices rock! The staff is very friendly, especially the owner Leo. We had a great time there, eating delicious food, drinking good wine and chatting up w/other patrons and staff. I will definetly go back and highly recommend it.

text_review: It's pretty small; you'll have to be lucky to not wait for at least 10 minutes, but the food is worth it.
