text_review: i've been to this place many times and i absolutely love it. great customer service and many different food options. although its quiet a drive for me from kirkland but me and my husband take a trip down there every once in a while. this place was recommended to by my best friends and i would recommend this to all of your as well. A+++

name: List
text_review: When I sit down at List, I get this sense that whenever Ikea starts feeling insecure about the reputation of their quality, they'll compensate by sticking their crap inside restaurants that serve good food. So that if ever I purchase white, plastic chairs sturdy enough to brave a Bangladeshi child and gaudy, red, plastic-looking chandeliers for my home, it'll feel like I am eating at List. I guess the more I sit on that thought, I wouldn't be totally against it. I used to be anti-tapas, just because I always viewed them as calorie-ridden appetizers you eat before you indulge in a Five Guys Bacon Cheeseburger. List has changed my mind; tapas are a novel idea. Given the flavors in every dish, it's surprisingly filling and at a great price, too. All of the food here is prepared extremely well but the main stars for me go to the Spicy Meatballs, Chilean Sea Bass, and the Bacon-wrapped Prawns. Don't put me in the same room with those things at the same time; otherwise, what will ensue is a chapter of deleted expletives.The Chilean Sea Bass is an essential fatty acid heaven on top of kale and farro. Whatever sauce they use with which to cook the farro is something I don't want to figure out but I will forego any diet to have more of this dish. The Spicy Meatballs are perfect and there are no adjectives I can use that will make it sound any less inappropriate. Something along the lines of tender, well-seasoned, and has a great sauce. I could cradle them against my bosom and read poetry to them as I tuck them into bed at night. The Bacon-wrapped Prawns is self-explanatory. Like the Bible, you just pick it up and you know where the night's going. The gnocchi and the mushroom soup deserve an honorable mention, as well. Although I am not sure I can say the gnocchi is a must-have being that it's not unique to List and it's not that satisfying because you will definitely need to order something else to complement the dish. It's worth ordering a bottle of wine during happy hour. When you polish off half the bottle in under an hour, you'll get to stumble out of the restaurant like an idiot as I do on occasion.I enjoy their limited menu because it makes it easier on me. I feel like having or being given too many choices is more suited for children under the age of 10. Also with a limited menu, it makes it a no-brainer for the chefs in the back so you get your food quickly but also with an emphasis on consistency. I've been here twice and have had about six or seven different items, all of which have been a hit thus far. It's also a bonus when you're with somebody who knows what they're talking about, as well. This is a touchy-feely, close quarters type of restaurant. When you're there, particularly the bar area, it can start feeling as if you're on a date with everybody sitting there. The music is loud and then the people respond to that by being loud. Small prices to pay for a great meal whether or not it's happy hour.

name: List
text_review: I've been several times, and have yet to be disapponted by any aspect of the experience - the food has never been anything less than excellent, it's run by an Itallian family, who, it seems to me, love running a restaurant, making the service great (stop by once or so weekly and they'll actually remember your name), and it's never overcrowded or noisy, though reservations wouldn't be a bad idea. That said, it's not cheap, but you won't wind up paying $15-20 for an entree if you choose by price. It's one of my favorite local restaurants, if not my absolue top, and, having lived here my entire life, that might be saying something...I rated List 5 accross the board, simply put, because it is.

name: List
text_review: A bit on the louder side, but impressive food

name: List
text_review: These brothers dominate the restaurant business. So grateful they brought the Modern World Dining Experience to Seattle.

name: List
text_review: Amazing food! This is definately a must try!!

name: List
text_review: Love tapas, but the selection is rather limited in the Seattle area. This is the best place I've tried so far. I will be back.

name: List
text_review: We went to happy hour and found terrific food for very little cost. I can hardly wait to go back and I plan to tell all my friends. Great Place!

name: List
text_review: This is my favorite happy hour in all of Seattle! My boyfriend and I have been several times and are totally blown away by the ambiance, the courteous service, and amazing drinks and food. All day Sunday Happy Hour - So great! Chic and casual at the same time. Just found out they have a sister restaurant... so excited to check them out too! Order the gnocchi!

name: List
text_review: Have held business meetings here. I really like it!

name: List
text_review: This is by far the most satisfying happy hour place in WA. Their food is delicious, savory, and of high quality.Bacon wrapped florida prawns: Large prawns with bacon on top on bed of beans and kale. Everything about it was great. Highly recommend this one.Mussels: Soft and saucy. The mussels are cooked perfectly and the marinera-like sauce was great for dipping in.Grilled octopus salad: A must have! The octopus is so tender, I can't believe it was octopus! The salad is very citrusy, which I loved. It had quite the kick. Highly recommend this one, too, especially since this is hard to find elsewhere.Gnocchi: The little gnocchis were good, but what makes this dish great was the sauce! The black truffle sauce was very yummy. You'll want to lick the plate at the end.Desert: Ah, I tried just because it was the only dessert they had. I would skip it next time. Nothing too exciting about it. Very small, too. Overall, I do love this place. Great, simple dishes with bold flavors and great presentation.

name: List
text_review: We just had dinner at List- warm service, fabulous food and amazing wine! Our Server Jackie was just an absolute doll! Highly recommended this darling gem!

name: List
text_review: Awesome food! And a great happy hour! The staff is very friendly and wonderful people

name: List
text_review: Can not wait to go back! Great service, absolutely delicious food!

name: List
text_review: My wife and i decided to give it a try while wandering downt the street and found ourselves beyond pleased!The happy hour is unbeatable. We ordered grilled seabass and roasted duck (each $6 / $7) and found ourselves amazed by the portions and used our bread to mop the plate. Ontop of this, our server was incredibly sweet and helpful.We found out (only after our meal!) that it is under the same ownership as both Barolo and Mama Melinas, which we also love.This is a must try! Particularly the happy hour!

name: List
text_review: a few friends and i stumbled upon this place for happy hour. it is amazing. the happy hour is from 4-630 and late nights on weeknights from 10-12. the food menu says that it is small plates but the dishes are anything but small. you can definately have a great meal for a reasonable price. italian flare. we got a wonderful bottle of wine for $14 and had a nice evening at this place. the atmosphere is fun with funky chandielers and a red bar. great quality and atmosphere for a cheap price. our server was friendly and took good care of us. it was pretty empty when we were there but when people find out about it its going to be packed. check it out...

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Seriously meet the moon? I spend $15+ on a grilled cheese with tomato soup and fries and this is how many fries you provide? Terrible service... sandwich and soup seem fine.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: We went in on Sunday the 24th at 1:30. They forgot to teach the service part of the service charge to their employees. The little Asian chick with the print romper was terrible! She sat people way out of order and, didn't apologize didn't seat us promptly and said "yeah I've got bigger tables to seat". She needs some training, or they need to hire an actual host.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: The place is nice, the food is underwhelming, but fine. Parking is a bitch, and the clientele here are me-firster Seattle trash and entitled tourist scum. I will probably never be back.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: The food is nothing wrong but tastes really so-so. Also over priced... Not a fan of it.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: The food and drinks were good, but the portions were a bit smaller than expected. We enjoyed all that we ate and drank .

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: I only give it a 4 because the service was slow. Never came to ask if we needed anything. Food came out before mimosas. But the food was fantastic!

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Awesome for brunch/dinner, the service and food is always incredible and definitely save room for a cinnamon roll!

name: Meet the Moon

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: food was great! we loved all our dishes. they were great accommodating our pup too!!!

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Breakfast meal. The ambiance and decor were excellent. Low noise volume. Good selection of coffee, espresso, etc., and coffee was good.Food is rated a few points below/lower than another popular breakfast place and prices were a few dollars lower. Meet the Moon has a nice feature...large outside covered patio. I will try their lunch menu when the climate permits outside eating!

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Awesome service! Yummy food! Super flavorful, with tons of options. They accommodate many food restrictions (Vegan, Vegetarian, Allergies)!! Have a full bar, with very innovative mimosa options! We left very satisfied.The service was good too which is rare these days. The interior is cute and clean too so I'd definitely return.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Huge quantities, warm service, and outstanding cuisine! Everything about the waffle breakfast sandwich combo! Also present are the grits! After tasting this delectable homemade food, I will never look at chain restaurant breakfast the same way!

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: You are erring if you choose to go elsewhere. The flavor of the espresso is fantastic, to start. The latte had been expertly made. The eggs Benedict were wonderful and comfortingly creamy. And there are a ton more options available. Excellent dining experience at a diner. Absolutely among my top 10.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: The food was delicious, it was hard to decide what to order. We will for sure be back.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: The cost and quantity sizes at this restaurant are excellent. The food is excellent and delicious. Every member of your group will be bale to select something from the extensive menu to suit their particular palate. The price is undoubtedly affordable. The Carne Asada Skillet and Avocado Toast were both excellent.The place is well-liked. Overall it is a good place to eat good food. I highly recommend it to all.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: We had a wonderful brunch here. I had the farmhouse bloody mary and breakfast tacos with carne asada. My wife had a grapefruit bellini and a breakfast sandwich with chicken sausage. All the food was delicious. The service was a little slow due to how busy it was but our waiter Michael was fantastic.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Great food! Excellent service Worth the stop!

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: This restaurant is one of the excellent restaurant. Of all restaurants, I know I prefer it most. I will always get an opportunity to stop here. Whenever I feel like having a superb meal, this restaurant comes straightaway to my mind. Love the french toast, veggie Scramble, and Carne Asada Skillet. Great breakfast meals and options are pretty amazing. Great and food and a rich menu, courteous team, and great mood.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: I love this spot in Leschi. It is right on the lake, and it a great spot for brunch or coffee. They have a nice little patio that is open in the summer, and the garage doors open up to make the entire spot feel bright and breezy. There is a great bar as well and the food is fantastic. I love the service here. They remember you, and even remember favorite drinks etc. This is the perfect spot for locals. Highly recommend the scones, or biscuits and gravy with fried chicken! If you are in the mood for a cocktail, the big negroni is perfect.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Delicious Wonderful service  Very flavorful food Love this spot , highly recommended

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner tonight. You could tell it was understaffed as there were only three waitresses, one of which working as the host, but everything was great and pretty speedy. Super romantic and all the food was delicious.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: This is probably my favorite place for breakfast; I went with a big group and everything we ordered was so good. It's a small place but it's worth the wait. Clean and friendly service.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: This charming restaurant called Meet the Moon is right by the water and is an all day eatery. Brunch/lunch stops at 4:00pm. Literally everything on the menu sounded phenomenal but I ended up going with their Salmon Corn Chowder, Carne Awadallah skillet and Biscuits & Gravy! BUT it wasn't just any gravy - it was mushroom gravy with two poached eggs. So with ordering 3 things we didn't have any room for dessert which is a pity because they're cinnamon rolls looked BOMB. Make sure you save some room for dessert (I know I will next time I'm there)! But I highly recommend the 3 above dishes I was more than happy to indulge in On the drinks side, if you're a cold brew fan you HAVE to try the cold brew tonic. It's supposed to be a "hit or miss" but me personally thought it was amazing! Our server even gave us free pastries after the meal. Highly recommend this spot IG @stephaniejltan For more foodie adventures

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Amazing burger. Got the special fried chicken tacos. And the drinks are amazing. The staff was amazing. Great music.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Cute little place, we were sat by the window, breakfast options were great and the wait staff were friendly and helpful. Perfect spot for brunch and parking was easy.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: This place was excellent. The wait is most definitely worth it. Go here and check it out.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: Love it! All good food, drinks, and service. Been here a few times and it never disappoints.

name: Meet the Moon
text_review: I love this place. I have only been here once, but it's so good. Also, I didn't realize they were owned by the same group as Lot 3 and Purple. The breakfast is unique, it looks like a small family owned shop. So good!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: overrated

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Worst place I have ever visited.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: The food is horrible.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Very slow service, the staff has horrible attitude - very rude

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I had one of my worst exeperinces eating out when I visited this restaurant a few weeks ago. It wasn't the food, the food was good. Overpriced, but good. It wasn't our waiter, he was great. It was the hostess and even more the bartender/manager. The hostess was rude and insulted us when we pointed out that several parties had been seated out of turn ahead of us. But the manager/bartender is a complete horror show. Her name is A. Wallace and she's the bartender with a lot of tattoos. She was obnoxious, rude and belittled us in front of the restaurant for "having a bad attitude". Apparantly we were supposed to be happy about sitting around for nearly 2 hours waiting to be seated while we watched party after party who came after us be seated. We were supposed to be honored to have the hostess be snobby and insult us when we asked to be seated. This whole experience would have been different had the hostess just apologized for her error rather than get defensive, or if the manager had not inexplicably confronted us. She was just awful and should not be working with people in any capacity. If/when this restaruant fails, the owners can easily point to her as a big reasons why.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: This resturant has some very serious service issues backed up by a very strong air of snobbery. As long as there are no issues that you bring up, you should enjoy your meal or you could end up with a terrible event like we did.I went to the Walrus and the Carpenter with family...party of 4. We had some delays in getting a seat due to an error made by the hostess. That error caused several other parties to get seated before us. When this error was brought up, the hostess quickly became very defensive informing us we "don't know the science of the restaurant business". After a few more words were said back and forth, the hostess offered to cover the first round of drinks. When we were seated, 2 glasses of Champagne where oddly placed on our table by the hostess with no interaction at all. We didn't order Champagne, and there were 4 people at our table not 2. If this was supposed to be our first round of drinks it made no sense at all. Our dinner itself was great. Our server was wonderful and the food was delicious. When the bill was brought...by the manager oddly enough...we noticed we were charged for all the drinks we ordered. We mentioned to her the issue with the hostess, as well as the offer she made and the oddly placed champagnes. I did not get the name of the manager, however she is the woman with the tattoos that I assume most every other negative review on yelp is about. She, like the hostess earlier, quickly became very defensive and rude. She mentioned that she would be willing to help us more, however she felt we were very negative. This situation with the manager was the strangest interaction I have ever had with anyone in a service position. She continued to school us, in front of the rest of the restaurant, on our attitude. She then banned us from ever returning to the resturant. During this mind wrecking event, I mentioned to the manager that this was just bizarre. That was my interaction with the manager, and that got me banned. That was it. No yelling, no foul language, nothing. My partner left the restaurant during this interaction without saying a word due to the absurdness of how we were being treated. It is sad that a beautiful restaurant with great food, and at least one great server, is doing the easiest thing to do right (the hiring of a good hostess and a service oriented manager) horribly wrong. Treat your customers well and they will spread the word about your great food. Treat them like this and you don't have to ban them because they will never return and they will spread the word about the horrible customer service. The owners really need to rethink their staffing and read the reviews on yelp. That manager is a Grimm Reaper in your restaurant, killing off your customers 4 at a time.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Have a sign that all races, genders and religions are welcome and then blast misogynistic rap music. Uhh...what the actual f*ck?? They are confused here.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Simply not that good.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Loud, crowded, overpriced and trying too hard to be cool.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Yet another over-hyped and over-priced restaurant from a Seattle "serial" restauranteur (why does one chef need so many restaurants???). The food is OK, but is neither worth the wait nor the over-the-top accolades.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I'm sure its good if you could actually get in - two to three hour waits. Maybe they could take reservations? That would be good.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: With the Union Oyster House and the Grand Central Oyster Bar his normal stomping grounds, and gout just being something you live with in order to keep eating raw shellfish, I would consider my father a bit of an oyster expert. Some pretentious PNW restaurants no longer stoop so low as to serve cocktail sauce to accompany our pearls of the sea, but if a 70 year old man who has eaten more oysters then your entire wait and cook staff combined asks for some cocktail sauce, I don't care if you have to high tail it all the way up to Kings to steal some ketchup, but you should make it happen. And please save the lecture about the "right" way to eat a PNW oyster, being so "delicate" it requires only the most minimalist of accompaniment. Each trip my father makes out here from the last great seafood mecca of New England, I try to show him just how great the shellfish is in the PNW. Instead, you showed how out of control the snobby foodie culture has become in Seattle. While riding the great Ballard Ave bandwagon to success, you have forgotten you table manners. Respecting your elders falls much higher on the food chain than oysters.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: As long time patrons of the Boat Street Café (we go back to when you were intimately located on Boat Street), my wife with our friends looked forward with full anticipation to wonderful dining experience last evening at The Walrus and the Carpenter - sadly we were disappointed. While we appreciate the need for table turns, Joe our waiter seemed distant, uninformed on the cuisine and clearly was pushing the course rate to free up the table ("Please don't take our plates yet."). Our primary culinary disappointments were resident with the overcooked grilled sardines, the undercooked (virtually raw and dripping with fat ) pork belly and bland cheese course (served with oiled (?) walnuts and celery slices) - we did send the pork belly back and our waiter and the kitchen staff agreed with our assessment. Our waiter did provide a free dessert course in consideration for the undercooked pork belly. On a positive culinary note the shigoku oysters, snow creek oysters and green olives were wonderful. All restaurants have off nights for service and cuisine, possibly this was so for The Walrus and the Carpenter.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Nice place i like to visit there . Really recommend good service yes sure .... Recommend again

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Visiting from out of town I wanted to have as much seafood and oysters as possible while in Seattle. We tried all of the oysters and most of the seafood items on the menu. I had hoped to try some creamy oysters from Puget Sound, so I was a bit disappointed to find rather briny ones. We liked most of the other seafood dishes, including the crudo's, fried oysters, and the clams. We did not enjoy the sardines with walnuts, however. I thought the walnuts overpowered everything and the sardines didn't taste different from canned ones.The service was excellent and I am glad to have tried this restaurant, but I would not particularly recommend it as a special place to visit.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Not a great variety of food at all. Some things looked like they had been sitting out for a long time. Don't know what was up with the staff they working is slow. Expensive price.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Make sure to get there on time if you plan to go their happy hour, the first hour is 50% off and second hour is 25% off. Don't want to wait too long to miss the deal

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Great food, but the service took away from the experience.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Food is spectacular and the oyster selection is unbeatable. I like the unusual side dish selections as well (radishes with cold unsalted butter - who would have thought!) However, I can't give this a top review for two reasons: 1. the prices were pretty steep. 2. the wait was unbelievable. However, the food is good enough that it's probably worth both the cost and the wait. Better solution: go on a weeknight!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: love the vibe and the good food. i come back often

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: nice food, nice menue, nice ppl. the 16% charge is not necessary

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: The food is good, the wait isnot. The ambiance is good but the crowds are not. Why, oh why, won't you take reservations?!?

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Upbeat and friendly, the food is also just out of this world. Prices are fair, and the patio is a great touch. I'll be back asap!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Absolutely delicious food and excellent service. You can't go wrong with the fried oysters. A definite must try, you won't be disappointed. Having never really rated raw oysters before I didn't know if I would like them, but once again I was wrong. The oysters were the star of the meal. We tried the halibut carpaccio tonight. It was light with spices that enhanced the natural flavors of the halibut. he staff were all courteous helpful and extremely nice you almost feel like you're part of the family. I will def come back here to try more!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Love the place. Enjoying a glass of fresh cocktail and some handcrafted small plates.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Delicious oysters, clams, sardines, etc. Great bottle of wine. None of which is a cheap date. A little hard to find and small so it can be crowded with a wait.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Great food and very friendly service.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: The food here was really great.  If you like quality seafood and are willing to pay the price for it and willing to wait a little while for it, then give this a try. I will say that I can't give it the full 5 stars because it's on the expensive side and the atmosphere can be so crowded that it takes away from the experience and causes a bit of wait time. Staff was also very nice and drinks were made well.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: What a joy to eat! Every clam was open and I found no grit in any single one. The clams were small, but tender and the broth was savory until every last drop. I finished it off with the complimentary sourdough bread.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Nice place if you can get a table! I've only successfully been here twice as they don't take reservations and it's sometimes a 90min wait. It can be a little frustrating. That said, the food is spectacular! The oysters are so fresh, and the waitstaff are super knowledgeable about all the varieties. Good variety of small plates too!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: oysters are awesome. love the steak tare tare. usually get lucky without a wait but otherwise come early

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: so-so

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: A friend and I ate here during the last Restaurant Week and enjoyed a wonderful Prix Fix meal. The petite filet steak, theThe Walrus and the Carpenter potatoes, the cauliflower, the breads, the dessert everything we had was perfect! The service was excellent, and the atmosphere of wonderful, old elegance made us feel so special. We just honestly couldn't find anything bad to say.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: A great place to eat and loved the atmosphere. You must definitely try this place out

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Ok place, but seems like a place frequented by old, bald, fat white guys who think they are black. Very Strange.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Good food, drinks are a little pricy, but overall a very good experience, enjoyed the ambiance!!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: We enjoyed our anniversary here and especially the steak tartare.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Always a bit of a wait, but well worth it. Just plan ahead. Oysters...best in the area.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Two words: Fried Oysters

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Good food, good atmosphere...long wait.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Just visited this gem in Ballard for the first time on Saturday night and I know I'll be back as often as I can! Try the halibut - you wont' regret it!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Get there early for happy hour. Those tables fill up fast.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: great food i love this place!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Great service and tasty oysters!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Awesome oysters! Get the steak tartare and scallop tartare :)

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: All around very nice. Oysters and sardines were wonderful?

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: This is one the best places in all of Seattle to have food and drinks the only problem is you better get there early because if you don't you might be an hour or two. I find that the service is always good and the place fills up quickly so if you are on a short time span don't try to go unless you have a few hours. The oysters are always so fresh and taste that I can't get enough of them when I'm drinking. One of there best kept secrets are the desserts you can't go wrong with any of them because I have had them all.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Great Oysters both raw and fried.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Been here a few times since they opened. Go for the oysters and booze. That's about all you need to know.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: we started with a half dozen oysters. 2 each of the 3 smaller kinds: hama hama, kumamoto, kusshi. really good. horseradish is awesome.i'm not a foodie, but i play one when i'm on here rating these cool places like this. more on why i call this a 'cool place' at the end. looking back at what we had, we had a lot of dishes: anchovy tartine, bread pudding, lev, pamplemousse, salmon tartare, sauteed baby turnips, and speck. it was a couple of weeks ago...the ones that stand out the most for me at this point are the anchovy tartine and speck and the oysters and the bread pudding. i'm not a dessert guy typically. so the semi-sweet bread pudding was perfect for me. very, very tasty!we sat at the bar, and it's pretty entertaining to watch the cooks and the service from the bartender was good. it's one big room. well lit. high ceiling.so about my 'cool place' statement. they don't take reservations. so you have to go and put your name down on the list and take your chances. it could be a while. so being a very busy weekend night i figured i would try to game the system a bit.;.. i budgeted enough time to be able to drive there, put my name down on the list, go pick up my date, then arrive back by the time my name was ready to be called. i told the host that that was my plan and he was cool with it. he agreed that the amount of time that would pass between putting my name down and returning *might* be just right. but no guarantees. i was already pretty hungry on my first drive over and didn't want to get stuck waiting forever to get seated, so there would be a dual benefit: i don't get annoyed at our wait. she don't get annoyed at our wait. my plan worked pretty well. our wait wasn't too long and there was a serendipitous side benefit: the place has no designated parking AND it's harder to find than usual. Even though I had never been there, I totally knew exactly where to go!I guess I could explain how the place is situated, but that would ruin your fun of having to find this place when you decide to go...

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Rocked the happy hour here the other day. 50% off oysters before 5. 25% off from 5-6. $1 off beer. There maybe other specials, but given that all I consumed was beer and oysters, I wouldn't know. If I'm lucky, Kumamoto oysters are on the menu. Those are my favorite. Fortunately, they get them pretty often. My only jib is that they would have a cocktail sauce to go with the oysters. They only provide a vinegar-based sauce and horseradish.I've recently tried their geoduck crudo and their fried brussel sprouts. I'd recommend both. Couldn't get enough. I really like bringing people here. It makes you seem like you're really in the know if you take them down the long hall way. Sure, if you come around from the backside it's right there. But come on! You're a Yelper. You are already in the know.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I really like this place, have been twice and the servers haven't made me crazy enough not to consider going again - close but not quite. The super cool zinc topped bar looks into the kitchen where hopefully the staff will start to be a little more interactive = take lessons from Harvest Vine. I like the lightness of the place, an interesting twist on a place in the back of a building, and it feels like you might smell the ocean from there because of it. Cool.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Welcome to Ballard. Finally more seafood in Ballard - just like old times - and good design to boot. I am liking it.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Excellent food and service. The food was delicious and great choices. Wait time was reasonable.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: If you have NEVER experienced fresh oysters I would definitely EAT HERE! I would highly recommend making a reservation. This place is incredibly popular. A fantastic variety of fresh oysters My boyfriend and I had never had fresh ones like these. Honestly, we didn't know much about how many different kinds and flavors oysters can have! The menu has all the names of the different types and it can be daunting if you have little knowledge of oysters However, our server directed us to try her favorites and educated us about the sweet vs. brine-y.Every oyster we tried was shucked fresh and had been delivered that same day. The owners of the restaurant are very involved and hand pick different oysters on a daily basis! So, it is very likely there will be a different menu selection each time you visit!Atmosphere was super fun! All the tables are very close together and really made the dinner experience unique. One of my favorite items was the bread and butter ! The butter was so delicious with large rock salt in it! Highly recommended!!!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Wow wow wow. This oyster bar is top tier. They do not take reservations but we had no problem waiting with some drinks at The Barnacle while a table opened up! The food is decadent, the drinks are drool worthy, and the service is superb. This is a date night MUST if you're in Fremont!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Portions very small, but good.The sardines were out of this world and so surprisingly good.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: The perfect happy hour spot. Delicious cocktails, tasty oysters, amazing steak tartare, and perfect grilled sardines. The best part though: the olive oil they used for the marinated olives and the sardines. I have never In my life tasted a more fragrant or delicious one.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Om! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom!Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom!Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom! Nom!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: We tried all of the oysters and they were all delicious! It was so fresh and the vinegar sauce that came with it compliment it really well. It is very strong so I would recommend dipping it with your fork to taste with the oysters before pouring it right on. I think it goes really well with the after taste of the oysters. So after swallowing the oysters will I get a taste of the vinegar. The baywater sweet was my favorite! Although it was the briniest on our menu, I thought it was a mild briny with a sweet aftertaste. You can't go wrong with any of the oysters though! We also ordered the clams and they were also delicious. Cooked perfectly, sweet, in a savory sauce. Service and staff were very friendly and prompt.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Every single course was exceptionally good- with a lot of flavour! The food portion size is a perfect balance. The atmosphere is also very peaceful n tranquil. Waiters can get overwhelming easily so you need to get their attention.Otherwise a lovely menu that is forever expanding. Go early as there sometimes can be a queue. Had the most amazing experience here! Everything from the service to the food was perfect from start to finish.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Consistently amazing food and service!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Oysters! If you love eating simple with a farm to table flare you will love eating here!! We love coming here for the variety of oysters offered and the presentation when they are served makes ordering around a must. The salads in the summer using both vegetables and fruits create pairings that you are not sure about until you enjoy that very first bite. Get there early cause there is a wait but everything about this place makes it worth it.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Even more delicious than expected! The menu items were so unique and tasty sounding I wanted to try everything on the menu!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Excellent service and tartare and oysters were great! I have never had a bad experience!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Really great place! Tartar is amazing.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Simply one of the best meals of my life.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: The Walrus and the Carpenter is definitely a cool place to visit. We enjoyed everything we ordered of the items we ordered. Oysters were very fresh and tasted great. The scallops were perfectly cooked and well seasoned. And the drinks were very good.It was a challenge to get a reservation since this place is very busy and we had small children with us with is probably not the best idea as this is more of a tapas bar than a restaurant. I would recommend making the reservations in advance and not bringing small children if you can avoid it as this place isn't the best environment for children, at least in my opinion, but great for adults looking for good food and great drinks.I'll definitely be back.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Bar is so awesome for your long wait which will be well worth it!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: The food and service is great here, the only gripe I had was having to wait for a seat, but totally worth it. The fried oysters, clam and steak tartare were probably the best of the many dishes we had. The food was reasonably priced for what it was. I would definitely come back and would try their happy hour.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: One of my favorites in Ballard and worth the drive no matter where you are. I don't know how many dozens of oysters on the half shell we've had here over the years but it would probably be several hundred. A perfect place for a glass of wine and nibbles on sunny days after walking the streets in Ballard and I cannot recommend highly enough.A must do in Seattle and is always a hit with visiting guests.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Unique and awesome! It sort of reminds me of an old diner but is very modern and classy. This is a great spot for oysters and the staff are incredibly knowledgable on the food and cocktails. If you need a spot to impress a date this one will do the trick!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Worth the wait.The oyster selection is incredible... everything from sweet to briny! Don't forget to try the steak tartare or the smoked mackerel salad. Delish

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Great experience! Service is top notch! Our meal was amazing! I highly recommend this location!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: everything I've had has been very tasty and very well done

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: great oysters!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: The food here is amazing, and the atmosphere is really great. Love the hip hop!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Heard the wait for this place was hours but worth it. Since they don't take reservations I made the drive over from the Eastside with my boyfriend on a Wednesday night. Arrived a little before 8pm and got a table right away. Very close seating but I cared about the food AND IT DIDN'T DISAPPOINT! Loved the endive salad! Best beef tartare I've ever had! And the bread and butter were totally worth the add on price. Oh and AMAZING OYSTERS!! (no surprise!) So glad I made it to this Seattle favorite! The bars within the building look darling too so if I go on a weekend I think the wait will be a fun one.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Superb! Must check out this great seafood place in Seattle.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Best oysters on the planet. Fabulous!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Soooooo delicious!!! Visiting from Denver and had such an amazing meal. Wonderful wait staff, and great food. The hype is true!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Educate yourself and eat tons of oysters!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: We plan to eat here at least once a season. Simply the best!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: With out a doubt, this is one of the best restaurants in Seattle. Arrive long before you intend to eat. They don't take reservations, but will put down your number and call when your table is open. They like to scare newbies away by saying it will take 2+ hours for a table. Usually it's much faster. The oysters are top notch. But the small plates are what set them apart from your standard oyster house. I have yet to have a bad dish. The food is creative, fresh and different.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Definitely a family favorite for good eats and fresh seafood! But the bread pudding for dessert is a DO-NOT-MISS!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Took forever to finally eat here but it was well with the wait. The Tatar (sp?) was amazing. One of the best meals I have ever had. Wish it wasn't so pricey or else I would eat here weekly!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Great food, great service, great vibes!!!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I ordered more oysters for dessert. Nuff said :-)

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Definitely the place to go for amazing oysters in Seattle. We had such an awesome experience we just had to go back the next day! The atmosphere is bustling and lively. I really liked the open kitchen where you can see the staff at work. My water glass was always full and the service was excellent. We got there early thinking we'd beat the wait, but everyone else had the same idea. The nice thing is there is a great bar next door that serves nice wines and appetizers while you wait.The waitress at the Walrus and the Carpenter made great suggestions for wine and was one of the most knowledgeable people about wine that I've come across. We ordered the scallop tartare, olives, Dinah's cheese, cabbage salad, dried trout, sardines, and octopus. For dessert we had the bread pudding. My recommendations are the oysters, the sardines, and the padron peppers. The cabbage salad was excellent with the sardines. Check it out! You won't be disappointed.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: there isn't enough good words to describe this place I had one of the best meals of my life there and its kinda cool that you can see right into the restaurant next door

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I saw this place on Anthony Bordain's show "The Layover" when he filmed in Seattle. Hands down the best oysters I've ever had. If you are an oyster nut like I am, you have to try this place. However be prepared, it's a bit pricey. However, well worth it!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I don't give five stars TOO often, so when I do you must know I mean it. I talk about The Walrus and the Carpenter to anyone who will listen. I've encouraged all of my fellow New Yorkers to go to Seattle simply for this restaurant, which is located in the Ballard neighborhood but could easily be mistaken for parts of hipster and "it"-scene Brooklyn.The local west coast oysters were shucked perfectly and were the freshest I've ever had. But I knew I was going to get good oysters, so I was equally thrilled by the other dishes and drinks on the menu. You can't go wrong with shishito peppers if they're on the menu toward the end of summer. And if you see the fennel salad on the menu, too, be sure to order it. I've been trying to recreate it in my own home for nearly a year now. Finally, save room for dessert. Fresh blueberry panna cotta melted in my mouth and was the perfect ending to a fantastic meal.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Love this place. Great drinks, oysters, and professional waitstaff!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: yep. amazing. get here. 'nuff said.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I would gladly say this is one of my favorite restuarants in the entire world! I am so glad Seattle is finally freaking embracing raw seafood, fresh oysters, and fresh flavors. MOUTH GAZM! It helps, too, that the staff is friendly and the drinks are tasty. We have been there probably 6 or 7 times now, once with the kids, and even they dug the food. Innovative, fresh, and delicous. But, please dont go, I want to keep this secret all to myself!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: While searching for a happy hour spot to go with my boyfriend, I kept entertaining the idea of The Walrus and the Carpenter. The two of us have never been self-proclaimed oyster connoisseurs, but we do have an affinity for all forms of seafood and shellfish, so we decided to give it a try. The location is hidden within Ballard, and while I don't think I'd want to be walking around there solo at night, the isolation does add to the charm. Lucky for us, we arrived around 5:30pm on a Tuesday (thirty minutes before happy hour ended) and only had to wait for five minutes. Still, it was surprisingly crowded. We ended up sitting at the bar, which I highly recommend if you're just casually going with a friend or date. As you can probably see from all the photos, the interior is intimate, yet bright and lively. Sitting at the bar truly added to this experience. I will admit, that type of dining environment isn't for everyone, and it isn't for every type of occasion, but for a post-work happy hour, it was perfectly light-hearted. My date & I decided to share a variety of plates: we started off with two of each oyster (one for each of us). As we were still there for happy hour, the oysters were less expensive (I believe 20% off, coming in around $1.50 per oyster). The oysters were tasty, but honestly, I probably don't know a superb oyster from a really good one. Those fried oysters, however, were to die for. You must order the fried oysters. The bartender suggested a Muscadet to pair with our meal, which ended up being a perfect addition; we ordered a pichet (about 55% of a bottle) that was happy hour priced. A lot of people have voted against ordering bread, but I'd actually suggest getting it. No, it isn't anything incredible, but it broke up our meal well and was used for soaking up the excess aioli from our fried oysters.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I love me some oysters & a great atmosphere!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: 2nd review ever!!!  This place is incredible!!!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: really great. i literally wondered aloud how food could taste this good.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I loved my date here. My only complaint is that calling ahead an hour got us a 2 hour wait. But if you love French wine and local oysters,  cheeses this is a great spot.Albert

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Memorable and downright awesome.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I try not to give five star reviews- I really do. To give a five star review is saying that the place couldn't do anything better. Everything was perfect. Period. That's damn near impossible to do! And yet, dammit, here I am doing just that.On several occasions- not just once- the place has nailed it across the board. Service, beverages, and the oysters- oh the oysters! Without a doubt the best selection and quality in the city.I do hope that someday they will be allowed to wipe out the parking lot that their patio sits in- wait! There IS room for improvement!- but other than that, I look forward to my next visit. You should too!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: We basically ordered everything on the menu and it was delicious!

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: So yummy! Can't wait to go back. Great decor. Friendly staff.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Long overdue review.....It was a bit tricky to spot at first, but I am not giving less stars because of that. Sometimes the gems are hidden, and I'd have no problem climbing a broken ladder to eat here again (or maybe just to have a late cocktail.) The staff is professional and attentive. I wish I remembered our server's name. :( My friend and I ate here months ago and we really enjoyed ourselves. The oysters, the small plates, the cocktails, and dessert were all fantastic to say the least. My favorite dish was the pork crepinette with romesco (recommended by a friend) and of course the Oysters! They had Fernet so I was pleased! The open kitchen gives a homey vibe, and the intimate ambiance feels pretty dang good...not to mention, it's beautifully designed...simple and elegant. It's one of my new favorite spots in Seattle.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: I hands down love this Oyster Bar in Ballard. We have not had oysters that fresh in a long time except maybe at the Brooklyn oyster bar downtown. My favorite oyster was a Pacific larger size that began with a T. We where able to get a seat up @ the bar to watch the clever shuckers and bartenders mixing up the love we where about to devour. Cool Decor.We can not wait to go back soon. Wonder if they will ever offer a oyster wine/stout/ or vodka "flight" in the near future? I am a big FAN of the Flight pairings but will just have to keep checking back in the meantime. We look forward to hanging out on the the deck out back with a group of our oyster loving friends to sample everything. everything on the menu.

name: The Walrus and the Carpenter
text_review: Oysters, incredible food, cocktails, mustaches. What more does a man need? Service is impeccable. Fried oysters, smoked trout, mussels, and chantrelles were out of this world. Effingham oysters on the half-shell were expertly shucked and served with a ludicrous champagne mignonette and horseradish. All around a great experience. Can't wait to go back

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The new Kedai Makan has been disappointing throughout. Today's experience was the icing on the cake where they denied us service at 10.05pm for a 10pm reservation because their "kitchen was closed". I cant understand how a restaurant would accept a 10pm reservation but deny entry 5 mins later. And this is when they were accepting reservations till 10.15pm. Thanks for a great friday night - I will never come back again.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Horrible horrible horrible service. They want you in and out and that's it, not worth it. Ruined our whole night

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Had a very bad experience. Very long wait. Didn't like the food. Not at all worth the wait.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: While the lack of takeout was infuriating at the old Kedai, I have gotta say the new one skimps on portion sizes and the out-of-this-galaxy flavor. You literally bought the recipes from the owners, why not stick to them? Take the flavors and portions they pushed out and add takeout - you will see a healthy profit AND a loyal fan base. For now, I'm holding off on this place again until they find the essence of their food, again.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: What was wrong with the old menu that we all knew and loved? Add drinks and seating, then it would have been perfect. But the new menu is nothing special, unfortunately.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: What we took away - I wasn't impressed. None of the dishes stood out. Kerabu Mangga - the mix of ripe and semi ripe mangoes in the salad didn't work, i was so excited to order it. The fried rice was too salty to taste on its own. It came with a sweet chilli sauce which was helpful. The pork ribs were good, but they were dry. I had heard good things about this place but maybe we caught them on a bad day.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The original Kedai Makan was one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle, but the new version is a bit of a disappointment. The new location has its pros (much bigger, almost no wait times, nice ambience) but seems to be missing what the original was known for--fantastic food. While the menu is similar, the quality of the food has gone downhill at the new location and the prices have gone up. The texture of the roti net bread was off, the dhal was super oily and missing the depth of flavor it once had, and the nasi goreng could best be described as "okay". The new location might be worth trying for an introduction to Malaysian food, but if you've visited the old, I'm not sure it'll live up to expectations. I was really looking forward to seeing this place come back to life, but I will not be returning.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: kedai makan would rate 3.5/5 stars. I really wanted to try this place before they close. Overall, the food was good but just not sure it was worth the hype. I waited in line since 10:30am to put my name down and got a table for 5pm. Their jala was delicious but other vegetarian options were ok. The pudding with longan berries was great!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: They had a variety of dishes but I believe they could cook better. I guess they have to serve a crowd so they do it fast and some out of it remains uncooked. And some part of it was a little burnt assuming it got overcooked a little. They are good on the quantity , have to match up on the quality.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: A recipe has no soul. The cook must bring soul to recipe. I would say this place partially succeeded in doing the job. I think it's a 3.5*, here is why -Ordered -Kerabu Timun Nanas : cold salad heavily loaded with peanuts and some curry powder I guess. Pineapple and cucumber are my favorite things on this world and this salad ruined it for me.Cocolife : rum, coconut cream and curry powder? Looks interesting right? Tasted like 2/5. Highly not recommended.Roti Jala: sounds like an Indian origin. Best of all the dishes I ordered. If you have tried rice crepes before, roti just tastes like that. Side of dal tasted delicious though.Malay fried peanuts: flavored peanuts that are crispy and tasty.Wait times are crazy, waited close to 1.5hrs. You see more than 4.5*, but honestly I'm not impressed.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: the food was good...and we would go there again.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: They make me wait for an extra hour. They could be more honest about it. In California restaurants will give you a complimentary drink or something. Last time here. There are plenty of good places in Seattle.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The food was absolutely delicious--big portions and full of flavor. The staff was incredibly friendly and seemed to genuinely love the food they were serving.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Oysters tasted great and fresh! They were the highlight. Tikka masala chicken katsu was an interesting fusion dish. It was good but not something I feel like i need to get again. I think I like the loco moco with scotch egg more. Seems like their menu rotates though since I didn't see some of the items I saw on yelp on their menu. Food was definitely on the pricier side but maybe thats expected from this being more of a bar? 3.5/5

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The menu items here were what drew me in to this spot and they did not disappoint. For a party of two, we definitely ordered more with our eyes, but everything just sounded so good that it was hard not to! We had the oysters, Seattle dog musubi, and loco moco scotch egg. The loco moco scotch egg was actually so filling that I had a good amount of leftovers. Looking forward to returning soon since service was friendly and attentive, and the food was tasty. I still need to try the oxtail risotto and tikka tonkatsu don!Highly recommend making reservations in advance, as the restaurant tends to get full pretty often.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: I visited this restaurant with my Malaysian boyfriend based on glowing online reviews. Finding truly authentic Malay food in America can be a challenge, so our expectations were high.Roti Jala: This dish surprised me because I had never tried net bread before. I found the chewy texture to be delightful, and it ended up being my favorite from the meal.Nasi Lemak: The dish was good, and the flavors were quite authentic. However, the sambal didn't quite hit the mark.Rusuk Babi: The ribs were fantastic, tender, but the dish overall was very spicy!In summary, the food was good and reasonably authentic. However, we might think twice about bringing his parents here.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: I visited this restaurant with my Malaysian boyfriend after reading excellent reviews online. We were excited to find authentic Malay food in the United States.Roti Jala: This dish surprised me because I had never tasted roti net bread before. Nevertheless, I enjoyed its chewy texture, and it turned out to be my favorite from the meal.Nasi Lemak: The flavor was pretty authentic, but the sambal didn't quite hit the mark.Rusuk Babi: The ribs were tender and delicious, but the overall dish was very spicy!In summary, the food was good and reasonably authentic. However, we might not bring his parents here.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: My recent visit to Kedai Makan left me with a delightful array of Malaysian flavors and culinary experiences. While there were some remarkable highlights, a few minor areas held back what could have been a perfect dining experience.First and foremost, the Nasi Lemak was a delightful choice, and opting for the tofu option turned out to be a great decision. The dish was flavorful and authentically prepared, showcasing the kitchen's skill in crafting this Malaysian classic.The Roti Jala with chicken curry was not only very good but also visually appealing. The intricate lace-like pattern of the Roti Jala added an extra layer of charm to the dish, and the accompanying chicken curry was rich and savory.However, the real star of the meal was the Chili Pan Mee. It stood out as the best among the dishes we tried. The flavors were explosive, and the noodles were cooked to perfection, maintaining just the right level of consistency. It's a must-try for those seeking a flavorful punch in their meal.On a positive note, the restaurant honored our check-in and offered us a delightful treat to end our meal: coconut ice cream. It was a pleasant surprise and a perfect conclusion to the dining experience.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Amazing food, friendly staff, cool decor. 10/10 bussing. the roti jala with chicken curry in particular was absurdly good, super tender chicken in a great coconut sauce.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: They had a variety of dishes, but I believe they could cook better. I guess they have to serve a crowd, so they do it fast and come out of it remains uncooked. And some part of it was a little burnt, assuming it got overcooked a little.We enjoyed our dinner here. The food was delicious, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The site was comfortable to dine in, so simple, and everyone was hospitable. The food took 20 minutes to come out.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Unfortunately they were out of the mushrooms, but the meat dishes we had were very good. Everything was seasoned nicely, and very fresh.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: I have been here several times and there is always a crazy wait. I recently tried out the No Wait app to "get in line" rather than actually get in line. The only problem is that you can't get in line until the restaurant opens. I used the app 30min after the restaurant opened on a Tuesday evening and still had to wait almost 2 hours to be seated. Plan on getting pre-dinner drinks at the bars around the corner if you decide to come here. The food is always amazing and makes you feel like the wait was worth it. The menu seems to be slightly different every time I visit so I am always trying something new. I recently had some very spicy and crispy chicken wings. the Jala bread was very delicate and almost melted in my mouth with the curry (?) dipping sauce. For my entree, I enjoyed the nashi goering (?). The food is always hot, always delicious, and heats up well the next day for more goodness. While the food is great, service is sub par. Waitors seems to enjoy plenty of relaxed conversations with each other at the bar while my throat is burning since I seem to never have my water refilled...Would very much appreciate a bit more attentive service. The restaurant is always packed and hiring an extra bus boy/water boy would make a huge difference in service.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Awesome food, fantastic drinks! Expect around an hour wait during the weekends for dinner.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: So really great! My first time here. I've learned about it through the grapevine when it was only that little take out place on olive. I'm so happy they updated the place. We'd the roti Babi, chili pan mi and wok cooked pork belly. We ate every bite! Delicious!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The food was absolutely mouthwatering, featuring generous portions that left everyone satisfied. Each dish was bursting with flavor, showcasing a variety of well-balanced ingredients that tantalized the taste buds. The staff went above and beyond in their service; they were exceptionally friendly and welcoming, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable. It was clear that they had a genuine passion for the food they were serving, as they took the time to explain the dishes and share recommendations. Overall, it was a delightful experience that highlighted both the quality of the cuisine and the warmth of the service.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Kedai Makan have a delicious food quality. Great staff services and good environment with Good food too! I will back again......

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Would suggest this location! Everything was delicious, the food arrived swiftly, and there were plenty of vegetarian options.The dish with mushrooms was my favorite thing. It had a great flavor.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: I thought this place shut down but I guess it was their other location. Food was great here.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: I thoroughly enjoyed all the food and drinks at this restaurant. The cocktails were especially nice--I tried the Passion Old Fashioned, the Lychee Martini, and another delightful drink whose name I can't quite remember.The kitchen went above and beyond to accommodate my peanut allergy. They made my wings with a different sauce, as the original had peanuts, which others in my group wanted to try. This thoughtful gesture was much appreciated.My favorite dish of the evening was the Nasi Biryani. The flavors were rich and perfectly balanced. It was a fantastic dining experience, and I can't wait to visit again!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: When seafood meets soul food, it's a magical thing!If you're craving comfort food with an ocean twist, then look no further than Shaker + Spear. Last night I had the pleasure of dining here and their food did not disappoint. Soul food classics get a delicious upgrade with fresh local seafood and ingredients. I devoured my seafood boil with a side of greens and can't wait to go back to try some new dishes (they update their menu according to what's fresh in season). I absolutely love the ambiance too. It's a true wine bar vibe. Shoutout to Robin, our waitress that had amazing energy.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: We recently dined at this Malaysian restaurant and once again, it didn't disappoint. The Nae Limak was not only delicious but also had a generous quantity--enough for two. Despite the slightly higher prices, it's worth the meal experience. We've been regulars, and the consistency in quality keeps us coming back. The honeycomb cake from the dessert menu was a delightful end to the meal.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Great environment with cozy spaces. We did not order side dishes. We went for main dishes directly as recommended by friends. They all tasted good except ribs (in dry side). Parking can be challenging. Service is good and fast.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Would recommend this place! There were many vegetarian options, the food came out quickly, and everything was very tasty! My favorite item was the mushroom dish. It was very flavorful.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The food was amazing! The service was great! More seating options would be great but otherwise wonderful place!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The food here is great and atmosphere is awesome. We had wonderful service that was quick.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Can be a long wait but well worth it. Some of the most unique food I've had in Seattle. I remember when it was just a take out window!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Holy moly! Best Malaysian spot in town, the place was packed and I now certainly know why, food was excellent, we got the wings, the ribs and and the Nasi lemak, all are definitely a must, can't wait to try other items on the menu when we comeback!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Love love love! Roti Jala and fried rice were extraordinary! We also got the wings and some cocktails, everything was on point. Great service as well, can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Lovely place to eat. I turned up as a solo diner without a reservation, and they were more than happy to accommodate me. The staff were polite, and the food incredible. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal, even more so as it was served very quickly, piping hot.I highly recommend the nasi goreng kedai, unique, but great nonetheless, and the roti sum were a nice side.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: One of the best restaurants in Seattle, you'll never have a bad meal here. Well worth the wait, just make sure to get there early and put your name down. The fried chicken and Roti are off the hook! Service is always great and the ambiance is too.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: I love chicken , especially at this place

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Got there about 30 minutes before opening and there was already about 8-10 people waiting in line. Get their early if you want to try most of the menu. THE FRIED CHICKEN IS A MUST HAVE, we tried everything on the menu and all was delicious

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Fantastic meal, worth the long wait . Been there twice and every time it was on point

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Everything was excellent. Food is fantastic and service is friendly. Only complaint is the wait but it's understandable.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: kedai makan has fantastic food, it was my first time and they did a great job in every area.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: First time having Malaysian food and I'll definitley be coming back to kedai makan!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The food was great.The owner was very friendly and the staff was helpful.Highly recomend .

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: They had amazing Malaysian food

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: All I can say is take one step in the place and let your sense of smell do the work. This place is unique and delicious.Cozy and worth the wait.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Wow I can't say enough about this place. So I won't.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: If you haven't eaten here you've messed up already. You must go, and go now. Or as soon as you can.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Some of the best food I've had in Seattle! Love this place.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: One of the best restaurants in Seattle, you'll never have a bad meal here. Well worth the wait, just make sure to get there early and put your name down. The fried chicken and Roti are off the hook! Service is always great and the ambience is too.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The best authentic Malaysian food in town. Give a shot and you will love it.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: One of my favorite spots on the hill.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Worth each moment of any hold up time you're given. Great leader, holding up staff, and obviously, the most tasty and complex flavors you can request in Seattle. Pass on my most loved place in the city.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Get here early when they first open and you'll love it. Otherwise get here later and wait in line and you'll still love it.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Worth the wait. Delicious food, cool ambiance, great service and fun drinks! Be prepared to wait in line but know that you're in for a treat

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: It's hard to find Malaysian food to begin with, let alone good Malaysian food. The flavors are delightful, reminiscent of when I was wandering around SE Asia, and the portions are more than enough for a meal. The bonus meal you get from leftovers are icing on an already delectable cake of carbs, carbs, and more delicious carbs.If you're looking for something extra special (in a unique way, not a you'll-necessarily-like-it way), try the Chinese herb-infused shots. They pack quite a punch, and, as someone who grew up surrounded by herbal medicine, a healthy dose of nostalgia.Really appreciated being able to share this experience!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Such a lovely gem in Seattle! This restaurant is tucked on the north end of Capitol Hill and sound 4:30pm is when the line starts forming around the block :-OWe ordered the netted roti appetizer, the Nasi Goreng (fried rice with a sunny side up egg on top) and the fried chicken and rice dish. Everything had such complex flavors and were delicious! This place did not disappoint and I can't wait to come back again! Can't wait to bring my mom when she comes to visit!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The best restaurant I have ever had the privilege of attending.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: I came back to Kedai Makan to bring a friend that was staying with us from Denver. He liked it and mentioned that he will bring his wife when she comes in town. The food is always great and the service is fast and friendly. If you have not tried this place yet, you need check it out because once they put your order in front of you, you will not be disappointed. Enjoy!!!Any explanation I may attempt to describe Kedai Makan will not do it justice, so I suggest tasting it yourself. In fact, you can try the food by yourself, or get a group to share many dishes! I have had a great experience and great food every time.Service was perfect for my visits here. The drinks are always filled, and my water never touched the bottom. Food arrived in a timely manner. No complaints, really. Will I be back for more? Yes! The food is so yummy!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: When you need noodles, this is the place to go!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Amazing food with great service! I was pleasantly surprise and can not wait to go back.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: The food was incredibly delicious. Big portions, full flavor. The staff was so very nice and really seemed to love the food they were serving.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Food: The spice blends in the lamb fried rice were amazing - complex and delicious. Also highly recommend the stuffed naan. Table wait time can be up to an hour, but we were able to get seating immediately at the bar.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Love this place!! My favorite food in Seattle!! I would highly suggest checking this place out.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Absolutely incredible food. May be a long wait, but the drinks are unique and amazing, and the food is some of the best Asian I've had.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: This is the best restaurant in Seattle as far as I am concerned.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: This place was fantastic! Expect long waits, even on weekdays.

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: the lamb fried rice was so good!!

name: Kedai Makan
text_review: Straight up volcanic.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Hostess was really rude. Asked for a table and she said it would be 20 minutes. There was no one in the place. My wife came a minute later and she said 30 minutes. Asked politely what the deal was and she was really rude about it.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Corporate raiders. Adding 20% to the bill WTF??? Oh no, Not giving this to the servers, but pocketing for pure profit. Unscrupulous to wait to the end of the meal to tell us. What's the issue? Can't compete fairly with other real restaurants??? Looser management. Never go to Elliott's or any other E3 owned restaurant. Unbelievable, truly"

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Worst host ever!  He was very rude and stereotyped us right from the start! Told us they weren't taking walk-ins and while we were literally standing right there he offered 4 other people walk-in spots!  He also turned the Asian guy away!  How can he be LBGTQ and still judge people? He should know better about being judged.  Such a shame! If zero stars were an option I would have gladly entered it.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The food is good but BE AWARE that there's a 20% service charge plus 9.3% tax on the service charge. There's no sign about this charge and you'll find out on the receipt when you are paying. You end up paying over 40% to the total when you include gratuity for your server. I'm NOT going back to this restaurant!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: While I was dining at Elliot's Oyster House, I witnessed the most appalling scene. Near my table, a man was being interviewed for a serving job. The hiring manager, at a certain point, said to the applicant, "Look around at the servers. We don't hire your kind here." The applicant was a black man. The applicant had a friend (maybe partner? unsure) with him who immediately got up to leave. The applicant replied to the hiring manager by saying, "You can't talk to me like that, sir. That is out of line." The hiring manager replied with, "You know what? We don't even like serving your kind here," and promptly kicked the applicant and his companion out of the restaurant. I quickly asked for the check and left the restaurant. I don't care how good the food is or isn't, I vow to never support this restaurant again. If I had ever known that they employ racists and ask those racists to hire based on skin color, I never would have set foot in the establishment in the first place. The sheer audacity that a hiring manager felt comfortable having this conversation in the dining area, within earshot of paying customers, is indicative of the kind of insidious racism that can't be pinned on one solitary employee. Elliot's can't do anything to make up for this. I can't imagine what the culture is like in the kitchen, where the line staff is likely entirely composed of people of color. Will never set foot in here again and highly encourage everyone to reconsider spending their money in a place that discriminates against the African American community.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Worst Mother's Day experience!!! Had reservations but many seated before us. Very unacceptable!!!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The place gets one star for consistently ignoring emails sent to management regarding an incident of very bad and insulting service. Never going back, never recommending.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Very bad service, we went there for dinner on Monday,  we got seated in the room where they have the large tables, the waiter who took care of us gave us a lousy bad service, he made a couple mistakes, he didn't took any dirty dishes out of the table, our table was a mess, he didn't even offer us dessert, (young tall cocky white guy, reddish hair, tattooed arms, waive short hair and glasses) so next time if you go to Elliotts and this guy is ur server u better run off

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: All we wanted was happy hour but the bar was full so we asked to sit on the patio they said yes. They put us at the very end of the patio outside which was okay because it was a nice day. We had to go into the bar and order our own drinks which was fine. But then we decided we wanted to have the oysters so we went into the bar to order the oysters and they told us no because we were not sitting in the happy hour section very very very bad service Left unhappy

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Unreasonably slow service and quality is not worth the price.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Over priced. Took extremely long. Food was fair, fries not cooked well. Seems a place like this could properly cook french fries. 3 people agree the "gravy" was friggen wierd.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Not worth it. If you can find another place, go there. It might seem nice at first on the outside as it is beside the water but overall is a failure.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The food was good but the service was horrific. If you go plan to wait. We waited 45 minutes for a cup of chowder and salad. No apologies given.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: We chose to eat here because our friends were already downtown and we wanted seafood. The restaurant is located in a very touristy location, which takes away from the experience. Oysters: The oysters all tasted the same and were not particularly memorable. There are better places for oysters in Seattle. Appetizers: The calamari is frozen, not fresh, which the waitress was forthcoming about when we asked. We did not order it. The crab cakes were fine, but not remarkable. I ordered the Cioppino for the main course. The fish was tough--I did not like the texture and was not sure how fresh the fish was.
