Bottom line: Save your money for better food and a better atmosphere in a less touristy part of town.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Nothing special but longer time waiting for food! We have been waiting with 3 cups of water Above 20 minutes~

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Very average food, especially for the price. We were very disappointed. I wouldn't recommend them.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Elliott's Oyster House was really good. The oysters were fantastic, especially with the awesome toppings they came with. The mussels were great, and the crab cakes were delish. The salmon Caesar was also very tasty.The views from the patio are lovely, which definitely added to our experience. The service, on the other hand, was just okay. It started off pretty slow, and unfortunately, our server forgot to bring the spicy crab & corn chowder we were excited to try. But overall, we still had a good experience!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Loved the view but Oysters were bad, they brought us new ones but after I consumed a bad one. Felt a little gross but the risk in oysters. amazing views worth it despite the touristy vibe

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: While this restaurant was quite good, it was not worth the prices they were charging.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: We recently dined at Elliott's Oyster House during our Seattle visit and our experience was a mixed bag. Let's start with the beverages - I ordered an Old Fashioned and Amy had a glass of cider. The Old Fashioned was quite disappointing. Note to all restaurants - don't serve this classic cocktail without a single ice cube, it's a major faux pas.We kicked off our meal with an assortment of oysters. It's fascinating how different oysters can taste depending on their origin, and as someone who prefers ones that carry the taste of the sea, this was a treat. The Ahi Tuna Tacos were next - they were perfectly portioned and tasted incredibly fresh.The Seafood Pasta was a hearty and rich dish, with shellfish taking center stage. However, my wife Amy wished there had been more shrimp. The seasonal specialty, a Halibut dish, came served with fresh vegetables and was full of flavor.But here's where things get tricky - Elliott's Oyster House is not easy on the wallet. The prices are quite steep, and to add to that, there's a mandatory 20% service charge added to the bill. The check mentions that part of this charge is shared with the service staff, who are paid a competitive wage. But what's unclear is the exact portion of the service charge that actually goes to the staff. In comparison, other similar establishments often explicitly outline what percentage of the service charge goes to the wait staff. Without this knowledge, customers like us are left wondering if we should tip more and whether the servers are actually benefitting from the service charge. In conclusion, while the food at Elliott's Oyster House is truly wonderful, the service charge practices leave you with an unsavory aftertaste. It's a real pity, as such issues detract from an otherwise great dining experience.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The spot was very more agreeable than anticipated. We felt like home so we cut our stuff down and furthermore laid back on the excursion persona we have when we got out. We had an incredible time here. Some of the best oysters you'll find. Seattle really grows on you.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I never been to a restaurant have such a fresh seafood. The view is beautiful, one thing is don't expect the service. Service was horrible.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Cheap oysters during happy hour. Im sold!! Had a great time here the other day and I will be coming back for ages.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I love supporting local businesses; this place offers a very fancy experience at a very high price for oysters if you're not going for happy hour. Their staff is great and always helpful.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Seriously we paid $100 for dinner and they couldn't give us bread without charging $3.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Food was decent for the price paid. It wasn't outstanding by any means.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I enjoy there clam chowder, but I didn't enjoy the hostess!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Over 2 dz oyster varieties!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Really pricy but the food was pretty good. Large portions.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great Happy Hour. Otherwise the menu is a bit pricey.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Very good. I had the sole and the house salad. It was way too much food for me.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Meh...

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I'm new to the city and this place was recommended to me by my co-worker. I think this place has it's positives and negatives. I loved loved loved the happy hour. The oyster's were incredibly yummy and it was unexpectedly affordable. However, when going back for dinner at a later time I was very disappointed. I found the food was not up to par - especially considering the price. Also, I wasn't satisfied by the seating. Our table had a lot to be desired.I will go back again and try out lunch but will go with a reservation and request a boot so that there will be more room. The servers were pleasant, which is very important to me.Will re-review once I go for lunch. *fingers crossed*

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Tourist place, nothing wrong, but nothing special.Seafood is excellent. The place is big and busy, filled with tourists. But there's no special class to the presentation, nor anything but standard fare on the menu. Swordfish - with potato salad and mustard. Now there's a creative presentation! Crab cakes - with slaw and fries. Go here if you need some boring food. Good food, but boring.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Even the restaurant was in a tourist area, but more food. I hope they continue. Only one thing, we have to wait to eat. Overall we will enjoy our meal.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great service and food. The chef's on oysters was awesome. The view warps the whole experience up that few restaurants can match.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Recently dined at this restaurant and the crab cake and oysters were delicious, definitely a highlight of the meal! Unfortunately, the halibut was a letdown, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. However, the stunning view made up for it, and the good weather added to the overall pleasant ambiance. The service was also top-notch, friendly and attentive. Overall, it was a nice day out, and I would recommend this place for the views and some of their seafood options, just maybe not the halibut!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Consider this review from someone who is not an avid seafood lover. However, the ambience was nice and make sure that you make a reservation prior to going OR be the first to stand in line when it opens. The Servers and management were very nice and accommodating. We ate they right after they opened and the food was good. I ordered Fish and Chips and the Clam Chowder. The clam chowder had a really tasty base. I definitely would recommend this place while visiting Seattle.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The seafood was fresh and delicious. The service was very friendly, and our server was very attentive and accommodating. We had the crab which was fresh and tasted great, and the Oysters were out of this world. I also loved their clam chowder. All tasted great. Some of our dishes are expensive, but I'm sure it was all worth it.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: We enjoyed the food at this place but the facilities sure need a little revamping and even a little more serious cleaning in some places. We ordered the clam linguini, the seafood risotto, a couple of the fish a chips, a glass of wine and strawberry lemonade. We all felt the food was very tasty, packed with quality and fresh seafood. A good wine selection allowed for a good glass of wine and the strawberry lemonade was a hit with the kiddo in our party. But for the location, the up an coming newly revamped Seattle water front, this place fell short in terms of style and even cleanliness. The carpet throughout the place is truly done after way too many years of service, and the bathrooms were truly way out of sync with the location, menu prices and reputation of the place. So they loose a star (should have been minus 2 stars but wanted to be more lenient). The bathrooms were for sure fairly dirty, but the food still made up for the decaying ambiance. Hopefully it gets a lift sometime soon. P.S. the staff was welcoming, very nice and efficient.Thanks

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Our appetizers were very good (oysters on half shell, calamari, clams) but I did not like my main course: the halibut. Everyone else liked their entree. A little overpriced but not terrible (except crab was really high). Need reservations! The people who came at same time as us were told an hour wait or more. Restaurant wasn't super crowded but probably limited due to being short-staffed.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The oysters are cooked really well, delicious sauces to pick from too!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: This was my restaurant of choice for my recent birthday party. I had the Halibut cheeks with wild rice and a shot of Glen-Livett. The portion of the food that was given was very impressive for me. I have a cup of their clam chowder too and it's perfect. The atmosphere here is beautiful and the bar is awesome. This is an absolutely lovely restaurant and they have outdoor seating. Their staff was helpful, hardworking, and the service was excellent. They wear a mask and they enforce social distancing too. Kudos to this eatery. I'll brag to my buddies about this store.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great food and atmosphere. Lovely first night dinner. Service was super friendly too.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: A little overpriced but I love their oyster chowder ! Very nice sit down restaurant off the pier in downtown Seattle.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Prices can be high but that's why I get paid well.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Good spot. The fish and chips were huge

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Excellent oysters! I had the house salad and highly recommend it. Service was also excellent but very busy so relax and enjoy the atmosphere. It is speedy but it is fine dining on the Harbor.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Remedy to Review - in the wake of voicing my failure with the dinner (not the administration which was astounding), the general director contacted me and tried to make things right. I regard that and value his thought. He has given me a gift voucher to take care of my expense and, that by itself, is all that could possibly be needed to make things right. I mean to return and attempt Elliott's Oyster House once more. My suggestion is that it merits experimenting with and if things aren't up to standard, convey it up to the administration. I'm certain they will take the necessary steps to make things right.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: It was excellent food but we had to ask for drinks after about 15-20 minutes. Service wasn't the best but awesome food.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great happy hour if you're an oyster lover. My company has an office up here and this is my go to place for oysters on the half shell. Get there early!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: While I would give the food about a 4, the location is a 5, and the wait staff is always friendly and nice. This is really about a 4.5 stars.The Oysters are solid, but I would suggest that when you order your fish medium rare, you emphasize that they cook it that way -- mine came semi well done.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I have been here about 6 times. I have only been for happy hour, but it is excellent. All of the small plates on the happy hour menu are very good and the drinks are excellent. I brought a foodie friend from out of town to Elliott's Oyster House and he was impressed with my selection.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Excellent oysters yes one of my favorite foods, and this is a great location, just get there early, friendly staff and don't forget happy hour.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The food was very good. Portions were terribly small. Spent over $200 on dinner for 2 people, my wife and I. My 115 pound wife made me take her to get pizza afterwards because she didn't get enough to eat...

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Come here do the amazing oysters and happy hour specials. Best part of the whole thing. Better seafood experiences can be found other places with less tourists. But as far as an oyster bar it is perfection.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Delicious! Had the king salmon grilled. Smaller than I thought but oh so tasty!! We were a group of 28 so it was a tough order to keep us sorted out and the noise level was a challenge. All in all, the views, location, service and food were as I expected, pricy, above average quality and good service. I would go again for another special occasion. Requesting a quiet corner.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Awesome oyster! Waiter was very knowledgeable on all types of oyster. The hamma hamma, was our favorite.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: When they call it the Oyster House they were not kidding, all the Oysters you can eat. Try to catch them during their happy hour from 3 - 6 and you will not be sorry

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Only the best oysters today: Hama Hama, Kumamoto, Cranberry Creek & Hump Island. Eating them & then finishing it up with the dessert like Chinook salmon aka King Salmon alder planked prepared medium rare with beurre blanc & the season's fresh vegetables was surely a dessert of its own, as it is seldom noticed as one, whilst finishing sweet down my gullet with Omega 3 oily fats in the finest way possible. If I could see the merry catch hauled off the Puget Sound whilst eating the very catch, bait & shelled crustaceans as they're coming off the boat from the Pacific Ocean, then it would have surely been a more superlative sight to behold, & I may have added another star, so catch that. ;-) Being one of the tourist venues notwithstanding garners it one less star. Just eat, chat with the knowledgeable shuckers & then shlurppp some more, & then what? Then proceed outward bound hastily walking out from Elliott's, which is packed like sardines with the general ill-informed tourist populace popping their heads in here thinking this is THE place where locals go, & then constantly bobbing their heads in disbelief like the buoys you can also see out in the water. :-PGood, attentive service followed by the charging of my phone was even better than the real catch. ;-)

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Came for dinner, it was ok. Overpriced. Came for happy hour, what a deal.Recommend only for happy hour.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I love oysters. The oyster house is the place to go. A little spendy but well worth the drive into seattle!!!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Really good food. They had an amazing spread of oysters and delicious food. We split the strawberry and walnut salad and the ciopino. Only reason why not 5 stars is although the food was good, the price was very high. Bread and butter was an extra $5 which seems ridiculous not to include that at a fine dining restaurant when you're asking patrons to pay $35+ per plate not including apps, drinks, etc.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: It was so great that we ate there twice in the 3 nights we were in Seattle. Service the first night, brilliant, I 'd crab and they did the total crab service with the bib, hand washing and all that fun stuff. The second time we had a younger waiter that 'spoke too much" according my honey. I adored the salmon bisque and the crab (yeah, not overly original). Honey had oysters galore and they were fresh (made me have a flashback to my days as a mermaid) but I actually can not tell the distinct in flavor.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Would be five stars if the two younger hostesses at the front desk weren't so rude. Hey we're condescending and had an attitude like they didn't want us to be there. They shouldn't be employed at Elliot's as the first impression.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The oyster happy hours is always fun! A race to order more before prices hike up every 30 minutes. They seem to have a good selection of local draft beers as well which go well with the oysters! Wine selection is actually decent and reasonably priced. Only downside is the regular seafood menu items like fish, crab, etc. are good but nothing spectacular. Still, overall, I am a fan!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: If i had only know about the progressive oyster happy hour before I ordered. Still, this place is great.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Room didn't have coffee maker, so I ordered a pot of coffee from roomservice. The pot was good size, and was only $6. But with a $4 service fee and 18% gratuity, it was an expensive pot. Room service food was great, restaurant food was great.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great happy hour prices, great view if you seat by the pier! Knocked off a star due to long waits but that's understandable, their happy hour prices increased recently though :( the cheapest happy hour is now $1 per oyster. Still great, fresh, juicy, but you know how it feels when you are 100% positive that a place increased their pricing!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Okay. For the price, it was not spectacular.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: really nice place. food was good.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: All positive, and on a Sunday evening! Definitely a return visit!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great seafood fettucini.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Just great! Tasty drinks too.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Oh boy this place is super expensive oh well still pretty good.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: salmon was great, but the view was amazing!!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great oysters and excellent service.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Who knew there was so much to oysters?! Those slimy gooey sexy little briny bivalves! OMG. I think the oysters here were definitely the highlight of our self-guided Seattle food and drink tour. Pretty cool little happy hour deal on them too - I think they start at like 75 cents each and then increase every half hour. Unfortunately, we got there at the last half hour, so by that time they were $1.75 each, but damn, they were worth it. And the oyster shucker (oyster tender?) knew a LOT about all of them, giving us samples of his favorites as we dined at the bar. It's a swanky spot for sure, perhaps a bit outside of our swank range, but we sat at the bar with a drink and some happy hour oysters (and other appetizers which were less memorable, including the babiest sized mussels I have ever seen! - slightly disappointing) and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. So I say to you, Yelpers, go there for happy hour. Get there early and fill yourselves with many, many deliciously glistening oysters. They're good for you!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Came up from Gig Harbor for lunch today and the oysters were great. Very fresh. The room is a bit too touristy for me. The service was efficient but I really came for the oysters and I'd do it again.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The seafood is outstanding

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Always a good time; quality service, and quality oysters.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: service was not the best, but can't really complain about 50 cent oysters!!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: First stop in must do things in Seattle was the .50 cent oyster HH that runs Monday thru Friday. The way it works is starting at 3pm the HH prices are .50 cents each with a 3 dozen per table limit on the order. If you finish the ones you order you can order more but depending on the currnet time each half hour the price increases by .25 cents. Factors like the time to place the order and have the oysters shucked plus eat time can slow the glutany process down. At 4 when we finally made it there and got a table the price was already $1 per oyster, not terrible but not quite the price we had been shooting for so curse you broken GPS, Seattle freeway system, Seattle parking machines and man who took extra 20 mins at the table which we were waiting for at the bar......Yeah I know better planning should have been happening here but we were dying to try em. We also got $3 beers, oyster shooters and a few other appetizers for $3 each. The Salmon Slider was really awesome in my opinion but the fish taco was just ok. I liked the oyster but I didn't love them and I felt the sizes were not consistent but over all I would love to just stuff myself on .50 cent oysters next visit.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Excellent spot for drinks and appetizers.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: ok!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: If I lived in seattle, I'd go there for happy hour oysters every friday!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I'm not an oyster fan but my fiance is. So i was very excited to find out they have alot on their menu other then just oysters. They have amazing seafood pasta dishes. And good cocktails. I rarely say avoid happy hour, because normally the deals are really good. The only thing is people have caught on to their cheap oysters at happy hour so the place is fairly packed.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Very good oysters, and a hefty selection.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: A friend and I had been galavanting about town all day and wanted to eat somewhere semi-fancy for dinner. After wandering up and down the pier looking for a restaurant that my friend wanted to go to that he couldn't remember the name of, or where it was, or what it looked like, we settled on Elliot's.The food was great, and the waitstaff was very attentive. We started with the Appetizer Tower, which the waiter seemed a little shocked that we wanted that much food between the two of us for our APPETIZER, but neither of us had eaten anything all day, and hell, we were in for an adventure. I didn't try any of the calamari, but my friend said that it was very good, and I really enjoyed the crab cakes, and the dip was good as well. Ate my appetizers with a very tasty Lemon Drop.For entrees, I had the King Salmon and chips, he had the Blackened Rockfish. I'd never had breaded salmon before, and while it was good, it left a little to be desired taste-wise. The Rock Fish I was told was tasty, but could've tasted a little Blacker. Had my entree with the best Mai Tai I've ever had!For dessert, I had the Granny Smith Apple Napoleon, which was AMAZING, despite not a hazelnut to be seen. My friend had the Deep Fried Truffle Sundae, which I had a bite of and thought was very good.Finished the meal with some Kenyan coffee to sober us up enough to make it to our next destination :)All and all, it was a very good dining experience. They do get docked a star though do to our complaints (listed above) about the entrees, and the fact that while there was not another person out of the bar/lounge area, they still tried to hide us (a very pierced, tattooed, brightly colored duo) in the furthest table in the back.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: As a first-time visitor to Seattle, dining at Elliott's Oyster House was an absolute highlight of the trip! The food and drinks were incredibly delicious, and the ambiance was equally amazing--elegant yet welcoming, with stunning waterfront views. Everything from the fresh oysters to the perfectly crafted cocktails exceeded our expectations. We're already planning to come back on our next visit to Seattle! A small tip: make a reservation ahead of time because this place gets busy, and it's easy to see why. Highly recommended!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: If you're craving fresh seafood in a cozy, upscale atmosphere, Elliott's Oyster House delivers a truly exceptional dining experience. Located in the heart of the city, this seafood haven offers a wide range of dishes that highlight the best of the ocean's bounty.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Our company recently hosted a dinner for 30 guests at Elliott's Oyster House in Seattle, and let me tell you - they exceeded every expectation! We had 10 additional guests show up unexpectedly, but Corrine and Vince worked their magic to accommodate everyone seamlessly, as if it had been planned from the start. They quickly arranged extra tables and chairs without missing a beat.Nick and Tom were absolute stars, keeping everything running smoothly and ensuring that all our guests were happy throughout the evening. The service was 1000% - truly flawless!And the food? Outstanding! Every dish was top-notch, but I have to give a special shoutout to the desserts - they were phenomenal!If you're looking for a venue for any event, I highly recommend Elliott's Oyster House. The combination of impeccable service and incredible food makes it the perfect place for any gathering. We'll definitely be back!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Elliot's Oyster House offers a perfect blend of fresh seafood, excellent service, and stunning waterfront views. The oysters were incredibly fresh with a wide variety to choose from, and the staff's recommendations were spot on. We also loved the crab cakes and grilled salmon, both cooked to perfection.The wine and cocktail selections paired perfectly with our meal, enhancing the overall experience. With its inviting atmosphere and unbeatable location, Elliot's is a must-visit for seafood lovers. We can't wait to return!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Amazing food , excellent service and beautiful view. Would definitely come back!! Our waitress gave excellent recommendations.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Place was really clean, service was fast and drinks were delicious. Food was really tasty.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Wonderful seafood dinner by the water with views of the sound, ferries, and sunset. Ordered the Kumamoto oyster, mussels and crab cakes as starters. Followed by the grilled prawns, swordfish and scallops as entrees. Oysters were so good and especially liked the grilled prawns. Highly recommended!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Fabulous place for our special celebration! Just gets better and better each time. Service great, food superb!! Portions were very generous with their price truly affordable. Will keep coming back!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: We stopped by here before SeaTac because we were craving fresh seafood, and we were shocked at the quality. A friend said their fried oysters were the best he's ever had, and the fresh oysters I ordered were absolutely amazing! The clam chowder was probably the best I've ever had, as well. Customer service was top-notch from our first step in the door. So appreciating this place and will be back soon!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The oyster bar has one of the most extensive offerings I have ever seen. The service was friendly and quick. The restaurant is beautiful. There was a bit of a service issue,The clam chowder, my personal fave, was delicious. We ordered a panko crusted fish and chips for the table which satisfied our craving for fried fish.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Good Seattle staple! Was a bit cold inside but the food and service were all in point!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The oysters are super fresh, and the Dungeness crab is a standout. The sea view vibe is relaxed, not too fancy. Good service too. . Shoutout to the staff--super friendly.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: First time here the seafood was great! Great service and loved the location on the waterfront.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Food was great an Charles the server was excellent. Definitely coming back for another meal

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: This place is realy amazing,the food wos sooo tasty.Honestly i realy love this place,my bf and i came here for seafood experience it wos soo tasty.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great services ,good food very clean place

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Food is good and the vibe is good as well. The waiter that served me was top notched so I'd give this a 6/5.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Very nice place and the food is always deliciously served.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Overall, our dining experience was great! Definitely will be back again on our next visit to Seattle.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Stopped by while I was in town for business. I love oysters and this place was so good

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Great customer service and also have a great dishes which will make you come back for me

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I highly reccommend this place.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: doesn't look like much when you walk past, but I was practically dying of hunger so I popped in. The definition of a hole-in-the-wall. I got the regular hamburger and wow... there are no words. A classic burger done right. Crisp bun, juicy patty, stuffed with all the essentials (ketchup, shredded lettuce, tomato, and pickles). There's about a million options available between the menu board and wall full of specials, so it can get a little overwhelming, but you really can't go wrong. Not much else to say besides go see for yourself! You won't be disappointed.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The setting of the caf� is the thing that removed me as it can oblige individuals agreeable. Other than that, the servers were amicable and assisted us with choosing the best supper that we could appreciate. So far no gripes since it was my first time there however you merit my 5 star rating.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Been looking for a place to get some really good oysters and I finally filed it too bad I was only visiting from out of state if I ever come again I will definitely be back would highly recommend

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Nice place and good service. Delicious food as well. Highly recommended

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I was in town with my dad, and we wanted to visit this place for dinner. We really enjoyed this place, and it's a restaurant that never disappoints you.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The food was amazing and they treated us really well. I will definitely come back when I come back to Seattle!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Brought my parents in for dinner last week. We didn't have reservations but were sat right away. Everything from service, ambiance and quality of food was incredible. We had several dozen oysters, pan fired oysters, king crab legs and some salads. Everything top-notch! Great care was taken to follow state rules regarding Covid-19 but never felt that it impeded on our meal. Our entire party left very happy and full.I would highly recommend Elliott's to anyone interested in the best seafood in Seattle!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Excellent food, especially the oysters. Would highly recommend.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: My favorite hot spot for oysters. Wis I could eat here every day. Great waitstaff.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I love the see food and this place is amazing for that food

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I enjoyed an evening meal here with some friends, and we all had a wonderful time. We did make reservations ahead of time. The location was very nice, and we sat outside with the view of the water. The food was amazing. We had oysters, spicy crab, and King Salmon. They are all tasted great.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: The food was wonder and the Natalie was friendly and knowledgeable I recommend this place.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Food and oysters were great!!! Our server Natalie was awesome! Very knowledgeable about the oysters and helpful.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Awesome fresh oysters. House salad is delicious also. The staff is super friendly, definitely a great place to go!!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: This place is incredible!!! Everything from the food to the service was perfect. The cocktails that we started off with were delicious and well priced. The variety of oysters our server chose for us were incredible. My entree of salmon was perfectly cooked and seasoned. My girlfriend's rockfish was interesting and tasty. Our server answered every question that we had and was spot on with every possible detail for our meal. Wish I could give this place more stars! We will definitely be back the next time that we are in Seattle!!!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I eat here every time I am in Seattle.  The food is great and service outstanding.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: My friend convinced me that Elliot's was the place to go if I wanted the best oysters on the pier. And I wasn't disappointed. We sat at the Bar and was served delicious drinks by Ben. He also recommended some great pairing with our appetizers. He provided excellent service as we feasted on our Happy Hour oysters. They were delicious and too tempting when asked if we wanted more and the minutes seem to pass by faster. The ambiance is really great. You have the view right out to the pier. The food is on point. And I couldn't have been happier with my sweet fresh Seattle oysters. Shout out to Ben and the staff here!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: When in Seattle right? A friend took me here for their happy hour which was unique to anything I've experienced. For $1.50?? That's a great price.The oysters were fresh and flavorful, there were two types that we ordered and both were delicious. They came with pink Himalayan salt as well as tobasco sauce, and a house made sauce. You can't complain about the cost, and you don't feel guilty eating so many!The service was very friendly, we ordered more as we went and also asked for more sauce and our waiter happily helped us. A must go for fresh oysters!

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Wow u have to try their mussel n calms, oyster, crab cake n the pan fried oysters n salmon exceeded my expectation. We like the place, the atmosphere, the view, the people, the service and the food. This is a place I would enjoy coming with friends regularly.

name: Elliott's Oyster House

text_review: Really great! The poke appetizer was awesome. I feel like the wine was poured light, but good options. I got king crab legs which was cooked perfectly and easy to get out of the shell. My date ordered the Halibut which was incredible! I would order the halibut next time. We got the strawberry shortcake dessert which was also very tasty and full of flavor. There are so many places to eat in Denver, and i would choose to come back here.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: This place is amazing. It lives up to all the good reviews on yelp and then some. I had the steamed sampler with peel and eat shrimp, mussels and clams. The shrimp were huge, the clams delicious and the mussels steamed perfect. The coleslaw on the side, a perfect blend of tangy vinegar and dressing to go well with the meal. The wait staff were also awesome. If you love good seafood without all the fuss, go here.

It is ot the cheapest place in town, but well worth the price.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: I love this place...the food is very fresh and delicious. The oysters are very good, this is the place where you get the freshest produce from the market. The menu is easy to follow and the waiters are very pleasant and easy to work with. They don't give any attitude and will take good care of you. I never thought that I would be able to differentiate between various types of oysters before I started coming here but I was pleasantly surprised. There are a lot of tourists that stop in but it's one of the best attractions in Seattle. It can get a little busy so you need to know when to go, otherwise the service is quick and enjoyable. Its' also clean considering how many people stop in every day. If you are looking for the freshest oysters, go there and you will not be disappointed.

name: Elliott's Oyster House
text_review: Had a fantastic lunch here - this is what living in Seattle is all about! We were seated by a corner glass window overlooking the Puget Sound, with the sun, boats, and Bainbridge Island in the background. The wait staff was very courteous and attentive, and their recommendations on the menu were very helpful. We had the smoked salmon linguine and Rockfish tacos, along with an oyster sampler. The champagne topping for the oyster sampler went well with the oysters, without overpowering them. The salmon linguine was delicious and a generous portion size, due to being so rich! I actually had trouble finishing it. The Rockfish tacos were delicious and had a very fun presentation - the redness of the very large cut of Rockfish was an eye-catcher. The texture was perfect - most and just flakey enough. The atmosphere and food were top notch, and the setting can't be beat. I would take any newcomer to Seattle here for a real experience of Seattle living!

name: Elliott's Oyster House

name: Skalka
text_review: I had to sign up for Yelp today in order to leave my review because I don't know where else I can do it, maybe on Google too. Nah....food is not the same as it was before. This will be good only for those who never tried real Georgian food in Georgia. Very sad. It was delicious before and the server was a very friendly and cool guy too as other servers. Now it's all suck. SAD.

name: Skalka
text_review: I have been to Skalka twice before and the food was delicious as Georgians were making them as far as I remember. I was there today with my girlfriend, and we ordered the same food, but the taste was different. I'm not sure why but it does not taste the same anymore. Very disappointed. Of course, people who never tried this food before will be good to them, but those who have been already eaten this food before will see the difference right away. I hope you guys will bring back the same authentic taste as it was before.

name: Skalka
text_review: Waited 50 minutes. Was told to deal with it.It's a pizza (with egg) place. Totally not worth it.

name: Skalka
text_review: Ridiculous wait list management. We have been said it would take 30 minutes wait, and it haven't been ended in more than an hour.

name: Skalka
text_review: I recently visited shalka and found their concept to be quite unique. The food itself was absolutely delicious, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. However, I do have a few concerns regarding the service that I would like to address, which is why I am deducting a few stars from my overall rating.One issue I encountered was the opening time. Despite the advertised opening time of 9AM, the door was already open for guests to enter before that. It was a bit confusing as we were told that they don't officially open until 9AM, even though we were allowed to hang out inside until then. This inconsistency in their opening procedure was a little frustrating.Additionally, there was a situation where someone placed an order at 8:48AM, and they were told that they needed to wait until 9AM. This kind of miscommunication or refusal of service after the official opening time can be quite off-putting for customers.Lastly, when we wanted to share our meals, we realized that there were no knives available. It would have been more convenient if the restaurant had provided all the necessary utensils to enjoy the meal properly.In order to enhance the overall experience, I would suggest that shalka ensures that their doors are not opened before the official opening time if they are not ready to serve customers yet. Consistency in adhering to the advertised opening hours would greatly improve the customer experience. Additionally, it would be beneficial for them to ensure that all necessary utensils are readily available for customers, especially if sharing meals is encouraged.

name: Skalka
text_review: This place does bread bowls right! The filling is delicious--cheesy, flavorful, and super satisfying. They offer options for everyone, with chicken, beef, or vegan choices, so there's something for every preference. Each bread bowl is made to order, keeping it nice and crispy on the outside while perfectly holding all that tasty goodness inside. The place itself is clean and set up for self-service, from ordering to cleanup, which makes it an easy, casual stop. Definitely worth a visit if you're craving a hearty, well-made bread bowl!

name: Skalka
text_review: Despite frequently passing by this restaurant, it was my first visit, inspired by rave reviews. I decided to go for brunch on a Saturday, but the timing coincided with the Seafair Torchlight Parade, which led to most streets being closed. After 30 minutes of searching, I found street parking nearly a mile away and walked to the restaurant.**Ambiance**:The restaurant has large floor-to-ceiling windows that let in plenty of natural light, creating an airy and welcoming atmosphere. The decor is funky and fun, adding to the overall charm.**Ordering Process**:I ordered at a kiosk and provided my phone number, which felt unnecessary. It would be more customer-friendly to use numbered tokens instead of collecting personal information. After ordering, the food was brought to my table, and there were no further interactions with the staff during my meal.**Food**:I ordered a Lobiani, which consisted of red beans, runny eggs, bacon, banana peppers, and butter melting into the cheese alongside the egg yolk. Initially, I was unsure how to eat it, but I decided to chip away at the fresh and fluffy bread and use a fork for the filling. Once it was small enough, I used my hands. Although it didn't look very big, it was quite filling, and I had some leftovers.**Taste**:The food was good, but it didn't live up to the rave reviews that had set my expectations very high. It reminded me of a pizza, especially with the egg yolk and two handle-like protrusions on each side. However, it was still enjoyable and satisfying.**Value**:The price was around $18, which seemed reasonable for the portion and quality.**Conclusion**:I have nothing bad to say about the food, but it wasn't as mind-blowing as some reviews claimed. Despite that, I'm a sucker for breakfast restaurants and wouldn't hesitate to return.

name: Skalka
text_review: Nestled on the outskirts of Pikes Place in Seattle, Skalka offers a delightful culinary experience with a scenic backdrop that complements its unique approach to dining. The restaurant's commitment to delicious food and an innovative online ordering system makes it a standout in the bustling Seattle food scene.One of the notable features of Skalka is its picturesque location, providing a charming escape from the urban hustle. The ambiance is perfect for those seeking a break from the Pike's Place touristy noise.Skalka takes an unconventional approach to ordering, with the entire process conducted online. While this may be a novel concept, it does streamline the ordering process, ensuring efficiency and accuracy. However, this approach might not suit everyone, especially those who prefer a more traditional experience with face-to-face interaction.The menu at Skalka boasts a variety of delectable options, showcasing a fusion of flavors that cater to diverse palates. The Chicken Boat seemed a bit overwhelming and a bit to ummm mushy. In hindsight, opting for the Cheese Boat alone might have been a wiser choice, as it allowed the individual ingredients to shine without the slight overcrowding observed in the Chicken Boat.While the food at Skalka is undoubtedly a highlight, the service could use a friendlier touch. The online ordering system, while efficient, lacks the personal interaction that many patrons seek in a dining experience. A bit more warmth and engagement from the staff could elevate the overall satisfaction for guests. If the restaurant could enhance its service with a more personable touch, it would undoubtedly secure its place as a must-visit destination on the outskirts of Pikes Place in Seattle.

name: Skalka
text_review: Came here for my birthday breakfast and it was absolutely delicious! My mom is coming to visit in a few weeks and I'm going to take her here!

name: Skalka
text_review: Skalka's chicken boat khachapuri is a Seattle gem. The bread is perfectly balanced - soft inside, crispy out. The gooey egg and cheese meld beautifully, and the saucy chicken takes it over the top. A comforting, flavorful must-try.Great service and the servers treat me well. Nice ambiance and I like ordering on tablets.

name: Skalka
text_review: I visited Skalka this morning and ordered the Chicken Georgian Boat. Wow, it was one of the best things I've ever tasted! The bread was incredibly soft and doughy, perfect for tearing off and dipping into the flavorful ingredients in the middle. It took about 20 minutes to come out, but it was definitely worth the wait. Highly recommend!

text_review: The ordering system was interesting, but I really enjoyed the simple menu and the interface was easy to use. The options were just enough for anyone who had specific dietary needs. I got the lobiani khachapuri and it was delicious! The wait was about 15 minutes after ordering it, but it was well worth it! They make the food to order and it shows. The bread was crisp on the outside and pillowy on the inside. The toppings were fresh and perfectly cooked. I love this dish and I can't wait to get back to try the other variations they offer. You must stop by here if you're downtown Seattle.

Can't wait to go back with friends and family! Totally unique and amazing.If you're in the area, I wholeheartedly recommend stopping by Skalka Restaurant. It's a 5-star experience all the way!
