name: Skalka
text_review: The food here is amazing and the lady that served us the food was very nice as well. The only thing I did not like was a green drink I don't remember the name of. I'm sure other people love this drink, but it's not something I would order again.

Bad service. Bad server with impolite attitude. Very racist restaurant. Always ignore Asian faces and lie that they don't provide this or that even yelp shows other customers are taking the same service. Don't go. Try somewhere else.

I decided to check this place out while I was downtown checking out the biospheres. A weird latin influenced menu which doesn't seem to be figured out yet. The chef seems confused. The cocktails are ok, however there bartender seemed almost irritated that he had to serve me and wasn't very knowledgeable for the food. He was very rude. If your in the hospitality business, shouldn't you not serve with a smile. The location & design are the only reason its getting any star. Underwhelming indeed.

Having visited the 2120 establishment with girl, I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere that reigned in this place. The cool and cozy atmosphere created a special mood for the evening. The service also deserves the highest praise - the staff was attentive and friendly. However, there is one point that slightly clouded my experience. After trying the Prime New York Steak, I ordered it Well Done. Unfortunately, the dish was brought medium rare. But it is worth nothing that when I brought this error to the attention of the waiter, the problem was promptly corrected.Thus, despite a small glitch with the order, the overall impression of the 2120 establishment remained positive.

I visited the restaurant for a mid-week dinner. I had made a reservation a few weeks in advance and arrived slightly late due to traffic. Thankfully, they accommodated us, but requested that we finish by a specific time, which was fine as we had enough time. A nice touch was the free parking available in the same building after 4 pm.The restaurant was quite busy, and it took a while before someone noticed us and took our reservation. However, once we were attended to, the service was smooth. The closely spaced tables contributed to noticeable noise levels, but it wasn't unbearable.We started with some small dishes, which arrived quickly. However, our main courses took a bit longer. We ordered six items, but only one stood out for me, and I would consider ordering it again: the calamari. The green salad was good but rather simple, consisting of greens, strawberries, and crumbled cheese with a tasty vinaigrette. It was enjoyable but not quite at the level I expected.The calamari was very good, with the highlight being the yogurt sauce (though it was labeled as labneh, it wasn't as sour as traditional Mediterranean labneh). The warm spices added a nice touch.The pork belly roulette was disappointing and felt like a calorie waste.I had high hopes for the steak tartar, but it turned out to be overly sour, with the sourness overshadowing the gentle sweetness of the yolk. The textures of the meat and the popping mustard seeds were interesting, but the sourness was too much for my taste.My husband ordered the rack of lamb, which tasted very good but was rather small for its $62 price tag, consisting of only two chops and some veggies.The cream puff had a moderate sweetness level, which was appreciated. However, I found the cream both inside and outside to be overly fatty, with just a hint of fruit filling in the middle. I would have preferred a better balance with less cream and more filling.Despite the restaurant's great reviews, I don't plan on returning.

I liked this place a lot! I came in for brunch and the food/ drink aesthetic was very pretty and the flavors were very well mixed too! It is also across the street from the Amazon spheres and that was neat. The one downside I really had was that my poached eggs were really over cooked and that's never fun. But I'd definitely be open to coming back!

A solid salad, enough to fill you up although I don't think they give as much as evergreens does. Here, I'd stick to a preset menu item over individually ordering because so many things cost extra that it's too much to keep track of. The harvest salad was definitely yummy but I really couldn't tell you how I ended up paying $20 for it. I feel like sweetgreen is cool because it's the prototype for these types of salad places but holy moly I don't want to pay this much for a bowl of kale.

I recently dined at 2120, an upscale casual restaurant located inside the Amazon One building, the birthplace of Jeff Bezos' empire. The ambience inside is warm and modern, with about thirty tables and a bar that seats around ten to fifteen people. The restaurant also boasts a very nice patio that overlooks a globe building, adding to its aesthetic appeal.The highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the food and the service. I started with the carrots as an appetizer, which had a surprising texture similar to a baked potato rather than traditional carrots. For the main course, I had the scallops, which were absolutely amazing--tender and delicious, served with a curry and cumin sauce that was out of this world and really highlighted the dish. We also tried the Belgian frites, which were crispy and flavorful, clearly benefitting from their double-frying process.Our server, Will, was excellent. He was attentive without being overbearing, allowing us to enjoy our meal at a comfortable pace. He had great wine recommendations and picked out an incredible dessert for us, carrot cake, which was a perfect end to a wonderful meal. Will truly enhanced our dining experience with his professionalism and expertise.Overall, I highly recommend 2120 for its outstanding food, inviting atmosphere, and exceptional service.

It was our first time visiting the restaurant , and we decided to celebrate Galentine's Day there. I must say, the overall experience was amazing.The highlight of our evening was our waiter, Spencer. Spenser's patience, kindness, and attentiveness made our dining experience truly memorable. Not only did he provide excellent service, but he also recommended great dishes and drinks. The combination of delicious food, impeccable service, and a beautiful setting made for an unforgettable evening.Thank you, to Spencer for his exceptional service.

We chose 2120 to celebrate a family birthday, based on yelp reviews. In short, 2120 delivered and then some. We loved the variety of food, the atmosphere and the service.A memorable evening. We will be back.

Hold onto your taste buds and prepare for a wild ride at 2120 in Seattle! This place had me drooling, and questioning why I hadn't discovered it sooner. Brace yourself for an epic culinary adventure that will leave your belly satisfied!Let's talk about the braised lamb cacciatore, shall we? It was so good that I momentarily forgot my own name. The lamb was so tender, it practically serenaded me with a love ballad as I took my first bite. The tomato sauce was so rich, it had more flavor than a Shakespearean tragedy. I half-expected the chef to burst out of the kitchen and take a bow for this masterpiece. Seriously, they should consider selling tickets to this lamb extravaganza--it's that good!And oh, the pumpkin puff! It was like the dessert gods decided to throw a party in my mouth. The puff pastry was so light and fluffy; I swear it had levitation powers. The pumpkin filling was like a magic potion brewed by a mischievous wizard. One bite, and I was under its spell--complete with giggles, swoons, and a longing for more. Move over Cinderella, this pumpkin creation is the real star of the fairytale!The ambiance was the cherry on top of this feast. The lighting was dim enough to create an intimate atmosphere, but not so dim that I couldn't see my food (because let's be honest, that would be a tragedy).To sum it up, 2120 is the place where culinary excellence. The braised lamb cacciatore and pumpkin puff are the headliners of this comedy show for your taste buds. The staff deserves a standing ovation for their top-notch service. So, bring your appetite, and get ready to feast on delicious food at 2120. It's a culinary adventure you won't soon forget!

I have been talking about this salmon since I visited 2120 back in February 2023... it is the best salmon I have ever had.People typically describe their salmon according to its flakiness, falling apart with a touch of their fork. Looking at it from that lens, 2120's salmon would melt apart if you were to simply blow on it like a candle. It was buttery smooth, fatty, with almost no need to chew. It was perfection and I am already planning a return when back in Seattle later this year. Amazing food aside, I also want to shoutout their private dining service. Our group of 20 was welcomed to our dining room with a signature cocktail, a three-course menu imprinted with our names, and friendly service that didn't miss a beat.Highly recommend as a must-visit dinner restaurant.
I really enjoy the place and their food. I love to go there again. Highly recommended!
Nice location, booking in advance at peak times is a good idea, the atmosphere and service is great, each dish is well prepared and tastes great.

Thank you 2120 for the amazing food & the complimentary donuts & champagne for our engagement. Ambiance was beautiful! Perfect for date night, coworker hang out, friends reunion. Beautiful design and service was super nice. But the star of the show was the FOOD! Burrata and panna cotta were a perfect bookends of freshness to introduce and conclude our night. My fiance had an super juicy Pork Chop while I had the best Salmon I have ever eaten. Must visit if you are in Seattle! BurrataKing Salmon Miso Butter Pork ChopHouse Made DonutsEspresso Panna Cotta

Tried 2120 this evening!! First time in this stunning restaurant. Great service from Wilson!!! The food was amazing!! Chef Kyle and Chef Nick know how to bring out great flavor in all of the dishes!! General Manager, Chris was so hospitable, serving wine and great conversation. Give Wilson his bottle of wine!!!! We will be back. Tell your friends!!!

Amazing service! From the moment we walked into the restaurant to the moment we left. Our server was very accommodating and went above and beyond. The food left us speechless; we had items for the night, and everything was our favorite, can't pick one if we had to. We can't wait to come back and see what new items they'll have drinks, were perfection.
Food is always amazing, drinks are even better. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu

My partner and I decided to dine at 2120 for the first time tonight.. safe to say, we are both at a LOSS for words. The food, service, ambience were beyond immaculate. Amanda was an incredible part of our dining experience. She was lovely to talk to and made our night. We honestly cannot wait to dine here again!!!

We had Jason as our waiter for this evening and it was an absolutely incredible experience. From the food to the service to the reception it was a complete treat as an experience. Not only was Jason attentive and friendly he was someone we would come back to see here for a regular basis. Unbelievably positive customer experience, fantastic food, great atmosphere. this might seem like a bot posting this but I promise if you give this place a shot you will NOT be disappointed. 10/10
This is a great place with amazing food and fabulous service!! I would recommend this place to everyone!

My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and decided to check 2120 out. We were so incredibly impressed! The staff greeted us by our names and wished us a happy anniversary. We were given complimentary champagne...amazing!...and Wilson, our server, was so attentive and fantastic! They went above and beyond our expectations and have definitely set the bar incredibly high. This is our new favorite spot in Seattle and we have already told so many of our friends. Thank you! - Justin and Sabrina

I came here for lunch with a friend and was very happy with my choice. I had the roasted delicata bowl and my friend had the Caesar salad with shrimp. Both were very good and full of flavor, and the portion sizes were generous. We each had a glass of ros�, which was also nice (I like that their wine list is Washington focused). Our food came out in a timely fashion, and our server was very pleasant. The restaurant itself is very pretty with a nice view of the Amazon biospheres. I also like that they have convenient parking in the building. I'll definitely be back for lunch again, and look forward to trying their dinner menu soon.

I decided to come back for lunch, as I heard that they changed up their lunch menu a bit (I normally come for dinner). They have a nice selection of sandwiches, which they had previously, but also added a new Salads & Bowls section that has some yummy sounding dishes. It looks like the bulk of the new dishes have vegetarian options too. I had the roasted delicata dish, and it was very good! Full of flavor, and quite filling. The food came out quickly too, which is great for my lunch time crunch. I look forward to trying some more of the new lunch dishes soon.

I came back to try their new lunch menu. I've tried both the dinner and brunch menus, both of which I liked. The lunch menu was also quite good. I like the addition of their "Bowls & Salads" section, as it adds a nice, light option. Each of the dishes come with the option to add a protein (salmon, shrimp, or chicken), which is great, and I believe that they all come as vegetarian options by default (with out the added proteins, of course!). I had the quinoa bowl with shrimp, and it was very tasty, and filling, but not heavy. I like that I was able to get in an out for lunch at well under an hour too. I'll be back for sure.

Great food and service. The happy hour menu did not disappoint and their new pork belly tostadas were delicious. Also, try the punch on draft. They serve punch bowls and are discounted heavily on happy hour.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: This restaurant is modern yet relaxed and the food and service were great! Delicious pancakes and bacon. Polite staff with great views. Enjoyed walking along the water after, and it was a quick walk to Olympic sculpture park.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Good food but extremely pricey for what you get! Omelette was $16, bacon $6. Convenient if you're staying at the Edgewater Hotel...

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: My favorite place to go for weekend drinks! The ambience is so cool.. right on the water and cool lighting. So much more sophisticated than Belltown, but with the mix of crowd (all different ages because it's in a hotel) it never seems pretentious. I've seen various music acts here most of which were fabulous... too good to be free! And the bartenders and wait staff are great (especially Lee at the bar).  The only reason I don't give 5 stars is that the drinks are on the spendy side, and they have to shut the music down at midnight.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Great service and awesome food! We shall return!

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Great food, great atmosphere and a great view! The food was very tasty, the flavors were really nice, and the price for all of it is very reasonable. No problem with service at all!

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: The views from this place are unbelievable. The food is also very good but expect to shell out some clams at dinner. Breakfast and lunch are a much better value. Every time I go in there on a beautiful day they are super busy and the food takes a really long time. They also seem to be understaffed by the way I see the employees rushing around. If you are not in a hurry and want to enjoy your surroundings then you definitely need to go.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: great happy hour, great view. Fish is tasty.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: I have spent time at the bar three times when Jagger was working and once when Mark was working; both of them were really good. They took care of customers and gave great service while keeping the drinks flowing for the dining room. Also, I need to give a shout-out to the guy cleaning up in the lodge area; he also did a great job.The food is top-notch, though-it's a bit on the high side, price-wise. A main course will be about $50-60. Expect to spend in the region of $150-200 dinner for two, including drinks. I had the clam chowder, and it was great. Seafood mix and steak were great, nice and done.The only downside would be that the place feels a little old, but that is not really a big deal.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Six Seven Restaurant is a very good restaurant. The service was unimpeachable, with staff who were not only attentive but also genuinely passionate about ensuring our dining experience was memorable. I highly recommend this restaurant.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: 5 star company! I recommend a must to eat here! recommending everyone and bringing family back

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: The food was some of the best iv ever eaten. It was a little warm on the patio. Once the sun was about to set it cooled off and one amazing view

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: I recently dined at Six Seven Restaurant and had an enjoyable experience. The restaurant is located in a beautiful waterfront setting, offering stunning views of the Seattle skyline and Elliott Bay. The ambiance is sophisticated and elegant, making it a perfect choice for a special occasion or a romantic evening.The menu at Six Seven Restaurant features a variety of culinary delights. I had the opportunity to try their seafood dishes, and they were delicious. The flavors were well-balanced, and the presentation was impeccable. The freshness of the ingredients was evident in every bite, and the seafood was cooked to perfection.The service at Six Seven Restaurant was exceptional. The staff was attentive, and knowledgeable, and provided excellent recommendations. They were also mindful of dietary restrictions and accommodated special requests with ease.In addition to the wonderful food and service, the restaurant offers an extensive wine list and a well-crafted cocktail menu. The sommelier was helpful in suggesting pairings that enhanced the dining experience.The only minor drawback was that the prices at Six Seven Restaurant are on the higher side, reflecting the upscale dining experience and waterfront location. However, considering the quality of the food, service, and ambiance, it was a worthwhile investment.Overall, I would highly recommend Six Seven Restaurant to those looking for an elegant dining experience in Seattle. The combination of exquisite cuisine, impeccable service, and breathtaking views make it a standout restaurant that truly showcases the best of the city.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: The views from this place are unbelievable. The food is also very good but expects to shell out some clams at dinner. Breakfast and lunch are a much better value. Every time I go in there on a beautiful day they are super busy and the food takes a long time. They also seem to be understaffed by the way I see the employees rushing around. If you are not in a hurry and want to enjoy your surroundings then you need to go.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Amazing place for brunch ,Beautiful view ! The crabs are very tasty and I will go there again for sure on my next family visit in Seattle

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Great view, great food and ambiance. We waited a bit longer to sit outside and it was worth it.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: I've been coming here for years and absolutely love it!! The staff is always pleasant and go out of there way to make my experience amazing! Totally come here if you want a fine dining experience

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: If you're looking for some scenery to go along with a great meal I would highly recommend eating here the service was great glad this was one of my choices while I was visiting here in Seattle if I ever come back I would definitely eat here again

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: EXCELLENT dining experience. Our server was great. The food was fantastic and the view was amazing. They have a bar and sitting area on the lower level. My kids played corn hole with some other children who were present. Overall lovely time. I will be returning.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Delicious Dinner with friends January 17, 2020We had a good birthday party at Six Seven. Dishes included pasta, steak, and pork chops. Be sure to try the amazing artisan bread. We had a friendly and funny waitress, who made our meal even better.she was a gas and a real bonus for helping us to have such a good time.

name: Six Seven Restaurant
text_review: Incredible view, location and food.! Def recommend attending during sunset hours!

name: Palisade
text_review: Kait W. This review is for you...what are you even doing with your automatic response...shows that this establishment has gone to or has always been sh...t. Go ahead Kait W. Reply with your usual...with that dry pond!

name: Palisade
text_review: Not ONE woman working on the wait staff or cooking. This means that all of the higher income jobs are closed off to women. Blatant gender bias. Sorry folks but it's no longer 1980 and this open misogyny is NOT acceptable. Gender equality will never occur if we do not vote with our wallets. If you care about this issue, DO NOT EAT HERE!

name: Palisade
text_review: Cool spot and good food, but you have to be kidding me making last call at 9:45 for drinks! 9:45?? What are we kids and its our bedtime at 10pm? You have people in the bar that want to spend money at your restaurant and you basically kick them out because your employees want to go home... Get it together!!

name: Palisade
text_review: If you are thinking of having your wedding or wedding reception here, read more:I was a guest here for a wedding ceremony/reception in the Orchid Room in July this year 2011. Having had dinner multiple times here before in their main dinning area, the food was more than impressive. The view is picturesque and the food is exceptional- for all intents and purposes, this was a great place for a wedding reception. While the overall picture was great, the Catering Team GAVE THEIR WEDDING CAKE AWAY.The cake was bought through Palisade made through a local vendor, Dessert Works, with whom they had a cake tasting months prior like most couples do. The assistant manager came up to the BRIDE during the pictures and said that 'WE' have a problem. They had lost the cake.The bride and groom were nothing but pleasant and accommodating (what else were they supposed to do?) and had their ceremony. During the reception, the assistant manager again spoke to the bride and said that after investigating the matter, they had concluded the cake was GIVEN TO THE ANOTHER WEDDING RECEPTION THE NIGHT BEFORE. He proceeded to describe that 'WE' had two options: a cake from QFC (he misspoke and meant Whole Foods- imagine the astonishment) or cupcakes from Cupcake Royale. The Bride and Groom chose cupcakes and did not elude to their company of the unfortunate mistake as most of the guests thought this was their choice for dessert. Although many people choose cupcakes for their reception, this was not the cake they chose. After more investigating, Dessert Works did their job and delivered what could only be imagined to be a wonderful cake that another wedding party got to enjoy (were they VIP?) because the bride and groom's name was on the cake box according to Dessert Works.Palisade compensated in various ways but you can not replicate the moment or pictures of your wedding day again.

name: Palisade
text_review: I have lived in Seattle for 30 years and have been to just about every restaruant here. THIS IS THE ONLY RESTARAUNT I HAVE ACTUALLY BEEN KICKED OUT OF! Why? Simply because I asked an obviously overworked doorman why my car hadn't been brought out for us when many others behind us in line were being brought their car?! He accused me of "touching him" on the shoulder. I was with a company christmas party in 2008, and EVERYONE WAS APPAULED. Needless to say I will never return. ALSO! Take notice that the people most excited about the restaraunt ARE THE PEOPLE WHO WORK THERE. They often seem overwhelmed with satisfaction of their own restaraunt, snobbish. If you go, see if you agree....Oh! AND DEFINATELY DON'T USE THE VALET!!! Much better optioin is SALTY'S restaraunt in West Seattle, especially for Sunday brunch. Unlike the Palisades, it's an open buffet of EVERYTHING...meat, seafood, omelette bar, NOT JUST PANCAKES!

name: Palisade
text_review: This place is way over priced for the unprofessional staff in dirty clothes and unkept appearance. The food quality was very disappointing. I had the surf and turf and ordered my steak medium rare. It came after a long 45+ minute wait, only to cut into it and it was well done. I never send food back, but I did on this occasion because it was a 3:15pm dinner reservation and there is no excuse to overcook steaks when it's not super busy. After sending it back, I was brought a steak that they just threw on the grill for a couple minutes on high heat and they called it a day. It was absolutely rare in the middle and burnt outside. Worst cooked steak ever. I ate it cause it was $74 but the whole deal was terrible. They were out of the desert we wanted at 4:30pm. They said it was cause of the banquet that they had. Ok lol. This place just sucked these days. If you're gonna spend money like that. Go somewhere else for sure. The view is nice of course. But you could find a way better restaurant.

name: Palisade
text_review: Our latest visit will be our last. Sad to hear their company declared bankruptcy and they are clearly cutting corners on food quality. Servers seemed stretched as we hardly saw ours during the meal and had to flag down multiple people for water, salt and another drink. Fingers crossed a savvy restauranteur will swoop in and save this dying Seattle landmark.

name: Palisade
text_review: View is fabulous. Food was excellent, when we finally received it. The service or lack there of, was horendous. Manager made it right in the end.

name: Palisade
text_review: Wow for $209 I would think you woudl have an amazing meal. Hostess staff great and the meal went downhill from there. Appetizer felt like QFC sushi cheap. Steak was overdone we sent back and my wifes sat there for 15 minutes - they brought another 22 minutes later after she had finished very poor serving should have taken hers to stay warm. Then forgot shared salad. When I went to the bathroom I asked to talk to the manager and they point out a bald guy named Paul who said oh he was really sorry. He then offered to buy us a drink, which we were charged for. So as we were leaving we asked to see him again to tell him. I saw him in the hallway behind the bathroom and they said nope he is not here. He was laughing with his girlfriend or hitting on a cocktail waitress. Only reason it gets 2 is the view and the hostess. Awful service and good food but very overpriced.

name: Palisade
text_review: I recently went here for an anniversary dinner with my wife, and i was treated incredibly rudely by the manager Delyce Howell. The food was ok, but the service definitely needs improvement. After remarking to our waiter that we had a hair on the caesar salad, the manager then came over and gave a half-hearted apology and quite frankly just ruined the evening for me and the misses. I don't mean to be one of those vindictive type of yelp reviewers, but certainly this place could use a bit of improvement. On the plus side, the Palisades Ocean Tower was delicious and the cabarnet short rib was delicious.

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: I was told the wait was 30 minutes... an hour and 10 minutes later still no text to be seated. Ended up canceling my wait.

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: I regularly order here and I don't know what happened today, but they usually have good pizza.

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: U just turned away 8 people. Who makes up your rules? What a bunch of fools!    ............

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: Not worth the wait. Portions were very small. I was expecting a little more since I was was paying almost 20$ for a pizza, and waiting about an hour , Staff didn't seem to be so nice. We came down the street to eat

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: Pizza was just ok, not even as good as pizza hut pizzas. Added on 20% tips with out notice. Very bad experience. You really want money? Not this way. Offering better pizzas and services instead!

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: Rude people. After getting over the rude people the pizza was burnt. Terrible, non repeatable experience.

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: WTF, forced 20% gratuity? $80 pizza lunch for 3 people? Who the hell these guys think they are? This is a Heist. Never ever going here. Douche. Oh, and I have had better pizza elsewhere.

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: Great location /restaurant . Not so great pizza /food, not sure what all the rave is about .

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: I only have the happy hour menu here. The portions are so small.

name: Serious Pie Downtown
text_review: meh, over-rated...

name: Tanoor
text_review: Extremely Disappointing and terrible Experience at Tanoor RestaurantLocation: Tanoor Seattle My husband and I decided to try Tanoor Restaurant for the first time, but it turned out to be the worst dining experience we've ever had. The restaurant was busy, but we were seated in an uncomfortably tight spot, which already made us feel unwelcome. From there, things only got worse.Despite waiting for 30 minutes, not a single server came to take our order or even offer us water. Meanwhile, we watched other customers, who arrived after us, being served promptly. The servers took their orders, brought out appetizers, and attended to them, but no one bothered to check on us.What made it even more frustrating was that the staff clearly saw us waiting--they even glanced in our direction several times--but chose to ignore us completely. It felt disrespectful and left us wondering why we were being treated this way.After waiting and hoping for someone to acknowledge us, we finally gave up and left. It was humiliating and upsetting to experience such poor service, especially when we had been excited to try a new restaurant.This was the first time something like this had ever happened to us at a restaurant, and it will certainly be the last time we visit Tanoor. If this is how they treat customers, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

name: Tanoor
text_review: My brother and I live nearby and we've always wanted to check it out. We decided to go on a Friday to avoid the dinner rush. It wasn't very busy, but we ended up waiting for service for 30 minutes. Nobody offered us water and we noticed other people being served. Eventually, we just decided to leave and went to a place across the street. Nobody said anything to us as we left; they seemed more interested in their own conversations. We won't be recommending this place to anyone. Maybe the food is good, but the service, or lack thereof, was really bad. Even Stone Korean, which is much smaller, has better service than this place.

name: Tanoor
text_review: They take too long, the food isn't great, poor management.Would not recommend.

name: Tanoor
text_review: Fresh, super flavorful food! Lots of vegetarian and carnivore options. House made pita... wow! With a large variety of dips- we had the muhammara - peppers,walnuts, pomegranate syrup with a touch of spiciness- could have made a meal from that and the pita! The mixed plate for 2-3 easily served 5 people- freshly grilled veggies, 3 quality meats cooked just right, yellow ( saffron?) rice.  Great value for the quantity of food!    No alcoholic drinks, but a wide variety of juices, teas, and Turkish coffee. Will definitely become a repeat customer!Dietary restrictions: Good variety of keto and vegetarian options.Wheelchair accessibility: I have limited mobility, so I appreciated the no barrier entry- they let me come in a different door,closer to where I parked. Parking nearby would be difficult, as one side of the building is on a steep hill.

name: Tanoor
text_review: I always enjoy going here for amazing atmosphere and service. The food was good and fresh except Kunnafah, they really need to fix that. It was soggy and chewy, rest everything was amazing. I will visit again but will never order dessert.

name: Tanoor
text_review: Delicious , great quality,real family style .Great service . Not a single complaint .

name: Tanoor
text_review: At the end of every meal, I like to wind down my night with a coffee. Surprisingly, this place always brews my coffee fresh. Which a lot of places don't do. And I get a desert to pair with it nicely. I'd just like to say thank you for always providing great and consistent service. I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Tanoor
text_review: Tanoor in Seattle is a gem for anyone who enjoys authentic Lebanese cuisine. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm and attentive service, making the dining experience truly exceptional. The staff here are fantastic, and I must praise Ali, who stood out with his accommodating and cooperative approach. He ensured everything ran smoothly, from seating to meal recommendations, and his efficiency made the evening even more enjoyable.The food was simply amazing. Each dish was packed with flavor, showcasing the true essence of Lebanese cooking. The blend of spices and fresh ingredients made every bite a delight. If you're looking for a place with both incredible food and outstanding service, Tanoor is definitely the spot to visit. Highly recommended!

name: Tanoor
text_review: This was my wife's and my first time here and we thought it was incredible. The food was perfect in flavor and portion. Their home made pita bread was next level and our server was knowledgeable of the cuisine and friendly.

name: Tanoor
text_review: Tried the Batata Harra, and it was a spicy revelation! Perfectly crispy, flavorful, and a tasty kick that lingers. A must-try for spice lovers!

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: How can you possible justify a $65 dollar strip steak? I assume you're paying for the location rather than the food. Typical for a fame hungry business; ramp the price up for the location while serving unimpressive food. I could make the same meal for $25. I'm willing to pay for service buy you're being ridiculous.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: Disappointing meal. Steak not cooked properly, twice. Nothing of quality to report. Very disappointing.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: Waited for 20 minutes and nobody greeted me. Parking is also not free, will not return.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: not what you would expect when entering a fine dining restaurant. when i entered i wasn't greeted with any sort of hospitality and felt like the next customer. I've worked in restaurants for years and know what good service is. after we were sat the waiter promptly took our drink orders before we could even take a look at the menu. interesting fact, the steaks here a way overpriced. i order the filet, and obviously at these prices i was expecting perfection. instead i got inspection, the steak appeared to be raw so i kindly notified the waiter that i would appreciate a few more min on the grill. when they brought it back to me 10 min later, it was medium well, i ordered medium rare. not to mention the sear on the steak was pathetic. I've been cooking all my life and I could have done better with a filet purchased from Wal-Mart! i was too upset to complain about my meal so i just bit the bullet of a steak and tried to enjoy the remainder of the evening. the service was good but i felt a bit of animosity from the waiter. not sure if ill be coming back here, It' s hard to recommend. el gaucho on the other hand...that's a different story.Ian W.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: They changed their happy hour a few weeks ago and it sucks now. The happy hour food is no longer 1/2 off and the wine / drinks are only $2 off. They had one of the best happy hours. It's too bad.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: 1st time and not impressed. 20% guaranty automatically added to your bill which goes to the company. Waiters receive commission on sales. Our waiters attitude changed toward us when we ordered coffee and not alcohol. Food was just ok and very disappointed.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: I've eaten here many times, while the food and service was good I am very upset that they automatically added a 20% service charge to my bill and than leave space for an "additional tip". When my wife and I come we always tip well, to add this automatically is highly offensive. I doubt I'll be back as there are many fine dinning establishments in Seattle who still give you a choice in the amount you tip.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: Three times I've been here now. Two times with groups of about 10 and once with a date. The group things seem to put the staff in a bad way. One time we had extra drinks on our bill (The drinks we ordered from the bar due to not wanting to keep waiting forever for our waiter to take our order were paid for at the bar AND put on our receipt) including a bottle of wine we didn't order, a pile of plates were dropped, we literally did not get asked what choice of side we wanted until one of the people in our party asked the waiter if they wanted to know what we wanted, my steak (medium well) also was literally charred on both sides that the meat on the inside was only about 1/4 inch thick. I get that bigger groups are more difficult and things like dropping plates is just something that is going to happen but if you can't provide excellent service at this price point you need to stay within your abilities. My date experience was better but there's plenty of nice places at this price point that can really "Wow" you.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: The steak was mediocre at best. The service and atmosphere is excellent.You pay for the atmosphere not the food by any means. Does not compare to the met. I sent my steak back . The salmon was great.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: I was really disappointed in the service we got from our waiter. First he wasn't really friendly and welcoming off the bat. My order got messed up and he wasn't very attentive with what we needed. Definetely not what I expected from a classy establishment. It could've been just this particular waiter. His name was Kermit J. Other than that this is a really good place to take a date. Food is alright but the ambience is great.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: Here's an improved version of your review for better readability and clarity: "The food was, as always, outstanding, and the ambiance was great. We visited for a New Year's Eve dinner and everything was going well--until just before midnight. Two minutes before the countdown, we received our dessert and asked if we could step outside to watch the fireworks. The staff asked us to leave our card as a precaution due to previous walkouts, which we did. However, when the fireworks ended, we found the doors locked and struggled to get back inside. To make matters worse, the waitress had already packed up our desserts and removed my glass of wine. This was not how I wanted to start the new year! The manager eventually offered to have our desserts remade at the table, but by that point, the damage was done. The experience left us all with a bitter taste. As leaving I went to the toilet, there was no toilet paper and looked trashed...very unusual.It's truly disappointing to have such an unfortunate experience at Daniel's, especially on a special occasion like New Year's Eve,

name: Daniel's Broiler

text_review: The management offers you a reservation, parking valet, street or private lot, full bars of alcoholic drinks, and you can visit there during happy hours. They will also give you complimentary cakes with vanilla ice cream and berries.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: MIIA gave us fabulous service. Friendly and professional. 5/5Wine. Miia offered some Washington wine that i loved. 5/5Invited 6 guests, three from out of country. Normally i like to offer American meat to my foreign guests, in particularly French ones, as I think our meats are so much better than theirs.I got the bone-in rib eye. Found the meat too dry, not great quality perhaps. It was done a true medium rare as i asked. I appreciated that very much but it was a bit too hard to chew. 3/5 maybe 2.5/5Salad. 3/5peach tart with ice cream 2/5ambiance 4/5Price around $150 per person which for such a place is reasonable.I have no problem going back

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: Our Thanksgiving gathering at Daniel's Broiler, set against the backdrop of the bar, followed a straightforward culinary narrative. My companion opted for the classic turkey, while I leaned towards the prime rib. The gustatory experience was undeniably praiseworthy, with flavors that underscored a notable culinary finesse.Service, operating within the parameters of adequacy, maintained an understated demeanor, providing a seamless backdrop to our dining experience.However, the post-dinner endeavor to secure leftovers took an unforeseen turn. A meticulous separation of meat and fat, coupled with a modest request for an extra serving of potatoes, aimed to prolong the culinary pleasure. Regrettably, upon revisiting the remains, the gastronomic continuity suffered a setback. The boxed ensemble, lacking cranberry sauce, horseradish that had been left on my plate, and the absent side of coveted potatoes I requested, presented a major Thanksgiving leftovers letdown---especially taking into consideration the high price we had paid for the meal. Nevertheless, let this culinary service anomaly not overshadow the overall commendable nature of the experience. As we contemplate future visits, a pragmatic approach emerges - a proactive request during the boxing process to ensure a more faithful representation of the intended leftovers. Here's to culinary precision and anticipating an untarnished encore in subsequent engagements.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: Tough to beat Daniel's Broiler Lake Union for Happy Hour. Incredible views of Lake Union, sailboats and seaplanes. Great pricing on signature appetizers like filet mignon steak strips and crispy artichoke hearts and classic cocktails- martinis and manhattans. It's been my go to place for happy hour in Seattle for over 2 decades!

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: Love this restaurant! I believe it is a Seattle staple. The beautiful views combined with top notch service and atmosphere. I think Daniels is an excellent choice for any special occasion. I personally spent my last birthday here and everything was perfect my steak was cooked to a perfect rare plus. The staff even checks with you to confirm your steak is cooked exactly to your specification. I do not believe that the yelp rating for this restaurant does this place justice. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to splurge a little bit and have an elegant dinner. Daniels deserves all five stars in my book!

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: I used to be a steak lover but now I'm a vegetarian/aspiring vegan and want to give Daniel's big love for having a dedicated vegan menu. While most steakhouses have veggie options tucked into their sides and appetizers, it's rare for any restaurant to have a specific vegan menu. As a veggie-eater who still likes the steakhouse atmosphere, I deeply appreciate it.

name: Daniel's Broiler
text_review: I have never had a bad experience at Daniel's! The staff is amazing (esp. the wine director Erik Segelbaum), they have an amazing happy hour menu (I am an HUGE oyster fan and they always have the best ones at the best price!) During the summer, the outdoor seating area is beautiful which is another plus! Their dinner menu is exquisite as well. I have had my share of steaks and Daniel's has the best steak. Their seafood is also very well prepared although sometimes the king crab legs can be a little bit too salty at times. All in all, if you are looking for a good time with good food, good wine, and good service, go to Daniel's!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I have been banking with Banner Bank for a couple of years with not overdrafts of problems. I used Banner Banks smartphone app (official Banner Bank App promoted by bank) to make a deposit as I was leaving for vacation. I had used this process a couple of times before with no problem. This was used to move money from one of my bank account to another (available funds was never stated as a problem). The app involves submitting a photo of both the front and back of the check. When submitting the deposit the app show "submitted" as status. After reviewing, the app status gets changed to "accepted". I verified that the status was "Accepted" before leaving data coverage. When I returned on 7/19/2014, the status still showed "accepted" but the transaction was never processed. This resulted in overdraft fees of $120 plus the fees applied by the other banks that were declined. On 7/21/2014 I went to the branch to see what had happened. They said that they had questions about the check and had declined to process it. The teller told me that she didn't care what the app said, it didn't process and they weren't going to back off any charges. When I asked to speak to the manager I was asked to be seated. then a couple of minutes later the teller came back out and said that the manager "reviewed the case" and that they wouldn't make any changes. When asked if I could talk to her, I was told NO. When I returned home, I contacted the corporate office and was told it was up to the local branch manager. I did get a phone number for a regional supervisor (Marcello (425) 739-1055), but he seams to not want to answer his phone.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Piroshky is a hole in the wall shoppe smack dab in the middle of Pike Place Market. Their food is pretty good... ask them for their most famous piroshky and you'll be happy. You can't actually sit down and eat so you're going to be dealing with a hit and run scenario. To me, a 5-star rating consists of AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE, AMAZING FOOD, AND AMAZING AMBIANCE and here you just get good food.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Piroshky Piroshky is a Seattle institution and a must-visit for anyone exploring Pike Place Market. This small, bustling bakery offers an incredible selection of hand-held pastries that are as delicious as they are iconic.I tried the Smoked Salmon Pate Piroshky, and it was everything I hoped for and more. The pastry itself was flaky, golden, and baked to perfection, while the filling was rich, flavorful, and packed with high-quality smoked salmon. The balance of buttery dough and savory filling made every bite unforgettable.Be prepared for a line--it's a testament to how beloved this spot is. But trust me, the wait is worth it. The staff works quickly and efficiently, and the pastries are always fresh out of the oven.Whether you're grabbing a quick bite while exploring Pike Place or looking for a unique Seattle treat to take home, Piroshky Piroshky delivers an authentic and satisfying experience.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: A Seattle classic! always has a line but it moves pretty fast! food never disappoints! size is pretty small tho

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Another MUST visit when visiting Pike Place Market! They almost always have a line down the block. Just like Starbucks.  Do not fear the wait times though for Piroshky!!! The lines go very quickly and all food is made from scratch and very fresh!!!4/5 s for atmosphere because it is neat they have windows where you can see into the kitchen and watch them make everything and bake , but they do not have tables or chairs available!!We tried a savory and sweet piroshky! The savory was the salmon pate, which I felt was very fitting since we were visiting the fish market . It was smoked salmon and very creamy--absolutely delicious. The sweet was the Moscow roll. Another delicious choice 4/5 s for service. It is counter service and very quick paced. Not much time for friendly conversation, definitely not rude or bad, just too quick for much.A must try when you are visiting Pike Place Market and I rate it as a must try when in Seattle Peep the food pics there are yummy sights to see!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Love this place, how could you not. I love the salmon. Kid loved the beef.Always a must visit when at Pike Place

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Purchased two pirodhkys. Ate one just as soon as I left the store. It was good! I stored the other one in a refrigerator overnight and reheated it. The reheated one was disappointing.Bottom line, enjoy it fresh and hot out of the oven.

name: Piroshky Piroshky

name: Piroshky Piroshky

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I can't even describe how much I loved this. Since this was my first time here, I wanted to try the most popular items as a start. They have a "Best Seller" section shown on their menu. The main three: Beef and Cheese, Smoked Salmon Pate, and Potato and Cheese.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: It's mid. It's just okay. Worth one visit, or if you have a favorite pastry here then it's worth a stop if you're in the area, but that's kind of it. I don't understand the super long lines and I definitely wouldn't stand in the cold for it. Sounds harsh, but this place gets so much hype and yes it's good, but the hype doesn't match the product in my opinion. Again, worth one visit, but not my favorite.My only favorite thing to get here is the pastry with the spicy cheese sausage in it. If anything, it speaks volumes on how good the sausage is, not the actual breading around it. It's the only thing I will buy here moving forward. Otherwise, workers here are very friendly and patient, they provide a very comfortable vibe and they are just so nice.

name: Piroshky Piroshky

text_review: My husband has a food allergy, so we have to be cautious where we go. It's not typical that the waiters ask about them but the fact that they did surprised me. I'm quite picky with my meat so I was also surprised at how fresh the ingredients tasted. The food came out to perfection. Will be coming again soon. I would also recommend this place to anyone!

text_review: This is one of the freshest bakeries i have been to! The staff inside was great as well super friendly and helpful. Prices were very fair, and despite how small these things might look, they were more filling than we anticipated. Everything was fresh.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This place has reached meme-tier levels of hype, and I'm not sure if it's that special, although it's hard to not grab one when I come down to Pike Place Market. I like the potato, cheese, and onion.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: You kind of know a place is good when the lines are out the door and the place smells like butter. These piroshkies are a little different then what you would find in a typical Russian or Eastern European bakery. The dough is puff pastry instead of baked/fried bread. Reminds me of a fancy empanada or handpie. I had the beef and onion. Based on appearances, I was expecting it to sit like a brick in my stomach but the pastry was surprisingly light with a good beef flavor and nicely seasoned not overly salty. Wish I had more time and the stomach space to sample their other offerings.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Fast service, suddenly I was expecting more.. not sure why.. mine didnt like it that much..

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Piroshky Piroshky! This was actually my friends and I's FIRST stop in Seattle. We were hungry and we looked at my Seattle "to do" list and bam, there it was. Right in front of our eyes. We waited in the line outside with our luggage because we came straight from the airport. The line did go pretty quickly. Do you know what a piroshky is? If not, compare it to a pierogi or a kolachi. Basically bread with stuff .. stuffed inside lol. Carb heaven I must say. Everything has bread with it. Therefore, if you cannot eat carbs or it's a weakness for you, stay away lol. I ended up getting the Smoked Salmon Pate. Giving the traditional Piroshky a local spin, this bestseller is a delicious blend of Smoked Salmon, cream cheese, a dash of dill and onion. I really loved it. It was nice and warm and the smoked salmon was flavorful.Then during a food tour, I had the Smoked Salmon Pate and then an Apple Cinnamon Roll. This includes slices of Granny Smith Apples dusted with Cinnamon, rolled into dough and finished with a glaze of honey and lemon. It is their bestselling sweet creation. It was really good.The morning we had to run to the airport, we ended up coming back. I had the Spinach, Egg, and Cheese. It contained Spinach tossed with Parmesan then baked with egg. This squared pied is topped of a sprinkle of Columbia Valley Sharp Cheddar. Overall, it was a great experience. A little of the expensive side for a pastry. However, it's a "must go" for Seattle! [Review 72 for 2019. Review 514 overall]

The sweet ones are really good too. The bread is so flaky and warm. If you're ever in Pike Place Market, I would definitely recommend you check them out. The line can get long, but it's worth it. Best to go during the week.

text_review: This place is a great spot downtown for some authentic russian food. I got a piroshky for the first time and it was delicious. I got the turkey and cheddar one and I would definitely recommend. It's always fun to try some food from different countries when you are just in downtown Seattle!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I once dated a Russian / Armenian girl whos grandmother introduced me to the Piroshky (what a fun word by the way!)So after finding other spots through yelp I decided to give this one a go and look this place up... pretty glad that I did. Was not dissapointed one bit. I had never though salmon would go well in a piroshky but oh boy was I impressed. I want to go back and try them all. All the food is made fresh daily and it showsYou can taste the freshness in all of the food. I would consider this comfort food and again not sure if it is really healthy although my ex's g-ma used to say it was... Or maybe she wanted me to put those extra pounds on haha

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: great piroshkys!! great location awesome staff

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: One of my favorite places to visit at Pike Place Market! They offer both sweet and savory options, but I tried savory options both times. Their signature item is a smoked salmon pate piroshky... I had someone explain it to me as a somewhat healthy Hot Pocket, and it is very similar! I thoroughly enjoyed the dill flavor in the crust, and the smoked salmon on the inside was fresh, it felt like it had just come out of the oven! I also tried the smoked mozzerella, mushroom, and broccoli and that tasted more like a calzone to me, but still equally as great! The only downside is that this seems to be one of the most popular places in the market and there is often a long line. Be prepared to wait about 15 minutes. It is worth the wait though, I can't wait to come back and try more of their flavors!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Great, fresh pastries and fast moving lines! Having been disappointed yet. Come here at least once a week. Yeah it's that good :)

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This area is awesome. I literally have nothing bad to say relating to this area; the piroshky is consistently fresh and the staff is consistently friendly. I have not attempted all of the many distinct flavors of piroshky, but the ones I 've had (which contain the steak and cheese, rhubarb, cinnamon and cardomon braid, cranberry apple, and basic steak) are amazing! They do not constantly have borscht, but when they do it's also excellent and I highly recommend it.

name: Piroshky Piroshky

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Based on Piroshky Piroshky's web site, Piroshky is a derivative of the Russian word (pir) for banquet. This small hole in the wall definitely lives up to the concept of a double banquet! Situated on exactly the same side of the road as the first Starbucks across from Pike's Place Market, Piroshky Piroshky serves up pastries filled with either salty or sweet ingredients. My favorites include the Apple Cinnamon Roll as well as the Cheese Onion Garlic Roll. They're REALLY SO great!!!

text_review: Having Russian heritage, when I heard about Piroshky Piroshky I knew I had to come in. name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: OMG, Russian women will be the death of me. They have legs from here to forever. That and the baked goods will drive a simple man insane. The Pumpkin Cinnamon Roll was to die for and the smoked salmon was exceptionally fresh. They must have connection with the mob or something to make sure they have first choice at the freshest ingredients. At times it was unbelievable except for the beef and cheese piroshky. You might like beef and cheese more than I do but I guess I grew up with a bit of Jew in me because I don't like how those ingredients mix. Go there and try everything and then pick your favorite to share with your friends. This is the place that adds a bit of class to the city.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I've been on a hunt for kolaches here for awhile, then I realized people here don't even know what a kolache is. :((i'm originally from texas, and they rock)if you don't know what a kolache is, i pity you. kolachefactory.comanyways, i was so sad to find out about the lack of kolaches in seattle, until i stumbled across Piroshky. The first time I had it was at the Bumbershoot festival last year. It was freshly made, and the guy gave it to me right out of the fryer. I had the salmon piroshky, shaped like a fish (uber cute). It was sooo good, I went back for another one. Some time later, I was craving another one, so I went by the shop in Pike's Market. It just wasn't the same. sad face. It was still good, but just didn't taste as fresh? I got the same salmon one, but the fish seemed a bit dried out and wasn't as creamy as the one i had at the festival. Still, piroshky is good and yes i will go again, but I still miss my kolaches..

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: The smoked salmon pate is absolutely amazing! It was worth the wait and heat, especially since the line moves fast and the employees are extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend that everyone give this place a try. Especially since it's easy to eat and walk or loiter in a corner.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Piroshky Piroshky is an absolute gem! From the moment you step inside, the enticing aroma of freshly baked goods surrounds you and the welcoming staff who are super friendly. Among the many delicious options, the smoked salmon pate stands out as an absolute must-try.The smoked salmon pate is incredibly flavorful and perfectly balanced. What surprised me the most was that it doesn't smell fishy at all, which is often a concern with seafood pastries. The taste is phenomenal, with the rich, smoky flavor of the salmon beautifully complemented by the creamy pate. It's a savory delight wrapped in a golden, flaky pastry that is pure perfection.Whether you're a local or a tourist, this is one treat you don't want to miss.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: The line might be long, but trust me, the wait is absolutely worth it for the delectable treats awaiting you at Piroshky Piroshky!Piroshky Piroshky at Pike Place Market never fails to impress! I tried their Traditional Beef and Onion piroshky, and it was absolutely mouthwatering. The combination of tender beef, savory onions, and perfectly baked dough made each bite heavenly. The smoked salmon piroshky was another winner, with its rich and smoky flavor complemented by the flaky pastry.To cap off the experience, I indulged in their chocolate hazelnut dessert piroshky, and it was pure bliss! The decadent chocolate paired with the nutty hazelnut filling was a delightful way to end the meal.The staff were friendly, the service was prompt, and the atmosphere bustling with energy. Piroshky Piroshky is definitely a must-visit spot for anyone craving delicious pastries in Seattle's iconic Pike Place Market. Can't wait to go back for more!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Piroshky Piroshky is a gem tucked away in Pike Place Market, and a must-visit on any Seattle trip. This charming bakery is known for its diverse and flavorful piroshkies, and it certainly lives up to its reputation.My personal favorite was the cheese and meat piroshky - a warm, hearty parcel filled with aromatic spices. It was the perfect way to kick-start our day of exploration. The taste still lingers in my memory, making me crave another bite.Another standout item was the Vatrushka, a house specialty. This delectable treat consists of house-made dough topped with marionberries & sweet cream cheese, all dusted with powdered sugar. It was sweet without being cloying, and the marionberries added a delightful tanginess that played off the creamy cheese perfectly.Don't let the line intimidate you - Piroshky Piroshky is more than worth the wait. In fact, the anticipation only adds to the experience. As I pen this review, I find myself longing to be back there again, savoring those incredible flavors.Piroshky Piroshky offers an authentic, delicious taste of Seattle that you won't want to miss. Whether you're a local or a visitor, this place should be at the top of your foodie list.

text_review: A very delightful Russian bakery with sweet treats and pierogis! A long line is still there, but it's worth the wait. Piroshky Piroshky just got done seeing it. Honestly, my stomach and soul have made me happy. The food was so good that it delighted a picky and judgmental eater like me. I've never been upset before about their food. The service can be slow from time to time, which was one of the places recommended to me shortly after I moved as a "must-try."

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Was with the wife walking towards the original Starbucks when I noticed this shop very close that had a longer line than Starbucks. Upon investigation I came to see it was a Russian bakery. I had never had Russian breakfast rolls/danishes. Man, I have been missing out all my life! Never would have thought that the food would be so good. Lots of savory items, lots of sweet items. Try them all! Don't waste time on any breakfast food at Starbucks. Get your coffee and get in line at Piroshky Piroshky! It'll be long, but it moves pretty fast. You won't regret!

It's nestled among many other places that suck tourists in, but this one is the truth. It's worth the stop.It's located right across from the public market; you can't miss it. Look for the line--and get there early! ;-D

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: When visiting Seattle, I was just walking by when the incredible smell of this place pulled me in the store. I didn't know what it yet was but I had to have it! I got in line and saw the different kinds of pastries and knew this was going to be an awesome place to snack! The bread not only smells good but tastes amazing! The light crispness and softness of the bread just filled me with joy when taking that first bite. From the freshness to the flavor, I felt I was in heaven. Living in California we definitely have good bakeries but this place is definitely unique to the flavor. So wishing there was one here!

name: Piroshky Piroshky

The line can be long high season , but I tend to take an earlier lunch since I work at 530am. These are perfect. Shh. Don't tell!

I had two, although I wish I had, had the balls to order 4 and let the world judge me how they saw fit. There were some sweet options as well--- one looked like a death star, I abstained given my preference to gorge myself on savory, but it looked great. Also, a fun line to wait in. Part of the experience right?!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This meal was bitter sweet. This is my last day in Seattle and work is carrying me off again. I wanted to leave with a belly full of delicious food and I knew this had to be the place. The crust is perfectly flaky and they are filled to bust. My favorites have to be the beef and onion, the cabbage and onion, and the beef and cheese. The cherry chocolate is always the perfect end. Sometimes the lines are long, *usually* but sometimes if you hit it at the right time, you'll be in and out. Don't let the lines discourage you, it's worth the wait (most good food is). I will certainly miss you and I hope my journey across the country brings me back here again one day.

text_review: Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.I think this is one of the few places in Pike Place market that the locals actually go to. People always go to the Starbucks down the road but really that's just for sightseeing. A really nice experience, munching away along the waterfront with such deliciousness, especially during the fall or winter seasons. To share the joy, I brought some home (not sure how I managed the 2 hour bus ride home without eating them) and everyone there also enjoyed them!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I can't say enough about this place. If you like a YUM piroshky, you must try. If you don't know what a piroshky is, you must try. Try to plan your visit away from popular eating times, as the line outside the place will be long. You won't be disappointed in the place.I didn't know what a piroshky was until I was at a Seafair party 10+ years ago. That's when JEN COLLINS made some for the party and I became a major fan of piroshkies. Jen passed away a few years ago. When I come to PP I think of JEN. This review is dedicated to JEN.

text_review: I actually like bakeries and all kind of pastry stuff but I had never tried a piroshky. Have had many other types of filled pastry but NOTHING compares to these little gems. Had the potato and cheese which was super delicious! My friend had the smoked salmon and claimed it to be one of the best things she has ever eaten. We also got a chocolate cream hazelnut piroshky which was also super tasty. The line went fast and service was friendly. I highly enjoyed this place and I will go back there again.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: First time eating Piroshky. Definitely doesn't disappoint! The treats we bought the first day were so great, we came 2 days in a row. First day we lucked out in the afternoon with no line. Next day, we went to get coffee at the first Starbucks in the world next door and got caught up in the morning rush in a 20 minute Piroshky line. My favorite was the salmon pate, a fish shaped pastry filled with tasty salmon pate; it was a first for me, and quite satisfying. I also tried the beef and cheese, ham, cheese, and spinach, smoked mozzarella, mushroom, and broccoli, and apple cinnamon roll, all recommended by other Yelpers, but out of all of them, the salmon pate was in my opinion the most flavorful and suited to my taste. Though the other pastries didn't become my favorite, they were all worth a try. You'll experience various pastry textures and consistencies;

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: My background is Hungarian, and I thought after my Grandmother's death I would never experience that home-cooked taste in this country. Many of the foods served here are a great reminder of those times. There are some differences, but overall, excellent and great tasting food. I highly-recommend them!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Gets busy in the summer but the line moves fast. Tip: the busier they are, the fresher the food is! When you go in the winter time, the piroshkies aren't as hot and you won't smell that amazing buttery aroma when you walk by the shop. The service is good, too!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This place is awesome, and I am so happy that one of my Russian friends dragged me here. If you have never had a piroshok (I think they are called?) then you are in for a treat like I was. Basically they are mini pies with ingredients like meat, veggies, and other things inside. They are flakey and crunchy and filled with all sorts of things. My recommendation is the mushroom, chicken, and rice, the flavors mixed so well with the bread. Also the cranberry apple piroshki were a great dessert, although I guess they are technically not a desert.The bottom line is go here, eat, and you will enjoy.

The line was pretty long and we probably waited about 20-30 minutes to order but it was SO worth it. Got the two best sellers, the Salmon Pate Piroshky and the Beef and Cheese Piroshky. The salmon one was my FAVE, it was so good. I'll definitely be stopping by again next time I am in town!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Is there anything bad to say about this place (besides the line)? Everytime I go I pick a sweet and a savory one. I know, I know, serious artery blocker. My favorite is still the smoked salmon piroshky. I usually end up at the Market and just follow the smell. Seriously, a classic. Always great.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Very very busy, but for good reason. The piroshky have amazing crusts, and then filled with flavors such as salmon, broccoli cheese, and cream of mushroom, and sweet Piroshky such as rhubarb and chocolate. There seem to be different types of crust for different types of fillings. I find two savory and one sweet piroshky splits well between 2 people.You will need to stand in line, or go on a slow day (some weekday during the winter when the skies are dark). Then, there is not seating, so you will have to take your piroshky and flee to somewhere more comfortable. If you explore Pike Place, you will find that there is public seating available, or coffee shops you can occupy. If you go straight back and to the left of the Piroshky place, you can find some small amount of public seating, and if that is full, across the street there is a nice park (although someone tried to sell me drugs last time I went there, which might make tourists more uncomfortable).You might wonder if this hassle is worth it. I would say yes. The closest I've found elsewhere is savory pies, but never of the same quality. They are high quality, quirky, but simple, and very Seattle to me. Besides, sometimes standing in line with a bunch of other people excited to experience a place is what you need to convince yourself to pay attention to what you are eating.

text_review: I love Piroshky Piroshky! They are so awesome that they had to mention piroshky twice in their name. I tried two of their creations, one savory and one sweet. For my savory I selected the smoked salmon, broccoli, and mushroom. It was so yummy, I couldn't get enough of it! And then I tried the cherry and white chocolate piroshky, which was so decadently delicious! The people here are so nice. I love this place!
