name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This place is a definite try it no matter how full you are or no matter if you just ate five seconds ago. Try something here. Who doesn't like stuff wrapped in a light flaky dough. The smell of the place was what got me so enticed. The place is a tiny spot in one of the buildings of the market. The wife really liked this place at it reminded her of her grandmothers meat pies as a kid. So we only tried the one beef and onion, but we couldn't be happier. This thing was heavenly. Just one more bite was all I wanted and then when it was all gone, I almost ran back from the hotel to get another one. Will have to try another one before leaving town.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Delicious! Had the Salmon Piroshki.  So good.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: How can you go wrong with fresh pastries? All the more if it's filled with BEEF & CHEESE???? It's impossible! You just can't go wrong!So, we waited in a long line that cleared out fast and the whole time, my mouth was watering looking at their pastries and trying to decide what to get. We tried the Apple Cinnamon Roll, Beef & Cheese, Chocolate Hazelnut roll, and their Potato Mushroom & Onion. Out of the 4, the beef and cheese was the best, BUT everything else was good. It's places like these that make me want to have a second stomach. Mark my words, I WILL BE BACK HERE...and will write love letters to you in the meantime while looking at a picture I took of you, oh Beef & Cheese Piroshky!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I dropped by my first afternoon in Seattle and the line was so long, I said, hmm, maybe later...But the smell was so good I found myself walking there in the rain the next morning to just catch a whiff of the baked goods. I was lucky, there is no long line in the morning and I got a wonderful apple cinnamon piroshky. The next day, I got the egg, cheese and spinach.It was a wonderful way to pack such great flavors into such a little pastry! Just remembering the taste makes me miss this place!!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Well, as a few reviews have already said before this one, everything that has to be said about this place has already been said. Freakin' amazing.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I think one reason why I love visiting Seattle is because of Piroshky Piroshky. This hole in the wall bakery attracts many tourists not only because you can watch them make these delicious treats, they are indeed melt in your mouth sinful! The Salmon Pate' piroshky is to die for! I can't name them all but most of what I've tried are awesome. Beware of the sometimes long line but it moves fairly quickly. This is a MUST visit when you go to Seattle.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Get the salmon filled one. Incredible.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: salmon piroshky..SO DELICIOUS~!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This place is really unique. Pike's Place itself is an experience, but you never know if tourist spots will have good food. Piroshky's perogies are delish. The line is worth waiting in and moves fast. A perogie is a Russian pie. I had the salmon pate and dill perogie. It was piping hot and flaky, buttery soft. I would order these to have in Texas! For dessert I had an apple cinnamon made with green apples. It was full of big chunks of delicious fresh, apple. It was an affordable lunch for just about $8. Be prepared to eat standing up, unless you can find a bench somewhere around the shops.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Good, my favorite snacking spot in Pikes

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I had a piroshky and it was GOOD. I even walked around the marketplace with it.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Light, Fluffy, Crispy, Fresh... DELICIOUS!!!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This makes me want to become Russian...

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: i could eat these every day.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: Yum,,, Eeeeeee!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: i don't think i've ever had something here that i didn't like.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: The piroshkis here are the best I've ever had. They're fresh baked and come out warm and doughy. There are a lot of flavors to choose from. I was here on business and wish there was one back in California so I could go every day!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: DELICIOUS! The beef and cheese piroshkys are the best!!!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: if i knew it was that good i would've bought 5!! very nice delight!

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: We NEVER go to the Market without stopping at Piroshky. It doesn't matter what you get, it's all good. My fave is the apple-cranberry.There's a reason why there's always a line out the door. Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: I am in love with you. I like to eat you. You are delicious. Fill me with your goodness.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: theres a reason why people love these local of places of lore. the kind of places that have been made famous by their history, simplicity and loyalty to a product that is distinctly local in flavor. despite the fact that they have been washed over by waves and waves of tourists, these places are still able to maintain their sense of indivuduality by marketing to a uniquely regional appeal. when i first moved to seattle i went looking for that regional treat. that one comfort food that cannot be replicated anywhere else (read: philly cheesesteaks at geno's, wings at buffalo's anchor bar, bens chili bowl in dc). i and many others would believe that that place can be found at piroshky piroshky.purists can talk all they want about how close to the original recipe they may be, what resonates with these delicious russian treats is a taste of home, even if it isnt orignally yours. piroshky piroshky is a cheap, delicious treat that maks any day in the market all the more rewarding. for four dollars (5 with a cup of coffee) grab a warm, flaky, salty and fulfilling meat and cheese pastry and enjoy it at steinbrueck park while you watch the boats float in. nothing could be better on a lazy morning.

name: Piroshky Piroshky
text_review: This place is Great! Always a line, but it moves very quickly. Delicious!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The food looked great, but it was just okay. The bread cost $5 extra and tasted like a metal frying pan, which was disappointing. The waiter spent more time outside and ignored us, but the location near Pike was beautiful.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: great menu recommendations and kept smiling and giving great service even when we knocked a beverage all over the floor.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Jose he provides excellent customer serviceHe knows peoples needs in the restaurant a greatEmployee to keep employedEsperanza and Ricardo 206 799 7913

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Rude waitress

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The restaurant had a nice vibe, and the staff was attentive. The pizza tasted delicious! The sauce on the pasta was flavorful, but the noodles were mushy. The fries were crisp and tender, yet overly salty. The patty in the burger was overdone: cooked medium instead of rare.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Excellent drinks and burgers with outstanding service by Katya and Anastasia! outstanding service by Katya and Anastasia! Would definitely recommend when you are in the area!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: We ordered the bread with burrata, sourdough pasta with pulled pork, sliced fig pizza, buffalo wings, and...

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Went to get drinks and food before a show. After waiting over 30min for our food, we asked explaining we had to leave soon. We were told it would be out shortly. After another 15 minutes passed, no food and we had to leave.They offered to comp us for the food, etc, but doesn't really make up for the lack of dinner and the long wait.On the upside, the drinks were good and arrived in a timely manner.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I told the male waitress that my drink was not right, and he mentioned that it was done right. He didn't check it out. French fries were cold with hot fish on. Most likely, I will not come.back. All (4) our mix drink was just heavy in scentric taste..

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Food was not good at all. Drinks were great. I'll only come here for drinks. I was very disappointed on the food.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I don't want to write the review . This place should be my little secret but I also need to share and tell all what a great dining experience I had.Food was delicious, hands down, some of the best I've had and even better on the second visit.If you are coming to eat here Oh man, one order is not enough.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Charges a "cook commission" what a joke.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This place got spontaneously great service. It's chicken was fantastic and tasty too. It's veggies were outstanding as well. But honestly, the place was not so appealing and I think they can make their place more beautiful next time and I'm looking forward to it.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Muh. We were not too impressed with vons. I had not been for years, since they left their former location. The service was OK, the food was OK, lots of kids and crying babies which we thought was weird for a Sunday night. Overall seems not as fun as the old bar a little bit too corporate.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The way I would describe my visit is that it was a good overall experience. The service was great and the food was very good.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: It was my first time here and it won't be my last either. Will return for other dishes. The service was good and friendly. We ordered Basil Almond Pesto Pasta and Original Mac and 4 Cheeses which were quit delicious. Next time will be back to try the pizza.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: It is my first time here at Von's. I like the delicious pasta. I also tried the pizza which was flatbread and it was very good. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. Will be back if I am in the area again.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Delicious food and good portion sizes! Really enjoyed the variety of in-house made pasta. Place tends to get a bit crowded especially in the evenings, so make sure you get some reservations.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Recently came here with a coworker for happy hour. I got the cuban sandwich and he got the fried chicken sammy. The happy hour drinks were incredible, I had mostly lemon drops as they were the special on the wheel and my friend had an smoky old fashioned. We shared a plate of nachoes as well that were incredible. The ambience was loud and fast paced as the place appears to be very popular which is the only downside, it's not quiet or a place to have a conversation.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Drinks are good but a bit on the expensive side. We like the overall vibe. Place could be a bit cleaner but overall a good experience.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The service was quick, super friendly, and tasty! The restaurant is located in a convenient area with cool spots worth checking nearby, depending on the time of day. The eggplant hummus is an absolute must! I had the vegan pasta and my friend had a cheesy chicken pasta. I can't wait to come back!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: My girls and I traveled to Seattle and were on the search for a great happy hour place with good drinks. Vons did not disappoint. I started with the smoked cherry Manhattan and the salmon chowder. The flavor of the salmon chowder was awesome I thoroughly enjoyed it. The bacon chunks caught me by surprise but overall still a great meal. The cherry Manhattan was a bit too sweet for my liking but luckily for me the Monday special was traditional manhattans, so of course I indulged. The traditional manhattan was a crowd favorite and made with love. Highly recommend this place for drinks, ambience, and food. The service was also excellent.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: A bit of a tourist spot, but the service was prompt and the food did not disappoint.They offer a menu with some interesting sounding cocktails and have an extensive amount of spirits promptly displayed as well.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Had a fantastic early dinner date at Von's! The sourdough pasta was a flavor explosion - so good! The service was top-notch, and the staff was super friendly. Couldn't resist eyeing the burger, it looked amazing. And let's talk about the Huckleberry Gin drink - a total game-changer, super tasty! My friend's date went for the pork fries and pasta and had a thumbs up experience too. All in all, a great time. Definitely marking this spot for a repeat visit!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: My experience at this restaurant left me quite disappointed last night, particularly when it came to the drinks. I had high hopes when I ordered a specialty drink from their menu, with a simple request to substitute Bar Boss vodka for Grey Goose. However, the waiter's response left me baffled as he kept mentioning he would "add on" to the drink. Confused but willing to trust his expertise, I let it slide.When our drinks finally arrived, I couldn't help but feel like I was sipping on colored water. It seemed like my custom concoction had gone awry. My husband, who ordered his usual Hendricks gin and tonic, was met with a diluted disappointment. We're no strangers to this drink, and this one was exceptionally watered down. In summary, I would advise you to bypass the drinks altogether at this establishment. While the cocktails may leave much to be desired, the food is an entirely different story. We had the "bang bang chicken" and a serving of shredded pork fries, both bursting with flavor. If you're dining here, save your money for the delectable dishes and opt for tap beers or bottled drinks if you're in the mood. Skip the bartender's experiments

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: 5th time at this restaurant, always they're very friendly and cooperative. Burgers, services and ambiance everything were very good. Price was very reasonable.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: $26 Quatre Viande (4 Meat) Pizza....Torrid Wurst, soppressata, lardons, pepperoni, whole milk mozzarella, grated parm...its basically their meat lovers pizza, and we did indeed LOVE it! Von's claim to fame is their unique sourdough crust, which adds extra flavor and creativity to an already fantastic pizza! Where else are you gonna find a sourdough pizza? Its shareable for two people, but I was really really hungry I could've eaten the entire thing cause I'm a fatty!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Food is good, however it's overpriced, crowded and noisy. Not a relaxing atmosphere to me

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Food was good. large enough to fit a party of eight, but not restaurant seating style. Would have been nice to sit outside or have a view. but overall service was good and food was good.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Little pricey but great macaroni and cheese

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Delicious sourdough pastas and flatbread pizzas. The drinks are also fabulous. Pictured here is a delicious plant eggplant, sun dried tomato and kalamata olive pasta. Amazing! Sit at the bar on a Saturday afternoon and tell wonderful Bartender Jess I sent you!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Good food, drinks, and ambience. Great service.Went here for dinner as a group of 4 people. Even for a Friday night 9pm, the wait was minimal (5mins) which was a pleasant surprise considering this is a popular place. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating available.Ordered 6 plates of 4 different types of food items: burrata, hummus, bang bang chicken, chicken wings. The food was quite good. Nothing to die for, but good. Chicken wings could have been better. The drinks were fine as well. Some of them have additional presentation added like a mini firecracker (picture attached).Service was fantastic. With 6 food plates shared in 4 people, and 2-3 drinks per person, the total cost price was $70 per person (including tips taxes).

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Love love love their salad with Salmon added. It's my go to when I'm in town for work.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Really good food and service was friendly.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great food, music and vibe. Was in town on a work trip and Von's was a great, casual place to go for happy hour and dinner after a long workday. Loved their homemade pastas!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The ambience was chill. The staff were amazing and also the food was beautifully made. My friends and I really enjoyed the service there and would tell anyone to come dine here. What is simply amazing is that the place offers an opportunity to choose from a variety of dishes and desserts. What is more is that the establishment has a dancing arena. This is just cool. I recall how beautiful it was enjoying our meals and watching people dance to some good slow music. From my experience I feel that the place not only feeds the body but it also feeds the heart. Coming from the place I felt so elated and relaxed, I am surely looking forward to coming back to this place and bring more of my friends to live the experience.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Continuously an extraordinary time in here, the smell of their dishes simply lifts my disposition up. On the off chance that it were in my grasp I would simply stay here the entire day and direct my entire kind of work from here while making the most of my #1 bites. All comfortable in here .

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I haven't been to the new location until very recently. I do miss the quirkiness of the previous place; however I think this location is awesome. They are doing such a wonderful job with the restrictions of COVID. Great drink selection as I remember and great food!Thanks!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: As of the end of September, their happy hour is a great deal. The food portions are large and the drink specials wheel they spin is a cool idea. The house in Manhattan is terrible btw.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I enjoyed myself here, the foods drinks and staff are all great, Thank you Von's 1000 Spirits for your wonderful service!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Very very busy place. The food was AMAZING the drinks were AMAZING. Service was a little bit slow (because the place seems to be always packed) we really liked the food and drinks there but decided to leave after one drink because we couldn't stand how crowded it was

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great quality food and friendly staff, they carded my mom even though shes 62 and she didnt have it so they wouldn't serve her. I understand the laws but i have to say she felt embarrased to be carded at her age.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great collection of foods including homemade pasta. Good selection of brews and cocktails. Good place for small groups and fun!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great food - minor mistake on the order but they made it right and covered the meal.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Our party of 2 made reservations for noon - but it was 12:30pm before we actually arrived at the restaurant as a result of a meeting delay. They seated us with no issues despite our delay. We each had a house salad and split a pizza - excellent lunch overall. I recommend going and making reservations as we were seated in a quieter area in the back which was better for lunch conversation.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Good service & helpful staff. Good food!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I used ton't venture too much into the menu because the first hamburger got my eye instantly! The Classic burger was awesome! Trying to be somewhat "wholesome" I asked for no bun and they set it over a fresh green salad...which was AMAZING! I tasted a few of the chips which were some of the finest I Have had in awhile. I saw lots of the pizza's coming out and while dining with my father we understood we should have mixed it up a bit and not gotten the same thing! Rave reviews were being discussed at the tables around us. Really excited about this new place! They make an excellent martini and it only has an excellent vibe!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Tasty food and a huge drink menu.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The crab cake burger was delicious!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: A great place to have a drink Service was good, would go back.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I liked the atmosphere. I liked their service. Food was rather excellent. I would definitely recommend to a burger enthusiast. A little too greasy, but that's it. Come on down, it's good!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Krystle was awesome! Plus a fantastic happy hour. Thanks for the great suggestions. Loving the new local spot.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Really tasty burger & delicious fries! We stopped in for lunch on a blustery day & this spot worked out great. Coba was a terrific server.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: They really have like 1000 bottles of spirits. Happened to came here by happy hour, which is from 3 to 6 i reckon and the place is packed, but not too noisy. I tried the mango champagne magarita, which is lovely and refreshing with nice touch of tajin. Burger was so good with huge and juicy beef patties, brown sugar bacon and I love the sourdough brioche.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I had a fantastic time at Von's 1000 Spirits! The atmosphere is great, and the food is incredible. We tried a few different dishes, and everything was bursting with flavor. I love the variety of unique menu options they have, and the craft cocktails were on point.The staff was super welcoming and gave excellent recommendations.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Went there for a quick bite and beers. I got to say it exceeded my expectations by far. Delicious wings. Flavorful Crispy Bang Bang Chicken. And Mouthwatering Confit Fries. Delicious IPA selection. Highly recommended.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I stopped by Von's 1000 Spirits on a whim and decided to try their Seattle Classic Burger, and wow--it did not disappoint!The burger was everything you could hope for in a classic yet elevated experience. The patty was cooked to perfection--juicy, flavorful, and with a slight char that added a smoky depth. The sourdough bun (a signature at Von's) was soft yet sturdy, with a subtle tang that complemented the burger perfectly. The toppings were fresh and well-balanced: crisp lettuce, ripe tomato, melty cheese, and just the right amount of their house-made sauce.I also appreciated the side of hand-cut fries, which were crispy on the outside and fluffy inside--just the way I like them. Paired with one of their craft cocktails, it was an absolutely satisfying meal.The atmosphere added to the experience: casual yet stylish, with great service and a lively vibe. Whether you're a Seattle local or just visiting, Von's 1000 Spirits is a must for a great burger and an unforgettable dining experience.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Jess is amazing! Made is the best cocktails. The En Fuego and the smoked oak and cherry Manhattan were amazing. The selection of spirts is impressive. The food was from scratch and delicious. Highly recommend, sit at the copper bar and ask for Jess!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: My boyfriend and I arrived at Vons 1000 Spirits around 6:30 PM, hopeful for a spontaneous anniversary dinner despite having no reservation. Luck was on our side -- after a brief wait, we were seated near the back line and welcomed by our server, Chris R.The restaurant was bustling, but it was clear that this place operates like a well-oiled machine. The energy was lively, and the efficiency of the staff was remarkable.Chris greeted us promptly with a warm smile and immediately made us feel at ease. He expertly guided us through the menu, offering thoughtful recommendations that showcased the restaurant's best dishes in a way that was both helpful and approachable.We ordered: * Sparkling Water * Brain Booster Mocktail * Hefeweizen Beer * Bang Bang Chicken (a playful nod to where we first met -- a place called Bang Bang) * Alfredo Chicken Sourdough Pasta * Roasted Mushroom Sourdough Pizza (served with hot honey on the side, per Chris's suggestion -- a brilliant recommendation)Every single item was incredible. The flavors were balanced, the quality was superb, and each dish left us wanting just one more bite.From start to finish, the service was top-notch. We even noticed a busser nearby who cleaned a four-top table with such impressive speed and precision, it seemed almost superhuman.Thank you, Chris, and the entire Vons 1000 Spirits team for a refreshing, memorable, and delicious dining experience.We will definitely be back! :)

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Food and service was wonderful! Bit of a wait for a table, but well worth it! Loved Chris R. By far was my favorite part of my experience here! AL girl

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This place is absolutely amazing! The ambiance is vibrant, the service was top-notch, and the food hit all the right notes. We tried the Bang Bang Chicken, the Double Smash Burger, and the mac and cheese--everything was delicious, but that chicken sauce was next-level. The burger was a standout too, with the soft, melt-in-your-mouth bread elevating the whole experience.As for drinks, the selection is insane--literally thousands of options! I think the bartender mentioned they have over 2,000 bottles behind the bar. I went with the pineapple old-fashioned, and it was perfectly crafted and absolutely hit the spot. Great food, great drinks, great vibes--definitely a must-visit!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Ron was our server and the service was amazing! Friendly, very quick and checking on us often. We were sat in the very back but our service was the best it's ever been.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Pretty awesome place for great food and great service. I would highly recommend scheduling some time to visit this place.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Von's 1000 Spirits is an absolute gem in Seattle! The handmade noodles and pizza are out of this world-so fresh and packed with flavor. You can tell they put real care into crafting each dish. The cocktails are a must-try as well; they're unique, perfectly balanced, and truly worth every sip. The service here is exceptional, with a friendly and attentive staff that makes the whole experience even better. The ambiance is very cozy, with lots of personality. They have so many different types of alcohol to look at (hence the name lol), and pieces of art on the wall. Whether you're a local or just visiting, I highly recommend stopping by Von's for a memorable meal and drinks!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Our bartender Richie was awesome! Great knowledge on all the spirits and very friendly and cool!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Vons is definitely for pasta lovers, offering an impressive selection of delicious dishes. The pasta is cooked perfectly, with a variety of sauces that cater to every palate.The drink menu complements the food beautifully, featuring both classic and creative cocktails that elevate the dining experience.What truly stood out was the service. Chris R. was exceptional--attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. His recommendations were spot-on, and he made sure our experience was seamless and enjoyable.Highly recommended!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Katya- I recently had the pleasure of being served by an exceptional server who went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing dining experience. From the moment we were seated, they were incredibly friendly, making us feel welcomed and comfortable. They were not only knowledgeable about the menu, offering helpful recommendations based on our preferences, but also patient and attentive to our questions. What stood out the most was how effortlessly they interacted with both locals and tourists, offering insights and tips about the area that were much appreciated. Their warm demeanor and outstanding service truly enhanced our experience, making the meal one to remember. I highly recommend dining here and hope you're lucky enough to have this server take care of you!Pedro is a hardworking and friendly busser during my visit. Throughout the entire meal, they were constantly moving, ensuring that tables were cleaned quickly and efficiently. Despite the busy environment, they always had a smile on their face and were genuinely friendly with both customers and staff. Their positive attitude and work ethic did not go unnoticed, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. It's clear they take pride in their work, and their efforts made a great impression!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Vons 1000 Spirits is a standout destination for anyone looking to enjoy a unique dining and drinking experience. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between casual and upscale, making it ideal for both a laid-back evening and a special occasion.The cocktail menu is particularly impressive, featuring a creative selection of craft cocktails that highlight quality ingredients and innovative techniques. Each drink is beautifully presented and bursting with flavor, showcasing the mixologists' expertise.The food is equally remarkable, with a menu that offers a diverse range of options. From small plates to hearty entrees, each dish is thoughtfully prepared and beautifully plated. The emphasis on fresh, local ingredients shines through, making every bite a delight.The service is attentive and friendly, adding to the overall inviting atmosphere. Whether you're seated at the bar or a cozy table, the staff is knowledgeable about the menu and eager to make recommendations.Overall, Vons 1000 Spirits is a must-visit for anyone in the area. It's a place where great food and exceptional drinks come together, ensuring a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great place for lunch in downtown! Food and service were great. I had the salmon Cesar salad and my friend had the fish tacos. Everything tasted great. Fries and Guava Mule mocktail were also delicious. Would come back to try their homemade sourdough pasta or pizza for sure.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Out of 10 I'd rate this place a 9.6. It is phenomenal food and really great cocktails as well. The burgers are good but the pasta is better especially the Gouda pasta. Would highly recommend.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Christian was great, he was very helpful and made our experience incredible! The food was delicious and happy hour has some great deals.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Excellent meal, service was the best I've had in years! Christian was amazing and would love to come back to see him.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: First of all - all of the food was amazing. Our group had the Mac & cheese, hummus, pizza, sandwiches, and more. Nothing was underwhelming. Our server Christian was great - he answered all of our questions and was able to make great recommendations.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Excellent food, great menu, fine service. What a find!  Christian provided great service.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I got to chill out on the patio while there was live music playing on the piers, so it was a pretty sweet setup. Our server was on the ball and answered all our questions. I went for the steak and garlic cheese fries. The steak was on point, but the fries were a bit too greasy for my liking--I couldn't finish them.I'm glad I made reservations, even for a late dinner midweek, because this place fills up super fast. I definitely want to come back and try more items from their menu. Though there weren't a ton of choices, but based on what I had, I'd say all their veg options are top-notch.Skip driving and just grab a cab. Parking around Pike Place is always a nightmare.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great food, service, atmosphere, and location. The pieces are also fair. The "damn good wings" are my favorite item on the menu.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Von's 1000 Spirits in downtown Seattle is a must-visit! Their hamburgers are nothing short of awesome, packed with flavor and cooked to perfection. The pasta offerings are equally impressive, satisfying any craving you might have. The Staff will guide you to pick something perfect for you! But what truly sets Von's apart is their massive liquor selection. With 1,000 spirits to choose from, there's something for everyone. Whether you're a whiskey connoisseur or a cocktail lover, you'll find plenty to enjoy. The vibe is lively and welcoming, making it the perfect spot for a great meal and a fantastic drink. Highly recommend!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great place to come for any occasion! The place itself is beautiful and the drinks were awesome. Wonderful service by the server who made sure we were comfortable throughout the meal. I had the Walla Walla burger that was delicious, but the pasta is absolutely to die for! We will be visiting here again soon!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: food and service was fantastic!! Really enjoyed the pizza and the fish and chips. Joe was great.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: We had excellent food, drinks and service at Vons! Shoutout to our server Christian who went above and beyond with service and our meal and drink requests! We'll be back!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Von's 1000 Spirits offers a delightful dining experience with its house-made specialties and welcoming atmosphere. The Original Mac & 4 Cheeses is a standout dish, featuring sourdough pasta made in-house, a creamy and amazing cheese sauce, and perfectly complementary breadcrumbs on top--definitely a must-try. The Quatre Viande Pizza boasts an excellent dough with a crunchy yet soft crust and savory toppings balanced by a subtly sweet tomato sauce. The Hass Avocado & Billionaire's Bacon burger is another winner, with juicy beef, flavorful bacon, and avocado that ties everything together perfectly. The Seattle Seafood Stew has a comforting tomato flavor, with flakey cod, well-cooked clams, and fluffy focaccia for dipping, though the stew's overall flavor is somewhat muted. For dessert, the Vanilla Ice Cream, served with a huge sparkler for my birthday, was fresh with a noticeable vanilla bean taste, though a bit icy in texture which I personally enjoyed.The interior is dimly lit and cozy, creating a warm atmosphere. It gets packed around dinnertime, which is a good sign because it means the food is good! The service was generally good despite the busy environment; the wait time was shorter than expected, and the staff was friendly and helpful, even if the waitress couldn't check in as often as desired. Overall, Von's 1000 Spirits provides a great dining experience with its delicious food and friendly service.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits

Would skip the pineapple and cucumber salad, mine had mainly pineapple and just tastes like tajin and fish sauce, can simple make at home. The fried chicken wings were dry and simple, would pass on that as well. Food portions were small for the price.Staff were friendly, checked up on us often and gave good recommendations. Their reservation system was convenient. Decorations were pretty and welcoming. A nice spot to take friends to.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Let me tell you about the incredible bartending duo of Taylor and Erick at Vons 1000 Spirits - these two are like the dynamic duo of mixology, with a side of comedy! I mean, I've seen some impressive bartenders in my time, but these two take the cake (or should I say, the cocktail)!First off, let's talk about the happy hour - it was like a magical potion of joy and discounted drinks. I don't know how they do it, but Taylor and Erick managed to turn an ordinary evening into a fabulous fiesta! And the drinks? Oh boy, they were so tasty that I almost wanted to order one of each just to taste the rainbow of flavors. I'm pretty sure they secretly sprinkle a little bit of unicorn dust in every glass.Now, let's not forget the atmosphere - it was as lively as a pack of party animals on a Friday night! I don't know if it was Taylor and Erick's magnetic personalities or just the fact that they make drinks that are pure liquid happiness, but the place was buzzing with good vibes.Overall, my experience with Taylor and Erick at Vons 1000 Spirits was nothing short of amazing. They're like the Batman and Robin of bartending - except instead of fighting crime, they're fighting sobriety! If you want a good time, tasty drinks, and an atmosphere that feels like a non-stop party, look no further than these two maestros of mixology. Cheers to Taylor and Erick - you both were absolutely fabulous!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Von's 1000 Spirits is a hidden gem when it comes to unique drinks and a vibrant atmosphere. From the moment you step inside, you can feel the energy and excitement buzzing in the air. The extensive drink menu is a paradise for beverage enthusiasts, offering an impressive selection of creative concoctions that you won't find anywhere else.The mixologists at Von's 1000 Spirits are true artists, crafting drinks that are both visually stunning and bursting with distinct flavors. Whether you're a fan of classic cocktails or adventurous spirits, there's something for everyone to enjoy. From smoky and robust whiskies to refreshing and innovative blends, each sip takes your taste buds on a delightful journey.What sets Von's 1000 Spirits apart is not only the exceptional drinks but also the lively atmosphere. The place exudes a vibrant energy, with a crowd that's always buzzing and conversations flowing

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I was in Seattle for a brief work trip and the hotel suggested Vons 1000 Spirits (which also happened to be about a block up the street~MAJOR PLUS). I came in just after checking into the hotel around lunch time and was surprised to find a full and bustling bar with the coolest kitchen and tons of cool stuff to look at everywhere! Josh, the host was warm and welcoming handed me menus and pointed me to the bar upon request. I was greeted with a warm friendly smile by Jess the bartender and a personal pitcher of nice cold water without first requesting. I was excited after reading the menu and asked Jess for some recommendations on a house cocktail and some lunch options. She suggested the old fashioned alternative they called "The Leatherbound," and after a lovely rundown of the menu I decided on the Tellicherry Chicken pasta dish, which came out in superhero time. I was blown away with BOTH my drink and my pasta dish. Sabrina, the other bartender, came over to check on me just after my food was delivered- there was absolutely nothing that could have made my lunch any closer to perfection. The atmosphere was rocking throughout the restaurant, everyone was smiling and the service was incredible! I unfortunately had to go off to a work meeting for the rest of the day followed by an early flight home in the morning so I couldn't experience more cocktails and what looks to be a fantastic menu. The only bad part was leaving this little treasure I had just discovered. Thank you for a wonderful, even if brief, experience. I wish there were more establishments just like this one!

Josh made sure we always had new straws and napkins and everything we need!!! The food was delicious. presentation 10. Flavor 10. Adorable and fair pricing!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Go and you'll see. Amazing food there and very friendly staff. I can't describe the taste of the food because it's to good.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Everything is amazing! Of course, the pasta is our favorite. We would go here every night if we could. I highly recommend the cocktails as well. We are always seated quickly, even if it's very busy.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great energy and atmosphere. Their food and bar offerings were all well executed

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Holy cow! The Bolognese is as good as they said and the chicken pasta was to die for too. Open seating at the bar was easy even on the weekend or about a 20 minute wait for 2.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Friends chose this place to meet up and we are sure glad they did. Jess made the entire experience a great one with attention to detail, awesome sense of humor and excellent customer service.The Cuban is AMAZING and you cannot miss the salted Carmel warm apple yumminess at the end.We enjoyed it so much we will for sure be back....but only if Jess is working ;)

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I just moved to Seattle from NYC and found Vons in my neighborhood. This place I'd amazing by itself because of their hospitality. However Erick and Chelsea makes this place such an amazing place to be especially for a Newyorker new to Seattle. They make me feel at home

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: My bf and i came here for appetizers and drinks, and we loved it. our waitress was Jordyn, she was super nice, very helpful, over all amazing customer service. 10/10 recommend, food was incredible.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Emma was great. She made my trip to Seattle more memorable. She remembered who I was after one visit.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Tasted great, recommend! Great service

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This has been my favorite restaurant for a while now. I really like the place and the food is amazing. Lopita and Traci were very helpful and made our experience enjoyable, as long as Vons is open, I will always come back! :)

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This was my first time visiting this restaurant and I was very pleased! Mikayla was very welcoming and energetic when she seated us. There were a few mishaps with a couple light bulbs breaking next to our table, but our waitress Traci was very understanding with our concerns. Great experience!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Our host Mikayla was amazing, kind and helpful. She led us straight to the table on the patio with thoughtful conversation. Our server Traci did such an amazing job. After some hiccups on the patio, she understood our concerns and was incredibly kind and accommodating for our needs. Our food was A+, will be back again. And will be asking for Traci.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: First time here! Food was amazing and the staff was great! Our host Mikayla was super friendly and welcoming and our waiter, Traci was wonderful and personable. It all made for a lovely dinner.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I came here with my mom as I had simply saw it was the first thing that came up when I asked siri," What are the best food places in Seattle." Von's 1000 spirits was the first thing that came up and it didn't disappoint. The fresh pasta mixed with amazing seafood made for a stunning meal. My server David carried around rainbow pens and was super nice and funny. He would always serve us food with a smile on his face and make funny remarks while doing so. Not to mention the food came in about the blink of an eye. Definitely worth going to.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Went in for lunch today! Chad was our server he was great! Will be back! Food was delicious, so was Chad ;)

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: we had a wonderful time at vons for 21st birthday and TRACI brought us ice cream and a sparkle, she was amazing! will definitely be back. great food, great vibes!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Pasta was fantastic. Drinks were great. Overall wonderful experience.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Traci was amazing, she kept checking up and making sure the food was great!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Excellent service David was a great server  and we really enjoyed our experience there.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Bomb food! Katie and Natalie were awesome and accommodating. Started with the pork confit fries and had to get another portion before entrees arrived. Traci was the best, you better hope you're in her section.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Erick was a great server. It was my sisters 21st birthday and he brought her ice cream and was very attentive. Would highly recommend this place.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: If we could fly every weekend from Orange County to Seattle to eat here here we would . 5 stars over and over again

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: So glad I found Vons. In Seattle it is hard to find a full kitchen available so late in the evening. Katie and Natalie were pleasant at the front desk and even let me sit outside at 10pm! They had a heater and amazing suggestions. Traci was our server and she was training Rebecca. She had awesome banter but also incredible knowledge on the food. We settled on some pastas to share. The king salmon pasta and chicken pasta with pepper. I was so full and happy at the end of my meal. Thanks Vons! We will be back!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: David was so wonderful and had the best energy! On top of all our drink orders which we desperately needed. Definitely coming back!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Love Von's!! Our server David was the best!! Had the best energy! Will come back again just to see him!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Erick was the best! Thank you for the amazing service!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Erick in the bar was absolutely great! Amazing drinks and service, thank you so much Erick!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Visiting there was amazing!Katie & Natalie at the front desk was very kind and showed great service!And Traci was of great help, made things easier and smooth for us with picking food and drinks! Very high-spirited and awesome Server!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The food was so incredible!! Natalie and Katie were amazing hostess and so kind when walking in and Traci was such a great help when it came to the menu!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Ainora is the nicest! She was attentive, answered all my questions, and made our experience enjoyable! We will back because of her! Cute, fun atmosphere! Great food and drinks!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: So so good! I was only in seattle for a day and I stopped through here - so glad I did. My waitress Jessi was awesome and made me feel at home right away. Food and drinks were both delicious. Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in town!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I brought my grandmother and a good friend in for lunch. Great location near pike market and the water. We had the spiced fig pizza ( which was AMAZING and my favorite) , sweet and sour coconut prawn salad, clams and calamari. All the food was top notch and flavorful. Portions were a good amount and all the staff were pleasant that we interacted with. Server Jessi was extra upbeat and always smiling ( even through her mask I could tell haha) I will definitely be back in the future. Thanks for a great lunch!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Food was amazing! We had the smoked gouda and chicken sourdough pasta and it was so hot and fresh and perfect textures and flavor. We also had the 4 meat pizza and it did not disappoint. Cocktails were wonderful and great presentation on the Manhatten. Erick helped us out and he went above and beyond. There was a little bit of a wait but well worth it and they did hustle to get us seated.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Erick was dope! Will come back here just for him, but also food was dope too! Pasta was dope, pizza was dope, and smoked Manhatten was dope!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This server erik was unbelievable he pinpointed exactly what I was craving within 2 questions .

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Our server Eric was great! 10 years really shows his love for the place and the food. I hope he continues showing top knotch service with incredible gusto

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I travel a lot and this place was recommended. I couldn't be happier with everything, like literally everything from the time I walked in. Jessi is your girl to see, she was so good in fact I came back a second day and she killed it again, even though she was completely slammed. I had two of their burgers per her recommendations. This place is a great spot for travelers! Strongly recommend if you want food that matches the vibes.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Sooooo good. The wings were amazing. Pizza was amazing. We will be back!! Waiter was amazing

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: We had the best experience on the patio with David, as our server! He was outstanding and kept us laughing! so glad we stopped here on our travels! 10/10 recommend

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This is one of my favorite restaurants in downtown Seattle. The pasta is fabulous the drinks are awesome good food and great atmosphere.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The bread is absolutely delicious here, good spirits too!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The happy hour is the best in Seattle!Our guy Erick was the best! Will be coming back.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Waiter(David) was amazing!!! I'm totally coming back!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great place for burgers and beers

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Yummy!! I really enjoyed this pizza. Very tasty. The attention was sensational. I really haven't eaten such delicious food for a long time ***** =)

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: 5 stars for food, drinks, service, and atmosphere. Von's it's a must! I had their wings and Bloody Mary yesterday, absolutely delicious. Everything looks very tasty on their menu. Thanks to our server, Ainura for her professionalism! Keep up the good work!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Amazing mac and cheese. Whoa! Nothing like it. Kinda pricey. $25 for my favorite dish but once in a while it hits the spot.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Ben was a fabulous waiter. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and excellent service at Von's 1000 Spirits!The presentation of the skinny bitch cocktail was great too! A must order!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Our group had a great dinner and fantastic drinks. Highly suggest this restaurant! But the highlight of our evening was our host SHAUN. He is by far one of the best wait staff I have ever encountered. Engaging, funny, knows his stuff about the menu and drink selections. We thoroughly enjoyed our two hours with him. Trust me... go to Von's for the food and drink. Ask for Shaun. You won't be disappointed!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Vooooooons got to go here good food and they got all the booze you could want seats are close so you got to be ready to mingle . They got cool decorations too.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: this is a hidden treasure for really great food. you won't be disappointed.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Lupe was great. Will definately come here again. She was fun and very friendly. The setting was nice and I loved the ladder.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Always consistent! Great atmosphere. One of my favorite go to restaurants in Seattle.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Wonderful service at Vons! Shane was great! Would definitely return and highly recommend!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Chris was amazing and very pleasent. He made amazing drinks and he had wonderful customer service.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Blake is amazing.  Thanks !!! Can't wait to come back!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great pizza for lunch. Best Margarita ever using the own brew.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Erick and Chris L. have served me on multiple occasions, they're part of the reason I keep coming back! Exceptional service, incredibly friendly, and always make you feel like you're their only customer. Great place to hang out and enjoy your evening!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Ainura was the best! Service was excellent and food was perfect!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Unbelievable pizza!! Service was great and the pizza was delicious!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Super cool bar with $5 martinis! Nuff said. Chris m. And Stephanie were really friendly and made the experience that much better!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Aloha, my visit from Hawai'i to Seattle was made to even better when I was brought to Vons by some friends which turned into my end of the day spot for the entire trip. I always requested or had the same amazing Care Facilitator her name was Elizabeth! I highly recommend coming to Vons for the Manhattans but make sure to get it from Elizabeth. She is Vons!! When I come back from Hawai'i to visit - she better have a salary raise or hourly! Mahalo nui Elizabeth!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This place has incredible Salmon Chowder!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Came here for some good snacks and drinks. Wasn't disappointed. The wheel was fun and a good experience. Our bartenders were Jason and Elizabeth who were both awesome! (Cadyn came in later and was great too & super knowledgeable). Jason & Elizabeth made us mystery shots, and they were fun. Elizabeth's was veryyyy yummy! And she was very personable & friendly. But definitely will be back, the staff and vibe was very good & love the set up of the bar/wheels!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Benjamin was awesome!! We loved his dinner suggestions , his friendly demeanour, and this has been the best restaurant experience in Seattle. Ps. Happy 26th birthday Ben!!! Sincerely Outback Team

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Excellent food, one of my favorites in Seattle! Awesome service from Elizabeth at the bar!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Brandi was amazing. So spunky and fun!! Can't wait to go back

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Von's 1000 Spirit's is a haven to anyone looking to escape the mundane. As soon as I walked in the door, I was greated by a lovely young host. I think her name was Zia? She took the time to find accommodations for my group. There were 6 of us on a busy Friday night, yet she was able to find us a table almost immediately, to our delight. Our server, Elizabeth, was a wealth of knowledge on their spirit collection ( Yes they really have over 1 thousand) and was able to recommend each of us great drinks to try. Having already been impressed, to food left me speechless. Their "Mac n 4 cheeses" was decadent. The perfect amount of rich, not to mention how delicious their house made sourdough pasta is! My wife had Avocado Bacon burger and was equally satisfied. It safe to say me and my family will be back soon!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The hostess, Zia, was very welcoming and friendly. Food was great, and hospitality phenomenal. Because of this, we decided to come back two more times. The Sourdough pizza was the best pizza I've had!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I went to this place and loved it! The hostess Zia was very cheerful and accommodating. I was able to be seated at a table fairly quickly during happy hour. The food was very tasty, especially the salmon pasta. 5/5 stars.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: You won't be finding any IMPASTAs here! Their sourdough pesto pasta was delicious! What I really appreciated was that our server, Traci, took the time to explain all her favorite key dishes to us when we were having difficulty deciding over the incredible menu choices.What really stood out to me as a patron was the care she took with our kids at the table. My daughter loves mac and cheese but there was no option for it on the kids menu. Without hesitation Traci said she could modify a kids pasta to make as mac and cheese. She did give warning that the mac and cheese would be a bit spicy but my daughter was elated at the idea of mac and cheese. Wouldn't you know it, as children do, my daughter changed her mind after one bite. Apologetically I explained the situation to our server when she came to the table after the food was delivered. Traci was more than happy to replace my child's meal with an alternative cream sauce, which my daughter loved, and the new dish was out within minutes of my request. As a parent it is always an adventure to go out with your children because you can never anticipate how long their attention will be kept before they are ALL DONE and want to move on. I was extremely impressed and thankful for the care and understanding our server took to make sure everyone at my table enjoyed their meal. Even though Von's has 1000 spirits and seems to cater to an older crowd I still left feeling it was a family-friendly restaurant as well.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: amazing service. put together a table just for us. and was so attentive all throughout the meal. go. eat. drink. be happy.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: It's everything that I could have wanted or imagined! With no pretense this is The quintessential cocktail bar. Get it. Chelsea made this experience for us and we appreciate her expertise!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great drinks, great atmosphere great food great prices, friendly staff, knowledgeable bartender

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: This place was amazing. I originally made reservations for party of 6, that changed to 8. I called and spoke to Dan the GM and he meet our needs for a table of 8. Dan went above and beyond to ensure our table was what we wanted. Huge selection of spirits as the name says. Highly recommend this place. Ainura was our server and she was top notch. Prompt service and attention to detail was in point. Every 30mins the bar spins a wheel for a discount drink price. Our table had the following: pulled pork Mac and cheese (2 orders), pulled pork fries, salmon pasta, salmon chowder, salmon fish and chips (3 orders), and hamburger. The entire party would come back. My only regret is that we waiting till our last night in town to come here. PS. Don't forget to get the beignets. They are amazing.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Food and service is always great there! Sourdough pasta is a must must must.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Erik recommend a great cocktail. May be best bartender in all of Seattle

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great food. We went there twice for lunch during our visit to Seattle

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Amazing homemade pasta dishes and the drinks are delighted. Highly recommended anything here since so many dishes are made in-house.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I can't say enough about this place ( i created a yelp account just to rate them...) I ate at Bobby Flays restaurant in Vegas as well as had the "famous" burger of Gordon Ramsay.. the burger here put both to shame. Best food I have EVER had ( I've eaten around the world, I did not expect to say that about Seattle). The atmosphere was incredible- unique and classy yet edgy, fun and chaotic without being boisterous, a mystery without being complicated. The staff (ask for Gabby!!) was beyond helpful as well as knowledgable, attentive without being annoying; impeccable service. The manager was out and about, the entire place was so genuine it was almost hard to believe. I would give more stars if I could, AMAZING experience. If you are in Seattle, ignore what the hotel puts in your room.... GO TO VONS 1,000 SPIRITS (gustobistro) you can thank me later :)

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great service, interesting cocktails

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The best salmon chowder...ever! If you like chowder give this try, you won't regret it!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great food, great service. I'll make a point to come back for more meatballs!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Reliablly tasty!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great happy hour food, decent happy hour prices, huge selection of food, what's not to like. Actually, the food is really really tasty. Just what we were looking for.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Loved the sourdough pasta with salmon! A must have if you come to this place! :)

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great dinner. I had a sourdough pizza and my son had the sourdough pasta. Amazing....

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Fun place for drinks and the sourdough pasta is AWESOME!!!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great place to hang out with your buddys. Its always nice to go where you see a lot of regulars having a good time. Been coming here for a little while now and they are so spot on with the drinks every time. If you need to get out and meet cool people this is the place.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Vons. What can I say?  The staff is so friendly and smooth.  They don't stress during busy rushes like some places. The Ricochet Rabbit is my favorite thanks to Kelsey.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: I love this place. I drive all the way into Seattle just to go here which is about 20 minutes out. When I think about going to Pike's, I know Von's is waiting. I love the decor, the lighting, the food, the drinks..........AND, dun da da DAAAAAhhhhh, the beignet's are little cushions of happy. I was out and about doing some photography when started to get a little hungry, plus it was beer-thirty. The glowing sign peeked out and caught my attention. I went in to order a stout and the cinnamon sugar beignets and from that moment I was hooked. I knew, just from the menu, there was more deliciousness to come. I wasn't wrong.  They have an aged old eloquent selection of liquors on a lovely glass shelf with little cards that indicate what it is and pricing, plus a full bar, and nice beer on tap. They have really good cocktails and it's always fun to spin the wheel and see what you can get a discount on for the next thirty minutes. The staff is really nice and accommodating and I just have the best time when I go in there. The burgers are unique and good, the pizza is amazing, the pasta is delicious, and the salmon soup/stew with a nice chunk of sourdough soaking in the bowl is heavenly. I've ordered that twice. It's just great and I'm running out of adjectives to describe it. Just go in, sit down, and enjoy yourself.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Really enjoy the atmosphere of this place. Waitress was really helpful for my first time here.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Meatballs, the poutine, and the Vietnamese burger are awesome!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Always love going to this place. Went last night and had a more than wonderful evening. Our incredible waiter Joe was finishing his last shift before moving to Hawaii,playfully joked with us throughout the evening, recommending great drinks and entrees. We all left full, a littled tipsy and laughing. Perfect.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Artisinal. Handmade sourdough pastas. Who ever heard of such a great thing!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: First time in Seattle and came in on a recommendation. Loved it. The wall of spirits was impressive. Try to Corpse Reviver cocktail - really good. We also enjoyed a Fric (sourdough pizza) which was also really good.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great! We came in on a fluke, just walking by. had not seen the place before. The steak salad was yummy, and the fries were delicious! This place has a timeliness guarantee for lunch. Not too busy when we came, but key for a lunchtime rush. Recommended.

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Kerri is an absolute pleasure!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great ambiance. Mayahuel tequila is a must try. Love the new location. Mel gave excellent service and recommendations. Will definitely be back!!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Great drinks. Love the wheel for drink specials and every flatbread pizza on the menu is amazing!! Krystle is an amazing server!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Fun place! Great atmosphere for after work or tourists...will definitely come back! Thanks Erick for the great service!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: If you are in the downtown Seattle area don't miss out on this place! Great atmosphere, great happy hour, great service, great food! The Pistou Chevre Sourdough Fric is amazing!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: Best place for Happy Hour on a beautiful day!

name: Von's 1000 Spirits
text_review: The French Onion Burger was amaz-a-balls! Although, this week I attempted the Monster. Clearly, I was not going to finish this behemoth version of a double-double in five minutes, but was worth a try. The meat in all the burgers is well seasoned and a tender pink. I also recommend Alchemist Peanuts if you enjoy a salty buttery finish in your mouth. Just waiting for my Chocolate Cake on a Cloud and a larger pair of pants.

name: Paseo
text_review: This place was so so horrible. The worst place I I've ever eaten at. When we got our food it was cold. They were greasy, soggy, and the lettuce didn't even look like it was edible. We also ordered fries, hibiscus tea, and churros. Not a single thing was edible. It was incredibly expensive for the items we good which again were not edible. We are physically ill and would never ever eat her again. I even tried putting the inside contents on the sandwich on toasted sourdough bread (since the bread was soggy). The sandwich was still horrible and gross. I'll probably be in the bathroom the rest of the night. Thanks Paseo!

name: Paseo
text_review: Their shrimp po boy sandwich at nearly $14 is a rip-off. There are more onions than there are shrimp. The taste of onion overpowered other ingredients in the sandwich. Paseo was better under the previous owners, who opened their own sandwich shop - Un Bien - #2 sandwich shop in Seattle! Skip Paseo and go to Un Bien instead!

name: Paseo
text_review: First they stole the namesake and recipes of the original Paseo, and now they open a store a few blocks away from Cafe Con Leche in SoDo (a Cuban-owned restaurant), which threatens to put them out of business. Ryan Santwire (the owner) is a prime example of an exploitive culture vulture who profits off of a stolen brand and cuisine. The food doesn't compare to the original, especially the caramelized onions, which are bland. I'd advice ya'll to skip this place and head to Un Bien, which was opened by the sons of the original owner of Paseo.

name: Paseo
text_review: Being from Florida, this is an insult to my ethnic tastebuds.This is not Cuban food in the slightest. You can fool the people of the PNW into thinking this is Cuban, but not those of us that know the real deal.That being said, for a cheap imposter, if I completely forget what you're trying to be, it's tasty, but it's not what you claim.

name: Paseo
text_review: Hey, Paseos! SLOW IT DOWN. That "Roasted Pork" is being cooked too damn fast. Its tough, not tender. No matter how much mayo you slather on that sandwich, you can't hide the truth. Braising pork takes time, I know you have to make a lot of it, but what is the point if you are just going to half ass it. Not to mention, nobody in that joint looks happy to be there. Whats up y'all, not paying your people enough? Hiring people who will accept your crappy wages and work environment over people who should get paid more and will make better food. Something isn't working, you guys, pull your heads out of your techie culitos and get with the programa. The equation isn't that hard.

name: Paseo
text_review: Tried this spot for the first time after the original closed. I've had a few (to say the least) Cuban sandwiches in my day so I'm no stranger to what authentic should taste like.I ordered the press and a side of rice + beans. The meat wasn't marinated in OJ or spices at all and the rice + beans lacked flavor, tasted canned.A far cry from the original. Some stones are better left unturned and the reopening of Paseo is one of those.

name: Paseo
text_review: Not the original Paseo !!!! former owners didnt' share the marinade huh !!! way overrated !!!!

name: Paseo
text_review: Horrible experience! The food is pretty good. The techyuppie scum in the 70 minute line (sending Postmate delivery riders in their place) may burn in fucking hell.

name: Paseo
text_review: This company gave me a quote $4000.00 over the average quote from other reputable companies.

name: Paseo
text_review: Don't waste your time! Not good pizza, unprofessional attitude

name: Paseo
text_review: I expected better quality and more quantity... I shall try somewhere else..

name: Paseo
text_review: Yeah its just another Cuban restaurant now. The Paseo magic left with the original owners. Sure it is the same name, but, usually when a restaurant is purchased the previous owners teach the new owner's the recipes and techniques. This is obviously NOT the case. The new owner poached the place in the hallway of a courthouse auction. The food tastes like a Bellevue version of Cuban food - bland, dry, and lacks originality. We will miss you original Paseo. Yes, it was #2 with the previous owners. Definitely not number two under this ownership that purchased it in a hallway auction WITHOUT the recipes. Pathetic.

name: Paseo
text_review: Stopped by there yesterday. Definitely not the same sandwich. It takes more than the same bread company and same meat vendor to be the original sandwich. I think it is also a joke of the picture of the ethnic people, how desperate is the owner to show past workers are returning. I went there a lot every week, I didn't recognize one face or person. This restaurant is now a joke and a disgrace to the Paseo's legacy. Too bad.

name: Paseo
text_review: Told ya'll. They don't even pay their workers and also, none of them are even Cuban. And the naive of Seattle have been trying to raise 250k to keep them open. So dumb. They will run to Cuba without paying their dues here and live like hogs. Seattle wake up. Why does nobody in this town have any street smarts?

name: Paseo
text_review: Whoa! Heep bad Karma happening here! Too bad...I will miss the incredibly friendly and efficient staff here and on Seaview Avenue, and the food!

name: Paseo
text_review: Rude/Racist Behavior:My wife went with a female friend to the store this afternoon, and a male yelled rudely at them due to their religious dress, preventing them from taking a cart. He even approached them threatening them. When asked about his manager, he shouted at them that he is the manager (his name tag said "Bill"). My wife needed to call the police who asked her to leave to a safe place till they arrive. Upon arrival, her friend also complained that this is not the first time to harass female Muslims who wear Hijab (religious headscarf). The police filed a report against this manager.

text_review: Ok, everyone knows the sandwiches here are the fucking best sandwich you can get for under $10. I've eaten here about 25 times already, and the sandwiches are always fucking BOMB!!! But I must say, service has gone downhill. Wait times have increased from 15 minutes (About 2 years ago) to now 30-60 minutes. The workers are slow as fuck. They look stoned to hell (Hey I use to smoke and work at fast food too) and are slow to take your order and don't really give a shit about you. The napkins and hand sanitizer wipes were empty when I was there recently, and I told them about it and it took them 15 minutes to refill them. It's like the owners of Paseos knows everybody loves their food, they're bringing in hoards of cash with their low overhang and endless stream of customers, so FUCK CUSTOMER SERVICE cause these PASEO ADDICTED FIENDS will ALWAYS come back for more.I also have a conspiracy theory on how they create artificial drug like demand. After 5pm, they usually run out of fucking bread. Tell me, how fucking hard is it to get BREAD!?!?! It's fucking bread. It's not some magic Cuban bread that falls out the sky when the Earth's hemispheres hits a certain longitude. How hard is it to send some 19 year old pothead to GO GET MORE FUCKING BREAD!?!? It's like they run out of bread purposely, so you get PISSED and return the next day ready to double your order to make up for yesterday's waste of time. And they know your succulent pork morsel addicted crackfiend ass will be BACK the NEXT DAY ready to order again.I'm starting to wonder if Paseos is owned by a Cuban druglord and his business is simply a front to launder cash....o.O*Disclosure* I went to Paseos today and they ran out of fucking bread. I'll be back tomorrow to get my fix you bastards.

name: Paseo
text_review: That Paseo place is just ridiculous. If you just drove by and didn't know what it was, you'd think it's a food bank, seeing how many hungry-looking folks standing in line.Anyways, my curiosity got the best of me and I got in the long line and waited for 40 minutes, paid $9 for the Caribbean Roast sandwich and waited for another 20 minutes for my order to be ready. For a finger food joint, it's hideous, yo!!And it was a disappointing experience. To be fair, the pork was very good with a hint of soy sauce used in its aioli marinade. The caramelized onion gave good flavor and a nice texture to the combination while the lettuce provided an overall freshness. The bread was baked to near perfection. But the sandwich looked obnoxious. Because it's made from a stupid recipe. The hard bread a la French baguette isn't meant to be made into a sandwich, let alone with heavy fillings. That's why it's so messy to eat. The Vietnamese Banh mi, on the other hand, is made from a modified French baguette with rice flour added to the dough, and the bread and the fillings are rather light.   The Paseo sandwich is neither traditional nor authentic. It should be called the random sandwich instead, because no one can trace its origin to the Caribbean, Cuba or even Miami. There's nothing Caribbean or Cuban about the sandwiches at Paseo. For all I care, it can be called the Nigerian sandwich or whatever. It's a faux ethnic food item, just like the infamous fortune cookies. For some strange reasons, the joint has become quite popular here in North Seattle. But I'm not a masochist and I don't like waiting for an hour for a kid-sized meal, where ever the hell it came from. I wasn't impressed at all and I think the place is a fraud with all its pretentiousness.

name: Paseo
text_review: Oh my gosh, this place is so nasty. No place to set, people are RUDE and the food is gross. I grew up all my life in Florida and am Cuban myself and would not dare call any of the stuff they serve Cuban. Please don't go, waste or $. Go to La Isla in Ballard, much better.

text_review: Not a review of the food. I went Saturday night: out of sandwiches. I went tonight. Sold out of sandwiches. 1 star for being really out of sandwiches = being really annoying. I asked about it and the guy, although kind of 'nice' wasn't saying anything other than "yep..sold out". It would have been nice had he pulled his head out and said " you know, we're out of sandwiches, again, I'm sorry about that...here's the deal...we just don't have room to store extra bread...or meat...or whatever" as opposed to just "yeah..we're out"...I know you're out, I'm more curious to know why after running out so consistently you don't prep for more sandwiches. Anyway...after I get around to eating one (it's been a year since my last go around) I'll write a proper food review. But until then...I've spent about $10 on gas just to hear "yeah..we're out"

name: Paseo
text_review: Since I live three blocks away, I have tried five times to get the sandwich that I love. Too bad that sandwich no longer exist there anymore. I had eaten there four times a week for the last five years of my life, and I didn't recognize one face working the counter or the back kitchen. I wonder what returning employees they are always boasting about. If there was a returning employee, it wasn't someone high up in the back kitchen. Now back to the sandwich, the meat as others have posted was dry dry dry. It tasted like it was made three days ago and re-heated that morning in a watery broth. The sauce was less spicy and the bread was still pretty rock hard as usual. This all equates to someone who isn't Cuban and trying a feeble attempt at re-creating it. Yes, it looked the same with the big juicy onions but it lacked the execution, experience, and most important the love for the product. This an Americanized version of the previous sandwich. But, I feel this restaurant is not as good or the same as when owned by the previous family. I don't predict longs lines after their initial push when they opened.Also the guy working the cash register wearing the stocking hat is truly horrible. The look he gives you is sort of condescending, like I'm lucky to eat there. I guess it is probably all the tourist that don't know any better, or all the Seattlelites that only ate here once a year and can't really remember what the original version tasted like. I won't be going again for an overpriced sandwich at $12 dollars for not even half as good as it was before.
