name: Paseo
text_review: This will sound like blasphemy, I know, but I ate a sandwich at Paseo recently, and it wasn't a particularly good experience. I'd been there a long time ago, so I thought I knew what to expect, but still. It was a rare hot day in Seattle, so I decided to hang out in Fremont for the afternoon. The line at Paseo was extremely long, as usual. I waited in the hot sun for about 30 minutes before getting under the shaded awning of the restaurant. The line started moving, and as I made my way to the front, I saw the dreaded sign: Cash Only. I cursed myself for forgetting they were cash sticklers, and that I was out of cash. By this point I was at the front of the line anyway. I mentioned it to the guy taking orders, and he said that he could take my order, and that I could run up the block and get cash from an ATM and come back. Not ideal, but I agreed. I ordered a scallop sandwich, then took a walk to the grocery store up the block to get cash. Twenty minutes and a $3 ATM fee later, I was back. I gingerly made my way to the front of the line again, explaining to the people who I was passing that, no, I wasn't cutting in line and taking the spot that they had waited a half an hour to claim, and that I was simply picking up an order. I paid my $10 (including tax) for my prize, handed to me rather unceremoniously in a warm plastic bag. (Side note: Aren't they banned now?) I briefly considered waiting for one of the three tables in the restaurant to clear out, but that wasn't happening. Instead, I took my sandwich down Fremont Ave., looking for any spot to stop and eat it. No park benches or appealing curbs, so my choices were a bus shelter or a dirt-covered ledge in a public park. I chose the ledge, and there, yes, I finally savored the sweet taste of victory. I sunk my teeth into the sandwich, and it was as delicious as I remembered it. For a brief second, it was all worth it. But then, the sandwich basically disintegrated on me, and on the dirty ledge where I was eating. Caramelized onions, cilantro, the garlic tapenade... they all schlooped down my hands and onto the ground. The whole thing was over in under five minutes. And there I was, stooping in a wooded park, my face and hands covered in some weird Caribbean sauce, $13 poorer and a good chunk of my afternoon gone. Honestly, it doesn't seem like a good way to spend one's time. Of the hour and a half I spent procuring, financing, and eating this sandwich, less than 10 minutes of it was pleasant. To me it's just not worth the bullshit. I would be interested in going back if they ever expanded their space, but as it is it's mostly a novelty that's best experienced once.

Yes... literally I had to go through whole roll of kitchen towel to wipe my greasy while/after eating. I won't go back there as I am not very fond of the food they are serving.The flip side is the price is good as long as you stick to the sandwiches.

name: Paseo
text_review: I have been chasing the opportunity for a Paseo sandwich for close to a decade like a dog in heat and I finally rode the Paseo orgy train this weekend. It felt like I was handed someone else's sloppy seconds fermenting in a dirty loincloth. The unpleasant sight of my eating a Paseo sandwich ranks as one of my relationship milestones among being able to shit in your presence, comfortably talk about vaginal blood clots, and a gesture of endearment equates to nightly dutch ovens. If you are still attracted to your significant other after watching them finger-bang a Paseo Press lubricated by a jug of grease, I would consider that a real avenue of love. If one is going to fetishize a sandwich, at least have the decency to fetishize a sandwich that demonstrates immaculate culinary skills and whose bread isn't a gigantic crouton. Luckily, we came in early enough to avoid all of the other thirsty asses. Had we arrived any later, I think we would have spent at least 30 minutes waiting in line for an under-seasoned, overcooked sandwich. I would rather asphyxiate myself with plastic wrap. Dare I say that the Paseo Press and Caribbean Roast both had overcooked, chewy pork and terrifyingly under-performed in regards to flavor and taste overall. I am stunned at how something can be so freakishly oily and awfully bland at the same time. The only ounce of flavor I tasted was one pickled jalapeño that fell out of my sandwich, as with everything else to the point where it deconstructed itself. Customers ought to file a license in order to be in public with an unconcealed weapon that is the bread of a Paseo sandwich. Shit's terrible as sandwich bread, it's super dense and hard to chew. The pressure you have to apply to gnaw at the bread forces the pork and other insides to fall out. Stupid. I did prefer the Caribbean Roast far more than the Paseo Press because it had the lettuce and mayonnaise, which counteracted the pork jerky. Paseo is running on a fine line between a tolerable sandwich stop and an overrated fartbag. I am going to give Paseo the benefit of the doubt because it might have been an off day for whomever prepared the pork in the back; however, it seems that they are consistent with inconsistencies with either service or the food. I would hardly worship the grounds on which they erect their 10-person capacity shacks.

However, the need to stand in a long line and wait to get this sandwich is lost on me. It's just not a trend I can get into and it really hampers my enjoyment of the establishment and its food.

name: Paseo
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of trying the Caribbean roast sandwich at Paseo and I have to say, it was one of the juiciest and most flavorful sandwiches I have ever had! The combination of tender roast beef, tangy Caribbean spices, and fresh vegetables made for a truly unforgettable taste experience.The sandwich itself was generously sized, and the bread was perfectly toasted to add a nice crunch to each bite. But what really stood out was the incredibly juicy and tender meat, which was cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor.Unfortunately, I can't give the same glowing review for the wings I tried. While they were decent, they were just ordinary and didn't quite measure up to the outstanding flavors of the Caribbean roast sandwich.Overall, I highly recommend giving the Caribbean roast sandwich a try if you're in the mood for something truly special. It's a definite 4/5 stars in my book!

I usually just grab something to go and eat a park nearby. There's lots of places to go to if you know Seattle. Their sandwiches are amazing. I get the Caribbean every time. It's HUGE and quite greasy but that's okay. It is a bit pricey at 9.75... but it's worth it! The braised pork is amazingggg!! It melts in your mouth. The onions are really good too. I'm not much of a big chunks of onion person, but they're so sweet and not too sweet. Just perfect!

text_review: What popped at me initially was the menu. I despise basic breakfast/brunch foods. Being a home cook, I want something a bit more original and complex that I haven't made at home a million times.The setting is in a perfect location. Fremon t a nice walking yuppie area where everyone pretends to be yoga/pilates experts in their Lulu outfits they may or may not have actually worked out in. It was beautiful weather so I asked to sit out front, but the place is SO light and airy inside that I would have gladly sat in there instead.A couple great bloody marys, some avocado, and perfect size portions and we were done! Would love to explore their regular menu as well. Flavors were simple yet complex enough to be interesting and satisfying.The only drawback of a lunch h is the "lunch crowd". The most painfully basic conversations about their cliche night before, drivel about the pointless rest of their day, or people practically making out with random dogs walking by. But, that is to be expected and this restaurant does not hold exclusivity in cheesy people!

name: Paseo
text_review: I came here for lunch at 2:15PM on a Friday, assuming it would be empty; I was shocked to find a long line out the door, even with the threat of rain looming.Obviously, this place is well-known, and for good reason. We ended up waiting about 45 minutes to order, and another 15-20 to receive our food after that. The line went fast enough, and the cashier at the front was very courteous, unlike what I would expect in a similar situation in New York City.I got the Caribbean Roast sandwich, which is their specialty. I have to say: it is the best sandwich I have had in my life to date. I was hard-pressed to think of a sandwich that was that close, honestly. The famous cheesesteaks of Philadelphia were no match; only a deli sandwich from 2nd Ave Deli in NYC is close, but no cigar.There is so much going on in this sandwich. The pork is sopping with juice and flavor. The aioli adds a pop, and the caramelized onions add some sweetness and complexity. Add some cilantro and romaine for a little bit of balance and a lightly toasted baguette and this thing is damn close to perfect. Keep in mind, though: it is near impossible to eat without making a tremendous mess. Be prepared to be covered in sauce, but you won't mind.

name: Paseo
text_review: Ok, I finally got to taste the #2 and am reviewing a couple of months after the fact. It was very good and craved for another, but at the time I went back a few weeks later, they were closed for a vacation. Yikes! A coworker told me about a sack lunch box lunch whatever delivery company that they had ordered from in the North called Eclectic. I was weary, because who could compete with Seattle's best sandwich? I gave them a call and they said that they would deliver to our company the following day (24 hours notice is required for all orders). Holy $%#! Their Cubano was a taste that lingered in my mouth! It wasn't Paseo's #2 but more along the lines of Paseo's press, (but not pressed) with ham and Swiss, succulent pork and actual caramelized onions! I wish they had a storefront! If you're ever in the mood to have lunch delivered to you or your company (and can call ahead), their Cubano is other-worldly. They have other stuff too, like Chinese humbao and Vietnamese Bah Mi sandwiches, but we all ordered the Cubano and didn't regret a thing! All there items come as combos, didn't bother to ask if they sell just the sandwiches.

name: Paseo
text_review: If you have not eaten at the OLD Paseo's yet? Ask yourself what are you waiting for? I discovered Paseo's when I signed up with yelp last year. It would be the most recommended restaurant for weeks. Like a hit song in the Top 40. I got the pirate to take me to lunch here. So we had the Pork Sandwiches since that was the Only item that did not sell out. We were lucky. They only served 6 people after us. They ran out of bread. The food here flies out like Planes out of Seatac. The sandwiches were memorable. He rarely dishes out $8.00 for something exotic. Being from the backwoods of Michigan he rarely eats anything ethnic. He usually is a cheap skate kind of guy. He really likes the $5 Subway sandwiches. So if I can get the pirate to try something new and he treats, its a win win for both parties. And like Mikey said "He likes it !!"If your new to the area take a tip from the many locals who review restaurants online. You gotta try this place at least once. Drive, fly, crawl stand in line with the throngs of people and wait patiently. Your time will be well spent.

name: Paseo
text_review: Well... the reality of it is that you can't walk out of this place without a foodgasm. I'm not sure who coined that word but it probably has something to do with Paseos. Their Midnight Cuban sandwich is to DIE for. Be prepared to bring cash and you might have to wait to get a seat as the actual eating section of the establishment is rather small but for the love of God please do not pass this place up. The food melts in your mouth and their sauces are spectacular. Writing this review made my mouth water. Drop everything and find your way here. It will definitely behoove you to do so.

text_review: Ok, I admit I was a bit dubious after hearing all the reviews that any sandwich could be that good. But it was! I got the chicken (last one of the day -- they ran out of bread) and it was awesome.

name: Paseo
text_review: I had a sandwich the other day and I have to say it was good. It's always hard with a restaurant because so many things can affect your perception of the place. I have to say though, as objectively as I can, my meal was good. Real good. I think people get a little crazy with the five stars around here. They start handing them out like bread loaves at a soup kitchen. A five star hotel is a place you stay that makes you want to not go home to your wife and kids. A five star meal is a dinner that makes you want to cut out your tongue afterwards so you don't have to suffer a mediocre meal ever again. This place is a solid four. You won't be amazed but you certainly won't be disappointed...

name: Paseo
text_review: One of the best sandwiches i have ever had. Please visit if you are ever in Seattle.

text_review: There is a fine balance in sandwich construction wherein the sandwich retains its shape but becomes a bit of a hot mess. Paseo has found the balance between sandwich civil engineering and sandwich abstract art. This balance is only nanometers wide, and yet their sandwiches always seem to find it.

text_review: The Famous Caribbean Roast is #1 on the menu and #1 in my heart! Very limited seating but the sandwich is so good you want to devour it without breathing, so you can stand and enjoy it!

It'll still be good, don't get me wrong, but it will be soggy... and will probably fall apart (this was my only gripe).

I've been coming to the Fremont location for years now and I'm ecstatic to find out that there's a new location in Capitol Hill now as well. In a perfect world this place would be on every single corner instead of Subway or Jimmy Johns.

name: Paseo
text_review: McMinnville Toyota Review at Yelp.com  03/23/2015A Good Used Vehicle Buying Experience at McMinnville ToyotaI searched for a reliable and affordable used Toyota Tacoma pickup for several months before finally finding one in March, 2015 at McMinnville Toyota in McMinnville, Oregon . It was a 2004 1-owner Tacoma TRD with 64,424 miles for less than $16,000 and had good Carfax and Autocheck reports. It also had the following features I was looking for: four wheel drive, automatic transmission, V-6 engine, TRD/SR5 road package, locking rear differential, and 2-door cab.The pickup was first listed online on March 17. We called the salesman, Mr. Curt Ritter, that afternoon and bought the pickup the next morning.  My son (who is a knowledgeable and experienced vehicle buyer) assisted with a preliminary inspection and we took the pickup on an extensive test drive. The vehicle's condition and performance were completely as advertised. A subsequent detailed inspection by an independent mechanic verified that the pickup was in very good condition with no problems. During the entire transaction, Mr. Ritter dealt with us in a friendly, straightforward, and honest manner. I would be glad to purchase another vehicle from McMinnville Toyota at any time in the future.

text_review: Ashley Furniture in Tacoma really was great. I called all sales people were with other customers. The receptionist checked stock for me, Not her job but she went above and beyond her job description. We went in and purchased, drove to the warehouse to get the TV console. The warehouse people we polite and helped us right away. After we put the console together the top had some flaws in the varnish. Called customer service and was on hold for over 30 minutes. Called Tacoma store was given an email address and asked to send a cc to the Tacoma store so they could follow it up. 3 days latter, a tech came out, revarnished the top. What could they of done better? Nothing that I know of. The console was just packaged to soon before the varnish was cured, problem taken care of. Thank you Ashley Furniture. Debbi

text_review: Precision Dental of Seattle has taken care of my dental needs for over 15 years. They are efficient,courteous and on time! T.G. the hygienist, takes time to listen to any dental concerns I might have, and I always feel that no question is a stupid one.What they don't lnow,they will find out. Which is usually very little! That is important to me. Dr Taylor is kind and informative. I appreciate his willingness to inform me and discuss any procedures I ask about during my visit. I have noticed that I take better care of my teeth when I know what is going on. That may sound like a no brainier but it has really helped me. We are partners in taking care of my needs!Carrie the receptionist, always sets a positive,happy tone that makes me feel less stressed. I recommend Precision Dental! Parking no problem!

name: Paseo
text_review: I bought a new car at South Tacoma Honda. Even though it's been a few days since I purchased it, I am still amazed at the professionalism and straightforwardness which isn't something your ordinarily associate with car dealerships.I have been researching the car I purchased for over 6 months and I knew the price I wanted to pay. I checked with over 20 Honda dealer who all flatly turned me down. I recently got an email from Nick Cruthers telling me that he could come very close to the price I wanted to pay. I sent his offer to all the other dealers - not one of them said they could even match it, let alone beat it, and a few suggested that Mr. Cruthers wasn't being entirely honest with me.I drove out of South Tacoma Honda having financed the car at exactly what I wanted to pay. They didn't try to force me to pay any other fees, etc. Of course they offered accessories and other stuff, but I refused everything - and they still smiled and treated me like a king. I am pleased to tell you that Mr Cruthers has my ringing endorsement. He couldn't have made the process easier.

text_review: AUGH THIS SANDWICH PLACEEEEEEEEEEEMy friend and I spent a few days visiting Seattle and staying in Fremont, and this is the first place we went to after we landed and checked into our hostel. Mind you, we were so hungry and tired, the walk from our hostel to Paseo was a little longer than we expected, we waited about 20 minutes in the long line to order and about 20-30 minutes more to receive our order, walked BACK to our hostel to eat because there was no seating there, AND IT WAS STILL WORTH IT! SO DELICIOUS! We got the Paseo Press? Their most popular pressed sandwich that takes a little longer to make. It was seriously delicious. The meat, cheese, grilled onion, and whatever sauce they used went PERFECTLY together. Paseo is a MUST TRY when you're visiting Seattle and want to stop by the cute little Fremont area.

text_review: John works hard to build trust with his clients. The Pacific Rim Automotive is the closest you'll get from a dealer. Unhappy with the demeanor of one of his employees, I had placed a bad review here before. Couple of hours later John gets in touch with me to apologize and gives me great news. He's willing to do my timing belt, replace my water pump, and fix the power window at no cost. It's exactly what we expect from a professional in this type of situation. No regrets to have driven my car to the Pacific Rim Automotive at all. I'm here to testify that they will work hard to get the job nicely done no mater what. I strongly recommend the Pacific Rim Automotive for your Subaru Forester. Ask for John that it can't go wrong. Cheers!

name: Paseo
text_review: My boyfriend and I visited Seattle for my birthday in December. Before I left Arizona, my tattoo artist made sure to let me know about Paseo. "Remember Paseo! That is all!" he said in complete seriousness. So I did.My boyfriend and I got to Fremont around 9:00 a.m.--too early because nothing is open, apparently. We started at Fremont Coffee Co. and walked around a bit, then headed down to the water to find the Troll before Paseo opened at 10:30. We walked all the way up what felt like the tallest hill in the entire world before arriving at tiny Paseo around 10:00. A line was already forming, and we made friends with a gentleman named Terrence who said it was also his first time, and he would be grabbing sandwiches to-go. Everything I've read told me not to take it to-go unless you plan on wearing most of it.I intended to get the full experience. My boyfriend and I both went for the Caribbean Roast Sandwich. It took all of three minutes to get, and we even got a table! We sat, unwrapped the steaming pile of pork and went at it. It was the most satisfying greasy mess I've ever had the pleasure of wearing all over my face and hands. The jalapenos scattered throughout offered the perfect kick to the mild flavor of the pork. The baguette was crisp and stayed that way!I looked around the room and noticed not two people eat a Paseo sandwich the same way. While we opted for the "face first" method, one man had grabbed a fork and taken off the top part of the sandwich, scooping sauce and pork in single-bite increments. Another gent had used a fork entirely. Some a bag, already slightly spotted with grease, to-go. It was magical to see everyone so satisfied!It turned out to be a good thing we walked a hundred blocks up a gigantic hill to get to Paseo because we were absolutely full to the brim after. I would walk up that hill a million times over just to get to that sandwich. You have quite the gem, Seattle!!

name: Paseo
text_review: You know, I've been going to Paseo quite a bit because it's been hyped up and highly regarded by both Seattle people and tourists. When friends come into town to visit, this is a place I try to take them to. And at first, I didn't get it, it was just a sandwich that tasted normal. But the more I have it, the more it sticks out to me. Fair warning for those having it the first time, this is a greasy sandwich so load up on napkins. I usually go for the Cuban Roast, as it's what they tout as their most popular. Comes with HUGE slices of onions, a leaf of lettuce and some juicy savory pork. Can't figure out what the sauce is either, is it just mayo? In any case, the bite goes down so good and the jalapenos add the heat that I look for in any great sandwich. I would consider getting extra jalapenos next time.A tip if you plan on heading there is call in an order beforehand. After about half an hour, you can walk right in and pick it up instead of waiting in line. I've waited for an hour and half before.

text_review: I walked in skeptical and left a believer in the power of meat between bread. It is so difficult to explain the sheer joy one receives from getting a sandwich from a well managed restaurant with fresh ingredients. It was as if I was blind my whole life and then suddenly I saw colors for the first time. I recommend the Italian sandwich sprinkled with basil and lightly toasted for perfection and a well rounded meal. After each bite remember to cleanse your palate after each bite with a crisp spring water. This way each time you chew it is nothing but flavor explosions in your mouth.

name: re:public
text_review: Just had a fantastic time with friends at this pub! The food was absolutely delicious, especially the Steak Bites, Fries, and Crispy Brussels Sprouts. The menu offered a variety of options, and everything we tried was top-notch. The pub itself has a great atmosphere, with solid vibes that make it a nice spot to hang out.One of the highlights was the extensive drink options available. They had a wide selection of drinks to choose from, catering to various preferences. The service was quick and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, making sure we had everything we needed.The prices were fair for the quality and quantity of food and drinks provided. It's always a relief when you get good value for your money. All in all, it was a great experience - good food, good drinks, good service, and good vibes. Definitely recommend giving it a try if you're in the mood for a enjoyable and satisfying pub experience.

name: re:public
text_review: Strolled in for brunch midday on a Saturday, not really knowing what to expect. I had previewed a brunch menu online that looked like it was on point, but I was really sold by the fact that they take online reservations for brunch - unheard of in Seattle - and all I really wanted was some good food in a decent atmosphere without the hours long wait that generally trademark brunch in this city.While this is certainly one of the many dinner/bar locations that brunch offerings are clearly their second line of business, with "brunch" written on a chalkboard for diners to take notice while they are in for a drink on a Friday night, I was pleasantly surprised at the airiness of the place with the roll-up opened on a nice summer day.Service was great - timely, thoughtful, and kind. Mimosas were generous in the champagne department and were mixed with fresh oj. And the food - THE FOOD! I ordered the beef short rib chilaquiles and the hubs ordered the fried chicken/waffle. The chilaquiles were delicious! Topped with radish and cilantro, a side of black brand with cotija cheese, and served with crème fraîche, a lime wedge, and green "diablo salsa" - just the right amount of heat. The fried chicken and waffle were also amazing - the chicken was juicy on the inside and had perfectly crispy skin, and the waffle was sprinkled with pecans and bacon and topped with a cardamon butter that was to die for! The perfect sweet/savory brunch item.If you're looking for a fabulous brunch without the wait, re:public is now definitely on the top of my list.

name: re:public
text_review: Only been here from lunch and drinks.  Not bad, but not great.

name: re:public
text_review: i like this place a lot. a couple of weeks ago i wound up here twice in one week. i really like the bread and butter dish. i recommend asking for extra salt to bring the butter up to that special zing level. i think it's either $2 or $3.i met up with a friend to give him some water bottles for his future STP ride. they are massively late. parking is a hassle around there. i found a couple of douchey guys sitting in their douchey cars, talking on their douchey cell phones, taking up valuable free street parking spots. hope that doesn't turn into a hot new trend. i would go back again for the good beers and i'd try the food too.

name: re:public
text_review: Great decor. Great wine selection. Great food, except for the egg on the asparagus plate. My friend and I enjoyed being by the garage door. I'm a foodie, she's not. Good time had by both. Would come again.

name: re:public
text_review: SNARF!Re:Public is a new cute little cubby looking joint straight ILLIN' in the midst of SLU. The red letters on the sign make it that much more magical. Anywho, we had a private company event here and I definitely indulged. The ambiance was very romantic so I could definitely see myself cruising here for a nice glass of vino on a weekend or weekday with a sweet lil' thang.I had the crab puffs as an appetizer and they were quite scrumptious, some amazing lasagna and pasta for my entree. After I was almost all the way full I tried their rib eye and was immediately blown away. This place wasn't too pricey so definitely worth your time if you're in the area.Bonus info: This is about 1 notch up from Joey's in SLU. It's more expensive so I would recommend Joey's if you're just having drinks and/or a light appetizer and Re:Public if you want a higher class menu and ambiance.

name: re:public
text_review: I was happy to try this place. Great food. Everyone I was with enjoyed it.

name: re:public
text_review: Great happy hour menu for food and drinks. The service was fast and friendly. Lunch and dinner menu are great too.

name: re:public
text_review: Absolutely delicious and service was impeccable. Would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

name: re:public
text_review: Was in Seattle for 36 hours and wound up here twice. Delicious foods, one of the best Old fashioneds I've ever had, and AMAZING service from the bar staff.

name: re:public
text_review: The menu is excellently great and good quality meals. Great spot for dinner. We occasionally dined here and so far the food never disappoint us. The kurobuta Pork Chop and Risotto were on-point, well-cooked, and taste really delicious. The drinks selection made our night perfectly great, Cocktails are fantastic. The price is reasonable.

name: re:public
text_review: The carne asada fries here are to die for!

name: re:public
text_review: This is the best place to get some carne asada fries in my opinion!

name: re:public
text_review: The steak fries are absolutely phenomenal here!

name: re:public
text_review: Amazing service and delicious food selection, you can't go wrong with anything here! Food to service is spot on :)

name: re:public
text_review: Four words. Happy hour lamb burger. Do it.

name: re:public
text_review: i love food and staff here.for the great food and wonderful experience, i would give them 10 stars :)

name: re:public
text_review: Fantastic staff, great space and location in South Lake Union. I LOVE the bartender Rory. (Had been in the week before and really liked it so brought my team in for drinks after work, Rory remembered what I had the last time I was in and was a dream!) Everyone made us feel very welcome and will definitely be back. Seems like a lot of regulars with the staff greeting many by name.A really wonderful place and worth a visit if you're working near Amazon campus.

name: re:public
text_review: One of the best bars and restaurants in Seattle.

name: re:public
text_review: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! This has become a monthly treat for me and a couple co-workers. Fantastic wine list, amazing food, small portions but worth every penny. You just have to get a little wine-drunk first and savor each bite. I wish I had done a review when this was still on the menu, but I am going to mention it anyway...foie gras creme brulee. Yep, most amazing thing I have ever had in my entire life. I couldn't tell if I was eating a meal or a dessert, omg, if you guys are reading this please, please bring it back! I have only sat at the bar, but service is always attentive even when its busy. Until last week I was only in on weekday nights, but I stopped by for a martini by myself on a friday and it was packed! Definitely a fun scene on the weekends if you are looking to meet people or come in with a group, probably not as good for a date seeing as it was super loud, but good for them for being busy. A+

name: re:public
text_review: Great food. Really cool ambiance. Love this place.

name: re:public
text_review: Went in on a friends recommendation last night. The place has a bigger city feel and a great whiskey selection. Started at the bar with manila clams and the pork belly...wow. Moved to a table after that and split some pastas and steak. Great food across the board. Solid ambiance and knowledgeable staff...I will head back soon

name: re:public
text_review: Went Back for drinks and those crab Agnolotti, EXCELLENT!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: the food quality was not special to pay $115 for 2 people. the pasta tasted fresh but the chicken tasted like a box of sand which is very sand, dissappointing in my opinion. the desert wine tasted i literally yacked two. the desert was very decent but again over pricedthe ambiance was really extraordinary i would say that but other than not visiting seattle because of this

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I recently visited Purple Café and Wine Bar in Seattle for the first time, and unfortunately, my experience left much to be desired. While the ambiance and drink selection were noteworthy, my overall impression was tainted by uncomfortable seating, lackluster food, and an unpleasant aftermath.Let's start with the positives. The restaurant's ambiance and wine selection create a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere, making it a suitable spot for drinks and socializing. However, when it comes to the dining experience, there are considerable drawbacks.The seating arrangement was notably uncomfortable, detracting from what could have been an enjoyable evening. The chairs lacked ergonomic design, making it difficult to relax and fully savor the dining experience.Turning to the food, I ordered the chicken, expecting a premium dish given the prices. Regrettably, the reality fell short of expectations. The chicken was disappointingly dry, reminiscent of a budget BBQ chicken one might find at a grocery store. The lack of succulence and flavor left me questioning the value for the cost.Unfortunately, my disappointment did not end with the underwhelming meal. The next day, I experienced persistent gas and an upset stomach. While I'm not quick to attribute these symptoms solely to the restaurant, it does raise concerns about the quality of ingredients or food handling practices.In light of my overall dissatisfaction and the subsequent digestive discomfort, I believe the establishment should consider refunding my purchase. A dining experience should leave patrons satisfied and comfortable, and unfortunately, Purple Café and Wine Bar fell short of these expectations.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We got kicked out for not having our vaccine cards handy deapite having ample seating available outside. ironically we not only had the vaccine but also the booster AND are healthcare workers that take care of about 1,000 patients a day in Texas. So glad to get this amazing service after all we do to fight covid on a daily basis. Great way to treat the healthcare workers By kicking us out to the streets.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I wouldn't even rate this one star, they discriminated against me and my family. I will never return, I have never I my life been treated this way. Unbelievable!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Beautiful chic trendy downtown vibe restaurant, but...so disappointing, bad server she was unprofessional in a rush hurry forgetting things too abrupt @ table, so-so food from the over priced menu considering "What This Place Is"! Ordered 2 Wine Flights @ table server forget one card listing what we were drinking and finally brought the info wine description card half way after drinking the wine. We here just after 4p the place was not that busy! Terrible rock shrimp asparagus pizza dried out tasted like a unsalted cracker. Salads too small for the price and not that appealing looking or tasty!!!!! Parking was great only $5 after 4p underneath in garage.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: One of the worst experiences. Waiter was rude and beligerant, and turned a celebration for our son's camp getaway into a miserable experience. It was so bad we walked out of the restaurant before ordering anything, even though we had no other place to go. Terrible, and sad. Management didn't care, and their fake empathy towards us was even more insulting, even as they realized the ridiculodness of the situation. Too bad, we have been there before and liked it. We will never set foot in that establishment.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I used to love this restaurant for their wonderful service and Sommeliers.  The last two times I have been there in the last two months, the servers just seemed to be checked out and going through the motions. There is no passion in their work, and they are no longer trying to create an ambiance or a dining experience, and when I drop 2-300 for a dinner for 2, I expect more. I went there this evening, and again the waitress comes over with a nice bottle of wine, but where is the sommelier? Have they gotten rid of this program where the Som comes over and decants your wine. I loved talking about wine with the Som, and thought it added a nice touch. Guess Harvest Vine and Luc will now get my business. Goodbye Purple Cafe. My filet mignon was not medium, and even though I told my server, she didn't really seem to care, and I am not one to send food back unless she felt it should return to the kitchen, and she didn't say anything. The filet came by itself, so I found myself hungry afterwards and ordered two cheese tastings which were nice as always. There just isn't anything special about Purple any longer........it's just get the customer in, and get them out...............I can feel a better energy and have a special dining experience elsewhere. Seattle has some great restaurants. Sorry Purple........won't be back. GC

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Horrible place and the worst manager ever.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: If you haven't noticed by now, I'm huge on customer service. This place had some of the rudest, most pretentious @$$holes I have ever met. So we went in late on a Tuesday night after a Mariners game, as my buddies sister and friend were in town from the East Coast. After ordering a shot and a drink, we were content for about 45 minutes. My buddy ordered a drink and about 20 minutes later hadn't received it. When he finally received his drink, I ordered another, and jokingly asked him if I could get it in less than a half hour. Turns out we didn't look like the crowd they prefer, so he decided that my joke meant I was intoxicated and didn't deserve to be served anymore. It was my 2nd drink in an hour, AND we had ordered food. After speaking with a manager, he agreed that I did not look intoxicated, but they don't undermine the "judgement of their staff". Maybe my joke was in poor taste, but I was trying to be lighthearted, not offensive, and if you work in a bar, you should be ready to deal with garbage from rude patrons, and a little banter at the bar shouldn't be handled like that. 0 stars is what they deserve,, and I guarantee I will never return to this place. I will say I was digging the atmosphere of the place before that whole thing happened.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Cafe has been one of my favorites for the past few years and I have celebrated many birthdays and other special occasions there. Last night I came in excited but was very disappointed with the service. After waiting for some time to get our food, my table was finally served except for myself. Unfortunately, many of the pastas cold upon serving. I had ordered the purple chopped salad which was okay once I got it but that wasn't until 20-30 minutes after the rest of the table. By the time I was starting to eat the rest of the table was finished. Not even an acknowledgment from the waiter or an apology was given. I understand mishaps occur but I'd expect some sort of acknowledgment of it by the staff so I was not left waiting.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I thought that the food was pretty average. It was definitely over-priced for the quality of food. It was not bad, but it was not worth the price we paid.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Wines are over priced and list is not well put together.  Food ok but once again you can get better across the street

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food was so-so at best and our waiter had an attitude. Definitely won't go to this place again next time we're in Seattle. Thank God we were with good company!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This restaurant is a real deal! It is the place where you can find the real food at the real price. Worth paying for it trust me! See you soon! Highly recommended!! Prices are fair for most items and the food is delivered to your table in a reasonable time. They have the best service in town.I can't wait to come back here!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: food is great. of course the wine is yummy but it is pretty loud. came in with a group of girls (7) and sat at a table and couldnt hear eachother talk. good for a casual meal but not if you want something more intimate i wouldnt recommend.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Ate here for dinner. Muslced the door open to a nice restaurant inside.The food was great, good selection of wines,had a great red, but don't expect me to remember what it was. Would be a a nicer atmosphere if it weren't so loud. Couldn't carry a conversation. Overall, satisfied.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Foods are ok, not sure this is American or Chinese, but it has many selections.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is a nice place with a really nice atmosphere. If you make sure to order anything in particular, order the lobster mac and cheese. Very nice!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good atmosphere but this place is definitely more style than substance.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place was cool

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The atmosphere was lovely, a GREAT wine list and amazing service. However, the food was a little salty. I will definitely give it another chance. Perfect location for a girls night out!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Outstanding selection of wine and a great atmosphere.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Like a model: gorgeous on the outside, vacuous inside. I adore this convertion of a bank's big windows to a chi-chi wine bar with a spiral wine column in the middle. But was I surrounded by celebs or something? I don't think I had spinach in my teeth!!!!! Pay attention to me, please. Nice full flavored cup of soup. Looks like great wine flight options. PUHLEASE though .... I am not invisible even though I wasn't showing cleavage.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Meh. That pretty much sums it up. The food was meh. The atmosphere was meh. The service was meh. Even some of the wine was meh.We had a few things off the tasting menu and a couple of that evenings specials. It was all so unremarkable that I really don't remember what any of them were.While parts of the interior are cool, it felt like a cafeteria in there (albeit a nice one). It's like they were going for European Courtyard and instead got Food Court At A Reasonably Nice Mall.My wine flight was good (I guess I chose well), but my husband's was not (I guess he didn't).It was a totally passable (if not far too pricey) evening, that I won't be hurrying back to repeat. But if I end up there again somehow? Whatever. I'll eat, I'll drink, I'm sure it will be fine. But..... meh.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Came for a date night, ambiance was among the best. Food was good although I think we got youelr typical dinner burgers & fries. Service was acceptable. Would go again for memorable nights. Pricing was fair.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Everything about this restaurant is very good. It's a large open space with comfortable seating and great service. The food is quite good.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We came here for dinner and made a reservation immediately. It's a huge cool place, and the decor is beautiful, however I think they could happily use more lighting when the sun goes down it feels really dark and difficult. I think they have an intimate feel but it's completely dark.We ordered appetizers, which came out quickly. However, it takes a long time for us to heal ourselves after being cleansed. The food was great; I enjoyed the burrata and calamari appetizer, but found the duck a bit dry.Overall would get it here but again due to cheap service.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love this place! Large selection of wine and exquisite hand-crafted cocktails. Every appetizer we tried was fantastic, but the Gorgonzola dates are by far our favorite!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Food was delicious, service was great. Great date spot. Close walk from the water. Sit at the table or bar and you're in good hands.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food was prepared well and everything was simply in the perfect spot. The lighting is sufficiently dim to set the disposition . My beau cherishes the spot, we come here consistently to have our dinner. The staff is warm, inviting as well and they got you covered for every one of your necessities.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I don't live in the city so when I do get to go to the city I have a list of restaurants I want to visit. This spot being one of them. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience - from the food, to the service to the atmosphere. Come here if you want a great time and great food.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love the downtown Seattle location's atmosphere! The only issue is that it can be a little busy and sometimes the wait is long between check-ins from the server. The food is incredible and, of course, the wine is amazing. Would recommend for a nice date night!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I had lunch with my coworkers there for the first time. The atmosphere was good, really like their wine case. The food was good - I ordered the Spaghetti and meatballs - so so good. The only complaint I have is that the wait time was too long. I was there during the peak lunchtime, so I think this could be acceptable. Also, they have great dessert menu. I had the Creme Brulee. I definitely will be back to try them all haha.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We had a party of 6. Service was prompt and our server was very knowledgeable about menu items.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Pretty good food and a cute place.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing pizza! The wine (of course) is amazing as well. I'll be back again soon.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Could have been a 5 except for the screaming kids. Don't go here for a quiet dining experience.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food, wine, service and atmosphere were great. Had a great girls night out here. Will definitely be going back.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Pleasant place for weekend out! Parking is a little inconvenient though.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love the sandwiches and salads but they are very expensive. Salads will run you close to $15 not including drink or anything else.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: we really enjoyed this place. great food and great ambiance.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Ambiance is lovely. The food here is delicious! I'm a huge fan of the baked brie. Will come back for more!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is always a restaurant that I get excited to go to. It can sometimes get a little loud, but the food always makes up for it! I had a special of theirs a while back that was a steak and risotto dish, and I still dream about it! The service is almost always good, and the food is amazing, but I'd highly recommend making a reservation!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is the place to go for great wine sampling. Whether you try a flight or taste by the glass, the selection of wine here is extensive. They have really great small plates and happy hour prices as well.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I just had a 20 person party in one if the back rooms at The Purple and the staff, food and wine were amazing. The pairings were superb. Anna and Tyler did such a great job, I remember Anna from another very positive dining experience there. I so appreciate her style. She was attentive and handled the crowd with such professionalism. I would highly recommend The Purple!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: The food was incredible, the staff was super sweet and the cocktails were perfect. If only I was wealthy, I'd go all the time..

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Went there for dinner last night before a show. The service was excellent and the food was amazing!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great place to visit.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Really good, nice ambiance.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good food, good service and comfortable seating! Loved the layout and different options for dining and drinking here. Also a bit pricey.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great food but service can be improved!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I always get something from the tasting bar including the wine pairing. I am never disappointed here; try the duck liver pate or the curry lamb empanada. The atmosphere at the purple in downtown is always good and waitresses are super nice. It is noisy, so get ready to have a loud conversation.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great Happy Hour in Kirkland. I like the Beef carpaccio, not for the vegans, but I love it especially when it is washed with some Pinot Noir

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I ordered the pesto pasta...delicious! My favorite dish we tried...goat cheese topped with cranberries appetizer. yes...yum!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Just amazinggg... Great service, nice cocktails..

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I was contacted through Yelp, by the Manager, after I left my previous review. He offered apologies and wanted to try to make things right. His apologies were greatly appreciated. It says a lot. I will be back.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Fun wines and cheeses!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: If you go to Purple, take your time and settle in. Enjoy a flight of wine and cheese pairing or something else before you order. I'm definitely not a wine buff and my wife is no expert, but we enjoy the ability to have a relaxing conversation and enjoy some new wines we normally wouldn't try. The staff is very helpful in recommending combinations and they don't make you feel out of place if you aren't a wine expert. The entrees have all been quite good and very reasonably priced, with the exception of the lobster mac' n cheese (although it is well worth the $27). My only complaint is how cold it sometimes feels. I would love to see a nice fireplace added to warm things up in the winter.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: My favorite lunch spot downtown. One of the best wine lists in Seattle

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Tha experience was amazing as always!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Coolest place ever!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is such a cool place. I just found them for the first time. The decor is amazing and reminds me of something you would see in LA. The food was so good. For the prices they charge I thought they should have given you larger portions. It isn't a place I would go all the time due to the cost but it is really nice for once in a while.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great environment to bring a friend and drink some wine! Don't go there if you want to have an intimate conversation because it's loud. All the hard surfaces make for a loud environment. Loved the food and enjoyed the Rafanelli 06 zin for $75.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple is a wonderful place. We did the cheese and wine pairing and it was delightful. They are only missing 5 stars because my customer service experience from the male bartender was not good. Everyone else was great though. Ill be back for sure.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Just had a group business lunch here and was impressed with the decor and the taste of the food. Service was solid and the wine list was very deep. We ate upstairs in the balcony the space is small but quite enough during the lunch hour to carry on conversations.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love their lamb burger and sea salt caramel desserts. The pork sirloin was so-so. What was that they put over the meat? Caramelized sweet radish? It just doesn't go well with the meat. Service was good and the atmosphere was lively.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great wine selection and a very cool decor. The wine markup isnt so bad, but that should be expected at a wine bar. They have a great wine list and good options for tastings of wine and cheeses by the flight. The bar doesnt know how to make a martini, but once again they are a wine bar. If anything, I would say they should simplify the food menu. I found it to be too many choices, found myself spending too much time reviewing the menu, but I went there for wine and appetizers, not for dinner, so I may be biased.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: DInnerFood was good

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Lobster Mac n' cheese. that's all i got to say.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar is a fantastic spot that deserves five stars. The pasta was absolutely delicious, bursting with flavor and perfectly prepared. The ambiance was lovely, creating an inviting and elegant atmosphere that made the meal even more enjoyable. The service was standard but efficient, allowing the food and setting to shine. Overall, it's a wonderful place for a great dining experience. Highly recommend!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We had a wonderful experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious as was the service. I ordered the grilled lamb chops and my wife had the dungeoness crab pasta. Both were amazing. We also ordered the spicy prawns which had a kick but were so tasty. And finished it off with the vanilla bean creme brulee.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Lovely service - the waitress was kind and accommodated a table of our choice. The place gets loud, so best to take a table or two away from the crowd if you can. Food was great - we had the calamari and pasta and both were great. Cocktails were top notch and no complaints.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Very very good indeed This is the perfect date or group dining spot.Absolutely fantastic little spot in downtown Seattle.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Café and Wine Bar in Seattle truly delivers an exceptional experience. The ambiance instantly captures you, creating a perfect backdrop for the exquisite food. The wine and cocktail selection is top-notch, perfectly complementing the culinary delights. Highly recommended for those seeking an unparalleled dining journey

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Food was great, and surprisingly they weren't busy at all for mothers day when we got there. No complaints except i wish they had checked on us a little more. I had to keep looking for someone when I needed water, or napkins or to order.Kid-friendliness: They do have a kids menu and were great to my kiddo for mothers day

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love it, amazing service, amazing ambiance, foods amazing don't know what else you could ask for.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Purple Cafe and Wine Bar and I have to say, it was an absolutely fantastic experience from start to finish! From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the elegant and inviting atmosphere. The decor is sophisticated and stylish, with plenty of seating options to suit any preference.The menu is full of delicious and creative dishes that are made with high-quality ingredients and cooked to perfection. I especially loved the cheese and charcuterie board, which was beautifully presented and paired perfectly with the wine selection. Speaking of wine, the wine list is extensive and impressive, with a great selection of wines from around the world to choose from.The service was also top-notch, with friendly and knowledgeable staff who were always available to answer questions and make recommendations. The attention to detail was evident in everything from the presentation of the dishes to the quality of the stemware used for the wine.One of the things that really stood out to me was the emphasis on sustainability and locally sourced ingredients. It's clear that the restaurant takes great care in selecting the best possible ingredients, which adds an extra layer of quality to every dish.Overall, I would highly recommend Purple Cafe and Wine Bar to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in an elegant and sophisticated setting. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a great night out, this place is sure to exceed your expectations. I can't wait to come back and try more of their amazing dishes and wines!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good service, good food, highly recommend!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Beautiful atmosphere, delicious wine. Stopped in for a quick drink on our way to a show.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Wow-what a great time we had at Purple.There were 6 of us. We had drinks, apps, entrees and desert. All of the food was exceptional.The service was top notch too. The server was always there.One other positive is the restaurant was not loud and we could actually hear each other from the other side of the table. In some restaurants, its so loud you cant hear the person next to you when they are yelling in your ear. Not here!Highly recommended!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This was a great place. Great wine selection and food.  Service was very nice and informative.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I've been to this place two years ago for my husband's birthday. The interior has a cool vibe and there is an impressive wine display. The staff were friendly. I loved the bone marrow appetizer and the seared scallop main course. This place is on the quieter side for a wine bar. I'd recommend this place.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place is perfect for a lunch date or dinner date. The atmosphere is calm and soothing and let's talk about their meals! They're well done and absolutely delicious! Dessert was a bit dry but I generally loved the whole experience. The décor is poetic from the choice of color and accessories in the establishment. The special service offered for a romantic date is just on another level. I think it would be had for any person to turn down an engagement  or wedding proposal that is made in this establishment. More to the service and the décor, the accommodation facilities befit loyalty. Spending a night at the establishment is an epic experience. I would definitely come back for a second date at this place and recommend it to my friends with a lot of confidence.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: OK, so I am writing this about pre-COVID Purple, in the hopes that soon we will be back to normal post-COVID Purple.It's one of my favorite places for a date night, from the ambiance, to the amazing food, to the fabulous wine pairings.A wine flight at Purple was always a wonderful trip. I am holding the vision of doing more of them sometime soon....viva la Purple!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing restaurant! Great staff and excellent communication

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: nice place, nice people, good prices

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I always enjoy the service and food at Purple. I've been here before multiple times and liked it. The food and wine are always consistent. Our server was fabulous and made the whole dining experience remarkable.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I found this place by chance. I found the food excellent, and the wine list was impressive. We had the cranberry chicken salad and Lobster Mac & cheese. We enjoyed our meal so much.Everyone was incredibly friendly & helpful.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Yum yum yum! This is one of my favorite spots up north and the wine list is amazing! Try the lobster mac and cheese and you won't be disappointed :)

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Delicious food and the wine selection is AWESOME. I don't know if they have it on the menu anymore but awhile back they had a lobster mac and cheese which was FANTASTIC. I hope they bring it back to the menu.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love this place! Been back several times. Everything is great, but especially the cocktails. Delicious.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Located downtown seattle. Great food and ambience.  The service was amazing. Our server was on top of it and extremely helpful. High quality food. The place is beautifully decorated. Highly recommend

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Wow, SUCH friendly service! And the view is great. I have nothing to complain about here at all, I'll be back for sure! I had a great cabernet that I forget the name of, I hope they remember what it is haha.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Fantastic place! Food was incredible coupled with excellent service. Very nice wine selection.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: It was simply amazing. Everything was great. The Brie is amazing and the mushroom soup.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Good food and really great staff.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: So good! We came on a Tuesday night around 7pm, and they were already packed! We ended up waiting about 15 minutes for some seats at the bar. The ambiance is great -- dim lighting that worked seamlessly with the high ceilings & impressive floor-to-ceiling wine tower. The wait staff was extremely friendly, and made great food recommendations! We tried:- the Riesling -- sweet and fruity!- baked brie -- no need to elaborate, just get it.- seafood stew -- recommended by our waiter, and it was so good! Will definitely be back if I'm ever in town again, but perhaps with a reservation next time.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I am not usually someone who leaves reviews but i was so impressed with Purple Cafe that I thought I should! The following was excellent 1.)Making a reservation over the phone2.Being welcomed at the door3.)Service 4.) FoodFood was off the charts. I impressed my entire family. Thank you for making a special night perfect!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love, love, love this restaurant! I've never had a bad meal here. Our sommelier last night was so attentive, and helpful. He made our night.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great service. Food is delicious. Very crowded. Make sure to make reservations before going in.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We went here for lunch, everyone at the table ordered a glass of wine and salmon with rice. Great atmosphere, business professional setting. Excellent waiter! I highly recommend this location and we will be back again.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We got a table for four almost immediately. The service was friendly and the staff very attentive. We REALLY Really enjoyed our meal here. Probably one of the best corned beef hash I've had. The corned beef was tender, flavorful; potatoes perfectly fried; delicious rye bread and two fried eggs on top. My friend had the fried egg sandwich (provolone, bacon, egg, greens) which he thought was great. We had a vegan with us as well and the server said the chefs are really good at accommodating food requests. They made the Espanola vegan by replacing the eggs with more veggies and avocados. Everyone was satisfied. Great service as well. Facility was clean including the bathrooms. I can confidently recommend Purple Cafe to others!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place was amazing! The atmosphere was perfect and the food was unbelievable. The staff could not have been nicer!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Purple Cafe was highly recommended, and exceeded my expectations! The decor is elegant and modern with an interesting wine twist. The menu is varied and satisfying. However, the true highlight is the staff... They were warm, charming, and so knowledgeable about their products & features! Janice, the Sommelier is elegant with a fun spirit, and will guide your wine journey like a true professional. This place is legit!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love so many things about this place. Great wine selection and lovely small plates. I also had one of the best soups I've ever had here--it was the soup of day so sadly it isn't there all the time. I've been here several times and it's always good. Even nice if you are flying solo and just want to sit at the bar.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: One of my favorite downtown spots for wine. Vast selection and very good service. I also recommend the lamb sirloin or crab cakes here. They're ******* outrageous.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I work near by and decided to check it out after work. So good!!. Came back two days in a row because i was so in love! Definitely a new after work unwind spot. Love it!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Went to Purple café with my fiancé on our first anniversary and it was perfect date!!It was so beautiful inside(especially the wine tower) and the service was good, food was great.Everything was perfect and even our server gave me a wine for free when I told him that we are here to celebrate the anniversary. I would like to visit again!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Walked in based on yelp review and we're not disappointed. Amazing!! Every dish was a culinary delight.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love love love this place!! Amazing food to die for and an even more wonderful wine list! This is a must go spot for everyone!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great atmosphere/food/wine, easy parking

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We just had tapas and drinks. Everything was very tasty. Decor is modern/eclectic. Service was very good and helpful with suggestions. Oh yeah, desserts were great... try the chocolate caramels with sea salt.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great food, ambiance and service. Worth every penny!!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: YUM! The pizza special was soooo good! And, they have great wine too.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This is by far my favorite resturant, everything on the menu is absolutely fabulous! Great for happy hour!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great, creative food. Loved the wine flights! Made me want to take a vacation to the vineyards! Waitstaff was very pleasant, patient and helpful. Cool ambiance too.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: LOVE!!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Nice atmosphere...service is excellent...if your in downtown Seattle. You should definitely stop by and grab a drink...will not be disappointed..lots of attractive women around...

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Everything was perfect. Food was amazing!!! Service was great. Price was right.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: This place is SO good, and gets better every time!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I love Purple Cafe! Their baked Brie is to die for. And, I am in love with their lobster mac. Did I mention how much I love their baked Brie? Warm right out of the oven, melting all over the plate, fresh cut grapes on top with fresh baked rosemary flat bread. #mmm

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great small plate menu

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing, from start to finish!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I recently had the opportunity to take my girlfriend here for her birthday. I wanted to take her somewhere nice and make it memorable for her. She's a wine and cheese lover so I knew she'd appreciate this place but I also wanted to take her here so she could try something new as she doesn't have a very adventurous palate.First off, the ambiance was nice and romantic. She loved the tower of wine and spiral staircase in the middle of the restaurant. We started off upstairs in the lounge with a drink while we waited for our table and then headed to our table where we chose from the Tasting Bar menu.She was feeling a little adventurous so we had the the Duck Liver Pate and the Ahi Tuna Poke which were both spectacular. For our entrees, the lady chose Duck Confit and I had Filet Mignon. She LOVED the Duck and couldn't stop raving about it.After the numerous bottles of wine and all the delicious food, I'd say we had a pretty sexy evening.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Amazing!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Love it. Really nice place. Try their salty caramel chocolates :)

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I went with my boyfriend last night for a "date night" very classy and ultra hip and modern.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Took my girl here for " date night" and they did not disappoint.The atmosphere is perfect for a nice semi classy date. They had great food options beautiful selection of wine choices.Try a few different wine flights, its a better bang for your buck kind of thing.You will not be disappointed. Oh and save room for desert!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great Place great wines!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: SO AMAZING! I had the lobster mac & cheese and it was to die for!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Great place for lunch or dinner. Definitely worth a try!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Five of us sat down Saturday for a last minute 10pm reservation and we started by asking the waiter for an exciting, well priced, bottle of Pinot. Naturally, we got the look one gets when asking for exciting pinot and a "Well, pinots are usually more mellow than exciting," yes we said, exciting but mellow will be fine.That interaction managed us the sommelier who came, chatted, and quickly returned with a few fist fulls of bottles and glasses and our dinner for 5 turned into a wine tasting for 5. We all learned something, and chose a bottle, which was great. We dared not ask its cost though we had asked for "value." A few "tasting" rounds of apps, some salads, and some great entrees, I had the pork, done nicely, and the to die for deserts..... we picked up another bottle. The check arrived and our new favorite was only $30, very nice Purple, very nice.But what blows me away about this place is the size of the space. It has got to be one of the biggest, openest venues in seattle with the giant wine rack spiraling up the middle. I think you just feel really good here, you feel out and alive as you look at the downtown buildings though the two story windows. Just go already.....

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: Do yourself a favor and get yourself a cheese plate with a wine pairing. DIVINE! Great Atmosphere and great booze. I'll be back

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: I'm usually not that big on salads, but theirs are fantastic. The roasted red pepper & goat cheese one is something I have cravings for from time to time, and the apple, walnut & stilton salad is great, too (it comes with a light, sweet, interesting champagne vinaigrette).Mondays are half-price bottle night. Recently, I was here with two friends and we shared a cheese flight to start, then we each had an entree and dessert, plus we shared a great bottle of pinot noir. It worked out to $33 each, including tip. You can't beat that!Their sorbets are always creative, fresh and delicious, and I love their sea salt caramels (you can now get an order of sea salt caramels to go, by the way! They make a great hostess gift).I love the decor here, too. Service is a tad slow, but knowledgable and friendly. When my husband and I went to lunch here as a little celebration on the day we picked up our marriage certificate, they brought us out champagne and sea salt caramels--on the house!We go here five or six times a year, and every single experience has been great!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: If I could, I'd fly to Seattle just to have dinner here. J'tadore, Purple.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: BEST wine bar hands down. Killer Filet Minion!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: We were there for our anniversary and we love it! Our first time and certainly won't be our last!

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: What can I say. I loooove Purple. The General Manager (Stephanie) is wonderful and always makes sure we are well taken care of. Their spectacular daily Risotto specials rarely fall under 5 stars. And they have a few nice selections of wine..hahaha.

name: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar
text_review: It is a great place, in my opinion the best overall restaurant in Seattle. The service is excellent, the food is good enough and the setting is just perfect.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: DO NOT PLACE AN ONLINE ORDER!  They had technical difficulties, didn't fulfill the order, but charged us anyway. The manager, Natalie called me the next day to see if we wanted the order filled still. I said no and not to charge us for it or refund us the money. I was charge and never received a credit. I tried for over a month to get it credited. Called every number (there are 3 different numbers listed on google, their website and the credit card stmt 206-584-2998, 206-206-1838, 206-420-3831 and none of them will get through to a person! I finally went in person to get it resolved and spoke to Natalie face-to-face. She remembered me and the technical problems. She took copies of the receipts and apologized that none or the phone numbers worked and she didn't know why the credit hadn't been issued. She gave me her personal cell and said to call her if I still didn't receive the credit. I called her 3x over a 2 week period. Not a single returned phone call and STILL NO CREDIT!!!!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Customer service at Capitol Hill location is getting worse and worse !The owner and manager should fix this ASAP.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: The food here is amazing. The management has fallen hard over the last year. "We don't have eggs" After we ordered online and paid for it. "We didn't see your online order, we will put it in now and it will be ready in 20 minutes". *Standing at the front door for over 5 minutes before greeting*. Orders are wrong about 25% of the time. It's as if they don't care really. Good thing there is a new ramen place that just opened 2 blocks away.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: I grew up in Chiba Japan, and ramen is a part of my life...firstly, it is too expensive for a bowl of ramen. and their ramen is nothing special. I am sure they know they cannot survive even one week in Japan with their quality and taste. I have to say this, however, but employees were wonderful! But sorry, to me, ramen is not about how friendly employees are... to me, ramen must be all about taste but nothing. fancy interior is not important at all.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Used to be great. Now slow and poor drink selection.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: The host is unwelcoming. He should be replaced.The ramen was not good at all. The amount was small. I ordered extra noodles but I received it on a plate. I dumped the extra noodles in the bowl. There wasn't enough broth. The noodles were overcooked. The water was disgustingly lukewarm. None of the waiters knew who had what...I never recommend restaurants where waiters ask who had what. It's your job as a waiter to deliver the food from the kitchen to the proper person. That's the core task of being a waiter. Get it right. Four waiters came out with our food. It wasn't even timed properly. All four waiters asked 'who had what'.It was simply annoying.We were a party of eight and paid 18% gratuity for this poor service.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: This place used to be fantastic, but their service has taken a nosedive recently. Lately, I've consistently waited an astonishing 20-30 minutes (no exaggeration) for the check. They rarely check on you for additional drink orders or refill your water, and there's often a frustrating 5-minute wait at the host stand before anyone greets or seats you. While I understand staffing shortages, it appears that there are just as many employees as before, but their coordination has seriously deteriorated. It's disheartening because this used to be my go-to neighborhood spot, but after my last five visits, I'm seriously considering not returning.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Relatively mediocre food compared to other places in cap hill. If you have a choice, other ramen places are probably a better bet. Edamame was undercooked, ramen was okay...service was good.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: In Seattle staying at a hotel. We ordered for delivery. We didn't receive our potstickers. I asked for soy sauce and red chili sauce. Received neither. I asked for an extra empty bowl so we could share, because I told them we were two people. Got the bowl, got only ONE spoon, even though I clearly stated we are 2 people. I asked them to send the ramen hot since there is no microwave in this hotel room. It arrived cold. And even after I located a microwave 30 floors away from us, the ramen was terrible. I called the listed restaurant number numerous times and nobody answered. I've emailed them and waiting on a response.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Noodles are too soft... I thought ramen was supposed to be firm has bite. This reminds me of more like Chinese noodles. or just mistake?? I arent sure since it was my first time to have ramen here. Maybe I should try one more time. Though they had great service.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Ramen was good but forgetful; service was terrible and unforgetful.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Cramped. Very small and over priced. Will not be coming back here again.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: So-so ramen

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Good ramen options but not as many without pork and beef! Chicken tan tan is great option

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Good value and yummy noodles. Try the Gonzaga. Casual, bustling atmosphere and good takeaway

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: nice ramen in seattle，i always order Uber Eat for this one，it taste very good，but i ordered 5 times uber eat for this restaurant，they sent me the wrong food twice，for example：i ordered miso ramen，but they gave me the other ramen，but anyway，kizuki is still a good restaurant

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: was not impressed with the taste and quality of the food, even though received a good quality service. Don't think I will go there again.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: First time at this restaurant, nice decor. The food was okay they have food that suits most diets. I was a bit uncomfortable because there was a staff group of 5 people standing in the middle of the floor just talking and staring, and I mean the stares where they don't look off when you notice them. Other than that food was fine, nothing crazy good or that flavorful.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Food here was great, although dish was not really clean. The lady who served our food had her finger almost dipped in the broth which I found it gross. We ordered spicy ramen, karaage don and house salad. Everything tasted good.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
