text_review: It was pretty good ramen and it was a slightly dimmed seating area that i liked. I spotted a lipstick mark on my water cup but i couldnt seem to flag down the wait staff until i was done but it was busy so thats probably why.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: The ramen was delicious but I prefer the low sodium because I nearly finished all my water and was full before I could even finish it. The service was amazing, the waiter brought extra condiments for the ramen that he suggested. And the ambiance was beautiful and very clean. You can see the food being made through the kitchen/bar.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Popular place with pretty good ramen.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: This was my first time using this restaurant. I wanted a specific restaurant and they seemed to be the only ones delivering for them now. Everything went well. Driver was fast and courteous. Wait time was a tad longer than I thought it should be. Will use them again.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: We tried few Ramen places in Seattle. This is the best one.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Great food!I like how they have mouthwash in the restrooms!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: We've been to a couple ramen puts in Seattle, and this is unquestionably one of my new top picks. I requested the garlic tonkatsu stock with pork tummy and kale noodles, and it turned out consummately. The administration was quick and the staff is well disposed and pleasant. The air is extraordinary as well, and in a decent area.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Good ramen. Rice dishes are okay.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Been here twice. Great service and good ramen

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Broth was really good. Only one slice of pork meat but everything was done really well.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Great place to get some quick noodles and/or tempura. Would definitely come back.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: My family and I enjoyed it, but certainly not the best ramen in town.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Not bad. But not as good as expected.Well decorated restaurant.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: The wait is reasonable on Friday night. The price range is also reasonable. The food is good and the slice of pork the have with the ramen is actually pan fried a little bit too, you don't really get that in other ramen restaurant.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: yummy

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: A little piece of Japan in Cap Hill. Worth a try!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Nice place to go. But not as good as I expected, but worth going!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Really great flavors! Lots of menu options as well. First time here and we will be coming back.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: kizuki is the most consistent ramen I've ever had. It's always delicious and the staff are always kind and friendly!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Really great place. Food was great, servers were great. Loved it so much went back two days later. Highly recommend.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Server was very nice, sat us down quickly. At Kizukis servers are very nice. Helped out with our crying children and gave them coloring books. The food was amazing. The Garlic Tonkatsu was very flavorful. The Pork broth is very good. The noodles are cooked to perfection and it all around was an amazing experience. Would come again.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: amazing food, love the service. the ambiance is nice too. I really enjoyed the ramen. Its in my top 10 for sure

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: The food here is amazing with super kind and fast service ! Absolutely no complaints :)

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Kizuki Ramen offers a delightful dive into authentic Japanese flavors. The broth is rich and flavorful, with layers of umami that feel both comforting and indulgent. Each noodle slurp perfectly balances tenderness with a satisfying chew. Toppings, like the chashu and seasoned egg, are prepared with evident care, adding to the overall symphony of tastes and textures. For those in search of a genuine ramen experience outside of Japan, Kizuki is a must-visit.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Great place. Wouldn't recommend elsewhere presentation of entrees well enjoyed. Will be returning back.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Radiooooo Emory identify pogo hacks

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Great food and fantastservservice'

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Love the ramen is amazing and Dillion!!!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Good food! Love the place, gives a great and tranquil vibe

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Dillon and Danielle were excellent!!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Phenomenal staff, phenomenal food. Very quick and courteous service. 10/10 would recommend to anyone.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: This Ramen is mouthwatering delicious and flavorful Japanese food. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves traditional Japanese food and the staff is very helpful and friendly here. I love eating here and enjoyed my lunch here at this 5 star Japanese restaurant.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Both the food and service was amazing! Love this place. My new favorite spot

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Just stumbled across while wondering the city. Shoyu ramen is light refreshing broth with nice katsuo flavor. Silky noodles that slurp down, the fried pork and togarashi pepper elevate ramen to next level. Along with the soft boiled and tender Chashu, and crunch from Chinese broccoli. This Shoyu Ramen may be the best I ever had.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: The place was Excellent with its good ambiance. The interior was innovative, spacious with great lighting. One of the best Ramen in Downtown. The service was fantastic, thoughtful, prompt, and knowledgeable.Amazing ramen that will serve traditional and low sodium. Got their light sodium option for most ramen except veggies and miso. The portion was just right enough to fill you comfortably. The appetizers were great. I can't wait to come back and try more.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: ATE THE PLATE OF GYOZA in 3 minutes!!!!Just landed in Seattle from a bumpy flight...and knew exactly what would fix that! Ramen. From the reviews this place gets busy. Walked in a greeted warmly by the service staff. My server recommended Pork Gyoza (which I could get anywhere) but what the heck. It was pretty perfectly cooked, crisp and carmelized on one side and soft on the other. The dipping sauce was tangy with a bite of spice. Could be maybe the best Pork Gyoza I can remember having. Sooo good I ate all 5 pieces in about 3 minutes!!! That must be record time! No shame here...and I sipped on the dipping sauce. I am sure not the only one who does that?!?! For my ramen I had the Yuzu Shio. I will be honest with you I'm a Tongkatsu black garlic kind of a girl. But I think I have changed my way. The Yuzu Shio was simple, flavorful and hit the spot. Pork was so tender and perfectly balanced by the french sea salt. I would be all wrong it I didn't mention the soft boiled egg. You know you're giving 5 STARS when most of runny YOKE ends up on your upper lip as you slurp up the brothly goodness. Kizuki thanks for doing it right!!.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Food was excellent, there was a bit of a wait but it was definitely worth it

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Kizuki was absolutely amazing. I'd been craving ramen all day, and it was everything I hoped for. I ordered the garlic tonkotsu ramen, which was savory, garlicy (of course), and had delicious, we'll-balanced flavors. The egg was soft-boiled to perfection too. My girlfriend ordered the vegetarian ramen, which was delicious and flavorful as well. Hers was packed with tasty, well-cooked veggies. This place is great, and I highly recommend it for anyone in Seattle who's looking for ramen.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: A very busy location. Can be over an hour wait near lunchtime if sitting in, or 20 minutes if to go. But the wait is worth it as the food is delicious. Some of the best ramen in Seattle.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: After multiple locals suggested this place, finally put my thought of ramen aside. Ended up having to wait about 1 hours for a table, but it was 110% worth the wait!! This place exceeded my expectations by far! Great food and great service. Definitely suggest the pork belly steamed buns and the spicy chicken ramen dish. Both were to die for!! If your thinking, it's just ramen...your wrong. I haven't had them since college, but I could eat at Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya everyday!! Yummm

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Nice interior and ambiance!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: First time trying this place out and it was amazinggg. Probably one of the best broth that I've consumed and the ramen was al dente

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Amazing ramen! Almost as good as in Japan

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: This is a place where I hang out during my off days I love to go here food is good and service is good too

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: This is a very popular place because the ramen is so delicious! We each had a different ramen and came away so happily satisfied. I love Japanese food but have never really wanted to eat ramen. We were there in January 2016 and it was cold and snowing. Ramen sounded so good and so we drove over there. It's near my niece's college (Seattle University). Parking was a bit difficult but I found a little pay parking lot through the GPS and it was a few dollars and was in a safe area. Lots of students and office types at the restaurant. The food came out quickly. My daughter couldn't get over the delicious half cooked egg that came with her ramen. She had never tasted anything so delicious and she always talks about it. Not only was her egg delicious but the soup was wonderful too. We would highly recommend this place.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: I am not a huge ramen fan, but this place is sooo good. The ramen was amazing, the texture of the noodles was excellent. I have a severe craving for this place and have put it into my rotation of places to go on the Hill.

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Garlic Tonkotsu, you taste sooooo good

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: Best ramen in Seattle! The broth is really rich and flavorful. Everything you can wish for in a ramen!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: I love this place!!!! the food and service is outstanding!

name: Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya
text_review: First of all this place is amazingly clean and fresh...my server Tina was extremely attentive and helpful. Food came out maybe 4-5 min after I ordered and I don't think I have to say how delicious it was.. They kept on refilling my water and tea. And unlikely other most fast food/ fine dining places they don't rush you out of the door ! Great atmosphere and awesome decoration . My favorite ramen at kukai is Garlic tonkotsu low sodium and even thou I choose to get a lighter broth it's still very rich and flavorful. Professional staff with great attitude . Absolutely be back here another 18492047193 times probably .

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Visited to get some fresh pasta, however our pasta noodles were uncooked, dry, hard and cold.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: For the price of this joint, it is not worth it!! The pasta had a bitter taste and the noodles were hard af! I rather have gone to Olive Garden! That should tell you! Also the parking here is ridiculous ! 15$ fuck that.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Not worth the price! Came because of yelp and left very dissatisfied!!! The pasta was hard and tasted sour and rancid !! Save your money ppl believe me!!!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Looks pretty and the ingredients are very fresh. However, the pasta here is so salty that it is almost impossible to eat it. I forced myself to eat it because I was hungry, but my partner left half of her food. I drank 2 and a half cups of water...

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: As my first Italian dinner in Seattle, Due Cucina promised a tantalizing experience that left me with a taste of enthusiasm, albeit tinged with a hint of disappointment. My friends' and my culinary journey encompassed an array of classic dishes, including Spaghetti bolognese, Mushroom & White Truffle Oil pasta, Carbonara with Campanelle, and Braised Beef Ragu. Unfortunately, the Carbonara with Campanelle failed to meet the lofty expectations, as it lacked the richness that I had anticipated. However, it was the Mushroom & White Truffle Oil pasta that stole the show, surpassing my expectations with its fragrance and flavor. While the unique sausage in the dish showcased the restaurant's creativity, it didn't align with my personal preferences. Lastly, the Braised Beef Ragu' emerged as a satisfactory choice but it wasn't mind-blowing Considering the price and the hype surrounding Due Cucina, my overall experience left me moderately enthusiastic in spite of the nice staff and the warm ambiance.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: I had pasta with chicken, lemon and pistachio. The fresh pasta was really good and cooked al dente. The sauce, however, was flavourless an very salty.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: The mushroom and truffle oil healthy pasta has an excellent flavor. The noodles were well-cooked. They have a good selection of foods. The oxtail ragout was so tasty and has pleasant flavor. The menu was extensive and lots of options. Great quality of pastas. TSo amazing drinks, cocktails were so cool.The restaurant has nice seating. It has great ambiance inside. Worth the price!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: One of my most favorite Italian restaurants! This place is very casual. Perfect for a quick group meal. Their pastas are made in-house, and my most favorite is their campanelle which I always pair with their kale pesto pasta. This place to me is like comfort food and their prices are unbeatable for the quality.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Really tasty dishes and I like the specials they offer. The chefs here are quite talented and offer really unique options. A bit pricey but worth it

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: I have been in the health kick for a few months now and came across this joint in Cap Hill. I was hesitant to try it but it has received great reviews. I'm glad I did. The pasta was simple, fresh and delicioso!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Due Cocina Italiana has great food, with fresh ingredients and tasty dishes. The service is excellent, with friendly and helpful staff. The place has a cozy and welcoming atmosphere, perfect for a casual meal. Even though it's fast food, the experience feels high-quality and enjoyable. Highly recommended for a quick and delicious Italian meal.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Great food, fun staff and fast service whether you're picking up or sitting down. Thanks always Due'

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Consistently _great_ pasta that reminds me of what pasta is actually like all over Italy. I love the concept, I've been all over the menu, I will eat here again and again. Also they have a reference-quality Tiramisu.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Cozy atmosphere, a tasty, wonderful experience. First time dining in after my parents recommended it. Our server was awesome with perfect service. My husband had the Braised Hen & Citrus; the sauce was flavorful. My Traditional Bolognese was the perfect texture and had ample serving. Also, everyone was nice and very accommodating!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Food was amazing. The Cashier Sam was so welcoming and helpful thank you so much for that drink recommendation I am obsessed.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: I love coming here totally worth the drive from Tacoma. The service is always great and the food is amazing!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Awesome place. Chicken Alfredo was amazing. Service was great! And they even gave an awesome bday cake for my boyfriend!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: The most flavorful pasta in Seattle! Will be back again and again and again and again and... :)

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: An upscale Italian restaurant sitting right here in Capital Hill, Seattle. All ingredients are fresh and all the pasta is handmade, you cant get more authentic then this. I recommend having the lamb meatballs with bucatini noodles.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: This has got to the most amazing place to eat the food the service 5 Wow come see for yourselves.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Yum! Great white pasta options. I like their caprice too. If you like Italiana, stop by here!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: I loved the pasta and the pizza from this pasta restaurant. Especially, their pesto pasta, the taste was so heavenly.  The waiter was so pleasant to talk with and accommodating as well.  The food was served well plated and quickly. This place is indeed great for a fancy night out. It feels like. I'm dining in a 5-star restaurant.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: One of the best Italian restaurants in Seattle. I've mostly gone for Seattle Restaurant Week - this year they provided their entire menu which couldn't be better. The ambiance is nice and romantic, the service is exceptional and the waiters/waitresses I've had are always very educated on the menu. Most importantly the pasta is amazing! Highly recommend!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Five star for sureSuch a great place Can not love it moreSuper super delicious food and sauce

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: This shop has a pasta that is so good! the sauce is very tasty and the way they cooked it is just right. I enjoyed it while I am watching my favorite movie. I will order again to share it with my friends.Thanks, Due' Cucina Italiana!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Fresh made pasta. Simple delicious menu everything fresh. Love it because it's awesome and it's fresh

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: My and my best friend's favorite restaurant. Everything we have tried is incredible.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Honestly how can anyone hate on pasta. This place is fantastic.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Great food great service ....!!!

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: I appreciate the napkins here. The Lasagna Bolognase was 7.5/10. Service and experience was 10/10.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Went to dueminuti with some friends this evening and we had a great time! The casual atmosphere of the restaurant that serves great, healthy, inexpensive Italian food left us full and happy. My favourite dish from the restaurant was the pasta with oxtail ragu, and the spaghetti with tomato sauce. Having less carbs in their pasta also meant that I didn't leave the restaurant feeling bloated, I am still feeling full now after a few hours instead of feeling hungry again, which usually happens with normal pasta. There were 8 of us and we ordered a few dishes to share, the bill came up to just over $80.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: I went to this store with my friends last Friday. I love this place! I had basil pesto and my friend had ox tail. My spaghetti was perfectly al-dente that you would usually have to pay $20 or more for this quality of pasta at other restaurants in Seattle BUT theirs was only about $10. I think their pasta is the best quality and best price in town.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: I have no word other than "fantastic"! Sounds like the owner is an Italian man and firstly they had great service. But that wasn't "fantastic" part of this store. Their pasta is the best in town. I must come back soon.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Definitely the best restaurant in town.My family tried to find a good restaurant to visit every week.This restaurant is my pick of last week.Thank you for the service.

name: Due' Cucina Italiana - Capitol Hill
text_review: Everything about this place says that this is the future of pasta! Healthy pasta (made with 9 different grains as explained by the chef), a herb wall (hello urban farming), house-cured or artisanal meats and sauces made from scratch. The food itself is fresh and honest! The pastas have a rich, nutty flavour and a great texture and the sauces are bold, flavourful and tastes like.... real food! I ordered the basil pesto (the best I ever had) and my friends got the artisanal sausage with broccoli and Amatriciana. We couldn't pick a favourite. I never thought healthy food could taste so good! Oh don't forget to try their homemade sourdough too! It's the real deal!!I'm giving 5 stars for the food, vibe, price point, friendly staff and cleanliness!

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Food was ok and owner was rude honestly won't be coming back would rather go somewhere else.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Always skeptical of hyperbolic, overly warm & fuzzy reviews (especially those that refer to staff by name) but thought I'd take a chance anyway. No luck this time. Food was edible yet nothing at all extraordinary. But the service, staff, ambiance (cold, loud, uncomfortable furniture) completely failed. So who is writing all those verbose, glowing reviews? I think I know.....

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: So a nice surprise. Can't remember how I heard about it but the food was great. The owner was around and was a nice personable guy. Will be back!

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Always a fun spot to stop in and grab an interesting hand made drink and fun small plate.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: The staff were super nice especially a new waitress who said she'd only been working there for an hour I think her name was Griselda the atmosphere was fun and they had a string quartet playing French music with a French singer.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Inside was a good amount of seats and a long bar. Rows of bottles on both sides of the wall. Outdoor patio dining as well. Great setting. The owner was friendly and helpful. Happy hour drinks and food every day. Food options were so much more than just bar food. Since there were only two of us, we will come back to try more of their menu. The fried chicken entrée came with three pieces and sides of creamy coleslaw and Mac salad. The chicken was so crunchy on the outside and tender, juicy inside. No wonder theirs won the best-fried chicken in WA in 2020. The dipping sauce that accompanied it added sweetness.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Hand down the best fried chicken in WA!! So lucky to live close by to them now. Definitely be back to try more dishes

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Drinks are amazing and the spicy chicken sandwich is insane. Service was also excellent

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Good people Good food.  Ambiance is great as well. Try the soup. You won't be disappointed.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: My wife and I have been tempted here by Seattle Restaurant Week on different occasions between the two of us. A small restaurant/pub for that amazing Creole food.Try the fried chicken entree, gumbo, and bread pudding dessert meal investment. The fried chicken is very crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Chicken breast is especially juicy.Hush puppies and Brussels sprouts are also great sides.For drinks, we got Dolores and Strawberry Surfer. The drinks were delicious!The server and owner were very nice and the service was fast.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Hands down the best gumbo in town and a rustic chill vibes. Awesome fermented cocktails and a great friendly customer service. Loved it and we will be back with our friends. Thanks Rodel & crew. And best wishes!!!

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Best chicken sandwich! The spicy was perfect! The staff was amazing and made sure we had everything we needed:) Will visit again for sure.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: The food here is always top notch. Definitely not a one hit wonder. The vibe is super easy going and chill. Their craft cocktails are truly craft as they make their own fermented brews. This makes their margaritas impossible to beat. From oysters on the half shell to Fried Chicken or Nachos, there is something here for everyone AND they are totally Dog Friendly!!

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: I'm a huge fan of the burgers, first time here and was very impressed.

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Spicy chicken sandwich was amazing!

name: S/T Hooligans
text_review: Chicken is fantastic! Definitely will be coming back to try other items on the menu. Highly recommend to visit more than once!

name: Mojito
text_review: Don't be fooled by the lies given by the "owners" of this restaurant. Stolen recipes, restaurant, and ownership. This restaurant was not brought up by these guys. I, was a loyal customer with the real owners. I wouldn't trust my credit card information under these crooks. They fail to follow health code procedures. Food isn't stored properly, even watching the video on their site: mojitoseattle.com/Mojito… you see the "sous chef" handled raw meat before touching ready to eat food that will be served to consumers. Unless you want to leave with food poisoning, or salmonella poisoning i recommend staying clear of this restaurant.

name: Mojito
text_review: Food is not very good, and, you won't believe this, I found a bug in my food. They just change the part with bug and that's it.The service is very very slow!!

name: Mojito
text_review: We live only a few blocks from Mojito and SO wanted to like it. Unfortunately our one try at dinner last year was awful.We started with mojitos. Blech. A couple pieces of mint, some sugar water, and crappy rum do not a good mojito make.I don't remember the exact dinner items we ordered but each of our meals came with three or four items. Between the total of six or seven foods, the only edible one between us was the tostones.To top off the bad food and drinks, this place was pricey, annoyingly loud, and offered horrendous service. While we were two of only six diners the staff seemingly forgot about us and we went without water refills or the chance to ask for sauces or anything else that might have improved the meal.Mojito was a terribly disappointing experience and it's doubtful we'll ever give this another try.

name: Mojito
text_review: It's OK but you really should go elsewhere. I echo the other reviewers who question the 4 star status- how???? The food is OK, the service is OK, the drinks are OK- that's it. Did i get sick after eating here- no. Could I have gotten better food for less money elsewhere- yes.

name: Mojito
text_review: I'm sorry to say that I didn't really like this place too much. I wanted to like it, but it was loud and crowded, and the food was dried out and flavorless. I liked the sides, but the pollo I had was pretty much baked beyond recognition.

name: Mojito
text_review: I think I came at a bad time. The yucca fries were pretty good. My Cuban was ok. Too much mayo and my cheese wasn't even melted. Pork was dry and a little blend. I'll try it again in a few months to see

name: Mojito
text_review: The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.

name: Mojito
text_review: The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.

name: Mojito
text_review: The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.

name: Mojito
text_review: The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.

name: Mojito
text_review: Food was ok but the service rocked

name: Mojito
text_review: Mojito I wanted to give you 5 stars. I like to support small local businesses, but I think you could benefit from a few improvements!Pros:-Owner is very nice and friendly-Vaca Frita had the best flavor and was well balanced-Colorful decorCons:-The dining area was cold and drafty -The music was a bit loud for lunch-The menus could use a wipe down (the cleaner everything in the dining room the cleaner the kitchen should be)We had the:-Mojito Platter: yucca frita, tostones, and maduros (needed more seasoning)I liked the maduros the best because they naturally have more flavor. -Vaca Frita: best dish for balanced flavors-Lechon Asado: bland and sides did not seem fresh or hot from the kitchen-Cuban Sandwich: great! would get againRecommendations to future diners: ask for the sauces on the side if you do not like raw garlic (it is super healthy for you, but has a strong taste)Mojito I will try you again!

name: Mojito
text_review: I like it, its nice small, but the food does take a bit too long. IF I didn't have to wait so long it would be a 5 star for sure.

name: Mojito
text_review: Looking for some delicious Cuban/Latin American food with a cute and lively atmosphere? Look no further. This place has a friendly staff, amazing food and yummy cocktails. Not a huge space - don't recommend rolling in with a large party.

name: Mojito
text_review: Pretty good food. They have black beans which is a plus!!!

name: Mojito
text_review: Under the radar, underrated spot. recommended.

name: Mojito
text_review: we love it here we come once a week and they know exactly what we want its such a nice place

name: Mojito
text_review: Mojito serves some of the most authentic Caribbean food in the city! Excellent food and friendly service. Beautiful restaurant, multiple great dishes to order. Not a genre I run with often, but damn it was good! The owner or waiter/chef was super nice and inviting.

name: Mojito
text_review: Great little place. Food was amazing fresh and delicious. Service was also great. Will be back!!

name: Mojito
text_review: I used to lived in Venezuela for a couple years and wanted to try out some of my favorite Venezuelan food here. They had a great arepa and awesome parchita(passion fruit)!! The restaurant is a very cool atmosphere too!

name: Mojito
text_review: Came here to try something new and i was impressed! The food was delicious, i got the ceviche and a mojito drink and the mojito drink was really good!Overall i think we found our new "go to" place.We will be back to try some more.

name: Mojito
text_review: The food was on the pricey side for the amount they offer. But it tasted good, and it is close to where I live I would go again once in a while.

name: Mojito
text_review: love this place

name: Mojito
text_review: as long as I have lived in the Lake City area I have always drove right by Mojito. not knowing what I was missing. The food is crazy good...so much flavor. I was not disappointed in any of our choices. and of course great drinks! the Mojito being THE BEST! If you are in the area or if you are not...Mojito is a MUST!!

name: Mojito
text_review: Very tasty! I would definately go back. Only downside...place is very small.

name: Mojito
text_review: The lunch menu here is better than the dinner menu, but what really stands out is the service. They were all super friendly, made us feel like part of the gang. The lunch sandwiches are excellent and the plantains are great any time.

name: Mojito
text_review: Hooray! I was finally able to try Mojito! I've had this place bookmarked for months and at long last I was able to sit down and savor the flavor of the Caribbean! I was surprised how small it was! I mean, they have over 400 (mostly rave) reviews and maybe nine tables! That means that they have a steady stream of hip and satisfied customers. I had the roasted pollo (that's Spanish for "chicken"). I have to say that while I found it very flavorful, it was a little dry. Good thing they had so many really tasty things to pair it with. The first bite of their black beans and a little carnival started inside my mouth. The flavor was so deep and complex! I also liked the rice. Nice and simple. And I can never find anything wrong with fried things. I was afraid of the yucca, but like I say, fry it and I'll like it! I especially enjoyed the fried plantains! The creamy sauce with which they top it is out of this world!One more word on the service: Great!

name: Mojito
text_review: Went with a group of 6 on a Friday, pretty early so no wait, delicious drinks (lots of lime) and delicious food, even got the chance to play the drums! (Poorly) would highly recommend

name: Mojito
text_review: I've never had such a heartwarming experience. The food was absolutely delicious and I'll never forget the amazing and personal service. Such a cute place. 10000000 Stars!!!

name: Mojito
text_review: Very very good!! Super impressive. I'd go again. If you are in Seattle make it a point to stop by

name: Mojito
text_review: We are so glad we have chosen Mojito for a farewell lunch! The server was very nice, friendly, and funny. He gave us appetizers and added meat on our salad on the house because our colleague is returning to her home country. I am not writing a good review because of the food on the house; it made this special occasion even more special. And, the food was delicious! We had Mojito Platter, Arepa, Ensalad Palmito with steak, Veca Frita, Pescado Mojito, and Pescado en Guiso. The steak had wonderful citrus flavor. The meat in arepa was also very flavorful, and the "bread" part was so good. I particularly liked Pescado Mojito--white wine and cinnamon may sound unusual, but you just have to try it. The desserts (on the house, too!) weren't overly sweet, which was nice. Thank you, Server, for making our last lunch together unforgettable.

name: Mojito
text_review: Great spot for all the delicious food and alcohol you could hope for, special shout out to Victor!

name: Mojito
text_review: Many people recommended this place to me, and oh boy were they right! The service was great, the food was fantastic, the music was great, the paintjob was great. The owner came in and was very friendly and sociable. Will be coming back as much as possible.

name: Mojito
text_review: Mojito catered my son's 1st birthday party for ~20 people and it was AMAZING! It was a last minute request (less than 48 hours) and Luam made it so easy - he threw together an amazing spread of salad, empanadas, plantains, rice and beans, and two platters of shredded beef and roasted pork - sooo delicious! Everyone kept asking where the food was from and helped themselves to seconds (and thirds)! We live in the neighborhood and Mojito has been a trusty staple of ours, and we will definitely be using Mojito for more parties in the future! Thank you, Luam!!

name: Mojito
text_review: Get the Hotter than hell! Then do it again! Rinse with whiskey as needed! Repeat until full!

name: Mojito
text_review: Absolute fire food. Great and friendly service that went above and beyond. Owner made the experience great. Serving sizes are great for the price

name: Mojito
text_review: The food was good, and great cervez

name: Mojito
text_review: At least once a month for Takeout Thursday, we head to Luam's Mojitos. The food is delicious, even for a "take away", and the personal attention from Luam, Victor and the rest of the staff makes us feel like we're part of the family. Actually, I think we are!

name: Mojito
text_review: I love you guys the food and the service was great will definitely recommend this restaurant

name: Mojito
text_review: We love the food here and the owners are so sweet. The food is always super tasty and never disappoints.

name: Mojito
text_review: I ordered Mojito for myself and my coworkers, and it was a HUGE hit!! A variety of items were enjoyed by all of us, from the Cuban Sandwich to the Sautéed Eggplant to the Vaca Frita. We ordered vegetarian and meat dishes/sandwiches, and all were wonderful. Victor and the chef (I am sorry I didn't catch his name!) were timely and accommodating for the large order - they wrote what was in each box and had everything nicely organized upon pick up.We will definitely eat here again!Thank you Mojito!!

name: Mojito
text_review: The Foods are very wonderful, the way they cooked is just right. I'm going to order you to share it with my friends again. It is highly recommended!

name: Mojito
text_review: Had dinner for the first time last night at mojito. The owner, who is easy to spot from his outgoing and affable personality, was one of the many highlights of this restaurant. - the food 10/10- the mojito was delicious- the restaurant itself was a really cool set up with a nice patio, which I can't wait to go back and sit down at.Great spot.

name: Mojito
text_review: The food is always amazing, and the drinks are really great. Service is outstanding, there super friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back!

name: Mojito
text_review: Amazing food and drinks!! Love the atmosphere too. The owner and staff are so friendly - great service! This place is a must try! We will be back every time we visit Seattle

name: Mojito
text_review: great food great service and very legit. Bravo

name: Mojito
text_review: Best Cuban sandwich in Seattle. Mojito. I highly recommend. Food was delicious nice and hot. It reminded me about back home.

name: Mojito
text_review: Hands.Down.The.Best.It.Can.Get. I'm not sure what else to write here. Luam, the owner, is a hoot, and so welcoming to everyone that walks into his restaurant. I hear they also cater all the visiting Mariners teams, thats some high praise if I've ever heard anything.

name: Mojito
text_review: This place is great I got a bottle of rum and destroyed it and then it destroyed me is so tasty

name: Mojito
text_review: Luam is an amazing chef and host! The food here is unique to most flavors in our city, and they serve delicious Mojitos! The layout is quaint and cozy, but everyone that comes is friendly and just happy to get the best Latin food in the city!

name: Mojito
text_review: Both dishes we tried were excellent. Wait staff was attentive and friendly. Would definitely go back

name: Mojito
text_review: I loved this place. The entire experience was wonderful from the Food, to the service to the great prices. Do yourself a favor and visit them right away!

name: Mojito
text_review: Great Food, Great People! Love The Vaca Frita & Mojitos.

name: Mojito
text_review: Great restaurant, great food and drinks! Glad it is close to where I live. I keep coming back and back and am never disappointed.

name: Mojito
text_review: Mojito is one of our favorite places to dine for lunch or dinner. The owner is a wonderful guy who is super friendly and does everything he can to make sure you are enjoying your time. The food is OUTSTANDING. The flavors jump off your tongue! Their salad with avocados, onions and tomatoes with a mango dressing is superb. The mojitos are obviously delicious-half a lime in each with tiny crushed ice. So if you're looking for a cute little neighborhood restaurant with healthy, fresh, and flavorful food check out Mojitos! And try and save room for the Tres Leches!

name: Mojito
text_review: This is by far the best restaurant in all of Seattle. Everything about this place is delicious and authentic. It is a little small for the winter, but in the summer it would be the best date spot. It is not overrated like Paseos. It is GREAT food at great prices. Also they have a good happy hour.

name: Mojito
text_review: This place is great. It's our first time here and we will certainly be back. Great drinks, amazing flavorful food, and fun atmosphere.

name: Mojito
text_review: Love this place! The owner is very hands on and makes sure you're experience is amazing. He is very proud of his food and his passion for what he does is evident in the meal you will get here!!!

name: Mojito
text_review: My first time I had Cuban food. I was not too sure when I got there since the place is very small. I ordered a Caribbean salad and a pescado of the day. They food was delicious. I am definitely going back there.

name: Mojito
text_review: Literally the best place on earth.

name: Mojito
text_review: Who doesn't love Caribbean food on a cold and rainy day? The food is always fresh, light, and relatively healthy, the environment is always welcoming and cozy, and you'll always leave wanting more.

name: Mojito
text_review: love this place, the food is great, and the staff and owner are great too!

name: Mojito
text_review: Great place, great service, great food, great drinks. Great.

name: Mojito
text_review: Amazing food and friendly workers :-) The prices are really reasonable and it's so delicious.

name: Mojito
text_review: Food: amazingStaff: amazingOwners: amazingDrinks: amazingThis place is fricken amazing

name: Mojito
text_review: A friend and I went into this little place that has all of 8 tables in it. I had passed by it many times. But we were told we should try it and OH MY! We were greeted and seated right away. Our server was very nice and took the time to explain what some of the menu items were. We had a shredded beef that was so mouth watering delicous! we squeezed lime on it and it came with a rice adn black bean mixture adn plaintains that were simply incredible. 2 thumbs up on this one!

name: Mojito
text_review: Still the best Cuban cuisine and service in town.

name: Mojito
text_review: Very good food.

name: Mojito
text_review: Went here with a couple buddies, the food was amazing. AUTHENTIC tostones! later into the night they bumped up the music and it turned into an awesome dance party. A little crowded though.

name: Mojito
text_review: WOW- So glad we just found this little diamond in the rough. I have driven by this place tons of times and never had the chance to stop until the other day. SOOOOO Glad we did. The food here is craveable and such a nice change from the standard fare in Seattle. If you are looking for authentic Cuban food you need to make the trip to mojitos. We had the Caribbean Salad, Cuban Sandwich and another pork dish. The caipirinha's were pretty delicious as well and the have crushed ice :)

name: Mojito
text_review: ONE WORD! Delicious.

name: Mojito
text_review: Always treated like a queen when I go here, also love the food!

name: Mojito
text_review: Wonderful little place with great food! If you make it later in the night, you might get to play some bongo drums! Food is outstanding, and service is next to none. Love it!

name: Mojito
text_review: Daaaaay-ummmmmmm! This place is the shit! I don't know if it's authentic, all I knows and cares about is that it's slammin' good! I've had the Bistec A Caballo and the Vaca Frita so far and they do make a mean mojito. It is a small little weirdly shaped place, but that's part of it's charm in my opinion.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I used to love this place but I was utterly disappointed by the food I received today. I returned to this place after a few years with high hopes but I couldn't even finish the food after a few bites. It was way too doughy and the sauce was tasteless. It's as if the ownership changed. It did not taste anything like I remembered.It's sad to see such a great restaurant has gone down but I will no longer return to this place.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Tried to go here order noodles, they are out of noodles. What? You have noodles in the name. Ordering machine is confusing. Only selection is no no noodles?

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Staff there are really rude. They don't let us sit in empty seats, even there is not busy at all.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Not happy with this place. After reading all the hype about it decided to try and didn't have a good experience. The cashier that took my order went to vegetable station to add my side order of mushrooms and used his bare hands to put it in the bowl and take it to the kitchen. I couldn't believe it. If they are so unsanitary in front of customers I can only imagine what's going on in that kitchen. My order was steamed chicken with noodles. Mushy noodles with bone in chicken not tasty. Won't be back!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: The floor is dirty and the entire place is like a mess. Food there is so so. One more thing is I got alimentary infection after I had the cold noodles there.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: People, please read the owner's responses. She is so rude to her customers. Instead of taking feedback and taking the proper response, she completely humiliates her own customers. This speaks volumes about how she runs her business. Buyer beware!Anyways, my review (I can't wait for her response): I'm from Brazil on vacation. After this experience, I had to create a Yelp account today. I decided to try various places yesterday. I'm a great fan of Chinese food. I was visiting a friend at UW and I decided to try this restaurant due to the Yelp reviews. Worst.Mistake.Ever. Do not eat here. The cashier is rude and the "servers" are even ruder. I agree with others: the food is too salty. When I ordered the Tingly Beef, it smelled...like smelled rotten. I think that's why they salt it so much - to hide the fact it's rotten. I had one bite and I spit it out. I think I know why they call it "Tingly beef"...it makes your stomach tingly with pain. Terrible....so terrible!!! I truly don't understand how they have so many 5 star reviews. "They must be fake" - I put this in quotes because the owner always thinks any negative reviews are fake. Anyways, enjoy at your own risk!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: No good. too greasy. Salty. Resturant not clean

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: OMG We found a SPIDER and the waiter KILLED it in front of usPlease shut it down when you have a clean restaurant!!!!BAD SERVICE: waiter dropped the spoon and kept asking whether we were done or not REALLY HOT IN THERE because of open kitchen and poor fan

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: super melting:The inside temperature is at least 10 degree higher than the outside. they do have fans but the kitchen is open so the fans are not working well. I don't understand why the government would let this restaurant open given such a bad design. awful service: everyone is busy and we have to order first. The waitress does not have the time to care about you.Please raise your bar on taste. If you have tried Xi'an authentic noodles, there is no way that this could be compared. I normally would not do Yelp BUT this restaurant is very disappointing. Please think before go!!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: The owner harassed meThe Biang Biang noodle was too bad compared with what I have in China.The burger was ok but not authentic taste.Don't recommend based on my appetite on Xi'an foodI got a message from the owner privately on my comment. Your noodles need improvement you need to face the problem not begging for good comment or warning the customers The owner said she would report my comment to Yelp no matter what u do. You and your restaurant suck

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Quality has gone down in the past year. Not sure if the owner changed or due to something else.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Ordered a take out and not really impressed by the food. The spicy oil dumpling is sub-par. The filling is bland and the gravy/ soup is very salty. The spicy lamb cumin noodles is less than average. Shredded lamb makes their presence very insignificant and the meat has near to zero fragrance and taste. The noodles and sauce is of average and has zero spicy taste. Overall, a pretty disappointed meal.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: The food was good. You have line up at the counter to place your order, like other fast food restaurant.They bring the food to the table. They put 18% tip over my bill.I think they should let me know before hand.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I recommend that you order a hot tea and a vegetable side dish when you come here. The food is delicious, but it is very oily and spicy, and having tea would help wash it down and balance out the flavors more.Parking is not too bad since it's pretty up north from the campus. The service was okay.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Dumplings aren't spicy enough :(((, but I guess I'll try again! Light up the heat on those dumplings!!!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Just ok, well kind of good. We went here during a Seattle Washington rainstorm, my friend said it was a good spot. I like noodles and like to try different noodle joints when I am traveling so I went to Xi'an Noodles. Got the Pho vegetarian broth and they put the carrots, sprouts, cucumbers, jalapenos and cilantro on the side and also onions. The tastes of this Xi's different options for Asian foods, wow!!! love it, go here :). The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I was nervous walking to the restaurant, there were a few suspect characters hanging out outside

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I love their noodle dishes. They do traditional thai food pretty well too.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: It was tasty, though a little different from what I was expecting. Decent prices. Good experience.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I'm extremely excited about the customized noodle bowls! I can eat noodle soup for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, and this place is right up there on my list, along with Noodle.They have a wide array of options. I ordered Tom Yum base soup, enoki mushrooms, vermicelli, been sprouts, and wontons. My husband ordered spicy soup base and it really is spicy! Will be back!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: And I'm back again. This is probably my 4th time visiting this restaurant since it opened. I love the food so much. If you're looking for a great Chinese food with endless noodles, this is the place. There's an option to make your own noodle soup. Otherwise, you can choose from there Myriad of dishes. my favorite is the tingly beef and sauce as well as soup. Also if you need to add some veggies to your diet or are vegetarian, definitely get the garlic cucumber salad.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Great hole-in-the-wall noodle place. The hand-ripped noodles were so good, and the soup was flavorful and the perfect level of spiciness. Wish I could have gone back a second time.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: The noodles are no joke. The hamburger was okay but treat yourself to the noodles. Second to none

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I am very skeptical of Chinese cuisine, but this place fit the bill. My sister recently moved to Seattle and recommended this place. I was impressed by the authentic dishes. So nostalgic and delicious. I recommend this place!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Xi'an's pulled noodles are a true culinary delight, offering a unique and flavorful experience. The skillful artistry of noodle pulling is evident in the perfect texture and thickness of each strand. The diverse range of dishes showcases a harmonious blend of spices and ingredients, transporting diners to the heart of Xi'an's culinary traditions. The casual yet inviting ambiance adds to the authenticity, creating a welcoming space for noodle enthusiasts. Xi'an's pulled noodles stand out as a must-try for those seeking an exceptional taste of traditional Chinese cuisine with a focus on the artistry of hand-pulled noodles.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Noodles are great. Can't complain.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Best noodles I've ever had and they're my favorite food. Will always go back whenever I'm in Seattle

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Got some take-out from here a few weeks ago. Everything was great! Some delicious noodle dishes.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Best western Chinese food in Seattle. My friend and I had the lamb noodles and shrimp/pork dumplings. We loved how thick the dumpling skins were and how long the noodles were, had to pull them apart to be more edible in a bite and had a good laugh.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Delicious. Absolutely awesome. Try it

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: This place is amazing. Everything on the menu is five stars!! Can't wait to be back. Both locations are delicious.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I ate in this restaurant very often. They have interesting menu. And my favorite noodles that I had ever ate. Differently I and my friends recommend. We will come back soon. Thank you for the care about yours customers.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: One of my favorite places and one of my favorite dishes! I would definitely recommend the noodles yum!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Ugh, this place is so good. Literally so good at making noodles. The must-get is definitely the spicy cumin lamb noodles, Xi'an makes them so well, but honestly, any of their noodles are worth getting.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: LOVE this place. Can't wait for them to open back up!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Enough has been said about this place. One of my two favorite places for a delicious and quick meal.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I loved their noodles. The food was served very fast which was also very nice.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: This restaurant has good food. The waiters are kind and let us sit at a reserved table. Also the food comes quickly.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Hidden gem for some of the best Xi'an food in Seattle. The spice level is great and noodles are freshly made. Beef shank salad is great!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: The cumin lamb hand ripped noodles are my go-to comfort food! Nice portion sizes, quick service and typically no waiting time.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: This place makes me feel like I am home. The noodles are the best around. I come here often as it is close to my work. Absolutely love this place. And remember to get the sauces as they make the meal.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Small place, noodles are not cheap but great taste!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I eat too many Xi'an food. This is the best food, the best price.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I can't get enough of this place. So yummy. Go for the tingly pork, it's delicious. Go here.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Good food, good service i will come often

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Perfect little hidden gem on the hill. I'm never really sure what I'm getting because I don't know this type of cuisine that well but everything I've gotten has had amazing flavor and they're good portion sizes. It's usually pretty Busy during nights but right when they open it's not

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I very much like. Xian noodle however some Chinese people find it unreasonable to disregard their own food

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Very delicious!!and the service is good！！

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Food is fire. Prices are cheap. Yum.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Excellent hand pulled noodles. Not very spicy. Pretty much everything is excellent. Worth the trip.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: I love the condiment bar!! Can't wait to come back again and again to work my way through the menu!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: If you are in the U district you have to visit here! So good and I can't wait to go back! The tofu was amazing!

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: This falls under the "hole in the wall" label and I'm glad it does. The food is phenomenal for lack of better terms. From the hand pulled noodles to the broth, the flavor and spice blend is just right. The texture of the noodles is firm and stays firm throughout the meal instead of loosing it's hold and disintegrating into the broth. The broth has a very bold flavor profile and yet not too oilly as you would expect with Chinese cooking. I've personally always gone for the noodles with soup but either choice never fails. Xi'an noodles are hard to explain, it's a perfect soup dish when you want noodles but you're not feeling pho or ramen.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: It's great! Worth of coming and sharing with foodies.

name: Xi'an Noodles
text_review: Love this place so much. Food is authentic and delicious. I feel like I'm back in China.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Overly priced mediocre Italian food. They didn't have garlic bread but a loaf with quality similar to Safeway with a homemade pesto butter that barely had any flavor. I ordered the penny vodka and I honestly could've made better. The staff however was kind. But really, with how expensive the plates were, I expected alot better.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Came here on a Friday evening at 5:30PM with Pomodoro being empty. The ambience is quite nice if you don't mind the soapy smell alongside the head beams from vehicles exiting the lot outside hitting you if you're sitting by the window. The waiter was unable to strongly recommend anything, and no one approached me throughout dinner to ask how was the food.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: I really dig this place. I met up with a friend on Monday here and it's super cute. Easy to find and there's ample parking in the back (even though it's street parking / something I despise)! I ordered a mocha and it was awesome, one of the better ones I've had in awhile. I also got a almond poppyseed muffin, the girl behind the counter told me she had just put them in the case, so they were fresh. I wasn't a fan of the muffin, it was really dense. That being said, I am still interested in trying some of the other pastries they have and trying other drinks. Weirdly, after I parked my car and started walking to the Cafe, I swear I saw my dads car....and then I realized MY DAD WORKS NEXT DOOR. I felt like a shitty daughter. Maybe I can redeem myself for stopping in to see him from time to time before my stops in and out of Cafe?

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Waiters are so nice, and the environment is also attracting. But the waiter will hurry you for the bill. It's bad :(

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Found this place while looking for a late night meal! Can't believe I've missed it this long! Warm, welcoming atmosphere, great staff, outstanding food and wine selection! I really enjoyed myself here. Thanks and I'll be back soon!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Excellent dishes! The Linguine Alla Carbonara Con Pancetta was really delicious and very tasty. The noodle was great and the sauce has a balanced taste. I was delighted with their food. The portion was great and well-prepared food. The restaurant was big and amazing interior with great ambiance! Reasonable price and so worth it.However, the service was not good for me. My food served late.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Tasty Tiramisu. It was fresh (not frozen and reheated) like some restaurants. The cream was light on the tongue, and just perfect on the coffee dust.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: The owner and chef will come to your table and explain menu items. Small intimate bar. Nice conversation place at this Spanish restaurant.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: When you get inside, you can smell the goodness of their dishes. And their foods were good. Even though the waiting was not too quick but it's all worth it.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Came here with my girlfriend for our anniversary dinner. The space was great and the setting was upscale and classy. The bartenders, servers, and hostesses were all very friendly and professional. We ordered the paella and seafood experience, which were both delicious. We each had two drinks, I had champagne and she had Grey Goose martinis, and our total bill after tip was about $80. awe had a great time.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Great local place that's been around for years, my fall back place which never disappoints. Consistently excellent pasta and salads.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: I lack the words to describe the quality of food here more aptly satisfied grunts may do the trick. The food is the best Italian I've had in Seattle, the ambiance is intimate and friendly, and the complex foods being cooked only a few feet is the real reason to tell everyone you know, regardless of what you order the garlic and olive oil scented delicacies will be dancing with you all evening long.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: AMAZING! such wonderful food and staff. Everything was so flavorful and perfect. 10/10 would recommend

name: Pomodoro
text_review: We had great food and great service. Everything from appetizers, to dinner, to dessert was great!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Pomodoro has superb desserts, can't wait to come back!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Incredible food with great staff! Whenever I'm with a group, we order family style to try all of the dishes and I haven't had a dish I didn't like. Definitely a favorite!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Deserts here are fabulous! Very delicious, and I would definitely recommend stopping by!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Some of the most delicious desserts in all of seattle!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: First of all I wanted to thank the owner of the restaurant. He created something incredible. I came here with my wife and daughter. The waitress came to us, she advised us the best dishes for her taste. she was nice and friendly. Our order included Gnocchi con Salsiccia e Fungni, seapod paella, Caesar salad. the sun was incredibly tasty, all the products were fresh. We also liked the amosphere. thanks for a perfect evening Pomodoro!!!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Lovely Italian restaurant at Eastlake. The owner served us himself, and he is very nice and funny. He wanted us to tryout his special hot sauce and it was great! He also gave us a piece of tiramisu because it was my friend's birthday. Delicious.Most of their pastas are great, and I love the ambiance within. It is a place that I will be going back 100%.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Very good food. Big portions  Excellent service. Small restaurant, personal service. I will be back again.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Excellent menu and very attentive staff. Don't be afraid to try something you never had before

name: Pomodoro
text_review: We had a blast here for my girlfriend's birthday.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Amazing meal. All the sauces and almost everything is made from scratch and the freshness of the ingredients used was very apparent.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Amazing meal. All the sauces and almost everything is made from scratch and the freshness of the ingredients used was very apparent.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: SO GOOD. Just go... GO! I would say it's more $$$ than $$. About $20/entree. With that in mind... GO!!!!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Excellent dinner, excellent ambience, a lot of attention to detail. Delightful!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Wonderful meal and very friendly staff. Really loved the Fettuccine Alfredo! By the looks of those around me, everyone enjoyed their meal. Say hello to the owner, he loves Seattle and has a great story to tell.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: I LOVE this place! Excellent food, excellent service. One of my favorite restaurants.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: My kind of place. The food was great. It is the people that make the experience. These people are wonderful. We will be back!!!!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: I have been to this place twice since I moved to Eastlake and both times were simply excellent. The Lemon Drop I ordered before my meal was made to perfection with fresh squeezed lemon; and I consider myself something of a Lemon Drop connoisseure :)  Most recently, I ordered the Gnocchi con Salsiccia e Funghi with portobello mushrooms added. The Gnocchi was perfectly cooked, which as some of you may know is difficult to do, and the dish was absolutely delightful, a masterpiece of complementary flavors and textures.The first time I came, the restaurant was close to empty and the atmosphere was relaxed and pleasant. The courses were spaced out and my friend and I had time to enjoy our conversation and take in the overall experience. The next time, my boyfriend and and I came for New Years Eve and although it was packed and hectic, the staff did an excellent job paying attention to the costumers and balancing the aesthetic of slow-paced European style dining with the fast-paced demands of the New Years crowd. And boy were some people demanding :) The table next to us seemed quite rushed and rude, even when they were brought a Tiramisu for the woman's birthday. Hey, I had to pay for mine! Not that I minded; I would have gladly pay double for that fluffy morsel. Alas, such is the nature of a busy restaurant. Overall, I could not be more pleased by the experiences this restaurant has afforded me and I will certainly be back very soon. Buono Appetito!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Great food! Outstanding service. Highly recommend.

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Amazing!

name: Pomodoro
text_review: Great spot! Totally un-assuming. Food and service have always been great.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: they don't answer their phones and apparently they don't do open sitting but no where on their website or on their phone's automated message does it say that, so... feels racially motivated so i'll never be back

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: This place is a JOKE. Let me warn you they FORCE you to pay a 20% tip. The food is nothing to be proud of. It's a short menu with plates you cant share. Your rude waiter will tell you that you can share them lol. Stay away. Typical Seattle food trying to be better that what it is. And the people in there are f9cking loud and drunk and old.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Overrated! The decor and ambience is nice, but food is bland and uninspired.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Average place compared to others nearby. People are not super friendly (they are not rude either, service is ok), I tried steak tartar, which was ok. Feel free to go, other items might be better in the menu, but I probably won't go back, too expensive for average food & service.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Meh. Boring, kind of pretentious. Nothing new here.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Went to this restaurant for a second time and disappointed for a second time. First time had to wait about 40 minutes even though I had reservations for my anniversary dinner (made me feel a fool). This time was terrible for different reasons - many of them...First, got seated next to their huge booth, which somehow echoes and amplifies all the noise coming from it. Multiply that by wine-drunk women sitting there.Second, the food was no good. Got bread and the olive oil/vinegar dish. The bread we got was soo tiny that it was a joke. My date commented that they must have accidentally put a crouton instead. Asked for a larger bread and got it. I get that this is artisan-type bread. Their oil-vinegar presentation was terrible. They used some little deep dish that had vinegar on the bottom with a deep layer of oil on top. Problem is that there is no way to get both on the bread, so basically we were sopping up oil with the croutons.Their salumi plate was even bad - served on a gross cracked and discolored cutting board that should be tossed in the trash. Don't know why but the eats all seemed like they were dipped in oil.The ravioli fell apart. The two sides didn't stick together.Epic fail.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: meh. i'd heard the hype for about a year, prior to visiting HTCAW, and couldnt have been more excited to finally have the planets align, for a first date there! upon entry, the host was friendly and welcoming, however, the music was not. paula abdul, turned up to "make your parents angry" levels made the 30 minute wait nearly unbearable. i had to ask the host to lower the volume, which he reluctantly did, but only by an undetectable amount. next we were treated to "miami sound machine", and i started to think that perhaps it was a cocaine theme restaurant. i'd never heard of such a thing, but i'm adventurous, and usually willing to try anything once. ;)when we sat down, it took exactly 17 minutes for a server to take our drink order. i asked for a rootbeer-tini, half salted, half sugared rim. well, the bartender salted the entire rim, and i barely detected any gin. the taste of rootbeer schnapps was overwhelming, and sweet. far too sweet. when our waiter finally decided to stop playing angrybirds on his ipad, and come take our order, i specifically asked "how DO you cook a wolf?" he had no answer for me. additionally, there was no wolf to be found on the menu. apparently they'd sold out of the slow-cooked wolf shoulder by 8pm?? plan ahead, people! i opted for the chicken fried steak, with eggs three ways. it was cooked perfectly, i must admit. however, the side order of rutabaga chipotle dumplings was cold and uninspiring. dessert was the shining star of this meal. my date and i shared a molten chocolate bread pudding with whiskey sauce and vanilla ice cream. i told the waiter it was my date's birthday, (it wasnt!) and he gladly added a candle and got a few members of the wait staff to come out and sing happy birthday. if it wasnt so drafty, i'd give it another star. bring a sweater, and maybe eat before you come.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Food was weird and not memorable at all.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: The atmosphere is great. Warm, local neighborhood eatery. Very noisy though. All the food was good, but nothing really stood out as being exceptional. All in for a total of $120 including tip (for 2) it really fails to make the grade as a restaurant I would repeat visit.Tilth and Crush are still my standouts for high end dining in Seattle.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: We went here for a date night recently. The ambiance is inviting, and the service was attentive, but the food fell short of expectations. The Ahi tuna pasta, while inventive, was a bit of a miss for me. The concept of tuna in a red sauce pasta sounded intriguing, but the flavors didn't quite harmonize. It felt more like an experiment than a cohesive dish.Overall, it's a decent spot for the atmosphere, but the food could use some improvement.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Burrata was deliciousSpaghetti Nero was ok but overspiced.Service was mehAmbiance- lack of decor

name: How To Cook a Wolf

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: I wish we had had the great experiences people on this site describe. The service was okay, but not great. There was not wait as we went early on a week night.I hear that the menu changes a lot, and it must have been a good day for us as the food was great, but it was pretty expensive given the economic conditions.It's like Italian tapas, so we did as suggested by the server, and ordered six dishes for four people: Olives, panini, sea scallops, baked polenta, angolotti and spaghetti with wild boar bolognese. And wine. It cost $300.The portions are pretty sparse for the prices. I think $14 for four little scallops is exorbitant. They were good, but not worth the price. Ditto on the panini (it's a GRILLED SANDWICH) or the polenta, which were $9 and $13, respectively. I loved the spaghetti, though, and there was actually enough for all of us. For me, it's really a value thing. I'm still searching for that elusive Seattle restaurant that has top-notch food for reasonable prices.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: I know many people love it, but I cannot get over how the place looks and the food even though good does not make up for it.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: How to Cook a Wolf in Queen Ann Seattle is an absolute gem featuring Italian small plates and a robust cocktail & wine menu. The cuisine is rustic, bursting with flavor and texture. Each item was unique but was part of a larger culinary journey.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Had a wonderful dining experience here in How To Cook A Wolf.My family had dinner here because we were intrigue of its name, it sounds interesting. The ambiance is great. I'm impressed with the interior design. It made the place comfortable. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The food here is as interesting as the resto's name! We had their Sea Wolf Sourdough, fresh and tasty. Gnocchi is exquisite. Beets Salad is delectable. Plum Cake is simply delicious. We're going back here.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: glad to see wolf wasn't on the menu. Food and service was good.

name: How To Cook a Wolf

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: We came down from BC on a family getaway and were really excited to try this place! The service & atmosphere didn't disappoint. They were still vibrantly busy at 9pm mid-week, and our server had great knowledge about the menu items & their preparation. Their service was warm & welcoming, and the bathrooms were spotless. The only reason I didn't give them 5/5 was because I was actually quite disappointed with the menu - it was tiny, consisting primarily of small plates & pasta. In addition, they were out of one of the pastas, so it was even more limited. The Bucatini pasta, while tasty, had so little sauce that it was barely discernible. All in all we will be back next time, but maybe just for late drinks & a small snack.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: The decor in this place is great, and the atmosphere is very upscale, oh and the food tastes great. My favorites are the scallop crudo and the baby octopus, they had a perfect texture and a smokey flavor. As for a main course just go for the pasta, or whatever else sounds good on their menu because the menu is not very big; but everything on it has a big flavor. The only downside is that it can get very busy and when it gets busy it gets extremely loud, like you will have to shout at your boyfriend in his ear to be heard loud.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: very good place , just loved it.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: The good was great. I liked how our server explained all of our dishes to us and gave us time to slowly enjoy our meal here. Would definitely come back soon.

name: How To Cook a Wolf

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: I really enjoyed the 5 times I've been here. Always a little bit of a shock to my wallet, but well worth it. Quality of the food is superior, and the service was excellent. I would not consider this a family environment as they only have 2 tables that fit 4 people.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Good food and service.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: I went here on a first date and it was an overall good experience. The place is tiny, but the atmosphere is still good. We sat at the bar and got great, friendly service all night. The menu was a little intimidating. Even though I consider myself pretty experienced in the kitchen, I didn't recognize half the things on there! They don't have a huge selection either, which was actually a breath of fresh air from the usual novels you see at chain restaurants. You know they must change their menu often and the things on there must be chef favorites. Their servers were really great about answering our questions and giving us suggestions, too.Like some other posters have said, the portions are small and the prices are a little high, but I think the experience outweighs that. I suggest getting some wine (recommendations from the bartender are always helpful), a couple appetizers and a couple entrees and just sharing everything. You might not leave stuffed, but I think you will leave satisfied. My favorite thing from the night was the honey potato gnocchi. Cooked perfectly with just the right amount of sweetness! I do not recommend the chocolate gelato, however. Maybe venture elsewhere for dessert :)

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: I liked it. I would go again.

name: How To Cook a Wolf

I would recommend their fresh purciato and somethings with yellowtail, going well with wine.I and my wife love their food so much. thanks for perfect meal. I'll be back soon
