name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: This place is a gem! It is small, so plan ahead and make a reservation.  We were greeted with complimentary Prosecco and our server Robert was delightful and attentive.  There is a short list of handmade pastas that are pure artistry.  The chef went off menu for me and pulled together a beautiful vegetarian gnocchi with butternut squash and pepperocini. Can't wait to go back!

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Tapas were amazing! Each & every one. Can't wait to go back & try out more of the menu. Also loved the space.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: My new favorite restaurant - everything is amazing!

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Such a terrific restaurant and a great eating experience every time. One of Ethan Stowell's best. Great food cooked with fresh ingredients creatively used. Great food for vegetarians as well. The service, detailed but not intrusive. Thanks :-)

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Perfection! My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at this beautiful spot on Monday and I honestly am so bummed that I haven't been here sooner! As soon as we arrived through the front door we were greeted with an amazing energy from the staff. So many hellos and smiles to accompany the grace this restaurant has, was just the beginning of our experience. Our hostess was the epitome of perfect! Her eye contact and welcoming demeanor was such a breath of fresh air. She took the time to say congratulations for our celebration that evening, offered us a better suited table of we wanted, and explained everything to which we could understand. Thank You! As i sat across from the small intimate table from my husband, I observed every patron thoroughly enjoying their experience. Laughter could be heard, clinking of glasses echoed off the walls and the sunlight bouncing off the decor, was a picture perfect beginning to our night. Our waiter was fantastic! He really took his time with us! He explained the options we chose to start our night out with, and provided us with champagne that was pre ordered for our celebration. His authenticity and fabulous aura, was such a nice welcoming feeling. Now, the preparations of the menu items.... I swear, I have never tasted anything to heavenly in my entire life, minus my husband's home cooked meals (since he is the executive chef at Grappa and brother to the owner) every ounce of thought placed within the flavors were matched to Perfection! Every last bite I had was a mouthwatering as the first.. I couldn't get enough!!! I am so beyond thrilled to recommend this amazing gem to everyone and anyonen that is looking for a nice night out or just to be taken care of with grace and great attitudes! To those that worked this past Monday, I salute you to my and my husband's experience, making it one we will never forget. Till next time, Cheers!

text_review: Loved what I had, decor was fun, and the place has a tiny intimate feel. My food was simple and well prepared, I don't like too much messing with my food so this place was right up my alley. Drinks were just OK, but food made up for this. Will stick to the wine next time.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: Well, I have eaten at How To Cook A Wolf three times, and I have loved it every time. In fact, one of the times my visit was one of the best restaurant experiences that I have ever had in Seattle. I do love that place.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: I went to Wolf late on a tues with a group of seven and must have had the luck of the Gods as we were seated almost immediately (we knew we were taking a chance on the wait). I adore the interior- I felt like I was in a ships hull all be it the nicest ship and the most modern hull. The wine list was LOVELY. I worked in wine in NY for a few years and although most of my knowledge has drifted out of my brain I certainly am snob enough to know a good Italian lineup. This is where my review gets boring. I loved all of it- from the wine to the food- the food was thoughtful and elegant. The staff was available, considerate of our needs and knowledgeable.  And they were playing PRINCE.  It might have been a little loud but it was still awesome. We danced in our seats. And we had a diverse crew- a wee 24 to a wise 55 and everything else between. I have no idea why this nugget of gold doesn't have a fiver on this site.

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: We had a faulous time. We went down the street to have cocktails while we were waiting. It was so worth the wait. The wait staff was very helpful in making suggestions and we really enjoyed ourselves.

text_review: Wonderful! Great! Fantastic! you must go... find out yourself!!!!

name: How To Cook a Wolf
text_review: I had a great experience here a couple of weeks ago. I could go over all the menu items, but I would rather keep it pithy. All I can say is that the food was fantastic and the server was perfect. On top of that, I love small restaurants and this one is not only small and quaint, but also beautiful. I dine out quite a bit and I absolutely love this restaurant.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: **Restaurant Review - Poor Service from Waitress Wenjie**I recently visited this restaurant with high expectations, but unfortunately, the service left much to be desired. My party was placed on the waitlist, but after waiting for quite some time, we noticed that tables around us were being called and seated, yet we never heard our name.We approached the waitress, Wenjie, who was managing the waitlist. Wenjie insisted that she had called our table, but her voice was so quiet that no one in our party, nor those around us, could hear her. Instead of acknowledging this possibility or offering any sort of compromise, she doubled down and insisted she had done everything correctly. Her lack of flexibility and unwillingness to apologize made the situation even more frustrating.While the food may be good, the experience was overshadowed by this poor service. It's unfortunate that a lack of communication and unprofessional attitude from staff can ruin what could have been an enjoyable meal. I hope management addresses this issue to avoid upsetting more customers in the future.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: I heard many good things about Haidilao and decided to give it a try with my friends. Haidilao is well known for the service, but to be honest, we didn't receive any. There were two to three groups of people ahead of us yesterday at lunchtime, and we lined up for over 10 minutes without anyone greeting us. No one was there. I don't know how long the previous group waited, but we all left. My friends and I were HANGRY. We finally turned to upstairs DinTaiFung. DinTaiFung had two hosts serving us, and we got seated right away. Does Haidilao open the store for self-check-in? I don't know how the well-known service is, but it was a terrible experience for me. We will never be back to waste more time...... and money.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: 一星你值得拥有！感恩节假日去西雅图旅游. 因为英文不好而且对部附近真的不是很熟悉 所以才选择了海底捞 去之前就有心理准备想过和国内的没法比 但终究打破了我的心理防线... 价格是真的贵 但服务也是真的差！ 首先在我们点完餐以后要的热水等到我吃完饭了都一直没有给 好吧美国餐馆没有热水是吧 就算是冰水也是等了好久才拿来 我们没有点饮料也不止于此吧？ 服务员个个感觉都手忙脚乱的 像是新人一样 都走来走去的也不知道在忙什么 调料吧台也是一片狼藉 买个单都要等很久 重点！我的裙子 一坐下就脏了前一桌客人把酱料洒在座位侧边了 忙的卫生都不搞了吗？ 有个很年轻的女生应该是店长吧 从我们桌旁风风的走过 本想找她和她说的 我叫了一声她像没听到一样 被无视了... 本来都忍了 今天是在西雅图的最后一天走之前我们去了在这家附近另外一家海底捞吃饭 虽说服务赶不上国内 但相比这家好太多了 从服务卫生上都好过太多 同样是海底捞怎么会差距这么大？

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: You got many other choices... How did they get the 5star reviews??? I didn't write many reviews especially with low stars but for this one, I must give it one star at most. When I first got into the restaurant there was nobody serving us. The receptionist later came and was told I was on the waiting line (actually no one was waiting. It's empty.) her attitude was pretty unprofessional and I felt her unwillingness to serve us.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Honestly wasn't really good had to do a lot of work and still wasn't full in the end. It was our first time and we didn't know what to do waiter didn't help understand at all.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: My bf and I LOVE hot pot, and our go to spot is usually Happy Lamb. We've been hearing about the dancing noodles and just how delicious Haidilao is, so we had to try. The service was pretty good, everyone was pretty attentive. Overall, we thought the prices were too overpriced for what it was, but at least the dancing noodles were good! The milk tea was pretty good as well, but we thought for what it was, it wasn't worth it.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: This Haidilao store is the worse location that I ever visit. It seems busy, but we don't get any essential service. When we arrived at the store, there was no greeting person at the front. We have to walk in and ask for the table. Then the host brought us to the front again, and we had to step out to check our reservation. We are here for the noodle show, but the show is perfunctory. The sauce bar was dirty, and some ingredients were gone without refill. Not worth it to pay extra for a limited choice. The price is high and the flavor is just okay. Overall the service is lacking and missing.You can easily find a lower price with better service hot pot restaurants in Seattle.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: I had a late lunch at a hot Chinese chain restaurant. I've heard stories and hype about this brand from Asia that don't compare to what's available in the States. Soup was decent with some ingredients. Everything looked fresh with a bar of sauces. The portions are too small for the price. You can only see a show by ordering noodles.Overall clean, but knocking off stars for the price for the portions and constant interruption about their change of staff as we eat.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Restaurant Review: Haidilao Hotpot - SeattleMy daughter and I had an absolutely fantastic experience at Haidilao Hotpot in Seattle! From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed with friendly smiles and seated right away. The atmosphere was modern, clean, and inviting, setting the perfect tone for a fun and interactive dining experience.We opted for a spicy Sichuan broth and a tomato broth, and both were absolutely delicious. The spicy broth had just the right amount of heat without being overwhelming, while the tomato broth was rich, flavorful, and slightly sweet--perfect for balancing out the spice.The ingredients were fresh and high-quality. We enjoyed a variety of thinly sliced meats, seafood, and vegetables, all of which cooked quickly and absorbed the flavors of the broth beautifully. My daughter especially loved the hand-pulled noodles, which were prepared tableside with an impressive and fun performance.Another highlight was the dipping sauce bar, where we got to mix our own sauces to complement the hotpot. There were plenty of ingredients to choose from, and we had fun experimenting with different combinations.The service was outstanding. The staff was incredibly attentive, refilling our broths, clearing plates, and making sure we had everything we needed. They even provided aprons to keep us clean and warm towels for added comfort.Haidilao Hotpot was a memorable experience for both of us, and we're already planning our next visit. If you're looking for a fun, flavorful, and interactive dining experience in Seattle, I can't recommend this place enough!

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: My friend and I went for late-night happy hour. Some good deals on meat. So yummy! The staff are always friendly and helpful.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: I can't get enough of Haidilao when they're offering their special deals. The Angus beef for $1.99 and the Lamb shoulder for $2.99 were such good deals for the quality of meat you get. It's perfectly paired with their classic spicy broth.I always order the vegetable platter, mushrooms platter, and tofu platter to mix things up. And the fish roe lucky bag is a must-order for me every single time. The explosion of flavors inside that tofu bag filled with fish roe is delicious.The restaurant is very huge with some window seats that offer a view of Seattle downtown street. The highlight here is their sauce bar. With lots of options for appetizers, fruits, snacks, and desserts, there's something for everyone. And it's nice of them to provide instructions for each sauce style--it's a thoughtful touch.But I had some disappointing experiences. I have visited twice during non-busy hours, around 1-4pm, and the service can be a bit lacking. There were times when I couldn't find a server for 40 minutes, which was disappointing. However, my recent dinner visit was a different story--the service was prompt and attentive.Overall, Haidilao is a great spot for delicious hot pot. Based on my experience, I suggest going during dinner time for a better experience.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: The experience was great! My kids had so much fun cooking their own food at the table! We loved it!!

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Wanted to try this place and was greeted very nicely and was asked if it was my first time there. They showed me how to order and explained somethings. My waiter was very nice and made sure everything was okay. I came by myself so I just ordered the kobe beef belly combo. It was enough to satisfy me where I didn't feel gross, so personally for me the amount of food was good. I got 3 different soups my favorite was the pork bone broth (I think that's what it was called, the milky white color one). The traditional spicy was also good, pretty numbing. Lastly I ordered a mango green tea and that was also delicious. It tasted basically as the name suggests, mango with a hint of green tea flavor.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: A wonderful place for hotpot! This place is deceptively small based on the outside storefront but inside is a very large, modern dinning area with state of the art hotpot stoves and amenities! I would definitely recommend going here with at least 1 or 2 friends for a delicious experience!

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Here is a great place for an authentic Chinese hot pot experience. The ingredients were fresh, and the broth was rich and flavorful.The restaurant was clean, and the staff was friendly and attentive. There was also a well-stocked sauce bar to customize flavors. I highly recommend this place for a delicious and fun hot pot meal

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Best hotpot! Good service and good food, price was very reasonable, plenty of side dishes available, and the food was amazing. I really like it.

text_review: absolute delight! The variety of fresh ingredients was incredible--everything from tender cuts of meat to an assortment of seafood, vegetables, and noodles. The broths were rich and flavorful, with options for every palate, from mild herbal bases to spicy and aromatic blends.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: I had an amazing dining experience at Haidilao! The service was top-notch--staff were incredibly attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect. Haidilao

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: The service at Haidilao is as impressive as always, with staff who are warm, attentive, and truly customer-focused. The thoughtful details, such as providing aprons and glasses cloths, make the experience extra special. The food is fresh and delicious, with a wide variety of ingredients and soup bases to cater to different tastes. The restaurant is clean and comfortable, and they even offer snacks and drinks while waiting. Overall, it's a delightful dining experience and a top choice for gatherings with friends and family. Looking forward to coming back!

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Both the food and service they offered at this location were great! We enjoyed our time here and would come back again!

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle

text_review: Very comfy place that I go with my family and great service! I like their fish maw soup.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: The food was really good. Love the variety of vegetables and meet. There were lots of choices of sauces as well.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Food: 5/5. We ordered two bases, one spicy and one non spicy. Both were good.Service: 5/5. The servers came around frequently to remove plates and refill water.Ambiance: 5/5. They had decorations out for Chinese New Years. They usually have a show/performance as well.

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: We had such a great experience with exceptional service from our server, Eva. From the warm welcome to her attentive care, she went above and beyond to make our visit enjoyable. Eva kindly guided us through the menu, assisted with our order, and even reminded us about the all-you-can-eat option. Truly outstanding service!

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: This is the best hotpot and best service ever! I will definitely come back again. I would recommend it!

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: The service was great! Great value combo. There are plenty of snacks and desserts that are super tasty

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: This is a good place to have family members sit together and have fun during the dinner time

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: The food, service, and ambiance was excellent! The server was fast and attentive! The meat was fresh, and everything brought to our table was great quality! Bring all your friends here! :)

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: Nice food and service! wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow

name: Haidilao Hot Pot - Seattle
text_review: great service, food bar had many options, and food was delicious! Will definitely come back again

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Disappointed. I would give 0 star if its possible. Our server was great but others aren't. They have weird queuing system btw. U have to present there to be seated even if a person in your party is in toilet at the moment. After we got seated, we saw the host yelled at the customer, which was very unprofessional.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Not delicious at all. Will no go again for sure. Not delicious at all. Will no go again for sure.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: My visit to Kin Len Thai Night Bites on a Saturday morning with an elderly family member had its highs and lows. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. However, the service, particularly from the host during check-in, was not only rude and inattentive but also condescending and unfriendly. He seemed more interested in chatting with coworkers than acknowledging our presence, setting a negative tone for our visit. To make matters worse, my sister's experience mirrored mine. My sister joined our group later. When she asked the host for assistance in locating our table, his response was dismissive and unhelpful. Unfortunately, this unexpected behavior overshadowed the otherwise appealing food and ambiance, leading to a disappointing overall experience.Due to the unfavorable experience with the host, we were seriously considering seeking another dining establishment. Based on our overall experience, despite the good food, I would rate our visit to Kin Len Thai Night Bites as 1 out of 5. Moreover, considering the plethora of dining options available, it's unlikely that we will return to Kin Len Thai Night Bites in the future.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: I am absolutely appalled by the level of rudeness and disrespect I received from the receptionist at this restaurant. The customer service was by far the worst I have ever experienced. The receptionist consistently ignored us and even went so far as to call us liars, which is completely unacceptable.When we arrived, I didn't have my full party with me, so I asked if I could join the waitlist. The receptionist gave me an iPad to fill out our information, and the text message indicated that the wait time would be approximately 20 minutes. So when my friends arrived and waited for ~10 minutes, she decided to retrieve her jacket from the car. As soon as she left, a party of 6 walked in, and the receptionist immediately gave them a table. When I reminded him that we were still waiting, he first completely ignored me and walked away. Then when he returned, he rolled his eyes and accused us of lying about the number of people in our party, even though we clearly had four people.This kind of behavior is completely unacceptable, and it is not the kind of service that customers should be subjected to. I am extremely disappointed in the way we were treated, and I hope that the restaurant takes steps to ensure that this kind of behavior does not happen again.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: I want to make 5 really important key points for the reason of this rating.- Our food took over an hour to be served. I understand it was busy but it was a Tuesday night and the place should've been staffed accordingly -Our food portions were extremely small compared to online pictures with a lot of stuff missing, this is not super bad but still disappointing. When we asked for refill on our soup for our 20$ hot pot they said they couldn't give any which was really interesting given the tiny portion size.- We asked for ice and never got it, I had to walk up to the bar to ask for it.- They spilled our food all over one of us and didn't apologize or offer anything to make it up to us. - They forced us to tip right in front of them due to their paying system: which is extremely rude because we felt as if we didn't want to tip but she was staring at us tip so we felt pressured. The server was a girl wearing low cut black v shirt with thick eyeliner & kinda chubby named Praew?(it said this name on the receipt) and this was one of the worst customer service experience I've ever experienced. Please do not come here for good food or good service. Go a few blocks down for better Thai food and actual servers.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: I recently dined at Kin Len and, unfortunately, it was quite a disappointing experience. Firstly, we arrived excited for a relaxed evening, but the service left much to be desired. At the beginning, our server was extremely slow to take our order. We waited far too long to even get our drinks, which was frustrating. To make matters worse, when the end of our meal came around, it felt like the staff was rushing us out the door. The server brought the check without asking if we needed anything else, and hovered around, making us feel very unwelcome. She must've come to our table no less than 10 times in 10 minutes. Additionally, I was particularly disappointed to find that there were no vegetarian options on the happy hour menu. In this day and age, it's surprising that a restaurant wouldn't cater to a variety of dietary preferences, especially during a popular time like happy hour.Overall, the combination of poor service and lack of menu options really soured what should have been an enjoyable evening. I hope they make some changes to improve the dining experience.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: My recent visit to Kin Lin was a mixed experience. While I enjoyed some of the dishes, others left me feeling a bit underwhelmed. The standout dish was the glass noodle in clay pot - it was very flavorful and the shrimp was cooked to perfection. The dish had a nice blend of spices that made it a pleasure to eat.However, the fried chicken with red curry was a bit of a letdown. Although the chicken was cooked well, I found the red curry to be too sweet for my taste. It lacked the spicy kick that I usually associate with Thai cuisine, and as a result, it didn't live up to my expectations.On the service front, everything was fine. The staff were courteous and attentive, and the food was served promptly. Overall, my experience at Kin Lin was average. While there were some highlights, there were also some letdowns. If you're in the area and looking for a Thai meal, it's worth considering, but don't expect anything too extraordinary

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Kin Len Thai Night Bites is a fantastic spot for delicious Thai food in a lively, energetic setting. We tried the papaya salad, larb, and red curry with chicken, and all the dishes were top-notch. The flavors were vibrant and authentic, with the perfect balance of spices that made each bite a treat. The red curry, in particular, was rich and creamy, with tender chicken that soaked up all the flavors beautifully while still remaining quite crispy. The interior of the restaurant is stylish and fun, making it a great place to hang out, especially during happy hour. The deals are great, and the vibe really adds to the overall experience. Happy hour is definitely a must if you're visiting!The only downside is that there can be a bit of a wait, and they require the whole party to be present before seating, which can be a little inconvenient if you're with a group. However, the wait is worth it once you're inside.Overall, Kin Len Thai Night Bites is definitely worth a visit for the food and atmosphere. Just be prepared to wait if you're coming during peak hours. We'll definitely be back!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Good food! Been a few times for lunch. Service is quick. I like the papaya salad. It's not too fishy! Overall relaxing and comfortable environment for a meal with friends

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: I came here when they first opened and don't think they had the same menu as they do now. They were able to accommodate our group of 6. The food was fast and very tasty. We ordered the Crispy Chicken Red Curry, Eggplant and tofu, papaya salad, corn salad, pineapple fried rice, banana blossoms and a vegetarian curry. They were able to make some.of the dishes vegan which was great! Everything was very good but wouldn they the corn salad again. It really didn't have any flavor other than corn (which I LOVE corn) but for some reason it just didn't do it for any of us. Would highly recommend checking this place out. It was great to get a few dishes and share to get to try a bit of everything.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Huge portions, good food, nice vibe. Good for dates and your group of friends. Service is a little slow, but just come here with good company and you won't notice that so much.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: The ambiance is pleasant and so comfy inside. The decor is colorful and plenty of seating. The food here is absolutely incredible. The portions are generous and satisfying. The khao soi noodles are one of the most flavorful curries and I tasted. It's really delicious. I will back for more and taste their other dishes.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Love the food here and the service is great too! I've been here a few times and have always had good experiences.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Great food with great price. There is always waiting line tho, recommend to get there early to get a spot quick!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: The decor is very unique and eye catching. I've been here in several occasions and there can be long waits but the food is 100% worth it. Our go to order is the crispy battered red curry chicken and the Phad See Eiw with chicken. They have really tasty drinks as well. This is hands down one of my top 10 favorite places to eat in Seattle.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: The food was amazing! We ordered about 9 items from the menu and all were cooked to perfection!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Can't wait to go back and try more. The shrimp clay pot was excellent and a must try on the menu. Got the flank steak wrap cooked medium rare and it was also simple yet delicious. Firecracker cocktail had the perfect kick of spice! Loved the casual night street vibe.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Amazing restaurant; amazing food, amazing drinks!!! You can't go wrong with this restaurant!!!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Our eyes were bigger than our tummies and we ordered everything on the menu. It was all delicious.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Went to the place several times already, the food is pretty good. Will recommend friends to try this place as well.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: This place is ridiculously good! I wanted to finally try this place on my birthday. I'd been dying to visit but things just never lined up for whatever reason, but it was worth the wait! First, the vibe is super fun; modern mixed in with traditional and hip hop playing from the speakers! Off to a great start!Our server is fabulous - friendly, prompt, and knowledgeable. We ordered the battered chicken red curry, shrimp cakes & crispy pork belly & Chinese broccoli. The shrimp cakes were tasty but the entrees were stupid-good. I could eat the curry every single day and not get sick of it. The flavors and textures were perfect. I did find myself wishing there was more curry, but just wow! 12/10The pork belly was crispy and tender - flavorful! and the broccoli was perfectly prepared. 10/10There wasn't a bad bite on that table and I'm dying to get back in and work my way through their menu!!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Great lunch menu. Everything was delicious and great ambiance. Service was great and would definitely come back.

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: The foods are sooo good!!!!! There were 4 of us but we ordered 10 dishes and finished all of them. Definitely come back regularly!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: This was my first time having thai food and it was a really good experience!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: I love coming here for a drink and some food!

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: The best food u can think ofSuperSuper delicious And I ll for sure come back again

name: Kin Len Thai Night Bites
text_review: Great new addition Thai for the Fremont area!! Ambiance is really awesome and different. Loved the cocktails they had to offer...Had the Jar of Pleasure!! Also had the chicken and rice dish and my husband had the boat noodles. Another perk is they are open really late for night owls!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Mushy, gross wings. Drinks were not very good despite the high levels of snark in their description. Crab nachos had almost no crab (which paying that price for nachos, come on man bring the crab!)  Every time I've been in the bald bartender seems to have a serious chip on his shoulder and made some seriously creepy remarks to one of my girl-friends. Not sure how this place gets so highly reviewed...

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: I ate here this week and it will be my last. The food was dry and cold. There were flies in my food. Disgusting.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Trash. So many better bars in Seattle. Don't waste your time on this hole in the wall.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This bar blows, I was turned down despite having a legitimate Maryland ID. I mean I get trying to keep underage kids out, but at least teach your waitresses and bouncers what the legit IDs are for each state.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: First time I go here it is great view yet I think I am looking for something by the way staff are nice, thanks!

name: Some Random Bar

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Heard only beneficial things about this eatery before I even went there. The spot is open and the waiters are inviting contrasted with other adjoining spots. In any case their food was incredible and directly on its cost. I'll get a kick out of the chance to thank you for your extraordinary work and you're energetically suggested.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Not enolugh good things can be said about this "random" gem! Had a blast the other night!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This place has got so many good reviews so i was super excited to try it, But i was disappointed nothing great the wine was horrible

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The margarita was good, the dessert was good, but the main dish wasn't.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This place is good for drinks but not for food. Service is great !

text_review: Solid neighborhood place with good food, a great spirit selection and honest prices. name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The perfect place to hang out with your friends and families and to have fun, the nourishment was extraordinary and turned out super rapidly. The beverages were great, and they had a menu to look over. The staff was excessively agreeable and supportive. We made some extraordinary memories here, and I energetically suggest visiting here!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Watched the Seahawks game here and really enjoyed the food. It was Sunday afternoon and it was bust - but the service was great. The the staff made great beer recommendations, and the wings were exellent.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Amazing breakfast. Prices are steep but upfront. Prices are clearly explained. Amazing place with a excellent dishes. Satisfying portions and tasted their pork belly sliders. Great service with good staff.I would definitely come here again.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Fun fun place to go to! If you're in Belltown, it's a must to stop by. And I love the name!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This random bar is amazing. Something out of the ordinary, truly. The potatoes blew my mind, the steak was mouthwatering. It was an experience, truly. We used Instapark, found a nearby lot, and it worked out great!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Have only been for drinks... but I'm a fan of Some Random Bar.  Besides, the name is just fun to say...especially when meeting with peeps who've never been. Had great drinks, good times, and good service for being a busy night.  Check it out

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Stopped by this place a night ago. Great service. I have heard a lot about the Seattle freeze but didn't feel it here. Waiters were very friendly

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Decided to go here when we showed up to a closed No Anchor due to an emergency pipe repair that shut down the entire block and tore up the street. Friendly server, good drinks nice beer selection, game on TVs. One star taken away because they didn't have the beer I wanted that was up on the board and then didn't have the cocktail I wanted that was on the menu. Seems like a great local hang out.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Awesome experience all around!Came in last night when I saw that they served food late (kitchen closed at 11pm on a Sunday), and sat at the bar.Had the Sockeye salmon seasonal dish, which was excellent and surprising, with the cold teriyaki noodles. Also had the great cheesecake with sour cherry compote, and the delicious Mexican Hot Chocolate

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The wings are great, the nachos are really loaded, and the garlic bread is fantastic! The staff are friendly and attentive as well. Nice atmosphere too.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great spot in terms of food, drinks and flair! Small seating option outside in special style. Don't miss out going there on Sundays: You flip a coin for each beer you order, be lucky and pay only one dollar!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great name. The ambience is very nice. The beer and cocktails were fine as well. Staff was friendly. Liked the food that we ordered as well.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The name of the place is what made me want to come. In you love a good happy hour, you should stop by here at least once to try it out!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Good brunch, not expensive. I've heard mixed reviews, but I was always pleased with them and did not notice bad.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Went for lunch with co-workers. It was busy. Did not wait long for a table, but once we ordered it was awhile before food came. Good food.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Now I know why I moved to Seattle. It's such a great foodie town. So many different choices for cuisine and styles. And the bars...MU-AH! I got me some Random Bar after reading the reviews here. And I'm glad I tried it. Only been here once so I can only speak to one experience but it was good enough to give it 4 stars. Crab nachos were ok. The mixology in this place is not random but purposeful. Shit hits the spot. My opinions are my own and not influenced by a third party. Take my review for what it's worth as always.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: happy hour was good, drinks were reasonable, i like

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great beer selection. The crowd is what you expect for the location.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: I'm a fan. My wife had been talking about stopping by for a while, and we just did yesterday. They have amazing salmon sliders we tried out. The service was great, and on Sunday's they make you flip a coin to get your beer for just $1!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Constantly changing beer LOCAL selection, food looks/smells great but is a little over priced for the menu offerings so I've never eaten here. Happy Hour specials are very cheap, $4 and $5 beers

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: A number of the finest food in Belltown!!! So refreshing to go into a brand new eatery/pub as well as the owner really comes over to speak with you personally.Simply because they've opened, we've been there 3x's and there are always some new things on the menu. They got the BEST chicken wings in town! Excellent Beer and wine collection. The cocktails are also extremely yummy. So grateful to truly have a new eatery/pub in Belltown that's excellent high quality food, friendly staff and consistent service. Some Random Bar surpassed my expectations.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Stopped in here, and WOW great place, great food. Had a blast!! I'll be back for sure. Great staff, casual atmosphere. The crab nachos are awesome..

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Dropped in for a beer, some random beer that I can't remember. Nice vibe here.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: What a gem of a bar! My boyfriend and I visited on a random Tuesday and had a great time.1. Good selection of local craft beer 2. Mike is a knowledgeable & friendly bartender. He poured us samples and suggested two IPA's that were fresh and delicious. When we had finished and were ready to leave, he suggested some other good beer bars to try while we're in Seattle. Thanks Mike!3. The food was surprisingly good. My boyfriend and I shared a seafood linguine, and we both loved it so much we debated getting another bowl.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Nice vibe. Comfortable space. I definitely like coming to Some Random Bar. Everyone is friendly and it's a good mix of different sorts of people. It has a few TVs, but not enough to make it feel like a sports bar, but you can still catch the game if that's what you're in to. The beer is good and so is the happy hour. It's a nice place if you're looking for something that's not too trendy, but also not too boring.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Awesome place, great vibe and one of the best burgers I have had in Seattle.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: We arrived and asked for a table of 3... The place is good, so we had to wait for the table because it was full, but... It was worth it. We had a great breakfast, with fresh bread, espresso. Thank you!!!!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Tasty and delicious! Good ambiance.. came after a local show, good n quick service.. and liked the name itself.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Nestled in the heart of the city, this bar is an absolute gem. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a warm ambiance and friendly staff who make you feel right at home. The selection of drinks is impressive, with everything from craft cocktails to local brews on tap. Whether you're looking for a quiet spot to unwind after work or a lively atmosphere to kick off the weekend, this place has you covered. The decor is stylish yet comfortable, and the music sets the perfect mood for any occasion. Plus, the bar snacks are delicious. the perfect complement to your drink of choice. Overall, a fantastic spot to spend an evening with friends or enjoy some solo time. Highly recommend!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Everything was so good! I forgot to take a photo of my burger before I started eating it but it was DELICIOUS I definitely recommend.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great food and drinks! Fun people and great service. Will be back for sure. Love it!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Fantastic place to come watch the game! Everyone was so kind and friendly. The bartender was the friendliest around, she was super knowledgeable about the nice bottles of bourbon they had the shelves. Came here on Halloween and so glad we made the drive!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Food and the atmosphere was absolutely fantastic. Look forward to visiting again when I am back in town

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: My wife and I love this place, the setting is so good. Has wonderful dinner. Place is spacious and the ambiance is really pleasant. The food is good quality and well-prepared too. Been here many times and we really the Brisket Sandwich and Chicken wings which absolutely fantastic.The service is good, didn't wait too long for the food to arrive. Nice staff too.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: We had a great food, service, and drinks here on a Sunday afternoon. Will be back.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Comfortable atmosphere, friendly service and excellent drink and beer choices! Highly recommend!

text_review: ToeCurls.com is the best place to find single women in Seattle who are looking to be wined, dined, and well "you know what" so if you are looking for a date to take out to this restaurant, or are just looking for someone to have a good time with at home, TC is the place.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The sauce for the wings was phenominal!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The chicken wings are really yummy here!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Just eat and drink here. Just eat and drink here. Just eat and drink here. It is delicious.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Wow!This Place is Awesome, friendly People and awesome atmosphere food looks, Good for Family and friendsThis place is definitely one of the best spots On AlkiI didn't try their food this time but I am in the near future.I can't wait to come back.Welcome to the neighborhood

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This is my all time favorite restaurant/bar in Seattle. I lived in Seattle for 3 years and come back often and I ALWAYS make sure I have time to got to SRB. Mike, Jean and their are team are fabulous - great cocktails and phenomenal food. I tell everyone who asks for recommendations to go to this restaurant - ANY FOOD or BEVERAGE - because everything is good. They also carry some of the best local beers in Seattle. GO AND VISIT THIS PLACE IS EVERYTHING.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Atmosphere is super cool and the staff is friendly. Amazing meatless burgers and my friend had crab nachos which were sooo good. Oh also the chicken wings are bomb!!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great great food and experience. Andy was a super waitress. Best chicken wings I have ever had...

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: What a great bar. Visiting from NYC for the week, and this was one of my favorite stops in Seattle. Everything was great from the moment we walked through the door. The people who work here/run this place are fantastic. The beer list is on point, and the cocktail I had was delicious. Thanks SRB! We will make this a regular stop when in Seattle. On a side note, after reading a few of the reviews on here, I have a quick comment:@ Ken M. - For real? You gave a bar 3 stars because of Monday Night Football? If you show up to a bar, and it's "not what you were looking for", you leave and don't write a review. There are bars in either direction that don't have TVs. It's just bad form to say the drinks and service were awesome and then leave a 3-star rating.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This is my second time coming here, great service, great food, very reasonable prices.Will come here more often.

name: Some Random Bar

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Wow. Went there yesterday for brunch with a group of 7. The food was delicious but what really impressed me was the service. Our server Brian was just the right amount of attentive.  He made great suggestions when asked, kept our drinks topped off, and was super considerate -- even asking us how we wanted our bill split rather than just bringing it out. He even wrote in the tip box on each person's receipt that 18% gratuity had already been included. I felt compelled to add additional tip anyways!To top it off, I accidentally left my credit card there. I returned later in the day and they checked my ID and returned the card. I'll definitely be back!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great service. Great drinks. Waiter was so helpful and explained the process of making each drink. Not too crowded. Easy walk from anywhere.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: One of my favorite spots in the Belltown neighborhood. Very friendly staff, great creative cocktails and well thought-out beer selections. It can sometimes be tough to find a spot as they are always generally pretty busy, at least when I try to go, but if you get in it's more than worth it.
