text_review: OMG!!!! The Lobster Nachos are to DIE FOR! And the clam chowder is amazing!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This place rocks. Great local beer selection and they are always adding fresh ones. They don't have a million tap handles and I like that, makes you try something new. On that note they do cover the beer spectrum with the selection, so something for everyone. Staff rocks, the waitress totally gave me permission to be as creepy and awesome as I wanted. Couple TVs, some tunes, and tasty food. Haven't had the wings but if they are half as amazing as the guacamole then bring extra socks because your feet will get cold when they are blown straight off. (guacamole is so effing good) Love this place, just moved to Seattle and this will be my go-to for a long time.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: My regular Friday passed by so fast but it did in my favorite place in Seattle! Coming more often to this place made me feel like home. Love this place

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Really not some random bar. It's hands down the terrific!! Great food. I love coming here with my mates. &The tacos are especially delicious!!!! I can't wait to get my fix.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Awesome food, awesome music, awesome beer, cute girls working here... What else could you possibly ask for in a bar? Five stars

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: it was so random to stopped by Some Random Bar! It was a nice evening with my Dad who came to visit me for a night! Great place! My Dad loved it! And me too

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: my spot for good drinks and atmosphere. girlfriend loves this place too, which is a plus, right fellas?

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Just started coming here and I love it. The food is really first rate. Awesome apps and beer selection. The menu is quite interesting....some bar favorites with a twist like wings and fried chicken, but also some eclectic, quirky dishes like steak tartar and halibut ceviche. Just awesome, really.The best part is the warm, friendly staff. The owners, the bartenders, servers, and the kitchen staff are all so welcoming. It really seems like a big family. This place is such a nice change from the standard Belltown "joints". This place is kinda like "Cheers", but with amazing food. Kudos to the owners and staff.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: I LOVE this place and the people that work here.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The food item I drooled over were the fried tomato, best I've ever had! I had a beer flight as well, all local brews which was exactly what I was looking for on my first Washington State visit. The ambiance was pretty stellar with a wood/metal decor and a great playlist in the background, very suitable for my song-add.I ended up meeting the owner, he was conversing with a few people about the tap list, the brewers, and the soccer game up on Sunday. They also have a happy hour where both food and drinks are selectively included. 40% off

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Waitress - 5 starsMixed Drinks - 5 starsEnvironment - 5 starsI'll be back for the food. Like this place so far!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: The name caught my attention. I love the friendly staff. The food was great and the wait wasn't to long. Its nice to find a place that has all of the above without a complaint in my book. Thanks for the great experience.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great owners! Great food, great drinks, great music. A warm and welcoming environment if you're not an a*hole.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: One of the best burgers in Seattle.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great bar with a comfortable atmosphere, great drinks, awesome food and owners who actually care. What else could you want in a place.

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: This place home. everyone there is there to have fun. I will admit, its not for everyone. they do have a strict vibe at the door, but the staff is so nice and i love the candles :)

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Great gem in belltown, great service, awesome food, well priced!! Will visit again soon!!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: One of the best burgers I've ever had. Great atmosphere and great server!! I would highly recommend this place to everyone! We'll be back!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: A couple of friends and I stumbled in here five minutes before their happy hour ended. The bartender running the place was extremely kind in letting us order a cocktail and a tallboy each on the happy hour price (half price off all booze basically!) We also split a plate of sweet potato fries which were adequate. When it came for the bill, they split the fries onto all of our bills so we all paid the same. It was a really cool little detail that I appreciated a lot. It's a very thoughtful spot, great for conversations with your friends. Could do without the flatscreen tvs, but I get it. Will return!

name: Some Random Bar
text_review: Finally - someone who knows what to do with this restaurant/bar space!

name: Pink Salt Restaurant
text_review: Over-rated and over-priced. We experienced poor service during both visits to Pink Salt. Food was good but not great. Drinks were excellent. Maybe it just takes time for the owners to get into the swing of things - but we likely won't go back for dining - maybe a glass of wine but that's about it. Disappointing.  I agree with one of the other reviewers - if you're going to charge as much as you do, you really have to deliver.

name: Pink Salt Restaurant
text_review: Pink Salt is a hidden gem within Magnolia. There are not a lot of restaurant options in Magnolia that are worth going our of your way for, but Pink Salt is the exception. The food was delicious. Highly recommend getting the Yuca Rellana to start. The Pesto Rissotto with Tenderloin was also delicious. I only had a glass of wine but they had some tasty looking cocktails on the menu that are probably worth a try. The food was on the pricier side but it was cooked to perfection. We made reservations but were surprised that the restaurant was largely unoccupied on a Saturday night. It was nice that the restaurant was quiet but it was hard to get a sense for what the ambiance was intended to be. Great choice for delicious food and a nice dinner out though!

name: Pink Salt Restaurant
text_review: Love the ambiance and the servers were really awesome. Really delicious food. Great for a date or dinner and drinks with the girls!

name: Pink Salt Restaurant
text_review: Great food,and fantastic service....real Peruvian experience.I recommend this place to all friends.

name: Pink Salt Restaurant
text_review: Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful ExperienceA Taste of Peru in Magnolia, Washington USA

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Food was so bland. Their top recommended items had no seasoning. I would never go back.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: The worse Taiwanese food ever. I will never recommendation this restaurant to anyone.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Food had no seasoning and taste but the service was all right. Ordered the fried chicken with rice and they have plenty food enough to get full

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: GReat food, great people, excellent atmosphere. Will def be coming back here again. Staff was friendly to all my friends.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free! Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free! Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free! Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: A little pricy for the quality of food but its good for a fix. I love eating hot pot type dishes and this is quite nice. As for the other appetizers I like the fried buns!!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Looking for authentic Taiwanese food, and got what i was expected. Tasted the yummy bubble tea, chicken popcorn and spicy pork rice. Want to try more, have to visit again. My experience was fine and on that basis will recommend on that.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Love the malatang. Medium spicy has a really great kick without being overwhelming. The teas are a delight - can't wait to try them all. We also had the bean sprouts with meat sauce and loved it. The kids thought their plates were super cool (little car plates with good variety of things to taste), but I thought a little overpriced at $13 a throw. All up, cool vibe, great variety, unique dishes - we'll be back!!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: My girlfriend's favourite Taiwanese place in Seattle, she always want to eat there aha

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Service is quick, food is consistently delicious and the beef noodle soup has my heart. Good lighting, perfect for photos!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: 麻辣烫 offers a customizable and flavorful dining experience. Choose from fresh vegetables, meats, and tofu, paired with a rich, spicy broth tailored to your spice tolerance. The ingredients are fresh, the portions generous, and the bold flavors satisfying. Perfect for a quick, hearty meal or casual gathering, 麻辣烫 is a must-try for fans of Chinese street food!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: We love coming to 19 GOLD! Every time we visit Seattle, we make sure to stop here. The food is always bursting with flavor and served incredibly quickly. Everything at this restaurant is delicious and authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Moreover, their bubble tea has the most perfectly textured tapioca, and the richness of their beverages matches the high quality of the food. I love this place!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: I love 19 GOLD. The Taiwanese Sausage over rice was exceptional, with perfectly seasoned sausage paired with fluffy white rice and a savory sauce that tied everything together. The flavors were nostalgic and comforting, reminiscent of a classic Taiwanese street food experience. The portions were generous, and the presentation was simple yet inviting. The ambiance, complete with friendly service and warm décor, made for a delightful dining experience. For anyone craving genuine Taiwanese cuisine, this spot is a must-visit.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: great Taiwanese hotpot and very cozy restaurant. my favorite is surf and turf and the x2 meat

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Amazing food! Love the atmosphere. Quick to be seated. Attentive service. Love the vibes!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: I recently dined at 19 Gold in Fremont, and it was an unforgettable experience. The portion sizes were incredibly generous--enough to leave anyone satisfied. The garlic string beans were packed with flavor and could practically be a meal on their own.The minced pork over rice was equally delicious, with the added freshness of bok choy and steamed cabbage. I especially enjoyed the boiled egg, which was flavored perfectly--a delightful first for me. To top off the meal, the brown sugar milk boba was the perfect balance of sweetness and richness.What truly elevated the experience was the outstanding service. The servers were attentive to my needs and provided great recommendations, enhancing the overall dining experience. Additionally, the atmosphere at 19 Gold was fantastic, featuring modern decor and contemporary music playing at a reasonable volume in the background.Overall, 19 Gold offers exceptional quality, generous portions, and flavors that are hard to beat. Highly recommended!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Good was great and affordable! Boba and desserts are really good as well, would recommend.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Braised Minced Pork over Rice and 19 Gold Fries taste really good, and the milk tea sugar level is just right for me who doesn't like too sweet things. The staff is very nice and patient to introduce us the menu. Will come back again:)

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Highly recommended restaurant! I love the popcorn fried chicken and minced pork. Will definitely come back!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Good service and the food is delicious! The lighting is nice and the temperature is just perfect when it's the summer 10/10 would recommend again

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Great food, great service. Try the beef noodle soup. It's the best I've ever had. I'll be back.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Love the food, portions, price, and proximity to the market. The boba is lovely and I've never had a bad experience here! Would highly recommend.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: This is my go-to spot in Fremont for Taiwanese food + boba. My favorite is the danzai noodles, but the mala udon is also good! I've brought my friends here and they always want to come back for more. Service is quick an

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Great place to eat before STP race! We were seated quickly good recommendations and good service.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Gold 19 always has great food here! highly recommended.. the minced pork over rice is fantastic as well as all of the appetizers!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Visited 19 gold last night and was thoroughly impressed! We ordered a variety of dishes, including their braised beef and a classic Taiwanese sausage with rice plate. The braised beef was tender and flavorful, drenched in a savory sauce with a hint of sweetness, garnished with spring onions and sesame seeds. It was melt-in-your-mouth delicious!The Taiwanese sausage plate was equally satisfying. The sausages were juicy and had a nice smoky flavor, perfectly complemented by the sides of steamed rice, braised egg, and greens with a glossy glaze. Everything was well-presented, and the portions were generous. The ambiance of the restaurant added to the experience, making it a cozy spot for a casual dinner. Service was friendly and prompt, which was the cherry on top of a delightful visit. Highly recommend 19 Gold for anyone craving authentic Taiwanese cuisine. They nailed the flavors and the experience!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Excellent food, excellent service. Everyone in our office comes here weekly for their boba.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Excellent service and without waiting time. The chicken and fries were golden crisp to top off the golden atmosphere inside. Definitely would recommend.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: A great Taiwanese Restaurant in the town The hot pot are a great option to try. A lot of option to choose even. I would like to come back in the future.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Amazing milktea and comfort food! Would definitely recommend. The food and drinks were well priced as well.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: This is our go to spot! This place never disappoints. Also worth getting the bubble tea.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Great food and atmosphere! They have a BOGO deal on the boba if you leave a review. That staff are very friendly too!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Very good food here Very good food here Very good food here Very good food here Very good food here Very good food

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: I recently tried this malatang, and it was a flavor explosion! The broth was rich, spicy, and packed with depth, while the beef slices were tender and perfectly cooked. The subtle green onion garnish added a nice freshness to each bite. The accompanying rice was a perfect complement, balancing out the intense flavors. If you love bold, spicy dishes, this is a must-try. The presentation was inviting, and the portion size was generous. Highly recommend!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Nice lunch in 19 gold! Taste is good - not over salty or spicy. Love it! I do like the Taiwanese style popcorn chicken.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Nice restaurant! Good taste and warm service. Will visit this restaurant again. Thank you.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: 19 Gold is my favorite restaurant in Fremont.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: I recently visited 19Gold Restaurant in Seattle and was blown away by the exceptional experience. I ordered the popcorn chicken rice, and it was a culinary masterpiece. The chicken was tender with a crispy coating, perfectly complemented by the flavorful rice. The service was outstanding, with knowledgeable staff providing excellent recommendations. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, and the value for money was impressive. I highly recommend 19Gold for an unforgettable dining experience in Seattle.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: I've been to 19 gold multiple times, and the milk tea, golden fried buns, popcorn chicken, and minced pork over rice are some of my favorite items here. The prices are reasonable and the service is great.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: The drink is awesome and they have buy 1 get 1 free. The rice is amazing and I will go to the restaurant again.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: The food is so good! And the service is great. The waiters are super helpful and quick to provide help as needed.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Food was tasty, efficient ordering, and the bubble tea was finger licking good. Very friendly staff to boot

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: It's so hard to find an authentic taiwanese restaurant. I try coming here whenever I'm in town.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Good place for lunch!! There were 5 of us on Sunday for lunch. We only waited about 5 mins. Food is tasty.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: good boba tea!im vegan, so im really glad they use a nondairy milk powder!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Went here with family and we love the service! They're really nice and the food is amazing!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: It's a fantastic restaurant!! It is at a great location with spacious interior. They have the most traditional Taiwan food and affordable price. This restaurant deserves you have a try. I recommend bubble tea and Popcorn Chicken over Rice, Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup, and Seafood Malatang with Super Rich Broth. And the service is great. I will come back again!!!!!!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Awesome restaurant, my favorite food there was meat lover malatang, and the taste was amazing, meal was served in really short time, if you like Asian food, here's your best bet.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Great Taiwanese restaurant with lots of variety, super friendly waiters, and tasty food! All orders were placed via mobile and food was served in a super speedy manner at just the right temperature. House special combo featured a decent balance of meats and veggies. Fish balls/ hot pot items were ok, very much preferred the fresh food. Overall a positive experience and would definitely visit again

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Amazing genuine Taiwanese soup and food. Highly recommend, and will be back!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: 19 Gold is a really nice place to get appetizers and drinks!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Awesome Taiwanese food and authentic!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: We came here on a busy day. The entire dinning area is full of people waiting. Even with the crowd, the employees still patiently explain the menus to us and help us place an to-go order. They quoted the wait to be 30 mins, so we decide to go for a walk. After about 20 mins, they called and tell is the food is ready for pickup, which I appreciate the additional effort. The food is still warm when we got home, it's sealed properly, no spills and everything is accurate. We ordered the Mala Udon with the non-spicy broth and it's delicious! The soup is exceptional. The popcorn chicken juicy and crispy. The pork over rice is full of flavors.As a first timer, we are totally amazed! Will definitely come back again soon.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Ordered delivery. The food was quickly prepared and the pick up process was easy. I enjoyed the food and would recommend to friends.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: 19 GOLD is something special. Look at these Braised Duck Wings, they are perfectly marinated with beautiful caramelized flavor. It was sooo good that I had to order one to go! Their bubble tea is also very legit, I tried the Japanese Twice Roasted Milk Tea with Boba. The tea flavor is strong, which is exactly how I like it. I will definitely come back again soon and try more dishes!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Love this place and their bowl are large enough to share with someone. We've been here twice already and with certainly be back again.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: love everything about this place! great staff, amazing food!! highly recommend! I also was satisfied with their drinks option. Was so happy

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Great Food, all taste amazing. Good customer service. Would definitely come back again.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: 19 Gold is always my favorite restaurant in Seattle. I strongly recommend the duck wings,malatang and green onion pancake!Great food,great services. If you are finding the best Chinese food or Taiwanese food,please come to 19 Gold!!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: I loved this place. the food was great and they serve bubble tea, which I love.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: First time coming here and would definitely come back. If you're looking for some great food and amazing service, this is a great spot to check out. Everyone was very friendly and the food came out so quick! The quality of food was delicious and I can't wait to go back?

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: we loved the food... environment was very beautiful.A++

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Good food always make my day better! Love 19 gold. It's so close to where I live too!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: This is my first review~ I love this restaurant! I've been to here for 3 times. My favorite is the 19 Gold Fries. Must try!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: It's been awhile since I last ate Taiwanese food. It is very hard to find these kind of restaurant here. This is very legit. You can taste the same food that Taiwan offers.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: This place is a must try, amazing food! For the appetizer, We order the preserved egg with chilled tofu and it was amazing; the tofu was really soft and the preserved egg sauce was amazing!For the main meal; we order the malatang combo with original broth and the super rich malatang broth. the original broth was really rich and refreshing while the super rich one was really creamy and uniquely delicious!The main star of the day is the braised combination; the chicken wings and the intestine was sweet and amazing!!Gonna go back here for many times in the future for sure!

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Loved the Minced Pork over rice! They give free refills for the pork. We also had the Malatang which my parents really enjoyed. The 19 Gold fries were okay, nothing special. Overall, would recommend.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Very delicious. The malatang, dumplings, platter and bubble tea ... All of them are very good. And excellent service.

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: I really like the food I will come back again.Great atmosphere.One of my favorite restaurants looked fantastic

name: 19 GOLD
text_review: Amazing food and service! One of the best! A lot of varieties to choose from.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Simply, his place is the worse Mediterranean food I have ever try! And the atmosphere so bad

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Awesome for a cheat day! Got the lamb shanks with hummus. Shank was really good, very soft meat with minimal oil, or no oil. Protein packed and a good option for a cheat day instead of going for fast food.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: The Chicken is amazing. Also, bread tastes very good. I watched him cooking the bread in his masonry oven (brick oven). Very fresh. highly recommend.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Got their mixed grill and mezza platter with their beet salad, fattoush, cauliflower and babaganoush. It was all delicious! Def recommend going here with friends, casual date night, or just because you want Mediterranean cuisine.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: If you're in Seattle and haven't been to Almanqal yet, you're seriously missing out. This place is a total hidden gem! From the moment we walked in, we felt right at home thanks to the super friendly staff and the cozy, inviting vibe of the restaurant. It's got that perfect mix of chill and stylish that makes it great for any occasion.Now, let's talk about the food. Almanqal absolutely nails it. Every dish we tried was packed with flavor, and you can tell they use fresh, high-quality ingredients. The grilled meats were perfectly cooked, and the Schwarma platter? So good. The hummus was some of the creamiest and tastiest I've had--definitely worth the trip alone. My favorite thing on the menu is the Lamb Kabob, which comes with your choice of appetizer. ( I recommend the baba ghanoush)The service was top-notch, too. The staff were attentive but not over the top, always checking in without making us feel rushed. They were also super helpful when we had questions about the menu.Overall, Almanqal is the kind of place where you feel like you're getting a truly special experience. Whether you're a fan of Mediterranean food or just looking for something new, you've gotta give this place a try. You won't be disappointed!

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: I've called Seattle home for nearly three decades, and I just had to share my love for Almanqal Mediterranean restaurant and its talented chef, Haqi. In a nutshell, this place is extraordinary. After trying lamb, beef, and chicken dishes all around town, I can confidently say that Almanqal is in a league of its own. The flavors are simply incredible, and the meats are exceptionally tender. If you're a fan of lamb, beef, or chicken, you absolutely must pay them a visit.Their lentil soup is a warm hug in a bowl, and the Lamb Shank is a culinary masterpiece that practically melts in your mouth.Almanqal is now my go-to spot for forever. If you're in search of a fantastic Mediterranean meal, look no further. This place is a hidden Seattle treasure that you need to experience. Don't miss out!

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Their salad with lamb is excellent. The service is always excellent when eating in or for take-out. Reasonable prices.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: One of the best chicken shawarma's for sure, also the fries were tasty! Service was very nice

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Great food , welcoming staff can't ask for more. The owner is so friendly , I would recommend it to everyone

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Everything was great. The staff are very friendly. I recommend a platter of shawarma (choose meat) and choose 2 appetizers. They even have fresh lemonade. Great place.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: The food had immaculate flavors. I would 100% go again, the staff was very friendly and welcoming and was great mediterranean food

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: best restaurant in the world trust me i've been going for 5 years and can't find a restaurant that can compete. the food portions are extravagant and worth each penny. service is great the employees and owner are kinda and talk to each costumer at a personal level. I love almanqal grill give it a shot.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: It's great place with Awesome food and lovely people

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: This is my favorite Mediterranean food around!

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: I haven't really had Mediterranean food before but I really liked this place!

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Almanqal is an awesome spot if your craving Mediterranean food!

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Very cozy small town place with warm atmosphere! You can find nice choice of appetizers and main dishes! Don't forget specials! Couple days we have ordered a pick-up and my family couldn't be more satisfied with it. Will be back soon.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: I am absolutely in love with this restaurant! I have had Arabic food all over the world and this is one of my absolute favorite places, certainly my favorite in the states! The variety of the menu is great, the flavors are always amazing, and they give so much for the price! I hope this place is around forever! I could eat it every day!

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Really nice place. The service was fast and the food just amazing! Really tasty! We loved the bread coming right out the over.

name: Almanqal Mediterranean Grill
text_review: Hands-down the best Mediterranean food you can find in Seattle. Chef owned and operated you're greeted with a smile and good energy. Hand made, awesome authentic flavor.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I made a reservation several weeks prior and when I showed up for my email confirmed 6:15pm reservation on Wednesday November 27th (yes the day before Thanksgiving) and when we arrived the place was dark and closed. We were excited to go to this place as it had been on our list to try for over a year. We were so disappointed since we only find ourselves in Seattle 1-2x a year! I'm upset that no one ever called me to say the restaurant was closing early that day, very unprofessional. We sat outside the restaurant scrambling to find another restaurant to go to.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I recently dined at Sugo and I must say the experience was quite disappointing. While the food was decent, the service was far from acceptable. The sushi chef, who had visible tattoos, gave us incredibly rude service. His bad attitude and unkind words completely ruined what should have been a fun dinner. It's a shame because the quality of the food couldn't make up for the unpleasant interaction. I won't be returning.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Before I go in on why I am giving one star, I do want to say the food is great! A little overpriced. So I wouldn't go here with a complete empty stomach. My favorite was the spicy tuna and Hawaiian poke. I also liked the Lychee martini they had. The miso soup was amazingly paired with the tempura shrimp as well.The reason why I'm giving a terrible review is because the service was so bad. I read some reviews on here about the service and it's BAD! I read a review here that their manager yells at their employees while trying to be nice to the customers. I also saw reviews on here that the hostess flirts with the sushi chef? Completely unprofessional. Well anyways, my server was this girl with the weird neck tattoos. I forgot her name. She seemed so annoyed serving us and just seemed straight up rude. We would constantly have to ask for refills on the water and she seemed annoyed that we were ordering more rolls. It's like do you want us to eat here or not? She seems like she doesn't want to be there and that we were an inconvenience. And hearing the workers talk about their personal life so loud from the back is annoying. Who wants to hear about their drama when you're trying to have a nice meal?Overall, this place is alright. Food is amazing but it comes with terrible service. Management needs fixing because why are you as an adult yelling at your employees like they're 5? Talk to them and manage them like they're adults and maybe they'll listen. Definitely need new servers too who want to be there and who is there to work, not to play gossip girl. Sad to say I love the food but hate the people.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: My recent experience at Sugo Sushi in downtown Seattle left me feeling disappointed. The entrance was oddly decorated and staff were scattered, leaving their belongings on chairs in the dining area. Our table was located in a separate room, which was an unusual setup. The sushi was alright, but nothing stood out as particularly special, and with the high prices, I was left feeling underwhelmed and still hungry. While the restaurant itself was visually appealing and the staff seemed kind, they also came across as shy. With the underwhelming food and high price tag, I don't think I'll be coming back to Sugo Sushi.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Disappointed by my visit. Sugo checks all the boxes for a hand roll restaurant- bar seating, a quick-paced dining experience, and somewhat pricey, bite-sized offerings- but doesn't execute well.I ordered the set of 5 hand rolls for $33. This includes chef's selections of scallop, spicy tuna, snow crab, and eel, and lobster ( a substitute for salmon which they were out of).I was expecting to pay a premium for food that prioritized quality of ingredients over quality. Maybe Sugo does use fresh ingredients, but it was impossible to tell as much of the sashimi was served grounded up and mixed with Japanese mayo to the point where it was difficult to differentiate one roll from the next. This confusion wasn't helped by the lack of explanation of what was being served. It was towards the end of service so perhaps our chef was more interested in wrapping up our meal. The experience felt rushed and frenetic on the whole. More on the service- the restaurant automatically charges a 19% and boasts a minimum $23/hr wage. I'm all for this on principle, but the quality of our service was subpar. The staff came across as confused and somewhat unaccommodating. For example, when we were told they were out of salmon, we were told that the only possible substitution would be lobster without reasonable explanation as to why we couldn't substitute something of equal or lesser value. In another instance, another staff member came by to offer to refill my full glass of water while ignoring my friend with an empty glass. Just odd things here and there that dampened the overall visit.  I was visiting from out of town, but I'm confident you can find sushi of equal quality for far better value elsewhere.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The place was nice in terms of the ambience but the service and food were both lacking. The service was...strange. We had waitlist inconsistencies which is understandable. But in the meantime the seating waitress yelled an expletive, for which she did apologize. The strange part came after at the actual hand roll bar, where we were told as part of the set we ordered there wasn't King Salmon, oh wait there was King Salmon, and of course there wasn't King Salmon. She said we had to replace it with lobster, which we asked if we could pick a different roll (of lesser value) and the waitress declined without any real reasoning (along the lines of "it's our choice when we replace it" and "for the value", honestly didn't understand). Water refilling was awkward too. It was just strange. Then on to the food:- spicy tuna: very spicy, oddly very spicy - scallop: was spicy without any indication of it being so on the menu- snow crab: very mayo- lobster: very very mayo - eel: probably the best, nothing to write home about They all lacked an appropriate amount of rice to balance the flavors, so I was left with very salty, overly flavored taste and no real raw fish... which, echoing the service, strange for a "sushi" experienceHonestly probably wouldn't recommend given the price and the other sushi available in the area. But glad I tried!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The sushi was fantastic, but sadly, the service didn't match up. We're usually pretty laid-back, but we couldn't help noticing how off the mark the servers were, a sharp contrast to the sushi chef's warmth. Little things like not emailing receipts or grumbling about being swamped left a sour taste. We get that restaurant life is tough, but basic courtesy should be a given, right?

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Food was great and during happy hour it was a a great price. Good drinks menu. The bar seating is not my thing, but i can see some people liking it.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: It was fun small fun place. Good food, very friendly. I liked everything I had. Definitely would go back for more.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Delicious!!! Our first time trying this place, the food and the service were so amazing!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: food was a1, service was top notch, ambiance was ambiancing. we love johnny please come and show him love

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Best Sea Urchin Hand Roll Ever!If you're a fan of sea urchin, Sugo Hand Roll Bar is a dream come true! Their sea urchin (uni) hand roll is simply phenomenal--sweet, creamy, and incredibly fresh. The uni melts in your mouth, perfectly complemented by warm, seasoned rice and crispy seaweed.The quality of the sea urchin here is unmatched, and you can tell they source only the best. Every bite felt luxurious and indulgent, and it was truly the highlight of my meal.The staff was welcoming and attentive, and the rolls are made fresh right in front of you, adding to the experience. The ambiance is modern and vibrant, making it a perfect spot to enjoy high-quality sushi.If you love sea urchin--or even if you're new to it--Sugo Hand Roll Bar is a must-visit. I can't wait to come back and indulge again!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Delicious and fresh food, impeccable service! Would definitely recommend to everyone!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I love coming to Sugo! This place truly never disappoints. This is my favorite place to come and dine and bond with my sister and mom. The GM Sharon makes the experience such a warm and fun one every time! The sushi bar is unlike any experience I have had in Seattle. We were served by Chef Johnny and Tito and they were nothing short of super attentive. We always get the 5 handroll set and do al la carte for the rest of the menu. I highly recommend the wagyu uni and ikura and the uni caviar!! The freshness of the fish is unbeatable in Seattle. They also have tamari (gluten free soy sauce), which I greatly appreciate the thought behind it because I have a gluten allergy. We have been coming here for over a year at least once a month because the service, ambiance, and food is just unbeatable. During our most recent visit we had Joseph as our server and he was amazing! Super kind, and humorous, also made great suggestions. I always look forward to our once a month family gatherings at Sugo and appreciate everything they do!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo Hand Roll Bar is a must-visit for sushi lovers. My favorite roll was the hamachi with ikura, which truly stood out. The hamachi was incredibly fresh and had a melt-in-your-mouth quality, perfectly paired with the rich, briny burst of the ikura.The atmosphere is inviting and laid-back, ideal for enjoying a meal at your own pace. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, making the experience even better. Overall, Sugo Hand Roll Bar delivers an exceptional hand roll experience, and I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Sugo Hand Roll Bar and it was an amazing experience from start to finish. We opted for the 4 Hand Roll Set, which featured a delectable variety of flavors: King Salmon, Truffle Avocado, Crispy Shrimp, and Torched Eel. Each roll was expertly crafted and absolutely delicious, with the Truffle Avocado being a standout favorite. The service was equally impressive--prompt, polite, and attentive, adding to the overall enjoyable atmosphere. If you're looking for fresh, flavorful hand rolls and a top-notch dining experience, Sugo is a must-try!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The Wagyu& Uni is from Japan! Ikura cured in house! Vibes are immaculate!Service is great! Everybody looks like they have fun! I had fun! The whole world is having fun

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The food and the service were amazing. It was my first time trying a sit down Handroll experience and the servers and sushi chefs both helped me make excellent choices. I'll definitely be back! Make sure to try the otoro it's amazing!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo Sushi Bar in Seattle offers a delightful dining experience with its inviting ambience and top-notch ingredients. The freshness and quality of the sushi are unparalleled, making each bite a memorable one. The cozy, modern setting adds to the overall enjoyment, perfect for both casual outings and special occasions. Highly recommended for sushi enthusiasts!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The head chef Johnny took the best care of me and my wife on our Saturday date here. The hand roll sushi was some of the best sushi we've had thus far. The seafood was so fresh and tasteful. Watching Johnny prepare the food right in front of us while we had drinks was amazing. Our waitress also was a star player during this experience and was always checking in all of us. Me and my wife plan on going to Sugo every time we are in the area! - from Kanye West sweater guy.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I have been to Sugo more than a handful of times and always enjoy my experience. The GM Sharon is always so bubbly and provides the best service whenever I visit. I always get the 5 handroll set with an added extra scallop roll. The scallop roll is my all time favorite, the scallops are perfectly seasoned with the right amount of spice! Sugo is completely unique with the omakase style sushi bar, and it's so fun to watch the chefs make food. Jony & TIto have been there most times when I visit, and they're both awesome to talk to, and skilled sushi chefs! Will definitely be coming back.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: amazing food! fish was super fresh. wonderful service as well! And the environment was cozy!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I recently dined at Sugo Hand Roll Bar and was thoroughly impressed by the exceptional experience. From the moment I walked in, the staff made me feel incredibly welcomed and attended to. Sharonie, in particular, went above and beyond to ensure our dining experience was nothing short of perfection. The ambiance was inviting, the food was delicious, and the hand rolls were crafted with precision and care. I highly recommend Sugo Hand Roll Bar for anyone looking for a memorable dining experience with impeccable service.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The best date night spot in Seattle! We go to Sugo for every celebration and it never disappoints! The service is phenomenal and every roll is perfect, the truffle avocado will change your life!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: the food & everyone at the place are top tier. shout out to my man Tito behind the bar... a master of his craft!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I went to the new bar/lounge area they have attached to the Hand Roll Bar here and everything was so delicious!! The atmosphere was really fun and vibrant, will definitely be back for Happy Hour since it seems like they have some good deals!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Unforgettable Sushi Experience!Stepping into this sushi spot, we were warmly greeted and immediately impressed by the cozy yet sophisticated vibe. The service was top-notch, with our server offering invaluable recommendations from an extensive menu of sushi and sashimi.The sushi itself was a highlight, showcasing freshness and creativity in every bite. The Dragon Roll special , a perfect mix of texture and flavor, stood out. Attention to detail in presentation and meal pacing made our dining not just a meal, but a memorable experience. This restaurant is a must-visit for both sushi lovers and newcomers alike. Five stars for an exceptional culinary journey!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I would recommend this place! We stopped by randomly, but our experience exceeded our expectations. Chef Johnny did an amazing job making us feel welcome! The food was fresh and delicious. We will be coming back soon for happy hour.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: sugo is so cool! Handrolls are such a different experince and i enjoy how the sushi chef makes the handroll in front of us . Drinks are fun and service is so sweet. Great vibes overall

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo is incredible!! The service cares about food ,Drinks and taking care.Space is beautiful and unique.Great music

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: If you want some good sushi with some great service please come to Sugo!!!! amazing food! if you get the chance to have Yana as your waitress, you will not be disappointed. She is outstanding and is great at making sure all your needs are met. She pays attention to detail and will make sure you will have a good evening with :) please go visit and ask for Yana!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I recently had the pleasure of dining at Sugo Hand Roll Bar, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the unique atmosphere. The layout of the restaurant, with everyone seated around the bar overlooking the kitchen where the hand rolls are expertly prepared, created an engaging and interactive dining environment.One of the highlights of my visit was being able to watch and chat with the person preparing my food. It added a personal touch to the dining experience that you don't often find elsewhere. The staff, including Tyler, Tito, Nora, and Emi, were incredibly friendly and attentive throughout my meal. Despite dining alone, I never felt lonely thanks to their warm hospitality.Now, let's talk about the food.Not only did the rolls taste amazing, but they were also beautifully presented, earning a solid 5/5 in both taste and appearance.I'll definitely be back for more of those delicious hand rolls!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The food and service are always amazing when I come here. The staff makes me feel welcome and I always enjoy talking to all the staff!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Amazing place, very accommodating, came with a large party and they were able to take great care of us, plus the food was incredible!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Amazing service and amazing Food! The music was also on point. We came back twice.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I'm glad to hear that you had such a wonderful experience atugo hand roll sushi restaurant! From your description, it sounds like the staff, including Nora, Jane, Mel, and Emi, played a significant role in making your visit enjoyable. Their exceptional service clearly stood out to you and contributed to your overall positive experience. It's always refreshing to receive top-notch customer service when dining out, and it's clear that the staff at Sugo hand roll sushi restaurant went above and beyond to make sure you had a memorable meal. Thank you for sharing your feedback, and I hope you have many more delicious dining experiences in the future!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Food and service was excellent! Came during lunch and was served right away. Definitely will come back!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: My friends and I had an amazing time here. Service was quick, we didn't wait that long, food was delicious, all the staff are super friendly. Once you're seated they provide you a hand towel which is so cool to me! I definitely recommend this place!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: It was so delicious! Everybody is so kind and fun! music is a vibe and the bar is so pretty! And there is Boozy boba! Fun !

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Love the atmosphere and the food was amazing!!! Also, Nora is so kind and welcoming! We will be back:)

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Really great experience. Food quality was spectacular and service couldn't have been better-shout out to Tito! highly recommend.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo Hand Roll Bar exceeded all expectations with its exceptional hand rolls. The fish was incredibly fresh, elevating the dining experience to a new level. Each bite was a burst of flavor, showcasing the chef's commitment to quality ingredients. A must-visit for sushi enthusiasts seeking an unforgettable culinary adventure!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: We had a wonderful experience at Sugo! My friend visiting town wanted sushi, and I had been wanting to check out the restaurant for a while. We were VIP guests and felt very welcomed and well-cared for by the staff. The ambiance is calm and cozy, perfect for a gloomy day. The food was delicious - my favorites were the scallops, snow crab roll, and torched eel. The matcha magic and sweet sando were yummy too. My friend got the lycée martini and she said it looked like the Vegas sphere she had just visited!Thank you Sugo for the experience and hospitality! I'll definitely be back!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: 5star on everything! This place is small but yet AMAZING! Food, Service, recommendations, we're all spot on.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Best sushi in Seattle. The staff is very nice and the sushi is very fresh and tasty! It is a great semi casual sushi bar.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Had a great time here! I really enjoyed the environment and the vibe of the whole place. The manager did a great job making it comfy and fun! Just an overall great experience!! Not to mention the great service and food! Will be coming back!!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Aesthetic and excellent tasting cocktails and hand rolls. The service is top notch and Sharon always goes above and beyond to make our experience exemplary. One of the best restaurants to go on a date!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: We came here on a Saturday wanting to go to Sugo, and There was a wait ! I should have made a reservation. Which is the STAR of the show! The Hostess was super kind about the fact there was wait and offered the Shio Side to wait to grab drinks and food. We saved ourself for Sugo but will definitely need to come back and try!! It is a Japanese Street Food side that serves fun cocktails, charashi bowls and Sandos!We waited for about 25 mins and a seat opened up!The hostess then guided us to the Sugo side,And introduced us to our server and sushi chef!What a perfect hand off because the server came right away with my water! They were sooo sweet! The room so packed!!As somebody who use to work in the industry I can tell that this is a really fun place to work at!Our sushi chef was super nice,I really appreciate that they asked me if the pace is okay and told me to tell them if they need to pick up the pace or slow down!My favorite roll is the Ikura! The burst of soy and ocean essence burst into my mouth!!10/10 experience! I am a sushi lover and I go to all the Sushi spots around the country.And for this concept it works!!!!!!GO NOW!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Went to Sugo Hand Roll Bar with my boyfriend to celebrate our anniversary! Staff were very welcoming and informative! Asked for suggestions and got exactly what we wanted. It was my first hand roll bar experience and we could not have asked for anything better:) If you are in the Seattle area, definitely give them a visit. Atmosphere, food, and service all worth the price.Thank you Mel for serving us! She answered all our questions and constantly checked in on us. It was difficult to decide how many rolls to order, but she catered us perfectly

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The service was excellent. I would return here again me and my friend approached Sugo very welcoming vibes. and the place was clean. Very sleek in the servers were amazing. the person who took care of us was named Mel! she arranged a miniature towelette to allow us to clean our hands before we got into the Hand in Rolls which was a very cool experience. i've never been to a hand roll bar before but it was cool seeing them make everything by hand face to face!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: amazing, fresh seafood, and preparation and even more fabulous people especially Tito or sushi chef's .very responsive, cool spot. better make reservation before you come

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The ambiance during dinner time was amazing! I had the 4 handrolls set with norichos to share with my partner and it was all to die for. The hostess was able to squeeze us in even with the full reservations and I suggest you reserve your seats ahead of time. Mel was kind and checked in on us during our meal to see if I needed to order more rolls to avoid breaks between our meal. The hostess and Mel were fun and created a welcoming place. Both ladies had amazing personalities and made all customers feel like they are being taken care of!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Right on the way to Pike place... Amazing food... A casual place with quick and courteous service

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: This was my second time dining at Sugo, and it was just as incredible as the first.The hand rolls were wonderful, and the service was top notch.From the host who greeted us at the front door, to our server and our two Chefs.Definitely recommend for anyone looking for some quality hand roll selections.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: The manager is incredible and brings such a welcoming presence to this intimate dining experience. The chefs are amazing and once they're done rolling they put it right in front of you to enjoy. The rolls we got were delicious, I haven't had such fresh flavorful rolls before. Recommend calling in for a reservation!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: First time at sugo today definitely will come back the staffs were super nice and the manger was very friendly

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: So where do I begin, I'll start with the front door service! We were greeted and seated immediately, sometimes there's a wait, that iswell worth it the atmosphere is elegantly streamlined & very pleasing to take in, especially at the hand roll bar it's self.The staff are very attentive but not overwhelmingly so, and give great suggestions on what to grab from the menu if you're having trouble.The food it's self! well let's start that you get to have a front row seat to the preparation and then the presentation is great as well the rolls are placed on a flat stone in front of you. Now for the flavor I can't express how great the quality of the fish is and how well balanced the flavors from savory to sweet with just the right amount of spice while some rolls have caviar as an addition which is a very pleasant touch. I have to say it is and will be a great dining experience every time

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I work in the market close to here and there's nothing but good things to say. The food is delicious, the people are so kind, and Sharon should be a reason for everyone to come down and visit Sugos. Sharon is the general manager and has created a beautiful environment for people to enjoy delicious food and have a good time. Coming here has become a routine that I see no end to anytime soon. The torched eel roll is to die for!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Hands down the best sushi spot Washington has ever had. Everything here is fantastic, from the drinks, the apps, the rolls, and even the service from the staff! Sugo is just what Seattle was missing. The atmosphere is intimate & inviting, getting to see the food prepped right in front of you while speaking with staff is such a unique experience as well. Be warned once you try Sugo, there's no going back to any other sushi spots. #SugoSnob

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo is such a wonderful place to dine!! The vibes are great, the food taste amazing and fresh, and the employees are so kind and engaging. 10/10 I definitely would recommend every time!!!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I have gone several times and the service has always been great! Crispy Shrimp, Miso Shooter, Shrimp Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll, and Norichos are all delicious!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo has very quickly become my go to sushi spot. With an incredible food menu, great service, and some of the best cocktails in the city, I'm at Sugo, monthly.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I highly recommend trying the uni hand roll and wagyu at this restaurant - they are absolutely delicious! The drinks are also quite tasty and won't disappoint. What's more, the prices are quite reasonable.The service and ambiance here are both excellent. The restaurant has a welcoming atmosphere, and the staff are friendly and attentive, making for an enjoyable dining experience.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo is vibrate and full of life!!!!I ate so much!!!!The music is a vibe, felt like a mini party with the intimate seating! The sushi Chefs are so funny they were cracking so many jokes and teasing each other.I love seeing that type of relationship, and entertainment in play!The servers were attentive and gave me fresh napkins and ginger without asking me.The food is so fresh,A lot of their products is from Japan, such as the Otoro! Being the only place in Washington to have Japanese blue fin! It melted in my mouth! So dreamy!The Shooter was delicious!!The best Ebi I've ever had!Fun little miso shooter to dip dip my crispy Crunchy shrimp in! I enjoy adding Ikura on my rolls and I appreciate that being an option! Ikura is from Sapporo Japan, and is in house marinated!!I love the way the Ikura adds another layer of dimension to my rolls, adding a textual pop and umami flavor!And the Wagyu , oh yeah, definitely treating myself on that one,that fatty fat melts over the lobster , and it's just this richness of flavor that just hugs my taste buds.Cant forget the Sake!! I got this secret menu item Sparkling Sake.It is so smooth, and had tasting notes of Apple and Plum.Love my sake, and this one is unique since it's naturally carbonated created a light effervescence that really opened my pallet.I love that this isn't your traditional Japanese sushi bar, and has a modern take of a sushi experience.It's hip and fun! Something new to the City!Sugo is only soft opening and I can see a lot of potential in this space and can't wait to come again ! I hear there's tons of exciting things happening!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I love this place! Great atmosphere, great service, and great food! Didn't think much before I went but had a great experience. Will be going back!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Elite. Have to get the Otoro, Salmon, Eel, shoot try every roll you won't be disappointed. Didn't get a drink but saw a womens eyes roll back when she got hers

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I stopped by here for a soft opening and I absolutely love this place. The rolls are so fresh and the staff is super friendly. I got the lychee martini and it was one of the top tier drinks I've had. Would definitely come back here again!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Amazing experience, thats one great complete meal i had in a long time.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Great place! Will be back! Great atmosphere and great food.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I wanted to try Sugo for a few days now and I'm glad I did. I've been on a temaki lookout in Seattle. I got my own choices with the different hand rols. Favorites were thepoke,scallop, lobster and the crab. The crab temaki was amazing and wow! It was the standout dish. I would come here just for that.I also had the iced matcha. Loved that it was unsweetened!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Normally I only write reviews when I'm upset but I had to say something after coming here. My taste buds had quite the nostalgic experience from my favorite sushi place Mikuni's in Sacramento, CA.Not to mention, fresh fish straight out of the puget sound in my favorite place to hang out when I'm in Seattle!? Sugo for the win!!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Best sushi in the 206 hands down!!! So fresh, so delicious, a must try

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Visiting Seattle from La and would move here for this place! Such great food, amazing people, really cool location. I'll be back!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Food is awesome! I'm not typically a hand roll person but my friend invited me to join and so I gave this spot a chance... so glad I did!I loved the spicy tuna and the California rolls (I know... I'm basic). Also had one of their delicious sake cocktails - if you have a chance, stop by!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: This place is SO incredible. Perfect ambience, great food, service was incredible! I would HIGHLY recommend for anyone looking for sushi or a trendy date spot. I can't wait until I get to go to this restaurant again, I am going to make it a weekly habit!!!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: I went to SUGO for my first time today and was very impressed. Service was fast and staff were friendly. A fantastic new addition to Pikes Place. I ordered the Norichos and a spicy tuna hand roll that have me already wanting to go back !!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Get the Hawaiian Poke! So. Dang. Good. I've been to probably 10 different Poke spots throughout Seattle and this is literally second to none. I took my family here as I was showing them Seattle and Pike Place for the first time and it was their favourite food throughout the entire weekend they visited. Cocktails here are also top tier. Service, food, drinks - everything was phenomenal. This is one of those hidden gems since it opened up not long ago so get a piece of it while it's not too busy!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Just found a great new place. The sushi Roles are first class. I'm a big sushi eater and have been to a lot of local places and this one was special.The Spicy Tuna was my favorite although I enjoyed all the food. My wife loved her Special Saki drink. It was there soft open but here was still a bunch of interesting stuff on the menu.I didn't get a chance to try the appetizers but they looked really good.I suggest trying a bunch of different items because we really enjoyed the unique flavors. Interesting with just the right balance of flavor.It was nice to have friendly and professional service. We felt we where appreciated. It was overall a very good night.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Best spicy Tuna role I have ever had. I moved here from Los Angeles a few years ago where I ate sushi on a regular basis. I have been to many of the best LA sushi restaurants (Nobu, Takami, Sugarfish, etc). Great to find a new local place where I can get great sushi roles. I suggest the spicy tuna. It was super fresh with a perfect level of spice for me. Everything we had was overall good. No complaints.Not as expensive as LA. That was a relief. Looking forward to trying some of their unusual appetizers.The service was above average.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Came here with my girlfriend after hearing about this place from a friend, and I'm so glad we went. The ambiance is fun and unique. The staff were friendly. The food menu is small but high quality. The hand-rolled sushi is die for. We also tried the clam miso soup and the Norichos. Both were incredibly tasty. Th drink menu is so unique and creative. You have to try the lychee martini. The prices were very reasonable. We had such a great experience overall. We will definitely be back again

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Went with my wife to this new restaurant. We had a great time. Fun place with good food. My favorite was the sushi hand role. The waitress was very polite and totally sincere about us enjoying the food.I thought the price was very reasonable for such good food. I think I found my new go to place. The drinks looked great but I stuck to a couple jello shots. Everything was better than expected.Can't wait to try out some other goodies.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: FABULOUS food especially the Salmon hand roll and Norichous! The staff was incredible! Looking forward to going back A LOT!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Woah! Did I just come out of the Tsukiji Fish Market? Freshest Sushi I've had in a long time. I'll be coming back weekly.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: There is a trifecta that I look for when it comes to quality of restaurants and Sugo hits on all three!! QUALITY- I haven't enjoyed fish in such as way until I started eating here! AMBIENCE- talk about authenticity!! I went to Japan before the pandemic and this resembles a lot of what I saw there. SERVICE- this restaurant is not only memorable for the food, but the people. Staff was so kind and made me feel super welcomed. Thanks everyone for a super positive experience, will definitely be back when I visit Seattle again!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Sugo is amazing! The service was great and the hand rolls were delish. Also loved all of the unique drink options. Definitely really excited to go back and will for sure be a new go to spot for me.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Amazing! Incredible concept and food, very much enjoyed the experience and I will be back for more.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Wow!! The food here was absolutely fantastic. We got the 6-roll set and order of the cucumber avocado donburi. They are so friendl, accommodating and very good with handling food allergies. The staff were knowledgeable and the fish was so fresh. Highly recommend. We will be back for sure.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: High quality sushi in downtown! I came with my wife and got the spicy tuna and california rolls - both were quite good. Our server was very attentive and helpful.I had never had a sake cocktail before but as a big fan of sake I had to try it. Not at all disappointed and will be getting one every time I go back :)The atmosphere was quite nice - I enjoyed the attention to detail in the interior design.We will be coming back!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Second time in Sugo and YOU have to go! It's a modern vibe with amazing food. The Norichos and the Blue Fin Tuna Sashimi is to die for. IT WAS FIRE!! The service we received was solid and we will definitely be back again. They made us feel welcomed and gave us an amazing experience.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Loved this place, one of my new favorite spots in Seattle! We loved the atmosphere and had great service, I could tell the staff has put a ton of work into making this a top restaurant. The food was amazing, and I especially loved the salmon and toro hand rolls. Will definitely be back!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: WOW. Where to begin. I loveeee sushi and did not know what to expect just stumbling across this place while showing a out of town friend what Pike Place has to offer. So happy we found it! It was just their second day of a soft opening so they didn't have their full menu yet but what they had was AMAZING. I'm honestly considering going back tonight, that good. A lot of the basics you see but also some really unique items (truffle avocado roll? Yes please. Wagyu with uni and caviar? Sign me up). My sushi server was not just making us delicious rolls but entertaining us with great conversation throughout the meal. Apparently there is a second side of the restaurant that will open for summer time, can't wait to see what they do there! If I could give 6 stars I would - So good!

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: Got to try Sugo for their soft opening on Saturday night, servers were very friendly and attentive. I tried the 4 set along with a crispy shrimp roll and wagyu roll. Overall the quality of the fish/food was top notch. Found the clam miso a touch salty; the wagyu roll with uni/caviar was amazing! Will definitely be back soon.

name: Sugo Hand Roll Bar
text_review: So yummy! Tried Sugo for their soft opening and their food is already some of the best I've had in Seattle. The waiters and waitresses are really committed to providing great service and are really friendly. I really liked the modern atmosphere and how different their food was than any I've had before. A must try if you're in the Seattle area!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: The service and the pizza were the absolute worst. Never eating here again.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Was so excited to try Windy City and I'm extremely disappointed. We took our "Carnivore" home and it was so wet that I was able to fold the slice in half, vertically. The dough was like a wet sponge and it really appeared that the pizza was parbaked earlier in the day or even the day before. There was no marrying of the cheese and the sauce, and fully intact low-cost Hormel-esque pepperoni, further lending to evidence of pre-baking. Zero crunch, zero crisp. The dough was also way too sweet. This is not Chicago Style Pizza. So truly disappointed and I won't be going back. UPDATE: The owners of this establishment cannot handle any criticism of their sub-par pizza and resort to sophomoric replies that wave like a flag of unprofessional defensiveness. Their response of keeping our pizza flat, which we did, would have nothing to do with the pizza being wet, underbaked, and pre-made. Please don't waste your money here, there are far better pizza places and other local businesses that are actually deserving of your business.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Absolutely horrific place. The owner is batshit insane. Terrible pizza, terrible service and verbally abusive owner. Waiting until this place gets shut down.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: This place is expensive and the service is not up to my standards.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: 1st, for reference, see the photo of the menu presented when ordering online - There is no clear indication between Chicago Deep Dish (not labeled) and thin cracker crust other than a tiny banner over some that says "Tavern-Style", and a stand-alone pizza called "Tavern Style Thin Pizza" with red sauce and mozzarella. We can't be the only ones to have made this mistake, and hopefully WCP figures out how to handle it better and fix their on-line system...We ordered what we thought were 2 Chicago-style deep dish pizzas online with dine in for two people and had to prepay everything including the tip. We get there early, they confirm our reservation and sit us, and the wait person confirms our order for 2 thin cracker crust pizzas. We let them know that we were expecting deep dish but their response was to first show us the menu and our mistake, and that we could order and pay for a 3rd deep dish pizza. 3 pizzas for 2 people :/ and we were already in for $80.  We expressed our frustration very clearly, even including the words, "It's fine", which anyone in customer service should know means, "This customer is really dissatisfied and frustrated" and we need to make it better, including getting management involved. The thin crust pizzas came and at some point we were asked how was everything, to which we laid out our frustration very clearly. The waitstaff could only defend themselves and didn't offer any resolution, only excuses. They did offer to get the manager but at that point we had enough. We never saw that waitperson again or a manager, but someone did show up and made me pay for my $8 beer before we left.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Not quite Chicago pizza but pretty darn good

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Maybe the best deep dish Pizza I've had in Seattle. I wish they put on a little more protein on their Pizzas, but other than that really great.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Wasn't really sure what to expect since I haven't had a Chi style pizza since I was a kid. This was a delicious, dense pie. The crusty edge was awesome and the spicy peppers inside really kicked off the flavor. One pie was enough for 4 adults, just as the website says!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: i  went to here on the week before and was seriously blown away at how delicious  everything was, and so my girl and I wanted to check . Everything is fun and  cooked to perfection!! The flavors are popping, the cilantro sauce is maybe  one of the most amazing things that's ever hit my taste buds.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: I have been looking for a good pizza! I really liked this place, it's in a cool building in downtown,sharing with distillery .it took 30 min to bake

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Excellent pizza and very friendly staff. Conveniently Windy City is located next to a brewery so we were able to satisfy both our local beer craving as well as try some awesome pizza. Would definitely recommend and will come back whenever i visit again!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Huge pizzas and full of flavor. One pizza easily fills 4 people, 5 people could work. Lots of toppings and a nice toasty crust. I'll definitely be back here!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: The pizza is pretty solid and you can eat it there in the Batch Bar, next door at Holy Mountain, or take it to go. Since it's thick Chicago style, make sure you plan for about 30 minutes for it to be prepped.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Good deep dish, which is tough to find!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Consistently good. Wish it wasn't so far for me to drive!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: If you are looking for high quality pizza with a different type of style, windy city pie is your place to be!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Im not really a pizza lover before but after I try their pizza it literally hooks me, I recomment others to try their HOT ISLAND pizza the roasted garlic was so lit.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Windy City pie has pizza that is different, and super delicious.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Windy City pie has fantastic deep dish pizza!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Windy City Pie has absolutely amazing pizza!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: They have the best deep dish pizza here!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: We're longtime Windy City Pie fans, first-time reviewers. And this review is overdue, but still SO necessary to share. When we were planning our wedding, we knew we wanted great food, and didn't want to use typical catering. We thought of Windy City Pie and contacted Dave who helped us make it a reality. Serving 100 guests, we offered three pies (omnivore, Brussels snout, and 4 pepper) along with the beets by Schrute salad, on each table for a sit-down dinner. Dave and his team went above and beyond to provide us with amazing looking pizzas that tasted delicious. From planning to delivery and dinner, everything was amazing.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: This might the beautiful place I visit and the food is really good!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: First time here . And WOW!! Great pizza! You know it is a pizza pie when they tell you to keep it level so all of the goodness doesn't spill out . Next time I am in Seattle I will be hitting this place up .

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: From top to bottom, this is a wonderful addition to the city. The staff is aware and diligent, exceptionally managed, and the pie has quickly become something I cannot love without. Do yourself a favor, make this your place.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: I was on a trip from Chicago and I wanted to try a pizza like Pequod's Pizza so my wife and I went to Windy City Pie. WOW! It was better than Chicago's Pequod's Pizza. Pizza has been a big part of my life. I've tried every type of pizza in Chicago over the years and there is always room for more great pizza. This is a new great one.We order online. That made getting our pizza easy when we got to Phinney. Cool space. Love the eclectic environment. Neat bar and drinks. Check out the artwork. But it's the food and the friendly staff that make this place great. It is the food that is the star of this evening. We had the Meatza. The crust was crisp especially the carmelized cheese edge. It may look burnt to those who don't understand what they are getting but don't overlook that delicious part of the pizza. The sauce is a perfectly tangy and sweet combination. The homemade sausage was delicious. The bacon and pepperoni are equally balanced with the other ingredients. The cheese works as a great counterpoint to the sauce and the other in tasty fresh parts of this masterpiece. This pizza is an indulgence that is worth the calories and carbs. Go for it. If you're worried about your diet they have other great options. My wife had the All Kale Caesar! salad. She loved the freshness, the switch of kale for the romaine lettuce and taste overall with a smaller serving of pizza which left more for me. This place is busy, order online, but be patient. They have games you can play while you wait or just watch the campy movie on the screen. Enjoy your night at this unique place.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Unreal deep-dish pie. I do miss the location on 15th Ave, however the drive to their new location is well worth it.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: When I'm craving Pequods, this is the Northwest Answer.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Off the Hook! best pizza I ever had.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Great pizza and nice staff. My family is visiting from out of town and we happen to be big pizza and beer folks. Conveniently Windy City is located next to a brewery so i was able to satisfy both our local beer craving as well as try some awesome pizza. Would definitely recommend !

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Amazing pizza, and Dave is super cool!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Probably some of the best pizza in Seattle. One we were introduced, we were hooked. They have a good happy hour slice and tall boy. And if you have the late night munchies, show up after 10pm and they have a second happy hour.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Such a great find! The food was amazing, they actually know how to make a good pizza, and the service was phenomenal. Highly recommend this place and I definitely will be back.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Absolutely delicious. We had garlic crust, olives, spinach, and Marinera. The plate was completely clean.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: This place is the real deal. Authentic Chicago style pizza with a killer bar. Any other Illinois natives who relocated to Seattle will be pleased by the quality of the food and the excellent service.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Windy City is legitimately some of the best pizza, if not food, that I have found in Seattle. I have, on several occasions, purchased numerous pies to share with friends as I feel it is an experience that must be passed along to as many people as I can. A pizza missionary, if I may.Out of the people I have shared a pie with, I have a 100% conversion rate, spanning over dozens of friends and coworkers who in turn shared this glorious, cheesy wonder with the people they know.Keep up the awesome work, Windy City Pie.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Incredible. Had a Classic pie, which I expected to be rich, hearty, and full of flavor. This pizza exceeded all those expectations!

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: I am from Chicago... this place is great. Super happy to have found it.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: This is the best pizza in the city. Theres not much more to say than that.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: I am just visiting Seattle from San Jose...and they don't have pizza like this there!  Just like the 5 star review says..."Woohoo! As good as it gets!"

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: This IS Chicago style pizza. The real deal.

name: Windy City Pie
text_review: Dave (the one man operation behind this paradise) is unbelievably nice. What makes this pizza different is mostly how delicious it is, but the pizza maker working his ass off with the kind of quality you can't find elsewhere... That's what tasting the fruits of a person's American dream is like. Don't believe me? Try this stuff, LIFECHANGING. Keep kicking ass Dave, you're amazing!
